<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><div xmlns:xd="http://www.oxygenxml.com/ns/doc/xsl" xmlns:uslm="http://xml.house.gov/schemas/uslm/1.0" xmlns="http://xml.house.gov/schemas/uslm/1.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/" itemscope="" itemtype="uslm"><p itemtype="uscDoc" xsi:schemaLocation="http://xml.house.gov/schemas/uslm/1.0 USLM-1.0.15.xsd" xml:lang="en" identifier="/us/usc/t31"/>

<p itemtype="main"/>
<p itemtype="title" id="id0f9239a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31"><span itemtype="num" value="31">Title 31—</span><span itemtype="heading">MONEY AND FINANCE</span></p><p itemtype="subtitle" style="-uslm-lc:I52" id="id0f96f4a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBTITLE I—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0f96f4a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">CHAPTER 1—</span><span itemtype="heading">DEFINITIONS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f96f4ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s101"><span itemtype="num" value="101">§ 101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Agency</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">In this title, “agency” means a department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/877">96 Stat. 877</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f96f4af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s102"><span itemtype="num" value="102">§ 102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Executive agency</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">In this title, “executive agency” means a department, agency, or instrumentality in the executive branch of the United States Government.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/877">96 Stat. 877</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f96f4b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s103"><span itemtype="num" value="103">§ 103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> United States</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">In this title, “United States”, when used in a geographic sense, means the States of the United States and the District of Columbia.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/877">96 Stat. 877</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0f96f4b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">CHAPTER 3—</span><span itemtype="heading">DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0f96f4bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch3/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">ORGANIZATION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f96f4bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301"><span itemtype="num" value="301">§ 301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Department of the Treasury</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Department of the Treasury is an executive department of the United States Government at the seat of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The head of the Department is the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary is appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Department has a Deputy Secretary of the Treasury appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. The Deputy Secretary shall carry out—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f96f4c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f96f4c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the duties and powers of the Secretary when the Secretary is absent or unable to serve or when the office of Secretary is vacant.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Department has 2 Under Secretaries, an Under Secretary for Enforcement, and 2 Deputy Under Secretaries, appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. The Department also has a Fiscal Assistant Secretary appointed by the Secretary and a Treasurer of the United States appointed by the President. They shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary. The President may designate one Under Secretary as Counselor. When appointing each Deputy Under Secretary, the President may designate the Deputy Under Secretary as an Assistant Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Department has 8 Assistant Secretaries appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. The Department shall have 2 Assistant Secretaries not subject to the advice and consent of the Senate who shall be the Assistant Secretary for Public Affairs, and the Assistant Secretary for Management. The Assistant Secretaries shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary. The Assistant Secretaries appointed under this subsection are in addition to the Assistant Secretaries appointed under subsection (d) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Department has a General Counsel appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. The General Counsel is the chief law officer of the Department. Without regard to those provisions of title 5 governing appointment in the competitive service, the Secretary may appoint not more than 5 Assistant General Counsels. The Secretary may designate one of the Assistant General Counsels to act as the General Counsel when the General Counsel is absent or unable to serve or when the office of General Counsel is vacant. The General Counsel and Assistant General Counsels shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The President may appoint, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, an Assistant General Counsel who shall be the Chief Counsel for the Internal Revenue Service. The Chief Counsel is the chief law officer for the Service and shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f96f4c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s301/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> The Department shall have a seal.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/878">96 Stat. 878</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/594">Pub. L. 98–594</span>, § 1(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-30">Oct. 30, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/3129">98 Stat. 3129</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/190">Pub. L. 99–190</span>, § 141, <span itemtype="date" date="1985-12-19">Dec. 19, 1985</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/1324">99 Stat. 1324</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/211/tII">Pub. L. 103–211, title II</span>, § 2003(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-02-12">Feb. 12, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/24">108 Stat. 24</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/177/tI">Pub. L. 108–177, title I</span>, § 105(d)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2003-12-13">Dec. 13, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/2603">117 Stat. 2603</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/49">Pub. L. 110–49</span>, § 11(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2007-07-26">July 26, 2007</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/121/260">121 Stat. 260</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/343/dA/tI">Pub. L. 110–343, div. A, title I</span>, § 101(a)(3)(B)(ii), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-03">Oct. 3, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3768">122 Stat. 3768</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/166">Pub. L. 112–166</span>, § 2(<span itemtype="i">l</span>), <span itemtype="date" date="2012-08-10">Aug. 10, 2012</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/126/1286">126 Stat. 1286</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f96f4d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s302"><span itemtype="num" value="302">§ 302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Treasury of the United States</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The United States Government has a Treasury of the United States. The Treasury is in the Department of the Treasury.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/879">96 Stat. 879</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9964d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s303"><span itemtype="num" value="303">§ 303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Bureau of Engraving and Printing</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s303/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Bureau of Engraving and Printing is a bureau in the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s303/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of the Bureau is the Director of the Bureau of Engraving and Printing appointed by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Director—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9964dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s303/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9964dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s303/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> reports directly to the Secretary.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/879">96 Stat. 879</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9964e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s304"><span itemtype="num" value="304">§ 304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> United States Mint</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s304/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The United States Mint is a bureau in the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s304/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s304/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of the Mint is the Director of the Mint. The Director is appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. The term of the Director is 5 years. The President may remove the Director from office. On removal, the President shall send a message to the Senate giving the reasons for removal.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s304/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Director shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/879">96 Stat. 879</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/390/tII">Pub. L. 102–390, title II</span>, § 225(a), (b)(1), (2), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-06">Oct. 6, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/1629">106 Stat. 1629</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9964ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s305"><span itemtype="num" value="305">§ 305.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Federal Financing Bank</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Federal Financing Bank, established under section 4 of the Federal Financing Bank Act of 1973 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s2283">12 U.S.C. 2283</span>), is subject to the direction and supervision of the Secretary of the Treasury.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/879">96 Stat. 879</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9964ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306"><span itemtype="num" value="306">§ 306.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Fiscal Service</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Fiscal Service is a service in the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The head of the Fiscal Service is the Fiscal Assistant Secretary appointed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s301/d"/>section 301(d) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Fiscal Service has a—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9964f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Bureau of Government Financial Operations, having as its head a Commissioner of Government Financial Operations; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9964f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Bureau of the Public Debt, having as its head a Commissioner of the Public Debt.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9964f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s306/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may designate another officer or employee of the Department to act as the Fiscal Assistant Secretary when the Fiscal Assistant Secretary is absent or unable to serve or when the office of Fiscal Assistant Secretary is vacant.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/879">96 Stat. 879</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVII">Pub. L. 108–458, title VII</span>, § 7801, <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3860">118 Stat. 3860</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9964fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s307"><span itemtype="num" value="307">§ 307.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Office of the Comptroller of the Currency</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, established under section 324 of the Revised Statutes (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1">12 U.S.C. 1</span>), is an office in the Department of the Treasury.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/880">96 Stat. 880</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9964ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s308"><span itemtype="num" value="308">§ 308.</span><span itemtype="heading"> United States Customs Service</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The United States Customs Service, established under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1927-03-03/s1">section 1 of the Act of March 3, 1927</span> (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s2071">19 U.S.C. 2071</span>), is a service in the Department of the Treasury.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/880">96 Stat. 880</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f996505-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s309"><span itemtype="num" value="309">§ 309.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Office of Thrift Supervision</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Office of Thrift Supervision established under section 3(a) <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002002">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002002"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Home Owners’ Loan Act shall be an office in the Department of the Treasury.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/73/tIII">Pub. L. 101–73, title III</span>, § 307(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-08-09">Aug. 9, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/352">103 Stat. 352</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1361">108 Stat. 1361</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f99650c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310"><span itemtype="num" value="310">§ 310.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Financial Crimes Enforcement Network</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f99650d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p>The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network established by order of the Secretary of the Treasury (Treasury Order Numbered 105–08, in this section referred to as “FinCEN”) on <p itemtype="date" date="1990-04-25"/>April 25, 1990, shall be a bureau in the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f99650e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Director.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f99650f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Appointment</span>.—</span></p>The head of FinCEN shall be the Director, who shall be appointed by the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f996510-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Duties and powers</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The duties and powers of the Director are as follows:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f996511-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Advise and make recommendations on matters relating to financial intelligence, financial criminal activities, and other financial activities to the Under Secretary of the Treasury for Enforcement.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f996512-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Maintain a government-wide data access service, with access, in accordance with applicable legal requirements, to the following:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f996513-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Information collected by the Department of the Treasury, including report information filed under subchapter II of chapter 53 of this title (such as reports on cash transactions, foreign financial agency transactions and relationships, foreign currency transactions, exporting and importing monetary instruments, and suspicious activities), chapter 2 of title I of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508"/>Public Law 91–508, and section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f996514-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> Information regarding national and international currency flows.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f996515-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> Other records and data maintained by other Federal, State, local, and foreign agencies, including financial and other records developed in specific cases.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f996516-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> Other privately and publicly available information.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f996517-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Analyze and disseminate the available data in accordance with applicable legal requirements and policies and guidelines established by the Secretary of the Treasury and the Under Secretary of the Treasury for Enforcement to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f996518-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> identify possible criminal activity to appropriate Federal, State, local, and foreign law enforcement agencies;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f996519-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> support ongoing criminal financial investigations and prosecutions and related proceedings, including civil and criminal tax and forfeiture proceedings;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f99651a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> identify possible instances of noncompliance with subchapter II of chapter 53 of this title, chapter 2 of title I of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508"/>Public Law 91–508, and section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to Federal agencies with statutory responsibility for enforcing compliance with such provisions and other appropriate Federal regulatory agencies;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f99651b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> evaluate and recommend possible uses of special currency reporting requirements under section 5326;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f99651c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> determine emerging trends and methods in money laundering and other financial crimes;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f99651d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> support the conduct of intelligence or counterintelligence activities, including analysis, to protect against international terrorism; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f99651e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/C/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> support government initiatives against money laundering.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f99651f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> Establish and maintain a financial crimes communications center to furnish law enforcement authorities with intelligence information related to emerging or ongoing investigations and undercover operations.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f996520-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> Furnish research, analytical, and informational services to financial institutions, appropriate Federal regulatory agencies with regard to financial institutions, and appropriate Federal, State, local, and foreign law enforcement authorities, in accordance with policies and guidelines established by the Secretary of the Treasury or the Under Secretary of the Treasury for Enforcement, in the interest of detection, prevention, and prosecution of terrorism, organized crime, money laundering, and other financial crimes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f996521-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> Assist Federal, State, local, and foreign law enforcement and regulatory authorities in combatting the use of informal, nonbank networks and payment and barter system mechanisms that permit the transfer of funds or the equivalent of funds without records and without compliance with criminal and tax laws.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f996522-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> Provide computer and data support and data analysis to the Secretary of the Treasury for tracking and controlling foreign assets.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd623-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> Coordinate with financial intelligence units in other countries on anti-terrorism and anti-money laundering initiatives, and similar efforts.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd624-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> Administer the requirements of subchapter II of chapter 53 of this title, chapter 2 of title I of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508"/>Public Law 91–508, and section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act, to the extent delegated such authority by the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd625-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/b/2/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> Such other duties and powers as the Secretary of the Treasury may delegate or prescribe.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd626-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Requirements Relating to Maintenance and Use of Data Banks</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary of the Treasury shall establish and maintain operating procedures with respect to the government-wide data access service and the financial crimes communications center maintained by FinCEN which provide—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd627-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for the coordinated and efficient transmittal of information to, entry of information into, and withdrawal of information from, the data maintenance system maintained by FinCEN, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd628-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the submission of reports through the Internet or other secure network, whenever possible;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd629-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the cataloguing of information in a manner that facilitates rapid retrieval by law enforcement personnel of meaningful data; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd62a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a procedure that provides for a prompt initial review of suspicious activity reports and other reports, or such other means as the Secretary may provide, to identify information that warrants immediate action; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd62b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> in accordance with <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a">section 552a of title 5</span> and the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978, appropriate standards and guidelines for determining—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd62c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> who is to be given access to the information maintained by FinCEN;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd62d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> what limits are to be imposed on the use of such information; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd62e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> how information about activities or relationships which involve or are closely associated with the exercise of constitutional rights is to be screened out of the data maintenance system.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd62f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authorization of Appropriations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd630-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>There are authorized to be appropriated for FinCEN $100,419,000 for fiscal year 2011 and such sums as may be necessary for each of the fiscal years 2012 and 2013.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd631-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authorization for funding key technological improvements in mission-critical fincen systems</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>There are authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2005 the following amounts, which are authorized to remain available until expended:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd632-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> BSA <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">direct</span>.—</span></p>For technological improvements to provide authorized law enforcement and financial regulatory agencies with Web-based access to FinCEN data, to fully develop and implement the highly secure network required under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/s362"/>section 362 of Public Law 107–56 to expedite the filing of, and reduce the filing costs for, financial institution reports, including suspicious activity reports, collected by FinCEN under chapter 53 and related provisions of law, and enable FinCEN to immediately alert financial institutions about suspicious activities that warrant immediate and enhanced scrutiny, and to provide and upgrade advanced information-sharing technologies to materially improve the Government’s ability to exploit the information in the FinCEN data banks, $16,500,000.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd633-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Advanced analytical technologies</span>.—</span></p>To provide advanced analytical tools needed to ensure that the data collected by FinCEN under chapter 53 and related provisions of law are utilized fully and appropriately in safeguarding financial institutions and supporting the war on terrorism, $5,000,000.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd634-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Data networking modernization</span>.—</span></p>To improve the telecommunications infrastructure to support the improved capabilities of the FinCEN systems, $3,000,000.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd635-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Enhanced compliance capability</span>.—</span></p>To improve the effectiveness of the Office of Compliance in FinCEN, $3,000,000.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd636-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s310/d/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Detection and prevention of financial crimes and terrorism</span>.—</span></p>To provide development of, and training in the use of, technology to detect and prevent financial crimes and terrorism within and without the United States, $8,000,000.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 361(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/329">115 Stat. 329</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, §§ 6101, 6203(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3744">118 Stat. 3744</span>, 3746; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/195/tI">Pub. L. 111–195, title I</span>, § 109(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-01">July 1, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1338">124 Stat. 1338</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9bd63e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s311"><span itemtype="num" value="311">§ 311.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Office of Intelligence and Analysis</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd63f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s311/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>There is established within the Department of the Treasury, the Office of Intelligence and Analysis (in this section referred to as the “Office”), which shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd640-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s311/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> be within the Office of Terrorism and Financial Intelligence;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd641-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s311/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> be responsible for the receipt, analysis, collation, and dissemination of foreign intelligence and foreign counterintelligence information (within the meaning of section 3 of the National Security Act of 1947 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t50/s401a"/>50 U.S.C. 401a)) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002003"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002003"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> related to the operation and responsibilities of the Department of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd642-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s311/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> have such other related duties and authorities as may be assigned to it by the Secretary, subject to the authority, direction, and control of the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd643-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s311/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Assistant Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis</span>.—</span></p>The Office shall be headed by an Assistant Secretary, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. The Assistant Secretary shall report directly to the Undersecretary of the Treasury for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/177/tI">Pub. L. 108–177, title I</span>, § 105(a)(1)(B), <span itemtype="date" date="2003-12-13">Dec. 13, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/2603">117 Stat. 2603</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/447/dH/tII">Pub. L. 108–447, div. H, title II</span>, § 222(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-08">Dec. 8, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3245">118 Stat. 3245</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9bd64a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312"><span itemtype="num" value="312">§ 312.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Terrorism and financial intelligence</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd64b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Office of Terrorism and Financial Intelligence.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd64c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment</span>.—</span></p>There is established within the Department of the Treasury the Office of Terrorism and Financial Intelligence (in this section referred to as “OTFI”), which shall be the successor to any such office in existence on the date of enactment of this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd64d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Leadership.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd64e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Undersecretary</span>.—</span></p>There is established within the Department of the Treasury, the Office of the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes, who shall serve as the head of the OTFI, and shall report to the Secretary of the Treasury through the Deputy Secretary of the Treasury. The Office of the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes shall be the successor to the Office of the Undersecretary for Enforcement.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd64f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Appointment</span>.—</span></p>The Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd650-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Assistant secretary for terrorist financing.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd651-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment</span>.—</span></p>There is established within the OTFI the position of Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd652-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Appointment</span>.—</span></p>The Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd653-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Duties</span>.—</span></p>The Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing shall be responsible for formulating and coordinating the counter terrorist financing and anti-money laundering efforts of the Department of the Treasury, and shall report directly to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd654-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Functions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The functions of the OTFI include providing policy, strategic, and operational direction to the Department on issues relating to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd655-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> implementation of titles I and II of the Bank Secrecy Act;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd656-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> United States economic sanctions programs;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd657-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> combating terrorist financing;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd658-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> combating financial crimes, including money laundering, counterfeiting, and other offenses threatening the integrity of the banking and financial systems;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd659-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> other enforcement matters;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd65a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> those intelligence analysis and coordination functions described in subsection (b); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd65b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/4/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> the security functions and programs of the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd65c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reports to congress on proposed measures</span>.—</span></p>The Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes and the Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing shall report to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives not later than 72 hours after proposing by rule, regulation, order, or otherwise, any measure to reorganize the structure of the Department for combatting money laundering and terrorist financing, before any such proposal becomes effective.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd65d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Other offices within otfi</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the following offices of the Department of the Treasury shall be within the OTFI:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd65e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Office of the Assistant Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis, which shall report directly to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd65f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Office of the Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing, which shall report directly to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd660-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The Office of Foreign Assets Control (in this section referred to as the “OFAC”), which shall report directly to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd661-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The Executive Office for Asset Forfeiture, which shall report to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd662-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The Office of Intelligence and Analysis (in this section referred to as the “OIA”), which shall report to the Assistant Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd663-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/6/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> The Office of Terrorist Financing, which shall report to the Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd664-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> FinCEN.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd665-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reporting to undersecretary</span>.—</span></p>The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (in this section referred to as “FinCEN”), a bureau of the Department of the Treasury, shall report to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes. The Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes may not redelegate its reporting authority over FinCEN.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd666-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/a/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Office of compliance</span>.—</span></p>There is established within FinCEN, an Office of Compliance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd667-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Office of Intelligence and Analysis.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd668-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Assistant secretary for intelligence and analysis</span>.—</span></p>The Assistant Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis shall head the OIA.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd669-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Responsibilities</span>.—</span></p>The OIA shall be responsible for the receipt, analysis, collation, and dissemination of intelligence and counterintelligence information related to the operations and responsibilities of the entire Department of the Treasury, including all components and bureaus of the Department.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd66a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Primary functions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The primary functions of the OIA are—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd66b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to build a robust analytical capability on terrorist finance by coordinating and overseeing work involving intelligence analysts in all components of the Department of the Treasury, focusing on the highest priorities of the Department, as well as ensuring that the existing intelligence needs of the OFAC and FinCEN are met; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd66c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to provide intelligence support to senior officials of the Department on a wide range of international economic and other relevant issues.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd66d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Other functions and duties</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The OIA shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd66e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> carry out the intelligence support functions that are assigned, to the Office of Intelligence Support under section 311 (pursuant to section 105 of the Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2004);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd66f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> serve in a liaison capacity with the intelligence community; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd670-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> represent the Department in various intelligence related activities.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd671-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Duties of the assistant secretary</span>.—</span></p>The Assistant Secretary for Intelligence and Analysis shall serve as the Senior Officer Intelligence Community, and shall represent the Department in intelligence community fora, including the National Foreign Intelligence Board committees and the Intelligence Community Management Staff.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd672-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Delegation</span>.—</span></p>To the extent that any authorities, powers, and responsibilities over enforcement matters delegated to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes, or the positions of Assistant Secretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes, Assistant Secretary for Enforcement and Operations, or Deputy Assistant Secretary for Terrorist Financing and Financial Crimes, have not been transferred to the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Justice, or the Assistant Secretary for Tax Policy (related to the customs revenue functions of the Bureau of Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade), those remaining authorities, powers, and responsibilities are delegated to the Undersecretary for Terrorism and Financial Crimes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd673-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designation as Enforcement Organization</span>.—</span></p>The Office of Terrorism and Financial Intelligence (including any components thereof) is designated as a law enforcement organization of the Department of the Treasury for purposes of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9705"/>section 9705 of title 31, United States Code, and other relevant authorities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd674-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of Existing Resources</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may employ personnel, facilities, and other Department of the Treasury resources available to the Secretary on the date of enactment of this section in carrying out this section, except as otherwise prohibited by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd675-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s312/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">References</span>.—</span></p>References in this section to the “Secretary”, “Undersecretary”, “Deputy Secretary”, “Deputy Assistant Secretary”, “Office”, “Assistant Secretary”, and “Department” are references to positions and offices of the Department of the Treasury, unless otherwise specified.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/447/dH/tII">Pub. L. 108–447, div. H, title II</span>, § 222(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-08">Dec. 8, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3242">118 Stat. 3242</span>, § 313; renumbered § 312, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tV">Pub. L. 111–203, title V</span>, § 502(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1580">124 Stat. 1580</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/114/22/tI">Pub. L. 114–22, title I</span>, § 105(c)(2)(A)(ii)(I), <span itemtype="date" date="2015-05-29">May 29, 2015</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/129/237">129 Stat. 237</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9bd67d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313"><span itemtype="num" value="313">§ 313.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Federal Insurance Office</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd67e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment</span>.—</span></p>There is established within the Department of the Treasury the Federal Insurance Office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd67f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Leadership</span>.—</span></p>The Office shall be headed by a Director, who shall be appointed by the Secretary of the Treasury. The position of Director shall be a career reserved position in the Senior Executive Service, as that position is defined under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3132"/>section 3132 of title 5, United States Code.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd680-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Functions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd681-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority pursuant to direction of secretary</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Office, pursuant to the direction of the Secretary, shall have the authority—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd682-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to monitor all aspects of the insurance industry, including identifying issues or gaps in the regulation of insurers that could contribute to a systemic crisis in the insurance industry or the United States financial system;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd683-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to monitor the extent to which traditionally underserved communities and consumers, minorities (as such term is defined in section 1204(c) of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1811"/>12 U.S.C. 1811 note)), and low- and moderate-income persons have access to affordable insurance products regarding all lines of insurance, except health insurance;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd684-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> to recommend to the Financial Stability Oversight Council that it designate an insurer, including the affiliates of such insurer, as an entity subject to regulation as a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors pursuant to title I of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd685-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> to assist the Secretary in administering the Terrorism Insurance Program established in the Department of the Treasury under the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s6701"/>15 U.S.C. 6701 note);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd686-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> to coordinate Federal efforts and develop Federal policy on prudential aspects of international insurance matters, including representing the United States, as appropriate, in the International Association of Insurance Supervisors (or a successor entity) and assisting the Secretary in negotiating covered agreements (as such term is defined in subsection (r));<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd687-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> to determine, in accordance with subsection (f), whether State insurance measures are preempted by covered agreements;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd688-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> to consult with the States (including State insurance regulators) regarding insurance matters of national importance and prudential insurance matters of international importance; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd689-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/1/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> to perform such other related duties and authorities as may be assigned to the Office by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd68a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Advisory functions</span>.—</span></p>The Office shall advise the Secretary on major domestic and prudential international insurance policy issues.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd68b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Advisory capacity on council</span>.—</span></p>The Director shall serve in an advisory capacity on the Financial Stability Oversight Council established under the Financial Stability Act of 2010.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd68c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Scope</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The authority of the Office shall extend to all lines of insurance except—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd68d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> health insurance, as determined by the Secretary in coordination with the Secretary of Health and Human Services based on section 2791 of the Public Health Service Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s300gg–91"/>42 U.S.C. 300gg–91);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd68e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> long-term care insurance, except long-term care insurance that is included with life or annuity insurance components, as determined by the Secretary in coordination with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and in the case of long-term care insurance that is included with such components, the Secretary shall coordinate with the Secretary of Health and Human Services in performing the functions of the Office; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd68f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> crop insurance, as established by the Federal Crop Insurance Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s1501"/>7 U.S.C. 1501 et seq.).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9bd690-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Gathering of Information.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd691-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In carrying out the functions required under subsection (c), the Office may—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd692-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> receive and collect data and information on and from the insurance industry and insurers;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd693-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> enter into information-sharing agreements;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd694-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> analyze and disseminate data and information; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd695-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> issue reports regarding all lines of insurance except health insurance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd696-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Collection of information from insurers and affiliates.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd697-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except as provided in paragraph (3), the Office may require an insurer, or any affiliate of an insurer, to submit such data or information as the Office may reasonably require in carrying out the functions described under subsection (c).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9bd698-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rule of construction</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, for purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “insurer” means any entity that writes insurance or reinsures risks and issues contracts or policies in 1 or more States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd699-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exception for small insurers</span>.—</span></p>Paragraph (2) shall not apply with respect to any insurer or affiliate thereof that meets a minimum size threshold that the Office may establish, whether by order or rule.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9bd69a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Advance coordination</span>.—</span></p>Before collecting any data or information under paragraph (2) from an insurer, or affiliate of an insurer, the Office shall coordinate with each relevant Federal agency and State insurance regulator (or other relevant Federal or State regulatory agency, if any, in the case of an affiliate of an insurer) and any publicly available sources to determine if the information to be collected is available from, and may be obtained in a timely manner by, such Federal agency or State insurance regulator, individually or collectively, other regulatory agency, or publicly available sources. If the Director determines that such data or information is available, and may be obtained in a timely manner, from such an agency, regulator, regulatory agency, or source, the Director shall obtain the data or information from such agency, regulator, regulatory agency, or source. If the Director determines that such data or information is not so available, the Director may collect such data or information from an insurer (or affiliate) only if the Director complies with the requirements of subchapter I of chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code (relating to Federal information policy; commonly known as the Paperwork Reduction Act), in collecting such data or information. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, each such relevant Federal agency and State insurance regulator or other Federal or State regulatory agency is authorized to provide to the Office such data or information.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e208b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Confidentiality.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e208c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Retention of privilege</span>.—</span></p>The submission of any nonpublicly available data and information to the Office under this subsection shall not constitute a waiver of, or otherwise affect, any privilege arising under Federal or State law (including the rules of any Federal or State court) to which the data or information is otherwise subject.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e208d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Continued application of prior confidentiality agreements</span>.—</span></p>Any requirement under Federal or State law to the extent otherwise applicable, or any requirement pursuant to a written agreement in effect between the original source of any nonpublicly available data or information and the source of such data or information to the Office, regarding the privacy or confidentiality of any data or information in the possession of the source to the Office, shall continue to apply to such data or information after the data or information has been provided pursuant to this subsection to the Office.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e208e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Information-sharing agreement</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Any data or information obtained by the Office may be made available to State insurance regulators, individually or collectively, through an information-sharing agreement that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e208f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> shall comply with applicable Federal law; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e2090-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> shall not constitute a waiver of, or otherwise affect, any privilege under Federal or State law (including the rules of any Federal or State court) to which the data or information is otherwise subject.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2091-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Agency disclosure requirements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552"/>Section 552 of title 5, United States Code, shall apply to any data or information submitted to the Office by an insurer or an affiliate of an insurer.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2092-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/e/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Subpoenas and enforcement</span>.—</span></p>The Director shall have the power to require by subpoena the production of the data or information requested under paragraph (2), but only upon a written finding by the Director that such data or information is required to carry out the functions described under subsection (c) and that the Office has coordinated with such regulator or agency as required under paragraph (4). Subpoenas shall bear the signature of the Director and shall be served by any person or class of persons designated by the Director for that purpose. In the case of contumacy or failure to obey a subpoena, the subpoena shall be enforceable by order of any appropriate district court of the United States. Any failure to obey the order of the court may be punished by the court as a contempt of court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e2093-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Preemption of State Insurance Measures.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2094-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Standard</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A State insurance measure shall be preempted pursuant to this section or section 314 if, and only to the extent that the Director determines, in accordance with this subsection, that the measure—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2095-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> results in less favorable treatment of a non-United States insurer domiciled in a foreign jurisdiction that is subject to a covered agreement than a United States insurer domiciled, licensed, or otherwise admitted in that State; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2096-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is inconsistent with a covered agreement.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2097-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Determination.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2098-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice of potential inconsistency</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Before making any determination under paragraph (1), the Director shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e2099-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> notify and consult with the appropriate State regarding any potential inconsistency or preemption;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e209a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> notify and consult with the United States Trade Representative regarding any potential inconsistency or preemption;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e209b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> cause to be published in the Federal Register notice of the issue regarding the potential inconsistency or preemption, including a description of each State
