insurance measure at issue and any applicable covered agreement;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e209c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> provide interested parties a reasonable opportunity to submit written comments to the Office; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e209d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> consider any comments received.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e209e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Scope of review</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this subsection, any determination of the Director regarding State insurance measures, and any preemption under paragraph (1) as a result of such determination, shall be limited to the subject matter contained within the covered agreement involved and shall achieve a level of protection for insurance or reinsurance consumers that is substantially equivalent to the level of protection achieved under State insurance or reinsurance regulation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e209f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice of determination of inconsistency</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Upon making any determination under paragraph (1), the Director shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> notify the appropriate State of the determination and the extent of the inconsistency;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> establish a reasonable period of time, which shall not be less than 30 days, before the determination shall become effective; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/2/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> notify the Committees on Financial Services and Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committees on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs and Finance of the Senate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice of effectiveness</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Upon the conclusion of the period referred to in paragraph (2)(C)(ii), if the basis for such determination still exists, the determination shall become effective and the Director shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> cause to be published a notice in the Federal Register that the preemption has become effective, as well as the effective date; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> notify the appropriate State.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/f/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation</span>.—</span></p>No State may enforce a State insurance measure to the extent that such measure has been preempted under this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Applicability of Administrative Procedures Act</span>.—</span></p>Determinations of inconsistency made pursuant to subsection (f)(2) shall be subject to the applicable provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5 of title 5, United States Code (relating to administrative procedure), and chapter 7 of such title (relating to judicial review), except that in any action for judicial review of a determination of inconsistency, the court shall determine the matter de novo.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Regulations, Policies, and Procedures</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may issue orders, regulations, policies, and procedures to implement this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consultation</span>.—</span></p>The Director shall consult with State insurance regulators, individually or collectively, to the extent the Director determines appropriate, in carrying out the functions of the Office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Savings Provisions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Nothing in this section shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> preempt—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> any State insurance measure that governs any insurer’s rates, premiums, underwriting, or sales practices;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any State coverage requirements for insurance;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the application of the antitrust laws of any State to the business of insurance; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> any State insurance measure governing the capital or solvency of an insurer, except to the extent that such State insurance measure results in less favorable treatment of a non-United State <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002004"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002004"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> insurer than a United States insurer;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> be construed to alter, amend, or limit any provision of the Consumer Financial Protection Agency Act of 2010; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/j/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> affect the preemption of any State insurance measure otherwise inconsistent with and preempted by Federal law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Retention of Existing State Regulatory Authority</span>.—</span></p>Nothing in this section or section 314 shall be construed to establish or provide the Office or the Department of the Treasury with general supervisory or regulatory authority over the business of insurance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/l"><span itemtype="num" value="l">(l)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Retention of Authority of Federal Financial Regulatory Agencies</span>.—</span></p>Nothing in this section or section 314 shall be construed to limit the authority of any Federal financial regulatory agency, including the authority to develop and coordinate policy, negotiate, and enter into agreements with foreign governments, authorities, regulators, and multinational regulatory committees and to preempt State measures to affect uniformity with international regulatory agreements.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/m"><span itemtype="num" value="m">(m)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Retention of Authority of United States Trade Representative</span>.—</span></p>Nothing in this section or section 314 shall be construed to affect the authority of the Office of the United States Trade Representative pursuant to section 141 of the Trade Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s2171"/>19 U.S.C. 2171) or any other provision of law, including authority over the development and coordination of United States international trade policy and the administration of the United States trade agreements program.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/n"><span itemtype="num" value="n">(n)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annual Reports to Congress.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/n/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Section 313(</span>f<span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">) reports</span>.—</span></p>Beginning <p itemtype="date" date="2011-09-30"/>September 30, 2011, the Director shall submit a report on or before September 30 of each calendar year to the President and to the Committees on Financial Services and Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committees on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs and Finance of the Senate on any actions taken by the Office pursuant to subsection (f) (regarding preemption of inconsistent State insurance measures).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/n/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Insurance industry</span>.—</span></p>Beginning <p itemtype="date" date="2011-09-30"/>September 30, 2011, the Director shall submit a report on or before September 30 of each calendar year to the President and to the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate on the insurance industry and any other information as deemed relevant by the Director or requested by such Committees.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/o"><span itemtype="num" value="o">(o)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reports on U.S. and Global Reinsurance Market</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Director shall submit to the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/o/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a report received not later than <p itemtype="date" date="2012-09-30"/>September 30, 2012, describing the breadth and scope of the global reinsurance market and the critical role such market plays in supporting insurance in the United States; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/o/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a report received not later than <p itemtype="date" date="2013-01-01"/>January 1, 2013, and updated not later than <p itemtype="date" date="2015-01-01"/>January 1, 2015, describing the impact of part II of the Nonadmitted and Reinsurance Reform Act of 2010 on the ability of State regulators to access reinsurance information for regulated companies in their jurisdictions.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p"><span itemtype="num" value="p">(p)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Study and Report on Regulation of Insurance.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this section, the Director shall conduct a study and submit a report to Congress on how to modernize and improve the system of insurance regulation in the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Considerations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The study and report required under paragraph (1) shall be based on and guided by the following considerations:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Systemic risk regulation with respect to insurance.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Capital standards and the relationship between capital allocation and liabilities, including standards relating to liquidity and duration risk.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Consumer protection for insurance products and practices, including gaps in State regulation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The degree of national uniformity of State insurance regulation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The regulation of insurance companies and affiliates on a consolidated basis.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> International coordination of insurance regulation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Additional factors</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The study and report required under paragraph (1) shall also examine the following factors:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The costs and benefits of potential Federal regulation of insurance across various lines of insurance (except health insurance).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The feasibility of regulating only certain lines of insurance at the Federal level, while leaving other lines of insurance to be regulated at the State level.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The ability of any potential Federal regulation or Federal regulators to eliminate or minimize regulatory arbitrage.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The impact that developments in the regulation of insurance in foreign jurisdictions might have on the potential Federal regulation of insurance.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The ability of any potential Federal regulation or Federal regulator to provide robust consumer protection for policyholders.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The potential consequences of subjecting insurance companies to a Federal resolution authority, including the effects of any Federal resolution authority—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/F/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> on the operation of State insurance guaranty fund systems, including the loss of guaranty fund coverage if an insurance company is subject to a Federal resolution authority;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/F/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> on policyholder protection, including the loss of the priority status of policyholder claims over other unsecured general creditor claims;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/F/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> in the case of life insurance companies, on the loss of the special status of separate account assets and separate account liabilities; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0f9e20ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/F/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> on the international competitiveness of insurance companies.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/3/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> Such other factors as the Director determines necessary or appropriate, consistent with the principles set forth in paragraph (2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Required recommendations</span>.—</span></p>The study and report required under paragraph (1) shall also contain any legislative, administrative, or regulatory recommendations, as the Director determines appropriate, to carry out or effectuate the findings set forth in such report.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/p/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consultation</span>.—</span></p>With respect to the study and report required under paragraph (1), the Director shall consult with the State insurance regulators, consumer organizations, representatives of the insurance industry and policyholders, and other organizations and experts, as appropriate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/q"><span itemtype="num" value="q">(q)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of Existing Resources</span>.—</span></p>To carry out this section, the Office may employ personnel, facilities, and any other resource of the Department of the Treasury available to the Secretary and the Secretary shall dedicate specific personnel to the Office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r"><span itemtype="num" value="r">(r)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In this section and section 314, the following definitions shall apply:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Affiliate</span>.—</span></p>The term “affiliate” means, with respect to an insurer, any person who controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with the insurer.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Covered agreement</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “covered agreement” means a written bilateral or multilateral agreement regarding prudential measures with respect to the business of insurance or reinsurance that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is entered into between the United States and one or more foreign governments, authorities, or regulatory entities; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> relates to the recognition of prudential measures with respect to the business of insurance or reinsurance that achieves a level of protection for insurance or reinsurance consumers that is substantially equivalent to the level of protection achieved under State insurance or reinsurance regulation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Insurer</span>.—</span></p>The term “insurer” means any person engaged in the business of insurance, including reinsurance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Federal financial regulatory agency</span>.—</span></p>The term “Federal financial regulatory agency” means the Department of the Treasury, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, the Office of Thrift Supervision, the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Federal Housing Finance Agency, or the National Credit Union Administration.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Non-united states insurer</span>.—</span></p>The term “non-United States insurer” means an insurer that is organized under the laws of a jurisdiction other than a State, but does not include any United States branch of such an insurer.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Office</span>.—</span></p>The term “Office” means the Federal Insurance Office established by this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">State insurance measure</span>.—</span></p>The term “State insurance measure” means any State law, regulation, administrative ruling, bulletin, guideline, or practice relating to or affecting prudential measures applicable to insurance or reinsurance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">State insurance regulator</span>.—</span></p>The term “State insurance regulator” means any State regulatory authority responsible for the supervision of insurers.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Substantially equivalent to the level of protection achieved</span>.—</span></p>The term “substantially equivalent to the level of protection achieved” means the prudential measures of a foreign government, authority, or regulatory entity achieve a similar outcome in consumer protection as the outcome achieved under State insurance or reinsurance regulation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">United states insurer</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “United States insurer” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/10/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an insurer that is organized under the laws of a State; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/r/10/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a United States branch of a non-United States insurer.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s313/s"><span itemtype="num" value="s">(s)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authorization of Appropriations</span>.—</span></p>There are authorized to be appropriated for the Office for each fiscal year such sums as may be necessary.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tV">Pub. L. 111–203, title V</span>, § 502(a)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1580">124 Stat. 1580</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9e20e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314"><span itemtype="num" value="314">§ 314.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Covered agreements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary and the United States Trade Representative are authorized, jointly, to negotiate and enter into covered agreements on behalf of the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Requirements for Consultation With Congress.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Before initiating negotiations to enter into a covered agreement under subsection (a), during such negotiations, and before entering into any such agreement, the Secretary and the United States Trade Representative shall jointly consult with the Committee on Financial Services and the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs and the Committee on Finance of the Senate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Scope</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The consultation described in paragraph (1) shall include consultation with respect to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the nature of the agreement;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> how and to what extent the agreement will achieve the applicable purposes, policies, priorities, and objectives of section 313 and this section; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e20ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the implementation of the agreement, including the general effect of the agreement on existing State laws.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Submission and Layover Provisions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A covered agreement under subsection (a) may enter into force with respect to the United States only if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Secretary and the United States Trade Representative jointly submit to the congressional committees specified in subsection (b)(1), on a day on which both Houses of Congress are in session, a copy of the final legal text of the agreement; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s314/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a period of 90 calendar days beginning on the date on which the copy of the final legal text of the agreement is submitted to the congressional committees under paragraph (1) has expired.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tV">Pub. L. 111–203, title V</span>, § 502(a)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1588">124 Stat. 1588</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9e20f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s315"><span itemtype="num" value="315">§ 315.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Continuing in office</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">When the term of office of an officer of the Department of the Treasury ends, the officer may continue to serve until a successor is appointed and qualified.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/880">96 Stat. 880</span>, § 309; renumbered § 310, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/73/tIII">Pub. L. 101–73, title III</span>, § 307(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-08-09">Aug. 9, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/352">103 Stat. 352</span>; renumbered § 311, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 361(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/329">115 Stat. 329</span>; renumbered § 312, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/177/tI">Pub. L. 108–177, title I</span>, § 105(a)(1)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="2003-12-13">Dec. 13, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/2603">117 Stat. 2603</span>; renumbered § 315, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tV">Pub. L. 111–203, title V</span>, § 502(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1580">124 Stat. 1580</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0f9e20fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch3/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">ADMINISTRATIVE</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0f9e20fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321"><span itemtype="num" value="321">§ 321.</span><span itemtype="heading"> General authority of the Secretary</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e20fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e20ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> prepare plans for improving and managing receipts of the United States Government and managing the public debt;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2100-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> carry out services related to finances that the Secretary is required to perform;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2101-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> issue warrants for money drawn on the Treasury consistent with appropriations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2102-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> mint coins, engrave and print currency and security documents, and refine and assay bullion, and may strike medals;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2103-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> prescribe regulations that the Secretary considers best calculated to promote the public convenience and security, and to protect the Government and individuals from fraud and loss, that apply to anyone who may—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2104-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> receive for the Government, Treasury notes, United States notes, or other Government securities; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2105-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> be engaged or employed in preparing and issuing those notes or securities;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2106-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> collect receipts;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2107-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> with a view to prosecuting persons, take steps to discover fraud and attempted fraud involving receipts and decide on ways to prevent and detect fraud;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2108-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> maintain separate accounts of taxes received in each State, territory, and possession of the United States, and collection district, with each account listing—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2109-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/8/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> each kind of tax;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e210a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/8/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the amount of each tax; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e210b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/8/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the money paid as pay and allowances to officers and employees of the Department collecting taxes in that State, territory, possession, or district; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e210c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> advise the President on major domestic and international prudential policy issues in connection with all lines of insurance except health insurance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e210d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e210e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> prescribe regulations to carry out the duties and powers of the Secretary;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e210f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> delegate duties and powers of the Secretary to another officer or employee of the Department of the Treasury;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2110-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> transfer within the Department the records, property, officers, employees, and unexpended balances of appropriations, allocations, and amounts of the Department that the Secretary considers necessary to carry out a delegation made under clause (2) of this subsection;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2111-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> detail, in addition to details authorized under another law, not more than 6 officers and employees of the Department at any one time to enforce the laws related to the Department, except that of those 6 officers and employees not more than 4 officers and employees—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2112-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> paid from the appropriations for the collection of customs may be so detailed;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2113-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> paid from the appropriations for internal revenue may be so detailed; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0f9e2114-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> paid from the appropriations for suppressing counterfeiting and other crimes may be so detailed;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2115-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> authorize, at rates and under conditions prescribed by the Secretary, the private use of telephone lines controlled by the Department when the use does not interfere with Department business;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2116-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> buy arms and ammunition required by officers and employees of the Department in carrying out their duties and powers; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2117-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> notwithstanding any other provision of law, fulfill any requirement to issue a report on the financial condition of any fund on the books of the Treasury by including the required information in a consolidated report, except that information with respect to a specific fund shall be separately reported if the Secretary determines that the consolidation of such information would result in an unwarranted delay in the availability of such information.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e2118-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Duties and powers of officers and employees of the Department are vested in the Secretary except duties and powers—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e2119-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> vested by subchapter II of chapter 5 of title 5 in administrative law judges employed by the Secretary; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0f9e211a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> of the Comptroller of the Currency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e211b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e211c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may accept, hold, administer, and use gifts and bequests of property, both real and personal, for the purpose of aiding or facilitating the work of the Department of the Treasury. Gifts and bequests of money and the proceeds from sales of other property received as gifts or bequests shall be deposited in the Treasury in a separate fund and shall be disbursed on order of the Secretary of the Treasury. Property accepted under this paragraph, and the proceeds thereof, shall be used as nearly as possible in accordance with the terms of the gift or bequest.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e211d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> For purposes of the Federal income, estate, and gift taxes, property accepted under paragraph (1) shall be considered as a gift or bequest to or for the use of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0f9e211e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may invest and reinvest the fund in public debt securities with maturities suitable for the needs of the fund and bearing interest at rates determined by the Secretary of the Treasury, taking into consideration the current average market yield on outstanding marketable obligations of the United States of comparable maturities. Income accruing from the securities, and from any other property accepted under paragraph (1), shall be deposited to the credit of the fund, and shall be disbursed on order of the Secretary of the Treasury for purposes as nearly as possible in accordance with the terms of the gifts or bequests.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0911f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s321/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall, not less frequently than annually, make a public disclosure of the amount (and sources) of the gifts and bequests received under this subsection, and the purposes for which amounts in the separate fund established under this subsection are expended.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/880">96 Stat. 880</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dA/tIV">Pub. L. 98–369, div. A, title IV</span>, § 445, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/816">98 Stat. 816</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/73/tIII">Pub. L. 101–73, title III</span>, § 307(b), (d), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-08-09">Aug. 9, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/353">103 Stat. 353</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/66/tI">Pub. L. 104–66, title I</span>, § 1132(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1995-12-21">Dec. 21, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/725">109 Stat. 725</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tIII">Pub. L. 111–203, title III</span>, § 378(1), title V, § 502(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1570">124 Stat. 1570</span>, 1588.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa09127-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322"><span itemtype="num" value="322">§ 322.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Working capital fund</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09128-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Department of the Treasury has a working capital fund. Amounts in the fund are available for expenses of operating and maintaining common administrative services of the Department that the Secretary of the Treasury, with the approval of the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, decides may be carried out more advantageously and more economically as central services.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09129-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Amounts in the fund remain available until expended. Amounts may be appropriated to the fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0912a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The fund consists of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0912b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> amounts appropriated to the fund;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0912c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to the extent transferred to the fund by the Secretary, the reasonable value of supply inventories, equipment, and other assets and inventories on order for providing services out of amounts in the fund, less related liabilities and unpaid obligations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0912d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> amounts received from the sale or exchange of property; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0912e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> payments received for loss or damage to property of the fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0912f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s322/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The fund shall be reimbursed, or credited with advance payments, from amounts available to the Department or from other sources, for supplies and services at rates that will equal the expenses of operation, including accrual of annual leave and the depreciation of plant and equipment. Amounts the Secretary decides are in excess of the needs of the fund shall be deposited at the end of each fiscal year in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/881">96 Stat. 881</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dA/tIV">Pub. L. 98–369, div. A, title IV</span>, § 442, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/816">98 Stat. 816</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa09135-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323"><span itemtype="num" value="323">§ 323.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Investment of operating cash</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09136-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To manage United States cash, the Secretary of the Treasury may invest any part of the operating cash of the Treasury for not more than 90 days. The Secretary may invest the operating cash of the Treasury in—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09137-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> obligations of depositories maintaining Treasury tax and loan accounts secured by pledged collateral acceptable to the Secretary;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09138-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> obligations of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09139-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> repurchase agreements with parties acceptable to the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0913a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Subsection (a) of this section does not require the Secretary to invest a cash balance held in a particular account.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0913b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary shall consider the prevailing market in prescribing rates of interest for investments under subsection (a)(1) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0913c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0913d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall submit each fiscal year to the appropriate committees a report detailing the investment of operating cash under subsection (a) for the preceding fiscal year. The report shall describe the Secretary’s consideration of risks associated with investments and the actions taken to manage such risks.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0913e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s323/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “appropriate committees” means the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Finance of the Senate.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/882">96 Stat. 882</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/351/tV">Pub. L. 110–351, title V</span>, § 502, <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-07">Oct. 7, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3980">122 Stat. 3980</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa09143-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324"><span itemtype="num" value="324">§ 324.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Disposing and extending the maturity of obligations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09144-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09145-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> dispose of obligations—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa09146-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> acquired by the Secretary for the United States Government; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa09147-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> delivered by an executive agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09148-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> make arrangements to extend the maturity of those obligations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09149-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary may dispose or extend the maturity of obligations under subsection (a) of this section in the way, in amounts, at prices (for cash, obligations, property, or a combination of cash, obligations, or property), and on conditions the Secretary considers advisable and in the public interest.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0914a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s324/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The authority under this section is in addition to authority under another law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/882">96 Stat. 882</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dA/tIV">Pub. L. 98–369, div. A, title IV</span>, § 444, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/816">98 Stat. 816</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa0914f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325"><span itemtype="num" value="325">§ 325.</span><span itemtype="heading"> International affairs authorization</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09150-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury, the Secretary may provide officers and employees of the Department of the Treasury carrying out international affairs duties and powers of the Department with allowances and benefits comparable to those provided under chapter 9 of title I of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t22/s4081"/>22 U.S.C. 4081 et seq.).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09151-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The following amounts may be appropriated to the Secretary for the fiscal year ending <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-30">September 30, 1982</span>:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09152-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> not more than $22,896,000 to carry out the international affairs duties and powers of the Department (including amounts for official functions and reception and representation expenses).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09153-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> not more than $1,000,000 for increases in—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa09154-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> pay, under section 5382(c) and subchapter I of chapter 53 of title 5 (except section 5305, or corresponding prior provision of such title), of officers and employees carrying out the duties and powers referred to in clause (1) of this subsection;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa09155-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> departmental contributions attributable to those pay increases; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa09156-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> allowances and benefits, because of cost of living increases, provided under subsection (a) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09157-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Necessary amounts may be appropriated to the Secretary for each fiscal year beginning after <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-30">September 30, 1982</span>—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09158-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to carry out the international affairs duties and powers of the Department (including amounts for official functions and reception and representation expenses);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09159-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for increases in—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa0915a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> pay, under section 5382(c) and subchapter I of chapter 53 of title 5 (except section 5303), of officers and employees carrying out the duties and powers referred to in clause (1) of this subsection;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa0915b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> departmental contributions attributable to those pay increases; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa0915c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s325/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> allowances and benefits, because of cost of living increases, provided under subsection (a) of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/882">96 Stat. 882</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/509/tV">Pub. L. 101–509, title V</span>, § 529 [title I, § 101(b)(3)(D)], <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1427">104 Stat. 1427</span>, 1439.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa09163-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s326"><span itemtype="num" value="326">§ 326.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of appropriations for certain expenses</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09164-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s326/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury, an appropriation for the Department of the Treasury available to pay travel expenses also is available to pay expenses to attend meetings of organizations related to the function or activity for which the appropriation is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09165-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s326/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary may approve reimbursement to agents on protective missions for subsistence expenses authorized by law without regard to rates and amounts established under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5702"/>section 5702 of title 5.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/883">96 Stat. 883</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/234/tI">Pub. L. 99–234, title I</span>, § 107(e), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-01-02">Jan. 2, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/1759">99 Stat. 1759</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa0916b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327"><span itemtype="num" value="327">§ 327.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Advancements and reimbursements for services</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0916c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section, “service” includes service provided in—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0916d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> disbursing and receiving amounts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0916e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> servicing bonds.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0916f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> making accounts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09170-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> maintaining bank accounts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09171-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s327/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> When the Secretary of the Treasury provides a service for an agency (except the Department of the Treasury) for which amounts have not been appropriated to the Department, the agency may advance for credit or reimburse the Department the amounts necessary to provide the service. Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3302"/>section 3302 of this title, amounts advanced or reimbursed may be credited to the appropriation of the Department that is current when the service is provided.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/883">96 Stat. 883</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa09175-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s328"><span itemtype="num" value="328">§ 328.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Accounts and payments of former disbursing officials</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09176-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s328/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> If a chief disbursing official or a director of a disbursing center of the Department of the Treasury dies, resigns, or leaves office, the deputy chief disbursing official or the deputy director of the disbursing center designated by the Secretary of the Treasury may continue the accounts and payments in the name of the former disbursing official or director through the last day of the 2d month after the month in which the death, resignation, or separation occurs. The accounts and payments shall be allowed, audited, and settled as provided by law. The Secretary shall honor checks signed in the name of the former disbursing official or director in the same way as if the former disbursing official or director had continued in office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09177-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s328/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Only the deputy chief or deputy director designated under subsection (a) of this section is liable for actions taken in the name of the former disbursing official under subsection (a).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/883">96 Stat. 883</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa0917b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329"><span itemtype="num" value="329">§ 329.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitations on outside activities</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0917c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa0917d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury and the Treasurer may not—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0917e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> be involved in trade or commerce;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa0917f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> own any part of a vessel (except a pleasure vessel);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09180-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> buy or hold as a beneficiary in trust public property;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09181-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> be involved in buying or disposing of obligations of a State or the United States Government; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09182-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> personally take or use a benefit gained from conducting business of the Department of the Treasury except as authorized by law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09183-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An officer violating this subsection shall be fined $3,000, removed from office, and thereafter may not hold an office of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09184-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> An individual (except prosecutors) giving information leading to the prosecution and conviction of an individual violating this subsection shall receive $1,500 of the fine when paid.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09185-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09186-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An officer or employee of the Department (except the Secretary or Treasurer) may not—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09187-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> carry on a trade or business in the funds, debts, or property of a State or the Government; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa09188-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> personally use a benefit gained from conducting business of the Department.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa09189-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s329/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An officer or employee violating this subsection shall be fined $500 and removed from office.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/884">96 Stat. 884</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fa2db7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330"><span itemtype="num" value="330">§ 330.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Practice before the Department</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa2db7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subject to <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s500">section 500 of title 5</span>, the Secretary of the Treasury may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> regulate the practice of representatives of persons before the Department of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> before admitting a representative to practice, require that the representative demonstrate—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa2db81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> good character;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa2db82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> good reputation;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa2db83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> necessary qualifications to enable the representative to provide to persons valuable service; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fa2db84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> competency to advise and assist persons in presenting their cases.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa2db85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Any enrolled agents properly licensed to practice as required under rules promulgated under subsection (a) shall be allowed to use the credentials or designation of “enrolled agent”, “EA”, or “E.A.”.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa2db86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> After notice and opportunity for a proceeding, the Secretary may suspend or disbar from practice before the Department, or censure, a representative who—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is incompetent;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> is disreputable;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> violates regulations prescribed under this section; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> with intent to defraud, willfully and knowingly misleads or threatens the person being represented or a prospective person to be represented.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>The Secretary may impose a monetary penalty on any representative described in the preceding sentence. If the representative was acting on behalf of an employer or any firm or other entity in connection with the conduct giving rise to such penalty, the Secretary may impose a monetary penalty on such employer, firm, or entity if it knew, or reasonably should have known, of such conduct. Such penalty shall not exceed the gross income derived (or to be derived) from the conduct giving rise to the penalty and may be in addition to, or in lieu of, any suspension, disbarment, or censure of the representative.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa2db8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> After notice and opportunity for a hearing to any appraiser, the Secretary may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> provide that appraisals by such appraiser shall not have any probative effect in any administrative proceeding before the Department of the Treasury or the Internal Revenue Service, and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fa2db8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> bar such appraiser from presenting evidence or testimony in any such proceeding.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fa2db8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s330/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Nothing in this section or in any other provision of law shall be construed to limit the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury to impose standards applicable to the rendering of written advice with respect to any entity, transaction plan or arrangement, or other plan or arrangement, which is of a type which the Secretary determines as having a potential for tax avoidance or evasion.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/884">96 Stat. 884</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dA/tI">Pub. L. 98–369, div. A, title I</span>, § 156(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/695">98 Stat. 695</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/357/tVIII">Pub. L. 108–357, title VIII</span>, § 822(a)(1), (b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-22">Oct. 22, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1586">118 Stat. 1586</span>, 1587; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/280/tXII">Pub.
