L. 110–323</span>, § 5(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3544">122 Stat. 3544</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0faec2d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch7/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL DUTIES AND POWERS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0faec2d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s711"><span itemtype="num" value="711">§ 711.</span><span itemtype="heading"> General authority</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Comptroller General may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s711/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> prescribe regulations to carry out the duties and powers of the Comptroller General;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s711/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> delegate the duties and powers of the Comptroller General to officers and employees of the Government Accountability Office as the Comptroller General decides is necessary to carry out those duties and powers;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s711/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> regulate the practice of representatives of persons before the Office; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s711/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> administer oaths to witnesses when auditing and settling accounts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/889">96 Stat. 889</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0faec2df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s712"><span itemtype="num" value="712">§ 712.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Investigating the use of public money</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Comptroller General shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s712/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> investigate all matters related to the receipt, disbursement, and use of public money;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s712/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> estimate the cost to the United States Government of complying with each restriction on expenditures of a specific appropriation in a general appropriation law and report each estimate to Congress with recommendations the Comptroller General considers desirable;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s712/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> analyze expenditures of each executive agency the Comptroller General believes will help Congress decide whether public money has been used and expended economically and efficiently;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s712/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> make an investigation and report ordered by either House of Congress or a committee of Congress having jurisdiction over revenue, appropriations, or expenditures; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s712/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> give a committee of Congress having jurisdiction over revenue, appropriations, or expenditures the help and information the committee requests.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/889">96 Stat. 889</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0faec2ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713"><span itemtype="num" value="713">§ 713.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audit of Internal Revenue Service, Tax and Trade Bureau, and Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Under regulations of the Comptroller General, the Comptroller General shall audit the Internal Revenue Service and the Tax and Trade Bureau, Department of the Treasury, and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives, Department of Justice of the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002007"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002007"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> An audit under this section does not affect a final decision of the Secretary of the Treasury under section 6406 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s6406"/>26 U.S.C. 6406).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To carry out this section and to the extent provided by and only subject to section 6103 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s6103">26 U.S.C. 6103</span>)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> returns and return information (as defined in section 6103(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s6103/b"/>26 U.S.C. 6103(b)) shall be made available to the Comptroller General; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> records and property of, or used by, the Service or either Bureau, shall be made available to the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> At least once every 6 months, the Comptroller General shall designate each officer and employee of the Government Accountability Office by name and title to whom returns, return information, or records or property of the Service or either Bureau that can identify a particular taxpayer may be made available. Each designation or a certified copy of the designation shall be sent to the Committee on Finance of the Senate, the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives, the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate, the Committee on Government Operations of the House, the Joint Committee on Taxation, the Commissioner of Internal Revenue, the Tax and Trade Bureau, Department of the Treasury, and the Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives, Department of Justice.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s713/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Except as expressly provided by law, an officer or employee of the Office may make known information derived from a record or property of, or in use by, the Service or either Bureau that can identify a particular taxpayer only to another officer or employee of the Office whose duties or powers require that the record or property be made known.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/889">96 Stat. 889</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/296/tXI">Pub. L. 107–296, title XI</span>, § 1112(m), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-11-25">Nov. 25, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/2277">116 Stat. 2277</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0faec2f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714"><span itemtype="num" value="714">§ 714.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audit of Financial Institutions Examination Council, Federal Reserve Board, Federal reserve banks, Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and Office of Comptroller of the Currency</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, “agency” means the Financial Institutions Examination Council, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (in this section referred to as the “Board”), Federal reserve banks, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0faec2fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Under regulations of the Comptroller General, the Comptroller General shall audit an agency, but may carry out an onsite examination of an open insured bank or bank holding company only if the appropriate agency has consented in writing. Audits of the Board and Federal reserve banks may not include—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> transactions for or with a foreign central bank, government of a foreign country, or nonprivate international financing organization;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> deliberations, decisions, or actions on monetary policy matters, including discount window operations, reserves of member banks, securities credit, interest on deposits, and open market operations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0faec2fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> transactions made under the direction of the Federal Open Market Committee; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb132fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a part of a discussion or communication among or between members of the Board and officers and employees of the Federal Reserve System related to clauses (1)–(3) of this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb132ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13300-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in this subsection, an officer or employee of the Government Accountability Office may not disclose information identifying an open bank, an open bank holding company, or a customer of an open or closed bank or bank holding company. The Comptroller General may disclose information related to the affairs of a closed bank or closed bank holding company identifying a customer of the closed bank or closed bank holding company only if the Comptroller General believes the customer had a controlling influence in the management of the closed bank or closed bank holding company or was related to or affiliated with a person or group having a controlling influence.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13301-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An officer or employee of the Office may discuss a customer, bank, or bank holding company with an official of an agency and may report an apparent criminal violation to an appropriate law enforcement authority of the United States Government or a State.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13302-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Except as provided under paragraph (4), an officer or employee of the Government Accountability Office may not disclose to any person outside the Government Accountability Office information obtained in audits or examinations conducted under subsection (e) and maintained as confidential by the Board or the Federal reserve banks.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13303-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subsection shall not—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13304-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> authorize an officer or employee of an agency to withhold information from any committee or subcommittee of jurisdiction of Congress, or any member of such committee or subcommittee; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13305-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/c/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> limit any disclosure by the Government Accountability Office to any committee or subcommittee of jurisdiction of Congress, or any member of such committee or subcommittee.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13306-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13307-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> To carry out this section, all records and property of or used by an agency, including samples of reports of examinations of a bank or bank holding company the Comptroller General considers statistically meaningful and workpapers and correspondence related to the reports shall be made available to the Comptroller General. The Comptroller General shall have access to the officers, employees, contractors, and other agents and representatives of an agency and any entity established by an agency at any reasonable time as the Comptroller General may request. The Comptroller General may make and retain copies of such books, accounts, and other records as the Comptroller General determines appropriate. The Comptroller General shall give an agency a current list of officers and employees to whom, with proper identification, records and property may be made available, and who may make notes or copies necessary to carry out an audit.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13308-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall prevent unauthorized access to records, copies of any record, or property of or used by an agency or any person or entity described in paragraph (3)(A) that the Comptroller General obtains during an audit.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13309-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1330a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of conducting audits and examinations under subsection (e) or (f), the Comptroller General shall have access, upon request, to any information, data, schedules, books, accounts, financial records, reports, files, electronic communications, or other papers, things or property belonging to or in use by—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1330b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> any entity established by any action taken by the Board or the Federal Reserve banks described under subsection (e) or (f);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1330c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any entity participating in or receiving assistance from any action taken by the Board or the Federal Reserve banks described under subsection (e) or (f), to the extent that the access and request relates to that assistance; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1330d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the officers, directors, employees, independent public accountants, financial advisors and any and all representatives of any entity described under clause (i) or (ii); to the extent that the access and request relates to that assistance;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1330e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall have access as provided under subparagraph (A) at such time as the Comptroller General may request. The Comptroller General may make and retain copies of books, accounts, and other records provided under subparagraph (A) as the Comptroller General deems appropriate. The Comptroller General shall provide to any person or entity described in subparagraph (A) a current list of officers and employees to whom, with proper identification, records and property may be made available, and who may make notes or copies necessary to carry out a <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002008"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002008"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> audit or examination under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1330f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/d/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Each contract, term sheet, or other agreement between the Board or any Federal reserve bank (or any entity established by the Board or any Federal reserve bank) and an entity receiving assistance from any action taken by the Board described under subsection (e) or (f) shall provide for access by the Comptroller General in accordance with this paragraph.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13310-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Notwithstanding subsection (b), the Comptroller General may conduct audits, including onsite examinations when the Comptroller General determines such audits and examinations are appropriate, of any action taken by the Board under the third undesignated paragraph of section 13 <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002009"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002009"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> of the Federal Reserve Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s343"/>12 U.S.C. 343); with respect to a single and specific partnership or corporation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13311-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audits of Credit Facilities of the Federal Reserve System.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13312-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In this subsection, the following definitions shall apply:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13313-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Credit facility</span>.—</span></p>The term “credit facility” means a program or facility, including any special purpose vehicle or other entity established by or on behalf of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System or a Federal reserve bank, authorized by the Board of Governors under section 13(3) of the Federal Reserve Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s343"/>12 U.S.C. 343), that is not subject to audit under subsection (e).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13314-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Covered transaction</span>.—</span></p>The term “covered transaction” means any open market transaction or discount window advance that meets the definition of “covered transaction” in section 11(s) of the Federal Reserve Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13315-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority for audits and examinations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Subject to paragraph (3), and notwithstanding any limitation in subsection (b) on the auditing and oversight of certain functions of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System or any Federal reserve bank, the Comptroller General of the United States may conduct audits, including onsite examinations, of the Board of Governors, a Federal reserve bank, or a credit facility, if the Comptroller General determines that such audits are appropriate, solely for the purposes of assessing, with respect to a credit facility or a covered transaction—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13316-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the operational integrity, accounting, financial reporting, and internal controls governing the credit facility or covered transaction;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13317-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the effectiveness of the security and collateral policies established for the facility or covered transaction in mitigating risk to the relevant Federal reserve bank and taxpayers;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13318-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> whether the credit facility or the conduct of a covered transaction inappropriately favors one or more specific participants over other institutions eligible to utilize the facility; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13319-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the policies governing the use, selection, or payment of third-party contractors by or for any credit facility or to conduct any covered transaction.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1331a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports and delayed disclosure.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb1331b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reports required</span>.—</span></p>A report on each audit conducted under paragraph (2) shall be submitted by the Comptroller General to the Congress before the end of the 90-day period beginning on the date on which such audit is completed.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb1331c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents</span>.—</span></p>The report under subparagraph (A) shall include a detailed description of the findings and conclusions of the Comptroller General with respect to the matters described in paragraph (2) that were audited and are the subject of the report, together with such recommendations for legislative or administrative action relating to such matters as the Comptroller General may determine to be appropriate.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb1331d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Delayed release of certain information.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb1331e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall not disclose to any person or entity, including to Congress, the names or identifying details of specific participants in any credit facility or covered transaction, the amounts borrowed by or transferred by or to specific participants in any credit facility or covered transaction, or identifying details regarding assets or collateral held or transferred by, under, or in connection with any credit facility or covered transaction, and any report provided under subparagraph (A) shall be redacted to ensure that such names and details are not disclosed.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb1331f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Delayed release</span>.—</span></p>The nondisclosure obligation under clause (i) shall expire with respect to any participant on the date on which the Board of Governors, directly or through a Federal reserve bank, publicly discloses the identity of the subject participant or the identifying details of the subject assets, collateral, or transaction.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb13320-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General release</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall release a nonredacted version of any report on a credit facility 1 year after the effective date of the termination by the Board of Governors of the authorization for the credit facility. For purposes of this clause, a credit facility shall be deemed to have terminated 24 months after the date on which the credit facility ceases to make extensions of credit and loans, unless the credit facility is otherwise terminated by the Board of Governors.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb13321-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exceptions</span>.—</span></p>The nondisclosure obligation under clause (i) shall not apply to the credit facilities Maiden Lane, Maiden Lane II, and Maiden Lane III.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb13322-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s714/f/3/C/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Release of covered transaction information</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall release a nonredacted version of any report regarding covered transactions upon the release of the information regarding such covered transactions by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, as provided in section 11(s) of the Federal Reserve Act.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/890">96 Stat. 890</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/73/tIII">Pub. L. 101–73, title III</span>, § 307(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-08-09">Aug. 9, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/353">103 Stat. 353</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3834">110 Stat. 3834</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/22/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 111–22, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 801, <span itemtype="date" date="2009-05-20">May 20, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/1662">123 Stat. 1662</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tIII">Pub. L. 111–203, title III</span>, § 378(2), title XI, § 1102, <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/1570">124 Stat. 1570</span>, 2115.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb13329-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715"><span itemtype="num" value="715">§ 715.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audit of accounts and operations of the District of Columbia government</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1332a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In addition to the audit carried out under section 455 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/93/198"/>Public Law 93–198, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/87/803"/>87 Stat. 803; D.C. Code, § 47–117), the Comptroller General each year shall audit the accounts and operations of the District of Columbia government. An audit shall be carried out according to principles, under regulations, and in a way the Comptroller General prescribes. When prescribing the procedures to follow and the extent of the inspection of records, the Comptroller General shall consider generally accepted principles of auditing, including the effectiveness of accounting organizations and systems, internal audit and control, and related administrative practices.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1332b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall submit each audit report to Congress and (other than the audit reports of the District of Columbia Courts) the Mayor and Council of the District of Columbia. The report shall include the scope of an audit, information the Comptroller General considers necessary to keep Congress, the Mayor, and the Council informed of operations audited, and recommendations the Comptroller General considers advisable.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1332c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1332d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> By the 90th day after receiving an audit report from the Comptroller General, the Mayor shall state in writing to the Council measures the District of Columbia government is taking to comply with the recommendations of the Comptroller General. A copy of the statement shall be sent to Congress.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1332e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> After the Council receives the statement of the Mayor, the Council may make available for public inspection the report of the Comptroller General and other material the Council considers pertinent.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1332f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> To carry out this section, records and property of or used by the District of Columbia government necessary to make an audit easier shall be made available to the Comptroller General. The Mayor shall provide facilities to carry out an audit.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13330-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s715/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Not later than March 1 of each year, the Comptroller General shall submit to the Committee on the District of Columbia of the House of Representatives and the Subcommittee on General Services, Federalism, and the District of Columbia of the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate a review of the report of the breakdown of the independently audited revenues of the District of Columbia for the preceding fiscal year by revenues derived from the Federal Government and revenues derived from sources other than the Federal Government that is included in the independent annual audit of the funds of the District of Columbia conducted for such fiscal year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/891">96 Stat. 891</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/102">Pub. L. 102–102</span>, § 2(c)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1991-08-17">Aug. 17, 1991</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/105/496">105 Stat. 496</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/33/tXI">Pub. L. 105–33, title XI</span>, §§ 11244(b), 11717(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-08-05">Aug. 5, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/754">111 Stat. 754</span>, 786.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb1333a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716"><span itemtype="num" value="716">§ 716.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of information and inspection of records</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1333b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Each agency shall give the Comptroller General information the Comptroller General requires about the duties, powers, activities, organization, and financial transactions of the agency. The Comptroller General may inspect an agency record to get the information. This subsection does not apply to expenditures made under section 3524 or 3526(e) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1333c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1333d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> When an agency record is not made available to the Comptroller General within a reasonable time, the Comptroller General may make a written request to the head of the agency. The request shall state the authority for inspecting the records and the reason for the inspection. The head of the agency has 20 days after receiving the request to respond. The response shall describe the record withheld and the reason the record is being withheld. If the Comptroller General is not given an opportunity to inspect the record within the 20-day period, the Comptroller General may file a report with the President, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, the Attorney General, the head of the agency, and Congress.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1333e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Through an attorney the Comptroller General designates in writing, the Comptroller General may bring a civil action in the district court of the United States for the District of Columbia to require the head of the agency to produce a record—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1333f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> after 20 days after a report is filed under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13340-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> subject to subsection (d) of this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13341-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Attorney General may represent the head of the agency. The court may punish a failure to obey an order of the court under this subsection as a contempt of court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13342-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13343-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Subject to subsection (d) of this section, the Comptroller General may subpena a record of a person not in the United States Government when the record is not made available to the Comptroller General to which the Comptroller General has access by law or by agreement of that person from whom access is sought. A subpena shall identify the record and the authority for the inspection and may be issued by the Comptroller General. The Comptroller General may have an individual serve a subpena under this subsection by delivering a copy to the person named in the subpena or by mailing a copy of the subpena by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, to the residence or principal place of business of the person. Proof of service is shown by a verified return by the individual serving the subpena that states how the subpena was served or by the return receipt signed by the person served.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13344-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If a person residing, found, or doing business in a judicial district refuses to comply with a subpena issued under paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Comptroller General, through an attorney the Comptroller General designates in writing, may bring a civil action in that district court to require the person to produce the record. The court has jurisdiction of the action and may punish a failure to obey an order of the court under this subsection as a contempt of court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13345-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13346-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General may not bring a civil action for a record withheld under subsection (b) of this section or issue a subpena under subsection (c) of this section if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13347-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the record related to activities the President designates as foreign intelligence or counterintelligence activities;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13348-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the record is specifically exempted from disclosure to the Comptroller General by a statute that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb13349-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> without discretion requires that the record be withheld from the Comptroller General;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb1334a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> establishes particular criteria for withholding the record from the Comptroller General; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb1334b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> refers to particular types of records to be withheld from the Comptroller General; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1334c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> by the 20th day after a report is filed under subsection (b)(1) of this section, the President or the Director certifies to the Comptroller General and Congress that a record could be withheld under section 552(b)(5) or (7) of title 5 and disclosure reasonably could be expected to impair substantially the operations of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1334d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The President or the Director may not delegate certification under paragraph (1)(C) of this subsection. A certification shall include a complete explanation of the reasons for the certification.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1334e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1334f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall maintain the same level of confidentiality for a record made available under this section as is required of the head of the agency from which it is obtained. Officers and employees of the Government Accountability Office are subject to the same statutory penalties for unauthorized disclosure or use as officers or employees of the agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13350-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall keep information described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552/b/6"/>section 552(b)(6) of title 5 that the Comptroller General obtains in a way that prevents unwarranted invasions of personal privacy.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13351-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s716/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> This section does not authorize information to be withheld from Congress.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/892">96 Stat. 892</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb13356-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717"><span itemtype="num" value="717">§ 717.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Evaluating programs and activities of the United States Government</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13357-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, “agency” means a department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government (except a mixed-ownership Government corporation) or the District of Columbia government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13358-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall evaluate the results of a program or activity the Government carries out under existing law—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13359-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> on the initiative of the Comptroller General;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1335a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when either House of Congress orders an evaluation; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1335b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> when a committee of Congress with jurisdiction over the program or activity requests the evaluation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1335c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall develop and recommend to Congress ways to evaluate a program or activity the Government carries out under existing law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1335d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1335e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> On request of a committee of Congress, the Comptroller General shall help the committee to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1335f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> develop a statement of legislative goals and ways to assess and report program performance related to the goals, including recommended ways to assess performance, information to be reported, responsibility for reporting, frequency of reports, and feasibility of pilot testing; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13360-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> assess program evaluations prepared by and for an agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13361-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s717/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> On request of a member of Congress, the Comptroller General shall give the member a copy of the material the Comptroller General compiles in carrying out this subsection that has been released by the committee for which the material was compiled.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/893">96 Stat. 893</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb13365-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718"><span itemtype="num" value="718">§ 718.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of draft reports</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13366-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A draft report of an audit under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s714"/>section 714 of this title shall be submitted to the Financial Institutions Examination Council, the Federal Reserve Board, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, or the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency for comment for 30 days.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13367-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13368-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General may submit a part of a draft report to an agency for comment for more than 30 days only if the Comptroller General decides, after a showing by the agency, that a longer period is necessary and likely to result in a more accurate report. The report may not be delayed because the agency does not comment within the comment period.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13369-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When a draft report is submitted to an agency for comment, the Comptroller General shall make the draft report available on request to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1336a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> either House of Congress, a committee of Congress, or a member of Congress if the report was begun because of a request of the House, committee, or member; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1336b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives if the report was not begun because of a request of either House of Congress, a committee of Congress, or a member of Congress.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1336c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> This subsection is subject to statutory and executive order guidelines for handling and storing classified information and material.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb1336d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A final report of the Comptroller General shall include—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1336e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a statement of significant changes of a finding, conclusion, or recommendation in an earlier draft report because of comments on the draft by an agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb1336f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a statement of the reasons the changes were made; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb13370-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s718/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> for a draft report submitted under subsection (a) of this section, written comments of the agency submitted during the comment period.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/894">96 Stat. 894</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb13375-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719"><span itemtype="num" value="719">§ 719.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Comptroller General reports</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb13376-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> At the beginning of each regular session of Congress, the Comptroller General shall report to Congress (and to the President when requested by the President) on the work of the Comptroller General. A report shall include recommendations on—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a477-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> legislation the Comptroller General considers necessary to make easier the prompt and accurate making and settlement of accounts; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a478-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> other matters related to the receipt, disbursement, and use of public money the Comptroller General considers advisable.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a479-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a47a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall include in the report to Congress under subsection (a) of this section—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a47b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a review of activities under sections 717(b)–(d) and 731(e)(2) of this title, including recommendations under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s717/c"/>section 717(c) of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a47c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> information on carrying out duties and powers of the Comptroller General under clauses (A) and (C) of this paragraph, subsections (g) and (h) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002010"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002010"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of this section, and sections 717, 731(e)(2), 734, 1112, and 1113 of this title; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a47d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the name of each officer and employee of the Government Accountability Office assigned or detailed to a committee of Congress, the committee to which the officer or employee is assigned or detailed, the length of the period of assignment or detail, a statement on whether the assignment or detail is finished or continuing, and compensation paid out of appropriations available to the Comptroller General for the period of the assignment or detail that has been completed.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a47e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> In a report under subsection (a) of this section or in a special report to Congress when Congress is in session, the Comptroller General shall include recommendations on greater economy and efficiency in public expenditures.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a47f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The report under subsection (a) shall also include a statement of the staff hours and estimated cost of work performed on audits, evaluations, investigations, and related work during each of the three fiscal years preceding the fiscal year in which the report is submitted, stated separately for each division of the Government Accountability Office by category as follows:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a480-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> A category for work requested by the chairman of a committee of Congress, the chairman of a subcommittee of such a committee, or any other Member of Congress.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a481-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> A category for work required by law to be performed by the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a482-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/b/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> A category for work initiated by the Comptroller General in the performance of the Comptroller General’s general responsibilities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a483-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall report to Congress—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a484-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> specially on expenditures and contracts an agency makes in violation of law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a485-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> on the adequacy and effectiveness of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a486-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> administrative audits of accounts and claims in an agency; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a487-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> inspections by an agency of offices and accounts of fiscal officials; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a488-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> as frequently as practicable on audits carried out under sections 713 and 714 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a489-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall report on analyses carried out under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s712/3"/>section 712(3) of this title to the Committees on Governmental Affairs and Appropriations of the Senate, the Committees on Government Operations and Appropriations of the House, and the committees with jurisdiction over legislation related to the operation of each executive agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a48a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall give the President information on expenditures and accounting the President requests.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a48b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When the Comptroller General submits a report to Congress, the Comptroller General shall deliver copies of the report to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a48c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Committees on Governmental Affairs and Appropriations of the Senate;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a48d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Committees on Government Operations and Appropriations of the House;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a48e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a committee of Congress that requested information on any part of a program or activity of a department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government (except a mixed-ownership Government corporation) or the District of Columbia government that is the subject of any part of a report; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a48f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/f/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> any other committee of Congress requesting a copy.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a490-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a491-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall prepare—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a492-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/g/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> each month a list of reports issued during the prior month; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a493-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/g/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> at least once each year a list of reports issued during the prior 12 months.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a494-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall make each list available through the public website of the Government Accountability Office. On request, the Comptroller General promptly shall provide a copy of a report to a committee or member of Congress.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a495-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> On request of a committee of Congress, the Comptroller General shall explain to and discuss with the committee or committee staff a report the Comptroller General makes that would help the committee—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a496-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> evaluate a program or activity of an agency within the jurisdiction of the committee; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a497-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s719/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in its consideration of proposed legislation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/894">96 Stat. 894</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3834">110 Stat. 3834</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/85/dA/tX">Pub. L. 105–85, div. A, title X</span>, § 1044, <span itemtype="date" date="1997-11-18">Nov. 18, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/1887">111 Stat. 1887</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/188/tIX">Pub. L. 113–188, title IX</span>, § 902(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-11-26">Nov. 26, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/2021">128 Stat. 2021</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb3a4a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s720"><span itemtype="num" value="720">§ 720.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Agency reports</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s720/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, “agency” means a department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government (except a mixed-ownership Government corporation) or the District of Columbia government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s720/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When the Comptroller General makes a report that includes a recommendation to the head of an agency, the head of the agency shall submit a written statement on action taken on the recommendation by the head of the agency. The statement shall be submitted to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s720/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives before the 61st day after the date of the report; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s720/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Committees on Appropriations of both Houses of Congress in the first request for appropriations submitted more than 60 days after the date of the report.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/896">96 Stat. 896</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fb3a4aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch7/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">PERSONNEL</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb3a4ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731"><span itemtype="num" value="731">§ 731.</span><span itemtype="heading"> General</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General may appoint, pay, assign, and remove officers (except the Deputy Comptroller General) and employees the Comptroller General decides are necessary to carry out the duties and powers of the Government Accountability Office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Comptroller General may establish for appropriate officers and employees a merit pay system consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5401"/>section 5401 of title 5, as in effect on <p itemtype="date" date="1993-10-31"/>October 31, 1993.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The annual rate of basic pay of the General Counsel of the Government Accountability Office is equal to the rate for level IV of the Executive Schedule.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" status="repealed" id="id0fb3a4af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">[(d)</span></p> Repealed. <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323"/>Pub. L. 110–323, § 9(a)(1), <p itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22"/>Sept. 22, 2008, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3548"/>122 Stat. 3548.]<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Comptroller General may procure the services of experts and consultants under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3109"/>section 3109 of title 5 at rates not in excess of the daily rate for level IV of the Executive Schedule, except that the services of not more than 20 experts and consultants may be procured for terms of not more than 3 years, but which shall be renewable.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall prescribe regulations under which officers and employees of the Office may, in appropriate circumstances, be reimbursed for any relocation expenses under subchapter II of chapter 57 of title 5 for which they would not otherwise be eligible, but only if the Comptroller General determines that the transfer giving rise to such relocation is of sufficient benefit or value to the Office to justify such reimbursement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall prescribe regulations under which key officers and employees of the Office who have less than 3 years of service may accrue leave in accordance with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s6303/a/2"/>section 6303(a)(2) of title 5, in those circumstances in which the Comptroller General has determined such increased annual leave is appropriate for the recruitment or retention of such officers and employees. Such regulations shall define key officers and employees and set forth the factors in determining which officers and employees should be allowed to accrue leave in accordance with this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General may by regulation establish an executive exchange program under which officers and employees of the Office may be assigned to private sector organizations, and employees of private sector organizations may be assigned to the Office, to further the institutional interests of the Office or Congress, including for the purpose of providing training to officers and employees of the Office. Regulations to carry out any such program—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> shall include provisions (consistent with sections 3702 through 3704 of title 5) as to matters concerning—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the duration and termination of assignments;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> reimbursements; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> status, entitlements, benefits, and obligations of program participants;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> shall limit—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the number of officers and employees who are assigned to private sector organizations at any one time to not more than 15; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the number of employees from private sector organizations who are assigned to the Office at any one time to not more than 30;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> shall require that an employee of a private sector organization assigned to the Office may not have access to any trade secrets or to any other nonpublic information which is of commercial value to the private sector organization from which such employee is assigned;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> shall require that, before approving the assignment of an officer or employee to a private sector organization, the Comptroller General shall determine that the assignment is an effective use of the Office’s funds, taking into account the best interests of the Office and the costs and benefits of alternative methods of achieving the same results and objectives; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/h/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> shall not allow any assignment under this subsection to commence after the end of the 5-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An employee of a private sector organization assigned to the Office under the executive exchange program shall be considered to be an employee of the Office for purposes of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> chapter 73 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> sections 201, 203, 205, 207, 208, 209, 603, 606, 607, 643, 654, 1905, and 1913 of title 18;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> sections 1343, 1344, and 1349(b) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> chapter 171 of title 28 (commonly referred to as the “Federal Tort Claims Act”) and any other Federal tort liability statute;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> section 1043 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/i/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> chapter 21 of title 41.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> Funds appropriated to the Government Accountability Office for salaries and expenses are available for meals and other related reasonable expenses incurred in connection with recruitment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s731/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Federal Government Details</span>.—</span></p>The activities of the Government Accountability Office may, in the reasonable discretion of the Comptroller General, be carried out by receiving details of personnel from other offices of the Federal Government on a reimbursable, partially-reimbursable, or nonreimbursable basis.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub.
