L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/896">96 Stat. 896</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/326">Pub. L. 98–326</span>, § 1(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-06-22">June 22, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/269">98 Stat. 269</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/615/tII">Pub. L. 98–615, title II</span>, § 204(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-11-08">Nov. 8, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/3216">98 Stat. 3216</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/89">Pub. L. 103–89</span>, § 3(b)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-09-30">Sept. 30, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/983">107 Stat. 983</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/303">Pub. L. 106–303</span>, § 5, <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-13">Oct. 13, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1069">114 Stat. 1069</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, §§ 5–7, 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/813">118 Stat. 813</span>, 814; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323">Pub. L. 110–323</span>, § 9(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3548">122 Stat. 3548</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/114/113/dI/tI">Pub. L. 114–113, div. I, title I</span>, § 1301(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2015-12-18">Dec. 18, 2015</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/129/2671">129 Stat. 2671</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb3a4d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732"><span itemtype="num" value="732">§ 732.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Personnel management system</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall maintain a personnel management system. The Comptroller General may prescribe a regulation about the system only after notice and opportunity for public comment. A reprisal or threat of reprisal may not be made against an officer or employee of the Government Accountability Office because of comments on a proposed regulation about the system.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The personnel management system shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> include the principles of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s2301/b"/>section 2301(b) of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> prohibit personnel practices prohibited under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s2302/b"/>section 2302(b) of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> prohibit political activities prohibited under subchapter III of chapter 73 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> ensure that officers and employees of the Office are appointed, promoted, and assigned only on the basis of merit and fitness, but without regard to those provisions of title 5 governing appointments and other personnel actions in the competitive service;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> give a preference to an individual eligible for a preference in the executive branch of the United States Government in a way and to an extent consistent with a preference given an individual in the executive branch; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> provide that the Comptroller General shall fix the basic pay of officers and employees of the Office not fixed by law, consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5301"/>section 5301 of title 5, except as provided under subsection (c)(3) of this section and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/3/B"/>section 733(a)(3)(B) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb3a4db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Under the personnel management system—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Comptroller General shall publish a schedule of basic pay rates for officers and employees of the Office;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> except as provided in clause (4) of this subsection and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/3/A"/>section 733(a)(3)(A) of this title, the highest basic pay rate under the pay schedule may not be more than the rate for level III of the Executive Level, except that the total amount of cash compensation in any year shall be subject to the limitations provided under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5307/a/1"/>section 5307(a)(1) of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb3a4de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> except as provided under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/3/B">section 733(a)(3)(B) of this title</span>, basic rates of officers and employees of the Office shall be adjusted annually to such extent as determined by the Comptroller General, and in making that determination the Comptroller General shall consider—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the principle that equal pay should be provided for work of equal value within each local pay area;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the need to protect the purchasing power of officers and employees of the Office, taking into consideration the Consumer Price Index or other appropriate indices;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> any existing pay disparities between officers and employees of the Office and non-Federal employees in each local pay area;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the pay rates for the same levels of work for officers and employees of the Office and non-Federal employees in each local pay area;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the appropriate distribution of agency funds between annual adjustments under this section and performance-based compensation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb3a4e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> such other criteria as the Comptroller General considers appropriate, including, but not limited to, the funding level for the Office, amounts allocated for performance-based compensation, and the extent to which the Office is succeeding in fulfilling its mission and accomplishing its strategic plan;<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>notwithstanding any other provision of this paragraph, an adjustment under this paragraph shall not be applied in the case of any officer or employee whose performance is not at a satisfactory level, as determined by the Comptroller General for purposes of such adjustment;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the pay schedule for officers and employees of the Office may provide that the basic pay rates for not more than 129 positions (including senior-level positions under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732a"/>section 732a of this title) may be at rates not more than the rate of basic pay payable for grade GS–18 of the General Schedule, less the number of positions in the General Accounting Office Senior Executive Service <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002011"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002011"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733"/>section 733 of this title (except positions included in the Service under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733/c"/>section 733(c) of this title and senior-level positions described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732a/b"/>section 732a(b) of this title); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the Comptroller General shall prescribe regulations under which an officer or employee of the Office shall be entitled to pay retention if, as a result of any reduction-in-force or other workforce adjustment procedure, position reclassification, or other appropriate circumstances as determined by the Comptroller General, such officer or employee is placed in or holds a position in a lower grade or band with a maximum rate of basic pay that is less than the rate of basic pay payable to the officer or employee immediately before the reduction in grade or band; such regulations—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5edd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> shall provide that the officer or employee shall be entitled to continue receiving the rate of basic pay that was payable to the officer or employee immediately before the reduction in grade or band until such time as the retained rate becomes less than the maximum rate for the grade or band of the position held by such officer or employee; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5edd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> shall include provisions relating to the minimum period of time for which an officer or employee must have served or for which the position must have been classified at the higher grade or band in order for pay retention to apply, the events that terminate the right to pay retention (apart from the one described in subparagraph (A)), and exclusions based on the nature of an appointment; in prescribing regulations under this subparagraph, the Comptroller General shall be guided by the provisions of sections 5362 and 5363 of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The personnel management system shall provide—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for a system to appraise the performance of officers and employees of the General Accounting Office <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002012">2</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002012"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> that meets the requirements of <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s4302">section 4302 of title 5</span> and in addition includes—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5eddb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a link between the performance management system and the agency’s strategic plan;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5eddc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> adequate training and retraining for supervisors, managers, and employees in the implementation and operation of the performance management system;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5eddd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a process for ensuring ongoing performance feedback and dialogue between supervisors, managers, and employees throughout the appraisal period and setting timetables for review;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5edde-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> effective transparency and accountability measures to ensure that the management of the system is fair, credible, and equitable, including appropriate independent reasonableness, reviews, internal assessments, and employee surveys; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5eddf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> a means to ensure that adequate agency resources are allocated for the design, implementation, and administration of the performance management system;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> that the Comptroller General has the same responsibility for performance appraisals under this subsection as the Director of the Office of Personnel Management has under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s4302"/>section 4302 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> for a reduction in grade or removal of an officer or employee because of unacceptable performance consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s4303"/>section 4303 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> for other personnel actions consistent with chapter 75 of title 5; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> a procedure for processing complaints and grievances not otherwise provided for under clauses (3) and (4) of this subsection or subsection (e) or (f)(1) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ede4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The personnel management system shall provide—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a procedure that ensures that each officer and employee of the Government Accountability Office may form, join, or assist, or not form, join, or assist, an employee organization freely and without fear of penalty or reprisal; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> for a labor-management relations program consistent with chapter 71 of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ede7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ede8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The personnel management system shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ede9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> provide that all personnel actions affecting an officer, employee, or applicant for employment be taken without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, political affiliation, marital status, or handicapping condition; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> include a minority recruitment program consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s7201"/>section 7201 of title 5.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edeb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subchapter and subchapter IV of this chapter do not affect a right or remedy of an officer, employee, or applicant for employment under a law prohibiting discrimination in employment in the Government on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, political affiliation, marital status, or handicapping condition. However, for officers, employees, or applicants in the Government Accountability Office—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <p itemtype="sup"/>1 has the same authority over oversight and appeals matters as an executive agency has over oversight and appeals matters; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5eded-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Comptroller General has the same authority over matters (except oversight and appeals) as an executive agency has over matters (except oversight and appeals).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> This section does not affect a lawful effort to achieve equal employment opportunity through affirmative action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> An officer or employee of the Government Accountability Office completing at least one year of continuous service under a nontemporary appointment under the personnel management system acquires a competitive status for appointment to a position in the competitive service for which the officer or employee is qualified.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edf0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edf1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edf2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Comptroller General shall prescribe regulations, consistent with regulations issued by the Office of Personnel Management under authority of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3502/a"/>section 3502(a) of title 5 for the separation of employees of the Government Accountability Office during a reduction in force or other adjustment in force.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edf3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The regulations must give effect to the following factors in descending order of priority—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edf4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> tenure of employment;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edf5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> military preference subject to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3501/a/3"/>section 3501(a)(3) of title 5;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edf6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> veterans’ preference under sections 3502(b) and 3502(c) of title 5;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edf7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> performance ratings;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edf8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> length of service computed in accordance with the second sentence of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3502/a"/>section 3502(a) of title 5; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5edf9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/B/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> other objective factors such as skills and knowledge that the Comptroller General considers necessary and appropriate to realign the agency’s workforce in order to meet current and future mission needs, to correct skill imbalances, or to reduce high-grade, managerial, or supervisory positions.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edfa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Notwithstanding subparagraph (B), the regulations relating to removal from the General Accounting Office Senior Executive Service <p itemtype="sup"/>1 in a reduction in force or other adjustment in force shall be consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3595/a"/>section 3595(a) of title 5.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edfb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edfc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The regulations shall provide a right of appeal to the General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <p itemtype="sup"/>1 regarding a personnel action under the regulations, consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s753"/>section 753 of this title.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edfd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The regulations shall provide that final decision by the General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <p itemtype="sup"/>1 may be reviewed by the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s755"/>section 755 of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edfe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5edff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subparagraph (B), an employee may not be released, due to a reduction in force, unless such employee is given written notice at least 60 days before such employee is so released. Such notice shall include—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee00-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the personnel action to be taken with respect to the employee involved;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee01-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the effective date of the action;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee02-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> a description of the procedures applicable in identifying employees for release;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee03-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the employee’s ranking relative to other competing employees, and how that ranking was determined; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> a description of any appeal or other rights which may be available.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/h/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Comptroller General may, in writing, shorten the period of advance notice required under subparagraph (A) with respect to a particular reduction in force, if necessary because of circumstances not reasonably foreseeable, except that such period may not be less than 30 days.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> The regulations under subsection (h) shall include provisions under which, at the discretion of the Comptroller General, the opportunity to separate voluntarily (in order to permit the retention of an individual occupying a similar position) shall, with respect to the Government Accountability Office, be available to the same extent and in the same manner as described in subsection (f)(1)–(4) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3502"/>section 3502 of title 5 (with respect to the Department of Defense or a military department).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the term “pay increase”, as used with respect to an officer or employee in connection with a year, means the total increase in the rate of basic pay (expressed as a percentage) of such officer or employee, taking effect under section 731(b) and subsection (c)(3) in such year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the term “required minimum percentage”, as used with respect to an officer or employee in connection with a year, means the percentage equal to the total increase in rates of basic pay (expressed as a percentage) taking effect under sections 5303 and 5304–5304a of title 5 in such year with respect to General Schedule positions within the pay locality (as defined by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5302/5"/>section 5302(5) of title 5) in which the position of such officer or employee is located;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the term “covered officer or employee”, as used with respect to a pay increase, means any individual—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5ee0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> who is an officer or employee of the Government Accountability Office, other than an officer or employee described in subparagraph (A), (B), or (C) of section 4(c)(1) of the Government Accountability Office Act of 2008, determined as of the effective date of such pay increase; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5ee0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> whose performance is at least at a satisfactory level, as determined by the Comptroller General under the provisions of subsection (c)(3) for purposes of the adjustment taking effect under such provisions in such year; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the term “nonpermanent merit pay” means any amount payable under section 731(b) which does not constitute basic pay.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, if (disregarding this subsection) the pay increase that would otherwise take effect with respect to a covered officer or employee in a year would be less than the required minimum percentage for such officer or employee in such year, the Comptroller General shall provide for a further increase in the rate of basic pay of such officer or employee.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee11-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The further increase under this subsection—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee12-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> shall be equal to the amount necessary to make up for the shortfall described in subparagraph (A); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> shall take effect as of the same date as the pay increase otherwise taking effect in such year.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Nothing in this paragraph shall be considered to permit or require that a rate of basic pay be increased to an amount inconsistent with the limitation set forth in subsection (c)(2).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> If (disregarding this subsection) the covered officer or employee would also have received any nonpermanent merit pay in such year, such nonpermanent merit pay shall be decreased by an amount equal to the portion of such officer’s or employee’s basic pay for such year which is attributable to the further increase described in subparagraph (A) (as determined by the Comptroller General), but to not less than zero.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732/j/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, the effective date of any pay increase (within the meaning of paragraph (1)(A)) taking effect with respect to a covered officer or employee in any year shall be the same as the effective date of any adjustment taking effect under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5303"/>section 5303 of title 5 with respect to statutory pay systems (as defined by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5302/1"/>section 5302(1) of title 5) in such year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/897">96 Stat. 897</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/326">Pub. L. 98–326</span>, § 1(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-06-22">June 22, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/269">98 Stat. 269</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tIII">Pub. L. 100–426, title III</span>, §§ 302, 303, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1602">102 Stat. 1602</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/509/tV">Pub. L. 101–509, title V</span>, § 529 [title I, § 101(b)(2)(B)], <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1427">104 Stat. 1427</span>, 1439; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/53/tII">Pub. L. 104–53, title II</span>, § 212(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1995-11-19">Nov. 19, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/535">109 Stat. 535</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/303">Pub. L. 106–303</span>, §§ 3(a)(1), (b)(1), 4(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-13">Oct. 13, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1066">114 Stat. 1066</span>, 1068, 1069; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, §§ 3(a), (c), 4, 8(b), 9, 12, <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/812">118 Stat. 812</span>, 814, 816; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323">Pub. L. 110–323</span>, §§ 2(a), 8, <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3539">122 Stat. 3539</span>, 3548.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb5ee25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a"><span itemtype="num" value="732a">§ 732a.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Critical positions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General may establish senior-level positions to meet critical scientific, technical or professional needs of the Government Accountability Office. An individual serving in such a position shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> be subject to the laws and regulations applicable to the General Accounting Office Senior Executive Service <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002013"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002013"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733"/>section 733 of this title, with respect to rates of basic pay, performance awards, ranks, carry over of annual leave, benefits, performance appraisals, removal or suspension, and reductions in force;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> have the same rights of appeal to the General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <p itemtype="sup"/>1 as are provided to the Office Senior Executive Service;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> be exempt from the same provisions of law as are made inapplicable to the Office Senior Executive Service under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733/d"/>section 733(d) of this title, except for <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/e"/>section 732(e) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> be entitled to discontinued service retirement under chapter 83 or 84 of title 5 as if a member of the Office Senior Executive Service; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> be subject to reassignment by the Comptroller General to any position in the Office Senior Executive Service under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733"/>section 733 of this title, as the Comptroller General determines necessary and appropriate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s732a/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Senior-level positions under this section may include positions referred to in paragraph (1) or (2) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s731/e"/>section 731(e) of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/303">Pub. L. 106–303</span>, § 4(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-13">Oct. 13, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1068">114 Stat. 1068</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323">Pub. L. 110–323</span>, § 9(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3548">122 Stat. 3548</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb5ee31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733"><span itemtype="num" value="733">§ 733.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Senior Executive Service</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General may establish a General Accounting Office Senior Executive Service <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002014">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002014"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> —<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> meeting the requirements of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3131"/>section 3131 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> providing requirements for positions consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3132/a/2"/>section 3132(a)(2) of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> providing rates of basic pay—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5ee36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> not more than the maximum rate or less than the minimum rate for the Senior Executive Service under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5382"/>section 5382 of title 5; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb5ee37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> adjusted annually by the Comptroller General after taking into consideration the factors listed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/c/3"/>section 732(c)(3) of this title, except that an adjustment under this subparagraph shall not be applied in the case of any officer or employee whose performance is not at a satisfactory level, as determined by the Comptroller General for purposes of such adjustment;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> providing a performance appraisal system consistent with subchapter II of chapter 43 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> allowing the Comptroller General to award ranks to officers and employees in the Office Senior Executive Service consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s4507"/>section 4507 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> providing for removal consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3592"/>section 3592 of title 5, and for removal or suspension consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s7543"/>section 7543 of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> allowing the Comptroller General to reassign an officer or employee in the Office Senior Executive Service to any senior-level position established under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732a"/>section 732a of this title, as the Comptroller General determines necessary and appropriate; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb5ee3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> allowing the Comptroller General to pay performance awards to officers and employees of the Office Senior Executive Service consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5384"/>section 5384 of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Except as provided in subsection (a), the Comptroller General may apply any part of title 5 that applies to an applicant for or officer or employee in the Senior Executive Service under title 5 to the Office Senior Executive Service.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Office Senior Executive Service may include positions referred to in section 731(c), (e)(1), or (e)(2) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s733/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Section 732(b)(6), (c), (d)(1)–(4), and (e) of this title does not apply to the Office Senior Executive Service.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/899">96 Stat. 899</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/326">Pub. L. 98–326</span>, § 1(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-06-22">June 22, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/269">98 Stat. 269</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/303">Pub. L. 106–303</span>, § 4(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-13">Oct. 13, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1069">114 Stat. 1069</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 3(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/812">118 Stat. 812</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323">Pub. L. 110–323</span>, § 9(b)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3548">122 Stat. 3548</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb5ee47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s734"><span itemtype="num" value="734">§ 734.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Assignments and details to Congress</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Comptroller General may assign or detail an officer or employee of the Government Accountability Office to full-time continuous duty with a committee of Congress for not more than one year.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/899">96 Stat. 899</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/367/tI">Pub. L. 98–367, title I</span>, § 8, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-17">July 17, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/475">98 Stat. 475</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb5ee4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s735"><span itemtype="num" value="735">§ 735.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Relationship to other laws</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s735/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Except as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s733/c"/>section 733(c) of this title, this subchapter and subchapter IV of this chapter do not affect sections 702(b), 703, 731(c) and (e), 772, 775(a) and (d) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s735/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Except as specifically provided in this subchapter and subchapter IV of this chapter, those subchapters do not change the application of a law applicable to officers and employees of the Government Accountability Office.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/899">96 Stat. 899</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323">Pub. L. 110–323</span>, § 9(b)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3548">122 Stat. 3548</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb5ee53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s736"><span itemtype="num" value="736">§ 736.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authorization of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Amounts necessary to carry out this subchapter and subchapter IV of this chapter may be appropriated to the Comptroller General.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/900">96 Stat. 900</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fb5ee57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch7/schIV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">SUBCHAPTER IV—</span><span itemtype="heading">PERSONNEL APPEALS BOARD</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb5ee58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751"><span itemtype="num" value="751">§ 751.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Organization</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb5ee59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Government Accountability Office has a General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board.<span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002015">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002015"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> The Board is composed of 5 members appointed by the Comptroller General. An individual may be appointed only if the individual—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is not a current or former officer or employee of the Office or of the Architect of the Capitol, the Botanic Garden, or the Senate Restaurants,; <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002016"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002016"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> has the demonstrated ability, background, training, and experience necessary to be qualified specially to serve on the Board; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> demonstrates a capacity and willingness to devote sufficient time to dispose of cases in a timely way.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall appoint members only—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> after considering any candidates who are recommended to the Comptroller General (at such time and in such manner as the Comptroller General requires) by organizations composed primarily of individuals experienced in adjudicating or arbitrating personnel matters; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> after the Comptroller General consults with organizations representing employees of the Office and with any member of each committee of Congress, having legislative jurisdiction over the personnel management system maintained under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732"/>section 732 of this title, whom the chairman of the committee designates.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (2), the term of a member of the Board is 5 years. A member may not be reappointed. An individual appointed to fill a vacancy occurring before the expiration of a term of office is appointed for the remainder of the term. However, if the unexpired part of a term is less than one year, the Comptroller General may appoint an individual for a 5-year term plus the unexpired part of the term. When the term of a member ends, the member may continue to serve until a successor takes office or for 6 months after the term expires, whichever is earlier.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term of a member serving on the date of the enactment of the General Accounting Office Personnel Amendments Act of 1988 shall be as follows:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Of the 2 members appointed in 1985, the term of 1 such member shall be 5 years, and the term of the other such member shall be 6 years.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> Of the 2 members appointed in 1986, the term of 1 such member shall be 6 years, and the term of the other such member shall be 7 years.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> The term of the member appointed in 1987 shall be 7 years.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Within 60 days after the date referred to in subparagraph (A), the Comptroller General shall determine—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> with respect to the members under subparagraph (A)(i), which will have a term of 5 years and which will have a term of 6 years; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> with respect to the members under subparagraph (A)(ii), which will have a term of 6 years and which will have a term of 7 years.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A term established for a member under this paragraph shall be measured—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> from the date on which the member was originally appointed; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/c/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> in the case of a member serving for the unexpired portion of a term, from the appointment date of the individual who was originally appointed to serve for such term.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> A member may be removed by a majority of the Board (except the member subject to removal) only for inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office. A member subject to removal shall be given notice and an opportunity for a hearing before the Board unless the member waives the opportunity in writing.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s751/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> While carrying out a member’s duties (including travel), a member who is not an officer or employee of the United States Government is entitled to basic pay at a rate equal to the daily rate of basic pay payable for grade GS–18 of the General Schedule. Each member is entitled to travel expenses and per diem allowances under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5703"/>section 5703 of title 5.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/900">96 Stat. 900</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tI">Pub. L. 100–426, title I</span>, §§ 101, 102(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1598">102 Stat. 1598</span>, 1599; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/283/tIII">Pub. L. 103–283, title III</span>, § 312(e)(4)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-22">July 22, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1446">108 Stat. 1446</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85f77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752"><span itemtype="num" value="752">§ 752.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Chairman and General Counsel</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002017"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002017"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> shall select one of its members as Chairman. The Chairman is the chief executive and administrative officer of the Board.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall appoint as General Counsel of the Board an individual the Chairman selects. The General Counsel serves at the pleasure of the Chairman.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Chairman shall fix the pay of the General Counsel. The rate of basic pay of the General Counsel may be not more than the maximum rate of basic pay payable for grade GS–16 of the General Schedule.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The General Counsel shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> investigate an allegation about a prohibited personnel practice under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/2"/>section 732(b)(2) of this title to decide if there are reasonable grounds to believe the practice has occurred, exists, or will be taken by an officer or an employee of the Government Accountability Office;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> investigate an allegation about a prohibited political activity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/3"/>section 732(b)(3) of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> investigate a matter under the jurisdiction of the Board if the Board or a member of the Board requests; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s752/b/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> help the Board carry out its duties and powers.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/901">96 Stat. 901</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tI">Pub. L. 100–426, title I</span>, § 102(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1599">102 Stat. 1599</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85f87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753"><span itemtype="num" value="753">§ 753.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Duties and powers</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002018">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002018"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> may consider and order corrective or disciplinary action in a case arising from—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> an officer or employee appeal about a removal, suspension for more than 14 days, reduction in grade or pay, or furlough of not more than 30 days;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a prohibited personnel practice under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/2"/>section 732(b)(2) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a prohibited political activity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/b/3"/>section 732(b)(3) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a decision of an appropriate unit of employees for collective bargaining;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> an election or certification of a collective bargaining representative;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> a matter appealable to the Board under the labor-management relations program under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/e/2"/>section 732(e)(2) of this title, including a labor practice prohibited under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/e/1"/>section 732(e)(1) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> an action involving discrimination prohibited under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/f/1"/>section 732(f)(1) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> an issue about Office personnel the Comptroller General by regulation decides the Board shall resolve; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> an action involving discrimination prohibited under section 312(e)(2) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002019"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002019"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> of the Architect of the Capitol Human Resources Act.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Board has no authority to issue a stay of any reduction in force action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f93-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Board may delegate to a member or a panel of members the authority to act under subsection (a) of this section. A decision of a member or panel under subsection (a) is deemed to be a final decision of the Board unless the Board reconsiders the decision under subsection (d) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f94-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> On motion of a party or on its own initiative, the Board may reconsider a decision under subsection (a) of this section by the 30th day after the decision is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85f95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Board shall prescribe regulations—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> providing for officer and employee appeals consistent with sections 7701 and 7702 of title 5; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85f97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s753/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> on the operating procedure of the Board.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/901">96 Stat. 901</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/283/tIII">Pub. L. 103–283, title III</span>, § 312(e)(4)(B), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-22">July 22, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1446">108 Stat. 1446</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/53/tII">Pub. L. 104–53, title II</span>, § 213, <span itemtype="date" date="1995-11-19">Nov. 19, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/535">109 Stat. 535</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85f9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s754"><span itemtype="num" value="754">§ 754.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Action by the Comptroller General</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">When the Comptroller General has authority, the Comptroller General promptly shall carry out action the General Accounting Office Personnel Appeals Board <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002020">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002020"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> orders under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s753">section 753 of this title</span>.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/902">96 Stat. 902</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85fa4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s755"><span itemtype="num" value="755">§ 755.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Judicial review</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fa5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s755/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A final decision under section 753(a)(1)–(3), (6),,<span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002021">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002021"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> (7) or (9) of this title may be reviewed by the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit. Chapter 158 of title 28 applies to a review under this subchapter, except the petition for review shall be filed by the 30th day after the petitioner receives notice of the decision. The court shall set aside a final decision the court decides is—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fa6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s755/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not consistent with law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fa7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s755/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> not made consistent with required procedures; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fa8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s755/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> unsupported by substantial evidence.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fa9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s755/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> If an officer, employee, applicant for employment, or employee of the Architect of the Capitol, the Botanic Garden, or the Senate Restaurants is the prevailing party in a proceeding under this section, and the decision is based on a finding of discrimination prohibited under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s732/f"/>section 732(f) of this title or under section 312(e)(2) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002022"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002022"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> of the Architect of the Capitol Human Resources Act, attorney’s fees may be allowed by the court in accordance with the standards prescribed under section 706(k) of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/902">96 Stat. 902</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/216">Pub. L. 98–216</span>, § 1(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-02-14">Feb. 14, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/3">98 Stat. 3</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tI">Pub. L. 100–426, title I</span>, § 103(a), (b), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1599">102 Stat. 1599</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/283/tIII">Pub. L. 103–283, title III</span>, § 312(e)(4)(C), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-22">July 22, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1446">108 Stat. 1446</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fb85fb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch7/schV"><span itemtype="num" value="V">SUBCHAPTER V—</span><span itemtype="heading">ANNUITIES</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85fb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771"><span itemtype="num" value="771">§ 771.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this subchapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “dependent child” means an unmarried dependent child (including a stepchild or adopted child) who is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> under 18 years of age;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> incapable of self-support because of physical or mental disability; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> between 18 and 22 years of age and is a student regularly pursuing a full-time course of study or training in residence in a high school, trade school, technical or vocational institute, junior college, college, university, or comparable recognized educational institution. For the purposes of this subchapter, a child whose 22nd birthday occurs before July 1 or after August 31 of a calendar year, and while such child is regularly pursuing such a course of study or training, is deemed to have become 22 years of age on the first day of July after that birthday. A child who is a student is deemed not to have ceased to be a student during an interim period between school years if the interim period is not more than 5 months and if such child shows to the satisfaction of the General Counsel of the Government Accountability Office that such child has a bona fide intention of continuing in the same or a different school during the school semester (or other period into which the school year is divided) immediately after the interim period.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “surviving spouse” means a surviving spouse of an individual who was a Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General and the spouse—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> was married to the individual for at least 1 year immediately before the individual died; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> has not remarried before age 55 and is the parent of issue by the marriage.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fbb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s771/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> service as a Comptroller General equals the number of years and complete months an individual is Comptroller General.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/902">96 Stat. 902</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tII">Pub. L. 100–426, title II</span>, § 202, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1600">102 Stat. 1600</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85fc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772"><span itemtype="num" value="772">§ 772.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annuity of the Comptroller General</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, a Comptroller General serving a complete term as Comptroller General or who retires under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s703/e/1"/>section 703(e)(1) of this title is entitled to receive an annuity for life equal to the pay the Comptroller General is receiving on completion of the term or at the time of retirement.
