An annuity of a Comptroller General who completes a term before becoming 65 years of age is reduced by .25 percent for each complete month the Comptroller General is under 65 years of age.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, a Comptroller General becoming permanently disabled shall be retired and is entitled to receive an annuity for life equal to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the pay of the Comptroller General at the time of retirement if the Comptroller General served at least 10 years; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> 50 percent of the pay if the Comptroller General served less than 10 years.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A Comptroller General who, when appointed, is or has been subject to subchapter III of chapter 83 or chapter 84 of title 5 remains subject to such subchapter III or such chapter 84 (as the case may be) unless the Comptroller General elects in writing to receive an annuity under this section. An election is irrevocable and must be made within 10 years and 60 days after the start of service as Comptroller General. A Comptroller General electing to receive an annuity under this section is entitled to a refund of the lump-sum credit to the account of the Comptroller General in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A Comptroller General (except a Comptroller General remaining subject to subchapter III of chapter 83 of title 5) shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> deposit with the Government Accountability Office for redeposit in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts as a contribution to the annuity—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 3.5 percent of the pay received as Comptroller General before deductions are made under clause (2)(A) of this subsection plus 3 percent interest compounded every December 31 on the amount to be deposited, if electing survivor benefits under this subchapter; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 8 percent of the pay received as Comptroller General before deductions are made under clause (2)(B) of this subsection plus 3 percent interest compounded every December 31 on the amount to be deposited, if not electing survivor benefits under this subchapter; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fcb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> have—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fcc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 3.5 percent of the pay received as Comptroller General deducted as a contribution to the annuity if electing survivor benefits under this subchapter; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fcd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 8 percent of the pay received as Comptroller General deducted as a contribution to the annuity if not electing survivor benefits under this subchapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s772/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A Comptroller General receiving benefits under this section may not receive retirement or disability benefits under another law of the United States.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/902">96 Stat. 902</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tII">Pub. L. 100–426, title II</span>, § 203, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1600">102 Stat. 1600</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85fd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773"><span itemtype="num" value="773">§ 773.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Election of survivor benefits</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> To provide survivor benefits, a Comptroller General may elect in writing to reduce the pay and annuity of the Comptroller General. An election shall be made within 6 months of taking office or, if an election is made under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s772/c"/>section 772(c) of this title, by the 60th day after making an election under section 772(c).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A Comptroller General electing to provide survivor benefits shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> have 4.5 percent of the pay received as Comptroller General and 5 percent of the annuity of the Comptroller General deducted; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> deposit with the Government Accountability Office for redeposit in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 4.5 percent of the pay and annuity received as Comptroller General before the deductions begin;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 4.5 percent of basic pay received as a member of Congress or for other civilian service on which a surviving spouse’s annuity is computed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s774/d"/>section 774(d) of this title; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85fdb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> 4 percent interest before <p itemtype="date" date="1948-01-01"/>January 1, 1948, and 3 percent interest after <p itemtype="date" date="1947-12-31"/>December 31, 1947, compounded every December 31, on amounts deposited.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fdc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> This subchapter does not prevent a surviving spouse or dependent child from receiving another annuity while receiving an annuity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s774"/>section 774 of this title. However, service used in computing an annuity under section 774 may not be used in computing the other annuity.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fdd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s773/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The reduction in the Comptroller General’s annuity under subsection (b)(1) for the purpose of providing survivor benefits shall be terminated for each full month after the death of the spouse.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/903">96 Stat. 903</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tII">Pub. L. 100–426, title II</span>, § 204, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1600">102 Stat. 1600</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fb85fe3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774"><span itemtype="num" value="774">§ 774.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Survivor annuities</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fe4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fe5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “allowable military service” means honorable active service of not more than 5 years in an armed force (including service in the National Guard when ordered to active duty for the United States Government), when the service is not creditable in computing another annuity.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fe6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “other prior allowable service” means civilian service as an officer or employee of the Government or District of Columbia government not covered by subsection (d)(1) of this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fe7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “congressional employee” has the same meaning given that term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s2107"/>section 2107 of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fe8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A survivor annuity shall be paid under this subchapter when a Comptroller General—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fe9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> makes an election under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s773"/>section 773 of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> dies in office or while receiving an annuity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s772"/>section 772 of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85feb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> had at least 18 months of civilian service at death computed under subsections (a) and (d) of this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> had deductions or deposits under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s773"/>section 773 of this title made for the last 18 months of civilian service.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85fed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General is survived—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> only by a spouse, the surviving spouse shall receive an annuity computed under subsection (d) of this section beginning on the death of the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General or when the spouse is 50 years of age, whichever is later;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85fef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> by a spouse and a dependent child, the surviving spouse shall receive an immediate annuity computed under subsection (d) of this section and each dependent child shall receive an immediate annuity equal to the smaller of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ff0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 10 percent of the average annual pay computed under subsection (d)(1) of this section; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ff1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 20 percent of the average annual pay computed under subsection (d)(1) of this section, divided by the number of dependent children; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85ff2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> only by a dependent child, each dependent child shall receive an immediate annuity equal to the smaller of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ff3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the annuity a surviving spouse would be entitled to receive under clause (2) of this subsection, divided by the number of dependent children;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ff4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 20 percent of the average annual pay computed under subsection (d)(1) of this section; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ff5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> 40 percent of the average annual pay computed under subsection (d)(1) of this section, divided by the number of dependent children.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85ff6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The annuity of a surviving spouse is equal to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85ff7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> 1.5 percent of the average annual pay (based on the 3 years of highest pay received as Comptroller General and other prior allowable service) times—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ff8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the number of years of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb85ff9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> service as Comptroller General or a member of Congress; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fb85ffa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> prior allowable military service; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fb85ffb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> not more than 15 years of prior allowable service as a congressional employee; plus<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fb85ffc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> .75 percent of the average pay computed under clause (1) of this subsection times the number of years of other allowable service.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fb85ffd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s774/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A surviving spouse’s annuity may not be more than 50 percent nor less than 25 percent of the average annual pay computed under subsection (d)(1) of this section. If a Comptroller General does not make the deposit under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s773/b"/>section 773(b) of this title, a surviving spouse’s annuity shall be credited with the service during which a deposit was not made, unless the spouse elects not to have the service credited. However, the annuity shall be reduced by 10 percent of the amount of the unpaid deposit, computed on the date the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General dies.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/904">96 Stat. 904</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tII">Pub. L. 100–426, title II</span>, § 205, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1600">102 Stat. 1600</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa8f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775"><span itemtype="num" value="775">§ 775.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Refunds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa8f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A Comptroller General separated from office before becoming entitled to receive an annuity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s772"/>section 772 of this title is entitled to a lump-sum refund of the amount deducted from pay or deposited as a contribution under section 772, plus 3 percent interest on the amount compounded every December 31.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa8f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A Comptroller General making an election under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s773"/>section 773 of this title who is separated from office before becoming entitled to an annuity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s772"/>section 772 of this title is entitled to a lump-sum refund of the amount deducted under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s773"/>section 773 of this title, plus 4 percent interest before <p itemtype="date" date="1948-01-01"/>January 1, 1948, and 3 percent interest after <p itemtype="date" date="1947-12-31"/>December 31, 1947, compounded every December 31 until the separation date.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa8f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A lump-sum refund of the amounts deducted under sections 772 and 773 of this title, plus interest of 4 percent before <span itemtype="date" date="1948-01-01">January 1, 1948</span>, and 3 percent after <span itemtype="date" date="1947-12-31">December 31, 1947</span>, compounded every December 31 until the date of death, shall be paid under subsection (d) of this section if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a Comptroller General dies in office before completing 5 years of civilian service under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s774"/>section 774 of this title or after completing 5 years of civilian service but without a survivor entitled to an annuity under section 774(b) and (c) of this title; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> if a retired Comptroller General dies without a survivor entitled to an annuity under section 774(b) and (c) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa8f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If a Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General dies before a refund is made under this section, the refund shall be paid in the following order of precedence:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to a beneficiary the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General designated in writing if the designation was received by the Government Accountability Office before the death of the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to a surviving spouse.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> to the children and to a descendant of a deceased child by representation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> to the parents equally or, if only one surviving parent, to that survivor.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> to the executor or administrator of the estate of the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa8ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/d/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> to the next of kin that the General Counsel of the Government Accountability Office decides is entitled to the refund under the laws of the domicile of the Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General at the time of death.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa900-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The General Counsel is not subject to section 771(1) and (2) of this title when making a decision about a surviving spouse or child under subsection (c) or (d) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa901-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s775/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> If the annuities of all individuals entitled to survivor annuities under this subchapter end before the amount of annuities paid equals the amount deducted under sections 772 and 773 of this title, plus interest of 4 percent before <p itemtype="date" date="1948-01-01"/>January 1, 1948, and 3 percent after <p itemtype="date" date="1947-12-31"/>December 31, 1947, compounded every December 31 until the date of death, the remainder shall be paid under subsection (d) of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/905">96 Stat. 905</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa906-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776"><span itemtype="num" value="776">§ 776.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment of survivor benefits</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa907-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An annuity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s774"/>section 774 of this title accrues monthly and is paid monthly on the first business day of the month after the month in which an annuity accrues.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa908-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa909-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A surviving spouse’s annuity ends when the spouse remarries before age 55 or dies.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa90a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A dependent child’s annuity ends when the child becomes 18 years of age (unless the child is then a student as described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s771/1/C"/>section 771(1)(C) of this title), marries, or dies, whichever is earliest. However, if a child is not self-supporting because of a physical or mental disability, an annuity ends when the child recovers, marries, or dies.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa90b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> If a surviving spouse dies and a dependent child survives, the child’s annuity is recomputed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s774/c/3"/>section 774(c)(3) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa90c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> When a dependent child’s annuity ends, the annuity of another dependent child is recomputed as if the child whose annuity has ended did not survive a Comptroller General or retired Comptroller General.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa90d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An accrued annuity unpaid when the annuity of a survivor ends—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa90e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> for a reason except death, shall be paid to the survivor; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa90f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> when a survivor dies, shall be paid in the following order of precedence:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa910-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to the executor or administrator of the estate of the individual.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa911-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> if there is no executor or administrator, then after 30 days after the date of death, to an individual the General Counsel of the Government Accountability Office decides is legally entitled to the payment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa912-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa913-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A payment under subsection (c)(2)(B) of this section or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s775/d"/>section 775(d) of this title is a bar to recovery by another individual.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa914-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s776/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A benefit under this section and sections 773–775 of this title is not assignable or subject to legal process.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/906">96 Stat. 906</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tII">Pub. L. 100–426, title II</span>, § 206, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1601">102 Stat. 1601</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa91a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s777"><span itemtype="num" value="777">§ 777.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annuity increases</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa91b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s777/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An annuity payable under this subchapter shall be increased at the same time that, and by the same percent as the percentage by which, annuities are increased under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s8340/b"/>section 8340(b) of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa91c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s777/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An annuity under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s772"/>section 772 of this title may not be more than the basic pay of the Comptroller General. A surviving spouse’s annuity may be increased under this section without regard to any limitation set forth in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s774/e"/>section 774(e) of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/906">96 Stat. 906</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/426/tII">Pub. L. 100–426, title II</span>, § 207, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-09">Sept. 9, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1601">102 Stat. 1601</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa922-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s778"><span itemtype="num" value="778">§ 778.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Dependency and disability decisions</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The General Counsel of the Government Accountability Office shall decide a question of dependency, disability, or dependency and disability under sections 773–776 of this title. A decision under this section is final.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/907">96 Stat. 907</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa927-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s779"><span itemtype="num" value="779">§ 779.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Use of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Annuities and refunds under this subchapter shall be paid by the Comptroller General from appropriations of the Government Accountability Office.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/907">96 Stat. 907</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fbaa92c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch7/schVI"><span itemtype="num" value="VI">SUBCHAPTER VI—</span><span itemtype="heading">PROPERTY MANAGEMENT</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa92d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781"><span itemtype="num" value="781">§ 781.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority over the General Accounting Office Building</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa92e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall have exclusive custody and control over the building located at 441 G Street, N.W., in the District of Columbia, that is generally known as the General Accounting Office Building,<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002023"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002023"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> including operation, maintenance, protection, alteration, repair, and assignment of space therein. Such custody and control shall also extend to any machinery, equipment, spare parts and tools located in and usable for the operation and maintenance of the General Accounting Office Building.<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002023"/>1 For the purposes of securing approval of any prospectus detailing proposed alterations of the General Accounting Office Building,<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002023"/>1 as required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s3307"/>section 3307 of title 40, the Comptroller General shall perform the functions assigned to the Administrator of General Services by that section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa92f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Upon request of the Comptroller General, the Administrator of General Services shall provide, to the extent resources are available, any necessary services for the protection of the property and persons in the General Accounting Office Building,<p itemtype="sup"/>1 including the provision of special police, responding to and investigating incidents, and the monitoring of the perimeter security system. Such services may be provided with or without reimbursement as the Comptroller General and the Administrator may agree.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa930-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa931-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General is authorized to enter into agreements or contracts to acquire property or services on such terms and conditions and in such a manner as he deems necessary and without regard to section 6101(b) to (d) of title 41; except that the Comptroller General may not acquire real property unless specifically authorized by law. In exercising the authority granted by this section, the Comptroller General shall obtain full and open competition in accordance with the principles and purposes of the Competition in Contracting Act of 1984.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa932-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> To the extent that funds are otherwise available for obligation, agreements or contracts for utility services may be made for periods not exceeding 10 years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa933-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s781/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Comptroller General may make advance, progress, and other payments which relate to agreements or contracts entered into under authority of this section, without regard to the provisions of section 3324(a) and (b) of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/545">Pub. L. 100–545</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-28">Oct. 28, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2727">102 Stat. 2727</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1299">116 Stat. 1299</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa939-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s782"><span itemtype="num" value="782">§ 782.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Leasing of space in the General Accounting Office Building</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Comptroller General is authorized to lease or otherwise provide space and services within the General Accounting Office Building <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002024">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002024"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> to persons, both public and private, or to any department, agency or instrumentality of the United States Government upon such terms and conditions as the Comptroller General deems necessary to protect the public interest. The Comptroller General shall establish a rental rate for such leased space equivalent to the prevailing commercial rate for comparable space devoted to a similar purpose in the vicinity of the General Accounting Office Building.<span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002024">1</span> Additionally, the Comptroller General may make available, on occasion, or may lease at such rates and on such other terms and conditions as the Comptroller General deems to be in the public interest, auditoriums, meeting rooms, and lobbies of the General Accounting Office Building <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002024">1</span> to persons, firms, or organizations engaged in cultural, educational, or recreational activities (as defined in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s3306/a">section 3306(a) of title 40</span>). The Comptroller General will consult with the Administrator of General Services and will give priority to Federal agencies in filling available space within the General Accounting Office Building.<span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002024">1</span> Payments for space or services may be made in advance or by way of reimbursement and shall be deposited to a special account and shall be available for expenditure for operation, maintenance, protection, alteration, or repair of the General Accounting Office Building <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002024">1</span> in such amounts as are specified in annual appropriation Acts without regard to fiscal year limitations.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/545">Pub. L. 100–545</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-28">Oct. 28, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2728">102 Stat. 2728</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(D), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1299">116 Stat. 1299</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa93f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s783"><span itemtype="num" value="783">§ 783.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Rules and regulations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa940-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s783/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General is authorized to make all needful rules and regulations for the Government of the General Accounting Office Building,<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002025"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002025"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> and to annex to such rules and regulations such reasonable penalties, within the limits prescribed in subsection (b), as will ensure their enforcement. Such rules and regulations shall be posted and kept posted in a conspicuous place on such Federal property.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa941-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s783/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Whoever shall violate any rule or regulation promulgated pursuant to subsection (a) shall be fined not more than $500 or imprisoned not more than 6 months, or both.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/545">Pub. L. 100–545</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-28">Oct. 28, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2728">102 Stat. 2728</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fbaa945-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch7/schVII"><span itemtype="num" value="VII">SUBCHAPTER VII—</span><span itemtype="heading">CENTER FOR AUDIT EXCELLENCE</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa946-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791"><span itemtype="num" value="791">§ 791.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Center for Audit Excellence</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa947-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall establish, maintain, and operate a center within the Government Accountability Office to be known as the “Center for Audit Excellence” (hereafter in this subchapter referred to as the “Center”).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa948-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Purpose and Activities.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa949-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Center shall build institutional auditing capacity and promote good governance by providing affordable, relevant, and high-quality training, technical assistance, and products and services to qualified personnel and entities of governments (including the Federal Government, State and local governments, tribal governments, and governments of foreign nations), international organizations, and other private organizations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa94a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Determination of qualified personnel and entities</span>.—</span></p>Personnel and entities shall be considered qualified for purposes of receiving training, technical assistance, and products or services from the Center under paragraph (1) in accordance with such criteria as the Comptroller General may establish and publish.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa94b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Fees.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa94c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Permitting charging of fees</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General may establish, charge, and collect fees (on a reimbursable or advance basis) for the training, technical assistance, and products and services provided by the Center under this subchapter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa94d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Deposit into separate account</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall deposit all fees collected under paragraph (1) into the Center for Audit Excellence Account established under section 792.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa94e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Gifts of Property and Services</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General may accept and use conditional or non-conditional gifts of property (both real and personal) and services (including services of guest lecturers) to support the operation of the Center, except that the Comptroller General may not accept or use such a gift if the Comptroller General determines that the acceptance or use of the gift would compromise or appear to compromise the integrity of the Government Accountability Office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa94f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s791/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sense of Congress Regarding Personnel</span>.—</span></p>It is the sense of Congress that the Center should be staffed primarily by personnel of the Government Accountability Office who are not otherwise engaged in carrying out other duties of the Office under this chapter, so as to ensure that the operation of the Center will not detract from or impact the oversight and audit work of the Office.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/235/dH/tI">Pub. L. 113–235, div. H, title I</span>, § 1401(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-12-16">Dec. 16, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/2539">128 Stat. 2539</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa953-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s792"><span itemtype="num" value="792">§ 792.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Account</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa954-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s792/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment of Separate Account</span>.—</span></p>There is established in the Treasury as a separate account for the Government Accountability Office the “Center for Audit Excellence Account”, which shall consist of the fees deposited by the Comptroller General under section 791(c) and such other amounts as may be appropriated under law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa955-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s792/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of Account</span>.—</span></p>Amounts in the Center for Audit Excellence Account shall be available to the Comptroller General, in amounts specified in appropriations Acts and without fiscal year limitation, to carry out this subchapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/235/dH/tI">Pub. L. 113–235, div. H, title I</span>, § 1401(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-12-16">Dec. 16, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/2540">128 Stat. 2540</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa957-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s793"><span itemtype="num" value="793">§ 793.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authorization of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this subchapter.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/235/dH/tI">Pub. L. 113–235, div. H, title I</span>, § 1401(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-12-16">Dec. 16, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/2540">128 Stat. 2540</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fbaa959-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stI/ch9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">CHAPTER 9—</span><span itemtype="heading">AGENCY CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICERS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa95b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901"><span itemtype="num" value="901">§ 901.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Establishment of agency Chief Financial Officers</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa95c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> There shall be within each agency described in subsection (b) an agency Chief Financial Officer. Each agency Chief Financial Officer shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa95d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for those agencies described in subsection (b)(1)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa95e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa95f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> be designated by the President, in consultation with the head of the agency, from among officials of the agency who are required by law to be so appointed;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa960-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for those agencies described in subsection (b)(2)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa961-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> be appointed by the head of the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa962-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> be in the competitive service or the senior executive service; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa963-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> be career appointees; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa964-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> be appointed or designated, as applicable, from among individuals who possess demonstrated ability in general management of, and knowledge of and extensive practical experience in financial management practices in large governmental or business entities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa965-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa966-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The agencies referred to in subsection (a)(1) are the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa967-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Department of Agriculture.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa968-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Department of Commerce.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa969-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The Department of Defense.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa96a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The Department of Education.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa96b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The Department of Energy.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa96c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> The Department of Health and Human Services.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa96d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> The Department of Homeland Security.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa96e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> The Department of Housing and Urban Development.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa96f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> The Department of the Interior.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa970-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> The Department of Justice.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa971-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/K"><span itemtype="num" value="K">(K)</span></p> The Department of Labor.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa972-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/L"><span itemtype="num" value="L">(L)</span></p> The Department of State.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa973-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/M"><span itemtype="num" value="M">(M)</span></p> The Department of Transportation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa974-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/N"><span itemtype="num" value="N">(N)</span></p> The Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa975-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/O"><span itemtype="num" value="O">(O)</span></p> The Department of Veterans Affairs.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa976-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/P"><span itemtype="num" value="P">(P)</span></p> The Environmental Protection Agency.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa977-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/1/Q"><span itemtype="num" value="Q">(Q)</span></p> The National Aeronautics and Space Administration.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa978-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The agencies referred to in subsection (a)(2) are the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa979-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Agency for International Development.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa97a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The General Services Administration.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa97b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The National Science Foundation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa97c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The Nuclear Regulatory Commission.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa97d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The Office of Personnel Management.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa97e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> The Small Business Administration.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa97f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/b/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> The Social Security Administration.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa980-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa981-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> There shall be within the Executive Office of the President a Chief Financial Officer, who shall be designated or appointed by the President from among individuals meeting the standards described in subsection (a)(3). The position of Chief Financial Officer established under this paragraph may be so established in any Office (including the Office of Administration) of the Executive Office of the President.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa982-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Chief Financial Officer designated or appointed under this subsection shall, to the extent that the President determines appropriate and in the interest of the United States, have the same authority and perform the same functions as apply in the case of a Chief Financial Officer of an agency described in subsection (b).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa983-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The President shall submit to Congress notification with respect to any provision of section 902 that the President determines shall not apply to a Chief Financial Officer designated or appointed under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa984-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s901/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The President may designate an employee of the Executive Office of the President (other than the Chief Financial Officer), who shall be deemed “the head of the agency” for purposes of carrying out section 902, with respect to the Executive Office of the President.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tII">Pub. L. 101–576, title II</span>, § 205(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2842">104 Stat. 2842</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/296/tI">Pub. L. 103–296, title I</span>, § 108(j)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-08-15">Aug. 15, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1488">108 Stat. 1488</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/58/tVI">Pub. L. 106–58, title VI</span>, § 638(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1999-09-29">Sept. 29, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/475">113 Stat. 475</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/330">Pub. L. 108–330</span>, § 3(a), (d)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-16">Oct. 16, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1276">118 Stat. 1276</span>, 1277.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbaa990-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902"><span itemtype="num" value="902">§ 902.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority and functions of agency Chief Financial Officers</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa991-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An agency Chief Financial Officer shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa992-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> report directly to the head of the agency regarding financial management matters;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa993-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> oversee all financial management activities relating to the programs and operations of the agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa994-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> develop and maintain an integrated agency accounting and financial management system, including financial reporting and internal controls, which—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa995-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> complies with applicable accounting principles, standards, and requirements, and internal control standards;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa996-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> complies with such policies and requirements as may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa997-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> complies with any other requirements applicable to such systems; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa998-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> provides for—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fbaa999-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> complete, reliable, consistent, and timely information which is prepared on a uniform basis and which is responsive to the financial information needs of agency management;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fbaa99a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the development and reporting of cost information;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fbaa99b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/D/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the integration of accounting and budgeting information; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fbaa99c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/3/D/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the systematic measurement of performance;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa99d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> make recommendations to the head of the agency regarding the selection of the Deputy Chief Financial Officer of the agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa99e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> direct, manage, and provide policy guidance and oversight of agency financial management personnel, activities, and operations, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa99f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the preparation and annual revision of an agency plan to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fbaa9a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> implement the 5-year financial management plan prepared by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3"/>section 3512(a)(3) of this title; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fbaa9a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> comply with the requirements established under sections 3515 and subsections (e) and (f) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3521"/>section 3521 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the development of agency financial management budgets;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the recruitment, selection, and training of personnel to carry out agency financial management functions;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the approval and management of agency financial management systems design or enhancement projects;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/5/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the implementation of agency asset management systems, including systems for cash management, credit management, debt collection, and property and inventory management and control;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa9a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> prepare and transmit, by not later than 60 days after the submission of the audit report required by <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3521/f">section 3521(f) of this title</span>, an annual report to the agency head and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, which shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a description and analysis of the status of financial management of the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the annual financial statements prepared under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3515"/>section 3515 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the audit report transmitted to the head of the agency under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3521/f"/>section 3521(f) of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a summary of the reports on internal accounting and administrative control systems submitted to the President and the Congress under the amendments made by the Federal Managers’ Financial Integrity Act of 1982 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/255"/>Public Law 97–255); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbaa9ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> other information the head of the agency considers appropriate to fully inform the President and the Congress concerning the financial management of the agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa9ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> monitor the financial execution of the budget of the agency in relation to actual expenditures, and prepare and submit to the head of the agency timely performance reports; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbaa9ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> review, on a biennial basis, the fees, royalties, rents, and other charges imposed by the agency for services and things of value it provides, and make recommendations on revising those charges to reflect costs incurred by it in providing those services and things of value.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbaa9ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In addition to the authority otherwise provided by this section, each agency Chief Financial Officer—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> subject to paragraph (2), shall have access to all records, reports, audits, reviews, documents, papers, recommendations, or other material which are the property of the agency or which are available to the agency, and which relate to programs and operations with respect to which that agency Chief Financial Officer has responsibilities under this section;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> may request such information or assistance as may be necessary for carrying out the duties and responsibilities provided by this section from any Federal, State, or local governmental entity; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> to the extent and in such amounts as may be provided in advance by appropriations Acts, may—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/1/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> enter into contracts and other arrangements with public agencies and with private persons for the preparation of financial statements, studies, analyses, and other services; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/1/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> make such payments as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s902/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (1)(B), this subsection does not provide to an agency Chief Financial Officer any access greater than permitted under any other law to records, reports, audits, reviews, documents, papers, recommendations, or other material of any Office of Inspector General established under the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tII">Pub. L. 101–576, title II</span>, § 205(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2843">104 Stat. 2843</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbd19b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s903"><span itemtype="num" value="903">§ 903.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Establishment of agency Deputy Chief Financial Officers</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s903/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> There shall be within each agency described in section 901(b) an agency Deputy Chief Financial Officer, who shall report directly to the agency Chief Financial Officer on financial management matters. The position of agency Deputy Chief Financial Officer shall be a career reserved position in the Senior Executive Service.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s903/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Consistent with qualification standards developed by, and in consultation with, the agency Chief Financial Officer and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, the head of each agency shall appoint as Deputy Chief Financial Officer an individual with demonstrated ability and experience in accounting, budget execution, financial and management analysis, and systems development, and not less than 6 years practical experience in financial management at large governmental entities.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tII">Pub. L. 101–576, title II</span>, § 205(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2845">104 Stat. 2845</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subtitle" style="-uslm-lc:I52" id="id0fbd19bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBTITLE II—</span><span itemtype="heading">THE BUDGET PROCESS</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fbd19c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">CHAPTER 11—</span><span itemtype="heading">THE BUDGET AND FISCAL, BUDGET, AND PROGRAM INFORMATION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbd19c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1101"><span itemtype="num" value="1101">§ 1101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1101/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “agency” includes the District of Columbia government but does not include the legislative branch or the Supreme Court.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1101/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “appropriations” means appropriated amounts and includes, in appropriate context—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1101/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> funds;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1101/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> authority to make obligations by contract before appropriations; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1101/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> other authority making amounts available for obligation or expenditure.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub.
