L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/907">96 Stat. 907</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbd19d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1102"><span itemtype="num" value="1102">§ 1102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Fiscal year</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The fiscal year of the Treasury begins on October 1 of each year and ends on September 30 of the following year. Accounts of receipts and expenditures required under law to be published each year shall be published for the fiscal year.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/908">96 Stat. 908</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbd19db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1103"><span itemtype="num" value="1103">§ 1103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Budget ceiling</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Congress reaffirms its commitment that budget outlays of the United States Government for a fiscal year may be not more than the receipts of the Government for that year.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/908">96 Stat. 908</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbd19df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1104"><span itemtype="num" value="1104">§ 1104.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Budget and appropriations authority of the President</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1104/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The President shall prepare budgets of the United States Government under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105"/>section 1105 of this title and proposed deficiency and supplemental appropriations under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1107"/>section 1107 of this title. To the extent practicable, the President shall use uniform terms in stating the purposes and conditions of appropriations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1104/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Except as provided in this chapter, the President shall prescribe the contents and order of statements in the budget on expenditures and estimated expenditures and statements on proposed appropriations and information submitted with the budget and proposed appropriations. The President shall include with the budget and proposed appropriations information on personnel and other objects of expenditure in the way that information was included in the budget for fiscal year 1950. However, the requirement that information be included in the budget in that way may be waived or changed by joint action of the Committees on Appropriations of both Houses of Congress. This subsection does not limit the authority of a committee of Congress to request information in a form it prescribes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1104/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> When the President makes a basic change in the form of the budget, the President shall submit with the budget information showing where items in the budget for the prior fiscal year are contained in the present budget. However, the President may change the functional categories in the budget only in consultation with the Committees on Appropriations and on the Budget of both Houses of Congress. Committees of the House of Representatives and Senate shall receive prompt notification of all such changes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1104/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The President shall develop programs and prescribe regulations to improve the compilation, analysis, publication, and dissemination of statistical information by executive agencies. The President shall carry out this subsection through the Administrator for the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs in the Office of Management and Budget.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1104/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed by the President, each agency shall provide information required by the President in carrying out this chapter. The President has access to, and may inspect, records of an agency to obtain information.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/908">96 Stat. 908</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/177/tII">Pub. L. 99–177, title II</span>, § 224, <span itemtype="date" date="1985-12-12">Dec. 12, 1985</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/1060">99 Stat. 1060</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fbd19eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105"><span itemtype="num" value="1105">§ 1105.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Budget contents and submission to Congress</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd19ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> On or after the first Monday in January but not later than the first Monday in February of each year, the President shall submit a budget of the United States Government for the following fiscal year. Each budget shall include a budget message and summary and supporting information. The President shall include in each budget the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> information on activities and functions of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when practicable, information on costs and achievements of Government programs.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> other desirable classifications of information.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a reconciliation of the summary information on expenditures with proposed appropriations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, estimated expenditures and proposed appropriations the President decides are necessary to support the Government in the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted and the 4 fiscal years after that year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> estimated receipts of the Government in the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted and the 4 fiscal years after that year under—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> laws in effect when the budget is submitted; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> proposals in the budget to increase revenues.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> appropriations, expenditures, and receipts of the Government in the prior fiscal year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> estimated expenditures and receipts, and appropriations and proposed appropriations, of the Government for the current fiscal year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> balanced statements of the—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/9/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> condition of the Treasury at the end of the prior fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/9/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> estimated condition of the Treasury at the end of the current fiscal year; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/9/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> estimated condition of the Treasury at the end of the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted if financial proposals in the budget are adopted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> essential information about the debt of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> other financial information the President decides is desirable to explain in practicable detail the financial condition of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd19fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for each proposal in the budget for legislation that would establish or expand a Government activity or function, a table showing—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/12/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the amount proposed in the budget for appropriation and for expenditure because of the proposal in the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd19ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/12/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the estimated appropriation required because of the proposal for each of the 4 fiscal years after that year that the proposal will be in effect.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a00-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/13"><span itemtype="num" value="13">(13)</span></p> an allowance for additional estimated expenditures and proposed appropriations for the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a01-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/14"><span itemtype="num" value="14">(14)</span></p> an allowance for unanticipated uncontrollable expenditures for that year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a02-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/15"><span itemtype="num" value="15">(15)</span></p> a separate statement on each of the items referred to in section 301(a)(1)–(5) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t2/s632/a/1"/>2 U.S.C. 632(a)(1)–(5)).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a03-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/16"><span itemtype="num" value="16">(16)</span></p> the level of tax expenditures under existing law in the tax expenditures budget (as defined in section 3(a)(3) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t2/s622/a/3"/>2 U.S.C. 622(a)(3)) for the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted, considering projected economic factors and changes in the existing levels based on proposals in the budget.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/17"><span itemtype="num" value="17">(17)</span></p> information on estimates of appropriations for the fiscal year following the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted for grants, contracts, and other payments under each program for which there is an authorization of appropriations for that following fiscal year when the appropriations are authorized to be included in an appropriation law for the fiscal year before the fiscal year in which the appropriation is to be available for obligation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/18"><span itemtype="num" value="18">(18)</span></p> a comparison of the total amount of budget outlays for the prior fiscal year, estimated in the budget submitted for that year, for each major program having relatively uncontrollable outlays with the total amount of outlays for that program in that year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/19"><span itemtype="num" value="19">(19)</span></p> a comparison of the total amount of receipts for the prior fiscal year, estimated in the budget submitted for that year, with receipts received in that year, and for each major source of receipts, a comparison of the amount of receipts estimated in that budget with the amount of receipts from that source in that year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/20"><span itemtype="num" value="20">(20)</span></p> an analysis and explanation of the differences between each amount compared under clauses (18) and (19) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/21"><span itemtype="num" value="21">(21)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a horizontal budget showing—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/21/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the programs for meteorology and of the National Climate Program established under section 5 of the National Climate Program Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s2904"/>15 U.S.C. 2904);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/21/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> specific aspects of the program of, and appropriations for, each agency; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/21/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> estimated goals and financial requirements.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/22"><span itemtype="num" value="22">(22)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a statement of budget authority, proposed budget authority, budget outlays, and proposed budget outlays, and descriptive information in terms of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/22/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a detailed structure of national needs that refers to the missions and programs of agencies (as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s101"/>section 101 of this title); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/22/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the missions and basic programs.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/23"><span itemtype="num" value="23">(23)</span></p> separate appropriation accounts for appropriations under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t29/s651"/>29 U.S.C. 651 et seq.) and the Federal Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t30/s801"/>30 U.S.C. 801 et seq.).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/24"><span itemtype="num" value="24">(24)</span></p> recommendations on the return of Government capital to the Treasury by a mixed-ownership corporation (as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2"/>section 9101(2) of this title) that the President decides are desirable.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a11-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/25"><span itemtype="num" value="25">(25)</span></p> a separate appropriation account for appropriations for each Office of Inspector General of an establishment defined under section 11(2) of the Inspector General Act of 1978.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a12-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/26"><span itemtype="num" value="26">(26)</span></p> a separate statement of the amount of appropriations requested for the Office of National Drug Control Policy and each program of the National Drug Control Program.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a/27"><span itemtype="num" value="27">(27)</span></p> a separate statement of the amount of appropriations requested for the value="c">(c)</span></p> The President shall recommend in the budget appropriate action to meet an estimated deficiency when the estimated receipts for the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted (under laws in effect when the budget is submitted) and the estimated amounts in the Treasury at the end of the current fiscal year available for expenditure in the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted, are less than the estimated expenditures for that year. The President shall make recommendations required by the public interest when the estimated receipts and estimated amounts in the Treasury are more than the estimated expenditures.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> When the President submits a budget or supporting information about a budget, the President shall include a statement on all changes about the current fiscal year that were made before the budget or information was submitted.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The President shall submit with materials related to each budget transmitted under subsection (a) on or after <span itemtype="date" date="1985-01-01">January 1, 1985</span>, an analysis for the ensuing fiscal year that shall identify requested appropriations or new obligational authority and outlays for each major program that may be classified as a public civilian capital investment program and for each major program that may be classified as a military capital investment program, and shall contain summaries of the total amount of such appropriations or new obligational authority and outlays for public civilian capital investment programs and summaries of the total amount of such appropriations or new obligational authority and outlays for military capital investment programs. In addition, the analysis under this paragraph shall contain—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an estimate of the current service levels of public civilian capital investment and of military capital investment and alternative high and low levels of such investments over a period of ten years in current dollars and over a period of five years in constant dollars;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the most recent assessment analysis and summary, in a standard format, of public civilian capital investment needs in each major program area over a period of ten years;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> an identification and analysis of the principal policy issues that affect estimated public civilian capital investment needs for each major program; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> an identification and analysis of factors that affect estimated public civilian capital investment needs for each major program, including but not limited to the following factors:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> economic assumptions;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> engineering standards;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/D/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> estimates of spending for operation and maintenance;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/D/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> estimates of expenditures for similar investments by State and local governments; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fbd1a42-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/1/D/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> estimates of demand for public services derived from such capital investments and estimates of the service capacity of such investments.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>To the extent that any analysis required by this paragraph relates to any program for which Federal financial assistance is distributed under a formula prescribed by law, such analysis shall be organized by State and within each State by major metropolitan area if data are available.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a43-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this subsection, any appropriation, new obligational authority, or outlay shall be classified as a public civilian capital investment to the extent that such appropriation, authority, or outlay will be used for the construction, acquisition, or rehabilitation of any physical asset that is capable of being used to produce services or other benefits for a number of years and is not classified as a military capital investment under paragraph (3). Such assets shall include (but not be limited to)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a44-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> roadways or bridges,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a45-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> airports or airway facilities,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a46-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> mass transportation systems,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> wastewater treatment or related facilities,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a48-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> water resources projects,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a49-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> hospitals,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> resource recovery facilities,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" id="id0fbd1a4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> space or communications facilities,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> railroads, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/2/K"><span itemtype="num" value="K">(K)</span></p> federally assisted housing.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> For purposes of this subsection, any appropriation, new obligational authority, or outlay shall be classified as a military capital investment to the extent that such appropriation, authority, or outlay will be used for the construction, acquisition, or rehabilitation of any physical asset that is capable of being used to produce services or other benefits for purposes of national defense and security for a number of years. Such assets shall include military bases, posts, installations, and facilities.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Criteria and guidelines for use in the identification of public civilian and military capital investments, for distinguishing between public civilian and military capital investments, and for distinguishing between major and nonmajor capital investment programs shall be issued by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget after consultation with the Comptroller General and the Congressional Budget Office. The analysis submitted under this subsection shall be accompanied by an explanation of such criteria and guidelines.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the term “construction” includes the design, planning, and erection of new structures and facilities, the expansion of existing structures and facilities, the reconstruction of a project at an existing site or adjacent to an existing site, and the installation of initial and replacement equipment for such structures and facilities;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the term “acquisition” includes the addition of land, sites, equipment, structures, facilities, or rolling stock by purchase, lease-purchase, trade, or donation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbd1a54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/e/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the term “rehabilitation” includes the alteration of or correction of deficiencies in an existing structure or facility so as to extend the useful life or improve the effectiveness of the structure or facility, the modernization or replacement of equipment at an existing structure or facility, and the modernization of, or replacement of parts for, rolling stock.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The budget transmitted pursuant to subsection (a) for a fiscal year shall be prepared in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 that apply to that and subsequent fiscal years.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbd1a57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall establish the funding for advisory and assistance services for each department and agency as a separate object class in each budget annually submitted to the Congress under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbf8b58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbf8b59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In paragraph (1), except as provided in subparagraph (B), the term “advisory and assistance services” means the following services when provided by nongovernmental sources:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbf8b5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Management and professional support services.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbf8b5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> Studies, analyses, and evaluations.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbf8b5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> Engineering and technical services.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbf8b5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In paragraph (1), the term “advisory and assistance services” does not include the following services:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbf8b5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Routine automated data processing and telecommunications services unless such services are an integral part of a contract for the procurement of advisory and assistance services.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbf8b5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> Architectural and engineering services, as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s1102"/>section 1102 of title 40.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fbf8b60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/g/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> Research on basic mathematics or medical, biological, physical, social, psychological, or other phenomena.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbf8b61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbf8b62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If there is a medicare funding warning under section 801(a)(2) of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 made in a year, the President shall submit to Congress, within the 15-day period beginning on the date of the budget submission to Congress under subsection (a) for the succeeding year, proposed legislation to respond to such warning.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fbf8b63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1105/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Paragraph (1) does not apply if, during the year in which the warning is made, legislation is enacted which eliminates excess general revenue medicare funding (as defined in section 801(c) of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003) for the 7-fiscal-year reporting period, as certified by the Board of Trustees of each medicare trust fund (as defined in section 801(c)(5) of such Act) not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of such legislation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/908">96 Stat. 908</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2467">96 Stat. 2467</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/501/tII">Pub. A, title II</span>, § 203(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-03">Oct. 3, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3801">122 Stat. 3801</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/409">Pub. L. 110–409</span>, § 7(d)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-14">Oct. 14, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/4313">122 Stat. 4313</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/81">Pub. L. 111–81</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="2009-10-22">Oct. 22, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/2137">123 Stat. 2137</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/291/tIV">Pub. L. 111–291, title IV</span>, §§ 411(h), 415, <span itemtype="date" date="2010-12-08">Dec. 8, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3116">124 Stat. 3116</span>, 3121; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/352">Pub. L. 111–352</span>, § 11(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3881">124 Stat. 3881</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/235/dI/tII">Pub. L. 113–235, div. I, title II</span>, § 244(d), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-12-16">Dec. 16, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/2569">128 Stat. 2569</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d477-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106"><span itemtype="num" value="1106">§ 1106.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Supplemental budget estimates and changes</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d478-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before July 16 of each year, the President shall submit to Congress a supplemental summary of the budget for the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105/a">section 1105(a) of this title</span>. The summary shall include—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d479-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for that fiscal year—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d47a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> substantial changes in or reappraisals of estimates of expenditures and receipts;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d47b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> substantial obligations imposed on the budget after its submission;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d47c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> current information on matters referred to in section 1105(a)(8) and (9)(B) and (C) of this title; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d47d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> additional information the President decides is advisable to provide Congress with complete and current information about the budget and current estimates of the functions, obligations, requirements, and financial condition of the United States Government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d47e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> for the 4 fiscal years following the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted, information on estimated expenditures for programs authorized to continue in future years, or that are considered mandatory, under law; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d47f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> for future fiscal years, information on estimated expenditures of balances carried over from the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d480-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Before July 16 of each year, the President shall submit to Congress a statement of changes in budget authority requested, estimated budget outlays, and estimated receipts for the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted (including prior changes proposed for the executive branch of the Government) that the President decides are necessary and appropriate based on current information. The statement shall include the effect of those changes on the information submitted under section 1105(a)(1)–(14) and (b) of this title and shall include supporting information as practicable. The statement submitted before July 16 may be included in the information submitted under subsection (a)(1) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d481-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1106/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Subsection (f) of section 1105 shall apply to revisions and supplemental summaries submitted under this section to the same extent that such subsection applies to the budget submitted under section 1105(a) to which such revisions and summaries relate.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/911">96 Stat. 911</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/177/tII">Pub. L. 99–177, title II</span>, § 242, <span itemtype="date" date="1985-12-12">Dec. 12, 1985</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/1063">99 Stat. 1063</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d487-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1107"><span itemtype="num" value="1107">§ 1107.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Deficiency and supplemental appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The President may submit to Congress proposed deficiency and supplemental appropriations the President decides are necessary because of laws enacted after the submission of the budget or that are in the public interest. The President shall include the reasons for the submission of the proposed appropriations and the reasons the proposed appropriations were not included in the budget. When the total proposed appropriations would have required the President to make a recommendation under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105/c">section 1105(c) of this title</span> if they had been included in the budget, the President shall make a recommendation under that section. The President shall transmit promptly to Congress without change, proposed deficiency and supplemental appropriations submitted to the President by the legislative branch and the judicial branch.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/911">96 Stat. 911</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/74/dC/tVI">Pub. L. 112–74, div. C, title VI</span>, § 619, <span itemtype="date" date="2011-12-23">Dec. 23, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/125/926">125 Stat. 926</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d48c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108"><span itemtype="num" value="1108">§ 1108.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Preparation and submission of appropriations requests to the President</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d48d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section (except subsections (b)(1) and (e)), “agency” means a department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d48e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d48f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of each agency shall prepare and submit to the President each appropriation request for the agency. The request shall be prepared and submitted in the form prescribed by the President under this chapter and by the date established by the President. When the head of an agency does not submit a request by that date, the President shall prepare the request for the agency to be included in the budget or changes in the budget or as deficiency and supplemental appropriations. The President may change agency appropriation requests. Agency appropriation requests shall be developed from cost-based budgets in the way and at times prescribed by the President. The head of the agency shall use the cost-based budget to administer the agency and to divide appropriations or amounts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d490-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An officer or employee of an agency in the executive branch may submit to the President or Congress a request for legislation authorizing deficiency or supplemental appropriations for the agency only with the approval of the head of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d491-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an agency shall include with an appropriation request submitted to the President a report that the statement of obligations submitted with the request contains obligations consistent with <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1501">section 1501 of this title</span>. The head of the agency shall support the report with a certification of the consistency and shall support the certification with records showing that the amounts have been obligated. The head of the agency shall designate officials to make the certifications, and those officials may not delegate the duty to make the certifications. The certifications and records shall be kept in the agency—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d492-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> in a form that makes audits and reconciliations easy; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d493-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> for a period necessary to carry out audits and reconciliations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d494-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To the extent practicable, the head of an agency shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d495-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> provide information supporting the agency’s budget request for its missions by function and subfunction (including the mission of each organizational unit of the agency); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d496-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> relate the agency’s programs to its missions.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d497-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Except as provided in subsection (f) of this section, an officer or employee of an agency (as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1101"/>section 1101 of this title) may submit to Congress or a committee of Congress an appropriations estimate or request, a request for an increase in that estimate or request, or a recommendation on meeting the financial needs of the Government only when requested by either House of Congress.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d498-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The Interstate Commerce Commission shall submit to Congress copies of budget estimates, requests, and information (including personnel needs), legislative recommendations, prepared testimony for congressional hearings, and comments on legislation at the same time they are sent to the President or the Office of Management and Budget. An officer of an agency may not impose conditions on or impair communication by the Commission with Congress, or a committee or member of Congress, about the information.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d499-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1108/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> Amounts available under law are available for field examinations of appropriation estimates. The use of the amounts is subject only to regulations prescribed by the appropriate standing committees of Congress.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/912">96 Stat. 912</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d49e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1109"><span itemtype="num" value="1109">§ 1109.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Current programs and activities estimates</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d49f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1109/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> On or before the first Monday after January 3 of each year (on or before February 5 in 1986), the President shall submit to both Houses of Congress the estimated budget outlays and proposed budget authority that would be included in the budget for the following fiscal year if programs and activities of the United States Government were carried on during that year at the same level as the current fiscal year without a change in policy. The President shall state the estimated budget outlays and proposed budget authority by function and subfunction under the classifications in the budget summary table under the heading “Budget Authority and Outlays by Function and Agency”, by major programs in each function, and by agency. The President also shall include a statement of the economic and program assumptions on which those budget outlays and budget authority are based, including inflation, real economic growth, and unemployment rates, program caseloads, and pay increases.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1109/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Joint Economic Committee shall review the estimated budget outlays and proposed budget authority and submit an economic evaluation of the budget outlays and budget authority to the Committees on the Budget of both Houses before March 1 of each year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/913">96 Stat. 913</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/177/tII">Pub. L. 99–177, title II</span>, § 222, <span itemtype="date" date="1985-12-12">Dec. 12, 1985</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/1060">99 Stat. 1060</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d4a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1110"><span itemtype="num" value="1110">§ 1110.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Year-ahead requests for authorizing legislation</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">A request to enact legislation authorizing new budget authority to continue a program or activity for a fiscal year shall be submitted to Congress before May 16 of the year before the year in which the fiscal year begins. If a new program or activity will continue for more than one year, the request must be submitted for at least the first and 2d fiscal years.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/913">96 Stat. 913</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d4aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111"><span itemtype="num" value="1111">§ 1111.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Improving economy and efficiency</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>To improve economy and efficiency in the United States Government, the President shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> make a study of each agency to decide, and may send Congress recommendations, on changes that should be made in—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d4ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the organization, activities, and business methods of agencies;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d4ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> agency appropriations;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d4ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the assignment of particular activities to particular services; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc1d4af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> regrouping of services; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1111/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> evaluate and develop improved plans for the organization, coordination, and management of the executive branch of the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/913">96 Stat. 913</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d4b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112"><span itemtype="num" value="1112">§ 1112.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Fiscal, budget, and program information</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, “agency” means a department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States Government except a mixed-ownership Government corporation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> In cooperation with the Comptroller General, the Secretary of the Treasury and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall establish and maintain standard data processing and information systems for fiscal, budget, and program information for use by agencies to meet the needs of the Government, and to the extent practicable, of State and local governments.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> in cooperation with the Secretary, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the Director of the Congressional Budget Office, shall establish, maintain, and publish standard terms and classifications for fiscal, budget, and program information of the Government, including information on fiscal policy, receipts, expenditures, programs, projects, activities, and functions;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when advisable, shall report to Congress on those terms and classifications, and recommend legislation necessary to promote the establishment, maintenance, and use of standard terms and classifications by the executive branch of the Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> in carrying out this subsection, shall give particular consideration to the needs of the Committees on Appropriations and on the Budget of both Houses of Congress, the Committee on Ways and Means of the House, the Committee on Finance of the Senate, and the Congressional Budget Office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Agencies shall use the standard terms and classifications published under subsection (c)(1) of this section in providing fiscal, budget, and program information to Congress.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In consultation with the President, the head of each executive agency shall take actions necessary to achieve to the extent possible—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> consistency in budget and accounting classifications;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> synchronization between those classifications and organizational structure; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> information by organizational unit on performance and program costs to support budget justifications.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1112/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> In cooperation with the Director of the Congressional Budget Office, the Comptroller General, and appropriate representatives of State and local governments, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget (to the extent practicable) shall provide State and local governments with fiscal, budget, and program information necessary for accurate and timely determination by those governments of the impact on their budgets of assistance of the United States Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/913">96 Stat. 913</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc1d4c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113"><span itemtype="num" value="1113">§ 1113.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Congressional information</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> When requested by a committee of Congress having jurisdiction over receipts or appropriations, the President shall provide the committee with assistance and information.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> When requested by a committee of Congress, additional information related to the amount of an appropriation originally requested by an Office of Inspector General shall be submitted to the committee.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When requested by a committee of Congress, by the Comptroller General, or by the Director of the Congressional Budget Office, the Secretary of the Treasury, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the head of each executive agency shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> provide information on the location and kind of available fiscal, budget, and program information;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to the extent practicable, prepare summary tables of that fiscal, budget, and program information and related information the committee, the Comptroller General, or the Director of the Congressional Budget Office considers necessary; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> provide a program evaluation carried out or commissioned by an executive agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In cooperation with the Director of the Congressional Budget Office, the Secretary, and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, the Comptroller General shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> establish and maintain a current directory of sources of, and information systems for, fiscal, budget, and program information and a brief description of the contents of each source and system;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when requested, provide assistance to committees of Congress and members of Congress in obtaining information from the sources in the directory; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> when requested, provide assistance to committees and, to the extent practicable, to members of Congress in evaluating the information obtained from the sources in the directory.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> To the extent they consider necessary, the Comptroller General and the Director of the Congressional Budget Office individually or jointly shall establish and maintain a file of information to meet recurring needs of Congress for fiscal, budget, and program information to carry out this section and sections 717 and 1112 of this title. The file shall include information on budget requests, congressional authorizations to obligate and expend, apportionment and reserve actions, and obligations and expenditures. The Comptroller General and the Director shall maintain the file and an index to the file so that it is easier for the committees and agencies of Congress to use the file and index through data processing and communications techniques.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> carry out a continuing program to identify the needs of committees and members of Congress for fiscal, budget, and program information to carry out this section and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1112"/>section 1112 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> assist committees of Congress in developing their information needs;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> monitor recurring reporting requirements of Congress and committees; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> make recommendations to Congress and committees for changes and improvements in those reporting requirements to meet information needs identified by the Comptroller General, to improve their usefulness to congressional users, and to eliminate unnecessary reporting.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before September 2 of each year, the Comptroller General shall report to Congress on—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the needs identified under paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the relationship of those needs to existing reporting requirements;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the extent to which reporting by the executive branch of the United States Government currently meets the identified needs;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the changes to standard classifications necessary to meet congressional needs;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> activities, progress, and results of the program of the Comptroller General under paragraph (1)(B)–(D) of this subsection; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> progress of the executive branch in the prior year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc1d4df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before March 2 of each year, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the Secretary shall report to Congress on plans for meeting the needs identified under paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> plans for carrying out changes to classifications to meet information needs of Congress;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the status of information systems in the prior year; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc1d4e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1113/e/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the use of standard classifications.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/914">96 Stat. 914</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2467">96 Stat. 2467</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc445ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1114"><span itemtype="num" value="1114">[§ 1114.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tII">Pub. L. 103–355, title II</span>, § 2454(c)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3326">108 Stat. 3326</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc445f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115"><span itemtype="num" value="1115">§ 1115.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Federal Government and agency performance plans</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc445f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Federal Government Performance Plans</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In carrying out the provisions of section 1105(a)(28), the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall coordinate with agencies to develop the Federal Government performance plan. In addition to the submission of such plan with each budget of the United States Government, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall ensure that all information required by this subsection is concurrently made available on the website provided under section 1122 and updated periodically, but no less than annually. The Federal Government performance plan shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> establish Federal Government performance goals to define the level of performance to be achieved during the year in which the plan is submitted and the next fiscal year for each of the Federal Government priority goals required under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1120/a"/>section 1120(a) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> identify the agencies, organizations, program activities, regulations, tax expenditures, policies, and other activities contributing to each Federal Government performance goal during the current fiscal year;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> for each Federal Government performance goal, identify a lead Government official who shall be responsible for coordinating the efforts to achieve the goal;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> establish common Federal Government performance indicators with quarterly targets to be used in measuring or assessing—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc445f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> overall progress toward each Federal Government performance goal; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc445f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the individual contribution of each agency, organization, program activity, regulation, tax expenditure, policy, and other activity identified under paragraph (2);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> establish clearly defined quarterly milestones; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> identify major management challenges that are Governmentwide or crosscutting in nature and describe plans to address such challenges, including relevant performance goals, performance indicators, and milestones.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc445fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Agency Performance Plans</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Not later than the first Monday in February of each year, the head of each agency shall make available on a public website of the agency, and notify the President and the Congress of its availability, a performance plan covering each program activity set forth in the budget of such agency. Such plan shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> establish performance goals to define the level of performance to be achieved during the year in which the plan is submitted and the next fiscal year;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> express such goals in an objective, quantifiable, and measurable form unless authorized to be in an alternative form under subsection (c);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc445fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> describe how the performance goals contribute to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc445fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the general goals and objectives established in the agency’s strategic plan required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s306/a/2"/>section 306(a)(2) of title 5; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc445ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any of the Federal Government performance goals established in the Federal Government performance plan required by subsection (a)(1);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc44600-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> identify among the performance goals those which are designated as agency priority goals as required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1120/b"/>section 1120(b) of this title, if applicable;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc44601-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> provide a description of how the performance goals are to be achieved, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc44602-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the operation processes, training, skills and technology, and the human, capital, information, and other resources and strategies required to meet those performance goals;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc44603-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> clearly defined milestones;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc44604-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> an identification of the organizations, program activities, regulations, policies, and other activities that contribute to each performance goal, both within and external to the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc44605-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a description of how the agency is working with other agencies to achieve its performance goals as well as relevant Federal Government performance goals; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc44606-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1115/b/5/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> an
