reporting</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc900ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Agency Identification of Unnecessary Reports</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Annually, based on guidance provided by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, the Chief Operating Officer at each agency shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc900ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> compile a list that identifies all plans and reports the agency produces for Congress, in accordance with statutory requirements or as directed in congressional reports;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc900ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> analyze the list compiled under paragraph (1), identify which plans and reports are outdated or duplicative of other required plans and reports, and refine the list to include only the plans and reports identified to be outdated or duplicative;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc900f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> consult with the congressional committees that receive the plans and reports identified under paragraph (2) to determine whether those plans and reports are no longer useful to the committees and could be eliminated or consolidated with other plans and reports; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc900f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> provide a total count of plans and reports compiled under paragraph (1) and the list of outdated and duplicative reports identified under paragraph (2) to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc900f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Plans and Reports.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc900f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">First year</span>.—</span></p>During the first year of implementation of this section, the list of plans and reports identified by each agency as outdated or duplicative shall be not less than 10 percent of all plans and reports identified under subsection (a)(1).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc900f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Subsequent years</span>.—</span></p>In each year following the first year described under paragraph (1), the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall determine the minimum percent of plans and reports to be identified as outdated or duplicative on each list of plans and reports.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc900f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1125/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Request for Elimination of Unnecessary Reports</span>.—</span></p>In addition to including the list of plans and reports determined to be outdated or duplicative by each agency in the budget of the United States Government, as provided by section 1105(a)(37),<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002028"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002028"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> the Director of the Office of Management and Budget may concurrently submit to Congress legislation to eliminate or consolidate such plans and reports.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/352">Pub. L. 111–352</span>, § 11(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3881">124 Stat. 3881</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fc900f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch13"><span itemtype="num" value="13">CHAPTER 13—</span><span itemtype="heading">APPROPRIATIONS</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fc900fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch13/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc900fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301"><span itemtype="num" value="1301">§ 1301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Application</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc900ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Appropriations shall be applied only to the objects for which the appropriations were made except as otherwise provided by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90100-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The reappropriation and diversion of the unexpended balance of an appropriation for a purpose other than that for which the appropriation originally was made shall be construed and accounted for as a new appropriation. The unexpended balance shall be reduced by the amount to be diverted.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90101-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An appropriation in a regular, annual appropriation law may be construed to be permanent or available continuously only if the appropriation—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90102-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is for rivers and harbors, lighthouses, public buildings, or the pay of the Navy and Marine Corps; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90103-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> expressly provides that it is available after the fiscal year covered by the law in which it appears.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90104-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1301/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> A law may be construed to make an appropriation out of the Treasury or to authorize making a contract for the payment of money in excess of an appropriation only if the law specifically states that an appropriation is made or that such a contract may be made.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/917">96 Stat. 917</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc9010b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1302"><span itemtype="num" value="1302">§ 1302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Determining amounts appropriated</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Except as specifically provided by law, the total amount appropriated in an appropriation law is determined by adding up the specific amounts or rates appropriated in each paragraph of the law.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/917">96 Stat. 917</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc9010f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1303"><span itemtype="num" value="1303">§ 1303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Effect of changes in titles of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Expenditures for a particular object or purpose authorized by a law (and referred to in that law by the specific title previously used for the appropriation item in the appropriation law concerned) may be made from a corresponding appropriation item when the specific title is changed or eliminated from a later appropriation law.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/917">96 Stat. 917</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc90113-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304"><span itemtype="num" value="1304">§ 1304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Judgments, awards, and compromise settlements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90114-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Necessary amounts are appropriated to pay final judgments, awards, compromise settlements, and interest and costs specified in the judgments or otherwise authorized by law when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90115-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> payment is not otherwise provided for;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90116-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> payment is certified by the Secretary of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90117-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the judgment, award, or settlement is payable—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc90118-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> under section 2414, 2517, 2672, or 2677 of title 28;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc90119-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3723"/>section 3723 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc9011a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> under a decision of a board of contract appeals; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fc9011b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/a/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> in excess of an amount payable from the appropriations of an agency for a meritorious claim under section 2733 or 2734 of title 10, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t32/s715"/>section 715 of title 32, or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t51/s20113"/>section 20113 of title 51.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc9011c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc9011d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Interest may be paid from the appropriation made by this section—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9011e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> on a judgment of a district court, only when the judgment becomes final after review on appeal or petition by the United States Government, and then only from the date of filing of the transcript of the judgment with the Secretary of the Treasury through the day before the date of the mandate of affirmance; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9011f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> on a judgment of the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit or the United States Court of Federal Claims under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s2516/b"/>section 2516(b) of title 28, only from the date of filing of the transcript of the judgment with the Secretary of the Treasury through the day before the date of the mandate of affirmance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90120-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Interest payable under this subsection in a proceeding reviewed by the Supreme Court is not allowed after the end of the term in which the judgment is affirmed.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90121-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90122-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A judgment or compromise settlement against the Government shall be paid under this section and sections 2414, 2517, and 2518 <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002029">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002029"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of title 28 when the judgment or settlement arises out of an express or implied contract made by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90123-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the Army and Air Force Exchange Service;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90124-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Navy Exchanges;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90125-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the Marine Corps Exchanges;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90126-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the Coast Guard Exchanges; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90127-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the Exchange Councils of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90128-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1304/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Exchange making the contract shall reimburse the Government for the amount paid by the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, §§ 1, 2(m)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/917">96 Stat. 917</span>, 1062; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/572/tIX">Pub. L. 102–572, title IX</span>, § 902(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-29">Oct. 29, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4516">106 Stat. 4516</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tII">Pub. L. 104–316, title II</span>, § 202(m), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3843">110 Stat. 3843</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/314">Pub. L. 111–314</span>, § 4(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-12-18">Dec. 18, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3440">124 Stat. 3440</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc90131-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305"><span itemtype="num" value="1305">§ 1305.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Miscellaneous permanent appropriations</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Necessary amounts are appropriated for the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90132-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to pay the proceeds of the personal estate of a United States citizen dying abroad to the legal representative of the deceased on proper demand and proof.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90133-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to pay interest on the public debt under laws authorizing payment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90134-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> to pay proceeds from derelict and salvage cases adjudged by the courts of the United States to salvors.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90135-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> to make payments required under contracts made under section 108 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s5308"/>42 U.S.C. 5308) for the payment of interest on obligations guaranteed by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development under section 108.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90136-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> to make payments required under contracts made under section 103(b) of the Housing Act of 1949 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s1453/b"/>42 U.S.C. 1453(b)) for projects or programs for which amounts had been committed before <p itemtype="date" date="1975-01-01"/>January 1, 1975, and for which amounts have not been appropriated.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90137-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> to pay the interest on the fund derived from the bequest of James Smithson, for the construction of buildings and expenses of the Smithsonian Institution, at the rates determined under section 5590 of the Revised Statutes (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t20/s54"/>20 U.S.C. 54).<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I81" class="centered"/><p itemtype="inline" class="small-caps"/>annual contributions for assisted housing<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90138-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> to make payments required under contracts made under section 5 of the United States Housing Act of 1937, as amended (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s1437c"/>42 U.S.C. 1437c).<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I81" class="centered"/><p itemtype="inline" class="small-caps"/>college housing grants<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90139-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> to make payments required under contracts made under title IV of the Housing Act of 1950, as amended (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1749"/>12 U.S.C. 1749 et seq.).<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I81" class="centered"/><p itemtype="inline" class="small-caps"/>rent supplement program<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9013a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> to make payments required under contracts under section 101 of the Housing and Urban Development Act of 1965, as amended (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1701s"/>12 U.S.C. 1701s).<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I81" class="centered"/><p itemtype="inline" class="small-caps"/>homeownership and rental housing assistance<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9013b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1305/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> to make payments required under contracts under sections 235 and 236, respectively, of the National Housing Act, as amended (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1715z"/>12 U.S.C. 1715z, 1715z–1).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/918">96 Stat. 918</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(4), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2467">96 Stat. 2467</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/371/tI">Pub. L. 98–371, title I</span>, § 101, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1220">98 Stat. 1220</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc90142-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1306"><span itemtype="num" value="1306">§ 1306.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Use of foreign credits</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90143-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1306/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p>Foreign credits (including currencies) owed to or owned by the United States may be used by any agency for any purpose for which appropriations are made for the agency for the current fiscal year (including the carrying out of Acts requiring or authorizing the use of such credits), but only when reimbursement therefor is made to the Treasury from applicable appropriations of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90144-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1306/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exception to Reimbursement Requirement</span>.—</span></p>Credits described in subsection (a) that are received as exchanged allowances, or as the proceeds of the sale of personal property, may be used in whole or partial payment for the acquisition of similar items, to the extent and in the manner authorized by law, without reimbursement to the Treasury.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/918">96 Stat. 918</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tI">Pub. L. 104–208, div. A, title I</span>, § 101(f) [title VI, § 612(a)], <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-314">110 Stat. 3009–314</span>, 3009–355.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc9014b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1307"><span itemtype="num" value="1307">§ 1307.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Public building construction</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Amounts appropriated to construct public buildings remain available until completion of the work. When a building is completed and outstanding liabilities for the construction are paid, balances remaining shall revert immediately to the Treasury.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/918">96 Stat. 918</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc9014f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1308"><span itemtype="num" value="1308">§ 1308.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Telephone and metered services</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Charges for telephone and metered services (such as gas, electricity, water, and steam) for a time period beginning in one fiscal year or allotment period and ending in another fiscal year or allotment period may be charged against the appropriation or allotment current at the end of the time period covered by the service.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/919">96 Stat. 919</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc90153-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1309"><span itemtype="num" value="1309">§ 1309.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Social security tax</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Amounts made available for the compensation of officers and employees of the United States Government may be used to pay taxes imposed on an agency as an employer under chapter 21 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s3101">26 U.S.C. 3101</span> et seq.).</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/919">96 Stat. 919</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fc90158-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310"><span itemtype="num" value="1310">§ 1310.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Appropriations for private organizations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90159-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury shall credit an appropriation for a private organization to the appropriate fiscal official of the organization. The credit shall be carried on the accounts of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9015a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Treasury; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9015b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a designated depositary of the United States Government (except a national bank).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc9015c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The fiscal official may pay an amount out of the appropriation only on a check of the fiscal official—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9015d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> payable to the order of the person to whom payment is to be made; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc9015e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> that states the specific purpose for which the amount is to be applied.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc9015f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90160-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The fiscal official may pay an amount of less than $20 out of the appropriation on a check—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90161-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> payable to the order of the fiscal official; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fc90162-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> that states the amount is to be applied to small claims.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fc90163-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1310/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The fiscal official shall provide the Secretary or the designated depositary on which the check is drawn with a certified list of the claims. The list shall state the kind and amount of each claim and the name of each claimant.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/919">96 Stat. 919</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fc90167-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch13/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">TRUST FUNDS AND REFUNDS</span></p><p
