B, title VI</span>, § 633(f), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-01-23">Jan. 23, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/101">118 Stat. 101</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb71d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322"><span itemtype="num" value="1322">§ 1322.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payments of unclaimed trust fund amounts and refund of amounts erroneously deposited</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> On September 30 of each year, the Secretary of the Treasury shall transfer to the Treasury trust fund receipt account “Unclaimed Moneys of Individuals Whose Whereabouts are Unknown” that part of the balance of a trust fund account named in section 1321(a)(1)–(82) of this title or an analogous trust fund established under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1321/b"/>section 1321(b) of this title that has been in the fund for more than one year and represents money belonging to individuals whose whereabouts are unknown. Subsequent claims to the transferred funds shall be paid from the account “Unclaimed Moneys of Individuals Whose Whereabouts are Unknown”.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, necessary amounts are appropriated to the Secretary of the Treasury to make payments from—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Treasury trust fund receipt account “Unclaimed Moneys of Individuals Whose Whereabouts are Unknown”; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the United States Government account “Refund of Moneys Erroneously Received and Covered” and other collections erroneously deposited that are not properly chargeable to another appropriation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall hold in the Treasury trust fund receipt account “Unclaimed Moneys of Individuals Whose Whereabouts Are Unknown” the balance remaining after the final distribution of unclaimed Postal Savings System deposits under subsection (a) of the first section of the Act of <p itemtype="date" date="1971-08-13"/>August 13, 1971 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/92/117"/>Public Law 92–117; <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/85/337"/>85 Stat. 337). The Secretary shall use the balance to pay claims for Postal Savings System deposits without regard to the State law or the law of other jurisdictions of deposit concerning the disposition of unclaimed or abandoned property.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Necessary amounts may be appropriated without fiscal year limitation to the trust fund receipt account to pay claims for deposits when the balance in the account is not sufficient to pay the claims made within the time limitation set forth in paragraph (3) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> No claim for any Postal Savings System deposit may be brought more than one year from the date of the enactment of the Postal Savings System Statute of Limitations Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1322/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The United States Postal Service shall assist the Secretary of the Treasury in providing public notice of the time limitation set forth in paragraph (3) of this subsection by posting notices thereof in all post offices as soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of the Postal Savings System Statute of Limitations Act.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/922">96 Stat. 922</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/359">Pub. L. 98–359</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-13">July 13, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/402">98 Stat. 402</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb71e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323"><span itemtype="num" value="1323">§ 1323.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Trust funds for certain fees, donations, quasi-public amounts, and unearned amounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Amounts from the following sources held in checking accounts of disbursing officials shall be deposited in the Treasury to the appropriate trust fund receipt accounts:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> unearned money, lands (Department of the Interior).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> reentry permit fees (Department of Justice).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> naturalization fees (Department of Justice).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> registry fees (Department of Justice).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Amounts deposited under subsection (a) of this section are appropriated for refunds. Earned parts of those amounts shall be transferred and credited to the appropriate receipt fund accounts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Donations, quasi-public amounts, and unearned amounts shall be deposited in the Treasury as trust funds and are appropriated for disbursement under the terms of the trusts when the donation or amount is—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> administered by officers and employees of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1323/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> carried in checking accounts of disbursing officials or others required to account to the Comptroller General (except clerks and marshals of the United States district courts).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/922">96 Stat. 922</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb71f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324"><span itemtype="num" value="1324">§ 1324.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Refund of internal revenue collections</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Necessary amounts are appropriated to the Secretary of the Treasury for refunding internal revenue collections as provided by law, including payment of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> claims for prior fiscal years; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> accounts arising under—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb71f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> “Allowance or drawback (Internal Revenue)”;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb71f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> “Redemption of stamps (Internal Revenue)”;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb71f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> “Refunding legacy taxes, Act of <p itemtype="date" date="1928-03-30"/>March 30, 1928”;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb71f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> “Repayment of taxes on distilled spirits destroyed by casualty”; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb71fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> “Refunds and payments of processing and related taxes”.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb71fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Disbursements may be made from the appropriation made by this section only for—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> refunds to the limit of liability of an individual tax account; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb71fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1324/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> refunds due from credit provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.) enacted before <p itemtype="date" date="1978-01-01"/>January 1, 1978, or enacted by the Taxpayer Relief Act of 1997, or from section 25A, 35, 36, 36A, 36B, 168(k)(4)(F), 53(e), 54B(h), or 6431 of such Code, or due under section 3081(b)(2) of the Housing Assistance Tax Act of 2008.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/923">96 Stat. 923</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/34/tI">Pub. L. 105–34, title I</span>, § 101(d)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-08-05">Aug. 5, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/799">111 Stat. 799</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/210/dA/tII">Pub. L. 107–210, div. A, title II</span>, § 201(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-06">Aug. 6, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/960">116 Stat. 960</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/432/dA/tIV">Pub. L. 109–432, div. A, title IV</span>, § 402(b)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-12-20">Dec. 20, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/2954">120 Stat. 2954</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/185/tI">Pub. L. 110–185, title I</span>, § 101(f)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-02-13">Feb. 13, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/617">122 Stat. 617</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/234/tXV">Pub. L. 110–234, title XV</span>, § 15316(c)(6), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-05-22">May 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/1511">122 Stat. 1511</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/246">Pub. L. 110–246</span>, § 4(a), title XV, § 15316(c)(6), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-06-18">June 18, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/1664">122 Stat. 1664</span>, 2273; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/289/dC/tI">Pub. L. 110–289, div. C, title I</span>, § 3011(b)(3), title III, § 3081(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-07-30">July 30, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/2891">122 Stat. 2891</span>, 2906; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/5/dB/tI">Pub. L. 111–5, div. B, title I</span>, §§ 1001(e)(2), 1004(b)(8), 1531(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-02-17">Feb. 17, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/312">123 Stat. 312</span>, 314, 360; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/148/tI">Pub. L. 111–148, title I</span>, § 1401(d)(1), title X, § 10909(b)(2)(P), (c), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-03-23">Mar. 23, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/220">124 Stat. 220</span>, 1023; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/312/tI">Pub. L. 111–312, title I</span>, § 101(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-12-17">Dec. 17, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3298">124 Stat. 3298</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/295/dA/tII">Pub. L. 113–295, div. A, title II</span>, § 221(a)(112)(D), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-12-19">Dec. 19, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/4054">128 Stat. 4054</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fcb720c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch13/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">LIMITATIONS, EXCEPTIONS, AND PENALTIES</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb720f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341"><span itemtype="num" value="1341">§ 1341.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitations on expending and obligating amounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7210-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7211-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government may not—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7212-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> make or authorize an expenditure or obligation exceeding an amount available in an appropriation or fund for the expenditure or obligation;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7213-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> involve either government in a contract or obligation for the payment of money before an appropriation is made unless authorized by law;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7214-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> make or authorize an expenditure or obligation of funds required to be sequestered under section 252 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7215-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> involve either government in a contract or obligation for the payment of money required to be sequestered under section 252 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7216-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> This subsection does not apply to a corporation getting amounts to make loans (except paid in capital amounts) without legal liability of the United States Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7217-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1341/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An article to be used by an executive department in the District of Columbia that could be bought out of an appropriation made to a regular contingent fund of the department may not be bought out of another amount available for obligation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/923">96 Stat. 923</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/508/tXIII">Pub. L. 101–508, title XIII</span>, § 13213(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1388-621">104 Stat. 1388–621</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb721d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1342"><span itemtype="num" value="1342">§ 1342.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitation on voluntary services</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government may not accept voluntary services for either government or employ personal services exceeding that authorized by law except for emergencies involving the safety of human life or the protection of property. This section does not apply to a corporation getting amounts to make loans (except paid in capital amounts) without legal liability of the United States Government. As used in this section, the term “emergencies involving the safety of human life or the protection of property” does not include ongoing, regular functions of government the suspension of which would not imminently threaten the safety of human life or the protection of property.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/923">96 Stat. 923</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/508/tXIII">Pub. L. 101–508, title XIII</span>, § 13213(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1388-621">104 Stat. 1388–621</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/92/tIII">Pub. L. 104–92, title III</span>, § 310(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-01-06">Jan. 6, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/20">110 Stat. 20</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb7223-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343"><span itemtype="num" value="1343">§ 1343.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Buying and leasing passenger motor vehicles and aircraft</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7224-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, buying a passenger motor vehicle or aircraft includes a transfer of the vehicle or aircraft between agencies.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7225-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An appropriation may be expended to buy or lease passenger motor vehicles only—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7226-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for the use of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb7227-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the President;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb7228-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the secretaries to the President; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcb7229-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the heads of executive departments listed in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s101"/>section 101 of title 5; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb722a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> as specifically provided by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb722b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb722c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as specifically provided by law, an agency may use an appropriation to buy a passenger motor vehicle (except a bus or ambulance) only at a total cost (except costs required only for transportation) that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb722d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> includes the price of systems and equipment the Administrator of General Services decides is incorporated customarily in standard passenger motor vehicles completely equipped for ordinary operation;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb722e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> includes the value of a vehicle used in exchange;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb722f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> is not more than the maximum price established by the agency having authority under law to establish a maximum price; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7230-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> is not more than the amount specified in a law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7231-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Additional systems and equipment may be bought for a passenger motor vehicle if the Administrator decides the purchase is appropriate. The price of additional systems or equipment is not included in deciding whether the cost of the vehicle is within a maximum price specified in a law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7232-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> An appropriation (except an appropriation for the armed forces) is available to buy, maintain, or operate an aircraft only if the appropriation specifically authorizes the purchase, maintenance, or operation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7233-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not apply to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7234-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> buying, maintaining, and repairing passenger motor vehicles by the United States Capitol Police;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7235-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> buying, maintaining, and repairing vehicles necessary to carry out projects to improve, preserve, and protect rivers and harbors; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7236-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1343/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> leasing, maintaining, repairing, or operating motor passenger vehicles necessary in the field work of the Department of Agriculture.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/924">96 Stat. 924</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcb723c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344"><span itemtype="num" value="1344">§ 1344.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Passenger carrier use</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb723d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb723e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Funds available to a Federal agency, by appropriation or otherwise, may be expended by the Federal agency for the maintenance, operation, or repair of any passenger carrier only to the extent that such carrier is used to provide transportation for official purposes. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, transporting any individual other than the individuals listed in subsections (b) and (c) of this section between such individual’s residence and such individual’s place of employment is not transportation for an official purpose.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb723f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of paragraph (1), transportation between the residence of an officer or employee and various locations that is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7240-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> required for the performance of field work, in accordance with regulations prescribed pursuant to subsection (e) of this section, or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7241-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> essential for the safe and efficient performance of intelligence, counterintelligence, protective services, or criminal law enforcement duties,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>is transportation for an official purpose, when approved in writing by the head of the Federal agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7242-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> For purposes of paragraph (1), the transportation of an individual between such individual’s place of employment and a mass transit facility pursuant to subsection (g) is transportation for an official purpose.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7243-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A passenger carrier may be used to transport between residence and place of employment the following officers and employees of Federal agencies:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7244-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7245-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the President and the Vice President;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7246-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> no more than 6 officers or employees in the Executive Office of the President, as designated by the President; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7247-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> no more than 10 additional officers or employees of Federal agencies, as designated by the President;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7248-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Chief Justice and the Associate Justices of the Supreme Court;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7249-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb724a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> officers compensated at Level I of the Executive Schedule pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5312"/>section 5312 of title 5; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb724b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a single principal deputy to an officer described in subclause (A) of this clause, when a determination is made by such officer that such transportation is appropriate;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb724c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> principal diplomatic and consular officials abroad, and the United States Ambassador to the United Nations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb724d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> the Deputy Secretary of Defense and Under Secretaries of Defense, the Secretary of the Air Force, the Secretary of the Army, the Secretary of the Navy, the members and Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and the Commandant of the Coast Guard;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb724e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> the Director of the Central Intelligence Agency, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002030"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002030"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> the Administrator of the Drug Enforcement Administration, and the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb724f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> the Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7250-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> the Comptroller General of the United States and the Postmaster General of the United States; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcb7251-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/b/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> an officer or employee with regard to whom the head of a Federal agency makes a determination, in accordance with subsection (d) of this section and with regulations prescribed pursuant to paragraph (1) of subsection (e), that highly unusual circumstances present a clear and present danger, that an emergency exists, or that other compelling operational considerations make such transportation essential to the conduct of official business.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>Except as provided in paragraph (2) of subsection (d), any authorization made pursuant to clause (9) of this subsection to permit the use of a passenger carrier to transport an officer or employee between residence and place of employment shall be effective for not more than 15 calendar days.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7252-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A passenger carrier may be used to transport between residence and place of employment any person for whom protection is specifically authorized pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s3056/a"/>section 3056(a) of title 18 or for whom transportation is authorized pursuant to section 28 of the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t10/s2637"/>section 2637 of title 10, or section 8(a)(1) of the Central Intelligence Agency Act of 1949.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7253-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7254-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Any determination made under subsection (b)(9) of this section shall be in writing and shall include the name and title of the officer or employee affected, the reason for such determination, and the duration of the authorization for such officer or employee to use a passenger carrier for transportation between residence and place of employment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcb7255-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If a clear and present danger, an emergency, or a compelling operational consideration described in subsection (b)(9) of this section extends or may extend for a period in excess of 15 calendar days, the head of the Federal agency shall determine whether an authorization under such paragraph shall be extended in excess of 15 calendar days for a period of not more than 90 additional calendar days. Determinations made under this paragraph may be reviewed by the head of such agency at the end of each such period, and, where appropriate, a subsequent determination may be made whether such danger, emergency, or consideration continues to exist and whether an additional extension, not to exceed 90 calendar days, may be authorized. Determinations made under this paragraph shall be in accordance with regulations prescribed pursuant to paragraph (1) of subsection (e).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb46-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The authority to make designations under subsection (b)(1) of this section and to make determinations pursuant to subsections (a)(2) and (b)(3)(B) and (9) of this section and pursuant to paragraph (2) of this subsection may not be delegated, except that, with respect to the Executive Office of the President, the President may delegate the authority of the President under subsection (b)(9) of this section to an officer in the Executive Office of the President. No designation or determination under this section may be made solely or principally for the comfort or convenience of the officer or employee.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Notification of each designation or determination made under subsection (b)(1), (3)(B), and (9) of this section and under paragraph (2) of this subsection, including the name and title of the officer or employee affected, the reason for any determination under subsection (b)(9), and the expected duration of any authorization under subsection (b)(9), shall be transmitted promptly to the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb48-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb49-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Not later than <p itemtype="date" date="1987-03-15"/>March 15, 1987, the Administrator of General Services, after consultation with the Comptroller General, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts, shall promulgate regulations governing the heads of all Federal agencies in making the determinations authorized by subsections (a)(2)(A), (b)(9), and (d)(2) of this section. Such regulations shall specify that the comfort and convenience of an officer or employee is not sufficient justification for authorizations of transportation under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> In promulgating regulations under paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Administrator of General Services shall provide criteria defining the term “field work” for purposes of subsection (a)(2)(A) of this section. Such criteria shall ensure that transportation between an employee’s residence and the location of the field work will be authorized only to the extent that such transportation will substantially increase the efficiency and economy of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> Each Federal agency shall maintain logs or other records necessary to establish the official purpose for Government transportation provided between an individual’s residence and such individual’s place of employment pursuant to this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If and to the extent that the head of a Federal agency, in his or her sole discretion, deems it appropriate, a passenger carrier may be used to transport an officer or employee of a Federal agency between the officer’s or employee’s place of employment and a mass transit facility (whether or not publicly owned) in accordance with succeeding provisions of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Notwithstanding section 1343, a Federal agency that provides transportation services under this subsection (including by passenger carrier) may absorb the costs of such services using any funds available to such agency, whether by appropriation or otherwise.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In carrying out this subsection, a Federal agency, to the maximum extent practicable and consistent with sound budget policy, should—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> use alternative fuel vehicles for the provision of transportation services;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to the extent consistent with the purposes of this subsection, provide transportation services in a manner that does not result in additional gross income for Federal income tax purposes; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> coordinate with other Federal agencies to share, and otherwise avoid duplication of, transportation services provided under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> For purposes of any determination under chapter 81 of title 5 or chapter 171 of title 28, an individual shall not be considered to be in the “performance of duty” or “acting within the scope of his or her office or employment” by virtue of the fact that such individual is receiving transportation services under this subsection. Nor shall any time during which an individual uses such services be considered when calculating the hours of work or employment for that individual for purposes of title 5 of the United States Code, including chapter 55 of that title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Administrator of General Services, after consultation with the appropriate agencies, shall prescribe any regulations necessary to carry out this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Transportation services under this subsection shall be subject neither to the last sentence of subsection (d)(3) nor to any regulations under the last sentence of subsection (e)(1).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/g/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> In this subsection, the term “passenger carrier” means a passenger motor vehicle or similar means of transportation that is owned, leased, or provided pursuant to contract by the United States Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the term “passenger carrier” means a passenger motor vehicle, aircraft, boat, ship, or other similar means of transportation that is owned or leased by the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the term “Federal agency” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a department—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fcdbb5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> including independent establishments, other agencies, and wholly owned Government corporations; but<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fcdbb5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> not including the Senate, House of Representatives, or Architect of the Capitol, or the officers or employees thereof;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an Executive department (as such term is defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s101"/>section 101 of title 5);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a military department (as such term is defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s102"/>section 102 of title 5);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a Government corporation (as such term is defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s103/1"/>section 103(1) of title 5);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> a Government controlled corporation (as such term is defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s103/2"/>section 103(2) of title 5);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> a mixed-ownership Government corporation (as such term is defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2"/>section 9101(2) of this title);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> any establishment in the executive branch of the Government (including the Executive Office of the President);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> any independent regulatory agency (including an independent regulatory agency specified in section 3502(10) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002031"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002031"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> of title 44);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Smithsonian Institution; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/h/2/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> any nonappropriated fund instrumentality of the United States,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>except that such term does not include the government of the District of Columbia.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1344/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t39/s410/a"/>section 410(a) of title 39, this section applies to the United States Postal Service.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/924">96 Stat. 924</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/550">Pub. L. 108–7, div. K, title IV</span>, § 423, <span itemtype="date" date="2003-02-20">Feb. 20, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/526">117 Stat. 526</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/447/dB/tI">Pub. L. 108–447, div. B, title I</span>, § 117, <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-08">Dec. 8, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/2870">118 Stat. 2870</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/59/tIII">Pub. L. 109–59, title III</span>, § 3049(b)(1), (2), <span itemtype="date" date="2005-08-10">Aug. 10, 2005</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/119/1712">119 Stat. 1712</span>, 1713; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbb75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1345"><span itemtype="num" value="1345">§ 1345.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Expenses of meetings</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Except as specifically provided by law, an appropriation may not be used for travel, transportation, and subsistence expenses for a meeting. This section does not prohibit—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1345/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> an agency from paying the expenses of an officer or employee of the United States Government carrying out an official duty; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1345/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Secretary of Agriculture from paying necessary expenses for a meeting called by the Secretary for 4–H Boys and Girls Clubs as part of the cooperative extension work of the Department of Agriculture.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/925">96 Stat. 925</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbb7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346"><span itemtype="num" value="1346">§ 1346.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Commissions, councils, boards, and inter­agency and similar groups</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> public money and appropriations are not available to pay—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the pay or expenses of a commission, council, board, or similar group, or a member of that group;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> expenses related to the work or the results of work or action of that group; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbb81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> for the detail or cost of personal services of an officer or employee from an executive agency in connection with that group; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> an accounting or disbursing official, absent a special appropriation to pay the account or charge, may not allow or pay an account or charge related to that group.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Appropriations of an executive agency are available for the expenses of an interagency group conducting activities of interest common to executive agencies when the group includes a representative of the agency. The representatives receive no additional pay because of membership in the group. An officer or employee of an executive agency not a representative of the group may not receive additional pay for providing services for the group.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subject to <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1347">section 1347 of this title</span>, this section does not apply to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> commissions, councils, boards, or similar groups authorized by law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> courts-martial or courts of inquiry of the armed forces; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbb87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1346/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the contingent fund related to foreign relations at the disposal of the President.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/925">96 Stat. 925</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbb8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1347"><span itemtype="num" value="1347">§ 1347.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Appropriations or authorizations required for agencies in existence for more than one year</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1347/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An agency in existence for more than one year may not use amounts otherwise available for obligation to pay its expenses without a specific appropriation or specific authorization by law. If the principal duties and powers of the agency are substantially the same as or similar to the duties and powers of an agency established by executive order, the agency established later is deemed to have been in existence from the date the agency established by the order came into existence.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1347/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Except as specifically authorized by law, another agency may not use amounts available for obligation to pay expenses to carry out duties and powers substantially the same as or similar to the principal duties and powers of an agency that is prohibited from using amounts under this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/925">96 Stat. 925</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbb91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1348"><span itemtype="num" value="1348">§ 1348.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Telephone installation and charges</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1348/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb93-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1348/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in this section, appropriations are not available to install telephones in private residences or for tolls or other charges for telephone service from private residences.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb94-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1348/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Under regulations of the Secretary of State, appropriations may be used to install and pay for the use of telephones in residences owned or leased by the United States Government in foreign countries for the use of the Foreign Service.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1348/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary of the Army on recommendation of the Chief of Engineers, not more than $30,000 may be expended each fiscal year to install and use in private residences telephones required for official business in constructing and operating locks and dams for navigation, flood control, and related water uses.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1348/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary of Defense, funds appropriated to the Department of Defense are available to install, repair, and maintain telephone wiring in residences owned or leased by the United States Government and, if necessary for national defense purposes, in other private residences.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/926">96 Stat. 926</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/407/tVIII">Pub. L. 98–407, title VIII</span>, § 811(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-08-28">Aug. 28, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1523">98 Stat. 1523</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/201/dA/tXVII">Pub. L. 104–201, div. A, title XVII</span>, § 1721, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-23">Sept. 23, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2758">110 Stat. 2758</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbb9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1349"><span itemtype="num" value="1349">§ 1349.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Adverse personnel actions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbb9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1349/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government violating section 1341(a) or 1342 of this title shall be subject to appropriate administrative discipline including, when circumstances warrant, suspension from duty without pay or removal from office.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbba0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1349/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An officer or employee who willfully uses or authorizes the use of a passenger motor vehicle or aircraft owned or leased by the United States Government (except for an official purpose authorized by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1344"/>section 1344 of this title) or otherwise violates section 1344 shall be suspended without pay by the head of the agency. The officer or employee shall be suspended for at least one month, and when circumstances warrant, for a longer period or summarily removed from office.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/926">96 Stat. 926</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbba4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1350"><span itemtype="num" value="1350">§ 1350.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal penalty</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government knowingly and willfully violating section 1341(a) or 1342 of this title shall be fined not more than $5,000, imprisoned for not more than 2 years, or both.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/926">96 Stat. 926</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbba8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1351"><span itemtype="num" value="1351">§ 1351.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports on violations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">If an officer or employee of an executive agency or an officer or employee of the District of Columbia government violates section 1341(a) or 1342 of this title, the head of the agency or the Mayor of the District of Columbia, as the case may be, shall report immediately to the President and Congress all relevant facts and a statement of actions taken. A copy of each report shall also be transmitted to the Comptroller General on the same date the report is transmitted to the President and Congress.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/926">96 Stat. 926</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/447/dG/tI">Pub. L. 108–447, div. G, title I</span>, § 1401(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-08">Dec. 8, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3192">118 Stat. 3192</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fcdbbad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352"><span itemtype="num" value="1352">§ 1352.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitation on use of appropriated funds to influence certain Federal contracting and financial transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbaf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> None of the funds appropriated by any Act may be expended by the recipient of a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement to pay any person for influencing or attempting to influence an officer or employee of any agency, a Member of Congress, an officer or employee of Congress, or an employee of a Member of Congress in connection with any Federal action described in paragraph (2) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The prohibition in paragraph (1) of this subsection applies with respect to the following Federal actions:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The awarding of any Federal contract.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The making of any Federal grant.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The making of any Federal loan.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The entering into of any cooperative agreement.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The extension, continuation, renewal, amendment, or modification of any Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each person who requests or receives a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement from an agency or requests or receives from an agency a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan shall file with that agency, in accordance with paragraph (4) of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a written declaration described in paragraph (2) or (3) of this subsection, as the case may be; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> copies of all declarations received by such person under paragraph (5).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A declaration filed by a person pursuant to paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection in connection with a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement shall contain—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbbb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the name of any registrant under the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 who has made lobbying contacts on behalf of the person with respect to that Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbbc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a certification that the person making the declaration has not made, and will not make, any payment prohibited by subsection (a).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A declaration filed by a person pursuant to paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection in connection with a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan shall contain the name of any registrant under the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 who has made lobbying contacts on behalf of the person in connection with that loan insurance or guarantee.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbbe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A person referred to in paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection shall file a declaration referred to in that paragraph—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> with each submission by such person that initiates agency consideration of such person for award of a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement, or for grant of a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> upon receipt by such person of a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement or of a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan, unless such person previously filed a declaration with respect to such contract, grant, loan, cooperative agreement or commitment pursuant to clause (A); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> at the end of each calendar quarter in which there occurs any event that materially affects the accuracy of the information contained in any declaration previously filed by such person in connection with such Federal contract, grant, loan, cooperative agreement, loan insurance commitment, or loan guaranty commitment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Any person who requests or receives from a person referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection a subcontract under a Federal contract, a subgrant or contract under a Federal grant, a contract or subcontract to carry out any purpose for which a particular Federal loan is made, or a contract under a Federal cooperative agreement shall be required to file with the person referred to in such paragraph a written declaration referred to in clause (A) of such paragraph.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget, after consulting with the Secretary of the Senate and the Clerk of the House of Representatives, shall issue guidance for agency implementation of, and compliance with, the requirements of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Any person who makes an expenditure prohibited by subsection (a) of this section shall be subject to a civil penalty of not less than $10,000 and not more than $100,000 for each such expenditure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Any person who fails to file or amend a declaration required to be filed or amended under subsection (b) of this section shall be subject to a civil penalty of not less than $10,000 and not more than $100,000 for each such failure.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> A filing of a declaration of a declaration amendment on or after the date on which an administrative action for the imposition of a civil penalty under this subsection is commenced does not prevent the imposition of such civil penalty for a failure occurring before that date. For the purposes of this subparagraph, an administrative action is commenced with respect to a failure when an investigating official determines in writing to commence an investigation of an allegation of such failure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Sections 3803 (except for subsection (c)), 3804, 3805, 3806, 3807, 3808, and 3812 of this title shall be applied, consistent with the requirements of this section, to the imposition and collection of civil penalties under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> An imposition of a civil penalty under this subsection does not prevent the United States from seeking any other remedy that the United States may have for the same conduct that is the basis for the imposition of such civil penalty.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbcb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbcc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbcd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Subsection (a)(1) of this section does not apply in the case of a payment of reasonable compensation made to an officer or employee of a person requesting or receiving a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement to the extent that the payment is for agency and legislative liaison activities not directly related to a Federal action referred to in subsection (a)(2) of this section.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Subsection (a)(1) of this section does not prohibit any reasonable payment to a person in connection with, or any payment of reasonable compensation to an officer or employee of a person requesting or receiving, a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement or an extension, continuation, renewal, amendment, or modification of a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement if the payment is for professional or technical services rendered directly in the preparation, submission, or negotiation of any bid, proposal, or application for that Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement or for meeting requirements imposed by or pursuant to law as a condition for receiving that Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbcf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Nothing in this paragraph shall be construed as permitting the use of appropriated funds for making any payment prohibited in or pursuant to any other provision of law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbd0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The reporting requirement in subsection (b) of this section shall not apply to any person with respect to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbd1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> payments of reasonable compensation made to regularly employed officers or employees of a person requesting or receiving a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement or a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbd2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a request for or receipt of a contract (other than a contract referred to in clause (C)), grant, cooperative agreement, subcontract (other than a subcontract referred to in clause (C)), or subgrant that does not exceed $100,000; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/d/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a request for or receipt of a loan, or a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan, that does not exceed $150,000, or the single family maximum mortgage limit for affected programs, whichever is greater, including a contract or subcontract to carry out any purpose for which such a loan is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Secretary of Defense may exempt a Federal action described in subsection
