(a)(2) from the prohibition in subsection (a)(1) whenever the Secretary determines, in writing, that such an exemption is in the national interest. The Secretary shall transmit a copy of each such written exemption to Congress immediately after making such determination.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The head of each Federal agency shall take such actions as are necessary to ensure that the provisions of this section are vigorously implemented and enforced in such agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fcdbbd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this section:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term “recipient”, with respect to funds received in connection with a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbbd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> includes the contractors, subcontractors, or subgrantees (as the case may be) of the recipient; but<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbbd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> does not include an Indian tribe, tribal organization, or any other Indian organization eligible to receive Federal contracts, grants, cooperative agreements, or loans from an agency but only with respect to expenditures that are by such tribe or organization for purposes specified in subsection (a) and are permitted by other Federal law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The term “agency” has the same meaning provided for such term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552/f"/>section 552(f) of title 5, and includes a Government corporation, as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9101/1"/>section 9101(1) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fcdbbdb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term “person”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fcdbbdc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> includes an individual, corporation, company, association, authority, firm, partnership, society, State, and local government, regardless of whether such entity is operated for profit or not for profit; but<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02cdd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> does not include an Indian tribe, tribal organization, or any other Indian organization eligible to receive Federal contracts, grants, cooperative agreements, or loans from an agency but only with respect to expenditures by such tribe or organization that are made for purposes specified in subsection (a) and are permitted by other Federal law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cde-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The term “State” means a State of the United States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, a territory or possession of the United States, an agency or instrumentality of a State, and a multi-State, regional, or interstate entity having governmental duties and powers.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cdf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term “local government” means a unit of government in a State and, if chartered, established, or otherwise recognized by a State for the performance of a governmental duty, the following entities:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> A local public authority.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> A special district.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> An intrastate district.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> A council of governments.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> A sponsor group representative organization.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/5/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> Any other instrumentality of a local government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02ce6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02ce7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The terms “Federal contract”, “Federal grant”, “Federal cooperative agreement” mean, respectively—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a contract awarded by an agency;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ce9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> a grant made by an agency or a direct appropriation made by law to any person; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02cea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> a cooperative agreement entered into by an agency.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02ceb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Such terms do not include—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02cec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> direct United States cash assistance to an individual;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02ced-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> a loan;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02cee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> loan insurance; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02cef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/6/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> a loan guaranty.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cf0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> The term “Federal loan” means a loan made by an agency. Such term does not include loan insurance or a loan guaranty.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cf1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> The term “reasonable payment” means, with respect to professional and other technical services, a payment in an amount that is consistent with the amount normally paid for such services in the private sector.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cf2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> The term “reasonable compensation” means, with respect to a regularly employed officer or employee of any person, compensation that is consistent with the normal compensation for such officer or employee for work that is not furnished to, not funded by, or not furnished in cooperation with the Federal Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cf3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> The term “regularly employed”, with respect to an officer or employee of a person requesting or receiving a Federal contract, grant, loan, or cooperative agreement or a commitment providing for the United States to insure or guarantee a loan, means an officer or employee who is employed by such person for at least 130 working days within one year immediately preceding the date of the submission that initiates agency consideration of such person for receipt of such contract, grant, loan, cooperative agreement, loan insurance commitment, or loan guaranty commitment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02cf4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1352/g/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> The terms “Indian tribe” and “tribal organization” have the meaning provided in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t25/s450b"/>25 U.S.C. 450b).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/121/tIII">Pub. L. 101–121, title III</span>, § 319(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-10-23">Oct. 23, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/750">103 Stat. 750</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/512/tIII">Pub. L. 101–512, title III</span>, § 320, <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1977">104 Stat. 1977</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(F), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/65">Pub. L. 104–65</span>, § 10, <span itemtype="date" date="1995-12-19">Dec. 19, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/700">109 Stat. 700</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/66/tIII">Pub. L. 104–66, title III</span>, § 3001(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1995-12-21">Dec. 21, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/734">109 Stat. 734</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title X</span>, § 1064(c), div. D, title XLIII, § 4301(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/445">110 Stat. 445</span>, 656.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02cff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353"><span itemtype="num" value="1353">§ 1353.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Acceptance of travel and related expenses from non-Federal sources</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d00-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Administrator of General Services, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Government Ethics, shall prescribe by regulation the conditions under which an agency in the executive branch (including an independent agency) may accept payment, or authorize an employee of such agency to accept payment on the agency’s behalf, from non-Federal sources for travel, subsistence, and related expenses with respect to attendance of the employee (or the spouse of such employee) at any meeting or similar function relating to the official duties of the employee. Any cash payment so accepted shall be credited to the appropriation applicable to such expenses. In the case of a payment in kind so accepted, a pro rata reduction shall be made in any entitlement of the employee to payment from the Government for such expenses.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d01-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in this section or section 4111 or 7342 of title 5, an agency or employee may not accept payment for expenses referred to in subsection (a). An employee who accepts any payment in violation of the preceding sentence—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d02-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may be required, in addition to any penalty provided by law, to repay, for deposit in the general fund of the Treasury, an amount equal to the amount of the payment so accepted; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d03-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in the case of a repayment under paragraph (1), shall not be entitled to any payment from the Government for such expenses.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the term “executive branch” means all executive agencies (as such term is defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s105"/>section 105 of title 5); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the term “employee in the executive branch” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an appointed officer or employee in the executive branch; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an expert or consultant in the executive branch, under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3109"/>section 3109 of title 5; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the term “payment” means a payment or reimbursement, in cash or in kind.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of each agency of the executive branch shall, in the manner provided in paragraph (2), submit to the Director of the Office of Government Ethics reports of payments of more than $250 accepted under this section with respect to employees of the agency. The Director shall make such reports available for public inspection and copying.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The reports required by paragraph (1) shall, with respect to each payment—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> specify the amount and method of payment, the name of the person making the payment, the name of the employee, the nature of the meeting or similar function, the time and place of travel, the nature of the expenses, and such other information as the Administrator of General Services may prescribe by regulation under subsection (a);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> be submitted not later than May 31 of each year with respect to payments in the preceding period beginning on October 1 and ending on March 31; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1353/d/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> be submitted not later than November 30 of each year with respect to payments in the preceding period beginning on April 1 and ending on September 30.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/194/tIII">Pub. L. 101–194, title III</span>, § 302(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-11-30">Nov. 30, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/1745">103 Stat. 1745</span>, § 1352; renumbered § 1353 and amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/280">Pub. L. 101–280</span>, § 4(b)(1), (c), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-05-04">May 4, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/157">104 Stat. 157</span>, 158.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1354"><span itemtype="num" value="1354">§ 1354.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitation on use of appropriated funds for contracts with entities not meeting veterans’ employment reporting requirements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1354/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1354/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Subject to paragraph (2), no agency may obligate or expend funds appropriated for the agency for a fiscal year to enter into a contract described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t38/s4212/a"/>section 4212(a) of title 38 with a contractor from which a report was required under section 4212(d) of that title with respect to the preceding fiscal year if such contractor did not submit such report.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1354/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Paragraph (1) shall cease to apply with respect to a contractor otherwise covered by that paragraph on the date on which the contractor submits the report required by such section 4212(d) for the fiscal year concerned.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d17-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1354/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary of Labor shall make available in a database a list of the contractors that have complied with the provisions of such section 4212(d).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/339">Pub. L. 105–339</span>, § 7(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-31">Oct. 31, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3189">112 Stat. 3189</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd02d19-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch15"><span itemtype="num" value="15">CHAPTER 15—</span><span itemtype="heading">APPROPRIATION ACCOUNTING</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd02d1d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch15/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d1e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501"><span itemtype="num" value="1501">§ 1501.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Documentary evidence requirement for Government obligations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d1f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An amount shall be recorded as an obligation of the United States Government only when supported by documentary evidence of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d20-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a binding agreement between an agency and another person (including an agency) that is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d21-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> in writing, in a way and form, and for a purpose authorized by law; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d22-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> executed before the end of the period of availability for obligation of the appropriation or fund used for specific goods to be delivered, real property to be bought or leased, or work or service to be provided;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d23-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a loan agreement showing the amount and terms of repayment;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d24-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> an order required by law to be placed with an agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> an order issued under a law authorizing purchases without advertising—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> when necessary because of a public exigency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> for perishable subsistence supplies; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> within specific monetary limits;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a grant or subsidy payable—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> from appropriations made for payment of, or contributions to, amounts required to be paid in specific amounts fixed by law or under formulas prescribed by law;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> under an agreement authorized by law; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> under plans approved consistent with and authorized by law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d2d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> a liability that may result from pending litigation;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d2e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> employment or services of persons or expenses of travel under law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d2f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> services provided by public utilities; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d30-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> other legal liability of the Government against an available appropriation or fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1501/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A statement of obligations provided to Congress or a committee of Congress by an agency shall include only those amounts that are obligations consistent with subsection (a) of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/927">96 Stat. 927</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1502"><span itemtype="num" value="1502">§ 1502.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Balances available</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1502/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The balance of an appropriation or fund limited for obligation to a definite period is available only for payment of expenses properly incurred during the period of availability or to complete contracts properly made within that period of availability and obligated consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1501"/>section 1501 of this title. However, the appropriation or fund is not available for expenditure for a period beyond the period otherwise authorized by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1502/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A provision of law requiring that the balance of an appropriation or fund be returned to the general fund of the Treasury at the end of a definite period does not affect the status of lawsuits or rights of action involving the right to an amount payable from the balance.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/928">96 Stat. 928</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1503"><span itemtype="num" value="1503">§ 1503.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Comptroller General reports of amounts for which no accounting is made</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Comptroller General shall make a special report each year to Congress on recommendations for changes in laws, that the Comptroller General believes may be in the public interest, about amounts—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1503/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> for which no accounting is made to the Comptroller General; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1503/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> that are in—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1503/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> accounts of the United States Government; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1503/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the custody of an officer or employee of the Government if the Government is financially concerned.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/928">96 Stat. 928</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd02d46-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch15/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">APPORTIONMENT</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511"><span itemtype="num" value="1511">§ 1511.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definition and application</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d48-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this subchapter, “appropriations” means—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d49-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> appropriated amounts;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> funds; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> authority to make obligations by contract before appropriations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subchapter does not apply to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> amounts (except amounts for administrative expenses) available—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> for price support and surplus removal of agricultural commodities; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd02d4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1935-08-24/s32"/>section 32 of the Act of August 24, 1935 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s612c"/>7 U.S.C. 612c);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a corporation getting amounts to make loans (except paid in capital amounts) without legal liability on the part of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1511/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the Senate, the House of Representatives, a committee of Congress, a member, officer, employee, or office of either House of Congress, or the Office of the Architect of the Capitol or an officer or employee of that Office.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/928">96 Stat. 928</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512"><span itemtype="num" value="1512">§ 1512.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Apportionment and reserves</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Except as provided in this subchapter, an appropriation available for obligation for a definite period shall be apportioned to prevent obligation or expenditure at a rate that would indicate a necessity for a deficiency or supplemental appropriation for the period. An appropriation for an indefinite period and authority to make obligations by contract before appropriations shall be apportioned to achieve the most effective and economical use. An apportionment may be reapportioned under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An appropriation subject to apportionment is apportioned by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> months, calendar quarters, operating seasons, or other time periods;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> activities, functions, projects, or objects; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a combination of the ways referred to in clauses (A) and (B) of this paragraph.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The official designated in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1513"/>section 1513 of this title to make apportionments shall apportion an appropriation under paragraph (1) of this subsection as the official considers appropriate. Except as specified by the official, an amount apportioned is available for obligation under the terms of the appropriation on a cumulative basis unless reapportioned.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In apportioning or reapportioning an appropriation, a reserve may be established only—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to provide for contingencies;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to achieve savings made possible by or through changes in requirements or greater efficiency of operations; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> as specifically provided by law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A reserve established under this subsection may be changed as necessary to carry out the scope and objectives of the appropriation concerned. When an official designated in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1513"/>section 1513 of this title to make apportionments decides that an amount reserved will not be required to carry out the objectives and scope of the appropriation concerned, the official shall recommend the rescission of the amount in the way provided in chapter 11 of this title for appropriation requests. Reserves established under this section shall be reported to Congress as provided in the Impoundment Control Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t2/s681"/>2 U.S.C. 681 et seq.).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1512/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> An apportionment or a reapportionment shall be reviewed at least 4 times a year by the official designated in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1513"/>section 1513 of this title to make apportionments.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/929">96 Stat. 929</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513"><span itemtype="num" value="1513">§ 1513.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Officials controlling apportionments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The official having administrative control of an appropriation available to the legislative branch, the judicial branch, the United States International Trade Commission, or the District of Columbia government that is required to be apportioned under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1512">section 1512 of this title</span> shall apportion the appropriation in writing. An appropriation shall be apportioned not later than the later of the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> 30 days before the beginning of the fiscal year for which the appropriation is available; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> 30 days after the date of enactment of the law by which the appropriation is made available.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The President shall apportion in writing an appropriation available to an executive agency (except the Commission) that is required to be apportioned under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1512">section 1512 of this title</span>. The head of each executive agency to which the appropriation is available shall submit to the President information required for the apportionment in the form and the way and at the time specified by the President. The information shall be submitted not later than the later of the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d6f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 40 days before the beginning of the fiscal year for which the appropriation is available; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d70-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 15 days after the date of enactment of the law by which the appropriation is made available.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d71-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The President shall notify the head of the executive agency of the action taken in apportioning the appropriation under paragraph (1) of this subsection not later than the later of the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 20 days before the beginning of the fiscal year for which the appropriation is available; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 30 days after the date of enactment of the law by which the appropriation is made available.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> By the first day of each fiscal year, the head of each executive department of the United States Government shall apportion among the major organizational units of the department the maximum amount to be expended by each unit during the fiscal year out of each contingent fund appropriated for the entire year for the department. Each amount may be changed during the fiscal year only by written direction of the head of the department. The direction shall state the reasons for the change.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> An appropriation apportioned under this subchapter may be divided and subdivided administratively within the limits of the apportionment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1513/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> This section does not affect the initiation and operation of agricultural price support programs.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/930">96 Stat. 930</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1514"><span itemtype="num" value="1514">§ 1514.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Administrative division of apportionments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1514/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The official having administrative control of an appropriation available to the legislative branch, the judicial branch, the United States International Trade Commission, or the District of Columbia government, and, subject to the approval of the President, the head of each executive agency (except the Commission) shall prescribe by regulation a system of administrative control not inconsistent with accounting procedures prescribed under law. The system shall be designed to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1514/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> restrict obligations or expenditures from each appropriation to the amount of apportionments or reapportionments of the appropriation; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1514/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> enable the official or the head of the executive agency to fix responsibility for an obligation or expenditure exceeding an apportionment or reapportionment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1514/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> To have a simplified system for administratively dividing appropriations, the head of each executive agency (except the Commission) shall work toward the objective of financing each operating unit, at the highest practical level, from not more than one administrative division for each appropriation affecting the unit.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/930">96 Stat. 930</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515"><span itemtype="num" value="1515">§ 1515.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authorized apportionments necessitating deficiency or supplemental appropriations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An appropriation required to be apportioned under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1512"/>section 1512 of this title may be apportioned on a basis that indicates the need for a deficiency or supplemental appropriation to the extent necessary to permit payment of such pay increases as may be granted pursuant to law to civilian officers and employees (including prevailing rate employees whose pay is fixed and adjusted under subchapter IV of chapter 53 of title 5) and to retired and active military personnel.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subsection (a) of this section, an official may make, and the head of an executive agency may request, an apportionment under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1512">section 1512 of this title</span> that would indicate a necessity for a deficiency or supplemental appropriation only when the official or agency head decides that the action is required because of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a law enacted after submission to Congress of the estimates for an appropriation that requires an expenditure beyond administrative control; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an emergency involving the safety of human life, the protection of property, or the immediate welfare of individuals when an appropriation that would allow the United States Government to pay, or contribute to, amounts required to be paid to individuals in specific amounts fixed by law or under formulas prescribed by law, is insufficient.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd02d88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1515/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If an official making an apportionment decides that an apportionment would indicate a necessity for a deficiency or supplemental appropriation, the official shall submit immediately a detailed report of the facts to Congress. The report shall be referred to in submitting a proposed deficiency or supplemental appropriation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/931">96 Stat. 931</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/202">Pub. L. 100–202</span>, § 105, <span itemtype="date" date="1987-12-22">Dec. 22, 1987</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/1329-433">101 Stat. 1329–433</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd02d8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516"><span itemtype="num" value="1516">§ 1516.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Exemptions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>An official designated in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1513">section 1513 of this title</span> to make apportionments may exempt from apportionment—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a trust fund or working fund if an expenditure from the fund has no significant effect on the financial operations of the United States Government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a working capital fund or a revolving fund established for intragovernmental operations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> receipts from industrial and power operations available under law; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd02d91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> appropriations made specifically for—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd27682-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> interest on, or retirement of, the public debt;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd27683-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> payment of claims, judgments, refunds, and drawbacks;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd27684-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> items the President decides are of a confidential nature;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd27685-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/4/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> payment under a law requiring payment of the total amount of the appropriation to a designated payee; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd27686-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1516/4/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> grants to the States under the Social Security Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s301"/>42 U.S.C. 301 et seq.).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/931">96 Stat. 931</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd2768b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1517"><span itemtype="num" value="1517">§ 1517.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prohibited obligations and expenditures</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd2768c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1517/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government may not make or authorize an expenditure or obligation exceeding—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd2768d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1517/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> an apportionment; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd2768e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1517/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the amount permitted by regulations prescribed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1514/a"/>section 1514(a) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd2768f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1517/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> If an officer or employee of an executive agency or of the District of Columbia government violates subsection (a) of this section, the head of the executive agency or the Mayor of the District of Columbia, as the case may be, shall report immediately to the President and Congress all relevant facts and a statement of actions taken. A copy of each report shall also be transmitted to the Comptroller General on the same date the report is transmitted to the President and Congress.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/932">96 Stat. 932</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/447/dG/tI">Pub. L. 108–447, div. G, title I</span>, § 1401(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-08">Dec. 8, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3192">118 Stat. 3192</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd27694-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1518"><span itemtype="num" value="1518">§ 1518.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Adverse personnel actions</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government violating <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1517/a">section 1517(a) of this title</span> shall be subject to appropriate administrative discipline including, when circumstances warrant, suspension from duty without pay or removal from office.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/932">96 Stat. 932</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd27698-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1519"><span itemtype="num" value="1519">§ 1519.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal penalty</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An officer or employee of the United States Government or of the District of Columbia government knowingly and willfully violating <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1517/a">section 1517(a) of this title</span> shall be fined not more than $5,000, imprisoned for not more than 2 years, or both.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/932">96 Stat. 932</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd2769c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch15/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">TRANSFERS AND REIMBURSEMENTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd2769d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531"><span itemtype="num" value="1531">§ 1531.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Transfers of functions and activities</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd2769e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The balance of an appropriation available and necessary to finance or discharge a function or activity transferred or assigned under law within an executive agency or from one executive agency to another may be transferred to and used—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd2769f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> by the organizational unit or agency to which the function or activity was transferred or assigned; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> for a purpose for which the appropriation was originally available.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The head of the executive agency determines the amount that, with the approval of the President, is necessary to be transferred when the transfer or assignment of the function or activity is within the agency. The President determines the amount necessary to be transferred when the transfer or assignment of the function or activity is from one executive agency to another.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A balance transferred under this section is—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> credited to an applicable existing or new appropriation account;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> merged with the amount in an account to which the balance is credited; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> with the amount with which the balance is merged, accounted for as one amount.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1531/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> New appropriation accounts may be established to carry out subsection (c)(1) of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/932">96 Stat. 932</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd276ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1532"><span itemtype="num" value="1532">§ 1532.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Withdrawal and credit</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An amount available under law may be withdrawn from one appropriation account and credited to another or to a working fund only when authorized by law. Except as specifically provided by law, an amount authorized to be withdrawn and credited is available for the same purpose and subject to the same limitations provided by the law appropriating the amount. A withdrawal and credit is made by check and without a warrant.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/933">96 Stat. 933</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd276af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1533"><span itemtype="num" value="1533">§ 1533.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Transfers of appropriations for salaries and expenses to carry out national defense responsibilities</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An appropriation of an executive agency for salaries and expenses is available to carry out national defense responsibilities assigned to the agency under law. A transfer necessary to carry out this section may be made between appropriations or allocations within the executive agency. An allocation may not be made to an executive agency that can carry out with its regular personnel a defense activity assigned to it by using the authority of this section to re­align its regular programs.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/933">96 Stat. 933</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd276b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1534"><span itemtype="num" value="1534">§ 1534.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Adjustments between appropriations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1534/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An appropriation available to an agency may be charged at any time during a fiscal year for the benefit of another appropriation available to the agency to pay costs—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1534/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> when amounts are available in both the appropriation to be charged and the appropriation to be benefited; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1534/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> subject to limitations applicable to the appropriations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1534/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Amounts paid under this section are charged on a final basis during, or as of the close of, the fiscal year to the appropriation benefited. The appropriation charged under subsection (a) of this section shall be appropriately credited.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/933">96 Stat. 933</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd276bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535"><span itemtype="num" value="1535">§ 1535.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Agency agreements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an agency or major organizational unit within an agency may place an order with a major organizational unit within the same agency or another agency for goods or services if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> amounts are available;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the head of the ordering agency or unit decides the order is in the best interest of the United States Government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the agency or unit to fill the order is able to provide or get by contract the ordered goods or services; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the head of the agency decides ordered goods or services cannot be provided by contract as conveniently or cheaply by a commercial enterprise.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Payment shall be made promptly by check on the written request of the agency or unit filling the order. Payment may be in advance or on providing the goods or services ordered and shall be for any part of the estimated or actual cost as determined by the agency or unit filling the order. A bill submitted or a request for payment is not subject to audit or certification in advance of payment. Proper adjustment of amounts paid in advance shall be made as agreed to by the heads of the agencies or units on the basis of the actual cost of goods or services provided.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A condition or limitation applicable to amounts for procurement of an agency or unit placing an order or making a contract under this section applies to the placing of the order or the making of the contract.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An order placed or agreement made under this section obligates an appropriation of the ordering agency or unit. The amount obligated is deobligated to the extent that the agency or unit filling the order has not incurred obligations, before the end of the period of availability of the appropriation, in—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> providing goods or services; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> making an authorized contract with another person to provide the requested goods or services.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> authorize orders to be placed for goods or services to be provided by convict labor; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1535/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> affect other laws about working funds.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/933">96 Stat. 933</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/216">Pub. L. 98–216</span>, § 1(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-02-14">Feb. 14, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/3">98 Stat. 3</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd276d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1536"><span itemtype="num" value="1536">§ 1536.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Crediting payments from purchases between executive agencies</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1536/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An advance payment made on an order under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1535"/>section 1535 of this title is credited to a special working fund that the Secretary of the Treasury considers necessary to be established. Except as provided in this section, any other payment is credited to the appropriation or fund against which charges were made to fill the order.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1536/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An amount paid under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1535">section 1535 of this title</span> may be expended in providing goods or services or for a purpose specified for the appropriation or fund credited. Where goods are provided from stocks on hand, the amount received in payment is credited so as to be available to replace the goods unless—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1536/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> another law authorizes the amount to be credited to some other appropriation or fund; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1536/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the head of the executive agency filling the order decides that replacement is not necessary, in which case, the amount received is deposited in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1536/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> This section does not affect other laws about working funds.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/934">96 Stat. 934</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd276dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537"><span itemtype="num" value="1537">§ 1537.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Services between the United States Government and the District of Columbia government</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To prevent duplication and to promote efficiency and economy, an officer or employee of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the United States Government may provide services to the District of Columbia government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the District of Columbia government may provide services to the United States Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd276e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Services under this section shall be provided under an agreement—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd276e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> negotiated by officers and employees of the 2 governments; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> approved by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the Mayor of the District of Columbia.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Each agreement shall provide that the cost of providing the services shall be borne in the way provided in subsection (c) of this section by the government to which the services are provided at rates or charges based on the actual cost of providing the services.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To carry out an agreement made under this subsection, the agreement may provide for the delegation of duties and powers of officers and employees of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the District of Columbia government to officers and employees of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the United States Government to officers and employees of the District of Columbia government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In providing services under an agreement made under subsection (b) of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> costs incurred by the United States Government may be paid from appropriations available to the District of Columbia government officer or employee to whom the services were provided; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> costs incurred by the District of Columbia government may be paid from amounts available to the United States Government officer or employee to whom the services were provided.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1537/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> When requested by the Director of the United States Secret Service, the Chief of the Metropolitan Police shall assist the Secret Service and the Secret Service Uniformed Division on a non-reimbursable basis in carrying out their protective duties under sections 3056 and 3056A of title 18.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/934">96 Stat. 934</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/177/tVI">Pub. L. 109–177, title VI</span>, § 605(d)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-03-09">Mar. 9, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/255">120 Stat. 255</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd4e7f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stII/ch15/schIV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">SUBCHAPTER IV—</span><span itemtype="heading">CLOSING ACCOUNTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e7f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551"><span itemtype="num" value="1551">§ 1551.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions; applicability of subchapter</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this subchapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> An obligated balance of an appropriation account as of the end of a fiscal year is the amount of unliquidated obligations applicable to the appropriation less amounts collectible as repayments to the appropriation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An unobligated balance is the difference between the obligated balance and the total unexpended balance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A fixed appropriation account is an appropriation account available for obligation for a definite period.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The limitations on the availability for expenditure
