prescribed in this subchapter apply to all appropriations unless specifically otherwise authorized by a law that specifically—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> identifies the appropriate account for which the availability for expenditure is to be extended;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> provides that such account shall be available for recording, adjusting, and liquidating obligations properly chargeable to that account; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> extends the availability for expenditure of the obligated balances.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e7fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subchapter does not apply to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> appropriations for the District of Columbia government; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e7fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1551/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> appropriations to be disbursed by the Secretary of the Senate or the Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/935">96 Stat. 935</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1676">104 Stat. 1676</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/484/dA/tX">Pub. L. 102–484, div. A, title X</span>, § 1054(e)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-23">Oct. 23, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/2503">106 Stat. 2503</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/186/tII">Pub. L. 104–186, title II</span>, § 219(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-08-20">Aug. 20, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1748">110 Stat. 1748</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e804-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1552"><span itemtype="num" value="1552">§ 1552.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Procedure for appropriation accounts available for definite periods</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e805-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1552/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> On September 30th of the 5th fiscal year after the period of availability for obligation of a fixed appropriation account ends, the account shall be closed and any remaining balance (whether obligated or unobligated) in the account shall be canceled and thereafter shall not be available for obligation or expenditure for any purpose.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e806-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1552/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Collections authorized or required to be credited to an appropriation account, but not received before closing of the account under subsection (a) or under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1555"/>section 1555 of this title shall be deposited in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/935">96 Stat. 935</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1676">104 Stat. 1676</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e80d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553"><span itemtype="num" value="1553">§ 1553.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of appropriation accounts to pay obligations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e80e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> After the end of the period of availability for obligation of a fixed appropriation account and before the closing of that account under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1552/a"/>section 1552(a) of this title, the account shall retain its fiscal-year identity and remain available for recording, adjusting, and liquidating obligations properly chargeable to that account.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e80f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e810-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Subject to the provisions of paragraph (2), after the closing of an account under section 1552(a) or 1555 of this title, obligations and adjustments to obligations that would have been properly chargeable to that account, both as to purpose and in amount, before closing and that are not otherwise chargeable to any current appropriation account of the agency may be charged to any current appropriation account of the agency available for the same purpose.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e811-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The total amount of charges to an account under paragraph (1) may not exceed an amount equal to 1 percent of the total appropriations for that account.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e812-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e813-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> In the case of a fixed appropriation account with respect to which the period of availability for obligation has ended, if an obligation of funds from that account to provide funds for a program, project, or activity to cover amounts required for contract changes would cause the total amount of obligations from that appropriation during a fiscal year for contract changes for that program, project, or activity to exceed $4,000,000, the obligation may only be made if the obligation is approved by the head of the agency (or an officer of the agency within the Office of the head of the agency to whom the head of the agency has delegated the authority to approve such an obligation).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e814-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In the case of a fixed appropriation account with respect to which the period of availability for obligation has ended, if an obligation of funds from that account to provide funds for a program, project, or activity to cover amounts required for contract changes would cause the total amount obligated from that appropriation during a fiscal year for that program, project, or activity to exceed $25,000,000, the obligation may not be made until—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e815-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the head of the agency submits to the appropriate authorizing committees of Congress and the Committees on Appropriations of the Senate and the House of Representatives a notice in writing of the intent to obligate such funds, together with a description of the legal basis for the proposed obligation and the policy reasons for the proposed obligation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e816-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a period of 30 days has elapsed after the notice is submitted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e817-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> In this subsection, the term “contract change” means a change to a contract under which the contractor is required to perform additional work. Such term does not include adjustments to pay claims or increases under an escalation clause.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e818-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e819-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Obligations under this section may be paid without prior action of the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e81a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subchapter does not—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e81b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> relieve the Comptroller General of the duty to make decisions requested under law; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e81c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1553/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> affect the authority of the Comptroller General to settle claims and accounts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/936">96 Stat. 936</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1676">104 Stat. 1676</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e822-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554"><span itemtype="num" value="1554">§ 1554.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audit, control, and reporting</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e823-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Any audit requirement, limitation on obligations, or reporting requirement that is applicable to an appropriation account shall remain applicable to that account after the end of the period of availability for obligation of that account.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e824-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e825-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> After the close of each fiscal year, the head of each agency shall submit to the President and the Secretary of the Treasury a report regarding the unliquidated obligations, unobligated balances, canceled balances, and adjustments made to appropriation accounts of that agency during the completed fiscal year. The report shall be submitted no later than 15 days after the date on which the President’s budget for the next fiscal year is submitted to Congress under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105"/>section 1105 of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e826-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each report required by this subsection shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e827-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> provide a description, with reference to the fiscal year of appropriations, of the amount in each account, its source, and an itemization of the appropriations accounts;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e828-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> describe all current and expired appropriations accounts;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e829-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> describe any payments made under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1553"/>section 1553 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e82a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> describe any adjustment of obligations during that fiscal year pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1553"/>section 1553 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e82b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> contain a certification by the head of the agency that the obligated balances in each appropriation account of the agency reflect proper existing obligations and that expenditures from the account since the preceding review were supported by a proper obligation of funds and otherwise were proper;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e82c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> describe all balances canceled under sections 1552 and 1555 of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e82d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The head of each Federal agency shall provide a copy of each such report to the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Appropriations, the Committee on Governmental Affairs, and other appropriate oversight and authorizing committees of the Senate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e82e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1554/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The head of each agency shall establish internal controls to assure that an adequate review of obligated balances is performed to support the certification required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1108/c"/>section 1108(c) of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/936">96 Stat. 936</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1677">104 Stat. 1677</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/190/dA/tX">Pub. L. 102–190, div. A, title X</span>, § 1004(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1991-12-05">Dec. 5, 1991</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/105/1457">105 Stat. 1457</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e836-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1555"><span itemtype="num" value="1555">§ 1555.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Closing of appropriation accounts available for indefinite periods</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>An appropriation account available for obligation for an indefinite period shall be closed, and any remaining balance (whether obligated or unobligated) in that account shall be canceled and thereafter shall not be available for obligation or expenditure for any purpose, if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e837-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1555/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the head of the agency concerned or the President determines that the purposes for which the appropriation was made have been carried out; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e838-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1555/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> no disbursement has been made against the appropriation for two consecutive fiscal years.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/937">96 Stat. 937</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1678">104 Stat. 1678</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e83e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1556"><span itemtype="num" value="1556">§ 1556.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Comptroller General: reports on appropriation accounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e83f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1556/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In carrying out audit responsibilities, the Comptroller General shall report on operations under this subchapter to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e840-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1556/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the head of the agency concerned;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e841-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1556/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Secretary of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e842-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1556/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the President.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e843-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1556/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A report under this section shall include an appraisal of unpaid obligations under fixed appropriation accounts for which the period of availability for obligation has ended.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/937">96 Stat. 937</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1678">104 Stat. 1678</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e849-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1557"><span itemtype="num" value="1557">§ 1557.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority for exemptions in appropriation laws</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">A provision of an appropriation law may exempt an appropriation from the provisions of this subchapter and fix the period for which the appropriation remains available for expenditure.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/937">96 Stat. 937</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/510/dA/tXIV">Pub. L. 101–510, div. A, title XIV</span>, § 1405(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1679">104 Stat. 1679</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e84f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558"><span itemtype="num" value="1558">§ 1558.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of funds following resolution of a formal protest or other challenge</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e850-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1552"/>section 1552 of this title or any other provision of law, funds available to an agency for obligation for a contract at the time a protest or other action referred to in subsection (b) is filed in connection with a solicitation for, proposed award of, or award of such contract shall remain available for obligation for 100 days after the date on which the final ruling is made on the protest or other action. A ruling is considered final on the date on which the time allowed for filing an appeal or request for reconsideration has expired, or the date on which a decision is rendered on such an appeal or request, whichever is later.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e851-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subsection (a) applies with respect to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e852-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> any protest filed under subchapter V of chapter 35 of this title; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e853-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> an action commenced under administrative procedures or for a judicial remedy if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd4e854-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the action involves a challenge to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd4e855-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a solicitation for a contract;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd4e856-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> a proposed award of a contract;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd4e857-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> an award of a contract; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd4e858-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the eligibility of an offeror or potential offeror for a contract or of the contractor awarded the contract; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd4e859-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s1558/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> commencement of the action delays or prevents an executive agency from making an award of a contract or proceeding with a procurement.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/189/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 101–189, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 813(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-11-29">Nov. 29, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/1494">103 Stat. 1494</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dE/tLV">Pub. L. 104–106, div. E, title LV</span>, § 5502(a), (b), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/698">110 Stat. 698</span>, 699.)</p><p itemtype="subtitle" style="-uslm-lc:I52" id="id0fd4e85e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBTITLE III—</span><span itemtype="heading">FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd4e863-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch31"><span itemtype="num" value="31">CHAPTER 31—</span><span itemtype="heading">PUBLIC DEBT</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fd4e868-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch31/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">BORROWING AUTHORITY</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd4e869-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101"><span itemtype="num" value="3101">§ 3101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Public debt limit</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e86a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, the current redemption value of an obligation issued on a discount basis and redeemable before maturity at the option of its holder is deemed to be the face amount of the obligation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e86b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The face amount of obligations issued under this chapter and the face amount of obligations whose principal and interest are guaranteed by the United States Government (except guaranteed obligations held by the Secretary of the Treasury) may not be more than $14,294,000,000,000, outstanding at one time, subject to changes periodically made in that amount as provided by law through the congressional budget process described in Rule XLIX <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002032"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002032"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Rules of the House of Representatives or as provided by section 3101A or otherwise.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd4e86c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this section, the face amount, for any month, of any obligation issued on a discount basis that is not redeemable before maturity at the option of the holder of the obligation is an amount equal to the sum of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e86d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the original issue price of the obligation, plus<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd4e86e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the portion of the discount on the obligation attributable to periods before the beginning of such month (as determined under the principles of section 1272(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 without regard to any exceptions contained in paragraph (2) of such section).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/938">96 Stat. 938</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/34">Pub. L. 98–34</span>, § 1(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-05-26">May 26, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/196">97 Stat. 196</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/161">Pub. L. 98–161</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-21">Nov. 21, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1012">97 Stat. 1012</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/342">Pub. L. 98–342</span>, § 1(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-06">July 6, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/313">98 Stat. 313</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/475">Pub. L. 98–475</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-13">Oct. 13, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2206">98 Stat. 2206</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/177">Pub. L. 99–177</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1985-12-12">Dec. 12, 1985</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/1037">99 Stat. 1037</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/384">Pub. L. 99–384</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-08-21">Aug. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/818">100 Stat. 818</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/119">Pub. L. 100–119</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1987-09-29">Sept. 29, 1987</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/754">101 Stat. 754</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/72">Pub. L. 101–72</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1989-08-07">Aug. 7, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/182">103 Stat. 182</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/140">Pub. L. 101–140</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1989-11-08">Nov. 8, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/830">103 Stat. 830</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/508/tXI">Pub. L. 101–508, title XI</span>, § 11901[(a)], <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1388-560">104 Stat. 1388–560</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/66/tXIII">Pub. L. 103–66, title XIII</span>, § 13411(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-08-10">Aug. 10, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/565">107 Stat. 565</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/121/tIII">Pub. L. 104–121, title III</span>, § 301, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-03-29">Mar. 29, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/875">110 Stat. 875</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/33/tV">Pub. L. 105–33, title V</span>, § 5701, <span itemtype="date" date="1997-08-05">Aug. 5, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/648">111 Stat. 648</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/199">Pub. L. 107–199</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="2002-06-28">June 28, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/734">116 Stat. 734</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/24">Pub. L. 108–24</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="2003-05-27">May 27, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/710">117 Stat. 710</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/415">Pub. L. 108–415</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="2004-11-19">Nov. 19, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/2337">118 Stat. 2337</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/182">Pub. L. 109–182</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="2006-03-20">Mar. 20, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/289">120 Stat. 289</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/91">Pub. L. 110–91</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="2007-09-29">Sept. 29, 2007</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/121/988">121 Stat. 988</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/289/dC/tIII">Pub. L. 110–289, div. C, title III</span>, § 3083, <span itemtype="date" date="2008-07-30">July 30, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/2908">122 Stat. 2908</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/343/dA/tI">Pub. L. 110–343, div. A, title I</span>, § 122, <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-03">Oct. 3, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3790">122 Stat. 3790</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/5/dB/tI">Pub. L. 111–5, div. B, title I</span>, § 1604, <span itemtype="date" date="2009-02-17">Feb. 17, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/366">123 Stat. 366</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/123">Pub. L. 111–123</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="2009-12-28">Dec. 28, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/3483">123 Stat. 3483</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/139">Pub. L. 111–139</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="2010-02-12">Feb. 12, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/8">124 Stat. 8</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/25/tIII">Pub. L. 112–25, title III</span>, § 301(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-08-02">Aug. 2, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/125/251">125 Stat. 251</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd9a26d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A"><span itemtype="num" value="3101A">§ 3101A.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Presidential modification of the debt ceiling</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a26e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> In General.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a26f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> $900 billion.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a270-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Certification</span>.—</span></p>If, not later than <p itemtype="date" date="2011-12-31"/>December 31, 2011, the President submits a written certification to Congress that the President has determined that the debt subject to limit is within $100,000,000,000 of the limit in section 3101(b) and that further borrowing is required to meet existing commitments, the Secretary of the Treasury may exercise authority to borrow an additional $900,000,000,000, subject to the enactment of a joint resolution of disapproval enacted pursuant to this section. Upon submission of such certification, the limit on debt provided in section 3101(b) (referred to in this section as the “debt limit”) is increased by $400,000,000,000.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a271-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Resolution of disapproval</span>.—</span></p>Congress may consider a joint resolution of disapproval of the authority under subparagraph (A) as provided in subsections (b) through (f). The joint resolution of disapproval considered under this section shall contain only the language provided in subsection (b)(2). If the time for disapproval has lapsed without enactment of a joint resolution of disapproval under this section, the debt limit is increased by an additional $500,000,000,000.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a272-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Additional amount.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a273-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Certification</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If, after the debt limit is increased by $900,000,000,000 under paragraph (1), the President submits a written certification to Congress that the President has determined that the debt subject to limit is within $100,000,000,000 of the limit in section 3101(b) and that further borrowing is required to meet existing commitments, the Secretary of the Treasury may, subject to the enactment of a joint resolution of disapproval enacted pursuant to this section, exercise authority to borrow an additional amount equal to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd9a274-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> $1,200,000,000,000, unless clause (ii) or (iii) applies;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd9a275-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> $1,500,000,000,000 if the Archivist of the United States has submitted to the States for their ratification a proposed amendment to the Constitution of the United States pursuant to a joint resolution entitled “Joint resolution proposing a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution of the United States”; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fd9a276-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> if a joint committee bill to achieve an amount greater than $1,200,000,000,000 in deficit reduction as provided in section 401(b)(3)(B)(i)(II) of the Budget Control Act of 2011 is enacted, an amount equal to the amount of that deficit reduction, but not greater than $1,500,000,000,000, unless clause (ii) applies.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a277-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Resolution of disapproval</span>.—</span></p>Congress may consider a joint resolution of disapproval of the authority under subparagraph (A) as provided in subsections (b) through (f). The joint resolution of disapproval considered under this section shall contain only the language provided in subsection (b)(2). If the time for disapproval has lapsed without enactment of a joint resolution of disapproval under this section, the debt limit is increased by the amount authorized under subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a278-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Joint Resolution of Disapproval.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a279-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except for the $400,000,000,000 increase in the debt limit provided by subsection (a)(1)(A), the debt limit may not be raised under this section if, within 50 calendar days after the date on which Congress receives a certification described in subsection (a)(1) or within 15 calendar days after Congress receives the certification described in subsection (a)(2) (regardless of whether Congress is in session), there is enacted into law a joint resolution disapproving the President’s exercise of authority with respect to such additional amount.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a27a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents of joint resolution</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For the purpose of this section, the term “joint resolution” means only a joint resolution—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a27b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a27c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> for the certification described in subsection (a)(1), that is introduced on September 6, 7, 8, or 9, 2011 (or, if the Senate was not in session, the next calendar day on which the Senate is in session); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a27d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> for the certification described in subsection (a)(2), that is introduced between the date the certification is received and 3 calendar days after that date;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a27e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> which does not have a preamble;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a27f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the title of which is only as follows: “Joint resolution relating to the disapproval of the President’s exercise of authority to increase the debt limit, as submitted under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3101A"/>section 3101A of title 31, United States Code, on ______” (with the blank containing the date of such submission); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a280-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the matter after the resolving clause of which is only as follows: “That Congress disapproves of the President’s exercise of authority to increase the debt limit, as exercised pursuant to the certification under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/a"/>section 3101A(a) of title 31, United States Code.”.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a281-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Expedited Consideration in House of Representatives.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a282-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reconvening</span>.—</span></p>Upon receipt of a certification described in subsection (a)(2), the Speaker, if the House would otherwise be adjourned, shall notify the Members of the House that, pursuant to this section, the House shall convene not later than the second calendar day after receipt of such certification.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a283-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reporting and discharge</span>.—</span></p>Any committee of the House of Representatives to which a joint resolution is referred shall report it to the House without amendment not later than 5 calendar days after the date of introduction of a joint resolution described in subsection (a). If a committee fails to report the joint resolution within that period, the committee shall be discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and the joint resolution shall be referred to the appropriate calendar.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a284-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Proceeding to consideration</span>.—</span></p>After each committee authorized to consider a joint resolution reports it to the House or has been discharged from its consideration, it shall be in order, not later than the sixth day after introduction of a joint resolution under subsection (a), to move to proceed to consider the joint resolution in the House. All points of order against the motion are waived. Such a motion shall not be in order after the House has disposed of a motion to proceed on a joint resolution addressing a particular submission. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the motion to its adoption without intervening motion. The motion shall not be debatable. A motion to reconsider the vote by which the motion is disposed of shall not be in order.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a285-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consideration</span>.—</span></p>The joint resolution shall be considered as read. All points of order against the joint resolution and against its consideration are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the joint resolution to its passage without intervening motion except two hours of debate equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent. A motion to reconsider the vote on passage of the joint resolution shall not be in order.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a286-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Expedited Procedure in Senate.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a287-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reconvening</span>.—</span></p>Upon receipt of a certification under subsection (a)(2), if the Senate has adjourned or recessed for more than 2 days, the majority leader of the Senate, after consultation with the minority leader of the Senate, shall notify the Members of the Senate that, pursuant to this section, the Senate shall convene not later than the second calendar day after receipt of such message.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a288-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Placement on calendar</span>.—</span></p>Upon introduction in the Senate, the joint resolution shall be immediately placed on the calendar.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a289-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Floor consideration.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a28a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding Rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, it is in order at any time during the period beginning on the day after the date on which Congress receives a certification under subsection (a) and, for the certification described in subsection (a)(1), ending on <p itemtype="date" date="2011-09-14"/>September 14, 2011, and for the certification described in subsection (a)(2), on the 6th day after the date on which Congress receives a certification under subsection (a) (even though a previous motion to the same effect has been disagreed to) to move to proceed to the consideration of the joint resolution, and all points of order against the joint resolution (and against consideration of the joint resolution) are waived. The motion to proceed is not debatable. The motion is not subject to a motion to postpone. A motion to reconsider the vote by which the motion is agreed to or disagreed to shall not be in order. If a motion to proceed to the consideration of the resolution is agreed to, the joint resolution shall remain the unfinished business until disposed of.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a28b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consideration</span>.—</span></p>Consideration of the joint resolution, and on all debatable motions and appeals in connection therewith, shall be limited to not more than 10 hours, which shall be divided equally between the majority and minority leaders or their designees. A motion further to limit debate is in order and not debatable. An amendment to, or a motion to postpone, or a motion to proceed to the consideration of other business, or a motion to recommit the joint resolution is not in order.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a28c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Vote on passage</span>.—</span></p>If the Senate has voted to proceed to a joint resolution, the vote on passage of the joint resolution shall occur immediately following the conclusion of consideration of the joint resolution, and a single quorum call at the conclusion of the debate if requested in accordance with the rules of the Senate.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a28d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/d/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rulings of the chair on procedure</span>.—</span></p>Appeals from the decisions of the Chair relating to the application of the rules of the Senate, as the case may be, to the procedure relating to a joint resolution shall be decided without debate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a28e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Amendment Not in Order</span>.—</span></p>A joint resolution of disapproval considered pursuant to this section shall not be subject to amendment in either the House of Representatives or the Senate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a28f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Coordination With Action by Other House.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a290-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If, before passing the joint resolution, one House receives from the other a joint resolution—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a291-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the joint resolution of the other House shall not be referred to a committee; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fd9a292-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the procedure in the receiving House shall be the same as if no joint resolution had been received from the other House until the vote on passage, when the joint resolution received from the other House shall supplant the joint resolution of the receiving House.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a293-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment of joint resolution of other house</span>.—</span></p>If the Senate fails to introduce or consider a joint resolution under this section, the joint resolution of the House shall be entitled to expedited floor procedures under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a294-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment of companion measures</span>.—</span></p>If, following passage of the joint resolution in the Senate, the Senate then receives the companion measure from the House of Representatives, the companion measure shall not be debatable.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a295-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consideration after passage</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a296-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> If Congress passes a joint resolution, the period beginning on the date the President is presented with the joint resolution and ending on the date the President signs, allows to become law without his signature, or vetoes and returns the joint resolution (but excluding days when either House is not in session) shall be disregarded in computing the appropriate calendar day period described in subsection (b)(1).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a297-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Debate on a veto message in the Senate under this section shall be 1 hour equally divided between the majority and minority leaders or their designees.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a298-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Veto override</span>.—</span></p>If within the appropriate calendar day period described in subsection (b)(1), Congress overrides a veto of the joint resolution with respect to authority exercised pursuant to paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (a), the limit on debt provided in section 3101(b) shall not be raised, except for the $400,000,000,000 increase in the limit provided by subsection (a)(1)(A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a299-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sequestration</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a29a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> If within the 50-calendar day period described in subsection (b)(1), the President signs the joint resolution, the President allows the joint resolution to become law without his signature, or Congress overrides a veto of the joint resolution with respect to authority exercised pursuant to paragraph (1) of subsection (a), there shall be a sequestration to reduce spending by $400,000,000,000. OMB shall implement the sequestration forthwith.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a29b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/f/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> OMB shall implement each half of such sequestration in accordance with section 255, section 256, and subsections (c), (d), (e), and (f) of section 253 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985, and for the purpose of such implementation the term “excess deficit” means the amount specified in subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a29c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rules of House of Representatives and Senate</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>This subsection and subsections (b), (c), (d), (e), and (f) (other than paragraph (6)) are enacted by Congress—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a29d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the Senate and House of Representatives, respectively, and as such it is deemed a part of the rules of each House, respectively, but applicable only with respect to the procedure to be followed in that House in the case of a joint resolution, and it supersedes other rules only to the extent that it is inconsistent with such rules; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a29e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3101A/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> with full recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change the rules (so far as relating to the procedure of that House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in the case of any other rule of that House.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/25/tIII">Pub. L. 112–25, title III</span>, § 301(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-08-02">Aug. 2, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/125/251">125 Stat. 251</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fd9a2a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102"><span itemtype="num" value="3102">§ 3102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Bonds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may borrow on the credit of the United States Government amounts necessary for expenditures authorized by law and may issue bonds of the Government for the amounts borrowed and may buy, redeem, and make refunds under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3111"/>section 3111 of this title. The Secretary may issue bonds authorized by this section to the public and to Government accounts at any annual interest rate and prescribe conditions under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3121"/>section 3121 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary shall offer the bonds authorized under this section first as a popular loan under regulations of the Secretary that allow the people of the United States as nearly as possible an equal opportunity to participate in subscribing to the offered bonds. However, the bonds may be offered in a way other than as a popular loan when the Secretary decides the other way is in the public interest.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When the Secretary decides it is in the public interest in making a bond offering under this section, the Secretary may—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a2a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> make full allotments on receiving applications for smaller amounts of bonds to subscribers applying before the closing date the Secretary sets for filing applications;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a2a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> reject or reduce allotments on receiving applications filed after the closing date or for larger amounts;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a2a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> reject or reduce allotments on receiving applications from incorporated banks and trust companies for their own account and make full allotments or increase allotments to other subscribers; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fd9a2aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> prescribe a graduated scale of allotments.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary shall prescribe regulations applying to all popular loan subscribers similarly situated governing a reduction or increase of an allotment under paragraph (1) of this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary may make special arrangements for subscriptions from members of the armed forces. However, bonds issued to those members must be the same as other bonds of the same issue.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fd9a2ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3102/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Secretary may dispose of any part of a bond offering not taken and may prescribe the price and way of disposition.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/938">96 Stat. 938</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(5), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2467">96 Stat. 2467</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/34">Pub. L. 98–34</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-05-26">May 26, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/196">97 Stat. 196</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/302">Pub. L. 98–302</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1984-05-25">May 25, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/217">98 Stat. 217</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/272/tXIII">Pub. L. 99–272, title XIII</span>, § 13212, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-04-07">Apr. 7, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/325">100 Stat. 325</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/203/tIX">Pub. L. 100–203, title IX</span>, § 9403, <span itemtype="date" date="1987-12-22">Dec. 22, 1987</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/1330-377">101 Stat. 1330–377</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/647/tVI">Pub. L. 100–647, title VI</span>, § 6301, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-11-10">Nov. 10, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/3755">102 Stat. 3755</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3103"><span itemtype="num" value="3103">§ 3103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Notes</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3103/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may borrow on the credit of the United States Government amounts necessary for expenditures authorized by law and may issue notes of the Government for the amounts borrowed and may buy, redeem, and make refunds under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3111"/>section 3111 of this title. The Secretary may prescribe conditions under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3121"/>section 3121 of this title. Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/5"/>section 3121(a)(5) of this title, the payment date of each series of notes issued shall be at least one year but not more than 10 years from the date of issue.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3103/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Government may redeem any part of a series of notes before maturity by giving at least 4 months’ notice but not more than one year’s notice.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3103/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The holder of a note of one series issued under this section with the same issue date as another series of notes issued under this section may convert, at par value, a note of the holder for a note of the other series.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/939">96 Stat. 939</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3104"><span itemtype="num" value="3104">§ 3104.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Certificates of indebtedness and Treasury bills</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3104/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury may borrow on the credit of the United States Government amounts necessary for expenditures authorized by law and may buy, redeem, and make refunds under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3111">section 3111 of this title</span>. For amounts borrowed, the Secretary may issue—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3104/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> certificates of indebtedness of the Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3104/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Treasury bills of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3104/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary may prescribe conditions for issuing certificates of indebtedness and Treasury bills under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3121"/>section 3121 of this title and conditions under which the certificates and bills may be redeemed before maturity. Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/5"/>section 3121(a)(5) of this title, the payment date of certificates of indebtedness and Treasury bills may not be more than one year after the date of issue.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3104/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Treasury bills issued under this section may not be accepted before maturity to pay principal or interest on obligations of governments of foreign countries that are held by the United States Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/939">96 Stat. 939</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105"><span itemtype="num" value="3105">§ 3105.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Savings bonds and savings certificates</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may issue savings bonds and savings certificates of the United States Government and may buy, redeem, and make refunds under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3111"/>section 3111 of this title. Proceeds from the bonds and certificates shall be used for expenditures authorized by law. Savings bonds and certificates may be issued on an interest-bearing basis, on a discount basis, or on an interest-bearing and discount basis. Savings bonds shall mature not more than 20 years from the date of issue. Savings certificates shall mature not more than 10 years from the date of issue. The difference between the price paid and the amount received on redeeming a savings bond or certificate is interest under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> fix the investment yield for savings bonds; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> change the investment yield on an outstanding savings bond, except that the yield on a bond for the period held may not be decreased below the minimum yield for the period guaranteed on the date of issue.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may prescribe regulations providing that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> owners of savings bonds may keep the bonds after maturity or after a period beyond maturity during which the bonds have earned interest and continue to earn interest at rates consistent with paragraph (1) of this subsection; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> savings bonds earning a different rate of interest before the regulations are prescribed shall earn a rate of interest consistent with paragraph (1).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may prescribe for savings bonds and savings certificates issued under this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the form and amount of an issue and series;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the way in which they will be issued;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the conditions, including restrictions on transfer, to which they will be subject;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> conditions governing their redemption;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> their sales price and denominations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> a way to evidence payments for or on account of them and to provide for the exchange of savings certificates for savings bonds; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/c/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> the maximum amount issued in a year that may be held by one person.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may authorize financial institutions to make payments to redeem savings bonds and savings notes. A financial institution may be a paying agent only if the institution—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is incorporated under the laws of the United States, a State, the District of Columbia, or a territory or possession of the United States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in the usual course of business accepts, subject to withdrawal, money for deposit or the purchase of shares;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> is under the supervision of a banking authority of the jurisdiction in which it is incorporated;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> has a regular office to do business; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc13d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> is qualified under regulations prescribed by the Secretary in carrying out this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary may prescribe a way in which a check issued to an individual (except a trust or estate) as a refund for taxes imposed under subtitle A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.) may become a series E savings bond. However, a check may become a bond only if the claim for a refund is filed by the last day prescribed by law for filing the return (determined without any extensions) for the taxable year for which the refund is made. The Secretary may prescribe the time and way in which the check becomes a bond.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3105/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A bond issued under this subsection is deemed to be a series E bond issued under this section, except that the bond shall bear an issue date of the first day of the first month beginning after the close of the taxable year for which the bond is issued. The Secretary also may provide that a bond issued to joint payees may be redeemed by either payee alone.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/940">96 Stat. 940</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(6), (7), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2467">96 Stat. 2467</span>, 2468; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/465/tVII">Pub. L. 103–465, title VII</span>, § 745(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-12-08">Dec. 8, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/5011">108 Stat. 5011</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3106"><span itemtype="num" value="3106">§ 3106.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Retirement and savings bonds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3106/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may issue retirement and savings bonds of the United States Government and may buy, redeem, and make refunds under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3111"/>section 3111 of this title. The proceeds from the bonds shall be used for expenditures authorized by law. Retirement and savings bonds may be issued only on a discount basis. The maturity period of the bonds shall be at least 10 years from the date of issue but not more than 30 years from the date of issue.
