The difference between the price paid and the amount received on redeeming a bond is interest under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3106/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> With the approval of the President, the Secretary may allow owners of retirement and savings bonds to keep the bonds after maturity and continue to earn interest on them at rates that are consistent with the rate of investment yield provided by retirement and savings bonds.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3106/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Section 3105(c)(1)–(5) of this title applies to this section. Sections 3105(c)(6) and (d) and 3126 of this title apply to this section to the extent consistent with this section. The Secretary may prescribe the maximum amount of retirement and savings bonds issued under this section in a year that may be held by one person. However, the maximum amount shall be at least $3,000.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/941">96 Stat. 941</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(8), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2468">96 Stat. 2468</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3107"><span itemtype="num" value="3107">§ 3107.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Increasing interest rates and investment yields on retirement bonds</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may increase by regulation the interest rate or investment yield on an offering of bonds issued under this chapter that are described in sections 405(b) and 409(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s405/b">26 U.S.C. 405(b)</span>, 409(a)), as in effect before the enactment of the Tax Reform Act of 1984. The increased yield shall be for interest accrual periods specified in the regulations so that the interest rate or investment yield on the bonds for those periods is consistent with the interest rate or investment yield on a new offering of those bonds.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/941">96 Stat. 941</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dA/tIV">Pub. L. 98–369, div. A, title IV</span>, § 491(d)(59), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/852">98 Stat. 852</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3108"><span itemtype="num" value="3108">§ 3108.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prohibition against circulation privilege</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An obligation issued under sections 3102–3104(a)(1) and 3105–3107 of this title may not bear the circulation privilege.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/942">96 Stat. 942</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc13f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3109"><span itemtype="num" value="3109">§ 3109.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Tax and loss bonds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3109/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may issue tax and loss bonds of the United States Government and may buy, redeem, and make refunds under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3111"/>section 3111 of this title. The proceeds of the tax and loss bonds shall be used for expenditures authorized by law. Tax and loss bonds are nontransferrable except as provided by the Secretary, bear no interest, and shall be issued in amounts needed to allow persons to comply with section 832(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s832/e"/>26 U.S.C. 832(e)). The Secretary may prescribe the amount of tax and loss bonds and the conditions under which the bonds will be issued as required by section 832(e).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc13fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3109/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> For a taxable year in which amounts are deducted from the mortgage guaranty account referred to in section 832(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s832/e/3"/>26 U.S.C. 832(e)(3)), an amount of tax and loss bonds bought under section 832(e)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s832/e/2"/>26 U.S.C. 832(e)(2)) shall be redeemed for the amount deducted from the account. The amount redeemed shall be applied as necessary to pay taxes due because of the inclusion under section 832(b)(1)(E) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s832/b/1/E"/>26 U.S.C. 832(b)(1)(E)) of amounts in gross income. The Secretary also may prescribe additional ways to redeem the bonds.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/942">96 Stat. 942</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc1400-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3110"><span itemtype="num" value="3110">§ 3110.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Sale of obligations of governments of foreign countries</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc1401-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3110/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may sell obligations of the government of a foreign country when the obligations were acquired under—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc1402-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3110/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the First Liberty Bond Act and matured before <p itemtype="date" date="1947-06-16"/>June 16, 1947;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc1403-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3110/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Second Liberty Bond Act and matured before <p itemtype="date" date="1938-10-16"/>October 16, 1938; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc1404-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3110/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> section 7(a) of the Victory Liberty Loan Act.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc1405-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3110/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary may prescribe the conditions and frequency for receiving payment under obligations of a government of a foreign country acquired under the laws referred to in subsection (a) of this section. A sale of an obligation acquired under those Acts shall at least equal the purchase price and accrued interest. The proceeds of obligations sold under this section and payments received from governments on the principal of their obligations shall be used to redeem or buy (for not more than par value and accrued interest) bonds of the United States Government issued under this chapter. If those bonds cannot be redeemed or bought, the Secretary shall redeem or buy other outstanding interest-bearing obligations of the Government that are subject to redemption or which can be bought at not more than par value and accrued interest.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/942">96 Stat. 942</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc140a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3111"><span itemtype="num" value="3111">§ 3111.</span><span itemtype="heading"> New issue used to buy, redeem, or refund outstanding obligations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An obligation may be issued under this chapter to buy, redeem, or refund, at or before maturity, outstanding bonds, notes, certificates of indebtedness, Treasury bills, or savings certificates of the United States Government. Under regulations of the Secretary of the Treasury, money received from the sale of an obligation and other money in the general fund of the Treasury may be used in making the purchases, redemptions, or refunds.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/942">96 Stat. 942</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fdc140e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112"><span itemtype="num" value="3112">§ 3112.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Sinking fund for retiring and cancelling bonds and notes</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc140f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Department of the Treasury has a sinking fund for retiring bonds and notes issued under this chapter. Amounts in the fund are appropriated for payment of bonds and notes at maturity or for their redemption or purchase before maturity by the Secretary of the Treasury. The fund is available until all the bonds and notes are retired.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc1410-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For each fiscal year, an amount is appropriated equal to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc1411-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the interest that would have been payable during the fiscal year for which the appropriation is made on the bonds and notes bought, redeemed, or paid out of the fund during that or prior years;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc1412-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> 2.5 percent of the total amount of bonds and notes issued under the First Liberty Bond Act, the Second Liberty Bond Act, the Third Liberty Bond Act, the Fourth Liberty Bond Act, and the Victory Liberty Loan Act and outstanding on <p itemtype="date" date="1920-07-01"/>July 1, 1920, less an amount equal to the par amount of obligations of governments of foreign countries that the United States Government held on <p itemtype="date" date="1920-07-01"/>July 1, 1920; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fdc1413-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> 2.5 percent of the total amount expended after <p itemtype="date" date="1933-06-29"/>June 29, 1933, from appropriations made or authorized in sections 301 and 302 of the Emergency Relief and Construction Act of 1932.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fdc1414-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3112/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary may prescribe the price and conditions for paying, redeeming, and buying bonds and notes under this section. The average cost of bonds and notes bought under this section may not be more than par value and accrued interest. Bonds and notes bought, redeemed, or paid out of the sinking fund must be canceled and retired and may not be reissued.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/943">96 Stat. 943</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113"><span itemtype="num" value="3113">§ 3113.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Accepting gifts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To provide the people of the United States with an opportunity to make gifts to the United States Government to be used to reduce the public debt—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the Secretary of the Treasury may accept for the Government a gift of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fde5d0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> money made only on the condition that it be used to reduce the public debt;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fde5d0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an obligation of the Government included in the public debt made only on the condition that the obligation be canceled and retired and not reissued; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fde5d0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> other intangible personal property made only on the condition that the property is sold and the proceeds from the sale used to reduce the public debt; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Administrator of General Services may accept for the Government a gift of tangible property made only on the condition that it be sold and the proceeds from the sale be used to reduce the public debt.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary and the Administrator each may reject a gift under this section when the rejection is in the interest of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d11-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary and the Administrator shall convert a gift either of them accepts under subsection (a)(1)(C) or (2) of this section to money on the best terms available. If a gift accepted under subsection (a) of this section is subject to a gift or inheritance tax, the Secretary or the Administrator may pay the tax out of the proceeds of the gift or the proceeds of the redemption or sale of the gift.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d12-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Treasury has an account into which money received as gifts and proceeds from the sale or redemption of gifts under this section shall be deposited. The Secretary shall use the money in the account to pay at maturity, or to redeem or buy before maturity, an obligation of the Government included in the public debt. An obligation of the Government that is paid, redeemed, or bought with money from the account shall be canceled and retired and may not be reissued. Money deposited in the account is appropriated and may be expended to carry out this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary shall redeem a direct obligation of the Government bearing interest or sold on a discount basis on receiving it when the obligation—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is given to the Government;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> becomes the property of the Government under the conditions of a trust; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d17-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/e/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> is payable on the death of the owner to the Government (or to an officer of the Government in the officer’s official capacity).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d18-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3113/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If the gift or transfer to the Government is subject to a gift or inheritance tax, the Secretary shall pay the tax out of the proceeds of redemption.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/943">96 Stat. 943</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fde5d1c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch31/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">ADMINISTRATIVE</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d1d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121"><span itemtype="num" value="3121">§ 3121.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Procedure</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d1e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In issuing obligations under sections 3102–3104 of this title, the Secretary of the Treasury may prescribe—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d1f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> whether an obligation is to be issued on an interest-bearing basis, a discount basis, or an interest-bearing and discount basis;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d20-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> regulations on the conditions under which the obligation will be offered for sale, including whether it will be offered for sale on a competitive or other basis;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d21-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the offering price and interest rate;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d22-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the method of computing the interest rate;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d23-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> the dates for paying principal and interest;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d24-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> the form and denominations of the obligations; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> other conditions.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Under conditions prescribed by the Secretary, an obligation issued under this chapter and redeemable on demand of the owner or holder may be used to pay the United States Government for taxes imposed by it.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An obligation of the Government issued after <p itemtype="date" date="1971-03-03"/>March 3, 1971, under law may not be redeemed before its maturity to pay a tax imposed by the Government in an amount more than the fair market value of the obligation at the time of its redemption. This paragraph does not apply to a Treasury bill issued under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3104"/>section 3104 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Under conditions prescribed by the Secretary, an obligation authorized by this chapter may be issued in exchange for an obligation of an agency whose principal and interest are unconditionally guaranteed by the Government at or before maturity.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Under conditions prescribed by the Secretary, the Secretary may issue registered bonds in exchange for and instead of coupon bonds that have been or may be issued. The registered bonds shall be similar in all respects to the registered bonds issued under a law authorizing the issue of coupon bonds offered for exchange.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A decision of the Secretary about an issue of obligations under sections 3102–3104 of this title is final.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The Secretary may accept voluntary services in carrying out the sale of public debt obligations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d2d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d2e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this subsection, “registration-required obligation” means an obligation except an obligation—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d2f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/g/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> not of a type offered to the public; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d30-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/g/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> having a maturity (at issue) of not more than one year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Every registration-required obligation of the Government shall be in registered form. A book entry obligation is deemed to be in registered form if the right to principal and stated interest on the obligation may be transferred only through a book entry consistent with regulations of the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Secretary shall prescribe regulations necessary to carry out this subsection when there is a nominee.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary shall prescribe by regulation standards for the safeguarding and use of obligations issued under this chapter, and obligations otherwise issued or guaranteed as to principal or interest by the United States. Such regulations shall apply only to a depository institution that is not a government securities broker or a government securities dealer and that holds such obligations as fiduciary, custodian, or otherwise for the account of a customer and not for its own account. Such regulations shall provide for the adequate segregation of obligations so held, including obligations which are purchased or sold subject to resale or repurchase.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Violation of a regulation prescribed under paragraph (1) shall constitute adequate basis for the issuance of an order under section 5239(a) or (b) of the Revised Statutes (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s93/a"/>12 U.S.C. 93(a) or (b)), section 8(b) or 8(c) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act, section 5(d)(2) or 5(d)(3) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002033"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002033"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Home Owners’ Loan Act of 1933, section 407(e) or 407(f) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002033"/>1 of the National Housing Act, or section 206(e) or 206(f) of the Federal Credit Union Act. Such an order may be issued with respect to a depository institution by its appropriate regulatory agency and with respect to a federally insured credit union by the National Credit Union Administration Board.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to affect in any way the powers of such agencies under any other provision of law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The Secretary shall, prior to adopting regulations under this subsection, determine with respect to each appropriate regulatory agency and the National Credit Union Administration Board, whether its rules and standards adequately meet the purposes of regulations to be promulgated under this subsection, and if the Secretary so determines, shall exempt any depository institution subject to such rules or standards from the regulations promulgated under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> “depository institution” has the meaning stated in clauses (i) through (vi) of section 19(b)(1)(A) of the Federal Reserve Act and also includes a foreign bank, an agency or branch of a foreign bank, and a commercial lending company owned or controlled by a foreign bank (as such terms are defined in the International Banking Act of 1978).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> “government securities broker” has the meaning prescribed in section 3(a)(43) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> “government securities dealer” has the meaning prescribed in section 3(a)(44) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3121/h/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> “appropriate regulatory agency” has the meaning prescribed in section 3(a)(34)(G) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/944">96 Stat. 944</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(9), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2468">96 Stat. 2468</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/571/tII">Pub. L. 99–571, title II</span>, § 201(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-28">Oct. 28, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3222">100 Stat. 3222</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/147/tV">Pub. L. 111–147, title V</span>, § 502(d), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-03-18">Mar. 18, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/108">124 Stat. 108</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3122"><span itemtype="num" value="3122">§ 3122.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Banks and trust companies as depositaries</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3122/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may designate incorporated banks and trust companies as depositaries for any part of proceeds of an obligation issued under this chapter. The Secretary may prescribe the conditions under which deposits may be made under this section, including the interest rate on amounts deposited and security requirements.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3122/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary may designate a bank or trust company that is a depositary under subsection (a) of this section as a fiscal agent of the United States Government in selling and delivering bonds and certificates of indebtedness issued by the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/945">96 Stat. 945</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123"><span itemtype="num" value="3123">§ 3123.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment of obligations and interest on the public debt</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The faith of the United States Government is pledged to pay, in legal tender, principal and interest on the obligations of the Government issued under this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall pay interest due or accrued on the public debt. As the Secretary considers expedient, the Secretary may pay in advance interest on the public debt by a period of not more than one year, with or without a rebate of interest on the coupons.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary may issue a bond, note, or certificate of indebtedness authorized under this chapter whose principal and interest are payable in a foreign currency stated in the bond, note, or certificate. The Secretary may dispose of the bonds, notes, and certificates at a price that is at least par value without complying with section 3102(b)–(d) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> In determining the dollar amount of bonds, notes, and certificates of indebtedness that may be issued under this chapter, the dollar equivalent of the amount of bonds, notes, and certificates payable in a foreign currency is determined by the par of the exchange value on the date of issue of the bonds, notes, or certificates as published by the Secretary under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5151"/>section 5151 of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3123/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Secretary may designate depositaries in foreign countries in which any part of the proceeds of bonds, notes, or certificates of indebtedness payable in the foreign currency may be deposited.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/945">96 Stat. 945</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3124"><span itemtype="num" value="3124">§ 3124.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Exemption from taxation</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3124/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Stocks and obligations of the United States Government are exempt from taxation by a State or political subdivision of a State. The exemption applies to each form of taxation that would require the obligation, the interest on the obligation, or both, to be considered in computing a tax, except—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3124/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a nondiscriminatory franchise tax or another nonproperty tax instead of a franchise tax, imposed on a corporation; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fde5d5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3124/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> an estate or inheritance tax.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3124/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The tax status of interest on obligations and dividends, earnings, or other income from evidences of ownership issued by the Government or an agency and the tax treatment of gain and loss from the disposition of those obligations and evidences of ownership is decided under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.). An obligation that the Federal Housing Administration had agreed, under a contract made before <p itemtype="date" date="1941-03-01"/>March 1, 1941, to issue at a future date, has the tax exemption privileges provided by the authorizing law at the time of the contract. This subsection does not apply to obligations and evidences of ownership issued by the District of Columbia, a territory or possession of the United States, or a department, agency, instrumentality, or political subdivision of the District, territory, or possession.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/945">96 Stat. 945</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3125"><span itemtype="num" value="3125">§ 3125.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Relief for lost, stolen, destroyed, mutilated, or defaced obligations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3125/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In this section, “obligation” means a direct obligation of the United States Government issued under law for valuable consideration, including bonds, notes, certificates of indebtedness, Treasury bills, and interim certificates issued for an obligation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3125/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may provide relief for the loss, theft, destruction, mutilation, or defacement of an obligation identified by number and description.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3125/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3125/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> An indemnity bond is required as a condition of relief if the obligation is payable to bearer or assigned so as to become payable to bearer and is not proven clearly to have been destroyed. The Secretary may prescribe for the indemnity bond the form, amount, and surety or security requirements.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3125/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Relief for interest coupons claimed to have been attached to an obligation may be provided only if the Secretary is satisfied that the coupons have not been paid and are destroyed or will not become the basis of a valid claim against the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/946">96 Stat. 946</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fde5d6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3126"><span itemtype="num" value="3126">§ 3126.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Losses and relief from liability related to redeeming savings bonds and notes</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3126/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury, a loss resulting from a payment related to redeeming a savings bond or savings note shall be replaced out of the fund established by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s17303/a"/>section 17303(a) of title 40. A Federal reserve bank, a paying agent allowed to make payments in redeeming a bond or note, or an officer or employee of the Department of the Treasury is relieved from liability to the United States Government for the loss when the Secretary decides that the loss did not result from the fault or negligence of the bank, paying agent, officer, or employee. The Secretary shall relieve the bank, agent, officer, or employee from liability when the Secretary decides that written notice of liability or potential liability has not been given to the bank, agent, officer, or employee by the Government within 10 years from the date of the erroneous payment. However, the Secretary may not relieve a paying agent of an assumed unconditional liability to the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fde5d6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3126/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s17304/c"/>Section 17304(c) of title 40 applies to a decision of the Secretary made under this section. A recovery or repayment of a loss for which replacement is made out of the fund shall be credited to the fund and is available for the purposes for which the fund was established.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/946">96 Stat. 946</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1299">116 Stat. 1299</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ce73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3127"><span itemtype="num" value="3127">§ 3127.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Credit to officers, employees, and agents for stolen Treasury notes</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">When an officer, employee, or agent of the United States Government authorized to receive, redeem, or cancel Treasury notes receives or pays a note that was stolen and put in circulation after it had been received or redeemed by an officer, employee, or agent authorized to receive or redeem the note, the Secretary of the Treasury may allow the officer, employee, or agent receiving or paying the stolen note a credit for the amount of the note. The Secretary may allow the credit only if the Secretary is satisfied that the note was received or paid in good faith and in exercising ordinary prudence.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/947">96 Stat. 947</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ce77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3128"><span itemtype="num" value="3128">§ 3128.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Proof of death to support payment</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">A finding of death made by an officer or employee of the United States Government authorized by law to make the finding is sufficient proof of death to allow credit in the accounts of a Federal reserve bank or accountable official of the Department of the Treasury in a case involving the transfer, exchange, reissue, redemption, or payment of obligations of the Government, including obligations guaranteed by the Government for which the Secretary of the Treasury acts as transfer agent.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/947">96 Stat. 947</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ce7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3129"><span itemtype="num" value="3129">§ 3129.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Appropriation to pay expenses</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3129/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Amounts to pay necessary expenses (including rent) for an issue of obligations authorized under this chapter are appropriated to the Secretary of the Treasury. However, the amount appropriated under this section may not be more than—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3129/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> .2 percent of the amount of bonds and notes authorized under this chapter;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3129/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> .1 percent of the amount of certificates of indebtedness authorized under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3104"/>section 3104 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3129/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> .1 percent of the amount of certificates of indebtedness authorized under the First Liberty Bond Act.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3129/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An appropriation under this section is available for obligation only through the end of the fiscal year after the fiscal year in which the issue was made. During a period for which an appropriation for a specified amount is made for expenses for which this section makes an appropriation for an unspecified amount, only the appropriation for the specified amount is available for obligation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/947">96 Stat. 947</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ce85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130"><span itemtype="num" value="3130">§ 3130.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annual public debt report</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General Rule</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>On or before June 1 of each calendar year after 1993, the Secretary of the Treasury shall submit a report to the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Finance of the Senate on—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Treasury’s public debt activities, and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the operations of the Federal Financing Bank.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Required Information on Public Debt Activities</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each report submitted under subsection (a) shall include the following information:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A table showing the following information with respect to the total public debt:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The past levels of such debt and the projected levels of such debt as of the close of the current fiscal year and as of the close of the next 5 fiscal years under the most recent current services baseline projection of the executive branch.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The past debt to GDP ratios and the projected debt to GDP ratios as of the close of the current fiscal year and as of the close of the next 5 fiscal years under such most recent current services baseline projection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A table showing the following information with respect to the net public debt:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The past levels of such debt and the projected levels of such debt as of the close of the current fiscal year and as of the close of the next 5 fiscal years under the most recent current services baseline projection of the executive branch.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The past debt to GDP ratios and the projected debt to GDP ratios as of the close of the current fiscal year and as of the close of the next 5 fiscal years under such most recent current services baseline projection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The interest cost on such debt for prior fiscal years and the projected interest cost on such debt for the current fiscal year and for the next 5 fiscal years under such most recent current services baseline projection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The interest cost to outlay ratios for prior fiscal years and the projected interest cost to outlay ratios for the current fiscal year and for the next 5 fiscal years under such most recent current services baseline projection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A table showing the maturity distribution of the net public debt as of the time the report is submitted and for prior years, and an explanation of the overall financing strategy used in determining the distribution of maturities when issuing public debt obligations, including a discussion of the projections and assumptions with respect to the structure of interest rates for the current fiscal year and for the succeeding 5 fiscal years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce93-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A table showing the following information as of the time the report is submitted and for prior years:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce94-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> A description of the various categories of the holders of public debt obligations.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe0ce95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The portions of the total public debt held by each of such categories.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> A table showing the relationship of federally assisted borrowing to total Federal borrowing as of the time the report is submitted and for prior years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> A table showing the annual principal and interest payments which would be required to amortize in equal annual payments the level (as of the time the report is submitted) of the net public debt over the longest remaining term to maturity of any obligation which is a part of such debt.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce98-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Required Information on Federal Financing Bank</span>.—</span></p>Each report submitted under subsection (a) shall include (but not be limited to) information on the financial operations of the Federal Financing Bank, including loan payments and prepayments, and on the levels and categories of the lending activities of the Federal Financing Bank, for the current fiscal year and for prior fiscal years.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce99-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Recommendations</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may include in any report submitted under subsection (a) such recommendations to improve the issuance and sale of public debt obligations (and with respect to other matters) as he may deem advisable.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ce9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce9b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Current fiscal year</span>.—</span></p>The term “current fiscal year” means the fiscal year ending in the calendar year in which the report is submitted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Total public debt</span>.—</span></p>The term “total public debt” means the total amount of the obligations subject to the public debt limit established in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3101"/>section 3101 of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Net public debt</span>.—</span></p>The term “net public debt” means the portion of the total public debt which is held by the public.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Debt to gdp ratio</span>.—</span></p>The term “debt to GDP ratio” means the percentage obtained by dividing the level of the total public debt or net public debt, as the case may be, by the gross domestic product.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ce9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3130/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Interest cost to outlay ratio</span>.—</span></p>The term “interest cost to outlay ratio” means, with respect to any fiscal year, the percentage obtained by dividing the interest cost for such fiscal year on the net public debt by the total amount of Federal outlays for such fiscal year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/202/tII">Pub. L. 103–202, title II</span>, § 201(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-12-17">Dec. 17, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/2355">107 Stat. 2355</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fe0cea1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch33"><span itemtype="num" value="33">CHAPTER 33—</span><span itemtype="heading">DEPOSITING, KEEPING, AND PAYING MONEY</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fe0cea5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch33/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">DEPOSITS AND DEPOSITARIES</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0cea6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301"><span itemtype="num" value="3301">§ 3301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> General duties of the Secretary of the Treasury</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cea7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cea8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> receive and keep public money;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cea9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> take receipts for money paid out by the Secretary;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceaa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> give receipts for money deposited in the Treasury;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> endorse warrants for receipts for money deposited in the Treasury;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> submit the accounts of the Secretary to the Comptroller General every 3 months, or more often if required by the Comptroller General; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cead-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> submit to inspection at any time by the Comptroller General of money in the possession of the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ceae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3301/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Except as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3326"/>section 3326 of this title, an acknowledgment for money deposited in the Treasury is not valid if the Secretary does not endorse a warrant as required by subsection (a)(4) of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/948">96 Stat. 948</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ceb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302"><span itemtype="num" value="3302">§ 3302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Custodians of money</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0ceb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided by another law, an official or agent of the United States Government having custody or possession of public money shall keep the money safe without—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> lending the money;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> using the money;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> depositing the money in a bank; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cebb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> exchanging the money for other amounts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cebc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Except as provided in section 3718(b) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002036"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002036"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of this title, an official or agent of the Government receiving money for the Government from any source shall deposit the money in the Treasury as soon as practicable without deduction for any charge or claim.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cebd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cebe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A person having custody or possession of public money, including a disbursing official having public money not for current expenditure, shall deposit the money without delay in the Treasury or with a depositary designated by the Secretary of the Treasury under law. Except as provided in paragraph (2), money required to be deposited pursuant to this subsection shall be deposited not later than the third day after the custodian receives the money. The Secretary or a depositary receiving a deposit shall issue duplicate receipts for the money deposited. The original receipt is for the Secretary and the duplicate is for the custodian.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cebf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may by regulation prescribe that a person having custody or possession of money required by this subsection to be deposited shall deposit such money during a period of time that is greater or lesser than the period of time specified by the second sentence of paragraph (1).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cec0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> An official or agent not complying with subsection (b) of this section may be removed from office. The official or agent may be required to forfeit to the Government any part of the money held by the official or agent and to which the official or agent may be entitled.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cec1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> An official or agent of the Government having custody or possession of public money shall keep an accurate entry of each amount of public money received, transferred, and paid.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cec2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3302/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> When authorized by the Secretary, an official or agent of the Government having custody or possession of public money, or performing other fiscal agent services, may be allowed necessary expenses to collect, keep, transfer, and pay out public money and to perform those services. However, money appropriated for those expenses may not be used to employ or pay officers and employees of the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/948">96 Stat. 948</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(10), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2468">96 Stat. 2468</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVI">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VI</span>, § 2652(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1152">98 Stat. 1152</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(H), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/429">Pub. L. 103–429</span>, § 7(a)(3)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-31">Oct. 31, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/4388">108 Stat. 4388</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0cecc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3303"><span itemtype="num" value="3303">§ 3303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Designation of depositaries</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cecd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3303/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury designates depositaries of money as provided in this section and under other law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cece-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3303/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> When necessary to carry out the business of the United States Government and under conditions the Secretary decides are necessary, the Secretary may designate depositaries in foreign countries and in territories and possessions of the United States to receive deposits of public money. The Secretary shall give preference to United States financial institutions the Secretary decides are safe and able to give the service required.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/949">96 Stat. 949</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ced2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3304"><span itemtype="num" value="3304">§ 3304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Transfers of public money from depositaries</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Secretary of the Treasury may transfer public money in the possession of a depositary—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ced3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3304/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to the Treasury; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ced4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3304/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> if the Secretary believes the safety of the public money and convenience require it, to another depositary.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/949">96 Stat. 949</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0ced8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3305"><span itemtype="num" value="3305">§ 3305.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audits of depositaries</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Secretary of the Treasury, or an officer, employee, or agent designated by the Secretary, may audit a depositary of public money. For uniformity and accuracy in accounts and safety of public money, an individual conducting an audit shall audit a depositary’s—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ced9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3305/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> books;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0ceda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3305/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> accounts;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cedb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3305/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> returns; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cedc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3305/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> public money on hand and the way the money is kept.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/949">96 Stat. 949</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fe0cee0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch33/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">PAYMENTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe0cee1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321"><span itemtype="num" value="3321">§ 3321.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Disbursing authority in the executive branch</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cee2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Except as provided in this section or another law, only officers and employees of the Department of the Treasury designated by the Secretary of the Treasury as disbursing officials may disburse public money available for expenditure by an executive agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cee3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> For economy and efficiency, the Secretary may delegate the authority to disburse public money to officers and employees of other executive agencies.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cee4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of each of the following executive agencies shall designate personnel of the agency as disbursing officials to disburse public money available for expenditure by the agency:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cee5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> United States Marshal’s Office.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cee6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Department of Defense.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe0cee7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Department of Homeland Security.<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002037"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002037"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> (with respect to public money available for expenditure by the Coast Guard when it is not operating as a service in the Navy).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe0cee8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3321/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> On request of the Secretary and with the approval of the head of an executive agency referred to in subsection (c) of this section, facilities of the agency may be used to assist in disbursing public money available for expenditure by another executive agency.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/949">96 Stat. 949</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tIII">Pub. L. 103–355, title III</span>, § 3067, <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3337">108 Stat. 3337</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tIX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title IX</span>, § 913(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/410">110 Stat. 410</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/201/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–201, div. A, title X</span>, § 1009(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-23">Sept. 23, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2633">110 Stat. 2633</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/241/tIX">Pub. L. 109–241, title IX</span>, § 902(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-07-11">July 11, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/566">120 Stat. 566</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fe58947-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322"><span itemtype="num" value="3322">§ 3322.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Disbursing officials</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe58948-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury shall transfer public money to a disbursing official only by draft or warrant written on the Treasury. Except as provided in section 3716 and <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3720A">section 3720A of this title</span> and subsection (b) of this section, a disbursing official shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe58949-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> deposit public money as required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3302"/>section 3302 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe5894a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> draw public money from the Treasury or a depositary only—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe5894b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> as necessary to make payments; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fe5894c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> payable to persons to whom payment is to be made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fe5894d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In a place without a depositary, the Secretary, on deciding it is essential to the public interest, may authorize specially in writing that public money be—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fe5894e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3322/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> deposited in any other public depositary;
