A, title I</span>, § 101(f) [title VI, § 664], <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-314">110 Stat. 3009–314</span>, 3009–385.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fea4458-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch33/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">MISCELLANEOUS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fea4459-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3341"><span itemtype="num" value="3341">§ 3341.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Sale of Government warrants, checks, drafts, and obligations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea445a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3341/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A disbursing official of the United States Government may sell a Government warrant, check, draft, or obligation not the property of the official at a premium, or dispose of the proceeds of the warrant, check, draft, or obligation, only if the official deposits the premium and the proceeds in the Treasury or with a depositary for the credit of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea445b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3341/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A disbursing official violating subsection (a) of this section shall be dismissed immediately.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/956">96 Stat. 956</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fea445f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342"><span itemtype="num" value="3342">§ 3342.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Check cashing and exchange transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4460-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A disbursing official of the United States Government may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4461-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> cash and negotiate negotiable instruments payable in United States currency or currency of a foreign country;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4462-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> exchange United States currency, coins, and negotiable instruments and currency, coins, and negotiable instruments of foreign countries; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4463-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> cash checks drawn on the Treasury to accommodate United States citizens in a foreign country, but only if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea4464-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> satisfactory banking facilities are not available in the foreign country; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea4465-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a check is presented by the payee who is a United States citizen.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4466-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A disbursing official may act under subsection (a)(1) and (2) of this section only for the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4467-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> An official purpose.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4468-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Personnel of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4469-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A dependent of personnel of the Government, but only—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea446a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> at a United States installation at which adequate banking facilities are not available; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea446b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of negotiation of negotiable instruments, if the dependent’s sponsor authorizes, in writing, the presentation of negotiable instruments to the disbursing official for negotiation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea446c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> A veteran hospitalized or living in an institution operated by an agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea446d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> A contractor, or personnel of a contractor, carrying out a Government project.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea446e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> Personnel of an authorized agency not part of the Government that operates with an agency of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea446f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> A Federal credit union (as defined in section 101(1) of the Federal Credit Union Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1752/1"/>12 U.S.C. 1752(1))) that at the request of the Secretary of Defense is operating on a United States military installation in a foreign country, but only if that country does not permit contractor-operated military banking facilities to operate on such installations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4470-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A member of the military forces of an allied or coalition nation who is participating in a combined operation, combined exercise, or combined humanitarian or peacekeeping mission with the Armed Forces of the United States, but—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea4471-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/8/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> only if—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fea4472-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/8/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> such disbursing official action for members of the military forces of that nation is approved by the senior United States military commander assigned to that operation, exercise, or mission; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fea4473-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/8/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> that nation has guaranteed payment for any deficiency resulting from such disbursing official action; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea4474-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/b/8/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of negotiable instruments, only for a negotiable instrument drawn on a financial institution located in the United States or on a foreign branch of such an institution.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4475-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4476-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> An amount held by the disbursing official that is available for expenditure may be used to carry out subsection (a) of this section with the approval of the head of the agency having jurisdiction over the amount.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4477-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The head of an agency having jurisdiction over a disbursing official may offset, within the same fiscal year, a deficiency resulting from a transaction under subsection (a) of this section with a gain from a transaction under subsection (a). A gain in the account of a disbursing official not used to offset deficiencies under subsection (a) shall be deposited in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4478-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The amount of any deficiency resulting from cashing a check for a dependent under subsection (b)(3), including any charges assessed against the disbursing official by a financial institution for insufficient funds to pay the check, may be offset from the pay of the dependent’s sponsor.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4479-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Amounts necessary to adjust for deficiencies in the account of a disbursing official because of transactions under subsection (a) of this section are authorized to be appropriated.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea447a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury and, with the approval of the Secretary, the head of an agency having jurisdiction over a disbursing official, may issue regulations to carry out this section. However, under conditions the Secretary decides are necessary, the Secretary may delegate to the head of an agency the authority to issue regulations applying to a disbursing official that is an officer or employee of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea447b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Regulations prescribed under subsection (d) shall include regulations that define the terms “dependent” and “sponsor” for the purposes of this section. In the regulations, the term “dependent”, with respect to a member of a uniformed service, shall have the meaning given that term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t37/s401"/>section 401 of title 37.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea447c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> With respect to automated teller machines on naval vessels, the authority of a disbursing official of the United States Government under subsection (a) also includes the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea447d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The authority to provide operating funds to the automated teller machines.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea447e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3342/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The authority to accept, for safekeeping, deposits and transfers of funds made through the automated teller machines.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/957">96 Stat. 957</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title X</span>, § 1090, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/459">110 Stat. 459</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/201/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–201, div. A, title X</span>, § 1011, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-23">Sept. 23, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2635">110 Stat. 2635</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/65/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 106–65, div. A, title III</span>, § 372, <span itemtype="date" date="1999-10-05">Oct. 5, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/580">113 Stat. 580</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/136/dA/tXII">Pub. L. 108–136, div. A, title XII</span>, § 1224, <span itemtype="date" date="2003-11-24">Nov. 24, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/1653">117 Stat. 1653</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fea4483-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343"><span itemtype="num" value="3343">§ 3343.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Check forgery insurance fund</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4484-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Department of the Treasury has a special deposit revolving fund, the “Check Forgery Insurance Fund”. Necessary amounts are hereafter appropriated to the Fund out of any moneys in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, and shall remain available until expended to make the payments required or authorized under this section. The Fund consists of amounts—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4485-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> appropriated to the Fund; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4486-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> received under subsection (d) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea4487-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury shall pay from the Fund to a payee or special endorsee of a check drawn on the Treasury or a depositary designated by the Secretary the amount of the check without interest if in the determination of the Secretary the payee or special endorse <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002041">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002041"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> establishes that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4488-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the check was lost or stolen without the fault of the payee or a holder that is a special endorsee and whose endorsement is necessary for further negotiation;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4489-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the check was negotiated later and paid by the Secretary or a depositary on a forged endorsement of the payee’s or special endorsee’s name; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea448a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the payee or special endorsee has not participated in any part of the proceeds of the negotiation or payment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea448b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1306"/>section 1306 of this title, a check drawn on a designated depositary may be paid in the currency of a foreign country when the appropriate accountable official authorizes payment in that currency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea448c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary shall deposit immediately to the credit of the Fund an amount recovered from a forger or a transferee or party on the check. The Secretary may use amounts in the Fund to reimburse payment certifying or authorizing agencies for any payment that the Secretary determines would otherwise have been payable from the Fund, and may reimburse certifying or authorizing agencies with amounts recovered because of payee nonentitlement. However, currency of a foreign country recovered because of a forged check drawn on a designated depositary shall be credited to the Fund or to the foreign currency fund that was charged when payment was made under subsection (b) of this section to the payee or special endorsee.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea448d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Secretary may waive any provision of this section as may be necessary to ensure that claimants receive timely payments.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea448e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> Under such conditions as the Secretary may prescribe, the Secretary may delegate duties and powers of the Secretary under this section to the head of an agency. Consistent with a delegation from the Secretary under this subsection, the head of an agency may redelegate those duties and powers to officers or employees of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea448f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not relieve—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4490-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a forger from civil or criminal liability; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea4491-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a transferee or party on a check after the forgery from liability—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea4492-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> on the express or implied warranty of prior endorsements of the transferee or party; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea4493-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3343/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to refund amounts to the Secretary.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/957">96 Stat. 957</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(x)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-377">110 Stat. 1321–377</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fea4499-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35"><span itemtype="num" value="35">CHAPTER 35—</span><span itemtype="heading">ACCOUNTING AND COLLECTION</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fea449d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fea449e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3501"><span itemtype="num" value="3501">§ 3501.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definition</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">In this chapter, “executive agency” does not include (except in section 3513) a corporation, agency, or instrumentality subject to chapter 91 of this title.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/959">96 Stat. 959</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/107/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 107–107, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 831(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-12-28">Dec. 28, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/1189">115 Stat. 1189</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/204">Pub. L. 111–204</span>, § 2(h)(6)(B)(ii), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-22">July 22, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/2231">124 Stat. 2231</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fea44a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">ACCOUNTING REQUIREMENTS, SYSTEMS, AND INFORMATION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fea44a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511"><span itemtype="num" value="3511">§ 3511.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prescribing accounting requirements and developing accounting systems</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall prescribe the accounting principles, standards, and requirements that the head of each executive agency shall observe. Before prescribing the principles, standards, and requirements, the Comptroller General shall consult with the Secretary of the Treasury and the President on their accounting, financial reporting, and budgetary needs, and shall consider the needs of the heads of the other executive agencies.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Requirements prescribed under subsection (a) of this section shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> provide for suitable integration between the accounting process of each executive agency and the accounting of the Department of the Treasury;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> allow the head of each agency to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3512"/>section 3512 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> provide a method of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> integrated accounting for the United States Government;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> complete disclosure of the results of the financial operations of each agency and the Government; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/b/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> financial information and control the President and Congress require to carry out their responsibilities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Consistent with subsections (a) and (b) of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the authority of the Comptroller General continues under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s121/b"/>section 121(b) of title 40; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Comptroller General may prescribe the forms, systems, and procedures that the judicial branch of the Government (except the Supreme Court) shall observe.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3511/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Comptroller General, the Secretary, and the President shall conduct a continuous program for improving accounting and financial reporting in the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/959">96 Stat. 959</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(5), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1299">116 Stat. 1299</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fea44b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512"><span itemtype="num" value="3512">§ 3512.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Executive agency accounting and other financial management reports and plans</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall prepare and submit to the appropriate committees of the Congress and make available on the website described under section 1122 a financial management status report and a governmentwide 5-year financial management plan.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A financial management status report under this subsection shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a description and analysis of the status of financial management in the executive branch;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a summary of the most recently completed financial statements—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> of Federal agencies under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3515"/>section 3515 of this title; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> of Government corporations;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a summary of the most recently completed financial statement audits and reports—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> of Federal agencies under section 3521(e) and (f) of this title; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> of Government corporations;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a summary of reports on internal accounting and administrative control systems submitted to the President and the Congress under the amendments made by the Federal Managers’ Financial Integrity Act of 1982 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/255"/>Public Law 97–255);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> a listing of agencies whose financial management systems do not comply substantially with the requirements of Section <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002043"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002043"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> 3(a) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002044"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002044"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> the Federal Financial Management Improvement Act of 1996, and a summary statement of the efforts underway to remedy the noncompliance; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> any other information the Director considers appropriate to fully inform the Congress regarding the financial management of the Federal Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> A governmentwide 5-year financial management plan under this subsection shall describe the activities the Director, the Deputy Director for Management, the Controller of the Office of Federal Financial Management, and agency Chief Financial Officers shall conduct over the next 5 fiscal years to improve the financial management of the Federal Government.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each governmentwide 5-year financial management plan prepared under this subsection shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> describe the existing financial management structure and any changes needed to establish an integrated financial management system;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> be consistent with applicable accounting principles, standards, and requirements;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> provide a strategy for developing and integrating individual agency accounting, financial information, and other financial management systems to ensure adequacy, consistency, and timeliness of financial information;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> identify and make proposals to eliminate duplicative and unnecessary systems, including encouraging agencies to share systems which have sufficient capacity to perform the functions needed;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> identify projects to bring existing systems into compliance with the applicable standards and requirements;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> contain milestones for equipment acquisitions and other actions necessary to implement the 5-year plan consistent with the requirements of this section;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> identify financial management personnel needs and actions to ensure those needs are met;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/viii"><span itemtype="num" value="viii">(viii)</span></p> include a plan for ensuring the annual audit of financial statements of executive agencies pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3521/h"/>section 3521(h) of this title; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/ix"><span itemtype="num" value="ix">(ix)</span></p> estimate the costs of implementing the governmentwide 5-year plan.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Not later than 15 months after the date of the enactment of this subsection, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall submit the first financial management status report and governmentwide 5-year financial management plan under this subsection to the appropriate committees of the Congress.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/4/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Not later than January 31 of each year thereafter, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall submit to the appropriate committees of the Congress a financial management status report and a revised governmentwide 5-year financial management plan to cover the succeeding 5 fiscal years, including a report on the accomplishments of the executive branch in implementing the plan during the preceding fiscal year.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/4/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> The Director shall include with each revised governmentwide 5-year financial management plan a description of any substantive changes in the financial statement audit plan required by paragraph (3)(B)(viii), progress made by executive agencies in implementing the audit plan, and any improvements in Federal Government financial management related to preparation and audit of financial statements of executive agencies.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Not later than 30 days after receiving each annual report under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s902/a/6"/>section 902(a)(6) of this title, the Director shall transmit to the Chairman of the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives and the Chairman of the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate a final copy of that report and any comments on the report by the Director.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of each executive agency shall establish and maintain systems of accounting and internal controls that provide—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> complete disclosure of the financial results of the activities of the agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> adequate financial information the agency needs for management purposes;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> effective control over, and accountability for, assets for which the agency is responsible, including internal audit;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> reliable accounting results that will be the basis for—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> preparing and supporting the budget requests of the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> controlling the carrying out of the agency budget; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fea44df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> providing financial information the President requires under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1104/e"/>section 1104(e) of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> suitable integration of the accounting of the agency with the central accounting and reporting responsibilities of the Secretary of the Treasury under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3513"/>section 3513 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fea44e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To ensure compliance with subsection (b)(3) of this section and consistent with standards the Comptroller General prescribes, the head of each executive agency shall establish internal accounting and administrative controls that reasonably ensure that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> obligations and costs comply with applicable law;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fea44e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> all assets are safeguarded against waste, loss, unauthorized use, and misappropriation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> revenues and expenditures applicable to agency operations are recorded and accounted for properly so that accounts and reliable financial and statistical reports may be prepared and accountability of the assets may be maintained.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Standards the Comptroller General prescribes under this subsection shall include standards to ensure the prompt resolution of all audit findings.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In consultation with the Comptroller General, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> shall establish by <p itemtype="date" date="1982-12-31"/>December 31, 1982, guidelines that the head of each executive agency shall follow in evaluating the internal accounting and administrative control systems of the agency to decide whether the systems comply with subsection (c) of this section; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> may change a guideline when considered necessary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> By December 31 of each year (beginning in 1983), the head of each executive agency, based on an evaluation conducted according to guidelines prescribed under paragraph (1) of this subsection, shall prepare a statement on whether the systems of the agency comply with subsection (c) of this section, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> if the head of an executive agency decides the systems do not comply with subsection (c) of this section, a report identifying any material weakness in the systems and describing the plans and schedule for correcting the weakness; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a separate report on whether the accounting system of the agency conforms to the principles, standards, and requirements the Comptroller General prescribes under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3511/a"/>section 3511(a) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of each executive agency shall sign the statement and reports required by this subsection and submit them to the President and Congress. The statement and reports are available to the public, except that information shall be deleted from a statement or report before it is made available if the information specifically is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> prohibited from disclosure by law; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/d/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> required by Executive order to be kept secret in the interest of national defense or the conduct of foreign affairs.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> To assist in preparing a cost-based budget under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1108/b"/>section 1108(b) of this title and consistent with principles and standards the Comptroller General prescribes, the head of each executive agency shall maintain the accounts of the agency on an accrual basis to show the resources, liabilities, and costs of operations of the agency. An accounting system under this subsection shall include monetary property accounting records.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> cooperate with the head of each executive agency in developing an accounting system for the agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb4f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> approve the system when the Comptroller General considers it to be adequate and in conformity with the principles, standards, and requirements prescribed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3511"/>section 3511 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb4f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3512/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall review the accounting systems of each executive agency. The results of a review shall be available to the head of the executive agency, the Secretary, and the President. The Comptroller General shall report to Congress on a review when the Comptroller General considers it proper.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/959">96 Stat. 959</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(12), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2468">96 Stat. 2468</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tIII">Pub. L. 101–576, title III</span>, § 301(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2847">104 Stat. 2847</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(J), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tI">Pub. A, title I</span>, § 101(f) [title VIII, § 805(b)], <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-314">110 Stat. 3009–314</span>, 3009–392; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/101">Pub. L. 113–101</span>, § 4, <span itemtype="date" date="2014-05-09">May 9, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/1153">128 Stat. 1153</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fecb500-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513"><span itemtype="num" value="3513">§ 3513.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Financial reporting and accounting system</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb501-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall prepare reports that will inform the President, Congress, and the public on the financial operations of the United States Government. The reports shall include financial information the President requires. The head of each executive agency shall give the Secretary reports and information on the financial conditions and operations of the agency the Secretary requires to prepare the reports.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb502-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb503-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> establish facilities necessary to prepare the reports; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb504-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> reorganize the accounting functions and procedures and financial reports of the Department of the Treasury to develop an effective and coordinated system of accounting and financial reporting in the Department that will integrate the accounting results for the Department and be the operating center for consolidating accounting results of other executive agencies with accounting results of the Department.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb505-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb506-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> cooperate with the Secretary in developing and establishing the reporting and accounting system under this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb507-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3513/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> approve the system when the Comptroller General considers it to be adequate and in conformity with the principles, standards, and requirements prescribed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3511"/>section 3511 of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/960">96 Stat. 960</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fecb50b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3514"><span itemtype="num" value="3514">§ 3514.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Discontinuing certain accounts maintained by the Comptroller General</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Comptroller General may discontinue an agency appropriation, expenditure, limitation, receipt, or personal ledger account maintained by the Comptroller General when the Comptroller General believes that the accounting system and internal controls of the agency will allow the Comptroller General to carry out the functions related to the account.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/960">96 Stat. 960</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fecb50f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515"><span itemtype="num" value="3515">§ 3515.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Financial statements of agencies</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb510-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb511-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002045"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002045"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> Except as provided in subsection (e), not later than March 1 of 2003 and each year thereafter, the head of each covered executive agency shall prepare and submit to the Congress and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget an audited financial statement for the preceding fiscal year, covering all accounts and associated activities of each office, bureau, and activity of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb512-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each audited financial statement of a covered executive agency under this section shall reflect—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb513-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the overall financial position of the offices, bureaus, and activities covered by the statement, including assets and liabilities thereof; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb514-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> results of operations of those offices, bureaus, and activities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb515-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall identify components of covered executive agencies that shall be required to have audited financial statements meeting the requirements of subsection (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb516-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall prescribe the form and content of the financial statements of covered executive agencies under this section, consistent with applicable accounting and financial reporting principles, standards, and requirements.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb517-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb518-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget may exempt a covered executive agency, except an agency described in section 901(b), from the requirements of this section with respect to a fiscal year if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb519-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the total amount of budget authority available to the agency for the fiscal year does not exceed $25,000,000; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb51a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Director determines that requiring an annual audited financial statement for the agency with respect to the fiscal year is not warranted due to the absence of risks associated with the agency’s operations, the agency’s demonstrated performance, or other factors that the Director considers relevant.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb51b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Director shall annually notify the Committee on Government Reform of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate of each agency the Director has exempted under this subsection and the reasons for each exemption.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb51c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term “covered executive agency”—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb51d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> means an executive agency that is not required by another provision of Federal law to prepare and submit to the Congress and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget an audited financial statement for each fiscal year, covering all accounts and associated activities of each office, bureau, and activity of the agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb51e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3515/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> does not include a corporation, agency, or instrumentality subject to chapter 91 of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tIII">Pub. L. 101–576, title III</span>, § 303(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2849">104 Stat. 2849</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/356/tIV">Pub. L. 103–356, title IV</span>, § 405(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3415">108 Stat. 3415</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/531">Pub. L. 106–531</span>, § 4(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2000-11-22">Nov. 22, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/2539">114 Stat. 2539</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/289">Pub. L. 107–289</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-11-07">Nov. 7, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/2049">116 Stat. 2049</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fecb527-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516"><span itemtype="num" value="3516">§ 3516.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports consolidation</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb528-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb529-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> With the concurrence of the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, the head of an executive agency may adjust the frequency and due dates of, and consolidate into an annual report to the President, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and Congress any statutorily required reports described in paragraph (2). Such a consolidated report shall be submitted to the President, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and to appropriate committees and subcommittees of Congress not later than 150 days after the end of the agency’s fiscal year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb52a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The following reports may be consolidated into the report referred to in paragraph (1):<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb52b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Any report by an agency to Congress, the Office of Management and Budget, or the President under section 1116, this chapter, and chapters 9, 33, 37, 75, and 91.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb52c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The following agency-specific reports:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fecb52d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> The biennial financial management improvement plan by the Secretary of Defense under section 2222 <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002046"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002046"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of title 10.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fecb52e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> The annual report of the Attorney General under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s522"/>section 522 of title 28.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb52f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Any other statutorily required report pertaining to an agency’s financial or performance management if the head of the agency—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fecb530-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> determines that inclusion of that report will enhance the usefulness of the reported information to decision makers; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fecb531-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/a/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> consults in advance of inclusion of that report with the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate, the Committee on Government Reform of the House of Representatives, and any other committee of Congress having jurisdiction with respect to the report proposed for inclusion.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb532-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A report under subsection (a) that incorporates the agency’s program performance report under section 1116 shall be referred to as a performance and accountability report.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb533-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A report under subsection (a) that does not incorporate the agency’s program performance report under section 1116 shall contain a summary of the most significant portions of the agency’s program performance report, including the agency’s success in achieving key performance goals for the applicable year.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb534-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> A report under subsection (a) shall include a statement prepared by the agency’s inspector general that summarizes what the inspector general considers to be the most serious management and performance challenges facing the agency and briefly assesses the agency’s progress in addressing those challenges. The inspector general shall provide such statement to the agency head at least 30 days before the due date of the report under subsection (a). The agency head may comment on the inspector general’s statement, but may not modify the statement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb535-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A report under subsection (a) shall include a transmittal letter from the agency head containing, in addition to any other content, an assessment by the agency head of the completeness and reliability of the performance and financial data used in the report. The assessment shall describe any material inadequacies in the completeness and reliability of the data, and the actions the agency can take and is taking to resolve such inadequacies.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb536-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of Homeland Security—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb537-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall for each fiscal year submit a performance and accountability report under subsection (a) that incorporates the program performance report under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1116"/>section 1116 of this title for the Department of Homeland Security;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb538-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> shall include in each performance and accountability report an audit opinion of the Department’s internal controls over its financial reporting; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb539-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> shall design and implement Department-wide management controls that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fecb53a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/f/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> reflect the most recent homeland security strategy developed pursuant to section 874(b)(2) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fecb53b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3516/f/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> permit assessment, by the Congress and by managers within the Department, of the Department’s performance in executing such strategy.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/531">Pub. L. 106–531</span>, § 3(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2000-11-22">Nov. 22, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/2537">114 Stat. 2537</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/330">Pub. L. 108–330</span>, § 4(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-16">Oct. 16, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1277">118 Stat. 1277</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0fecb545-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">AUDITING AND SETTLING ACCOUNTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fecb546-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521"><span itemtype="num" value="3521">§ 3521.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audits by agencies</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb547-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Each account of an agency shall be audited administratively before being submitted to the Comptroller General. The head of each agency shall prescribe regulations for conducting the audit and designate a place at which the audit is to be conducted. However, a disbursing official of an executive agency may not administratively audit vouchers for which the official is responsible. With the consent of the Comptroller General, the head of the agency may waive any part of an audit.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb548-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an agency may prescribe a statistical sampling procedure to audit vouchers of the agency when the head of the agency decides economies will result from using the procedure. The Comptroller General—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb549-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may prescribe the maximum amount of a voucher that may be audited under this subsection; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb54a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in reviewing the accounting system of the agency, shall evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of the procedure.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb54b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A disbursing or certifying official acting in good faith under subsection (b) of this section is not liable for a payment or certification of a voucher not audited specifically because of the procedure prescribed under subsection (b) if the official and the head of the agency carry out diligently collection action the Comptroller General prescribes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fecb54c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subsections (b) and (c) of this section do not—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fecb54d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> affect the liability, or authorize the relief, of a payee, beneficiary, or recipient of an illegal, improper, or incorrect payment; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef264e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> relieve a disbursing or certifying official, the head of an agency, or the Comptroller General of responsibility in carrying out collection action against a payee, beneficiary, or recipient.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef264f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each financial statement prepared under section 3515 by an agency shall be audited in accordance with applicable generally accepted government auditing standards—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2650-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> in the case of an agency having an Inspector General appointed under the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.), by the Inspector General or by an independent external auditor, as determined by the Inspector General of the agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2651-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in any other case, by an independent external auditor, as determined by the head of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2652-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> For each audited financial statement required under subsection (a) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3515"/>section 3515 of this title, the person who audits the statement for purpose of subsection (e) of this section shall submit a report on the audit to the head of the agency and the Controller of the Office of Federal Financial Management. A report under this subsection shall be prepared in accordance with generally accepted government auditing standards.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2653-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General of the United States—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2654-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may review any audit of a financial statement conducted under this subsection by an Inspector General or an external auditor;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2655-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> shall report to the Congress, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the head of the agency which prepared the statement, regarding the results of the review and make any recommendation the Comptroller General considers appropriate; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2656-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may audit a financial statement prepared under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3515"/>section 3515 of this title at the discretion of the Comptroller General or at the request of a committee of the Congress.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>An audit the Comptroller General performs under this subsection shall be in lieu of the audit otherwise required by subsection (e) of this section. Prior to performing such audit, the Comptroller General shall consult with the Inspector General of the agency which prepared the statement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2657-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> Each financial statement prepared by an executive agency for a fiscal year after fiscal year 1991 shall be audited in accordance with this section and the plan required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3512/a/3/B/viii"/>section 3512(a)(3)(B)(viii) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2658-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2659-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If the Government Accountability Office audits any financial statement or related schedule which is prepared under section 3515 by an executive agency (or component thereof) for a fiscal year beginning on or after <p itemtype="date" date="2009-10-01"/>October 1, 2009, such executive agency (or component) shall reimburse the Government Accountability Office for the cost of such audit, if the Government Accountability Office audited the statement or schedule of such executive agency (or component) for fiscal year 2007.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef265a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Any executive agency (or component thereof) that prepares a financial statement under section 3515 for a fiscal year beginning on or after <p itemtype="date" date="2009-10-01"/>October 1, 2009, and that requests, with the concurrence of the Inspector General of such agency, the Government Accountability Office to conduct the audit of such statement or any related schedule required by section 3521 may reimburse the Government Accountability Office for the cost of such audit.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef265b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/i/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> For the audits conducted under paragraphs (1) and (2), the Government Accountability Office shall consult prior to the initiation of the audit with the relevant executive agency (or component) and the Inspector General of such agency on the scope, terms, and cost of such audit.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef265c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3521/i/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Any reimbursement under paragraph (1) or (2) shall be deposited to a special account in the Treasury and shall be available to the Government Accountability Office for such purposes and in such amounts as are specified in annual appropriations Acts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/961">96 Stat. 961</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tIII">Pub. L. 101–576, title III</span>, § 304(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2852">104 Stat. 2852</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/356/tIV">Pub. L. 103–356, title IV</span>, § 405(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3416">108 Stat. 3416</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tI">Pub. L. 104–208, div. A, title I</span>, § 101(f) [title VIII, § 805(a)], <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-314">110 Stat. 3009–314</span>, 3009–392; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/531">Pub.
