L. 106–531</span>, § 4(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2000-11-22">Nov. 22, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/2539">114 Stat. 2539</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/323">Pub. L. 110–323</span>, § 6(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-09-22">Sept. 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3547">122 Stat. 3547</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fef2666-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522"><span itemtype="num" value="3522">§ 3522.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Making and submitting accounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2667-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2668-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Unless the Comptroller General decides the public interest requires that an account be made more frequently, each disbursing official shall make a quarterly account. An official or agent of the United States Government receiving public money not authorized to be kept as pay of the official or agent shall make a monthly account of the money.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2669-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An official or agent of the Government receiving public money shall make an account of public money received by the official or agent according to the appropriation from which the money was advanced.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef266a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef266b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A monthly account shall be submitted to the appropriate official in the District of Columbia by the 10th day after the end of the month covered by the account. The official shall submit the account to the Comptroller General by the 20th day after receiving the account.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef266c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An account (except a monthly account) shall be submitted to the appropriate official in the District of Columbia by the 20th day after the end of the period covered by the account. The official shall submit the account to the Comptroller General by the 60th day after receiving the account.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef266d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection, an account of the armed forces shall be submitted to the Comptroller General by the 60th day after the account is received. However, during a war or national emergency and for 18 months after the war or emergency ends, an account shall be submitted to the Comptroller General by the 90th day after the account is received.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef266e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection, an account of a disbursing official of the Department of Justice shall be submitted to the Comptroller General by the 80th day after the account is received.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef266f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> An official shall give evidence of compliance with subsection (b) of this section if an account is not received within a reasonable time after the time required by subsection (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2670-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The head of an agency may require other returns or reports about the agency that the public interest requires.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2671-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2672-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall disapprove a requisition for an advance of money if an account from which the advance is to be made is not submitted to the Comptroller General within the time required by subsection (b) of this section. The Comptroller General may disapprove the request for another reason related to the condition of an account of the official for whom the advance is requested. However, the Secretary of the Treasury may overrule the decision of the Comptroller General on the sufficiency of the other reasons.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2673-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3522/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary may extend the time requirements of subsection (b)(1) and (2) of this section for submitting an account to the proper official in the District of Columbia or waive a condition of delinquency only when there is, or is likely to be, a manifest physical difficulty in complying with those requirements. If an account is not submitted to the Comptroller General on time under subsection (b), an order of the President or, if the President is ill or not in the District of Columbia, the Secretary is required to authorize an advance.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/961">96 Stat. 961</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fef2677-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3523"><span itemtype="num" value="3523">§ 3523.</span><span itemtype="heading"> General audit authority of the Comptroller General</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2678-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3523/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Except as specifically provided by law, the Comptroller General shall audit the financial transactions of each agency. In deciding on auditing procedures and the extent to which records are to be inspected, the Comptroller General shall consider generally accepted auditing principles, including the effectiveness of accounting organizations and systems, internal audit and control, and related administrative practices of each agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2679-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3523/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall audit the Architect of the Capitol at times the Comptroller General considers appropriate. <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s716"/>Section 716 of this title applies to the Architect in conducting the audit. The Comptroller General shall report the results of the audit to Congress. Each report shall be printed as a Senate document.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef267a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3523/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef267b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3523/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> When the Comptroller General decides an audit shall be conducted at a place at which the records of an executive agency or the Architect of the Capitol are usually kept, the Comptroller General may require the head of the agency or the Architect to keep any part of an account of an accountable official or of a record required to be submitted to the Comptroller General. The Comptroller General may require records be kept under conditions and for a period of not more than 10 years specified by the Comptroller General. However, the Comptroller General and the head of the agency or the Architect may agree on a longer period.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef267c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3523/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General and the head of an agency in the legislative or judicial branch of the United States Government (except the Architect) may agree to apply this subsection to the agency.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/962">96 Stat. 962</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fef2681-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524"><span itemtype="num" value="3524">§ 3524.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Auditing expenditures approved without vouchers</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2682-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2683-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General may audit expenditures, accounted for only on the approval, authorization, or certificate of the President or an official of an executive agency, to decide if the expenditure was authorized by law and made. Records and related information shall be made available to the Comptroller General in conducting the audit.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2684-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General may release the results of the audit or disclose related information only to the President or head of the agency, or, if there is an unresolved discrepancy, to the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate, the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives, and the committees of Congress having legislative or appropriation oversight of the expenditure.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2685-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Before December 1 of each year, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall submit a report listing each account that may be subject to this section to the Committees on the Budget and Appropriations of both Houses of Congress, the Committee on Governmental Affairs, and to the Committee on Government Operations, and to the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2686-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The President may exempt from this section a financial transaction about sensitive foreign intelligence or foreign counter-intelligence activities or sensitive law enforcement investigations if an audit would expose the identifying details of an active investigation or endanger investigative or domestic intelligence sources involved in the investigation. The exemption may apply to a class or category of financial transactions.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2687-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2688-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> apply to expenditures under section 102, 103, 105(d)(1), (3), or (5), or 106(b)(2) or (3) of title 3; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2689-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> affect authority under section 8(b) of the Central Intelligence Agency Act of 1949 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t50/s403j/b"/>50 U.S.C. 403j(b)).<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002047"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002047"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef268a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Information about a financial transaction exempt under subsection (c) of this section or a financial transaction under section 8(b) of the Central Intelligence Agency Act of 1949 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t50/s403j/b"/>50 U.S.C. 403j(b)) <p itemtype="sup"/>1 may be reviewed by the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence of the House and the Select Committee on Intelligence of the Senate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef268b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3524/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> Subsections (a)(1) and (d)(1) of this section may be superseded only by a law enacted after <p itemtype="date" date="1980-04-03"/>April 3, 1980, specifically repealing or amending this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/963">96 Stat. 963</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fef2692-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525"><span itemtype="num" value="3525">§ 3525.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Auditing nonappropriated fund activities</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2693-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General may audit—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2694-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the operations and accounts of each nonappropriated fund and related activities authorized or operated by the head of an executive agency to sell goods or services to United States Government personnel and their dependents;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2695-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> accounting systems and internal controls of the fund and related activities; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2696-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> internal or independent audits or reviews of the fund and related activities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef2697-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of each executive agency promptly shall provide the Comptroller General with—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef2698-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a copy of the annual report of a nonappropriated fund and related activities subject to this section when the Comptroller General—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef2699-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> requires a report for a designated class of each fund and related activities having gross sales receipts of more than $100,000 a year; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef269a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> specifically requests a report for another fund and related activities; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef269b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a statement on the yearly financial operations, financial condition, and cash flow and other yearly information about the fund and related activities that the head of the agency and the Comptroller General agree on if the information is not included in the annual report.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef269c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3525/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Records and property of a fund and related activities subject to this section shall be made available to the Comptroller General to the extent the Comptroller General considers necessary.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/963">96 Stat. 963</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fef26a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526"><span itemtype="num" value="3526">§ 3526.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Settlement of accounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall settle all accounts of the United States Government and supervise the recovery of all debts finally certified by the Comptroller General as due the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A decision of the Comptroller General under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3529"/>section 3529 of this title is conclusive on the Comptroller General when settling the account containing the payment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall settle an account of an accountable official within 3 years after the date the Comptroller General receives the account. A copy of the certificate of settlement shall be provided the official.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The settlement of an account is conclusive on the Comptroller General after 3 years after the account is received by the Comptroller General. However, an amount may be charged against the account after the 3-year period when the Government has or may have lost money because the official acted fraudulently or criminally.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A 3-year period under this subsection is suspended during a war.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subsection does not prohibit—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> recovery of public money illegally or erroneously paid;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> recovery from an official of a balance due the Government under a settlement within the 3-year period; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/c/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> an official from clearing an account of questioned items as prescribed by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> On settling an account of the Government, the balance certified by the Comptroller General is conclusive on the executive branch of the Government. On the initiative of the Comptroller General or on request of an individual whose accounts are settled or the head of the agency to which the account relates, the Comptroller General may change the account within a year after settlement. The decision of the Comptroller General to change the account is conclusive on the executive branch.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When an amount of money is expended under law for a treaty or relations with a foreign country, the President may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> authorize the amount to be accounted for each year specifically by settlement of the Comptroller General when the President decides the amount expended may be made public; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> make, or have the Secretary of State make, a certificate of the amount expended if the President decides the amount is not to be accounted for specifically. The certificate is a sufficient voucher for the amount stated in the certificate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall keep all settled accounts, vouchers, certificates, and related papers until they are disposed of as prescribed by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3526/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> This subchapter does not prohibit the Comptroller General from suspending an item in an account to get additional evidence or explanations needed to settle an account.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/964">96 Stat. 964</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fef26b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527"><span itemtype="num" value="3527">§ 3527.</span><span itemtype="heading"> General authority to relieve accountable officials and agents from liability</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, the Comptroller General may relieve a present or former accountable official or agent of an agency responsible for the physical loss or deficiency of public money, vouchers, checks, securities, or records, or may authorize reimbursement from an appropriation or fund available for the activity in which the loss or deficiency occurred for the amount of the loss or deficiency paid by the official or agent as restitution, when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the head of the agency decides that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef26b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the official or agent was carrying out official duties when the loss or deficiency occurred, or the loss or deficiency occurred because of an act or failure to act by a subordinate of the official or agent; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef26b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the loss or deficiency was not the result of fault or negligence by the official or agent;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the loss or deficiency was not the result of an illegal or incorrect payment; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the Comptroller General agrees with the decision of the head of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall relieve an official of the armed forces referred to in subsection (a) responsible for the physical loss or deficiency of public money, vouchers, or records, or a payment described in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/4/A">section 3528(a)(4)(A) of this title</span>, or shall authorize reimbursement, from an appropriation or fund available for reimbursement, of the amount of the loss or deficiency paid by or for the official as restitution, when—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> in the case of a physical loss or deficiency—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef26be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the Secretary of Defense or the appropriate Secretary of the military department of the Department of Defense (or the Secretary of Homeland Security, in the case of a disbursing official of the Coast Guard when the Coast Guard is not operating as a service in the Navy) decides that the official was carrying out official duties when the loss or deficiency occurred;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef26bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the loss or deficiency was not the result of an illegal or incorrect payment; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fef26c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/1/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the loss or deficiency was not the result of fault or negligence by the official; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of a payment described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/4/A"/>section 3528(a)(4)(A) of this title, the Secretary of Defense or the Secretary of the appropriate military department (or the Secretary of Homeland Security, in the case of a disbursing official of the Coast Guard when the Coast Guard is not operating as a service in the Navy), after taking a diligent collection action, finds that the criteria of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1"/>section 3528(b)(1) of this title are satisfied.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The finding of the Secretary involved is conclusive on the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> On the initiative of the Comptroller General or written recommendation of the head of an agency, the Comptroller General may relieve a present or former disbursing official of the agency responsible for a deficiency in an account because of an illegal, improper, or incorrect payment, and credit the account for the deficiency, when the Comptroller General decides that the payment was not the result of bad faith or lack of reasonable care by the official. However, the Comptroller General may deny relief when the Comptroller General decides the head of the agency did not carry out diligently collection action under procedures prescribed by the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When the Comptroller General decides it is necessary to adjust the account of an official or agent granted relief under subsection (a) or (c) of this section, the amount of the relief shall be charged—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to an appropriation specifically provided to be charged; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> if no specific appropriation, to the appropriation or fund available for the expense of the accountable function when the adjustment is carried out.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subsection (c) of this section does not—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> affect the liability, or authorize the relief, of a payee, beneficiary, or recipient of an illegal, improper, or incorrect payment; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fef26ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> relieve an accountable official, the head of an agency, or the Comptroller General of responsibility in carrying out collection action against a payee, beneficiary, or recipient.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fef26cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3527/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Relief provided under this section is in addition to relief provided under another law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/965">96 Stat. 965</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tIX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title IX</span>, § 913(c)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/411">110 Stat. 411</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/201/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–201, div. A, title X</span>, § 1009(c)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-23">Sept. 23, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2635">110 Stat. 2635</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/241/tIX">Pub. L. 109–241, title IX</span>, § 902(b)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-07-11">July 11, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/566">120 Stat. 566</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff170c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528"><span itemtype="num" value="3528">§ 3528.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Responsibilities and relief from liability of certifying officials</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A certifying official certifying a voucher is responsible for—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> information stated in the certificate, voucher, and supporting records;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the computation of a certified voucher under this section and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3325"/>section 3325 of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the legality of a proposed payment under the appropriation or fund involved;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> repaying a payment—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff170c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> illegal, improper, or incorrect because of an inaccurate or misleading certificate;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff170c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> prohibited by law; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff170c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> that does not represent a legal obligation under the appropriation or fund involved; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> verifying transportation rates, freight classifications, and other information provided on a Government bill of lading or transportation request, unless the Administrator of General Services has determined that verification by a prepayment audit conducted pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a"/>section 3726(a) of this title for a particular mode or modes of transportation, or for an agency or subagency, will not adequately protect the interests of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General may relieve a certifying official from liability when the Comptroller General decides that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the certification was based on official records and the official did not know, and by reasonable diligence and inquiry could not have discovered, the correct information; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the obligation was incurred in good faith;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> no law specifically prohibited the payment; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the United States Government received value for payment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General may deny relief when the Comptroller General decides the head of the agency did not carry out diligently collection action under procedures prescribed by the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall relieve a certifying official from liability for an overpayment—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to a common carrier under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3726"/>section 3726 of this title when the Comptroller General decides the overpayment occurred only because the administrative audit before payment did not verify transportation rates, freight classifications, or land-grant deductions and the Administrator of General Services has determined that verification by a prepayment audit conducted pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a"/>section 3726(a) of this title for a particular mode or modes of transportation, or for an agency or subagency, will not adequately protect the interests of the Government; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3528/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> provided under a Government bill of lading or transportation request when the overpayment was the result of using improper transportation rates or classifications or the failure to deduct the proper amount under a land-grant law or agreement and the Administrator of General Services has determined that verification by a prepayment audit conducted pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a"/>section 3726(a) of this title for a particular mode or modes of transportation, or for an agency or subagency, will not adequately protect the interests of the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/966">96 Stat. 966</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/216">Pub. L. 98–216</span>, § 1(4), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-02-14">Feb. 14, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/4">98 Stat. 4</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tIX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title IX</span>, § 913(c)(5), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/412">110 Stat. 412</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/264">Pub. L. 105–264</span>, § 3(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-19">Oct. 19, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2352">112 Stat. 2352</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff170dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529"><span itemtype="num" value="3529">§ 3529.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Requests for decisions of the Comptroller General</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A disbursing or certifying official or the head of an agency may request a decision from the Comptroller General on a question involving—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a payment the disbursing official or head of the agency will make; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a voucher presented to a certifying official for certification.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Comptroller General shall issue a decision requested under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A decision requested under this section concerning a function transferred to or vested in the Director of the Office of Management and Budget under section 211(a) of the Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 1996 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/535">109 Stat. 535</span>), as in effect immediately before the effective date of title II of the General Accounting Office Act of 1996, or under this Act, shall be issued—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, except as provided in subparagraph (B); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3529/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of a function delegated by the Director to another agency, by the head of the agency to which the function was delegated.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/967">96 Stat. 967</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tII">Pub. L. 104–316, title II</span>, § 204, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3845">110 Stat. 3845</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff170ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530"><span itemtype="num" value="3530">§ 3530.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Adjusting accounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An appropriation or fund currently available for the expense of an accountable function shall be charged with an amount necessary to adjust an account of an accountable official or agent when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> necessary to adjust the account for a loss to the United States Government resulting from the fault or negligence of the official or agent; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff170ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the head of the agency decides the loss is uncollectable.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An adjustment does not affect the personal financial liability of an official or agent for the loss.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall prescribe regulations to carry out subsection (a) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3530/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Under procedures prescribed by the Comptroller General, the head of an agency may charge the net amount of unpaid and overpaid balances in individual pay accounts against the appropriation for the fiscal year in which the balances occurred and from which the accounts were payable. The net amount shall be credited to and paid from the corresponding appropriation for the next fiscal year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/967">96 Stat. 967</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff170f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3531"><span itemtype="num" value="3531">[§ 3531.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(f)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3834">110 Stat. 3834</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff170f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3532"><span itemtype="num" value="3532">§ 3532.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Notification of account deficiencies</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An accounting official discovering a deficiency in an account of an official of the United States Government having custody of public money shall notify the head of the agency having jurisdiction of the official of the kind and amount of the deficiency.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/968">96 Stat. 968</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ff170fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35/schIV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">SUBCHAPTER IV—</span><span itemtype="heading">COLLECTION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff170fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3541"><span itemtype="num" value="3541">§ 3541.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Distress warrants</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3541/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> When an official receiving public money before it is paid to the Treasury or a disbursing or certifying official of the United States Government does not submit an account or pay the money as prescribed by law, the Comptroller General shall make the account for the official and certify to the Secretary of the Treasury the amount due the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff170fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3541/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary shall issue a distress warrant against the official stating the amount due from the official and any amount paid. The warrant shall be directed to the marshal of the district in which the official resides. If the Secretary intends to take and sell the property of an official that is located in a district other than where the official resides, the warrant shall be directed to the marshal of the district in which the official resides and the marshal of the district in which the property is located.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/968">96 Stat. 968</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff17102-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3542"><span itemtype="num" value="3542">§ 3542.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Carrying out distress warrants</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17103-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3542/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A marshal carrying out a distress warrant issued under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3541"/>section 3541 of this title shall seize the personal property of the official and sell the property after giving 10 days notice of the sale. Notice shall be given by posting an advertisement of the property to be sold in at least 2 public places in the town and county in which the property was taken or the town and county in which the owner of the property resides. If the property does not satisfy the amount due under the warrant, the official may be sent to prison until discharged by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17104-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3542/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17105-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3542/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The amount due under a warrant is a lien on the real property of the official from the date the distress warrant is issued. The lien shall be recorded in the office of the clerk of the appropriate district court until discharged under law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17106-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3542/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If the personal property of the official is not enough to satisfy a distress warrant, the marshal shall sell real property of the official after advertising the property for at least 3 weeks in at least 3 public places in the county or district where the property is located. A buyer of the real property has valid title against all persons claiming under the official.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17107-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3542/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The official shall receive that part of the proceeds of a sale remaining after the distress warrant is satisfied and the reasonable costs and charges of the sale are paid.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/968">96 Stat. 968</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff1710b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543"><span itemtype="num" value="3543">§ 3543.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Postponing a distress warrant proceeding</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1710c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A distress warrant proceeding may be postponed for a reasonable time if the Secretary of the Treasury believes the public interest will not be harmed by the postponement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1710d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1710e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A person adversely affected by a distress warrant issued under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3541"/>section 3541 of this title may bring a civil action in a district court of the United States. The complaint shall state the kind and extent of the harm. The court may grant an injunction to stay any part of a distress warrant proceeding required by the action after the person applying for the injunction gives a bond in an amount the court prescribes for carrying out a judgment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1710f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> An injunction under this subsection does not affect a lien under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3542/b/1"/>section 3542(b)(1) of this title. The United States Government is not required to answer in a civil action brought under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17110-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> If the court dissolves the injunction on a finding that the civil action for the injunction was brought only for delay, the court may increase the interest rate imposed on amounts found due against the complainant to not more than 10 percent a year. The judge may grant or dissolve an injunction under this subsection either in or out of court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17111-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3543/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A person adversely affected by a refusal to grant an injunction or by dissolving an injunction under subsection (b) of this section may petition a judge of a circuit court of appeals in which the district is located or the Supreme Court justice allotted to that circuit by giving the judge or justice a copy of the proceeding held before the district judge. The judge or justice may grant an injunction or allow an appeal if the judge or justice finds the case requires it.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/968">96 Stat. 968</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff17115-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3544"><span itemtype="num" value="3544">§ 3544.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Rights and remedies of the United States Government reserved</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">This subchapter does not affect a right or remedy the United States Government has by law to recover a tax, debt, or demand.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/969">96 Stat. 969</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff17119-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3545"><span itemtype="num" value="3545">§ 3545.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil action to recover money</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Attorney General shall bring a civil action to recover an amount due to the United States Government on settlement of the account of a person accountable for public money when the person neglects or refuses to pay the amount to the Treasury. Any commission of that person and interest of 6 percent a year from the time the money is received by the person until repaid to the Treasury shall be added to the amount due on the account. The commission is forfeited when judgment is obtained.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/969">96 Stat. 969</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ff1711d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35/schV"><span itemtype="num" value="V">SUBCHAPTER V—</span><span itemtype="heading">PROCUREMENT PROTEST SYSTEM</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff1711e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551"><span itemtype="num" value="3551">§ 3551.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this subchapter:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff1711f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term “protest” means a written objection by an interested party to any of the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17120-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> A solicitation or other request by a Federal agency for offers for a contract for the procurement of property or services.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17121-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The cancellation of such a solicitation or other request.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17122-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> An award or proposed award of such a contract.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17123-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> A termination or cancellation of an award of such a contract, if the written objection contains an allegation that the termination or cancellation is based in whole or in part on improprieties concerning the award of the contract.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17124-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> Conversion of a function that is being performed by Federal employees to private sector performance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17125-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The term “interested party”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17126-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> with respect to a contract or a solicitation or other request for offers described in paragraph (1), means an actual or prospective bidder or offeror whose direct economic interest would be affected by the award of the contract or by failure to award the contract; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff17127-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> with respect to a public-private competition conducted under Office of Management and Budget Circular A–76 with respect to the performance of an activity or function of a Federal agency, or a decision to convert a function performed by Federal employees to private sector performance without a competition under Office of Management and Budget Circular A–76, includes—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0ff17128-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> any official who is responsible for submitting the agency tender in such competition; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0ff17129-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any one individual who, for the purpose of representing the Federal employees engaged in the performance of the activity or function for which the public-private competition is conducted in a protest under this subchapter that relates to such public-private competition, has been designated as the agent of the Federal employees by a majority of such employees.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff1712a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3551/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The term “Federal agency” has the meaning given such term by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s102"/>section 102 of title 40.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVII">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VII</span>, § 2741(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1199">98 Stat. 1199</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/145/tXIII">Pub. L. 99–145, title XIII</span>, § 1304(d), <span itemtype="date" date="1985-11-08">Nov. 8, 1985</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/99/742">99 Stat. 742</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(K), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tI">Pub. L. 103–355, title I</span>, § 1401, <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3287">108 Stat. 3287</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dD/tXLIII">Pub. L. 104–106, div. D, title XLIII</span>, § 4321(d)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/674">110 Stat. 674</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(6), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1300">116 Stat. 1300</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/375/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 108–375, div. A, title III</span>, § 326(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-28">Oct. 28, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1848">118 Stat. 1848</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/161/dD/tVII">Pub. L. 110–161, div. D, title VII</span>, § 739(c)(1)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="2007-12-26">Dec. 26, 2007</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/121/2030">121 Stat. 2030</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/181/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 110–181, div. A, title III</span>, § 326(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-01-28">Jan. 28, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/62">122 Stat. 62</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/84/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 111–84, div. A, title III</span>, § 327(a), (b), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-10-28">Oct. 28, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/2255">123 Stat. 2255</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff17136-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3552"><span itemtype="num" value="3552">§ 3552.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Protests by interested parties concerning procurement actions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17137-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3552/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A protest concerning an alleged violation of a procurement statute or regulation shall be decided by the Comptroller General if filed in accordance with this subchapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17138-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3552/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17139-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3552/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> In the case of an agency tender official who is an interested party under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2/B"/>section 3551(2)(B) of this title, the official may file a protest in connection with the public-private competition for which the official is an interested party. At the request of a majority of the employees of the Federal agency who are engaged in the performance of the activity or function subject to such public-private competition, the official shall file a protest in connection with such public-private competition unless the official determines that there is no reasonable basis for the protest.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1713a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3552/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The determination of an agency tender official under paragraph (1) whether or not to file a protest is not subject to administrative or judicial review. An agency tender official shall provide written notification to Congress whenever the official makes a determination under paragraph (1) that there is no reasonable basis for a protest.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVII">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VII</span>, § 2741(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1199">98 Stat. 1199</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(L), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tX">Pub. L. 103–355, title X</span>, § 10005(d), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3408">108 Stat. 3408</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dE/tLVI">Pub. L. 104–106, div. E, title LVI</span>, § 5603, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/700">110 Stat. 700</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/375/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 108–375, div. A, title III</span>, § 326(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-28">Oct. 28, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1848">118 Stat. 1848</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff17143-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553"><span itemtype="num" value="3553">§ 3553.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Review of protests; effect on contracts pending decision</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17144-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Under procedures prescribed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3555"/>section 3555 of this title, the Comptroller General shall decide a protest submitted to the Comptroller General by an interested party.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17145-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17146-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Within one day after the receipt of a protest, the Comptroller General shall notify the Federal agency involved of the protest.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17147-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection, a Federal agency receiving a notice of a protested procurement under paragraph (1) of this subsection shall submit to the Comptroller General a complete report (including all relevant documents) on the protested procurement—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17148-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> within 30 days after the date of the agency’s receipt of that notice;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17149-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> if the Comptroller General, upon a showing by the Federal agency, determines (and states the reasons in writing) that the specific circumstances of the protest require a longer period, within the longer period determined by the Comptroller General; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff1714a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> in a case determined by the Comptroller General to be suitable for the express option under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/2"/>section 3554(a)(2) of this title, within 20 days after the date of the Federal agency’s receipt of that determination.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1714b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A Federal agency need not submit a report to the Comptroller General pursuant to paragraph (2) of this subsection if the agency is sooner notified by the Comptroller General that the protest concerned has been dismissed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/4"/>section 3554(a)(4) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1714c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1714d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, a contract may not be awarded in any procurement after the Federal agency has received notice of a protest with respect to such procurement from the Comptroller General and while the protest is pending.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1714e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of the procuring activity responsible for award of a contract may authorize the award of the contract (notwithstanding a protest of which the Federal agency has notice under this section)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff1714f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> upon a written finding that urgent and compelling circumstances which significantly affect interests of the United States will not permit waiting for the decision of the Comptroller General under this subchapter; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17150-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> after the Comptroller General is advised of that finding.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17151-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A finding may not be made under paragraph (2)(A) of this subsection unless the award of the contract is otherwise likely to occur within 30 days after the making of such finding.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17152-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17153-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A contractor awarded a Federal agency contract may, during the period described in paragraph (4), begin performance of the contract and engage in any related activities that result in obligations being incurred by the United States under the contract unless the contracting officer responsible for the award of the contract withholds authorization to proceed with performance of the contract.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17154-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The contracting officer may withhold an authorization to proceed with performance of the contract during the period described in paragraph (4) if the contracting officer determines in writing that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17155-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a protest is likely to be filed; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17156-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the immediate performance of the contract is not in the best interests of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17157-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff17158-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the Federal agency awarding the contract receives notice of a protest in accordance with this section during the period described in paragraph (4)—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff17159-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the contracting officer may not authorize performance of the contract to begin while the protest is pending; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff1715a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> if authorization for contract performance to proceed was not withheld in accordance with paragraph (2) before receipt of the notice, the contracting officer shall immediately direct the contractor to cease performance under the contract and to suspend any related activities that may result in additional obligations being incurred by the United States under that contract.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1715b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Performance and related activities suspended pursuant to subparagraph (A)(ii) by reason of a protest may not be resumed while the protest is pending.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff1715c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of the procuring activity may authorize the performance of the contract (notwithstanding a protest of which the Federal agency has notice under this section)—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff1715d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> upon a written finding that—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff1715e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/C/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> performance of the contract is in the best interests of the United States; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e15f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/C/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> urgent and compelling circumstances that significantly affect interests of the United States will not permit waiting for the decision of the Comptroller General concerning the protest; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e160-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> after the Comptroller General is notified of that finding.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e161-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The period referred to in paragraphs (2) and (3)(A), with respect to a contract, is the period beginning on the date of the contract award and ending on the later of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e162-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the date that is 10 days after the date of the contract award; or<p
