itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e163-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the date that is 5 days after the debriefing date offered to an unsuccessful offeror for any debriefing that is requested and, when requested, is required.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e164-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The authority of the head of the procuring activity to make findings and to authorize the award and performance of contracts under subsections (c) and (d) of this section may not be delegated.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e165-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e166-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Within such deadlines as the Comptroller General prescribes, upon request each Federal agency shall provide to an interested party any document relevant to a protested procurement action (including the report required by subsection (b)(2) of this section) that would not give that party a competitive advantage and that the party is otherwise authorized by law to receive.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e167-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e168-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Comptroller General may issue protective orders which establish terms, conditions, and restrictions for the provision of any document to a party under paragraph (1), that prohibit or restrict the disclosure by the party of information described in subparagraph (B) that is contained in such a document.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e169-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Information referred to in subparagraph (A) is procurement sensitive information, trade secrets, or other proprietary or confidential research, development, or commercial information.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e16a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/f/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> A protective order under this paragraph shall not be considered to authorize the withholding of any document or information from Congress or an executive agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e16b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3553/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> If an interested party files a protest in connection with a public-private competition described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3551/2/B"/>section 3551(2)(B) of this title, a person representing a majority of the employees of the Federal agency who are engaged in the performance of the activity or function subject to the public-private competition may intervene in protest.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVII">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VII</span>, § 2741(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1200">98 Stat. 1200</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tI">Pub. L. 103–355, title I</span>, §§ 1402, 1403(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3287">108 Stat. 3287</span>, 3290; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dD/tXLIII">Pub. L. 104–106, div. D, title XLIII</span>, § 4321(d)(2), div. E, title LV, § 5501(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/674">110 Stat. 674</span>, 698; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/375/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 108–375, div. A, title III</span>, § 326(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-28">Oct. 28, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1848">118 Stat. 1848</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e174-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554"><span itemtype="num" value="3554">§ 3554.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Decisions on protests</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e175-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e176-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> To the maximum extent practicable, the Comptroller General shall provide for the inexpensive and expeditious resolution of protests under this subchapter. Except as provided under paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Comptroller General shall issue a final decision concerning a protest within 100 days after the date the protest is submitted to the Comptroller General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e177-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall, by regulation prescribed pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3555"/>section 3555 of this title, establish an express option for deciding those protests which the Comptroller General determines suitable for resolution within 65 days after the date the protest is submitted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e178-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> An amendment to a protest that adds a new ground of protest, if timely made, should be resolved, to the maximum extent practicable, within the time limit established under paragraph (1) of this subsection for final decision of the initial protest. If an amended protest cannot be resolved within such time limit, the Comptroller General may resolve the amended protest through the express option under paragraph (2) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e179-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The Comptroller General may dismiss a protest that the Comptroller General determines is frivolous or which, on its face, does not state a valid basis for protest.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e17a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e17b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> With respect to a solicitation for a contract, or a proposed award or the award of a contract, protested under this subchapter, the Comptroller General may determine whether the solicitation, proposed award, or award complies with statute and regulation. If the Comptroller General determines that the solicitation, proposed award, or award does not comply with a statute or regulation, the Comptroller General shall recommend that the Federal agency—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e17c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> refrain from exercising any of its options under the contract;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e17d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> recompete the contract immediately;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e17e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> cancel the solicitation issued pursuant to the public-private competition conducted under Office of Management and Budget Circular A–76 or any successor circular;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e17f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> issue a new solicitation;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e180-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> terminate the contract;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e181-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> award a contract consistent with the requirements of such statute and regulation;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e182-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> implement any combination of recommendations under clauses (A), (B), (C), (D), (E), and (F); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e183-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/1/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> implement such other recommendations as the Comptroller General determines to be necessary in order to promote compliance with procurement statutes and regulations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e184-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If the head of the procuring activity responsible for a contract makes a finding under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3553/d/3/C/i/I"/>section 3553(d)(3)(C)(i)(I) of this title, the Comptroller General shall make recommendations under this subsection without regard to any cost or disruption from terminating, recompeting, or reawarding the contract.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e185-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> If the Federal agency fails to implement fully the recommendations of the Comptroller General under this subsection with respect to a solicitation for a contract or an award or proposed award of a contract within 60 days after receiving the recommendations, the head of the procuring activity responsible for that contract shall report such failure to the Comptroller General not later than 5 days after the end of such 60-day period.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e186-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e187-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the Comptroller General determines that a solicitation for a contract or a proposed award or the award of a contract does not comply with a statute or regulation, the Comptroller General may recommend that the Federal agency conducting the procurement pay to an appropriate interested party the costs of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e188-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> filing and pursuing the protest, including reasonable attorneys’ fees and consultant and expert witness fees; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e189-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> bid and proposal preparation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e18a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> No party (other than a small business concern (within the meaning of section 3(a) of the Small Business Act)) may be paid, pursuant to a recommendation made under the authority of paragraph (1)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e18b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> costs for consultant and expert witness fees that exceed the highest rate of compensation for expert witnesses paid by the Federal Government; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e18c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> costs for attorneys’ fees that exceed $150 per hour unless the agency determines, based on the recommendation of the Comptroller General on a case by case basis, that an increase in the cost of living or a special factor, such as the limited availability of qualified attorneys for the proceedings involved, justifies a higher fee.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e18d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the Comptroller General recommends under paragraph (1) that a Federal agency pay costs to an interested party, the Federal agency shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e18e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> pay the costs promptly; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e18f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> if the Federal agency does not make such payment, promptly report to the Comptroller General the reasons for the failure to follow the Comptroller General’s recommendation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e190-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> If the Comptroller General recommends under paragraph (1) that a Federal agency pay costs to an interested party, the Federal agency and the interested party shall attempt to reach an agreement on the amount of the costs to be paid. If the Federal agency and the interested party are unable to agree on the amount to be paid, the Comptroller General may, upon the request of the interested party, recommend to the Federal agency the amount of the costs that the Federal agency should pay.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e191-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Each decision of the Comptroller General under this subchapter shall be signed by the Comptroller General or a designee for that purpose. A copy of the decision shall be made available to the interested parties, the head of the procuring activity responsible for the solicitation, proposed award, or award of the contract, and the senior procurement executive of the Federal agency involved.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e192-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e193-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General shall report promptly to the Committee on Governmental Affairs and the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate and to the Committee on Government Reform and Oversight and the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives any case in which a Federal agency fails to implement fully a recommendation of the Comptroller General under subsection (b) or (c). The report shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e194-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a comprehensive review of the pertinent procurement, including the circumstances of the failure of the Federal agency to implement a recommendation of the Comptroller General; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e195-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a recommendation regarding whether, in order to correct an inequity or to preserve the integrity of the procurement process, the Congress should consider—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e196-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> private relief legislation;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e197-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> legislative rescission or cancellation of funds;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e198-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> further investigation by Congress; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e199-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/1/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> other action.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e19a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3554/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Not later than January 31 of each year, the Comptroller General shall transmit to the Congress a report containing a summary of each instance in which a Federal agency did not fully implement a recommendation of the Comptroller General under subsection (b) or (c) during the preceding year. The report shall also describe each instance in which a final decision in a protest was not rendered within 100 days after the date the protest is submitted to the Comptroller General. The report shall also include a summary of the most prevalent grounds for sustaining protests during such preceding year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVII">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VII</span>, § 2741(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1201">98 Stat. 1201</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/463/tVIII">Pub. L. 100–463, title VIII</span>, § 8139, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-01">Oct. 1, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2270-47">102 Stat. 2270–47</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tI">Pub. L. 103–355, title I</span>, § 1403(a)–(b)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3289">108 Stat. 3289</span>, 3290; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dD/tXLIII">Pub. L. 104–106, div. D, title XLIII</span>, § 4321(d)(3), div. E, title LV, § 5501(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/674">110 Stat. 674</span>, 698; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/84/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 111–84, div. A, title III</span>, § 327(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-10-28">Oct. 28, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/2255">123 Stat. 2255</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/239/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 112–239, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 867, <span itemtype="date" date="2013-01-02">Jan. 2, 2013</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/126/1862">126 Stat. 1862</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555"><span itemtype="num" value="3555">§ 3555.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Regulations; authority of Comptroller General to verify assertions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall prescribe such procedures as may be necessary to the expeditious decision of protests under this subchapter, including procedures for accelerated resolution of protests under the express option authorized by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3554/a/2"/>section 3554(a)(2) of this title. Such procedures shall provide that the protest process may not be delayed by the failure of a party to make a filing within the time provided for the filing.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The procedures shall provide that, in the computation of any period described in this subchapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the day of the act, event, or default from which the designated period of time begins to run not be included; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the last day after such act, event, or default be included, unless—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> such last day is a Saturday, a Sunday, or a legal holiday; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of a filing of a paper at the Government Accountability Office or a Federal agency, such last day is a day on which weather or other conditions cause the closing of the Government Accountability Office or Federal agency, in which event the next day that is not a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday shall be included.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Electronic Filing and Document Dissemination System.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment and operation of system</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Comptroller General shall establish and operate an electronic filing and document dissemination system under which, in accordance with procedures prescribed by the Comptroller General—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a person filing a protest under this subchapter may file the protest through electronic means; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> all documents and information required with respect to the protest may be disseminated and made available to the parties to the protest through electronic means.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Imposition of fees.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General may require each person who files a protest under this subchapter to pay a fee to support the establishment and operation of the electronic system under this subsection, without regard to whether or not the person uses the system with respect to the protest.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Amount</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall establish (and from time to time shall update) a schedule setting forth the amount of the fee to be paid under subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Treatment of amounts collected.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment of account</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General shall maintain a separate account among the accounts of the Government Accountability Office for the electronic system under this subsection, and shall deposit all amounts received as fees under paragraph (2) into the account.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of amounts</span>.—</span></p>Amounts in the account maintained under this paragraph shall be available to the Comptroller General, without fiscal year limitation, solely to establish and operate the electronic system under this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3555/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Comptroller General may use any authority available under chapter 7 of this title and this chapter to verify assertions made by parties in protests under this subchapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVII">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VII</span>, § 2741(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1202">98 Stat. 1202</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/355/tI">Pub. L. 103–355, title I</span>, § 1404, <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-13">Oct. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/3291">108 Stat. 3291</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/76/dI/tI">Pub. L. 113–76, div. I, title I</span>, § 1501, <span itemtype="date" date="2014-01-17">Jan. 17, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/433">128 Stat. 433</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3556"><span itemtype="num" value="3556">§ 3556.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Nonexclusivity of remedies; matters included in agency record</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">This subchapter does not give the Comptroller General exclusive jurisdiction over protests, and nothing contained in this subchapter shall affect the right of any interested party to file a protest with the contracting agency or to file an action in the United States Court of Federal Claims. In any such action based on a procurement or proposed procurement with respect to which a protest has been filed under this subchapter, the reports required by sections 3553(b)(2) and 3554(e)(1) of this title with respect to such procurement or proposed procurement and any decision or recommendation of the Comptroller General under this subchapter with respect to such procurement or proposed procurement shall be considered to be part of the agency record subject to review.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVII">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VII</span>, § 2741(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1202">98 Stat. 1202</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/572/tIX">Pub. L. 102–572, title IX</span>, § 902(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-29">Oct. 29, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4516">106 Stat. 4516</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/320">Pub. L. 104–320</span>, § 12(f), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3876">110 Stat. 3876</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3557"><span itemtype="num" value="3557">§ 3557.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Expedited action in protests of public-private competitions</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">For any protest of a public-private competition conducted under Office of Management and Budget Circular A–76 with respect to the performance of an activity or function of a Federal agency, the Comptroller General shall administer the provisions of this subchapter in the manner best suited for expediting the final resolution of the protest and the final action in the public-private competition.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/181/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 110–181, div. A, title III</span>, § 326(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-01-28">Jan. 28, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/63">122 Stat. 63</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/417">Pub. L. 110–417</span>, [div. A], title X, § 1061(c)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-14">Oct. 14, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/4613">122 Stat. 4613</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ff3e1c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch35/schVI"><span itemtype="num" value="VI">SUBCHAPTER VI—</span><span itemtype="heading">RECOVERY AUDITS <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002048">1</span><span itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002048"><span itemtype="num">1</span> Editorially supplied.</span></span></p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3561"><span itemtype="num" value="3561">[§ 3561.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/204">Pub. L. 111–204</span>, § 2(h)(6)(A)(i), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-22">July 22, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/2231">124 Stat. 2231</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3562"><span itemtype="num" value="3562">§ 3562.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Disposition of recovered funds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3562/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Availability of Funds for Recovery Audits and Activities Program</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Funds collected under a program carried out by an executive agency under section 3561 <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002049">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002049"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of this title shall be available to the executive agency for the following purposes:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3562/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> To reimburse the actual expenses incurred by the executive agency in the administration of the program.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3562/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> To pay contractors for services under the program in accordance with the guidance issued under section 3561(c)(5) <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3562/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">[(b)</span></p>, (c). Repealed. <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/204"/>Pub. L. 111–204, § 2(h)(6)(A)(i), <p itemtype="date" date="2010-07-22"/>July 22, 2010, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/2231"/>124 Stat. 2231.]<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/107/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 107–107, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 831(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-12-28">Dec. 28, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/1187">115 Stat. 1187</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/204">Pub. L. 111–204</span>, § 2(h)(6)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-22">July 22, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/2231">124 Stat. 2231</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3563...3567"><span itemtype="num" value="3563 to 3567">[§§ 3563 to 3567.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/204">Pub. L. 111–204</span>, § 2(h)(6)(A)(i), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-22">July 22, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/2231">124 Stat. 2231</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ff3e1e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch37"><span itemtype="num" value="37">CHAPTER 37—</span><span itemtype="heading">CLAIMS</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ff3e1e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch37/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff3e1e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701"><span itemtype="num" value="3701">§ 3701.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions and application</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “administrative offset” means withholding funds payable by the United States (including funds payable by the United States on behalf of a State government) to, or held by the United States for, a person to satisfy a claim.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “calendar quarter” means a 3-month period beginning on January 1, April 1, July 1, or October 1.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “consumer reporting agency” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a consumer reporting agency as that term is defined in section 603(f) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1681a/f"/>15 U.S.C. 1681a(f)); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff3e1eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a person that, for money or on a cooperative basis, regularly—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0ff3e1ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> gets information on consumers to give the information to a consumer reporting agency; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0ff3e1ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> serves as a marketing agent under an arrangement allowing a third party to get the information from a consumer reporting agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> “executive, judicial, or legislative agency” means a department, agency, court, court administrative office, or instrumentality in the executive, judicial, or legislative branch of Government, including government corporations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “military department” means the Departments of the Army, Navy, and Air Force.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> “system of records” has the same meaning given that term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a/a/5"/>section 552a(a)(5) of title 5.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> “uniformed services” means the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, Coast Guard, Commissioned Corps of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, and Commissioned Corps of the Public Health Service.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> “nontax” means, with respect to any debt or claim, any debt or claim other than a debt or claim under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In subchapter II of this chapter and subsection (a)(8) of this section, the term “claim” or “debt” means any amount of funds or property that has been determined by an appropriate official of the Federal Government to be owed to the United States by a person, organization, or entity other than another Federal agency. A claim includes, without limitation—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> funds owed on account of loans made, insured, or guaranteed by the Government, including any deficiency or any difference between the price obtained by the Government in the sale of a property and the amount owed to the Government on a mortgage on the property,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> expenditures of nonappropriated funds, including actual and administrative costs related to shoplifting, theft detection, and theft prevention,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> over-payments, including payments disallowed by audits performed by the Inspector General of the agency administering the program,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> any amount the United States is authorized by statute to collect for the benefit of any person,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the unpaid share of any non-Federal partner in a program involving a Federal payment and a matching, or cost-sharing, payment by the non-Federal partner,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> any fines or penalties assessed by an agency; <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002050"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002050"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> other amounts of money or property owed to the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> For purposes of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3716"/>section 3716 of this title, each of the terms “claim” and “debt” includes an amount of funds or property owed by a person to a State (including any past-due support being enforced by the State), the District of Columbia, American Samoa, Guam, the United States Virgin Islands, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, or the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> In sections 3716 and 3717 of this title, the term “person” does not include an agency of the United States Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e1fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Sections 3711(e) and 3716–3719 of this title do not apply to a claim or debt under, or to an amount payable under—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e1ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.),<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e200-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Social Security Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s301"/>42 U.S.C. 301 et seq.), except to the extent provided under sections 204(f) and 1631(b)(4) of such Act and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c"/>section 3716(c) of this title, or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e201-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the tariff laws of the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e202-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3716">section 3716 of this title</span>—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e203-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “creditor agency” means any agency owed a claim that seeks to collect that claim through administrative offset; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff3e204-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “payment certifying agency” means any agency that has transmitted a voucher to a disbursing official for disbursement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff3e205-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3701/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> In <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3711"/>section 3711 of this title, “private collection contractor” means private debt collectors under contract with an agency to collect a nontax debt or claim owed the United States. The term includes private debt collectors, collection agencies, and commercial attorneys.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/970">96 Stat. 970</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(13)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2469">96 Stat. 2469</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/387">Pub. L. 103–387</span>, § 5(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-22">Oct. 22, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/4077">108 Stat. 4077</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(c)(2), (d)(1), (3), (z)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-359">110 Stat. 1321–359</span>, 1321–361, 1321–378; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(g)(2)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3835">110 Stat. 3835</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/169/tII">Pub. L. 106–169, title II</span>, § 203(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1999-12-14">Dec. 14, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/1832">113 Stat. 1832</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/107/dA/tIII">Pub. L. 107–107, div. A, title III</span>, § 335, <span itemtype="date" date="2001-12-28">Dec. 28, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/1060">115 Stat. 1060</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff62b03-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702"><span itemtype="num" value="3702">§ 3702.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority to settle claims</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in this chapter or another law, all claims of or against the United States Government shall be settled as follows:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of Defense shall settle—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> claims involving uniformed service members’ pay, allowances, travel, transportation, payments for unused accrued leave, retired pay, and survivor benefits; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> claims by transportation carriers involving amounts collected from them for loss or damage incurred to property incident to shipment at Government expense.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Personnel Management shall settle claims involving Federal civilian employees’ compensation and leave.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Administrator of General Services shall settle claims involving expenses incurred by Federal civilian employees for official travel and transportation, and for relocation expenses incident to transfers of official duty station.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall settle claims not otherwise provided for by this subsection or another provision of law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A claim against the Government presented under this section must contain the signature and address of the claimant or an authorized representative. The claim must be received by the official responsible under subsection (a) for settling the claim or by the agency that conducts the activity from which the claim arises within 6 years after the claim accrues except—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> as provided in this chapter or another law; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a claim of a State, the District of Columbia, or a territory or possession of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> When the claim of a member of the armed forces accrues during war or within 5 years before war begins, the claim must be received within 5 years after peace is established or within the period provided in paragraph (1) of this subsection, whichever is later.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A claim that is not received in the time required under this subsection shall be returned with a copy of this subsection, and no further communication is required.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b11-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">One-Year Limit for Check Claims</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b12-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Any claim on account of a Treasury check shall be barred unless it is presented to the agency that authorized the issuance of such check within 1 year after the date of issuance of the check or the effective date of this subsection, whichever is later.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Nothing in this subsection affects the underlying obligation of the United States, or any agency thereof, for which a Treasury check was issued.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The official responsible under subsection (a) for settling the claim shall report to Congress on a claim against the Government that is timely presented under this section that may not be adjusted by using an existing appropriation, and that the official believes Congress should consider for legal or equitable reasons. The report shall include recommendations of the official.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of Defense may waive the time limitations set forth in subsection (b) or (c) in the case of a claim referred to in subsection (a)(1)(A). In the case of a claim by or with respect to a member of the uniformed services who is not under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of a military department, such a waiver may be made only upon the request of the Secretary concerned (as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t37/s101"/>section 101 of title 37).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b17-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Payment of a claim settled under subsection (a)(1)(A) shall be made from an appropriation that is available, for the fiscal year in which the payment is made, for the same purpose as the appropriation to which the obligation claimed would have been charged if the obligation had been timely paid, except that in the case of a claim for retired pay or survivor benefits, if the obligation claimed would have been paid from a trust fund if timely paid, the payment of the claim shall be made from that trust fund.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b18-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3702/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> This subsection does not apply to a claim in excess of $25,000.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/970">96 Stat. 970</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(14), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2470">96 Stat. 2470</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/86/tX">Pub. L. 100–86, title X</span>, § 1004(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1987-08-10">Aug. 10, 1987</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/659">101 Stat. 659</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/201/dA/tVI">Pub. L. 104–201, div. A, title VI</span>, § 608, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-23">Sept. 23, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2542">110 Stat. 2542</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tII">Pub. L. 104–316, title II</span>, § 202(n)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3843">110 Stat. 3843</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/85/dA/tX">Pub. L. 105–85, div. A, title X</span>, § 1012, <span itemtype="date" date="1997-11-18">Nov. 18, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/1874">111 Stat. 1874</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/398">Pub. L. 106–398</span>, § 1 [[div. A], title VI, § 664], <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-30">Oct. 30, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1654">114 Stat. 1654</span>, 1654A–168; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/314/dA/tVI">Pub. L. 107–314, div. A, title VI</span>, § 635(a), (b), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-12-02">Dec. 2, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/2574">116 Stat. 2574</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/163/dA/tX">Pub. L. 109–163, div. A, title X</span>, § 1056(e)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-01-06">Jan. 6, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/119/3440">119 Stat. 3440</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ff62b24-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch37/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">CLAIMS OF THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff62b25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711"><span itemtype="num" value="3711">§ 3711.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Collection and compromise</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall try to collect a claim of the United States Government for money or property arising out of the activities of, or referred to, the agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may compromise a claim of the Government of not more than $100,000 (excluding interest) or such higher amount as the Attorney General may from time to time prescribe that has not been referred to another executive or legislative agency for further collection action, except that only the Comptroller General may compromise a claim arising out of an exception the Comptroller General makes in the account of an accountable official; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may suspend or end collection action on a claim referred to in clause (2) of this subsection when it appears that no person liable on the claim has the present or prospective ability to pay a significant amount of the claim or the cost of collecting the claim is likely to be more than the amount recovered.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may not act under subsection (a)(2) or (3) of this section on a claim that appears to be fraudulent, false, or misrepresented by a party with an interest in the claim, or that is based on conduct in violation of the antitrust laws.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary of Transportation may not compromise for less than $500 a penalty under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t49/s21302"/>section 21302 of title 49 for a violation of chapter 203, 205, or 207 of title 49 or a regulation or requirement prescribed or order issued under any of those chapters.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b2d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A compromise under this section is final and conclusive unless gotten by fraud, misrepresentation, presenting a false claim, or mutual mistake of fact. An accountable official is not liable for an amount paid or for the value of property lost or damaged if the amount or value is not recovered because of a compromise under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b2e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency acts under—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b2f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> regulations prescribed by the head of the agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b30-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> standards that the Attorney General, the Secretary of the Treasury, may prescribe.<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002051"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002051"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When trying to collect a claim of the Government under a law except the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1">26 U.S.C. 1</span> et seq.), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> notice required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a/e/4"/>section 552a(e)(4) of title 5 indicates that information in the system may be disclosed to a consumer reporting agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the head of the agency has reviewed the claim and decided that the claim is valid and overdue;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the head of the agency has notified the person in writing—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> that payment of the claim is overdue;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> that, within not less than 60 days after sending the notice, the head of the agency intends to disclose to a consumer reporting agency that the person is responsible for the claim;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> of the specific information to be disclosed to the consumer reporting agency; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> of the rights the person has to a complete explanation of the claim, to dispute information in the records of the agency about the claim, and to administrative repeal or review of the claim;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the person has not—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> repaid or agreed to repay the claim under a written repayment plan that the person has signed and the head of the agency has agreed to; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> filed for review of the claim under paragraph (2) of this subsection;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the head of the agency has established procedures to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/E/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> disclose promptly, to each consumer reporting agency to which the original disclosure was made, a substantial change in the condition or amount of the claim;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/E/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> verify or correct promptly information about the claim on request of a consumer reporting agency for verification of information disclosed; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/E/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the information disclosed to the consumer reporting agency is limited to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b42-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/F/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> information necessary to establish the identity of the person, including name, address, and taxpayer identification number;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b43-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/F/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the amount, status, and history of the claim; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b44-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/1/F/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the agency or program under which the claim arose.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b45-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Before disclosing information to a consumer reporting agency under paragraph (1) of this subsection and at other times allowed by law, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall provide, on request of a person alleged by the agency to be responsible for the claim, for a review of the obligation of the person, including an opportunity for reconsideration of the initial decision on the claim.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b46-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Before disclosing information to a consumer reporting agency under paragraph (1) of this subsection, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall take reasonable action to locate a person for whom the head of the agency does not have a current address to send the notice under paragraph (1)(C).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The head of each executive agency shall require, as a condition for insuring or guaranteeing any loan, financing, or other extension of credit under any law to a person, that the lender provide information relating to the extension of credit to consumer reporting agencies or commercial reporting agencies, as appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b48-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> The head of each executive agency may provide to a consumer reporting agency or commercial reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim which is current, if notice required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a/e/4"/>section 552a(e)(4) of title 5 indicates that information in the system may be disclosed to a consumer reporting agency or commercial reporting agency, respectively.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b49-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of Defense may suspend or terminate an action by the Secretary or by the Secretary of a military department under subsection (a) to collect a claim against the estate of a person who died while serving on active duty as a member of the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, or Coast Guard during a period when the Coast Guard is operating as a service in the Navy if the Secretary determines that, under the circumstances applicable with respect to the deceased person, it is appropriate to do so.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary of Homeland Security may suspend or terminate an action by the Secretary under subsection (a) to collect a claim against the estate of a person who died while serving on active duty as a member of the Coast Guard if the Secretary determines that, under the circumstances applicable with respect to the deceased person, it is appropriate to do so.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may suspend or terminate an action by the Secretary under subsection (a) to collect a claim against the estate of a person who died while serving on active duty as a member of the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, or Coast Guard during a period when the Coast Guard is operating as a service in the Navy if the Secretary determines that, under the circumstances applicable with respect to the deceased person, it is appropriate to do so.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/f/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> In this subsection, the term “active duty” has the meaning given that term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t10/s101"/>section 101 of title 10.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If a nontax debt or claim owed to the United States has been delinquent for a period of 180 days—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the head of the executive, judicial, or legislative agency that administers the program that gave rise to the debt or claim shall transfer the debt or claim to the Secretary of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> upon such transfer the Secretary of the Treasury shall take appropriate action to collect or terminate collection actions on the debt or claim.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Paragraph (1) shall not apply—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> to any debt or claim that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> is in litigation or foreclosure;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> will be disposed of under an asset sales program within 1 year after becoming eligible for sale, or later than 1 year if consistent with an asset sales program and a schedule established by the agency and approved by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> has been referred to a private collection contractor for collection for a period of time determined by the Secretary of the Treasury;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> has been referred by, or with the consent of, the Secretary of the Treasury to a debt collection center for a period of time determined by the Secretary of the Treasury; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> will be collected under internal offset, if such offset is sufficient to collect the claim within 3 years after the date the debt or claim is first delinquent; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to any other specific class of debt or claim, as determined by the Secretary of the Treasury at the request of the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency or otherwise.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> For purposes of this section, the Secretary of the Treasury may designate, and withdraw such designation of debt collection centers operated by other Federal agencies. The Secretary of the Treasury shall designate such centers on the basis of their performance in collecting delinquent claims owed to the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> At the discretion of the Secretary of the Treasury, referral of a nontax claim may be made to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> any executive department or agency operating a debt collection center for servicing, collection, compromise, or suspension or termination of collection action;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a private collection contractor operating under a contract for servicing or collection action; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the Department of Justice for litigation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Nontax claims referred or transferred under this section shall be serviced, collected, or compromised, or collection action thereon suspended or terminated, in accordance with otherwise applicable statutory requirements and authorities.
