Executive departments and agencies operating debt collection centers may enter into agreements with the Secretary of the Treasury to carry out the purposes of this subsection. The Secretary of the Treasury shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> maintain competition in carrying out this subsection;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> maximize collections of delinquent debts by placing delinquent debts quickly;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> maintain a schedule of private collection contractors and debt collection centers eligible for referral of claims; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> refer delinquent debts to the person most appropriate to collect the type or amount of claim involved.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> Any agency operating a debt collection center to which nontax claims are referred or transferred under this subsection may charge a fee sufficient to cover the full cost of implementing this subsection. The agency transferring or referring the nontax claim shall be charged the fee, and the agency charging the fee shall collect such fee by retaining the amount of the fee from amounts collected pursuant to this subsection. Agencies may agree to pay through a different method, or to fund an activity from another account or from revenue received from the procedure described under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3720C"/>section 3720C of this title. Amounts charged under this subsection concerning delinquent claims may be considered as costs pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3717/e"/>section 3717(e) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Notwithstanding any other law concerning the depositing and collection of Federal payments, including <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3302/b">section 3302(b) of this title</span>, agencies collecting fees may retain the fees from amounts collected. Any fee charged pursuant to this subsection shall be deposited into an account to be determined by the executive department or agency operating the debt collection center charging the fee (in this subsection referred to in this section <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002052">2</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002052"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> as the “Account”). Amounts deposited in the Account shall be available until expended to cover costs associated with the implementation and operation of Governmentwide debt collection activities. Costs properly chargeable to the Account include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the costs of computer hardware and software, word processing and telecommunications equipment, and other equipment, supplies, and furniture;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> personnel training and travel costs;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> other personnel and administrative costs;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the costs of any contract for identification, billing, or collection services; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> reasonable costs incurred by the Secretary of the Treasury, including services and utilities provided by the Secretary, and administration of the Account.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> Not later than January 1 of each year, there shall be deposited into the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts an amount equal to the amount of unobligated balances remaining in the Account at the close of business on September 30 of the preceding year, minus any part of such balance that the executive department or agency operating the debt collection center determines is necessary to cover or defray the costs under this subsection for the fiscal year in which the deposit is made.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before discharging any delinquent debt owed to any executive, judicial, or legislative agency, the head of such agency shall take all appropriate steps to collect such debt, including (as applicable)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> administrative offset,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> tax refund offset,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b6f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Federal salary offset,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b70-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> referral to private collection contractors,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b71-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> referral to agencies operating a debt collection center,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> reporting delinquencies to credit reporting bureaus,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> garnishing the wages of delinquent debtors, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/9/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> litigation or foreclosure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> To carry out the purposes of this subsection, the Secretary of the Treasury may prescribe such rules, regulations, and procedures as the Secretary considers necessary and transfer such funds from funds appropriated to the Department of the Treasury as may be necessary to meet existing liabilities and obligations incurred prior to the receipt of revenues that result from debt collections.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency acting under subsection (a)(1), (2), or (3) of this section to collect a claim, compromise a claim, or terminate collection action on a claim may obtain a consumer report (as that term is defined in section 603 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1681a"/>15 U.S.C. 1681a)) or comparable credit information on any person who is liable for the claim.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The obtaining of a consumer report under this subsection is deemed to be a circumstance or purpose authorized or listed under section 604 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1681b"/>15 U.S.C. 1681b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may sell, subject to section 504(b) of the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990 and using competitive procedures, any nontax debt owed to the United States that is delinquent for more than 90 days. Appropriate fees charged by a contractor to assist in the conduct of a sale under this subsection may be payable from the proceeds of the sale.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> After terminating collection action, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall sell, using competitive procedures, any nontax debt or class of nontax debts owed to the United States, if the Secretary of the Treasury determines the sale is in the best interests of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Sales of nontax debt under this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> shall be for—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> cash, or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> cash and a residuary equity or profit participation, if the head of the agency reasonably determines that the proceeds will be greater than sale solely for cash,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> shall be without recourse, but may include the use of guarantees if otherwise authorized, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> shall transfer to the purchaser all rights of the Government to demand payment of the nontax debt, other than with respect to a residuary equity or profit participation under subparagraph (A)(ii).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Within one year after the date of enactment of the Debt Collection Improvement Act of 1996, each executive agency with current and delinquent collateralized nontax debts shall report to the Congress on the valuation of its existing portfolio of loans, notes and guarantees, and other collateralized debts based on standards developed by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall determine what information is required to be reported to comply with subparagraph (A). At a minimum, for each financing account and for each liquidating account (as those terms are defined in sections 502(7) and 502(8), respectively, of the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990) the following information shall be reported:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> The cumulative balance of current debts outstanding, the estimated net present value of such debts, the annual administrative expenses of those debts (including the portion of salaries and expenses that are directly related thereto), and the estimated net proceeds that would be received by the Government if such debts were sold.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> The cumulative balance of delinquent debts, debts outstanding, the estimated net present value of such debts, the annual administrative expenses of those debts (including the portion of salaries and expenses that are directly related thereto), and the estimated net proceeds that would be received by the Government if such debts were sold.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> The cumulative balance of guaranteed loans outstanding, the estimated net present value of such guarantees, the annual administrative expenses of such guarantees (including the portion of salaries and expenses that are directly related to such guaranteed loans), and the estimated net proceeds that would be received by the Government if such loan guarantees were sold.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> The cumulative balance of defaulted loans that were previously guaranteed and have resulted in loans receivables, the estimated net present value of such loan assets, the annual administrative expenses of such loan assets (including the portion of salaries and expenses that are directly related to such loan assets), and the estimated net proceeds that would be received by the Government if such loan assets were sold.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/4/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> The marketability of all debts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3711/i/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> This subsection is not intended to limit existing statutory authority of agencies to sell loans, debts, or other assets.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/971">96 Stat. 971</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(15), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2470">96 Stat. 2470</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/216">Pub. L. 98–216</span>, § 1(5), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-02-14">Feb. 14, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/4">98 Stat. 4</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/552">Pub. L. 101–552</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2746">104 Stat. 2746</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/365">Pub. L. 102–365</span>, § 4(a)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-09-03">Sept. 3, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/973">106 Stat. 973</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 5(i)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1375">108 Stat. 1375</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title X</span>, § 1089, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/459">110 Stat. 459</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(c)(1), (g)(1)(C), (k), (m)(1), (p), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-359">110 Stat. 1321–359</span>, 1321–363, 1321–365, 1321–366, 1321–371; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/201/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–201, div. A, title X</span>, § 1010, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-23">Sept. 23, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2635">110 Stat. 2635</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(g)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3834">110 Stat. 3834</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/241/tIX">Pub. L. 109–241, title IX</span>, § 902(b)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-07-11">July 11, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/566">120 Stat. 566</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/389/tVIII">Pub. L. 110–389, title VIII</span>, § 801(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-10">Oct. 10, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/4185">122 Stat. 4185</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff62b97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712"><span itemtype="num" value="3712">§ 3712.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Time limitations for presenting certain claims of the Government</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff62b98-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Claims Over Forged or Unauthorized Endorsements.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b99-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Period for claims</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the Secretary of the Treasury determines that a Treasury check has been paid over a forged or unauthorized endorsement, the Secretary may reclaim the amount of such check from the presenting bank or any other endorser that has breached its guarantee of endorsements prior to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the end of the 1-year period beginning on the date of payment; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff62b9b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the expiration of the 180-day period beginning on the close of the period described in subparagraph (A) if a timely claim is received under section 3702.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Civil actions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the United States may bring a civil action to enforce the liability of an endorser, transferor, depository, or fiscal agent on a forged or unauthorized signature or endorsement on, or a change in, a check or warrant issued by the Secretary of the Treasury, the United States Postal Service, or any disbursing official or agent not later than 1 year after a check or warrant is presented to the drawee for payment.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> If the United States has given an endorser written notice of a claim against the endorser within the time allowed by subparagraph (A), the 1-year period for bringing a civil action on that claim under subparagraph (A) shall be extended by 3 years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff62b9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Effect on agency authority</span>.—</span></p>Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to limit the authority of any agency under subchapter II of chapter 37 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ca0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, a civil action may be brought within 2 years after the claim is discovered when an endorser, transferor, depositary, or fiscal agent fraudulently conceals the claim from an officer or employee of the Government entitled to bring the civil action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ca1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall credit the appropriate account of the Treasury for the amount of a check or warrant for which a civil action cannot be brought because notice was not given within the time required under subsection (a) of this section if the failure to give notice was not the result of negligence of the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ca2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Government waives all claims against a person arising from dual pay from the Government if the dual pay is not reported to the Comptroller General for collection within 6 years from the last date of a period of dual pay.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ca3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Treasury Check Offset.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89ca4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>To facilitate collection of amounts owed by presenting banks pursuant to subsection (a) or (b), upon the direction of the Secretary, a Federal reserve bank shall withhold credit from banks presenting Treasury checks for ultimate charge to the account of the United States Treasury. By presenting Treasury checks for payment a presenting bank is deemed to authorize this offset.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89ca5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3712/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Attempt to collect required</span>.—</span></p>Prior to directing offset under subsection (a)(1), the Secretary shall first attempt to collect amounts owed in the manner provided by sections 3711 and 3716.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/971">96 Stat. 971</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/86/tX">Pub. L. 100–86, title X</span>, § 1004(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1987-08-10">Aug. 10, 1987</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/659">101 Stat. 659</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(d)(4), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-362">110 Stat. 1321–362</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff89cac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713"><span itemtype="num" value="3713">§ 3713.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Priority of Government claims</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A claim of the United States Government shall be paid first when—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89caf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a person indebted to the Government is insolvent and—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89cb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the debtor without enough property to pay all debts makes a voluntary assignment of property;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89cb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> property of the debtor, if absent, is attached; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89cb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/1/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> an act of bankruptcy is committed; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the estate of a deceased debtor, in the custody of the executor or administrator, is not enough to pay all debts of the debtor.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> This subsection does not apply to a case under title 11.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3713/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A representative of a person or an estate (except a trustee acting under title 11) paying any part of a debt of the person or estate before paying a claim of the Government is liable to the extent of the payment for unpaid claims of the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/972">96 Stat. 972</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff89cb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3714"><span itemtype="num" value="3714">§ 3714.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Keeping money due States in default</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Secretary of the Treasury shall keep the necessary amount of money the United States Government owes a State when the State defaults in paying principal or interest on investments in stocks or bonds the State issues or guarantees and that the Government holds in trust. The money shall be used to pay the principal or interest or reimburse, with interest, money the Government advanced for interest due on the stocks or bonds.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/972">96 Stat. 972</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff89cbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3715"><span itemtype="num" value="3715">§ 3715.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Buying real property of a debtor</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The head of an agency for whom a civil action is brought against a debtor of the United States Government may buy real property of the debtor at a sale on execution of the real property of the debtor resulting from the action. The head of the agency may not bid more for the property than the amount of the judgment for which the property is being sold, and costs. The marshal of the district in which the sale is held shall transfer the property to the Government.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/972">96 Stat. 972</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff89cc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716"><span itemtype="num" value="3716">§ 3716.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Administrative offset</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> After trying to collect a claim from a person under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3711/a">section 3711(a) of this title</span>, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may collect the claim by administrative offset. The head of the agency may collect by administrative offset only after giving the debtor—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> written notice of the type and amount of the claim, the intention of the head of the agency to collect the claim by administrative offset, and an explanation of the rights of the debtor under this section;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> an opportunity to inspect and copy the records of the agency related to the claim;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> an opportunity for a review within the agency of the decision of the agency related to the claim; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> an opportunity to make a written agreement with the head of the agency to repay the amount of the claim.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before collecting a claim by administrative offset, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency must either—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> adopt, without change, regulations on collecting by administrative offset promulgated by the Department of Justice, the Government Accountability Office, or the Department of the Treasury; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> prescribe regulations on collecting by administrative offset consistent with the regulations referred to in paragraph (1).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ccb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ccc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, a disbursing official of the Department of the Treasury, the Department of Defense, the United States Postal Service, the Department of Health and Human Services, or any other government corporation, or any disbursing official of the United States designated by the Secretary of the Treasury, shall offset at least annually the amount of a payment which a payment certifying agency has certified to the disbursing official for disbursement, by an amount equal to the amount of a claim which a creditor agency has certified to the Secretary of the Treasury pursuant to this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ccd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> An agency that designates disbursing officials pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3321/c"/>section 3321(c) of this title is not required to certify claims arising out of its operations to the Secretary of the Treasury before such agency’s disbursing officials offset such claims.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Payments certified by the Department of Education under a program administered by the Secretary of Education under title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 shall not be subject to administrative offset under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ccf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Neither the disbursing official nor the payment certifying agency shall be liable—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cd0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> for the amount of the administrative offset on the basis that the underlying obligation, represented by the payment before the administrative offset was taken, was not satisfied; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cd1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> for failure to provide timely notice under paragraph (8).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cd2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Notwithstanding any other provision of law (including sections 207 and 1631(d)(1) of the Social Security Act (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s407">42 U.S.C. 407</span> and 1383(d)(1)), <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/173/s413/b">section 413(b) of Public Law 91–173</span> (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t30/s923/b">30 U.S.C. 923(b)</span>), and <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1935-08-29/s14">section 14 of the Act of August 29, 1935</span> (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t45/s231m">45 U.S.C. 231m</span>)), except as provided in clause (ii), all payments due to an individual under—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Social Security Act,<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> part B of the Black Lung Benefits Act, or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/i/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> any law administered by the Railroad Retirement Board (other than payments that such Board determines to be tier 2 benefits),<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>shall be subject to offset under this section.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An amount of $9,000 which a debtor may receive under Federal benefit programs cited under clause (i) within a 12-month period shall be exempt from offset under this subsection. In applying the $9,000 exemption, the disbursing official shall—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> reduce the $9,000 exemption amount for the 12-month period by the amount of all Federal benefit payments made during such 12-month period which are not subject to offset under this subsection; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/A/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> apply a prorated amount of the exemption to each periodic benefit payment to be made to the debtor during the applicable 12-month period.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>For purposes of the preceding sentence, the amount of a periodic benefit payment shall be the amount after any reduction or deduction required under the laws authorizing the program under which such payment is authorized to be made (including any reduction or deduction to recover any overpayment under such program).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cdb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall exempt from administrative offset under this subsection payments under means-tested programs when requested by the head of the respective agency. The Secretary may exempt other payments from administrative offset under this subsection upon the written request of the head of a payment certifying agency. A written request for exemption of other payments must provide justification for the exemption under standards prescribed by the Secretary. Such standards shall give due consideration to whether administrative offset would tend to interfere substantially with or defeat the purposes of the payment certifying agency’s program. The Secretary shall report to the Congress annually on exemptions granted under this section.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cdc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The provisions of sections 205(b)(1), 809(a)(1), and 1631(c)(1) of the Social Security Act shall not apply to any administrative offset executed pursuant to this section against benefits authorized by title II, VIII, or title XVI of the Social Security Act, respectively.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cdd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> This section shall apply to payments made after the date which is 90 days after the enactment of this subparagraph (or such earlier date as designated by the Secretary of Health and Human Services) with respect to claims or debts, and to amounts payable, under title XVIII of the Social Security Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cde-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may charge a fee sufficient to cover the full cost of implementing this subsection. The fee may be collected either by the retention of a portion of amounts collected pursuant to this subsection, or by billing the agency referring or transferring a claim for those amounts. Fees charged to the agencies shall be based on actual administrative offsets completed. Amounts received by the United States as fees under this subsection shall be deposited into the account of the Department of the Treasury under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/7"/>section 3711(g)(7) of this title, and shall be collected and accounted for in accordance with the provisions of that section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cdf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury in consultation with the Commissioner of Social Security and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, may prescribe such rules, regulations, and procedures as the Secretary of the Treasury considers necessary to carry out this subsection. The Secretary shall consult with the heads of affected agencies in the development of such rules, regulations, and procedures.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Any Federal agency that is owed by a person a past due, legally enforceable nontax debt that is over 120 days delinquent, including nontax debt administered by a third party acting as an agent for the Federal Government, shall notify the Secretary of the Treasury of all such nontax debts for purposes of administrative offset under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall notify Congress of any instance in which an agency fails to notify the Secretary as required under subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The disbursing official conducting an administrative offset with respect to a payment to a payee shall notify the payee in writing of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89ce5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/7/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the occurrence of the administrative offset to satisfy a past due legally enforceable debt, including a description of the type and amount of the payment otherwise payable to the payee against which the offset was executed;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89ce6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/7/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the identity of the creditor agency requesting the offset; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89ce7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/7/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> a contact point within the creditor agency that will handle concerns regarding the offset.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> If the payment to be offset is a periodic benefit payment, the disbursing official shall take reasonable steps, as determined by the Secretary of the Treasury, to provide the notice to the payee not later than the date on which the payee is otherwise scheduled to receive the payment, or as soon as practical thereafter, but no later than the date of the administrative offset. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, the failure of the debtor to receive such notice shall not impair the legality of such administrative offset.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ce9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/c/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> A levy pursuant to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall take precedence over requests for administrative offset pursuant to other laws.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Nothing in this section is intended to prohibit the use of any other administrative offset authority existing under statute or common law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ceb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of law, regulation, or administrative limitation, no limitation on the period within which an offset may be initiated or taken pursuant to this section shall be effective.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89ced-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> This section does not apply when a statute explicitly prohibits using administrative offset or setoff to collect the claim or type of claim involved.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The Secretary may waive the requirements of sections 552a(<p itemtype="i"/>o) and (p) of title 5 for administrative offset or claims collection upon written certification by the head of a State or an executive, judicial, or legislative agency seeking to collect the claim that the requirements of subsection (a) of this section have been met.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> The Data Integrity Board of the Department of the Treasury established under 552a(u) of title 5 shall review and include in reports under paragraph (3)(D) of that section a description of any matching activities conducted under this section. If the Secretary has granted a waiver under subsection (f) of this section, no other Data Integrity Board is required to take any action under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a/u"/>section 552a(u) of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cf0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cf1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may, in the discretion of the Secretary, apply subsection (a) with respect to any past-due, legally-enforceable debt owed to a State if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cf2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the appropriate State disbursing official requests that an offset be performed; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cf3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a reciprocal agreement with the State is in effect which contains, at a minimum—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89cf4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> requirements substantially equivalent to subsection (b) of this section; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89cf5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any other requirements which the Secretary considers appropriate to facilitate the offset and prevent duplicative efforts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cf6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This subsection does not apply to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cf7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the collection of a debt or claim on which the administrative costs associated with the collection of the debt or claim exceed the amount of the debt or claim;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cf8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any collection of any other type, class, or amount of claim, as the Secretary considers necessary to protect the interest of the United States; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89cf9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the disbursement of any class or type of payment exempted by the Secretary of the Treasury at the request of a Federal agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89cfa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3716/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> In applying this section with respect to any debt owed to a State, subsection (c)(3)(A) shall not apply.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(16)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2471">96 Stat. 2471</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(c)(1), (d)(2), (e), (f), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-359">110 Stat. 1321–359</span>, 1321–362; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/169/tII">Pub. L. 106–169, title II</span>, § 251(b)(10), <span itemtype="date" date="1999-12-14">Dec. 14, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/1856">113 Stat. 1856</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/234/tXIV">Pub. L. 110–234, title XIV</span>, § 14219(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-05-22">May 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/1482">122 Stat. 1482</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/246">Pub. L. 110–246</span>, § 4(a), title XIV, § 14219(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-06-18">June 18, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/1664">122 Stat. 1664</span>, 2244; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/275/tI">Pub. L. 110–275, title I</span>, § 189(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-07-15">July 15, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/2590">122 Stat. 2590</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/101">Pub. L. 113–101</span>, § 5, <span itemtype="date" date="2014-05-09">May 9, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/1153">128 Stat. 1153</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff89d04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717"><span itemtype="num" value="3717">§ 3717.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Interest and penalty on claims</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall charge a minimum annual rate of interest on an outstanding debt on a United States Government claim owed by a person that is equal to the average investment rate for the Treasury tax and loan accounts for the 12-month period ending on September 30 of each year, rounded to the nearest whole percentage point. The Secretary of the Treasury shall publish the rate before November 1 of that year. The rate is effective on the first day of the next calendar quarter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary may change the rate of interest for a calendar quarter if the average investment rate for the 12-month period ending at the close of the prior calendar quarter, rounded to the nearest whole percentage point, is more or less than the existing published rate by 2 percentage points.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Interest under subsection (a) of this section accrues from the date—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> on which notice is mailed after <p itemtype="date" date="1982-10-25"/>October 25, 1982, if notice was first mailed before <p itemtype="date" date="1982-10-25"/>October 25, 1982; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> notice of the amount due is first mailed to the debtor at the most current address of the debtor available to the head of the executive or <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002053"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002053"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> legislative agency, if notice is first mailed after <p itemtype="date" date="1982-10-24"/>October 24, 1982.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The rate of interest charged under subsection (a) of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is the rate in effect on the date from which interest begins to accrue under subsection (b) of this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> remains fixed at that rate for the duration of the indebtedness.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Interest under subsection (a) of this section may not be charged if the amount due on the claim is paid within 30 days after the date from which interest accrues under subsection (b) of this section. The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may extend the 30-day period.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall assess on a claim owed by a person—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a charge to cover the cost of processing and handling a delinquent claim; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d11-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a penalty charge of not more than 6 percent a year for failure to pay a part of a debt more than 90 days past due.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d12-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> Interest under subsection (a) of this section does not accrue on a charge assessed under subsection (e) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not apply—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> if a statute, regulation required by statute, loan agreement, or contract prohibits charging interest or assessing charges or explicitly fixes the interest or charges; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to a claim under a contract executed before <p itemtype="date" date="1982-10-25"/>October 25, 1982, that is in effect on <p itemtype="date" date="1982-10-25"/>October 25, 1982.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> In conformity with standards prescribed jointly by the Attorney General, the Secretary of the Treasury, and the Comptroller General, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may prescribe regulations identifying circumstances appropriate to waiving collection of interest and charges under subsections (a) and (e) of this section. A waiver under the regulations is deemed to be compliance with this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d17-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d18-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may increase an administrative claim by the cost of living adjustment in lieu of charging interest and penalties under this section. Adjustments under this subsection will be computed annually.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d19-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For the purpose of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d1a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/i/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the term “cost of living adjustment” means the percentage by which the Consumer Price Index for the month of June of the calendar year preceding the adjustment exceeds the Consumer Price Index for the month of June of the calendar year in which the claim was determined or last adjusted; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d1b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3717/i/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the term “administrative claim” includes all debt that is not based on an extension of Government credit through direct loans, loan guarantees, or insurance, including fines, penalties, and overpayments.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added Pub L. 97–452, § 1(16)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2472">96 Stat. 2472</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(c)(1), (g)(1)(C), (q), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-359">110 Stat. 1321–359</span>, 1321–363, 1321–372.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ff89d20-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718"><span itemtype="num" value="3718">§ 3718.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Contracts for collection services</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d21-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Under conditions the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency considers appropriate, the head of the agency may enter into a contract with a person for collection service to recover indebtedness owed, or to locate or recover assets of, the United States Government. The head of an agency may not enter into a contract under the preceding sentence to locate or recover assets of the United States held by a State government or financial institution unless that agency has established procedures approved by the Secretary of the Treasury to identify and recover such assets. The contract shall provide that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d22-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the head of the agency retains the authority to resolve a dispute, compromise a claim, end collection action, and refer a matter to the Attorney General to bring a civil action; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ff89d23-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the person is subject to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89d24-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a"/>section 552a of title 5, to the extent provided in section 552a(m); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ff89d25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> laws and regulations of the United States Government and State governments related to debt collection practices.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Attorney General may make contracts retaining private counsel to furnish legal services, including representation in negotiation, compromise, settlement, and litigation, in the case of any claim of indebtedness owed the United States. Each such contract shall include such terms and conditions as the Attorney General considers necessary and appropriate, including a provision specifying the amount of the fee to be paid to the private counsel under such contract or the method for calculating that fee. The amount of the fee payable for legal services furnished under any such contract may not exceed the fee that counsel engaged in the private practice of law in the area or areas where the legal services are furnished typically charge clients for furnishing legal services in the collection of claims of indebtedness, as determined by the Attorney General, considering the amount, age, and nature of the indebtedness and whether the debtor is an individual or a business entity. Nothing in this subparagraph shall relieve the Attorney General of the competition requirements set forth in division C (except sections 3302, 3501(b), 3509, 3906, 4710, and 4711) of subtitle I of title 41.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ff89d29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Attorney General shall use his best efforts to enter into contracts under this paragraph with law firms owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals and law firms that are qualified HUBZone small business concerns (as defined in section 3(p) of the Small Business Act), so as to enable each agency to comply with paragraph (3).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may, subject to the approval of the Attorney General, refer to a private counsel retained under paragraph (1) of this subsection claims of indebtedness owed the United States arising out of activities of that agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each agency shall use its best efforts to assure that not less than 10 percent of the amounts of all claims referred to private counsel by that agency under paragraph (2) are referred to law firms owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals and law firms that are qualified HUBZone small business concerns. For purposes of this paragraph—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the term “law firm owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals” means a law firm that meets the requirements set forth in clauses (i) and (ii) of section 8(d)(3)(C) of the Small Business Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s637/d/3/C/i"/>15 U.S.C. 637(d)(3)(C)(i) and (ii)) and regulations issued under those clauses;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d2d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> “socially and economically disadvantaged individuals” shall be presumed to include these <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002054"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002054"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> groups and individuals described in the last paragraph of section 8(d)(3)(C) of the Small Business Act; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d2e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the term “qualified HUBZone small business concern” has the meaning given that term in section 3(p) of the Small Business Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d2f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Notwithstanding sections 516, 518(b), 519, and 547(2) of title 28, a private counsel retained under paragraph (1) of this subsection may represent the United States in litigation in connection with legal services furnished pursuant to the contract entered into with that counsel under paragraph (1) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d30-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A contract made with a private counsel under paragraph (1) of this subsection shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a provision permitting the Attorney General to terminate either the contract or the private counsel’s representation of the United States in particular cases if the Attorney General finds that such action is for the convenience of the Government;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a provision stating that the head of the executive or <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002055"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002055"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> legislative agency which refers a claim under the contract retains the authority to resolve a dispute regarding the claim, to compromise the claim, or to terminate a collection action on the claim; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a provision requiring the private counsel to transmit monthly to the Attorney General and the head of the executive or <p itemtype="sup"/>1 legislative agency referring a claim under the contract a report on the services relating to the claim rendered under the contract during the month and the progress made during the month in collecting the claim under the contract.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> Notwithstanding the fourth sentence of section 803(6) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1692a/6"/>15 U.S.C. 1692a(6)), a private counsel performing legal services pursuant to a contract made under paragraph (1) of this subsection shall be considered to be a debt collector for the purposes of such Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> Any counterclaim filed in any action to recover indebtedness owed the United States which is brought on behalf of the United States by private counsel retained under this subsection may not be asserted unless the counterclaim is served directly on the Attorney General or the United States Attorney for the judicial district in which, or embracing the place in which, the action is brought. Such service shall be made in accordance with the rules of procedure of the court in which the action is brought.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Attorney General shall transmit to the Congress an annual report on the activities of the Department of Justice to recover indebtedness owed the United States which was referred to the Department of Justice for collection. Each such report shall include a list, by agency, of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the total number and amounts of claims which were referred for legal services to the Department of Justice and to private counsel under subsection (b) during the 1-year period covered by the report;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the total number and amount of those claims referred for legal services to the Department of Justice which were collected or were not collected or otherwise resolved during the 1-year period covered by the report; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the total number and amount of those claims referred for legal services to private counsel under subsection (b)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> which were collected or were not collected or otherwise resolved during the 1-year period covered by the report;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> which were not collected or otherwise resolved under a contract terminated by the Attorney General during the 1-year period covered by the report; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/c/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> on which the Attorney General terminated the private counsel’s representation during the 1-year period covered by the report without terminating the contract with the private counsel under which the claims were referred.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3302/b"/>section 3302(b) of this title, a contract under subsection (a) or (b) of this section may provide that a fee a person charges to recover indebtedness owed, or to locate or recover assets of, the United States Government is payable from the amount recovered.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A contract under subsection (a) or (b) of this section is effective only to the extent and in the amount provided in an appropriation law. This limitation does not apply in the case of a contract that authorizes a person to collect a fee as provided in subsection (d) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> This section does not apply to the collection of debts under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s1"/>26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3718/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> In order to assist Congress in determining whether use of private counsel is a cost-effective method of collecting Government debts, the Attorney General shall, following consultation with the Government Accountability Office, maintain and make available to the Inspector General of the Department of Justice, statistical data relating to the comparative costs of debt collection by participating United States Attorneys’ Offices and by private counsel.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub.
