L. 97–452</span>, § 1(16)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2473">96 Stat. 2473</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/167">Pub. L. 98–167</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1104">97 Stat. 1104</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/578">Pub. L. 99–578</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-28">Oct. 28, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3305">100 Stat. 3305</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/589">Pub. L. 102–589</span>, § 6, <span itemtype="date" date="1992-11-10">Nov. 10, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/5135">106 Stat. 5135</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(M), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(c)(1), (<span itemtype="i">l</span>), (cc)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-359">110 Stat. 1321–359</span>, 1321–366, 1321–380; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/135/tVI">Pub. L. 105–135, title VI</span>, § 604(e)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-12-02">Dec. 2, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/2633">111 Stat. 2633</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/271">Pub. L. 108–271</span>, § 8(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-07-07">July 7, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/814">118 Stat. 814</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(6), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffb0d4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719"><span itemtype="num" value="3719">§ 3719.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports on debt collection activities</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In consultation with the Comptroller General of the United States, the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe regulations requiring the head of each agency with outstanding nontax claims to prepare and submit to the Secretary at least once each year a report summarizing the status of loans and accounts receivable that are managed by the head of the agency. The report shall contain—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> information on—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the total amount of loans and accounts receivable owed the agency and when amounts owed the agency are due to be repaid;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the total amount of receivables and number of claims at least 30 days past due;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the total amount written off as actually uncollectible and the total amount allowed for uncollectible loans and accounts receivable;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the rate of interest charged for overdue debts and the amount of interest charged and collected on debts;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the total number of claims and the total amount collected; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> the number and total amount of claims referred to the Attorney General for settlement and the number and total amount of claims the Attorney General settles;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the information described in clause (1) of this subsection for each program or activity the head of the agency carries out; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> other information the Secretary considers necessary to decide whether the head of the agency is acting aggressively to collect the claims of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3719/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary shall analyze the reports submitted under subsection (a) of this section and shall report annually to Congress on the management of debt collection activities by the head of each agency, including the information provided the Secretary under subsection (a).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(16)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2473">96 Stat. 2473</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(aa)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-380">110 Stat. 1321–380</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffb0d61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720"><span itemtype="num" value="3720">§ 3720.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Collection of payments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Each head of an executive agency (other than an agency subject to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1933-05-18/s9"/>section 9 of the Act of May 18, 1933 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/48/63"/>48 Stat. 63, chapter 32; <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s831h"/>16 U.S.C. 831h)) shall, under such regulations as the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe, provide for the timely deposit of money by officials and agents of such agency in accordance with section 3302, and for the collection and timely deposit of sums owed to such agency by the use of such procedures as withdrawals and deposits by electronic transfer of funds, automatic withdrawals from accounts at financial institutions, and a system under which financial institutions receive and deposit, on behalf of the executive agency, payments transmitted to post office lockboxes. The Secretary is authorized to collect from any agency not complying with the requirements imposed pursuant to the preceding sentence a charge in an amount the Secretary determines to be the cost to the general fund caused by such noncompliance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The head of an executive agency shall pay to the Secretary of the Treasury charges imposed pursuant to subsection (a). Payments shall be made out of amounts appropriated or otherwise made available to carry out the program to which the collections relate. The amounts of the charges paid under this subsection shall be deposited in the Cash Management Improvements Fund established by subsection (c).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> There is established in the Treasury of the United States a revolving fund to be known as the “Cash Management Improvements Fund”. Sums in the fund shall be available without fiscal year limitation for the payment of expenses incurred in developing the methods of collection and deposit described in subsection (a) of this section and the expenses incurred in carrying out collections and deposits using such methods, including the costs of personal services and the costs of the lease or purchase of equipment and operating facilities.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVI">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VI</span>, § 2652(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1152">98 Stat. 1152</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffb0d68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A"><span itemtype="num" value="3720A">§ 3720A.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reduction of tax refund by amount of debt</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Any Federal agency that is owed by a person a past-due, legally enforceable debt (including debt administered by a third party acting as an agent for the Federal Government) shall, and any agency subject to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1933-05-18/s9"/>section 9 of the Act of May 18, 1933 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s831h"/>16 U.S.C. 831h), owed such a debt may, in accordance with regulations issued pursuant to subsections (b) and (d), notify the Secretary of the Treasury at least once each year of the amount of such debt.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> No Federal agency may take action pursuant to subsection (a) with respect to any debt until such agency—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> notifies the person incurring such debt that such agency proposes to take action pursuant to such paragraph with respect to such debt;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> gives such person at least 60 days to present evidence that all or part of such debt is not past-due or not legally enforceable;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> considers any evidence presented by such person and determines that an amount of such debt is past due and legally enforceable;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> satisfies such other conditions as the Secretary may prescribe to ensure that the determination made under paragraph (3) with respect to such debt is valid and that the agency has made reasonable efforts (determined on a government-wide basis) to obtain payment of such debt; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d6f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> certifies that reasonable efforts have been made by the agency (pursuant to regulations) to obtain payment of such debt.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d70-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Upon receiving notice from any Federal agency that a named person owes to such agency a past-due legally enforceable debt, the Secretary of the Treasury shall determine whether any amounts, as refunds of Federal taxes paid, are payable to such person. If the Secretary of the Treasury finds that any such amount is payable, he shall reduce such refunds by an amount equal to the amount of such debt, pay the amount of such reduction to such agency, and notify such agency of the individual’s home address.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d71-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall issue regulations prescribing the time or times at which agencies must submit notices of past-due legally enforceable debts, the manner in which such notices must be submitted, and the necessary information that must be contained in or accompany the notices. The regulations shall specify the minimum amount of debt to which the reduction procedure established by subsection (c) may be applied and the fee that an agency must pay to reimburse the Secretary of the Treasury for the full cost of applying such procedure. Any fee paid to the Secretary pursuant to the preceding sentence may be used to reimburse appropriations which bore all or part of the cost of applying such procedure.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Any Federal agency receiving notice from the Secretary of the Treasury that an erroneous payment has been made to such agency under subsection (c) shall pay promptly to the Secretary, in accordance with such regulations as the Secretary may prescribe, an amount equal to the amount of such erroneous payment (without regard to whether any other amounts payable to such agency under such subsection have been paid to such agency).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Subsection (a) shall apply with respect to an OASDI overpayment made to any individual only if such individual is not currently entitled to monthly insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The requirements of subsection (b) shall not be treated as met in the case of the recovery of an OASDI overpayment from any individual under this section unless the notification under subsection (b)(1) describes the conditions under which the Commissioner of Social Security is required to waive recovery of an overpayment, as provided under section 204(b) of the Social Security Act.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> In any case in which an individual files for a waiver under section 204(b) of the Social Security Act within the 60-day period referred to in subsection (b)(2), the Commissioner of Social Security shall not certify to the Secretary of the Treasury that the debt is valid under subsection (b)(4) before rendering a decision on the waiver request under such section 204(b). In lieu of payment, pursuant to subsection (c), to the Commissioner of Social Security of the amount of any reduction under this subsection based on an OASDI overpayment, the Secretary of the Treasury shall deposit such amount in the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund or the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund, whichever is certified to the Secretary of the Treasury as appropriate by the Commissioner of Social Security.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> In the case of refunds of business associations, this section shall apply only to refunds payable on or after <p itemtype="date" date="1995-01-01"/>January 1, 1995. In the case of refunds of individuals who owe debts to Federal agencies that have not participated in the Federal tax refund offset program prior to the date of enactment of this subsection, this section shall apply only to refunds payable on or after <p itemtype="date" date="1994-01-01"/>January 1, 1994.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002056"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002056"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> The disbursing official of the Department of the Treasury—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> <p itemtype="sup"/>1 shall notify a taxpayer in writing of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the occurrence of an offset to satisfy a past-due legally enforceable nontax debt;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the identity of the creditor agency requesting the offset; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a contact point within the creditor agency that will handle concerns regarding the offset;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> <p itemtype="sup"/>1 shall notify the Internal Revenue Service on a weekly basis of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the occurrence of an offset to satisfy a past-due legally enforceable non-tax <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002057"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002057"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> debt;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the amount of such offset; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0d82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> any other information required by regulations; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0d83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> shall match payment records with requests for offset by using a name control, taxpayer identifying number (as that term is used in section 6109 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986), and any other necessary identifiers.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> <p itemtype="sup"/>1 The term “disbursing official” of the Department of the Treasury means the Secretary or his designee.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> An agency subject to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1933-05-18/s9"/>section 9 of the Act of May 18, 1933 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s831h"/>16 U.S.C. 831h), may implement this section at its discretion.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/369/dB/tVI">Pub. L. 98–369, div. B, title VI</span>, § 2653(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-07-18">July 18, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1153">98 Stat. 1153</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/508/tV">Pub. L. 101–508, title V</span>, § 5129(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05">Nov. 5, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1388-287">104 Stat. 1388–287</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/589">Pub. L. 102–589</span>, § 3, <span itemtype="date" date="1992-11-10">Nov. 10, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/5133">106 Stat. 5133</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/296/tI">Pub. L. 103–296, title I</span>, § 108(j)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-08-15">Aug. 15, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1488">108 Stat. 1488</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(u)(1), (v)(1), (w), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-375">110 Stat. 1321–375</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffb0d90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720B"><span itemtype="num" value="3720B">§ 3720B.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Barring delinquent Federal debtors from obtaining Federal loans or loan insurance guarantees</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720B/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Unless this subsection is waived by the head of a Federal agency, a person may not obtain any Federal financial assistance in the form of a loan (other than a disaster loan or a marketing assistance loan or loan deficiency payment under subtitle C of the Agricultural Market Transition Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s7231"/>7 U.S.C. 7231 et seq.)) or loan insurance or guarantee administered by the agency if the person has an outstanding debt (other than a debt under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) with any Federal agency which is in a delinquent status, as determined under standards prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury. Such a person may obtain additional loans or loan guarantees only after such delinquency is resolved in accordance with those standards. The Secretary of the Treasury may exempt, at the request of an agency, any class of claims.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720B/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The head of a Federal agency may delegate the waiver authority under subsection (a) to the Chief Financial Officer of the agency. The waiver authority may be redelegated only to the Deputy Chief Financial Officer of the agency.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(j)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-365">110 Stat. 1321–365</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/387">Pub. L. 106–387</span>, § 1(a) [title VIII, § 845(a)], <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-28">Oct. 28, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1549">114 Stat. 1549</span>, 1549A–65.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffb0d99-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C"><span itemtype="num" value="3720C">§ 3720C.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Debt Collection Improvement Account</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d9b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> There is hereby established in the Treasury a special fund to be known as the “Debt Collection Improvement Account” (hereinafter in this section referred to as the “Account”).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Account shall be maintained and managed by the Secretary of the Treasury, who shall ensure that agency programs are credited with amounts transferred under subsection (b)(1).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Not later than 30 days after the end of a fiscal year, an agency may transfer to the Account the amount described in paragraph (3), as adjusted under paragraph (4).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0d9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Agency transfers to the Account may include collections from—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> salary, administrative, and tax refund offsets;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Department of Justice;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> private collection agencies;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> sales of delinquent loans; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> contracts to locate or recover assets.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0da5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The amount referred to in paragraph (1) shall be 5 percent of the amount of delinquent debt collected by an agency in a fiscal year, minus the greater of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 5 percent of the amount of delinquent nontax debt collected by the agency in the previous fiscal year, or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 5 percent of the average annual amount of delinquent nontax debt collected by the agency in the previous 4 fiscal years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0da8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, the Office of Management and Budget may adjust the amount described in paragraph (3) for an agency to reflect the level of effort in credit management programs by the agency. As an indicator of the level of effort in credit management, the Office of Management and Budget shall consider the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0da9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The number of days between the date a claim or debt became delinquent and the date which an agency referred the debt or claim to the Secretary of the Treasury or obtained an exemption from this referral under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g/2"/>section 3711(g)(2) of this title.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0daa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The ratio of delinquent debts or claims to total receivables for a given program, and the change in this ratio over a period of time.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may make payments from the Account solely to reimburse agencies for qualified expenses. For agencies with franchise funds, such payments may be credited to subaccounts designated for debt collection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this section, the term “qualified expenses” means expenditures for the improvement of credit management, debt collection, and debt recovery activities, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> account servicing (including cross-servicing under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3711/g"/>section 3711(g) of this title),<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0daf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> automatic data processing equipment acquisitions,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0db0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> delinquent debt collection,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0db1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> measures to minimize delinquent debt,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0db2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> sales of delinquent debt,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0db3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> asset disposition, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0db4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> training of personnel involved in credit and debt management.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0db5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0db6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Amounts transferred to the Account shall be available to the Secretary of the Treasury for purposes of this section to the extent and in amounts provided in advance in appropriations Acts.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0db7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> As soon as practicable after the end of the third fiscal year after which amounts transferred are first available pursuant to this section, and every 3 years thereafter, any uncommitted balance in the Account shall be transferred to the general fund of the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0db8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> For direct loans and loan guarantee programs subject to title V of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974, amounts credited in accordance with subsection (c) shall be considered administrative costs.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0db9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720C/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe such rules, regulations, and procedures as the Secretary considers necessary or appropriate to carry out the purposes of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(t)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-373">110 Stat. 1321–373</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffb0dbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D"><span itemtype="num" value="3720D">§ 3720D.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Garnishment</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dbe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Notwithstanding any provision of State law, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency that administers a program that gives rise to a delinquent nontax debt owed to the United States by an individual may in accordance with this section garnish the disposable pay of the individual to collect the amount owed, if the individual is not currently making required repayment in accordance with any agreement between the agency head and the individual.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In carrying out any garnishment of disposable pay of an individual under subsection (a), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall comply with the following requirements:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The amount deducted under this section for any pay period may not exceed 15 percent of disposable pay, except that a greater percentage may be deducted with the written consent of the individual.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The individual shall be provided written notice, sent by mail to the individual’s last known address, a minimum of 30 days prior to the initiation of proceedings, from the head of the executive, judicial, or legislative agency, informing the individual of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0dc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the nature and amount of the debt to be collected;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0dc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the intention of the agency to initiate proceedings to collect the debt through deductions from pay; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0dc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> an explanation of the rights of the individual under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The individual shall be provided an opportunity to inspect and copy records relating to the debt.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The individual shall be provided an opportunity to enter into a written agreement with the executive, judicial, or legislative agency, under terms agreeable to the head of the agency, to establish a schedule for repayment of the debt.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The individual shall be provided an opportunity for a hearing in accordance with subsection (c) on the determination of the head of the executive, judicial, or legislative agency concerning—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0dc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the existence or the amount of the debt, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffb0dc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of an individual whose repayment schedule is established other than by a written agreement pursuant to paragraph (4), the terms of the repayment schedule.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> If the individual has been reemployed within 12 months after having been involuntarily separated from employment, no amount may be deducted from the disposable pay of the individual until the individual has been reemployed continuously for at least 12 months.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dcb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dcc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A hearing under subsection (b)(5) shall be provided prior to issuance of a garnishment order if the individual, on or before the 15th day following the mailing of the notice described in subsection (b)(2), and in accordance with such procedures as the head of the executive, judicial, or legislative agency may prescribe, files a petition requesting such a hearing.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dcd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If the individual does not file a petition requesting a hearing prior to such date, the head of the agency shall provide the individual a hearing under subsection (a)(5) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002058"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002058"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> upon request, but such hearing need not be provided prior to issuance of a garnishment order.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The hearing official shall issue a final decision at the earliest practicable date, but not later than 60 days after the filing of the petition requesting the hearing.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dcf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The notice to the employer of the withholding order shall contain only such information as may be necessary for the employer to comply with the withholding order.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> An employer may not discharge from employment, refuse to employ, or take disciplinary action against an individual subject to wage withholding in accordance with this section by reason of the fact that the individual’s wages have been subject to garnishment under this section, and such individual may sue in a State or Federal court of competent jurisdiction any employer who takes such action.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The court shall award attorneys’ fees to a prevailing employee and, in its discretion, may order reinstatement of the individual, award punitive damages and back pay to the employee, or order such other remedy as may be reasonably necessary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The employer of an individual—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> shall pay to the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency as directed in a withholding order issued in an action under this section with respect to the individual, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffb0dd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> shall be liable for any amount that the employer fails to withhold from wages due an employee following receipt by such employer of notice of the withholding order, plus attorneys’ fees, costs, and, in the court’s discretion, punitive damages.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency may sue an employer in a State or Federal court of competent jurisdiction to recover amounts for which the employer is liable under paragraph (1)(B).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffb0dd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> A suit under this paragraph may not be filed before the termination of the collection action, unless earlier filing is necessary to avoid expiration of any applicable statute of limitations period.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) and (2), an employer shall not be required to vary its normal pay and disbursement cycles in order to comply with this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> For the purpose of this section, the term “disposable pay” means that part of the compensation of any individual from an employer remaining after the deduction of any amounts required by any other law to be withheld.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720D/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall issue regulations to implement this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(<span itemtype="i">o</span>)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-369">110 Stat. 1321–369</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd56ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E"><span itemtype="num" value="3720E">§ 3720E.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Dissemination of information regarding identity of delinquent debtors</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The head of any agency may, with the review of the Secretary of the Treasury, for the purpose of collecting any delinquent nontax debt owed by any person, publish or otherwise publicly disseminate information regarding the identity of the person and the existence of the nontax debt.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the heads of other appropriate Federal agencies, shall issue regulations establishing procedures and requirements the Secretary considers appropriate to carry out this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Regulations under this subsection shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> standards for disseminating information that maximize collections of delinquent nontax debts, by directing actions under this section toward delinquent debtors that have assets or income sufficient to pay their delinquent nontax debt;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> procedures and requirements that prevent dissemination of information under this section regarding persons who have not had an opportunity to verify, contest, and compromise their nontax debt in accordance with this subchapter; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3720E/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> procedures to ensure that persons are not incorrectly identified pursuant to this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(r)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-372">110 Stat. 1321–372</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id0ffd56d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch37/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">CLAIMS AGAINST THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd56d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721"><span itemtype="num" value="3721">§ 3721.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Claims of personnel of agencies and the District of Columbia government for personal property damage or loss</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “agency” does not include a nonappropriated fund activity or a contractor with the United States Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “head of an agency” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> for a military department, the Secretary of the military department;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> for the Department of Defense (except the military departments), the Secretary of Defense; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> for another agency, the head of the agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “settle” means consider, determine, adjust, and dispose of a claim by disallowance or by complete or partial allowance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of an agency may settle and pay not more than $40,000 for a claim against the Government made by a member of the uniformed services under the jurisdiction of the agency or by an officer or employee of the agency for damage to, or loss of, personal property incident to service. If, however, the claim arose from an emergency evacuation or from extraordinary circumstances, the amount settled and paid under the authority of the preceding sentence may exceed $40,000, but may not exceed $100,000. A claim allowed under this subsection may be paid in money or the personal property replaced in kind.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary of State may waive the settlement and payment limitation referred to in paragraph (1) for claims for damage or loss by United States Government personnel under the jurisdiction of a chief of mission in a foreign country if such claims arise in circumstances where there is in effect a departure from the country authorized or ordered under circumstances described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s5522/a"/>section 5522(a) of title 5, if the Secretary determines that there exists exceptional circumstances that warrant such a waiver.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> On paying a claim under this section, the Government is subrogated for the amount of the payment to a right or claim that the claimant may have against a foreign country for the damage or loss for which the Government made the payment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Mayor of the District of Columbia may settle and pay a claim against the District of Columbia government made by an officer or employee of the District of Columbia government to the same extent the head of an agency may settle and pay a claim under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A claim may not be allowed under this section if the personal property damage or loss occurred at quarters occupied by the claimant in a State or the District of Columbia that were not assigned or provided in kind by the United States Government or the District of Columbia government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A claim may be allowed under this section only if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the claim is substantiated;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the head of the agency decides that possession of the property was reasonable or useful under the circumstances; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> no part of the loss was caused by any negligent or wrongful act of the claimant or an agent or employee of the claimant.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> A claim may be allowed under this section only if it is presented in writing within 2 years after the claim accrues. However, if a claim under subsection (b) of this section accrues during war or an armed conflict in which an armed force of the United States is involved, or has accrued within 2 years before war or an armed conflict begins, and for cause shown, the claim must be presented within 2 years after the cause no longer exists or after the war or armed conflict ends, whichever is earlier. An armed conflict begins and ends as stated in a concurrent resolution of Congress or a decision of the President.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of the agency—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may settle and pay a claim made by the surviving spouse, child, parent, or brother or sister of a dead member, officer, or employee if the claim is otherwise payable under this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd56ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> may settle and pay the claims by the survivors only in the following order:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the spouse’s claim.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a child’s claim.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a parent’s claim.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd56f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/h/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a brother’s or sister’s claim.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Notwithstanding a contract, the representative of a claimant may not receive more than 10 percent of a payment of a claim made under this section for services related to the claim. A person violating this subsection shall be fined not more than $1,000.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> The President may prescribe policies to carry out this section (except subsection (b) to the extent that subsection (b) applies to the military departments, the Department of Defense, and the Coast Guard). Subject to those policies, the head of each agency shall prescribe regulations to carry out this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd56f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3721/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span></p> Settlement of a claim under this section is final and conclusive.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/973">96 Stat. 973</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(17), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2474">96 Stat. 2474</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/565">Pub. L. 100–565</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-31">Oct. 31, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2833">102 Stat. 2833</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/236/tI">Pub. L. 103–236, title I</span>, § 172(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-04-30">Apr. 30, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/412">108 Stat. 412</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/106/dA/tX">Pub. L. 104–106, div. A, title X</span>, § 1088(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/458">110 Stat. 458</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd5700-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722"><span itemtype="num" value="3722">§ 3722.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Claims of officers and employees at Government penal and correctional institutions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5701-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Attorney General may settle and pay not more than $1,000 in any one case for a claim made by an officer or employee at a United States Government penal or correctional institution for damage to, or loss of, personal property incident to employment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5702-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A claim may not be allowed under this section if the loss occurred at quarters occupied by the claimant that were not assigned or provided in kind by the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5703-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A claim may be allowed only if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5704-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> no part of the loss was caused by any negligent or wrongful act of the claimant or an agent or employee of the claimant;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5705-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Attorney General decides that possession of the property was reasonable or useful under the circumstances; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5706-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> it is presented in writing within one year after it accrues.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5707-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> A claim may be paid under this section only if the claimant accepts the amount of the settlement in complete satisfaction of the claim.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5708-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3722/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Necessary amounts are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/974">96 Stat. 974</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd570c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3723"><span itemtype="num" value="3723">§ 3723.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Small claims for privately owned property damage or loss</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd570d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3723/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an agency (except a military department of the Department of Defense or the Coast Guard) may settle a claim for not more than $1,000 for damage to, or loss of, privately owned property that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd570e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3723/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is caused by the negligence of an officer or employee of the United States Government acting within the scope of employment; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd570f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3723/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may not be settled under chapter 171 of title 28.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5710-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3723/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A claim under this section may be allowed only if it is presented to the head of the agency within one year after it accrues.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5711-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3723/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A claim under this section may be paid as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1304"/>section 1304 of this title only if the claimant accepts the amount of the settlement in complete satisfaction of the claim against the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/975">96 Stat. 975</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd5716-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3724"><span itemtype="num" value="3724">§ 3724.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Claims for damages caused by investigative or law enforcement officers of the Department of Justice</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5717-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3724/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Attorney General may settle, for not more than $50,000 in any one case, a claim for personal injury, death, or damage to, or loss of, privately owned property, caused by an investigative or law enforcement officer as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s2680/h"/>section 2680(h) of title 28 who is employed by the Department of Justice acting within the scope of employment that may not be settled under chapter 171 of title 28. An officer or employee of the United States Government may not present a claim arising during the scope of employment. A claim may be allowed only if it is presented to the Attorney General within one year after it accrues.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5718-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3724/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A claim may be paid under this section only if the claimant accepts the amount of the settlement in complete satisfaction of the claim against the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/975">96 Stat. 975</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/203">Pub. L. 101–203</span>, § 1(a), (b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-12-07">Dec. 7, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/1805">103 Stat. 1805</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/362/tX">Pub. L. 105–362, title X</span>, § 1001(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-11-10">Nov. 10, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3291">112 Stat. 3291</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd571f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3725"><span itemtype="num" value="3725">§ 3725.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Claims of non-nationals for personal injury or death in a foreign country</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5720-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3725/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of State may settle, for not more than $1,500 in any one case, a claim for personal injury or death of an individual not a national of the United States in a foreign country in which the United States exercises privileges of extraterritoriality when the injury or death is caused by an officer, employee, or agent of the United States Government (except of a military department of the Department of Defense or the Coast Guard). An officer or employee of the Government may not present a claim. A claim under this section may be allowed only if it is presented to the Secretary within one year after it accrues.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5721-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3725/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary shall certify to Congress a settlement under this section for payment out of an appropriation that may be made to pay the settlement. The Secretary shall include a brief statement on the type of the claim, the amount claimed, and the amount of the settlement.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5722-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3725/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A claim may be paid under this section only if the claimant accepts the amount of the settlement in complete satisfaction of the claim against the Government.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/975">96 Stat. 975</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd5727-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726"><span itemtype="num" value="3726">§ 3726.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment for transportation</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5728-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5729-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Each agency that receives a bill from a carrier or freight forwarder for transporting an individual or property for the United States Government shall verify its correctness (to include transportation rates, freight classifications, or proper combinations thereof), using prepayment audit, prior to payment in accordance with the requirements of this section and regulations prescribed by the Administrator of General Services.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd572a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Administrator of General Services may exempt bills, a particular mode or modes of transportation, or an agency or subagency from a prepayment audit and verification and in lieu thereof require a postpayment audit, based on cost effectiveness, public interest, or other factors the Administrator considers appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd572b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Expenses for prepayment audits shall be funded by the agency’s appropriations used for the transportation services.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd572c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The audit authority provided to agencies by this section is subject to oversight by the Administrator.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd572d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Administrator may conduct pre- or post-payment audits of transportation bills of any Federal agency. The number and types of bills audited shall be based on the Administrator’s judgment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd572e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd572f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Administrator shall adjudicate transportation claims which cannot be resolved by the agency procuring the transportation services, or the carrier or freight-forwarder presenting the bill.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5730-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A claim under this section shall be allowed only if it is received by the Administrator not later than 3 years (excluding time of war) after the later of the following dates:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5731-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The date of accrual of the claim.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5732-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The date payment for the transportation is made.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5733-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The date a refund for an overpayment for the transportation is made.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5734-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/c/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> The date a deduction under subsection (d) of this section is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5735-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Not later than 3 years (excluding time of war) after the time a bill is paid, the Government may deduct from an amount subsequently due a carrier or freight forwarder an amount paid on the bill that was greater than the rate allowed under—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5736-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a lawful tariff under title 49 or on file with the Secretary of Transportation with respect to foreign air transportation (as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t49/s40102/a"/>section 40102(a) of title 49), the Federal Maritime Commission, or a State transportation authority;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5737-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a lawfully quoted rate subject to the jurisdiction of the Surface Transportation Board; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5738-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> sections 10721, 13712, and 15504 of title 49 or an equivalent arrangement or an exemption.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5739-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Expenses of transportation audit postpayment contracts and contract administration, and the expenses of all other transportation audit and audit-related functions conferred upon the Administrator of General Services, shall be financed from overpayments collected from carriers on transportation bills paid by the Government and other similar type refunds, not to exceed collections. Payment to any contractor for audit services shall not exceed 50 percent of the overpayment identified by contract audit.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd573a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> At least annually, and as determined by the Administrator, after making adequate provision for expense of refunds to carriers, transportation audit postpayment contracts, contract administration, and other expenses authorized in subsection (e), overpayments collected by the General Services Administration shall be transferred to miscellaneous receipts of the Treasury. A report of receipts, disbursements, and transfers (to miscellaneous receipts) pursuant to this section shall be made annually in connection with the budget estimates to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and to the Congress. This reporting requirement expires <p itemtype="date" date="1998-12-31"/>December 31, 1998.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd573b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> The Administrator may delegate any authority conferred by this section to another agency or agencies if the Administrator determines that such a delegation would be cost-effective or otherwise in the public interest.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd573c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> Under regulations the head of an agency prescribes that conform with standards the Secretary of the Treasury prescribes, a bill under this section may be paid before the transportation is completed notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3324"/>section 3324 of this title when a carrier or freight forwarder issues the usual document for the transportation.
