Payment for transportation ordered but not provided may be recovered by deduction or other means.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd573d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd573e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A carrier or freight forwarder may request the Administrator of General Services to review the action of the Administrator if the request is received not later than 6 months (excluding time of war) after the Administrator acts or within the time stated in subsection (c) of this section, whichever is later.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd573f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> This section does not prevent the Comptroller General from conducting an audit under chapter 35 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5740-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3726/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> The Administrator of General Services may provide transportation audit and related technical assistance services, on a reimbursable basis, to any other agency. Such reimbursements may be credited to the appropriate revolving fund or appropriation from which the expenses were incurred.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/976">96 Stat. 976</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/443">Pub. L. 98–443</span>, § 9(f), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-04">Oct. 4, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/1707">98 Stat. 1707</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/627">Pub. L. 99–627</span>, § 1, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-11-07">Nov. 7, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3508">100 Stat. 3508</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/123/tVI">Pub. L. 103–123, title VI</span>, § 620A, <span itemtype="date" date="1993-10-28">Oct. 28, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/1265">107 Stat. 1265</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, §§ 4(f)(1)(N), 5(i)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>, 1375; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/429">Pub. L. 103–429</span>, § 7(a)(3)(B), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-31">Oct. 31, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/4388">108 Stat. 4388</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/88/tIII">Pub. L. 104–88, title III</span>, § 306, <span itemtype="date" date="1995-12-29">Dec. 29, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/945">109 Stat. 945</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tII">Pub. L. 104–316, title II</span>, § 202(<span itemtype="i">o</span>), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3844">110 Stat. 3844</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/264">Pub. L. 105–264</span>, § 3(a)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-19">Oct. 19, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2353">112 Stat. 2353</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0ffd574a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727"><span itemtype="num" value="3727">§ 3727.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Assignments of claims</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd574b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section, “assignment” means—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd574c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a transfer or assignment of any part of a claim against the United States Government or of an interest in the claim; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd574d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the authorization to receive payment for any part of the claim.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd574e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An assignment may be made only after a claim is allowed, the amount of the claim is decided, and a warrant for payment of the claim has been issued. The assignment shall specify the warrant, must be made freely, and must be attested to by 2 witnesses. The person making the assignment shall acknowledge it before an official who may acknowledge a deed, and the official shall certify the assignment. The certificate shall state that the official completely explained the assignment when it was acknowledged. An assignment under this subsection is valid for any purpose.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd574f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subsection (b) of this section does not apply to an assignment to a financing institution of money due or to become due under a contract providing for payments totaling at least $1,000 when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5750-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the contract does not forbid an assignment;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5751-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> unless the contract expressly provides otherwise, the assignment—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd5752-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is for the entire amount not already paid;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd5753-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is made to only one party, except that it may be made to a party as agent or trustee for more than one party participating in the financing; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0ffd5754-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> may not be reassigned; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0ffd5755-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the assignee files a written notice of the assignment and a copy of the assignment with the contracting official or the head of the agency, the surety on a bond on the contract, and any disbursing official for the contract.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0ffd5756-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> During a war or national emergency proclaimed by the President or declared by law and ended by proclamation or law, a contract with the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, the Department of Energy (when carrying out duties and powers formerly carried out by the Atomic Energy Commission), or other agency the President designates may provide, or may be changed without consideration to provide, that a future payment under the contract to an assignee is not subject to reduction or setoff. A payment subsequently due under the contract (even after the war or emergency is ended) shall be paid to the assignee without a reduction or setoff for liability of the assignor—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc857-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to the Government independent of the contract; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc858-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> because of renegotiation, fine, penalty (except an amount that may be collected or withheld under, or because the assignor does not comply with, the contract), taxes, social security contributions, or withholding or failing to withhold taxes or social security contributions, arising from, or independent of, the contract.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc859-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc85a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> An assignee under this section does not have to make restitution of, refund, or repay the amount received because of the liability of the assignor to the Government that arises from or is independent of the contract.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc85b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3727/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Government may not collect or reclaim money paid to a person receiving an amount under an assignment or allotment of pay or allowances authorized by law when liability may exist because of the death of the person making the assignment or allotment.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/976">96 Stat. 976</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fffc85f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728"><span itemtype="num" value="3728">§ 3728.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Setoff against judgment</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc860-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall withhold paying that part of a judgment against the United States Government presented to the Secretary that is equal to a debt the plaintiff owes the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc861-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc862-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> discharge the debt if the plaintiff agrees to the setoff and discharges a part of the judgment equal to the debt; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc863-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc864-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> withhold payment of an additional amount the Secretary decides will cover legal costs of bringing a civil action for the debt if the plaintiff denies the debt or does not agree to the setoff; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc865-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> have a civil action brought if one has not already been brought.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc866-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3728/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> If the Government loses a civil action to recover a debt or recovers less than the amount the Secretary withholds under this section, the Secretary shall pay the plaintiff the balance and interest of 6 percent for the time the money is withheld.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/977">96 Stat. 977</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tII">Pub. L. 104–316, title II</span>, § 202(p), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3844">110 Stat. 3844</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fffc86b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729"><span itemtype="num" value="3729">§ 3729.</span><span itemtype="heading"> False claims</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc86c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Liability for Certain Acts.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc86d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Subject to paragraph (2), any person who—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc86e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> knowingly presents, or causes to be presented, a false or fraudulent claim for payment or approval;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc86f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> knowingly makes, uses, or causes to be made or used, a false record or statement material to a false or fraudulent claim;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc870-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> conspires to commit a violation of subparagraph (A), (B), (D), (E), (F), or (G);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc871-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> has possession, custody, or control of property or money used, or to be used, by the Government and knowingly delivers, or causes to be delivered, less than all of that money or property;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc872-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> is authorized to make or deliver a document certifying receipt of property used, or to be used, by the Government and, intending to defraud the Government, makes or delivers the receipt without completely knowing that the information on the receipt is true;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc873-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> knowingly buys, or receives as a pledge of an obligation or debt, public property from an officer or employee of the Government, or a member of the Armed Forces, who lawfully may not sell or pledge property; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc874-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> knowingly makes, uses, or causes to be made or used, a false record or statement material to an obligation to pay or transmit money or property to the Government, or knowingly conceals or knowingly and improperly avoids or decreases an obligation to pay or transmit money or property to the Government,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>is liable to the United States Government for a civil penalty of not less than $5,000 and not more than $10,000, as adjusted by the Federal Civil Penalties Inflation Adjustment Act of 1990 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s2461">28 U.S.C. 2461</span> note; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/410">Public Law 104–410</span> <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002059">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002059"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p>), plus 3 times the amount of damages which the Government sustains because of the act of that person.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc875-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reduced damages</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the court finds that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc876-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the person committing the violation of this subsection furnished officials of the United States responsible for investigating false claims violations with all information known to such person about the violation within 30 days after the date on which the defendant first obtained the information;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc877-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> such person fully cooperated with any Government investigation of such violation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc878-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> at the time such person furnished the United States with the information about the violation, no criminal prosecution, civil action, or administrative action had commenced under this title with respect to such violation, and the person did not have actual knowledge of the existence of an investigation into such violation,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>the court may assess not less than 2 times the amount of damages which the Government sustains because of the act of that person.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc879-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Costs of civil actions</span>.—</span></p>A person violating this subsection shall also be liable to the United States Government for the costs of a civil action brought to recover any such penalty or damages.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc87a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc87b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the terms “knowing” and “knowingly”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc87c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> mean that a person, with respect to information—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fffc87d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> has actual knowledge of the information;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fffc87e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> acts in deliberate ignorance of the truth or falsity of the information; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fffc87f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/1/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> acts in reckless disregard of the truth or falsity of the information; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc880-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> require no proof of specific intent to defraud;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc881-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the term “claim”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc882-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> means any request or demand, whether under a contract or otherwise, for money or property and whether or not the United States has title to the money or property, that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fffc883-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> is presented to an officer, employee, or agent of the United States; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id0fffc884-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> is made to a contractor, grantee, or other recipient, if the money or property is to be spent or used on the Government’s behalf or to advance a Government program or interest, and if the United States Government—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id0fffc885-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2/A/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> provides or has provided any portion of the money or property requested or demanded; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id0fffc886-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2/A/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> will reimburse such contractor, grantee, or other recipient for any portion of the money or property which is requested or demanded; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id0fffc887-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> does not include requests or demands for money or property that the Government has paid to an individual as compensation for Federal employment or as an income subsidy with no restrictions on that individual’s use of the money or property;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc888-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the term “obligation” means an established duty, whether or not fixed, arising from an express or implied contractual, grantor-grantee, or licensor-licensee relationship, from a fee-based or similar relationship, from statute or regulation, or from the retention of any overpayment; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc889-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the term “material” means having a natural tendency to influence, or be capable of influencing, the payment or receipt of money or property.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc88a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exemption From Disclosure</span>.—</span></p>Any information furnished pursuant to subsection (a)(2) shall be exempt from disclosure under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552"/>section 552 of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc88b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3729/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exclusion</span>.—</span></p>This section does not apply to claims, records, or statements made under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/978">96 Stat. 978</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/562">Pub. L. 99–562</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3153">100 Stat. 3153</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(O), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/21">Pub. L. 111–21</span>, § 4(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-05-20">May 20, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/1621">123 Stat. 1621</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fffc893-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730"><span itemtype="num" value="3730">§ 3730.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil actions for false claims</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc894-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Responsibilities of the Attorney General</span>.—</span></p>The Attorney General diligently shall investigate a violation under section 3729. If the Attorney General finds that a person has violated or is violating section 3729, the Attorney General may bring a civil action under this section against the person.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc895-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Actions by Private Persons</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc896-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A person may bring a civil action for a violation of section 3729 for the person and for the United States Government. The action shall be brought in the name of the Government. The action may be dismissed only if the court and the Attorney General give written consent to the dismissal and their reasons for consenting.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc897-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A copy of the complaint and written disclosure of substantially all material evidence and information the person possesses shall be served on the Government pursuant to Rule 4(d)(4) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002060"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002060"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure. The complaint shall be filed in camera, shall remain under seal for at least 60 days, and shall not be served on the defendant until the court so orders. The Government may elect to intervene and proceed with the action within 60 days after it receives both the complaint and the material evidence and information.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc898-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Government may, for good cause shown, move the court for extensions of the time during which the complaint remains under seal under paragraph (2). Any such motions may be supported by affidavits or other submissions in camera. The defendant shall not be required to respond to any complaint filed under this section until 20 days after the complaint is unsealed and served upon the defendant pursuant to Rule 4 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc899-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before the expiration of the 60-day period or any extensions obtained under paragraph (3), the Government shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc89a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> proceed with the action, in which case the action shall be conducted by the Government; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc89b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> notify the court that it declines to take over the action, in which case the person bringing the action shall have the right to conduct the action.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc89c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> When a person brings an action under this subsection, no person other than the Government may intervene or bring a related action based on the facts underlying the pending action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc89d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rights of the Parties to Qui Tam Actions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc89e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If the Government proceeds with the action, it shall have the primary responsibility for prosecuting the action, and shall not be bound by an act of the person bringing the action. Such person shall have the right to continue as a party to the action, subject to the limitations set forth in paragraph (2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc89f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Government may dismiss the action notwithstanding the objections of the person initiating the action if the person has been notified by the Government of the filing of the motion and the court has provided the person with an opportunity for a hearing on the motion.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Government may settle the action with the defendant notwithstanding the objections of the person initiating the action if the court determines, after a hearing, that the proposed settlement is fair, adequate, and reasonable under all the circumstances. Upon a showing of good cause, such hearing may be held in camera.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Upon a showing by the Government that unrestricted participation during the course of the litigation by the person initiating the action would interfere with or unduly delay the Government’s prosecution of the case, or would be repetitious, irrelevant, or for purposes of harassment, the court may, in its discretion, impose limitations on the person’s participation, such as—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> limiting the number of witnesses the person may call;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> limiting the length of the testimony of such witnesses;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> limiting the person’s cross-examination of witnesses; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> otherwise limiting the participation by the person in the litigation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> Upon a showing by the defendant that unrestricted participation during the course of the litigation by the person initiating the action would be for purposes of harassment or would cause the defendant undue burden or unnecessary expense, the court may limit the participation by the person in the litigation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> If the Government elects not to proceed with the action, the person who initiated the action shall have the right to conduct the action. If the Government so requests, it shall be served with copies of all pleadings filed in the action and shall be supplied with copies of all deposition transcripts (at the Government’s expense). When a person proceeds with the action, the court, without limiting the status and rights of the person initiating the action, may nevertheless permit the Government to intervene at a later date upon a showing of good cause.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Whether or not the Government proceeds with the action, upon a showing by the Government that certain actions of discovery by the person initiating the action would interfere with the Government’s investigation or prosecution of a criminal or civil matter arising out of the same facts, the court may stay such discovery for a period of not more than 60 days. Such a showing shall be conducted in camera. The court may extend the 60-day period upon a further showing in camera that the Government has pursued the criminal or civil investigation or proceedings with reasonable diligence and any proposed discovery in the civil action will interfere with the ongoing criminal or civil investigation or proceedings.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Notwithstanding subsection (b), the Government may elect to pursue its claim through any alternate remedy available to the Government, including any administrative proceeding to determine a civil money penalty. If any such alternate remedy is pursued in another proceeding, the person initiating the action shall have the same rights in such proceeding as such person would have had if the action had continued under this section. Any finding of fact or conclusion of law made in such other proceeding that has become final shall be conclusive on all parties to an action under this section. For purposes of the preceding sentence, a finding or conclusion is final if it has been finally determined on appeal to the appropriate court of the United States, if all time for filing such an appeal with respect to the finding or conclusion has expired, or if the finding or conclusion is not subject to judicial review.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Award to Qui Tam Plaintiff</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If the Government proceeds with an action brought by a person under subsection (b), such person shall, subject to the second sentence of this paragraph, receive at least 15 percent but not more than 25 percent of the proceeds of the action or settlement of the claim, depending upon the extent to which the person substantially contributed to the prosecution of the action. Where the action is one which the court finds to be based primarily on disclosures of specific information (other than information provided by the person bringing the action) relating to allegations or transactions in a criminal, civil, or administrative hearing, in a congressional, administrative, or Government <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002061"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002061"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> Accounting Office report, hearing, audit, or investigation, or from the news media, the court may award such sums as it considers appropriate, but in no case more than 10 percent of the proceeds, taking into account the significance of the information and the role of the person bringing the action in advancing the case to litigation. Any payment to a person under the first or second sentence of this paragraph shall be made from the proceeds. Any such person shall also receive an amount for reasonable expenses which the court finds to have been necessarily incurred, plus reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs. All such expenses, fees, and costs shall be awarded against the defendant.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If the Government does not proceed with an action under this section, the person bringing the action or settling the claim shall receive an amount which the court decides is reasonable for collecting the civil penalty and damages. The amount shall be not less than 25 percent and not more than 30 percent of the proceeds of the action or settlement and shall be paid out of such proceeds. Such person shall also receive an amount for reasonable expenses which the court finds to have been necessarily incurred, plus reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs. All such expenses, fees, and costs shall be awarded against the defendant.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Whether or not the Government proceeds with the action, if the court finds that the action was brought by a person who planned and initiated the violation of section 3729 upon which the action was brought, then the court may, to the extent the court considers appropriate, reduce the share of the proceeds of the action which the person would otherwise receive under paragraph (1) or (2) of this subsection, taking into account the role of that person in advancing the case to litigation and any relevant circumstances pertaining to the violation. If the person bringing the action is convicted of criminal conduct arising from his or her role in the violation of section 3729, that person shall be dismissed from the civil action and shall not receive any share of the proceeds of the action. Such dismissal shall not prejudice the right of the United States to continue the action, represented by the Department of Justice.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> If the Government does not proceed with the action and the person bringing the action conducts the action, the court may award to the defendant its reasonable attorneys’ fees and expenses if the defendant prevails in the action and the court finds that the claim of the person bringing the action was clearly frivolous, clearly vexatious, or brought primarily for purposes of harassment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Certain Actions Barred</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> No court shall have jurisdiction over an action brought by a former or present member of the armed forces under subsection (b) of this section against a member of the armed forces arising out of such person’s service in the armed forces.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> No court shall have jurisdiction over an action brought under subsection (b) against a Member of Congress, a member of the judiciary, or a senior executive branch official if the action is based on evidence or information known to the Government when the action was brought.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> For purposes of this paragraph, “senior executive branch official” means any officer or employee listed in paragraphs (1) through (8) of section 101(f) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> In no event may a person bring an action under subsection (b) which is based upon allegations or transactions which are the subject of a civil suit or an administrative civil money penalty proceeding in which the Government is already a party.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The court shall dismiss an action or claim under this section, unless opposed by the Government, if substantially the same allegations or transactions as alleged in the action or claim were publicly disclosed—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> in a Federal criminal, civil, or administrative hearing in which the Government or its agent is a party;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> in a congressional, Government Accountability Office, or other Federal report, hearing, audit, or investigation; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/4/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> from the news media,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>unless the action is brought by the Attorney General or the person bringing the action is an original source of the information.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/e/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> For purposes of this paragraph, “original source” means an individual who either (i) prior to a public disclosure under subsection (e)(4)(a), has voluntarily disclosed to the Government the information on which allegations or transactions in a claim are based, or (2) who has knowledge that is independent of and materially adds to the publicly disclosed allegations or transactions, and who has voluntarily provided the information to the Government before filing an action under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Government Not Liable for Certain Expenses</span>.—</span></p>The Government is not liable for expenses which a person incurs in bringing an action under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Fees and Expenses to Prevailing Defendant</span>.—</span></p>In civil actions brought under this section by the United States, the provisions of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s2412/d"/>section 2412(d) of title 28 shall apply.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Relief From Retaliatory Actions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Any employee, contractor, or agent shall be entitled to all relief necessary to make that employee, contractor, or agent whole, if that employee, contractor, or agent is discharged, demoted, suspended, threatened, harassed, or in any other manner discriminated against in the terms and conditions of employment because of lawful acts done by the employee, contractor, agent or associated others in furtherance of an action under this section or other efforts to stop 1 or more violations of this subchapter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Relief</span>.—</span></p>Relief under paragraph (1) shall include reinstatement with the same seniority status that employee, contractor, or agent would have had but for the discrimination, 2 times the amount of back pay, interest on the back pay, and compensation for any special damages sustained as a result of the discrimination, including litigation costs and reasonable attorneys’ fees. An action under this subsection may be brought in the appropriate district court of the United States for the relief provided in this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3730/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation on bringing civil action</span>.—</span></p>A civil action under this subsection may not be brought more than 3 years after the date when the retaliation occurred.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/978">96 Stat. 978</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/562">Pub. L. 99–562</span>, §§ 3, 4, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3154">100 Stat. 3154</span>, 3157; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/700">Pub. L. 100–700</span>, § 9, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-11-19">Nov. 19, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/4638">102 Stat. 4638</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/280">Pub. L. 101–280</span>, § 10(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-05-04">May 4, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/162">104 Stat. 162</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(P), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/21">Pub. L. 111–21</span>, § 4(d), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-05-20">May 20, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/1624">123 Stat. 1624</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/148/tX">Pub. L. 111–148, title X</span>, § 10104(j)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-03-23">Mar. 23, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/901">124 Stat. 901</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/203/tX">Pub. L. 111–203, title X</span>, § 1079A(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2010-07-21">July 21, 2010</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/2079">124 Stat. 2079</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fffc8ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731"><span itemtype="num" value="3731">§ 3731.</span><span itemtype="heading"> False claims procedure</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A subpena requiring the attendance of a witness at a trial or hearing conducted under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3730"/>section 3730 of this title may be served at any place in the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A civil action under section 3730 may not be brought—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> more than 6 years after the date on which the violation of section 3729 is committed, or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id0fffc8ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> more than 3 years after the date when facts material to the right of action are known or reasonably should have been known by the official of the United States charged with responsibility to act in the circumstances, but in no event more than 10 years after the date on which the violation is committed,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>whichever occurs last.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> If the Government elects to intervene and proceed with an action brought under 3730(b),<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002062"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002062"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> the Government may file its own complaint or amend the complaint of a person who has brought an action under section 3730(b) to clarify or add detail to the claims in which the Government is intervening and to add any additional claims with respect to which the Government contends it is entitled to relief. For statute of limitations purposes, any such Government pleading shall relate back to the filing date of the complaint of the person who originally brought the action, to the extent that the claim of the Government arises out of the conduct, transactions, or occurrences set forth, or attempted to be set forth, in the prior complaint of that person.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> In any action brought under section 3730, the United States shall be required to prove all essential elements of the cause of action, including damages, by a preponderance of the evidence.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3731/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, or the Federal Rules of Evidence, a final judgment rendered in favor of the United States in any criminal proceeding charging fraud or false statements, whether upon a verdict after trial or upon a plea of guilty or nolo contendere, shall estop the defendant from denying the essential elements of the offense in any action which involves the same transaction as in the criminal proceeding and which is brought under subsection (a) or (b) of section 3730.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/979">96 Stat. 979</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/562">Pub. L. 99–562</span>, § 5, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3158">100 Stat. 3158</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/21">Pub. L. 111–21</span>, § 4(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-05-20">May 20, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/1623">123 Stat. 1623</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id0fffc8d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3732"><span itemtype="num" value="3732">§ 3732.</span><span itemtype="heading"> False claims jurisdiction</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id0fffc8d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3732/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Actions Under Section</span> 3730.—</span></p>Any action under section 3730 may be brought in any judicial district in which the defendant or, in the case of multiple defendants, any one defendant can be found, resides, transacts business, or in which any act proscribed by section 3729 occurred. A summons as required by the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure shall be issued by the appropriate district court and served at any place within or outside the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3732/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Claims Under State Law</span>.—</span></p>The district courts shall have jurisdiction over any action brought under the laws of any State for the recovery of funds paid by a State or local government if the action arises from the same transaction or occurrence as an action brought under section 3730.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3732/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Service on State or Local Authorities</span>.—</span></p>With respect to any State or local government that is named as a co-plaintiff with the United States in an action brought under subsection (b), a seal on the action ordered by the court under section 3730(b) shall not preclude the Government or the person bringing the action from serving the complaint, any other pleadings, or the written disclosure of substantially all material evidence and information possessed by the person bringing the action on the law enforcement authorities that are authorized under the law of that State or local government to investigate and prosecute such actions on behalf of such governments, except that such seal applies to the law enforcement authorities so served to the same extent as the seal applies to other parties in the action.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/562">Pub. L. 99–562</span>, § 6(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3158">100 Stat. 3158</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/21">Pub. L. 111–21</span>, § 4(e), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-05-20">May 20, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/1625">123 Stat. 1625</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id100211d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733"><span itemtype="num" value="3733">§ 3733.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil investigative demands</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> In General.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Issuance and service</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Whenever the Attorney General, or a designee (for purposes of this section), has reason to believe that any person may be in possession, custody, or control of any documentary material or information relevant to a false claims law investigation, the Attorney General, or a designee, may, before commencing a civil proceeding under section 3730(a) or other false claims law, or making an election under section 3730(b), issue in writing and cause to be served upon such person, a civil investigative demand requiring such person—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to produce such documentary material for inspection and copying,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to answer in writing written interrogatories with respect to such documentary material or information,<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> to give oral testimony concerning such documentary material or information, or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> to furnish any combination of such material, answers, or testimony.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>The Attorney General may delegate the authority to issue civil investigative demands under this subsection. Whenever a civil investigative demand is an express demand for any product of discovery, the Attorney General, the Deputy Attorney General, or an Assistant Attorney General shall cause to be served, in any manner authorized by this section, a copy of such demand upon the person from whom the discovery was obtained and shall notify the person to whom such demand is issued of the date on which such copy was served. Any information obtained by the Attorney General or a designee of the Attorney General under this section may be shared with any qui tam relator if the Attorney General or designee determine it is necessary as part of any false claims act <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002063">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002063"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> investigation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Contents and deadlines.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Each civil investigative demand issued under paragraph (1) shall state the nature of the conduct constituting the alleged violation of a false claims law which is under investigation, and the applicable provision of law alleged to be violated.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If such demand is for the production of documentary material, the demand shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> describe each class of documentary material to be produced with such definiteness and certainty as to permit such material to be fairly identified;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> prescribe a return date for each such class which will provide a reasonable period of time within which the material so demanded may be assembled and made available for inspection and copying; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> identify the false claims law investigator to whom such material shall be made available.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If such demand is for answers to written interrogatories, the demand shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> set forth with specificity the written interrogatories to be answered;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> prescribe dates at which time answers to written interrogatories shall be submitted; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> identify the false claims law investigator to whom such answers shall be submitted.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If such demand is for the giving of oral testimony, the demand shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> prescribe a date, time, and place at which oral testimony shall be commenced;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> identify a false claims law investigator who shall conduct the examination and the custodian to whom the transcript of such examination shall be submitted;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/D/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> specify that such attendance and testimony are necessary to the conduct of the investigation;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/D/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> notify the person receiving the demand of the right to be accompanied by an attorney and any other representative; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100211e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/D/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> describe the general purpose for which the demand is being issued and the general nature of the testimony, including the primary areas of inquiry, which will be taken pursuant to the demand.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> Any civil investigative demand issued under this section which is an express demand for any product of discovery shall not be returned or returnable until 20 days after a copy of such demand has been served upon the person from whom the discovery was obtained.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> The date prescribed for the commencement of oral testimony pursuant to a civil investigative demand issued under this section shall be a date which is not less than seven days after the date on which demand is received, unless the Attorney General or an Assistant Attorney General designated by the Attorney General determines that exceptional circumstances are present which warrant the commencement of such testimony within a lesser period of time.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/a/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> The Attorney General shall not authorize the issuance under this section of more than one civil investigative demand for oral testimony by the same person unless the person requests otherwise or unless the Attorney General, after investigation, notifies that person in writing that an additional demand for oral testimony is necessary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Protected Material or Information.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) may not require the production of any documentary material, the submission of any answers to written interrogatories, or the giving of any oral testimony if such material, answers, or testimony would be protected from disclosure under—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the standards applicable to subpoenas or subpoenas duces tecum issued by a court of the United States to aid in a grand jury investigation; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the standards applicable to discovery requests under the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, to the extent that the application of such standards to any such demand is appropriate and consistent with the provisions and purposes of this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Effect on other orders, rules, and laws</span>.—</span></p>Any such demand which is an express demand for any product of discovery supersedes any inconsistent order, rule, or provision of law (other than this section) preventing or restraining disclosure of such product of discovery to any person. Disclosure of any product of discovery pursuant to any such express demand does not constitute a waiver of any right or privilege which the person making such disclosure may be entitled to invoke to resist discovery of trial preparation materials.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Service; Jurisdiction.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">By whom served</span>.—</span></p>Any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) may be served by a false claims law investigator, or by a United States marshal or a deputy marshal, at any place within the territorial jurisdiction of any court of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Service in foreign countries</span>.—</span></p>Any such demand or any petition filed under subsection (j) may be served upon any person who is not found within the territorial jurisdiction of any court of the United States in such manner as the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure prescribe for service in a foreign country. To the extent that the courts of the United States can assert jurisdiction over any such person consistent with due process, the United States District Court for the District of Columbia shall have the same jurisdiction to take any action respecting compliance with this section by any such person that such court would have if such person were personally within the jurisdiction of such court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Service Upon Legal Entities and Natural Persons.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Legal entities</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Service of any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) or of any petition filed under subsection (j) may be made upon a partnership, corporation, association, or other legal entity by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> delivering an executed copy of such demand or petition to any partner, executive officer, managing agent, or general agent of the partnership, corporation, association, or entity, or to any agent authorized by appointment or by law to receive service of process on behalf of such partnership, corporation, association, or entity;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> delivering an executed copy of such demand or petition to the principal office or place of business of the partnership, corporation, association, or entity; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> depositing an executed copy of such demand or petition in the United States mails by registered or certified mail, with a return receipt requested, addressed to such partnership, corporation, association, or entity at its principal office or place of business.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Natural persons</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Service of any such demand or petition may be made upon any natural person by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> delivering an executed copy of such demand or petition to the person; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> depositing an executed copy of such demand or petition in the United States mails by registered or certified mail, with a return receipt requested, addressed to the person at the person’s residence or principal office or place of business.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Proof of Service</span>.—</span></p>A verified return by the individual serving any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) or any petition filed under subsection (j) setting forth the manner of such service shall be proof of such service. In the case of service by registered or certified mail, such return shall be accompanied by the return post office receipt of delivery of such demand.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100211fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Documentary Material.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100211fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sworn certificates</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The production of documentary material in response to a civil investigative demand served under this section shall be made under a sworn certificate, in such form as the demand designates, by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> in the case of a natural person, the person to whom the demand is directed, or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100211ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of a person other than a natural person, a person having knowledge of the facts and circumstances relating to such production and authorized to act on behalf of such person.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>The certificate shall state that all of the documentary material required by the demand and in the possession, custody, or control of the person to whom the demand is directed has been produced and made available to the false claims law investigator identified in the demand.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021200-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Production of materials</span>.—</span></p>Any person upon whom any civil investigative demand for the production of documentary material has been served under this section shall make such material available for inspection and copying to the false claims law investigator identified in such demand at the principal place of business of such person, or at such other place as the false claims law investigator and the person thereafter may agree and prescribe in writing, or as the court may direct under subsection (j)(1). Such material shall be made so available on the return date specified in such demand, or on such later date as the false claims law investigator may prescribe in writing.
