Such person may, upon written agreement between the person and the false claims law investigator, substitute copies for originals of all or any part of such material.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10021201-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Interrogatories</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each interrogatory in a civil investigative demand served under this section shall be answered separately and fully in writing under oath and shall be submitted under a sworn certificate, in such form as the demand designates, by—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021202-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> in the case of a natural person, the person to whom the demand is directed, or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021203-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in the case of a person other than a natural person, the person or persons responsible for answering each interrogatory.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>If any interrogatory is objected to, the reasons for the objection shall be stated in the certificate instead of an answer. The certificate shall state that all information required by the demand and in the possession, custody, control, or knowledge of the person to whom the demand is directed has been submitted. To the extent that any information is not furnished, the information shall be identified and reasons set forth with particularity regarding the reasons why the information was not furnished.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10021204-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Oral Examinations.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021205-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Procedures</span>.—</span></p>The examination of any person pursuant to a civil investigative demand for oral testimony served under this section shall be taken before an officer authorized to administer oaths and affirmations by the laws of the United States or of the place where the examination is held. The officer before whom the testimony is to be taken shall put the witness on oath or affirmation and shall, personally or by someone acting under the direction of the officer and in the officer’s presence, record the testimony of the witness. The testimony shall be taken stenographically and shall be transcribed. When the testimony is fully transcribed, the officer before whom the testimony is taken shall promptly transmit a copy of the transcript of the testimony to the custodian. This subsection shall not preclude the taking of testimony by any means authorized by, and in a manner consistent with, the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021206-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Persons present</span>.—</span></p>The false claims law investigator conducting the examination shall exclude from the place where the examination is held all persons except the person giving the testimony, the attorney for and any other representative of the person giving the testimony, the attorney for the Government, any person who may be agreed upon by the attorney for the Government and the person giving the testimony, the officer before whom the testimony is to be taken, and any stenographer taking such testimony.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021207-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Where testimony taken</span>.—</span></p>The oral testimony of any person taken pursuant to a civil investigative demand served under this section shall be taken in the judicial district of the United States within which such person resides, is found, or transacts business, or in such other place as may be agreed upon by the false claims law investigator conducting the examination and such person.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021208-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Transcript of testimony</span>.—</span></p>When the testimony is fully transcribed, the false claims law investigator or the officer before whom the testimony is taken shall afford the witness, who may be accompanied by counsel, a reasonable opportunity to examine and read the transcript, unless such examination and reading are waived by the witness. Any changes in form or substance which the witness desires to make shall be entered and identified upon the transcript by the officer or the false claims law investigator, with a statement of the reasons given by the witness for making such changes. The transcript shall then be signed by the witness, unless the witness in writing waives the signing, is ill, cannot be found, or refuses to sign. If the transcript is not signed by the witness within 30 days after being afforded a reasonable opportunity to examine it, the officer or the false claims law investigator shall sign it and state on the record the fact of the waiver, illness, absence of the witness, or the refusal to sign, together with the reasons, if any, given therefor.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021209-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Certification and delivery to custodian</span>.—</span></p>The officer before whom the testimony is taken shall certify on the transcript that the witness was sworn by the officer and that the transcript is a true record of the testimony given by the witness, and the officer or false claims law investigator shall promptly deliver the transcript, or send the transcript by registered or certified mail, to the custodian.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002120a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Furnishing or inspection of transcript by witness</span>.—</span></p>Upon payment of reasonable charges therefor, the false claims law investigator shall furnish a copy of the transcript to the witness only, except that the Attorney General, the Deputy Attorney General, or an Assistant Attorney General may, for good cause, limit such witness to inspection of the official transcript of the witness’ testimony.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002120b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Conduct of oral testimony</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002120c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Any person compelled to appear for oral testimony under a civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) may be accompanied, represented, and advised by counsel. Counsel may advise such person, in confidence, with respect to any question asked of such person. Such person or counsel may object on the record to any question, in whole or in part, and shall briefly state for the record the reason for the objection. An objection may be made, received, and entered upon the record when it is claimed that such person is entitled to refuse to answer the question on the grounds of any constitutional or other legal right or privilege, including the privilege against self-incrimination. Such person may not otherwise object to or refuse to answer any question, and may not directly or through counsel otherwise interrupt the oral examination. If such person refuses to answer any question, a petition may be filed in the district court of the United States under subsection (j)(1) for an order compelling such person to answer such question.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002120d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> If such person refuses to answer any question on the grounds of the privilege against self-incrimination, the testimony of such person may be compelled in accordance with the provisions of part V of title 18.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002120e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/h/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Witness fees and allowances</span>.—</span></p>Any person appearing for oral testimony under a civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) shall be entitled to the same fees and allowances which are paid to witnesses in the district courts of the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002120f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Custodians of Documents, Answers, and Transcripts.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021210-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designation</span>.—</span></p>The Attorney General shall designate a false claims law investigator to serve as custodian of documentary material, answers to interrogatories, and transcripts of oral testimony received under this section, and shall designate such additional false claims law investigators as the Attorney General determines from time to time to be necessary to serve as deputies to the custodian.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021211-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Responsibility for materials; disclosure</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021212-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> A false claims law investigator who receives any documentary material, answers to interrogatories, or transcripts of oral testimony under this section shall transmit them to the custodian. The custodian shall take physical possession of such material, answers, or transcripts and shall be responsible for the use made of them and for the return of documentary material under paragraph (4).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021213-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The custodian may cause the preparation of such copies of such documentary material, answers to interrogatories, or transcripts of oral testimony as may be required for official use by any false claims law investigator, or other officer or employee of the Department of Justice. Such material, answers, and transcripts may be used by any such authorized false claims law investigator or other officer or employee in connection with the taking of oral testimony under this section.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021214-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, no documentary material, answers to interrogatories, or transcripts of oral testimony, or copies thereof, while in the possession of the custodian, shall be available for examination by any individual other than a false claims law investigator or other officer or employee of the Department of Justice authorized under subparagraph (B). The prohibition in the preceding sentence on the availability of material, answers, or transcripts shall not apply if consent is given by the person who produced such material, answers, or transcripts, or, in the case of any product of discovery produced pursuant to an express demand for such material, consent is given by the person from whom the discovery was obtained. Nothing in this subparagraph is intended to prevent disclosure to the Congress, including any committee or subcommittee of the Congress, or to any other agency of the United States for use by such agency in furtherance of its statutory responsibilities.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021215-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> While in the possession of the custodian and under such reasonable terms and conditions as the Attorney General shall prescribe—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021216-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> documentary material and answers to interrogatories shall be available for examination by the person who produced such material or answers, or by a representative of that person authorized by that person to examine such material and answers; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021217-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/2/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> transcripts of oral testimony shall be available for examination by the person who produced such testimony, or by a representative of that person authorized by that person to examine such transcripts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021218-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of material, answers, or transcripts in other proceedings</span>.—</span></p>Whenever any attorney of the Department of Justice has been designated to appear before any court, grand jury, or Federal agency in any case or proceeding, the custodian of any documentary material, answers to interrogatories, or transcripts of oral testimony received under this section may deliver to such attorney such material, answers, or transcripts for official use in connection with any such case or proceeding as such attorney determines to be required. Upon the completion of any such case or proceeding, such attorney shall return to the custodian any such material, answers, or transcripts so delivered which have not passed into the control of such court, grand jury, or agency through introduction into the record of such case or proceeding.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021219-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Conditions for return of material</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If any documentary material has been produced by any person in the course of any false claims law investigation pursuant to a civil investigative demand under this section, and—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002121a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> any case or proceeding before the court or grand jury arising out of such investigation, or any proceeding before any Federal agency involving such material, has been completed, or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002121b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> no case or proceeding in which such material may be used has been commenced within a reasonable time after completion of the examination and analysis of all documentary material and other information assembled in the course of such investigation,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>the custodian shall, upon written request of the person who produced such material, return to such person any such material (other than copies furnished to the false claims law investigator under subsection (f)(2) or made for the Department of Justice under paragraph (2)(B)) which has not passed into the control of any court, grand jury, or agency through introduction into the record of such case or proceeding.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002121c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Appointment of successor custodians</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In the event of the death, disability, or separation from service in the Department of Justice of the custodian of any documentary material, answers to interrogatories, or transcripts of oral testimony produced pursuant to a civil investigative demand under this section, or in the event of the official relief of such custodian from responsibility for the custody and control of such material, answers, or transcripts, the Attorney General shall promptly—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002121d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> designate another false claims law investigator to serve as custodian of such material, answers, or transcripts, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002121e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/i/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> transmit in writing to the person who produced such material, answers, or testimony notice of the identity and address of the successor so designated.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>Any person who is designated to be a successor under this paragraph shall have, with regard to such material, answers, or transcripts, the same duties and responsibilities as were imposed by this section upon that person’s predecessor in office, except that the successor shall not be held responsible for any default or dereliction which occurred before that designation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002121f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Judicial Proceedings.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021220-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Petition for enforcement</span>.—</span></p>Whenever any person fails to comply with any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a), or whenever satisfactory copying or reproduction of any material requested in such demand cannot be done and such person refuses to surrender such material, the Attorney General may file, in the district court of the United States for any judicial district in which such person resides, is found, or transacts business, and serve upon such person a petition for an order of such court for the enforcement of the civil investigative demand.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021221-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Petition to modify or set aside demand</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021222-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Any person who has received a civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) may file, in the district court of the United States for the judicial district within which such person resides, is found, or transacts business, and serve upon the false claims law investigator identified in such demand a petition for an order of the court to modify or set aside such demand. In the case of a petition addressed to an express demand for any product of discovery, a petition to modify or set aside such demand may be brought only in the district court of the United States for the judicial district in which the proceeding in which such discovery was obtained is or was last pending. Any petition under this subparagraph must be filed—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021223-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> within 20 days after the date of service of the civil investigative demand, or at any time before the return date specified in the demand, whichever date is earlier, or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021224-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> within such longer period as may be prescribed in writing by any false claims law investigator identified in the demand.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021225-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The petition shall specify each ground upon which the petitioner relies in seeking relief under subparagraph (A), and may be based upon any failure of the demand to comply with the provisions of this section or upon any constitutional or other legal right or privilege of such person. During the pendency of the petition in the court, the court may stay, as it deems proper, the running of the time allowed for compliance with the demand, in whole or in part, except that the person filing the petition shall comply with any portions of the demand not sought to be modified or set aside.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021226-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Petition to modify or set aside demand for product of discovery</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021227-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In the case of any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) which is an express demand for any product of discovery, the person from whom such discovery was obtained may file, in the district court of the United States for the judicial district in which the proceeding in which such discovery was obtained is or was last pending, and serve upon any false claims law investigator identified in the demand and upon the recipient of the demand, a petition for an order of such court to modify or set aside those portions of the demand requiring production of any such product of discovery. Any petition under this subparagraph must be filed—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021228-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> within 20 days after the date of service of the civil investigative demand, or at any time before the return date specified in the demand, whichever date is earlier, or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021229-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> within such longer period as may be prescribed in writing by any false claims law investigator identified in the demand.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002122a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The petition shall specify each ground upon which the petitioner relies in seeking relief under subparagraph (A), and may be based upon any failure of the portions of the demand from which relief is sought to comply with the provisions of this section, or upon any constitutional or other legal right or privilege of the petitioner. During the pendency of the petition, the court may stay, as it deems proper, compliance with the demand and the running of the time allowed for compliance with the demand.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002122b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Petition to require performance by custodian of duties</span>.—</span></p>At any time during which any custodian is in custody or control of any documentary material or answers to interrogatories produced, or transcripts of oral testimony given, by any person in compliance with any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a), such person, and in the case of an express demand for any product of discovery, the person from whom such discovery was obtained, may file, in the district court of the United States for the judicial district within which the office of such custodian is situated, and serve upon such custodian, a petition for an order of such court to require the performance by the custodian of any duty imposed upon the custodian by this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002122c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Jurisdiction</span>.—</span></p>Whenever any petition is filed in any district court of the United States under this subsection, such court shall have jurisdiction to hear and determine the matter so presented, and to enter such order or orders as may be required to carry out the provisions of this section. Any final order so entered shall be subject to appeal under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s1291"/>section 1291 of title 28. Any disobedience of any final order entered under this section by any court shall be punished as a contempt of the court.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002122d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/j/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Applicability of federal rules of civil procedure</span>.—</span></p>The Federal Rules of Civil Procedure shall apply to any petition under this subsection, to the extent that such rules are not inconsistent with the provisions of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002122e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Disclosure Exemption</span>.—</span></p>Any documentary material, answers to written interrogatories, or oral testimony provided under any civil investigative demand issued under subsection (a) shall be exempt from disclosure under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552"/>section 552 of title 5.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002122f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l"><span itemtype="num" value="l">(l)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021230-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the term “false claims law” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021231-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> this section and sections 3729 through 3732; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021232-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any Act of Congress enacted after the date of the enactment of this section which prohibits, or makes available to the United States in any court of the United States any civil remedy with respect to, any false claim against, bribery of, or corruption of any officer or employee of the United States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021233-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the term “false claims law investigation” means any inquiry conducted by any false claims law investigator for the purpose of ascertaining whether any person is or has been engaged in any violation of a false claims law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021234-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the term “false claims law investigator” means any attorney or investigator employed by the Department of Justice who is charged with the duty of enforcing or carrying into effect any false claims law, or any officer or employee of the United States acting under the direction and supervision of such attorney or investigator in connection with a false claims law investigation;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021235-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the term “person” means any natural person, partnership, corporation, association, or other legal entity, including any State or political subdivision of a State;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021236-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> the term “documentary material” includes the original or any copy of any book, record, report, memorandum, paper, communication, tabulation, chart, or other document, or data compilations stored in or accessible through computer or other information retrieval systems, together with instructions and all other materials necessary to use or interpret such data compilations, and any product of discovery;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021237-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> the term “custodian” means the custodian, or any deputy custodian, designated by the Attorney General under subsection (i)(1);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021238-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the term “product of discovery” includes—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021239-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the original or duplicate of any deposition, interrogatory, document, thing, result of the inspection of land or other property, examination, or admission, which is obtained by any method of discovery in any judicial or administrative proceeding of an adversarial nature;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002123a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any digest, analysis, selection, compilation, or derivation of any item listed in subparagraph (A); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002123b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/7/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> any index or other manner of access to any item listed in subparagraph (A); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002123c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3733/l/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> the term “official use” means any use that is consistent with the law, and the regulations and policies of the Department of Justice, including use in connection with internal Department of Justice memoranda and reports; communications between the Department of Justice and a Federal, State, or local government agency, or a contractor of a Federal, State, or local government agency, undertaken in furtherance of a Department of Justice investigation or prosecution of a case; interviews of any qui tam relator or other witness; oral examinations; depositions; preparation for and response to civil discovery requests; introduction into the record of a case or proceeding; applications, motions, memoranda and briefs submitted to a court or other tribunal; and communications with Government investigators, auditors, consultants and experts, the counsel of other parties, arbitrators and mediators, concerning an investigation, case or proceeding.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/562">Pub. L. 99–562</span>, § 6(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3159">100 Stat. 3159</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/21">Pub. L. 111–21</span>, § 4(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2009-05-20">May 20, 2009</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/123/1623">123 Stat. 1623</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10021242-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch38"><span itemtype="num" value="38">CHAPTER 38—</span><span itemtype="heading">ADMINISTRATIVE REMEDIES FOR FALSE CLAIMS AND STATEMENTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10021246-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801"><span itemtype="num" value="3801">§ 3801.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10021247-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021248-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “authority” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021249-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an executive department;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002124a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a military department;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002124b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> an establishment (as such term is defined in section 11(2) of the Inspector General Act of 1978) which is not an executive department;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002124c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the United States Postal Service;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002124d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the National Science Foundation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002124e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> a designated Federal entity (as such term is defined under section 8G(a)(2) of the Inspector General Act of 1978);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002124f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “authority head” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021250-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the head of an authority; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021251-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an official or employee of the authority designated, in regulations promulgated by the head of the authority, to act on behalf of the head of the authority;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021252-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “claim” means any request, demand, or submission—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021253-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> made to an authority for property, services, or money (including money representing grants, loans, insurance, or benefits);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021254-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> made to a recipient of property, services, or money from an authority or to a party to a contract with an authority—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10021255-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for property or services if the United States—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id10021256-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> provided such property or services;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id10021257-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> provided any portion of the funds for the purchase of such property or services; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id10021258-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/i/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> will reimburse such recipient or party for the purchase of such property or services; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10021259-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for the payment of money (including money representing grants, loans, insurance, or benefits) if the United States—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1002125a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> provided any portion of the money requested or demanded; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1002125b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/B/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> will reimburse such recipient or party for any portion of the money paid on such request or demand; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002125c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> made to an authority which has the effect of decreasing an obligation to pay or account for property, services, or money,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>except that such term does not include any claim made in any return of tax imposed by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002125d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “investigating official” means an individual who—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002125e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002125f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> in the case of an authority in which an Office of Inspector General is established by the Inspector General Act of 1978 or by any other Federal law, is the Inspector General of that authority or an officer or employee of such Office designated by the Inspector General;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021260-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> in the case of an authority in which an Office of Inspector General is not established by the Inspector General Act of 1978 or by any other Federal law, is an officer or employee of the authority designated by the authority head to conduct investigations under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/1"/>section 3803(a)(1) of this title; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021261-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/4/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> in the case of a military department, is the Inspector General of the Department of Defense or an officer or employee of the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Defense who is designated by the Inspector General; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021262-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> who, if a member of the Armed Forces of the United States on active duty, is serving in grade O–7 or above or, if a civilian employee, is serving in a position for which the rate of basic pay is not less than the minimum rate of basic pay for grade GS–16 under the General Schedule;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021263-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “knows or has reason to know”, for purposes of establishing liability under section 3802, means that a person, with respect to a claim or statement—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021264-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> has actual knowledge that the claim or statement is false, fictitious, or fraudulent;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021265-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> acts in deliberate ignorance of the truth or falsity of the claim or statement; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021266-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> acts in reckless disregard of the truth or falsity of the claim or statement,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>and no proof of specific intent to defraud is required;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021267-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> “person” means any individual, partnership, corporation, association, or private organization;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021268-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “presiding officer” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021269-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> in the case of an authority to which the provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5 of title 5 apply, an administrative law judge appointed in the authority pursuant to section 3105 of such title or detailed to the authority pursuant to section 3344 of such title; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002126a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> in the case of an authority to which the provisions of such subchapter do not apply, an officer or employee of the authority who—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002126b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> is selected under chapter 33 of title 5 pursuant to the competitive examination process applicable to administrative law judges;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002126c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> is appointed by the authority head to conduct hearings under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803"/>section 3803 of this title;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002126d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> is assigned to cases in rotation so far as practicable;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002126e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> may not perform duties inconsistent with the duties and responsibilities of a presiding officer;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002126f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> is entitled to pay prescribed by the Office of Personnel Management independently of ratings and recommendations made by the authority and in accordance with chapter 51 of such title and subchapter III of chapter 53 of such title;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10021270-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> is not subject to performance appraisal pursuant to chapter 43 of such title; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10021271-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/7/B/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> may be removed, suspended, furloughed, or reduced in grade or pay only for good cause established and determined by the Merit Systems Protection Board on the record after opportunity for hearing by such Board;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021272-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “reviewing official” means any officer or employee of an authority—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021273-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/8/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> who is designated by the authority head to make the determination required under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2"/>section 3803(a)(2) of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021274-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/8/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> who, if a member of the Armed Forces of the United States on active duty, is serving in grade O–7 or above or, if a civilian employee, is serving in a position for which the rate of basic pay is not less than the minimum rate of basic pay for grade GS–16 under the General Schedule; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021275-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/8/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> who is—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10021276-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/8/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> not subject to supervision by, or required to report to, the investigating official; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10021277-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/8/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> not employed in the organizational unit of the authority in which the investigating official is employed; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021278-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “statement” means any representation, certification, affirmation, document, record, or accounting or bookkeeping entry made—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021279-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/9/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> with respect to a claim or to obtain the approval or payment of a claim (including relating to eligibility to make a claim); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1002127a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/9/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> with respect to (including relating to eligibility for)—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002127b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/9/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a contract with, or a bid or proposal for a contract with; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1002127c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/a/9/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> a grant, loan, or benefit from,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I32" class="indent2 firstIndent0"/>an authority, or any State, political subdivision of a State, or other party, if the United States Government provides any portion of the money or property under such contract or for such grant, loan, or benefit, or if the Government will reimburse such State, political subdivision, or party for any portion of the money or property under such contract or for such grant, loan, or benefit,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>except that such term does not include any statement made in any return of tax imposed by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002127d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of paragraph (3) of subsection (a)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002127e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> each voucher, invoice, claim form, or other individual request or demand for property, services, or money constitutes a separate claim;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002127f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> each claim for property, services, or money is subject to this chapter regardless of whether such property, services, or money is actually delivered or paid; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021280-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a claim shall be considered made, presented, or submitted to an authority, recipient, or party when such claim is actually made to an agent, fiscal intermediary, or other entity, including any State or political subdivision thereof, acting for or on behalf of such authority, recipient, or party.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10021281-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of paragraph (9) of subsection (a)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021282-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> each written representation, certification, or affirmation constitutes a separate statement; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021283-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3801/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a statement shall be considered made, presented, or submitted to an authority when such statement is actually made to an agent, fiscal intermediary, or other entity, including any State or political subdivision thereof, acting for or on behalf of such authority.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1934">100 Stat. 1934</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(Q), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/69/tVII">Pub. L. 110–69, title VII</span>, § 7017, <span itemtype="date" date="2007-08-09">Aug. 9, 2007</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/121/684">121 Stat. 684</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/409">Pub. L. 110–409</span>, § 10, <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-14">Oct. 14, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/4314">122 Stat. 4314</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1002128c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802"><span itemtype="num" value="3802">§ 3802.</span><span itemtype="heading"> False claims and statements; liability</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002128d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1002128e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Any person who makes, presents, or submits, or causes to be made, presented, or submitted, a claim that the person knows or has reason to know—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1002128f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is false, fictitious, or fraudulent;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021290-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> includes or is supported by any written statement which asserts a material fact which is false, fictitious, or fraudulent;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021291-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> includes or is supported by any written statement that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021292-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> omits a material fact;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021293-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> is false, fictitious, or fraudulent as a result of such omission; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10021294-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> is a statement in which the person making, presenting, or submitting such statement has a duty to include such material fact; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10021295-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> is for payment for the provision of property or services which the person has not provided as claimed,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>shall be subject to, in addition to any other remedy that may be prescribed by law, a civil penalty of not more than $5,000 for each such claim. Except as provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection, such person shall also be subject to an assessment, in lieu of damages sustained by the United States because of such claim, of not more than twice the amount of such claim, or the portion of such claim, which is determined under this chapter to be in violation of the preceding sentence.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048396-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Any person who makes, presents, or submits, or causes to be made, presented, or submitted, a written statement that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048397-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the person knows or has reason to know—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10048398-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> asserts a material fact which is false, fictitious, or fraudulent; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10048399-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1004839a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/A/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> omits a material fact; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1004839b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/A/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> is false, fictitious, or fraudulent as a result of such omission;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1004839c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of a statement described in clause (ii) of subparagraph (A), is a statement in which the person making, presenting, or submitting such statement has a duty to include such material fact; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1004839d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> contains or is accompanied by an express certification or affirmation of the truthfulness and accuracy of the contents of the statement,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>shall be subject to, in addition to any other remedy that may be prescribed by law, a civil penalty of not more than $5,000 for each such statement.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004839e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> An assessment shall not be made under the second sentence of paragraph (1) with respect to a claim if payment by the Government has not been made on such claim.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004839f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a determination under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2"/>section 3803(a)(2) of this title that there is adequate evidence to believe that a person is liable under subsection (a) of this section; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a determination under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803"/>section 3803 of this title that a person is liable under subsection (a) of this section,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>may provide the authority with grounds for commencing any administrative or contractual action against such person which is authorized by law and which is in addition to any action against such person under this chapter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A determination referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection may be used by the authority, but shall not require such authority, to commence any administrative or contractual action which is authorized by law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3802/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> In the case of an administrative or contractual action to suspend or debar any person who is eligible to enter into contracts with the Federal Government, a determination referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection shall not be considered as a conclusive determination of such person’s responsibility pursuant to Federal procurement laws and regulations.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1937">100 Stat. 1937</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id100483a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803"><span itemtype="num" value="3803">§ 3803.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Hearing and determinations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The investigating official of an authority may investigate allegations that a person is liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title and shall report the findings and conclusions of such investigation to the reviewing official of the authority. The preceding sentence does not modify any responsibility of an investigating official to report violations of criminal law to the Attorney General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the reviewing official of an authority determines, based upon the report of the investigating official under paragraph (1) of this subsection, that there is adequate evidence to believe that a person is liable under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802">section 3802 of this title</span>, the reviewing official shall transmit to the Attorney General a written notice of the intention of such official to refer the allegations of such liability to a presiding officer of such authority. Such notice shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a statement of the reasons of the reviewing official for the referral of such allegations;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a statement specifying the evidence which supports such allegations;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a description of the claims or statements for which liability under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title is alleged;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> an estimate of the amount of money or the value of property or services requested or demanded in violation of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> a statement of any exculpatory or mitigating circumstances which may relate to such claims or statements.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Within 90 days after receipt of a notice from a reviewing official under paragraph (2) of subsection (a), the Attorney General or an Assistant Attorney General designated by the Attorney General shall transmit a written statement to the reviewing official which specifies—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> that the Attorney General or such Assistant Attorney General approves or disapproves the referral to a presiding officer of the allegations of liability stated in such notice;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in any case in which the referral of allegations is approved, that the initiation of a proceeding under this section with respect to such allegations is appropriate; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> in any case in which the referral of allegations is disapproved, the reasons for such disapproval.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A reviewing official may refer allegations of liability to a presiding officer only if the Attorney General or an Assistant Attorney General designated by the Attorney General approves the referral of such allegations in a written statement described in paragraph (1) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> If the Attorney General or an Assistant Attorney General designated by the Attorney General transmits to an authority head a written finding that the continuation of any hearing under this section with respect to a claim or statement may adversely affect any pending or potential criminal or civil action related to such claim or statement, such hearing shall be immediately stayed and may be resumed only upon written authorization of the Attorney General.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> No allegations of liability under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802">section 3802 of this title</span> with respect to any claim made, presented, or submitted by any person shall be referred to a presiding officer under paragraph (2) of subsection (b) if the reviewing official determines that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an amount of money in excess of $150,000; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> property or services with a value in excess of $150,000,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>is requested or demanded in violation of <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802">section 3802 of this title</span> in such claim or in a group of related claims which are submitted at the time such claim is submitted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Except as provided in subparagraph (B) of this paragraph, no allegations of liability against an individual under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title with respect to any claim or statement made, presented, or submitted, or caused to be made, presented, or submitted, by such individual relating to any benefits received by such individual shall be referred to a presiding officer under paragraph (2) of subsection (b).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Allegations of liability against an individual under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802">section 3802 of this title</span> with respect to any claim or statement made, presented, or submitted, or caused to be made, presented, or submitted, by such individual relating to any benefits received by such individual may be referred to a presiding officer under paragraph (2) of subsection (b) if—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> such claim or statement is made by such individual in making application for such benefits;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> such allegations relate to the eligibility of such individual to receive such benefits; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> with respect to such claim or statement, the individual—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B/iii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> has actual knowledge that the claim or statement is false, fictitious, or fraudulent;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B/iii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> acts in deliberate ignorance of the truth or falsity of the claim or statement; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/B/iii/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> acts in reckless disregard of the truth or falsity of the claim or statement.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this subsection, the term “benefits” means—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> benefits under the supplemental security income program under title XVI of the Social Security Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> old age, survivors, and disability insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> assistance under a State program funded under part A of title IV of the Social Security Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> medical assistance under a State plan approved under section 1902(a) of the Social Security Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> benefits under title XX of the Social Security Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> benefits under the supplemental nutrition assistance program (as defined in section 3 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/viii"><span itemtype="num" value="viii">(viii)</span></p> benefits under chapters 11, 13, 15, 17, and 21 of title 38;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/ix"><span itemtype="num" value="ix">(ix)</span></p> benefits under the Black Lung Benefits Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/x"><span itemtype="num" value="x">(x)</span></p> benefits under the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children established under section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/xi"><span itemtype="num" value="xi">(xi)</span></p> benefits under section 336 of the Older Americans Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/xii"><span itemtype="num" value="xii">(xii)</span></p> any annuity or other benefit under the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/xiii"><span itemtype="num" value="xiii">(xiii)</span></p> benefits under the Richard B.
