Russell National School Lunch Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/xiv"><span itemtype="num" value="xiv">(xiv)</span></p> benefits under any housing assistance program for lower income families or elderly or handicapped persons which is administered by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development or the Secretary of Agriculture;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/xv"><span itemtype="num" value="xv">(xv)</span></p> benefits under the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/c/2/C/xvi"><span itemtype="num" value="xvi">(xvi)</span></p> benefits under part A of the Energy Conservation in Existing Buildings Act of 1976,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>which are intended for the personal use of the individual who receives the benefits or for a member of the individual’s family.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> On or after the date on which a reviewing official is permitted to refer allegations of liability to a presiding officer under subsection (b) of this section, the reviewing official shall mail, by registered or certified mail, or shall deliver, a notice to the person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title. Such notice shall specify the allegations of liability against such person and shall state the right of such person to request a hearing with respect to such allegations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If, within 30 days after receiving a notice under paragraph (1) of this subsection, the person receiving such notice requests a hearing with respect to the allegations contained in such notice—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the reviewing official shall refer such allegations to a presiding officer for the commencement of such hearing; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the presiding officer shall commence such hearing by mailing by registered or certified mail, or by delivery of, a notice which complies with paragraphs (2)(A) and (3)(B)(i) of subsection (g) to such person.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Except as provided in subparagraph (B) of this paragraph, at any time after receiving a notice under paragraph (2)(B) of subsection (d), the person receiving such notice shall be entitled to review, and upon payment of a reasonable fee for duplication, shall be entitled to obtain a copy of, all relevant and material documents, transcripts, records, and other materials, which relate to such allegations and upon which the findings and conclusions of the investigating official under paragraph (1) of subsection (a) are based.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> A person is not entitled under subparagraph (A) to review and obtain a copy of any document, transcript, record, or material which is privileged under Federal law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> At any time after receiving a notice under paragraph (2)(B) of subsection (d), the person receiving such notice shall be entitled to obtain all exculpatory information in the possession of the investigating official or the reviewing official relating to the allegations contained in such notice. The provisions of subparagraph (B) of paragraph (1) do not apply to any document, transcript, record, or other material, or any portion thereof, in which such exculpatory information is contained.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Any hearing commenced under paragraph (2) of subsection (d) shall be conducted by the presiding officer on the record in order to determine—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the liability of a person under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> if a person is determined to be liable under such section, the amount of any civil penalty or assessment to be imposed on such person.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>Any such determination shall be based on the preponderance of the evidence.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each hearing under subsection (f) of this section shall be conducted—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> in the case of an authority to which the provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5 of title 5 apply, in accordance with—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the provisions of such subchapter to the extent that such provisions are not inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> procedures promulgated by the authority head under paragraph (3) of this subsection; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of an authority to which the provisions of such subchapter do not apply, in accordance with procedures promulgated by the authority head under paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An authority head of an authority described in subparagraph (B) of paragraph (1) shall by regulation promulgate procedures for the conduct of hearings under this chapter. Such procedures shall include:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The provision of written notice of the hearing to any person alleged to be liable under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802">section 3802 of this title</span>, including written notice of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the time, place, and nature of the hearing;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the legal authority and jurisdiction under which the hearing is to be held; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the matters of facts and law to be asserted.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The provision to any person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title of opportunities for the submission of facts, arguments, offers of settlement, or proposals of adjustment.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Procedures to ensure that the presiding officer shall not, except to the extent required for the disposition of ex parte matters as authorized by law—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> consult a person or party on a fact in issue, unless on notice and opportunity for all parties to the hearing to participate; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> be responsible to or subject to the supervision or direction of the investigating official or the reviewing official.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> Procedures to ensure that the investigating official and the reviewing official do not participate or advise in the decision required under subsection (h) of this section or the review of the decision by the authority head under subsection (i) of this section, except as provided in subsection (j) of this section.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> The provision to any person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title of opportunities to present such person’s case through oral or documentary evidence, to submit rebuttal evidence, and to conduct such cross-examination as may be required for a full and true disclosure of the facts.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> Procedures to permit any person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title to be accompanied, represented, and advised by counsel or such other qualified representative as the authority head may specify in such regulations.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Procedures to ensure that the hearing is conducted in an impartial manner, including procedures to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/G/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> permit the presiding officer to at any time disqualify himself; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100483f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/2/G/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> permit the filing, in good faith, of a timely and sufficient affidavit alleging personal bias or another reason for disqualification of a presiding officer or a reviewing official.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Each authority head shall promulgate by regulation procedures described in subparagraph (B) of this paragraph for the conduct of hearings under this chapter. Such procedures shall be in addition to the procedures described in paragraph (1) or paragraph (2) of this subsection, as the case may be.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The procedures referred to in subparagraph (A) of this paragraph are:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Procedures for the inclusion, in any written notice of a hearing under this section to any person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title, of a description of the procedures for the conduct of the hearing.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> Procedures to permit discovery by any person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title only to the extent that the presiding officer determines that such discovery is necessary for the expeditious, fair, and reasonable consideration of the issues, except that such procedures shall not apply to documents, transcripts, records, or other material which a person is entitled to review under paragraph (1) of subsection (e) or to information to which a person is entitled under paragraph (2) of such subsection. Procedures promulgated under this clause shall prohibit the discovery of the notice required under subsection (a)(2) of this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each hearing under subsection (f) of this section shall be held—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> in the judicial district of the United States in which the person alleged to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title resides or transacts business;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the judicial district of the United States in which the claim or statement upon which the allegation of liability under such section was made, presented, or submitted; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100483fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/g/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> in such other place as may be agreed upon by such person and the presiding officer who will conduct such hearing.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100483ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> The presiding officer shall issue a written decision, including findings and determinations, after the conclusion of the hearing. Such decision shall include the findings of fact and conclusions of law which the presiding officer relied upon in determining whether a person is liable under this chapter. The presiding officer shall promptly send to each party to the hearing a copy of such decision and a statement describing the right of any person determined to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title to appeal the decision of the presiding officer to the authority head under paragraph (2) of subsection (i).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048400-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048401-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3805"/>section 3805 of this title, the decision, including the findings and determinations, of the presiding officer issued under subsection (h) of this section are final.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048402-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048403-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048404-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> Except as provided in clause (ii) of this subparagraph, within 30 days after the presiding officer issues a decision under subsection (h) of this section, any person determined in such decision to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title may appeal such decision to the authority head.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048405-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> If, within the 30-day period described in clause (i) of this subparagraph, a person determined to be liable under this chapter requests the authority head for an extension of such 30-day period to file an appeal of a decision issued by the presiding officer under subsection (h) of this section, the authority head may extend such period if such person demonstrates good cause for such extension.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048406-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Any authority head reviewing under this section the decision, findings, and determinations of a presiding officer shall not consider any objection that was not raised in the hearing conducted pursuant to subsection (f) of this section unless a demonstration is made of extraordinary circumstances causing the failure to raise the objection. If any party demonstrates to the satisfaction of the authority head that additional evidence not presented at such hearing is material and that there were reasonable grounds for the failure to present such evidence at such hearing, the authority head shall remand the matter to the presiding officer for consideration of such additional evidence.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048407-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The authority head may affirm, reduce, reverse, compromise, remand, or settle any penalty or assessment determined by the presiding officer pursuant to this section. The authority head shall promptly send to each party to the appeal a copy of the decision of the authority head and a statement describing the right of any person determined to be liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title to judicial review under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3805"/>section 3805 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048408-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3803/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> The reviewing official has the exclusive authority to compromise or settle any allegations of liability under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title against a person without the consent of the presiding officer at any time after the date on which the reviewing official is permitted to refer allegations of liability to a presiding officer under subsection (b) of this section and prior to the date on which the presiding officer issues a decision under subsection (h) of this section. Any such compromise or settlement shall be in writing.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1939">100 Stat. 1939</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/448/tII">Pub. L. 103–448, title II</span>, § 204(w)(2)(C), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-11-02">Nov. 2, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/4746">108 Stat. 4746</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/193/tI">Pub. L. 104–193, title I</span>, § 110(<span itemtype="i">o</span>), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-08-22">Aug. 22, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/2175">110 Stat. 2175</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/78/tVII">Pub. L. 106–78, title VII</span>, § 752(b)(13), <span itemtype="date" date="1999-10-22">Oct. 22, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/1169">113 Stat. 1169</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/234/tIV">Pub. L. 110–234, title IV</span>, §§ 4002(b)(1)(A), (B), (2)(S), 4115(c)(2)(E), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-05-22">May 22, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/1095-1097">122 Stat. 1095–1097</span>, 1110; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/246">Pub. L. 110–246</span>, § 4(a), title IV, §§ 4002(b)(1)(A), (B), (2)(S), 4115(c)(2)(E), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-06-18">June 18, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/1664">122 Stat. 1664</span>, 1857, 1858, 1871; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/79/tIV">Pub. L. 113–79, title IV</span>, § 4030(<span itemtype="i">o</span>), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-02-07">Feb. 7, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/815">128 Stat. 815</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10048411-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3804"><span itemtype="num" value="3804">§ 3804.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Subpoena authority</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048412-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3804/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> For the purposes of an investigation under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/1"/>section 3803(a)(1) of this title, an investigating official is authorized to require by subpoena the production of all information, documents, reports, answers, records, accounts, papers, and data not otherwise reasonably available to the authority.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048413-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3804/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For the purposes of conducting a hearing under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f">section 3803(f) of this title</span>, a presiding officer is authorized—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048414-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3804/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to administer oaths or affirmations; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048415-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3804/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to require by subpoena the attendance and testimony of witnesses and the production of all information, documents, reports, answers, records, accounts, papers, and other data and documentary evidence which the presiding officer considers relevant and material to the hearing.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048416-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3804/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> In the case of contumacy or refusal to obey a subpoena issued pursuant to subsection (a) or (b) of this section, the district courts of the United States shall have jurisdiction to issue an appropriate order for the enforcement of any such subpoena. Any failure to obey such order of the court is punishable by such court as contempt. In any case in which an authority seeks the enforcement of a subpoena issued pursuant to subsection (a) or (b) of this section, the authority shall request the Attorney General to petition any district court in which a hearing under this chapter is being conducted, or in which the person receiving the subpoena resides or conducts business, to issue such an order.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1944">100 Stat. 1944</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10048418-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805"><span itemtype="num" value="3805">§ 3805.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Judicial review</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048419-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004841a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A determination by a reviewing official under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803"/>section 3803 of this title shall be final and shall not be subject to judicial review.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004841b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Unless a petition is filed under this section, a determination under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803"/>section 3803 of this title that a person is liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title shall be final and shall not be subject to judicial review.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004841c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004841d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004841e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Any person who has been determined to be liable under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802">section 3802 of this title</span> pursuant to <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803">section 3803 of this title</span> may obtain review of such determination in—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1004841f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the United States district court for the district in which such person resides or transacts business;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048420-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the United States district court for the district in which the claim or statement upon which the determination of liability is based was made, presented, or submitted; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048421-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the United States District Court for the District of Columbia.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048422-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Such review may be obtained by filing in any such court a written petition that such determination be modified or set aside. Such petition shall be filed—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048423-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> only after such person has exhausted all administrative remedies under this chapter; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10048424-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> within 60 days after the date on which the authority head sends such person a copy of the decision of such authority head under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/i/2"/>section 3803(i)(2) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048425-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The clerk of the court shall transmit a copy of a petition filed under paragraph (1) of this subsection to the authority and to the Attorney General. Upon receipt of the copy of such petition, the authority shall transmit to the Attorney General the record in the proceeding resulting in the determination of liability under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title. Except as otherwise provided in this section, the district courts of the United States shall have jurisdiction to review the decision, findings, and determinations in issue and to affirm, modify, remand for further consideration, or set aside, in whole or in part, the decision, findings, and determinations of the authority, and to enforce such decision, findings, and determinations to the extent that such decision, findings, and determinations are affirmed or modified.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048426-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The decisions, findings, and determinations of the authority with respect to questions of fact shall be final and conclusive, and shall not be set aside unless such decisions, findings, and determinations are found by the court to be unsupported by substantial evidence. In concluding whether the decisions, findings, and determinations of an authority are unsupported by substantial evidence, the court shall review the whole record or those parts of it cited by a party, and due account shall be taken of the rule of prejudicial error.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048427-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Any district court reviewing under this section the decision, findings, and determinations of an authority shall not consider any objection that was not raised in the hearing conducted pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f"/>section 3803(f) of this title unless a demonstration is made of extraordinary circumstances causing the failure to raise the objection. If any party demonstrates to the satisfaction of the court that additional evidence not presented at such hearing is material and that there were reasonable grounds for the failure to present such evidence at such hearing, the court shall remand the matter to the authority for consideration of such additional evidence.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048428-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3805/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> Upon a final determination by the district court that a person is liable under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3802"/>section 3802 of this title, the court shall enter a final judgment for the appropriate amount in favor of the United States.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1944">100 Stat. 1944</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1004842a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806"><span itemtype="num" value="3806">§ 3806.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Collection of civil penalties and assessments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004842b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Attorney General shall be responsible for judicial enforcement of any civil penalty or assessment imposed pursuant to the provisions of this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004842c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Any penalty or assessment imposed in a determination which has become final pursuant to this chapter may be recovered in a civil action brought by the Attorney General. In any such action, no matter that was raised or that could have been raised in a hearing conducted under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f"/>section 3803(f) of this title or pursuant to judicial review under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3805"/>section 3805 of this title may be raised as a defense, and the determination of liability and the determination of amounts of penalties and assessments shall not be subject to review.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004842d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The district courts of the United States shall have jurisdiction of any action commenced by the United States under subsection (b) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004842e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Any action under subsection (b) of this section may, without regard to venue requirements, be joined and consolidated with or asserted as a counterclaim, cross-claim, or setoff by the United States in any other civil action which includes as parties the United States and the person against whom such action may be brought.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004842f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The United States Court of Federal Claims shall have jurisdiction of any action under subsection (b) of this section to recover any penalty or assessment if the cause of action is asserted by the United States as a counterclaim in a matter pending in such court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048430-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> The Attorney General shall have exclusive authority to compromise or settle any penalty or assessment the determination of which is the subject of a pending petition pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3805"/>section 3805 of this title or a pending action to recover such penalty or assessment pursuant to this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048431-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048432-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, any amount of penalty or assessment collected under this chapter shall be deposited as miscellaneous receipts in the Treasury of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048433-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048434-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Any amount of a penalty or assessment imposed by the United States Postal Service under this chapter shall be deposited in the Postal Service Fund established by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t39/s2003"/>section 2003 of title 39.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048435-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Any amount of a penalty or assessment imposed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services under this chapter with respect to a claim or statement made in connection with old age and survivors benefits under title II of the Social Security Act shall be deposited in the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048436-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Any amount of a penalty or assessment imposed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services under this chapter with respect to a claim or statement made in connection with disability benefits under title II of the Social Security Act shall be deposited in the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048437-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> Any amount of a penalty or assessment imposed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services under this chapter with respect to a claim or statement made in connection with benefits under part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act shall be deposited in the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048438-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> Any amount of a penalty or assessment imposed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services under this chapter with respect to a claim or statement made in connection with benefits under part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act shall be deposited in the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1945">100 Stat. 1945</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/572/tIX">Pub. L. 102–572, title IX</span>, § 902(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-29">Oct. 29, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4516">106 Stat. 4516</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1004843e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3807"><span itemtype="num" value="3807">§ 3807.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Right to administrative offset</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1004843f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3807/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The amount of any penalty or assessment which has become final under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803"/>section 3803 of this title, or for which a judgment has been entered under section 3805(e) or 3806 of this title, or any amount agreed upon in a settlement or compromise under section 3803(j) or 3806(f) of this title, may be collected by administrative offset under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3716"/>section 3716 of this title, except that an administrative offset may not be made under this subsection against a refund of an overpayment of Federal taxes, then or later owing by the United States to the person liable for such penalty or assessment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048440-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3807/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> All amounts collected pursuant to this section shall be remitted to the Secretary of the Treasury for deposit in accordance with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3806/g"/>section 3806(g) of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1947">100 Stat. 1947</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10048442-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3808"><span itemtype="num" value="3808">§ 3808.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048443-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3808/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A hearing under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/d/2"/>section 3803(d)(2) of this title with respect to a claim or statement shall be commenced within 6 years after the date on which such claim or statement is made, presented, or submitted.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048444-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3808/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A civil action to recover a penalty or assessment under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3806"/>section 3806 of this title shall be commenced within 3 years after the date on which the determination of liability for such penalty or assessment becomes final.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048445-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3808/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> If at any time during the course of proceedings brought pursuant to this chapter the authority head receives or discovers any specific information regarding bribery, gratuities, conflict of interest, or other corruption or similar activity in relation to a false claim or statement, the authority head shall immediately report such information to the Attorney General, and in the case of an authority in which an Office of Inspector General is established by the Inspector General Act of 1978 or by any other Federal law, to the Inspector General of that authority.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1947">100 Stat. 1947</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10048449-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3809"><span itemtype="num" value="3809">§ 3809.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Regulations</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Within 180 days after the date of enactment of this chapter, each authority head shall promulgate rules and regulations necessary to implement the provisions of this chapter. Such rules and regulations shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1004844a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3809/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> ensure that investigating officials and reviewing officials are not responsible for conducting the hearing required in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/f"/>section 3803(f) of this title, making the determinations required by subsections (f) and (h) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803"/>section 3803 of this title, or making collections under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3806"/>section 3806 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1004844b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3809/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> require a reviewing official to include in any notice required by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3803/a/2"/>section 3803(a)(2) of this title a statement which specifies that the reviewing official has determined that there is a reasonable prospect of collecting, from a person with respect to whom the reviewing official is referring allegations of liability in such notice, the amount for which such person may be liable.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1947">100 Stat. 1947</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1004844f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3810"><span itemtype="num" value="3810">[§ 3810.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/66/tIII">Pub. L. 104–66, title III</span>, § 3001(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1995-12-21">Dec. 21, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/734">109 Stat. 734</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10048452-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3811"><span itemtype="num" value="3811">§ 3811.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Effect on other law</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048453-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3811/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> This chapter does not diminish the responsibility of any agency to comply with the provisions of chapter 35 of title 44.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10048454-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3811/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> This chapter does not supersede the provisions of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t44/s3512"/>section 3512 of title 44.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f455-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3811/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> For purposes of this section, the term “agency” has the same meaning as in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t44/s3502/1"/>section 3502(1) of title 44.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1948">100 Stat. 1948</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1006f457-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3812"><span itemtype="num" value="3812">§ 3812.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prohibition against delegation</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Any function, duty, or responsibility which this chapter specifies be carried out by the Attorney General or an Assistant Attorney General designated by the Attorney General, shall not be delegated to, or carried out by, any other officer or employee of the Department of Justice.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/509/tVI">Pub. L. 99–509, title VI</span>, § 6103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-21">Oct. 21, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/1948">100 Stat. 1948</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id1006f459-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIII/ch39"><span itemtype="num" value="39">CHAPTER 39—</span><span itemtype="heading">PROMPT PAYMENT</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1006f45d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901"><span itemtype="num" value="3901">§ 3901.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions and application</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f45e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f45f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “agency” has the same meaning given that term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s551/1"/>section 551(1) of title 5 and includes an entity being operated, and the head of the agency identifies the entity as being operated, only as an instrumentality of the agency to carry out a program of the agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f460-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “business concern” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f461-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a person carrying on a trade or business; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f462-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a nonprofit entity operating as a contractor.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f463-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “proper invoice” is an invoice containing or accompanied by substantiating documentation the Director of the Office of Management and Budget may require by regulation and the head of the appropriate agency may require by regulation or contract.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f464-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> for the purposes of determining a payment due date and the date upon which any late payment interest penalty shall begin to accrue, the head of the agency is deemed to receive an invoice—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f465-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> on the later of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f466-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the date on which the place or person designated by the agency to first receive such invoice actually receives a proper invoice; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f467-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> on the 7th day after the date on which, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract, the property is actually delivered or performance of the services is actually completed, as the case may be, unless—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1006f468-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4/A/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the agency has actually accepted such property or services before such 7th day; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1006f469-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4/A/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the contract (except in the case of a contract for the procurement of a brand-name commercial item for authorized resale) specifies a longer acceptance period, as determined by the contracting officer to be required to afford the agency a practicable opportunity to inspect and test the property furnished or evaluate the services performed; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f46a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> on the date of the invoice, if the agency has failed to annotate the invoice with the date of receipt at the time of actual receipt by the place or person designated by the agency to first receive such invoice.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f46b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> a payment is deemed to be made on the date a check for payment is dated or an electronic fund transfer is made.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f46c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> a contract to rent property is deemed to be a contract to acquire the property.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f46d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> This chapter applies to the Tennessee Valley Authority. However, regulations prescribed under this chapter do not apply to the Authority, and the Authority alone is responsible for carrying out this chapter as it applies to contracts of the Authority.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f46e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> This chapter applies to the United States Postal Service. However, the Postmaster General shall be responsible for issuing the implementing procurement regulations, solicitation provisions, and contract clauses for the United States Postal Service.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f46f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f470-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Notwithstanding subsection (a)(1) of this section, this chapter, except <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3907"/>section 3907 of this title, applies to the District of Columbia Courts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f471-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A claim for an interest penalty not paid under this chapter may be filed in the same manner as claims are filed with respect to contracts to provide property or services for the District of Columbia Courts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f472-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f473-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Except as provided in subparagraph (B), an interest penalty under this chapter does not continue to accrue for more than one year or after a claim for an interest penalty is filed in the manner described in paragraph (2), whichever is earlier.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f474-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> If a claim for an interest penalty is filed in the manner described in paragraph (2) and interest is not available for such claims under the laws and regulations governing claims under contracts to provide property or services for the District of Columbia Courts, interest will accrue under this chapter as provided in paragraph (A) and from the date the claim is filed until the date the claim is paid.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f475-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Paragraph (3) of this subsection does not prevent an interest penalty from accruing on a claim if such interest is available for such claim under the laws and regulations governing claims under contracts to provide property or services for the District of Columbia Courts. Such interest may accrue on an unpaid contract payment and on the unpaid penalty under this chapter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f476-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3901/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Except as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3904"/>section 3904 of this title, this chapter does not require an interest penalty on a payment that is not made because of a dispute between the head of an agency and a business concern over the amount of payment or compliance with the contract. A claim related to the dispute, and any interest payable for the period during which the dispute is being resolved, is subject to the laws and regulations governing claims under contracts to provide property or services for the District of Columbia Courts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(18)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2474">96 Stat. 2474</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/496">Pub. L. 100–496</span>, § 2(a)–(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-17">Oct. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2455">102 Stat. 2455</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/277/dA">Pub. L. 105–277, div. A</span>, § 101(c) [title I, § 162(a)], <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-21">Oct. 21, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2681-121">112 Stat. 2681–121</span>, 2681–148; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/362/tXIII">Pub. L. 105–362, title XIII</span>, § 1301(c)(2)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-11-10">Nov. 10, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3293">112 Stat. 3293</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1006f47d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902"><span itemtype="num" value="3902">§ 3902.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Interest penalties</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f47e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Under regulations prescribed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3903"/>section 3903 of this title, the head of an agency acquiring property or service from a business concern, who does not pay the concern for each complete delivered item of property or service by the required payment date, shall pay an interest penalty to the concern on the amount of the payment due. The interest shall be computed at the rate of interest established by the Secretary of the Treasury, and published in the Federal Register, for interest payments under section 7109(a)(1) and (b) of title 41, which is in effect at the time the agency accrues the obligation to pay a late payment interest penalty.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f47f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The interest penalty shall be paid for the period beginning on the day after the required payment date and ending on the date on which payment is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f480-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f481-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A business concern shall be entitled to an interest penalty of $1.00 or more which is owed such business concern under this section, and such penalty shall be paid without regard to whether the business concern has requested payment of such penalty.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f482-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Each payment subject to this chapter for which a late payment interest penalty is required to be paid shall be accompanied by a notice stating the amount of the interest penalty included in such payment and the rate by which, and period for which, such penalty was computed.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f483-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If a business concern—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f484-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is owed an interest penalty by an agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f485-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is not paid the interest penalty in a payment made to the business concern by the agency on or after the date on which the interest penalty becomes due;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f486-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> is not paid the interest penalty by the agency within 10 days after the date on which such payment is made; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f487-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/c/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> makes a written demand, not later than 40 days after the date on which such payment is made, that the agency pay such a penalty,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>such business concern shall be entitled to an amount equal to the sum of the late payment interest penalty to which the contractor is entitled and an additional penalty equal to a percentage of such late payment interest penalty specified by regulation by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, subject to such maximum as may be specified in such regulations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f488-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The temporary unavailability of funds to make a timely payment due for property or services does not relieve the head of an agency from the obligation to pay interest penalties under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f489-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> An amount of an interest penalty unpaid after any 30-day period shall be added to the principal amount of the debt, and a penalty accrues thereafter on the added amount.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f48a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> This section does not authorize the appropriation of additional amounts to pay an interest penalty. The head of an agency shall pay a penalty under this section out of amounts made available to carry out the program for which the penalty is incurred.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f48b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> A recipient of a grant from the head of an agency may provide in a contract for the acquisition of property or service from a business concern that, consistent with the usual business practices of the recipient and applicable State and local law, the recipient will pay an interest penalty on amounts overdue under the contract under conditions agreed to by the recipient and the concern. The recipient may not pay the penalty from amounts received from an agency. Amounts expended for the penalty may not be counted toward a matching requirement applicable to the grant. An obligation to pay the penalty is not an obligation of the United States Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f48c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f48d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> This section shall apply to contracts for the procurement of property or services entered into pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1948-06-29/s4/h"/>section 4(h) of the Act of June 29, 1948 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s714b/h"/>15 U.S.C. 714b(h)).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f48e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f48f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In the case of a payment to which producers on a farm are entitled under the terms of an agreement entered into under the Agricultural Act of 1949 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s1421">7 U.S.C. 1421</span> et seq.), an interest penalty shall be paid to the producers if the payment has not been made by the required payment or loan closing date. The interest penalty shall be paid—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f490-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> on the amount of payment or loan due; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f491-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> for the period beginning on the first day beginning after the required payment or loan closing date and ending on the date the amount is paid or loaned.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f492-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this subsection, the “required payment or loan closing date” means—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f493-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> for a purchase agreement, the 30th day after delivery of the warehouse receipt for the commodity subject to the purchase agreement;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f494-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> for a loan agreement, the 30th day beginning after the date of receipt of an application with all requisite documentation and signatures, unless the applicant requests that the disbursement be deferred;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f495-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> for refund of amounts received greater than the amount required to repay a commodity loan, the first business day after the Commodity Credit Corporation receives payment for such loan;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f496-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> for land diversion payments (other than advance payments), the 30th day beginning after the date of completion of the production adjustment contract by the producer;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f497-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> for an advance land diversion payment, 30 days after the date the Commodity Credit Corporation executes the contract with the producer;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f498-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> for a deficiency payment (other than advance payments) based upon a 12-month or 5-month period, 91 days after the end of such period; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f499-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/2/B/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> for an advance deficiency payment, 30 days after the date the Commodity Credit Corporation executes the contract with the producer.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f49a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Payment of the interest penalty under this subsection shall be made out of funds available under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1948-06-29/s8"/>section 8 of the Act of June 29, 1948 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s714f"/>15 U.S.C. 714f).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f49b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3902/h/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3907"/>Section 3907 of this title shall not apply to interest penalty payments made under this subsection.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(18)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2475">96 Stat. 2475</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/216">Pub. L. 98–216</span>, § 1(6), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-02-14">Feb. 14, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/4">98 Stat. 4</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/496">Pub. L. 100–496</span>, § 3, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-17">Oct. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2456">102 Stat. 2456</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/362/tXIII">Pub. L. 105–362, title XIII</span>, § 1301(c)(2)(B), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-11-10">Nov. 10, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3293">112 Stat. 3293</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(7), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1006f4a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903"><span itemtype="num" value="3903">§ 3903.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Regulations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall prescribe regulations to carry out <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3902">section 3902 of this title</span>. The regulations shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> provide that the required payment date is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the date payment is due under the contract for the item of property or service provided; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 30 days after a proper invoice for the amount due is received if a specific payment date is not established by contract;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> for the acquisition of meat or a meat food product (as defined in section 2(a)(3) of the Packers and Stockyards Act, 1921 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s182/3"/>7 U.S.C. 182(3))), including any edible fresh or frozen poultry meat, any perishable poultry meat food product, fresh eggs, and any perishable egg product, or of fresh or frozen fish (as defined in section 204(3) of the Fish and Seafood Promotion Act of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s4003/3"/>16 U.S.C. 4003(3)), provide a required payment date of not later than 7 days after the meat, meat food product, or fish is delivered; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> for the acquisition of a perishable agricultural commodity (as defined in section 1(4) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002064"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002064"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act, 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s499a/4"/>7 U.S.C. 499a(4))), provide a required payment date consistent with that Act;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> for the acquisition of dairy products (as defined in section 111(e) of the Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s4502/e"/>7 U.S.C. 4502(e)), the acquisition of edible fats or oils, and the acquisition of food products prepared from edible fats or oils, provide a required payment date of not later than 10 days after the date on which a proper invoice for the amount due has been received by the agency acquiring such dairy products, fats, oils, or food products;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> require periodic payments, in the case of a property or service contract which does not prohibit periodic payments for partial deliveries or other contract performance during the contract period, upon—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> submission of an invoice for property delivered or services performed during the contract period, if an invoice is required by the contract; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> either—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/5/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> acceptance of the property or services by an employee of an agency authorized to accept the property or services; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/5/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the making of a determination by such an employee, that the performance covered by the payment conforms to the terms and conditions of the contract;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> in the case of a construction contract, provide for the payment of interest on—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a progress payment (including a monthly percentage-of-completion progress payment or milestone payments for completed phases, increments, or segments of any project) that is approved as payable by the agency pursuant to subsection (b) of this section and remains unpaid for—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/6/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a period of more than 14 days after receipt of the payment request by
