the place or person designated by the agency to first receive such requests; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/6/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> a longer period, specified in the solicitation, if required to afford the Government a practicable opportunity to adequately inspect the work and to determine the adequacy of the contractor’s performance under the contract; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any amounts which the agency has retained pursuant to a prime contract clause providing for retaining a percentage of progress payments otherwise due to a contractor and that are approved for release to the contractor, if such retained amounts are not paid to the contractor by a date specified in the contract or, in the absence of such a specified date, by the 30th day after final acceptance;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> require that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> each invoice be reviewed as soon as practicable after receipt for the purpose of determining that such an invoice is a proper invoice within the meaning of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3901/a/3"/>section 3901(a)(3) of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any invoice determined not to be such a proper invoice suitable for payment shall be returned as soon as practicable, but not later than 7 days, after receipt, specifying the reasons that the invoice is not a proper invoice; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/7/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the number of days available to an agency to make a timely payment of an invoice without incurring an interest penalty shall be reduced by the number of days by which an agency exceeds the requirements of subparagraph (B) of this paragraph;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> permit an agency to make payment up to 7 days prior to the required payment date, or earlier as determined by the agency to be necessary on a case-by-case basis; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> prescribe the methods for computing interest under section 3903(c) <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A payment request may not be approved under subsection (a)(6)(A) of this section unless the application for such payment includes—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> substantiation of the amounts requested; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a certification by the prime contractor, to the best of the contractor’s knowledge and belief, that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the amounts requested are only for performance in accordance with the specifications, terms, and conditions of the contract;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> payments to subcontractors and suppliers have been made from previous payments received under the contract, and timely payments will be made from the proceeds of the payment covered by the certification, in accordance with their subcontract agreements and the requirements of this chapter; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the application does not include any amounts which the prime contractor intends to withhold or retain from a subcontractor or supplier in accordance with the terms and conditions of their subcontract.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The agency shall return any such payment request which is defective to the contractor within 7 days after receipt, with a statement identifying the defect.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A contract for the procurement of subsistence items that is entered into under the prime vendor program of the Defense Logistics Agency may specify for the purposes of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3902"/>section 3902 of this title a single required payment date that is to be applicable to an invoice for subsistence items furnished under the contract when more than one payment due date would otherwise be applicable to the invoice under the regulations prescribed under paragraphs (2), (3), and (4) of subsection (a) or under any other provisions of law. The required payment date specified in the contract shall be consistent with prevailing industry practices for the subsistence items, but may not be more than 10 days after the date of receipt of the invoice or the certified date of receipt of the items. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall provide in the regulations under subsection (a) that when a required payment date is so specified for an invoice, no other payment due date applies to the invoice.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The contracting officer shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> compute the interest which a contractor shall be obligated to pay under sections 3905(a)(2) and 3905(e)(6) of this title on the basis of the average bond equivalent rates of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the most recent auction of such bills prior to the date the contractor received the unearned amount; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> deduct the interest amount determined under subparagraph (A) of this paragraph from the next available payment to the contractor.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3903/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Amounts deducted from payments to contractors under paragraph (1)(B) shall revert to the Treasury.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(18)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2476">96 Stat. 2476</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/496">Pub. L. 100–496</span>, §§ 4–7, 13(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-17">Oct. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2457-2459">102 Stat. 2457–2459</span>, 2465; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/190/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 102–190, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 842, <span itemtype="date" date="1991-12-05">Dec. 5, 1991</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/105/1449">105 Stat. 1449</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/65/dA/tX">Pub. L. 106–65, div. A, title X</span>, § 1009, <span itemtype="date" date="1999-10-05">Oct. 5, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/738">113 Stat. 738</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1006f4d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3904"><span itemtype="num" value="3904">§ 3904.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitations on discount payments</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The head of an agency offered a discount by a business concern from an amount due under a contract for property or service in exchange for payment within a specified time may pay the discounted amount only if payment is made within the specified time. For the purpose of the preceding sentence, the specified time shall be determined from the date of the invoice. The head of the agency shall pay an interest penalty on an amount remaining unpaid in violation of this section. The penalty accrues as provided under sections 3902 and 3903 of this title, except that the required payment date for the unpaid amount is the last day specified in the contract that the discounted amount may be paid.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(18)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2476">96 Stat. 2476</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/496">Pub. L. 100–496</span>, § 8, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-17">Oct. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2460">102 Stat. 2460</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1006f4d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905"><span itemtype="num" value="3905">§ 3905.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment provisions relating to construction contracts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In the event that a contractor, after making a certified payment request to an agency pursuant to <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3903/b">section 3903(b) of this title</span>, discovers that a portion or all of such payment request constitutes a payment for performance by such contractor that fails to conform to the specifications, terms, and conditions of its contract (hereafter in this subsection referred to as the “unearned amount”), then the contractor shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> notify the agency of such performance deficiency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> be obligated to pay the Government an amount equal to interest on the unearned amount (computed in the manner provided in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3903/c">section 3903(c) of this title</span>), from the date of the contractor’s receipt of such unearned amount until—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the date the contractor notifies the agency that the performance deficiency has been corrected; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the date the contractor reduces the amount of any subsequent certified application for payment to such agency by an amount equal to the unearned amount.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each construction contract awarded by an agency shall include a clause that requires the prime contractor to include in each subcontract for property or services entered into by the prime contractor and a subcontractor (including a material supplier) for the purpose of performing such construction contract—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a payment clause which obligates the prime contractor to pay the subcontractor for satisfactory performance under its subcontract within 7 days out of such amounts as are paid to the prime contractor by the agency under such contract; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> an interest penalty clause which obligates the prime contractor to pay to the subcontractor an interest penalty on amounts due in the case of each payment not made in accordance with the payment clause included in the subcontract pursuant to paragraph (1) of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> for the period beginning on the day after the required payment date and ending on the date on which payment of the amount due is made; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> computed at the rate specified by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3902/a"/>section 3902(a) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The construction contract awarded by the agency shall further require the prime contractor to include in each of its subcontracts (for the purpose of performance of such construction contract) a provision requiring the subcontractor to include a payment clause and an interest penalty clause conforming to the standards of subsection (b) of this section in each of its subcontracts and to require each of its subcontractors to include such clauses in their subcontracts with each lower-tier subcontractor or supplier.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The clauses required by subsections (b) and (c) of this section shall not be construed to impair the right of a prime contractor or a subcontractor at any tier to negotiate, and to include in their subcontract, provisions which—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> permit the prime contractor or a subcontractor to retain (without cause) a specified percentage of each progress payment otherwise due to a subcontractor for satisfactory performance under the subcontract, without incurring any obligation to pay a late payment interest penalty, in accordance with terms and conditions agreed to by the parties to the subcontract, giving such recognition as the parties deem appropriate to the ability of a subcontractor to furnish a performance bond and a payment bond;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> permit the contractor or subcontractor to make a determination that part or all of the subcontractor’s request for payment may be withheld in accordance with the subcontract agreement; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> permit such withholding without incurring any obligation to pay a late payment penalty if—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/d/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a notice conforming to the standards of subsection (g) of this section has been previously furnished to the subcontractor; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/d/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a copy of any notice issued by a prime contractor pursuant to subparagraph (A) of this paragraph has been furnished to the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If a prime contractor, after making application to an agency for payment under a contract but before making a payment to a subcontractor for the subcontractor’s performance covered by such application, discovers that all or a portion of the payment otherwise due such subcontractor is subject to withholding from the subcontractor in accordance with the subcontract agreement, then the prime contractor shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> furnish to the subcontractor a notice conforming to the standards of subsection (g) of this section as soon as practicable upon ascertaining the cause giving rise to a withholding, but prior to the due date for subcontractor payment;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> furnish to the Government, as soon as practicable, a copy of the notice furnished to the subcontractor pursuant to paragraph (1) of this subsection;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> reduce the subcontractor’s progress payment by an amount not to exceed the amount specified in the notice of withholding furnished under paragraph (1) of this subsection;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> pay the subcontractor as soon as practicable after the correction of the identified subcontract performance deficiency, and—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> make such payment within—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> 7 days after correction of the identified subcontract performance deficiency (unless the funds therefor must be recovered from the Government because of a reduction under paragraph (5)(A)); or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> 7 days after the contractor recovers such funds from the Government; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> incur an obligation to pay a late payment interest penalty computed at the rate specified by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3902/a"/>section 3902(a) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> notify the Government, upon—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> reduction of the amount of any subsequent certified application for payment; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> payment to the subcontractor of any withheld amounts of a progress payment, specifying—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/5/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the amounts of the progress payments withheld under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1006f4f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/5/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the dates that such withholding began and ended; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> be obligated to pay to the Government an amount equal to interest on the withheld payments (computed in the manner provided in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3903/c">section 3903(c) of this title</span>), from the 8th day after receipt of the withheld amounts from the Government until—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the day the identified subcontractor performance deficiency is corrected; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1006f4fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/e/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the date that any subsequent payment is reduced under paragraph (5)(A).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f4fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If a prime contractor, after making payment to a first-tier subcontractor, receives from a supplier or subcontractor of the first-tier subcontractor (hereafter referred to as a “second-tier subcontractor”) a written notice in accordance with <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s3133/b">section 3133(b) of title 40</span>, asserting a deficiency in such first-tier subcontractor’s performance under the contract for which the prime contractor may be ultimately liable, and the prime contractor determines that all or a portion of future payments otherwise due such first-tier subcontractor is subject to withholding in accordance with the subcontract agreement, then the prime contractor may, without incurring an obligation to pay an interest penalty under subsection (e)(6) of this section—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> furnish to the first-tier subcontractor a notice conforming to the standards of subsection (g) of this section as soon as practicable upon making such determination; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f4ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> withhold from the first-tier subcontractor’s next available progress payment or payments an amount not to exceed the amount specified in the notice of withholding furnished under subparagraph (A) of this paragraph.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f500-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> As soon as practicable, but not later than 7 days after receipt of satisfactory written notification that the identified subcontract performance deficiency has been corrected, the prime contractor shall pay the amount withheld under paragraph (1)(B) of this subsection to such first-tier subcontractor, or shall incur an obligation to pay a late payment interest penalty to such first-tier subcontractor computed at the rate specified by <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3902/a"/>section 3902(a) of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1006f501-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A written notice of any withholding shall be issued to a subcontractor (with a copy to the Government of any such notice issued by a prime contractor), specifying—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1006f502-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the amount to be withheld;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093df3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the specific causes for the withholding under the terms of the subcontract; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093df4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the remedial actions to be taken by the subcontractor in order to receive payment of the amounts withheld.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093df5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> A prime contractor may not request payment from the agency of any amount withheld or retained in accordance with subsection (d) of this section until such time as the prime contractor has determined and certified to the agency that the subcontractor is entitled to the payment of such amount.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093df6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> A dispute between a contractor and subcontractor relating to the amount or entitlement of a subcontractor to a payment or a late payment interest penalty under a clause included in the subcontract pursuant to subsection (b) or (c) of this section does not constitute a dispute to which the United States is a party. The United States may not be interpleaded in any judicial or administrative proceeding involving such a dispute.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093df7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> Except as provided in subsection (i) of this section, this section shall not limit or impair any contractual, administrative, or judicial remedies otherwise available to a contractor or a subcontractor in the event of a dispute involving late payment or nonpayment by a prime contractor or deficient subcontract performance or nonperformance by a subcontractor.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093df8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3905/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span></p> A contractor’s obligation to pay an interest penalty to a subcontractor pursuant to the clauses included in a subcontract under subsection (b) or (c) of this section may not be construed to be an obligation of the United States for such interest penalty. A contract modification may not be made for the purpose of providing reimbursement of such interest penalty. A cost reimbursement claim may not include any amount for reimbursement of such interest penalty.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/496">Pub. L. 100–496</span>, § 9(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-17">Oct. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2460">102 Stat. 2460</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(7), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1300">116 Stat. 1300</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093dfe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3906"><span itemtype="num" value="3906">[§ 3906.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/362/tXIII">Pub. L. 105–362, title XIII</span>, § 1301(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-11-10">Nov. 10, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3293">112 Stat. 3293</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093e02-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907"><span itemtype="num" value="3907">§ 3907.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Relationship to other laws</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e03-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A claim for an interest penalty not paid under this chapter may be filed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t41/s7103"/>section 7103 of title 41.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An interest penalty under this chapter does not continue to accrue—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> after a claim for a penalty is filed under chapter 71 of title 41; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> for more than one year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Paragraph (1) of this subsection does not prevent an interest penalty from accruing under section 7109(a)(1) and (b) of title 41 after a penalty stops accruing under this chapter. A penalty accruing under section 7109(a)(1) and (b) may accrue on an unpaid contract payment and on the unpaid penalty under this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s3907/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Except as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s3904"/>section 3904 of this title, this chapter does not require an interest penalty on a payment that is not made because of a dispute between the head of an agency and a business concern over the amount of payment or compliance with the contract. A claim related to the dispute, and interest payable for the period during which the dispute is being resolved, is subject to chapter 71 of title 41.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(18)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2477">96 Stat. 2477</span>, § 3906; renumbered § 3907, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/496">Pub. L. 100–496</span>, § 9(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-10-17">Oct. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/2460">102 Stat. 2460</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(8), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subtitle" style="-uslm-lc:I52" id="id10093e0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">SUBTITLE IV—</span><span itemtype="heading">MONEY</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10093e10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch51"><span itemtype="num" value="51">CHAPTER 51—</span><span itemtype="heading">COINS AND CURRENCY</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10093e14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch51/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">MONETARY SYSTEM</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093e15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5101"><span itemtype="num" value="5101">§ 5101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Decimal system</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">United States money is expressed in dollars, dimes or tenths, cents or hundreths,<span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002069">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002069"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> and mills or thousandths. A dime is a tenth of a dollar, a cent is a hundredth of a dollar, and a mill is a thousandth of a dollar.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/980">96 Stat. 980</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093e25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5102"><span itemtype="num" value="5102">§ 5102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Standard weight</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The standard troy pound of the National Institute of Standards and Technology of the Department of Commerce shall be the standard used to ensure that the weight of United States coins conforms to specifications in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5112">section 5112 of this title</span>.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/980">96 Stat. 980</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/418/tV">Pub. L. 100–418, title V</span>, § 5115(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-08-23">Aug. 23, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1433">102 Stat. 1433</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093e2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5103"><span itemtype="num" value="5103">§ 5103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Legal tender</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">United States coins and currency (including Federal reserve notes and circulating notes of Federal reserve banks and national banks) are legal tender for all debts, public charges, taxes, and dues. Foreign gold or silver coins are not legal tender for debts.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/980">96 Stat. 980</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(19), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2477">96 Stat. 2477</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10093e31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch51/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL AUTHORITY</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093e32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111"><span itemtype="num" value="5111">§ 5111.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Minting and issuing coins, medals, and numismatic items</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall mint and issue coins described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5112"/>section 5112 of this title in amounts the Secretary decides are necessary to meet the needs of the United States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may prepare national medal dies and strike national and other medals if it does not interfere with regular minting operations but may not prepare private medal dies;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may prepare and distribute numismatic items; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> may mint coins for a foreign country if the minting does not interfere with regular minting operations, and shall prescribe a charge for minting the foreign coins equal to the cost of the minting (including labor, materials, and the use of machinery).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Department of the Treasury has a coinage metal fund and a coinage profit fund. The Secretary may use the coinage metal fund to buy metal to mint coins. The Secretary shall credit the coinage profit fund with the amount by which the nominal value of the coins minted from the metal exceeds the cost of the metal. The Secretary shall charge the coinage profit fund with waste incurred in minting coins and the cost of distributing the coins, including the cost of coin bags and pallets. The Secretary shall deposit in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts excess amounts in the coinage profit fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Procurements Relating to Coin Production.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may make contracts, on conditions the Secretary decides are appropriate and are in the public interest, to acquire articles, materials, supplies, and services (including equipment, manufacturing facilities, patents, patent rights, technical knowledge, and assistance) necessary to produce the coins referred to in this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Domestic control of coinage</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Subject to subparagraph (B), in order to protect the national security through domestic control of the coinage process, the Secretary shall acquire only such articles, materials, supplies, and services (including equipment, manufacturing facilities, patents, patent rights, technical knowledge, and assistance) for the production of coins as have been produced or manufactured in the United States unless the Secretary determines it to be inconsistent with the public interest, or the cost to be unreasonable, and publishes in the Federal Register a written finding stating the basis for the determination.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Subparagraph (A) shall apply only in the case of a bid or offer from a supplier the principal place of business of which is in a foreign country which does not accord to United States companies the same competitive opportunities for procurements in connection with the production of coins as it accords to domestic companies.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Determination.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10093e3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Any determination of the Secretary referred to in paragraph (2) shall not be reviewable in any administrative proceeding or court of the United States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10093e40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Other rights unaffected</span>.—</span></p>This paragraph does not alter or annul any right of review that arises under any provision of any law or regulation of the United States other than paragraph (2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Nothing in paragraph (2) of this subsection in any way affects the procurement by the Secretary of gold and silver for the production of coins by the United States Mint.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e42-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e43-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary may prohibit or limit the exportation, melting, or treatment of United States coins when the Secretary decides the prohibition or limitation is necessary to protect the coinage of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e44-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A person knowingly violating an order or license issued or regulation prescribed under paragraph (1) of this subsection, shall be fined not more than $10,000, imprisoned not more than 5 years, or both.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e45-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5111/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Coins exported, melted, or treated in violation of an order or license issued or regulation prescribed, and metal resulting from the melting or treatment, shall be forfeited to the United States Government. The powers of the Secretary and the remedies available to enforce forfeitures are those provided in part II of subchapter C of chapter 75 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002070"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002070"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s7321"/>26 U.S.C. 7321 et seq.).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/980">96 Stat. 980</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/274">Pub. L. 100–274</span>, § 3, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-03-31">Mar. 31, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/49">102 Stat. 49</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/390/tII">Pub. L. 102–390, title II</span>, § 222, <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-06">Oct. 6, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/1629">106 Stat. 1629</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10093e4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112"><span itemtype="num" value="5112">§ 5112.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Denominations, specifications, and design of coins</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury may mint and issue only the following coins:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a dollar coin that is 1.043 inches in diameter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a half dollar coin that is 1.205 inches in diameter and weighs 11.34 grams.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a quarter dollar coin that is 0.955 inch in diameter and weighs 5.67 grams.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a dime coin that is 0.705 inch in diameter and weighs 2.268 grams.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> a 5-cent coin that is 0.835 inch in diameter and weighs 5 grams.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> except as provided under subsection (c) of this section, a one-cent coin that is 0.75 inch in diameter and weighs 3.11 grams.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> A fifty dollar gold coin that is 32.7 millimeters in diameter, weighs 33.931 grams, and contains one troy ounce of fine gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> A twenty-five dollar gold coin that is 27.0 millimeters in diameter, weighs 16.966 grams, and contains one-half troy ounce of fine gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> A ten dollar gold coin that is 22.0 millimeters in diameter, weighs 8.483 grams, and contains one-fourth troy ounce of fine gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> A five dollar gold coin that is 16.5 millimeters in diameter, weighs 3.393 grams, and contains one-tenth troy ounce of fine gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> A $50 gold coin that is of an appropriate size and thickness, as determined by the Secretary, weighs 1 ounce, and contains 99.99 percent pure gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10093e5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/a/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span></p> A $25 coin of an appropriate size and thickness, as determined by the Secretary, that weighs 1 troy ounce and contains .9995 fine palladium.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10093e5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The half dollar, quarter dollar, and dime coins are clad coins with 3 layers of metal. The 2 identical outer layers are an alloy of 75 percent copper and 25 percent nickel. The inner layer is copper. The outer layers are metallurgically bonded to the inner layer and weigh at least 30 percent of the weight of the coin. The dollar coin shall be golden in color, have a distinctive edge, have tactile and visual features that make the denomination of the coin readily discernible, be minted and fabricated in the United States, and have similar metallic, anti-counterfeiting properties as United States coinage in circulation on the date of enactment of the United States $1 Coin Act of 1997. The 5-cent coin is an alloy of 75 percent copper and 25 percent nickel. In minting 5-cent coins, the Secretary shall use bars that vary not more than 2.5 percent from the percent of nickel required. Except as provided under subsection (c) of this section, the one-cent coin is an alloy of 95 percent copper and 5 percent zinc. In minting gold coins, the Secretary shall use alloys that vary not more than 0.1 percent from the percent of gold required. The specifications for alloys are by weight.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary may prescribe the weight and the composition of copper and zinc in the alloy of the one-cent coin that the Secretary decides are appropriate when the Secretary decides that a different weight and alloy of copper and zinc are necessary to ensure an adequate supply of one-cent coins to meet the needs of the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> United States coins shall have the inscription “In God We Trust”. The obverse side of each coin shall have the inscription “Liberty”. The reverse side of each coin shall have the inscriptions “United States of America” and “E Pluribus Unum” and a designation of the value of the coin. The design on the reverse side of the dollar, half dollar, and quarter dollar is an eagle. Subject to other provisions of this subsection, the obverse of any 5-cent coin issued after <p itemtype="date" date="2005-12-31"/>December 31, 2005, shall bear the likeness of Thomas Jefferson and the reverse of any such 5-cent coin shall bear an image of the home of Thomas Jefferson at Monticello. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Congress, shall select appropriate designs for the obverse and reverse sides of the dollar coin. The coins have an inscription of the year of minting or issuance. However, to prevent or alleviate a shortage of a denomination, the Secretary may inscribe coins of the denomination with the year that was last inscribed on coins of the denomination.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary shall prepare the devices, models, hubs, and dies for coins, emblems, devices, inscriptions, and designs authorized under this chapter. The Secretary may, after consulting with the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee and the Commission of Fine Arts, adopt and prepare new designs or models of emblems or devices that are authorized in the same way as when new coins or devices are authorized. The Secretary may change the design or die of a coin only once within 25 years of the first adoption of the design, model, hub, or die for that coin. The Secretary may procure services under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3109"/>section 3109 of title 5 in carrying out this paragraph.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary shall mint and issue, in qualities and quantities that the Secretary determines are sufficient to meet public demand, coins which—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> are 40.6 millimeters in diameter and weigh 31.103 grams;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> contain .999 fine silver;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> have a design—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> symbolic of Liberty on the obverse side; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> of an eagle on the reverse side;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> have inscriptions of the year of minting or issuance, and the words “Liberty”, “In God We Trust”, “United States of America”, “1 Oz. Fine Silver”, “E Pluribus Unum”, and “One Dollar”; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> have reeded edges.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Silver Coins.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sale price</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall sell the coins minted under subsection (e) to the public at a price equal to the market value of the bullion at the time of sale, plus the cost of minting, marketing, and distributing such coins (including labor, materials, dies, use of machinery, and promotional and overhead expenses).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Bulk sales</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall make bulk sales of the coins minted under subsection (e) at a reasonable discount.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Numismatic items</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5132/a/1"/>section 5132(a)(1) of this title, all coins minted under subsection (e) shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> For purposes of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5132/a/1"/>section 5132(a)(1) of this title, all coins minted under subsection (e) of this section shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> The coins issued under this title shall be legal tender as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5103"/>section 5103 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf6f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Notwithstanding <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5111/a/1">section 5111(a)(1) of this title</span>, the Secretary shall mint and issue the gold coins described in paragraphs (7), (8), (9), and (10) of subsection (a) of this section, in qualities and quantities that the Secretary determines are sufficient to meet public demand, and such gold coins shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf70-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> have a design determined by the Secretary, except that the fifty dollar gold coin shall have—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf71-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> on the obverse side, a design symbolic of Liberty; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> on the reverse side, a design representing a family of eagles, with the male carrying an olive branch and flying above a nest containing a female eagle and hatchlings;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> have inscriptions of the denomination, the weight of the fine gold content, the year of minting or issuance, and the words “Liberty”, “In God We Trust”, “United States of America”, and “E Pluribus Unum”; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> have reeded edges.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> The Secretary shall sell the coins minted under this subsection to the public at a price equal to the market value of the bullion at the time of sale, plus the cost of minting, marketing, and distributing such coins (including labor, materials, dies, use of machinery, and promotional and overhead expenses).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Secretary shall make bulk sales of the coins minted under this subsection at a reasonable discount.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> For purposes of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5132/a/1"/>section 5132(a)(1) of this title, all coins minted under this subsection shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of law and subject to subparagraph (B), the Secretary of the Treasury may change the diameter, weight, or design of any coin minted under this subsection or the fineness of the gold in the alloy of any such coin if the Secretary determines that the specific diameter, weight, design, or fineness of gold which differs from that otherwise required by law is appropriate for such coin.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The Secretary may not mint any coin with respect to which a determination has been made by the Secretary under subparagraph (A) before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date a notice of such determination is published in the Federal Register.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/i/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The Secretary may continue to mint and issue coins in accordance with the specifications contained in paragraphs (7), (8), (9), and (10) of subsection (a) and paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection at the same time the Secretary in minting and issuing other bullion and proof gold coins under this subsection in accordance with such program procedures and coin specifications, designs, varieties, quantities, denominations, and inscriptions as the Secretary, in the Secretary’s discretion, may prescribe from time to time.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span><span itemtype="heading"> General Waiver of Procurement Regulations.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/j/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except as provided in paragraph (2), no provision of law governing procurement or public contracts shall be applicable to the procurement of goods or services necessary for minting, marketing, or issuing any coin authorized under paragraph (7), (8), (9), or (10) of subsection (a) or subsection (e), including any proof version of any such coin.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/j/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Equal employment opportunity</span>.—</span></p>Paragraph (1) shall not relieve any person entering into a contract with respect to any coin referred to in such paragraph from complying with any law relating to equal employment opportunity.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span></p> The Secretary may mint and issue platinum bullion coins and proof platinum coins in accordance with such specifications, designs, varieties, quantities, denominations, and inscriptions as the Secretary, in the Secretary’s discretion, may prescribe from time to time.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l"><span itemtype="num" value="l">(l)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Redesign and Issuance of Quarter Dollar in Commemoration of Each of the</span> 50 States.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redesign beginning in 1999.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding the fourth sentence of subsection (d)(1) and subsection (d)(2), quarter dollar coins issued during the 10-year period beginning in 1999, shall have designs on the reverse side selected in accordance with this subsection which are emblematic of the 50 States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Transition provision</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding subparagraph (A), the Secretary may continue to mint and issue quarter dollars in 1999 which bear the design in effect before the redesign required under this subsection and an inscription of the year “1998” as required to ensure a smooth transition into the 10-year program under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Flexibility with regard to placement of inscriptions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding subsection (d)(1), the Secretary may select a design for quarter dollars issued during the 10-year period referred to in subparagraph (A) in which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baf86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/1/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the inscription described in the second sentence of subsection (d)(1) appears on the reverse side of any such quarter dollars; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baf87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/1/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any inscription described in the third sentence of subsection (d)(1) or the designation of the value of the coin appears on the obverse side of any such quarter dollars.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Single state designs</span>.—</span></p>The design on the reverse side of each quarter dollar issued during the 10-year period referred to in paragraph (1) shall be emblematic of 1 of the 50 States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance of coins commemorating 5 states during each of the 10 years.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The designs for the quarter dollar coins issued during each year of the 10-year period referred to in paragraph (1) shall be emblematic of 5 States selected in the order in which such States ratified the Constitution of the United States or were admitted into the Union, as the case may be.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Number of each of 5 coin designs in each year</span>.—</span></p>Of the quarter dollar coins issued during each year of the 10-year period referred to in paragraph (1), the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe, on the basis of such factors as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, the number of quarter dollars which shall be issued with each of the 5 designs selected for such year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Selection of design.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each of the 50 designs required under this subsection for quarter dollars shall be—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baf8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> selected by the Secretary after consultation with—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100baf8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/A/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Governor of the State being commemorated, or such other State officials or group as the State may designate for such purpose; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100baf90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/A/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the Commission of Fine Arts; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baf91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Selection and approval process</span>.—</span></p>Designs for quarter dollars may be submitted in accordance with the design selection and approval process developed by the Secretary in the sole discretion of the Secretary.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf93-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Participation</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may include participation by State officials, artists from the States, engravers of the United States Mint, and members of the general public.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf94-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Standards</span>.—</span></p>Because it is important that the Nation’s coinage and currency bear dignified designs of which the citizens of the United States can be proud, the Secretary shall not select any frivolous or inappropriate design for any quarter dollar minted under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/4/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Prohibition on certain representations</span>.—</span></p>No head and shoulders portrait or bust of any person, living or dead, and no portrait of a living person may be included in the design of any quarter dollar under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment as numismatic items</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of sections 5134 and 5136, all coins minted under this subsection shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf98-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Quality of coins</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may mint and issue such number of quarter dollars of each design selected under paragraph (4) in uncirculated and proof qualities as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf99-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Silver coins</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding subsection (b), the Secretary may mint and issue such number of quarter dollars of each design selected under paragraph (4) as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, with a content of 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baf9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/6/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sources of bullion</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall obtain silver for minting coins under subparagraph (B) from available resources, including stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf9b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/l/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Application in event of the admission of additional states</span>.—</span></p>If any additional State is admitted into the Union before the end of the 10-year period referred to in paragraph (1), the Secretary of the Treasury may issue quarter dollar coins, in accordance with this subsection, with a design which is emblematic of such State during any 1 year of such 10-year period, in addition to the quarter dollar coins issued during such year in accordance with paragraph (3)(A).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100baf9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m"><span itemtype="num" value="m">(m)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Commemorative Coin Program Restrictions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maximum number</span>.—</span></p>Beginning <p itemtype="date" date="1999-01-01"/>January 1, 1999, the Secretary may mint and issue commemorative coins under this section during any calendar year with respect to not more than 2 commemorative coin programs.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baf9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Mintage levels.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2"
