id="id100baf9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Except as provided in subparagraph (B), in carrying out any commemorative coin program, the Secretary shall mint—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafa0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> not more than 750,000 clad half-dollar coins;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafa1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> not more than 500,000 silver one-dollar coins; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafa2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> not more than 100,000 gold five-dollar or ten-dollar coins.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafa3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exception</span>.—</span></p>If the Secretary determines, based on independent, market-based research conducted by a designated recipient organization of a commemorative coin program, that the mintage levels described in subparagraph (A) are not adequate to meet public demand for that commemorative coin, the Secretary may waive one or more of the requirements of subparagraph (A) with respect to that commemorative coin program.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafa4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/m/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designated recipient organization defined</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this paragraph, the term “designated recipient organization” means any organization designated, under any provision of law, as the recipient of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bafa5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n"><span itemtype="num" value="n">(n)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Redesign and Issuance of Circulating</span> $1 Coins Honoring Each of the Presidents of the United States.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafa6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Redesign beginning in 2007</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding subsection (d) and in accordance with the provisions of this subsection, $1 coins issued during the period beginning <span itemtype="date" date="2007-01-01">January 1, 2007</span>, and ending upon the termination of the program under paragraph (8), shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafa7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> have designs on the obverse selected in accordance with paragraph (2)(B) which are emblematic of the Presidents of the United States; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafa8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> have a design on the reverse selected in accordance with paragraph (2)(A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafa9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Design requirements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The $1 coins issued in accordance with paragraph (1)(A) shall meet the following design requirements:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafaa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin reverse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The design on the reverse shall bear—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a likeness of the Statue of Liberty extending to the rim of the coin and large enough to provide a dramatic representation of Liberty while not being large enough to create the impression of a “2-headed” coin;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the inscription “$1”; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the inscription “United States of America”.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin obverse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The design on the obverse shall contain—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafaf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the name and likeness of a President of the United States; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> basic information about the President, including—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bafb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/B/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the dates or years of the term of office of such President; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bafb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/B/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> a number indicating the order of the period of service in which the President served.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Edge-incused inscriptions.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The inscription of the year of minting or issuance of the coin and the inscription “E Pluribus Unum” shall be edge-incused into the coin.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Preservation of distinctive edge</span>.—</span></p>The edge-incusing of the inscriptions under clause (i) on coins issued under this subsection shall be done in a manner that preserves the distinctive edge of the coin so that the denomination of the coin is readily discernible, including by individuals who are blind or visually impaired.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Inscriptions of “liberty”</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding the second sentence of subsection (d)(1), because the use of a design bearing the likeness of the Statue of Liberty on the reverse of the coins issued under this subsection adequately conveys the concept of Liberty, the inscription of “Liberty” shall not appear on the coins.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation in series to deceased presidents</span>.—</span></p>No coin issued under this subsection may bear the image of a living former or current President, or of any deceased former President during the 2-year period following the date of the death of that President.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Inscription of “in god we trust”</span>.—</span></p>The design on the obverse or the reverse shall bear the inscription “In God We Trust”.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance of coins commemorating presidents.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Order of issuance</span>.—</span></p>The coins issued under this subsection commemorating Presidents of the United States shall be issued in the order of the period of service of each President, beginning with President George Washington.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafbb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Treatment of period of service.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafbc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Subject to clause (ii), only 1 coin design shall be issued for a period of service for any President, no matter how many consecutive terms of office the President served.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Nonconsecutive terms</span>.—</span></p>If a President has served during 2 or more nonconsecutive periods of service, a coin shall be issued under this subsection for each such nonconsecutive period of service.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafbe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance of coins commemorating 4 presidents during each year of the period.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The designs for the $1 coins issued during each year of the period referred to in paragraph (1) shall be emblematic of 4 Presidents until each President has been so honored, subject to paragraph (2)(E).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Number of 4 circulating coin designs in each year</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall prescribe, on the basis of such factors as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, the number of $1 coins that shall be issued with each of the designs selected for each year of the period referred to in paragraph (1).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Legal tender</span>.—</span></p>The coins minted under this title shall be legal tender, as provided in section 5103.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment as numismatic items</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of section <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002071"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002071"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> 5134 and 5136, all coins minted under this subsection shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Issuance of numismatic coins</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may mint and issue such number of $1 coins of each design selected under this subsection in uncirculated and proof qualities as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Termination of program</span>.—</span></p>The issuance of coins under this subsection shall terminate when each President has been so honored, subject to paragraph (2)(E), and may not be resumed except by an Act of Congress.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/n/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reversion to preceding design</span>.—</span></p>Upon the termination of the issuance of coins under this subsection, the design of all $1 coins shall revert to the so-called “Sacagawea-design” $1 coins.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bafc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o"><span itemtype="num" value="o">(o)</span><span itemtype="heading"> First Spouse Bullion Coin Program.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>During the same period described in subsection (n), the Secretary shall issue bullion coins under this subsection that are emblematic of the spouse of each such President.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Specifications</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The coins issued under this subsection shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> have the same diameter as the $1 coins described in subsection (n);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> weigh 0.5 ounce; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafcb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> contain 99.99 percent pure gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafcc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Design requirements.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafcd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin obverse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The design on the obverse of each coin issued under this subsection shall contain—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the name and likeness of a person who was a spouse of a President during the President’s period of service;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafcf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> an inscription of the years during which such person was the spouse of a President during the President’s period of service; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafd0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> a number indicating the order of the period of service in which such President served.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafd1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin reverse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The design on the reverse of each coin issued under this subsection shall bear—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafd2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> images emblematic of the life and work of the First Spouse whose image is borne on the obverse; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the inscription “United States of America”.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designated denomination</span>.—</span></p>Each coin issued under this subsection shall bear, on the reverse, an inscription of the nominal denomination of the coin which shall be “$10”.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Design in case of no first spouse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In the case of any President who served without a spouse—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the image on the obverse of the bullion coin corresponding to the $1 coin relating to such President shall be an image emblematic of the concept of “Liberty”—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bafd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/D/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> as represented on a United States coin issued during the period of service of such President; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bafd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/D/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> as represented, in the case of President Chester Alan Arthur, by a design incorporating the name and likeness of Alice Paul, a leading strategist in the suffrage movement, who was instrumental in gaining women the right to vote upon the adoption of the 19th amendment and thus the ability to participate in the election of future Presidents, and who was born on <p itemtype="date" date="1885-01-11"/>January 11, 1885, during the term of President Arthur; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the reverse of such bullion coin shall be of a design representative of themes of such President, except that in the case of the bullion coin referred to in clause (i)(II) the reverse of such coin shall be representative of the suffrage movement.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Design and coin for each spouse</span>.—</span></p>A separate coin shall be designed and issued under this section for each person who was the spouse of a President during any portion of a term of office of such President.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafdb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/3/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Inscriptions</span>.—</span></p>Each bullion coin issued under this subsection shall bear the inscription of the year of minting or issuance of the coin and such other inscriptions as the Secretary may determine to be appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafdc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sale of bullion coins</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each bullion coin issued under this subsection shall be sold by the Secretary at a price that is equal to or greater than the sum of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafdd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the face value of the coins; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafde-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the cost of designing and issuing the coins (including labor, materials, dies, use of machinery, overhead expenses, marketing, and shipping).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafdf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance of coins commemorating first spouses.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafe0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The bullion coins issued under this subsection with respect to any spouse of a President shall be issued on the same schedule as the $1 coin issued under subsection (n) with respect to each such President.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafe1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maximum number of bullion coins for each design</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafe2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/5/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> prescribe, on the basis of such factors as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, the maximum number of bullion coins that shall be issued with each of the designs selected under this subsection; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafe3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/5/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> announce, before the issuance of the bullion coins of each such design, the maximum number of bullion coins of that design that will be issued.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafe4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Termination of program</span>.—</span></p>No bullion coin may be issued under this subsection after the termination, in accordance with subsection (n)(8), of the $1 coin program established under subsection (n).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafe5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Quality of coins</span>.—</span></p>The bullion coins minted under this Act shall be issued in both proof and uncirculated qualities.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafe6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Source of gold bullion.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafe7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall acquire gold for the coins issued under this subsection by purchase of gold mined from natural deposits in the United States, or in a territory or possession of the United States, within 1 year after the month in which the ore from which it is derived was mined.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafe8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Price of gold</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall pay not more than the average world price for the gold mined under subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafe9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Bronze medals</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may strike and sell bronze medals that bear the likeness of the bullion coins authorized under this subsection, at a price, size, and weight, and with such inscriptions, as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Legal tender</span>.—</span></p>The coins minted under this title shall be legal tender, as provided in section 5103.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafeb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/o/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment as numismatic items</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of section <p itemtype="sup"/>1 5134 and 5136, all coins minted under this subsection shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bafec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p"><span itemtype="num" value="p">(p)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Removal of Barriers to Circulation of</span> $1 Coin.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bafed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Acceptance by agencies and instrumentalities</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Beginning <span itemtype="date" date="2006-01-01">January 1, 2006</span>, all agencies and instrumentalities of the United States, the United States Postal Service, all nonappropriated fund instrumentalities established under title 10, United States Code, all transit systems that receive operational subsidies or any disbursement of funds from the Federal Government, such as funds from the Federal Highway Trust Fund, including the Mass Transit Account, and all entities that operate any business, including vending machines, on any premises owned by the United States or under the control of any agency or instrumentality of the United States, including the legislative and judicial branches of the Federal Government, shall take such action as may be appropriate to ensure that by the end of the 2-year period beginning on such date—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> any business operations conducted by any such agency, instrumentality, system, or entity that involve coins or currency will be fully capable of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bafef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> accepting $1 coins in connection with such operations; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baff0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> other than vending machines that do not receive currency denominations higher than $1, dispensing $1 coins in connection with such operations; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baff1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> displays signs and notices denoting such capability on the premises where coins or currency are accepted or dispensed, including on each vending machine.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baff2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Publicity</span>.—</span></p>The Director of the United States Mint,<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002072"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002072"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> shall work closely with consumer groups, media outlets, and schools to ensure an adequate amount of news coverage, and other means of increasing public awareness, of the inauguration of the Presidential $1 Coin Program established in subsection (n) to ensure that consumers know of the availability of the coin.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100baff3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coordination</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and the Secretary shall take steps to ensure that an adequate supply of $1 coins is available for commerce and collectors at such places and in such quantities as are appropriate by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100baff4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> consulting, to accurately gauge demand for coins and to anticipate and eliminate obstacles to the easy and efficient distribution and circulation of $1 coins as well as all other circulating coins, from time to time but no less frequently than annually, with a coin users group, which may include—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baff5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> representatives of merchants who would benefit from the increased usage of $1 coins;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baff6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> vending machine and other coin acceptor manufacturers;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baff7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> vending machine owners and operators;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baff8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> transit officials;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baff9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> municipal parking officials;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baffa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> depository institutions;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baffb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> coin and currency handlers;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baffc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/viii"><span itemtype="num" value="viii">(viii)</span></p> armored-car operators;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baffd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/ix"><span itemtype="num" value="ix">(ix)</span></p> car wash operators; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100baffe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/A/x"><span itemtype="num" value="x">(x)</span></p> coin collectors and dealers;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bafff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> submitting an annual report to the Congress containing—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb000-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> an assessment of the remaining obstacles to the efficient and timely circulation of coins, particularly $1 coins;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb001-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> an assessment of the extent to which the goals of subparagraph (C) are being met; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb002-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> such recommendations for legislative action the Board and the Secretary may determine to be appropriate;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb003-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> consulting with industry representatives to encourage operators of vending machines and other automated coin-accepting devices in the United States to accept coins issued under the Presidential $1 Coin Program established under subsection (n) and any coins bearing any design in effect before the issuance of coins required under subsection (n) (including the so-called “Sacagawea-design” $1 coins), and to include notices on the machines and devices of such acceptability;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb004-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> ensuring that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb005-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> during an introductory period, all institutions that want unmixed supplies of each newly-issued design of $1 coins minted under subsections (n) and (<p itemtype="i"/>o) are able to obtain such unmixed supplies; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb006-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> circulating coins will be available for ordinary commerce in packaging of sizes and types appropriate for and useful to ordinary commerce, including rolled coins;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb007-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> working closely with any agency, instrumentality, system, or entity referred to in paragraph (1) to facilitate compliance with the requirements of such paragraph; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb008-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/3/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> identifying, analyzing, and overcoming barriers to the robust circulation of $1 coins minted under subsections (n) and (<p itemtype="i"/>o), including the use of demand prediction, improved methods of distribution and circulation, and improved public education and awareness campaigns.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb009-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Bullion dealers</span>.—</span></p>The Director of the United States Mint shall take all steps necessary to ensure that a maximum number of reputable, reliable, and responsible dealers are qualified to offer for sale all bullion coins struck and issued by the United States Mint.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb00a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/p/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Review of co-circulation</span>.—</span></p>At such time as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, and after consultation with the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Secretary shall notify the Congress of its assessment of issues related to the co-circulation of any circulating $1 coin bearing any design, other than the so-called “Sacagawea-design” $1 coin, in effect before the issuance of coins required under subsection (n), including the effect of co-circulation on the acceptance and use of $1 coins, and make recommendations to the Congress for improving the circulation of $1 coins.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bb00b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q"><span itemtype="num" value="q">(q)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Gold Bullion Coins.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb00c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of the Presidential $1 Coin Act of 2005, the Secretary shall commence striking and issuing for sale such number of $50 gold bullion and proof coins as the Secretary may determine to be appropriate, in such quantities, as the Secretary, in the Secretary’s discretion, may prescribe.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb00d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Initial design.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb00e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except as provided under subparagraph (B), the obverse and reverse of the gold bullion coins struck under this subsection during the first year of issuance shall bear the original designs by James Earle Fraser, which appear on the 5-cent coin commonly referred to as the “Buffalo nickel” or the “1913 Type 1”.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb00f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Variations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The coins referred to in subparagraph (A) shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb010-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> have inscriptions of the weight of the coin and the nominal denomination of the coin incused in that portion of the design on the reverse of the coin commonly known as the “grassy mound”; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb011-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> bear such other inscriptions as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb012-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Source of gold bullion.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb013-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall acquire gold for the coins issued under this subsection by purchase of gold mined from natural deposits in the United States, or in a territory or possession of the United States, within 1 year after the month in which the ore from which it is derived was mined.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb014-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Price of gold</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall pay not more than the average world price for the gold mined under subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb015-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sale of coins</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each gold bullion coin issued under this subsection shall be sold for an amount the Secretary determines to be appropriate, but not less than the sum of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb016-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the market value of the bullion at the time of sale; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb017-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the cost of designing and issuing the coins, including labor, materials, dies, use of machinery, overhead expenses, marketing, and shipping.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb018-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Legal tender</span>.—</span></p>The coins minted under this title shall be legal tender, as provided in section 5103.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb019-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/q/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment as numismatic items</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of section <p itemtype="sup"/>1 5134 and 5136, all coins minted under this subsection shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bb01a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r"><span itemtype="num" value="r">(r)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Redesign and Issuance of Circulating</span> $1 Coins Honoring Native Americans and the Important Contributions Made by Indian Tribes and Individual Native Americans in United States History.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb01b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redesign beginning in 2008.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb01c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Effective beginning <span itemtype="date" date="2008-01-01">January 1, 2008</span>, notwithstanding subsection (d), in addition to the coins to be issued pursuant to subsection (n), and in accordance with this subsection, the Secretary shall mint and issue $1 coins that—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb01d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> have as the designs on the obverse the so-called “Sacagawea design”; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb01e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> have a design on the reverse selected in accordance with paragraph (2)(A), subject to paragraph (3)(A).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb01f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Delayed date</span>.—</span></p>If the date of the enactment of the Native American $1 Coin Act is after <p itemtype="date" date="2007-08-25"/>August 25, 2007, subparagraph (A) shall be applied by substituting “2009” for “2008”.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb020-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Design requirements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The $1 coins issued in accordance with paragraph (1) shall meet the following design requirements:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb021-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin reverse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The design on the reverse shall bear—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb022-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> images celebrating the important contributions made by Indian tribes and individual Native Americans to the development of the United States and the history of the United States;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb023-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the inscription “$1”; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb024-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the inscription “United States of America”.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb025-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin obverse</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The design on the obverse shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb026-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> be chosen by the Secretary, after consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and review by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb027-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> contain the so-called “Sacagawea design” and the inscription “Liberty”.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb028-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Edge-incused inscriptions.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb029-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The inscription of the year of minting and issuance of the coin and the inscription “E Pluribus Unum” shall be edge-incused into the coin.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb02a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Preservation of distinctive edge</span>.—</span></p>The edge-incusing of the inscriptions under clause (i) on coins issued under this subsection shall be done in a manner that preserves the distinctive edge of the coin so that the denomination of the coin is readily discernible, including by individuals who are blind or visually impaired.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb02b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reverse design selection</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The designs selected for the reverse of the coins described under this subsection—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb02c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> shall be chosen by the Secretary after consultation with the Committee on Indian Affairs of the Senate, the Congressional Native American Caucus of the House of Representatives, the Commission of Fine Arts, and the National Congress of American Indians;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb02d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> shall be reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb02e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> may depict individuals and events such as—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb02f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the creation of Cherokee written language;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb030-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the Iroquois Confederacy;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb031-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> Wampanoag Chief Massasoit;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb032-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/IV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">(IV)</span></p> the “Pueblo Revolt”;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb033-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/V"><span itemtype="num" value="V">(V)</span></p> Olympian Jim Thorpe;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb034-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/VI"><span itemtype="num" value="VI">(VI)</span></p> Ely S. Parker, a general on the staff of General Ulysses S. Grant and later head of the Bureau of Indian Affairs; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb035-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iii/VII"><span itemtype="num" value="VII">(VII)</span></p> code talkers who served the United States Armed Forces during World War I and World War II; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb036-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/D/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> in the case of a design depicting the contribution of an individual Native American to the development of the United States and the history of the United States, shall not depict the individual in a size such that the coin could be considered to be a “2-headed” coin.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb037-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Inscription of “in god we trust”</span>.—</span></p>The design on the obverse or the reverse shall bear the inscription “In God We Trust”.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb038-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance of coins commemorating 1 native american event during each year.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb039-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Each design for the reverse of the $1 coins issued during each year shall be emblematic of 1 important Native American or Native American contribution each year.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb03a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Issuance period</span>.—</span></p>Each $1 coin minted with a design on the reverse in accordance with this subsection for any year shall be issued during the 1-year period beginning on January 1 of that year and shall be available throughout the entire 1-year period.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb03b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Order of issuance of designs</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each coin issued under this subsection commemorating Native Americans and their contributions—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb03c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/3/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> shall be issued, to the maximum extent practicable, in the chronological order in which the Native Americans lived or the events occurred, until the termination of the coin program described in subsection (n); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb03d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/3/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> thereafter shall be issued in any order determined to be appropriate by the Secretary, after consultation with the Committee on Indian Affairs of the Senate, the Congressional Native American Caucus of the House of Representatives, and the National Congress of American Indians.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb03e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Issuance of numismatic coins</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may mint and issue such number of $1 coins of each design selected under this subsection in uncirculated and proof qualities as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb03f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/r/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Quantity</span>.—</span></p>The number of $1 coins minted and issued in a year with the Sacagawea-design on the obverse shall be not less than 20 percent of the total number of $1 coins minted and issued in such year.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bb040-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s"><span itemtype="num" value="s">(s)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redesign and Issuance of Circulating Quarter Dollar Honoring the District of Columbia and Each of the Territories.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb041-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redesign in 2009.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb042-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding the fourth sentence of subsection (d)(1) and subsection (d)(2) and subject to paragraph (6)(B), quarter dollar coins issued during 2009, shall have designs on the reverse side selected in accordance with this subsection which are emblematic of the District of Columbia and the territories.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb043-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Flexibility with regard to placement of inscriptions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding subsection (d)(1), the Secretary may select a design for quarter dollars issued during 2009 in which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb044-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the inscription described in the second sentence of subsection (d)(1) appears on the reverse side of any such quarter dollars; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb045-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any inscription described in the third sentence of subsection (d)(1) or the designation of the value of the coin appears on the obverse side of any such quarter dollars.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb046-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Single district or territory design</span>.—</span></p>The design on the reverse side of each quarter dollar issued during 2009 shall be emblematic of one of the following: The District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb047-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Selection of design.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb048-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each of the 6 designs required under this subsection for quarter dollars shall be—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb049-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> selected by the Secretary after consultation with—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb04a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/A/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the chief executive of the District of Columbia or the territory being honored, or such other officials or group as the chief executive officer of the District of Columbia or the territory may designate for such purpose; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb04b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/A/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the Commission of Fine Arts; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb04c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb04d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Selection and approval process</span>.—</span></p>Designs for quarter dollars may be submitted in accordance with the design selection and approval process developed by the Secretary in the sole discretion of the Secretary.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb04e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Participation</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may include participation by District or territorial officials, artists from the District of Columbia or the territory, engravers of the United States Mint, and members of the general public.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb04f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Standards</span>.—</span></p>Because it is important that the Nation’s coinage and currency bear dignified designs of which the citizens of the United States can be proud, the Secretary shall not select any frivolous or inappropriate design for any quarter dollar minted under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb050-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/3/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Prohibition on certain representations</span>.—</span></p>No head and shoulders portrait or bust of any person, living or dead, and no portrait of a living person may be included in the design of any quarter dollar under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb051-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment as numismatic items</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of sections 5134 and 5136, all coins minted under this subsection shall be considered to be numismatic items.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb052-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb053-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Quality of coins</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may mint and issue such number of quarter dollars of each design selected under paragraph (3) in uncirculated and proof qualities as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb054-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Silver coins</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding subsection (b), the Secretary may mint and issue such number of quarter dollars of each design selected under paragraph (3) as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, with a content of 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb055-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Timing and order of issuance</span>.—</span></p>Coins minted under this subsection honoring the District of Columbia and each of the territories shall be issued in equal sequential intervals during 2009 in the following order: the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb056-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Other provisions.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb057-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Application in event of admission as a state</span>.—</span></p>If the District of Columbia or any territory becomes a State before the end of the 10-year period referred to in subsection (<p itemtype="i"/>l)(1), subsection (<p itemtype="i"/>l)(7) shall apply, and this subsection shall not apply, with respect to such State.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb058-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Application in event of independence</span>.—</span></p>If any territory becomes independent or otherwise ceases to be a territory or possession of the United States before quarter dollars bearing designs which are emblematic of such territory are minted pursuant to this subsection, this subsection shall cease to apply with respect to such territory.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb059-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/s/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Territory defined</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this subsection, the term “territory” means the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id100bb05a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t"><span itemtype="num" value="t">(t)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redesign and Issuance of Quarter Dollars Emblematic of National Sites in Each State, the District of Columbia, and Each Territory.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb05b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redesign beginning upon completion of prior program.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb05c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding the fourth sentence of subsection (d)(1) and subsection (d)(2), quarter dollars issued beginning in 2010 shall have designs on the reverse selected in accordance with this subsection which are emblematic of the national sites in the States, the District of Columbia and the territories of the United States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb05d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Flexibility with regard to placement of inscriptions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding subsection (d)(1), the Secretary may select a design for quarter dollars referred to in subparagraph (A) in which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb05e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the inscription described in the second sentence of subsection (d)(1) appears on the reverse side of any such quarter dollars; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb05f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any inscription described in the third sentence of subsection (d)(1) or the designation of the value of the coin appears on the obverse side of any such quarter dollars.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb060-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Inclusion of district of columbia, and territories</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this subsection, the term “State” has the same meaning as in section 3(a)(3) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb061-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Single site in each state</span>.—</span></p>The design on the reverse side of each quarter dollar issued during the period of issuance under this subsection shall be emblematic of 1 national site in each State.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100bb062-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Selection of site and design.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb063-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Site.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb064-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The selection of a national park or other national site in each State to be honored with a coin under this subsection shall be made by the Secretary of the Treasury, after consultation with the Secretary of the Interior and the governor or other chief executive of each State with respect to which a coin is to be issued under this subsection, and after giving full and thoughtful consideration to national sites that are not under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Interior so that the national site chosen for each State shall be the most appropriate in terms of natural or historic significance.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb065-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Timing</span>.—</span></p>The selection process under clause (i) shall be completed before the end of the 270-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of the America’s Beautiful National Parks Quarter Dollar Coin Act of 2008.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb066-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Design</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each of the designs required under this subsection for quarter dollars shall be—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb067-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> selected by the Secretary after consultation with—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb068-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/B/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Secretary of the Interior; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id100bb069-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/B/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the Commission of Fine Arts; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id100bb06a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb06b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Selection and approval process</span>.—</span></p>Recommendations for site selections and designs for quarter dollars may be submitted in accordance with the site and design selection and approval process developed by the Secretary in the sole discretion of the Secretary.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb06c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Participation in design</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may include participation by officials of the State, artists from the State, engravers of the United States Mint, and members of the general public.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100bb06d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Standards</span>.—</span></p>Because it is important that the Nation’s coinage and currency bear dignified designs of which the citizens of the United States can be proud, the Secretary shall not select any frivolous or inappropriate design for any quarter dollar minted under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id100df95e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/3/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Prohibition on certain representations</span>.—</span></p>No head and shoulders portrait or bust of any person, living or dead, no portrait of a living person, and no outline or map of a State may be included in the design on the reverse of any quarter dollar under this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id100df95f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5112/t/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Issuance of coins.—</span></p><p
