G, title LXXIII</span>, § 73001(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2015-12-04">Dec. 4, 2015</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/129/1786">129 Stat. 1786</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10179664-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133"><span itemtype="num" value="5133">§ 5133.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Settlement of accounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10179665-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary of the Treasury shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10179666-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> charge the superintendent of each mint with the amount in weight of standard metal of bullion the superintendent receives from the Secretary;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10179667-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> credit each superintendent with the amount in weight of coins, clippings, and other bullion the superintendent returns to the Secretary; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10179668-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> charge separately to each superintendent, who shall account for, copper to be used in the alloy of gold and silver bullion.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10179669-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Settlement of Accounts.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1017966a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>At least once each year, the Secretary of the Treasury shall settle the accounts of the superintendents of the mints.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1017966b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Procedure</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>At any settlement under this subsection, the superintendent shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1017966c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> return to the Secretary any coin, clipping, or other bullion in the possession of the superintendent; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1017966d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> present the Secretary with a statement of bullion received and returned since the last settlement (including any bullion returned for settlement).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1017966e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Audit</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1017966f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> audit the accounts of each superintendent; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10179670-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> allow each superintendent the waste of precious metals that the Secretary determines is necessary—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10179671-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> for refining and minting (within the limitations which the Secretary shall prescribe); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10179672-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/b/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> for casting fine gold and silver bars (within the limit prescribed for refining), except that any waste allowance under this clause may not apply to deposit operations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10179673-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> After settlement, the Secretary shall compare the amount of gold and silver bullion and coins on hand with the total liabilities of the mints. The Secretary also shall make a statement of the ordinary expense account.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10179674-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5133/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary shall procure for each mint a series of standard weights corresponding to the standard troy pound of the National Institute of Standards and Technology of the Department of Commerce. The series shall include a one pound weight and multiples and subdivisions of one pound from .01 grain to 25 pounds. At least once a year, the Secretary shall test the weights normally used in transactions at the mints against the standard weights.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/989">96 Stat. 989</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/274">Pub. L. 100–274</span>, § 2(c)(4)–(7), (9), (10), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-03-31">Mar. 31, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/49">102 Stat. 49</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/418/tV">Pub. L. 100–418, title V</span>, § 5115(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-08-23">Aug. 23, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1433">102 Stat. 1433</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1019df69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134"><span itemtype="num" value="5134">§ 5134.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019df6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Fund</span>.—</span></p>The term “Fund” means the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Mint</span>.—</span></p>The term “Mint” means the United States Mint.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Numismatic item</span>.—</span></p>The term “numismatic item” means any medal, proof coin, uncirculated coin, bullion coin, or other coin specifically designated by statute as a numismatic item, including products and accessories related to any such medal, coin, or item.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Numismatic operations and programs</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “numismatic operations and programs”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df6f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> means the activities concerning, and assets utilized in, the production, administration, sale, and management of numismatic items and the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df70-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> includes capital, personnel salaries, functions relating to operations, marketing, distribution, promotion, advertising, and official reception and representation, the acquisition or replacement of equipment, and the renovation or modernization of facilities (other than the construction or acquisition of new buildings).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df71-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Secretary</span>.—</span></p>The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019df72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment of Fund</span>.—</span></p>There is hereby established in the Treasury of the United States a revolving Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund consisting of amounts deposited in the fund <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002074"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002074"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> under subsection (c)(2) of this section or section 221(b) of the United States Mint Reauthorization and Reform Act of 1992 which shall be available to the Secretary for numismatic operations and programs of the United States Mint without fiscal year limitation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019df73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Operations of the Fund.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Payment of expenses</span>.—</span></p>Any expense incurred by the Secretary for numismatic operations and programs which the Secretary determines, in the Secretary’s sole discretion, to be ordinary and reasonable incidents of the numismatic business shall be paid out of the Fund, including any expense incurred pursuant to any obligation or other commitment of Mint numismatic operations and programs which was entered into before the beginning of fiscal year 1993.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Deposit of receipts</span>.—</span></p>All receipts from numismatic operations and programs shall be deposited into the Fund, including amounts attributable to any surcharge imposed with respect to the sale of any numismatic item.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Transfer of seigniorage</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall transfer monthly from the Fund to the general fund of the Treasury an amount equal to the total amount on the seigniorage of numismatic items sold since the date of any preceding transfer.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Transfer of excess amounts to the treasury.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>At such times as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, the Secretary shall transfer any amount in the Fund which the Secretary determines to be in excess of the amount required by the Fund to the Treasury for deposit as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Report to congress</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall submit an annual report to the Congress containing—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/4/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a statement of the total amount transferred to the Treasury pursuant to subparagraph (A) during the period covered by the report;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/4/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> a statement of the amount by which the amount on deposit in the Fund at the end of the period covered by the report exceeds the estimated operating costs of the Fund for the 1-year period beginning at the end of such period; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/c/4/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> an explanation of the specific purposes for which such excess amounts are being retained in the Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019df7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Budget Treatment.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall prepare budgets for the Fund, and estimates and statements of financial condition of the Fund in accordance with the requirements of section 9103 which shall be submitted to the President for inclusion in the budget submitted under section 1105.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Inclusion in annual report</span>.—</span></p>Statements of the financial condition of the Fund shall be included in the Secretary’s annual report on the operation of the Mint.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment as wholly owned government corporation for certain purposes</span>.—</span></p>Section 9104 shall apply to the Fund to the same extent such section applies to wholly owned Government corporations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019df81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Financial Statements, Audits, and Reports.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Annual financial statement required</span>.—</span></p>By the end of each calendar year, the Secretary shall prepare an annual financial statement of the Fund for the fiscal year which ends during such calendar year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents of financial statement</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each statement prepared pursuant to paragraph (1) shall, at a minimum, contain—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the overall financial position (including assets and liabilities) of the Fund as of the end of the fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the results of the numismatic operations and programs of the Fund during the fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the cash flows or the changes in financial position of the Fund;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a reconciliation of the financial statement to the budget reports of the Fund; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a supplemental schedule detailing—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/E/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the costs and expenses for the production, for the marketing, and for the distribution of each denomination of circulating coins produced by the Mint during the fiscal year and the per-unit cost of producing, of marketing, and of distributing each denomination of such coins; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/2/E/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the gross revenue derived from the sales of each such denomination of coins.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annual audits.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each annual financial statement prepared under paragraph (1) shall be audited—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> by—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1019df8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/A/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> an independent external auditor; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1019df8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/A/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I66" class="indent3 firstIndent-1"/> as designated by the Secretary; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> in accordance with the generally accepted Government auditing standards issued by the Comptroller General of the United States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Auditor’s report required</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The auditor designated to audit any financial statement of the Fund pursuant to subparagraph (A) shall submit a report—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> to the Secretary by March 31 of the year beginning after the end of the fiscal year covered by such financial statement; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df93-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> containing the auditor’s opinion on—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1019df94-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/B/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the financial statement of the Fund;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1019df95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/B/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the internal accounting and administrative controls and accounting systems of the Fund; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1019df96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/3/B/ii/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> the Fund’s compliance with applicable laws and regulations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019df97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annual report on fund.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df98-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Report required</span>.—</span></p>By April 30 of each year, the Secretary shall submit a report on the Fund for the most recently completed fiscal year to the President, the Congress, and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019df99-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents of annual report</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The annual report required under subparagraph (A) for any fiscal year shall include—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the financial statement prepared under paragraph (1) for such fiscal year;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df9b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the audit report submitted to the Secretary pursuant to paragraph (3)(B) for such fiscal year;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> a description of activities carried out during such fiscal year;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> a summary of information relating to numismatic operations and programs contained in the reports on systems on internal accounting and administrative controls and accounting systems submitted to the President and the Congress under section 3512(c);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> a summary of the corrective actions taken with respect to material weaknesses relating to numismatic operations and programs identified in the reports prepared under section 3512(c);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019df9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> any other information the Secretary considers appropriate to fully inform the Congress concerning the financial management of the Fund; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfa0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/4/B/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> a statement of the total amount of excess funds transferred to the Treasury.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfa1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Marketing report.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfa2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Report required for 10 years</span>.—</span></p>For each fiscal year beginning before fiscal year 2003, the Secretary shall submit an annual report on all marketing activities and expenses of the Fund to the Congress before the end of the 3-month period beginning at the end of such fiscal year.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfa3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents of report</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The report submitted pursuant to subparagraph (A) shall contain a detailed description of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfa4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/5/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the sources of income including surcharges; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfa5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/e/5/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> expenses incurred for manufacturing, materials, overhead, packaging, marketing, and shipping.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019dfa6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Conditions on Payment of Surcharges to Recipient Organizations.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfa7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment of surcharges.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfa8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item shall be paid from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 to any designated recipient organization unless—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfa9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> all numismatic operation and program costs allocable to the program under which such numismatic item is produced and sold have been recovered; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfaa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the designated recipient organization submits an audited financial statement that demonstrates, to the satisfaction of the Secretary, that, with respect to all projects or purposes for which the proceeds of such surcharge may be used, the organization has raised funds from private sources for such projects and purposes in an amount that is equal to or greater than the total amount of the proceeds of such surcharge derived from the sale of such numismatic item.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Unpaid amounts</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item that may otherwise be paid from the fund,<p itemtype="sup"/>1 under any provision of law relating to such numismatic item, to any designated recipient organization remains unpaid to such organization solely by reason of the matching fund requirement contained in subparagraph (A)(ii) after the end of the 2-year period beginning on the later of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the last day any such numismatic item is issued by the Secretary; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the date of the enactment of the American 5-Cent Coin Design Continuity Act of 2003,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I32" class="indent2 firstIndent0"/>such unpaid amount shall be deposited in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annual audits.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfaf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Annual audits of recipients required</span>.—</span></p>Each designated recipient organization that receives any payment from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item shall provide, as a condition for receiving any such amount, for an annual audit, in accordance with generally accepted government auditing standards by an independent public accountant selected by the organization, of all such payments to the organization beginning in the first fiscal year of the organization in which any such amount is received and continuing until all amounts received by such organization from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 with respect to such surcharges are fully expended or placed in trust.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Minimum requirements for annual audits</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>At a minimum, each audit of a designated recipient organization pursuant to subparagraph (A) shall report—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the amount of payments received by the designated recipient organization from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 during the fiscal year of the organization for which the audit is conducted that are derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the amount expended by the designated recipient organization from the proceeds of such surcharges during the fiscal year of the organization for which the audit is conducted; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> whether all expenditures by the designated recipient organization during the fiscal year of the organization for which the audit is conducted from the proceeds of such surcharges were for authorized purposes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Responsibility of organization to account for expenditures of surcharges</span>.—</span></p>Each designated recipient organization that receives any payment from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item shall take appropriate steps, as a condition for receiving any such payment, to ensure that the receipt of the payment and the expenditure of the proceeds of such surcharge by the organization in each fiscal year of the organization can be accounted for separately from all other revenues and expenditures of the organization.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Submission of audit report</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Not later than 90 days after the end of any fiscal year of a designated recipient organization for which an audit is required under subparagraph (A), the organization shall—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> submit a copy of the report to the Secretary of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> make a copy of the report available to the public.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of surcharges for audits</span>.—</span></p>Any designated recipient organization that receives any payment from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item may use the amount received to pay the cost of an audit required under subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Waiver of paragraph</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may waive the application of any subparagraph of this paragraph to any designated recipient organization for any fiscal year after taking into account the amount of surcharges that such organization received or expended during such year.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Nonapplicability to federal entities</span>.—</span></p>This paragraph shall not apply to any Federal agency or department or any independent establishment in the executive branch that receives any payment from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfbb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Availability of books and records</span>.—</span></p>An organization that receives any payment from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item shall provide, as a condition for receiving any such payment, to the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury or the Comptroller General of the United States, upon the request of such Inspector General or the Comptroller General, all books, records, and work papers belonging to or used by the organization, or by any independent public accountant who audited the organization in accordance with subparagraph (A), which may relate to the receipt or expenditure of any such amount by the organization.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfbc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of agents or attorneys to influence commemorative coin legislation</span>.—</span></p>No portion of any payment from the fund <p itemtype="sup"/>1 to any designated recipient organization of any amount derived from the proceeds of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item may be used, directly or indirectly, by the organization to compensate any agent or attorney for services rendered to support or influence in any way legislative action of the Congress relating to such numismatic item.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/f/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designated recipient organization defined</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this subsection, the term “designated recipient organization” means any organization designated, under any provision of law, as the recipient of any surcharge imposed on the sale of any numismatic item.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019dfbe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Quarterly Financial Reports.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Not later than the 30th day of each month following each calendar quarter through and including the final period of sales with respect to any commemorative coin program authorized on or after the date of enactment of the Treasury, Postal Service, and General Government Appropriations Act, 1997, the Mint shall submit to the Congress a quarterly financial report in accordance with this subsection.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Requirements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Each report submitted under paragraph (1) shall include, with respect to the calendar quarter at issue—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a detailed financial statement, prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, that includes financial information specific to that quarter, as well as cumulative financial information relating to the entire program;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a detailed accounting of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> all costs relating to marketing efforts;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> all funds projected for marketing use;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> all costs for employee travel relating to the promotion of commemorative coin programs;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> all numismatic items minted, sold, not sold, and rejected during the production process; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> the costs of melting down all rejected and unsold products;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> adequate market-based research for all commemorative coin programs; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5134/g/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a description of the efforts of the Mint in keeping the sale price of numismatic items as low as practicable.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/390/tII">Pub. L. 102–390, title II</span>, § 221(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-06">Oct. 6, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/1624">106 Stat. 1624</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tI">Pub. L. 104–208, div. A, title I</span>, § 101(f) [title V, § 529(b)(1), (2), (c)], <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-314">110 Stat. 3009–314</span>, 3009–349, 3009–350, 3009–352; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/445">Pub. L. 106–445</span>, § 3, <span itemtype="date" date="2000-11-06">Nov. 6, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1931">114 Stat. 1931</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/15/tI">Pub. L. 108–15, title I</span>, § 103(d)(2), title II, § 201(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2003-04-23">Apr. 23, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/619">117 Stat. 619</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1019dfd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135"><span itemtype="num" value="5135">§ 5135.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019dfd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Establishment.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>There is hereby established the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee (in this section referred to as the “Advisory Committee”) to advise the Secretary of the Treasury on the selection of themes and designs for coins.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Oversight of advisory committee</span>.—</span></p>The Advisory Committee shall be subject to the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury (hereafter in this section referred to as the “Secretary”).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1019dfd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Membership.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1019dfd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Appointment</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Advisory Committee shall consist of 11 members appointed by the Secretary as follows:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1019dfd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Seven persons appointed by the Secretary—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1019dfda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> one of whom shall be appointed from among individuals who are specially qualified to serve on the Advisory Committee by virtue of their education, training, or experience as a nationally or internationally recognized curator in the United States of a numismatic collection;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> one of whom shall be appointed from among individuals who are specially qualified to serve on the Advisory Committee by virtue of their experience in the medallic arts or sculpture;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> one of whom shall be appointed from among individuals who are specially qualified to serve on the Advisory Committee by virtue of their education, training, or experience in American history;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> one of whom shall be appointed from among individuals who are specially qualified to serve on the Advisory Committee by virtue of their education, training, or experience in numismatics; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> three of whom shall be appointed from among individuals who can represent the interests of the general public in the coinage of the United States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Four persons appointed by the Secretary on the basis of the recommendations of the following officials who shall make the selection for such recommendation from among citizens who are specially qualified to serve on the Advisory Committee by virtue of their education, training, or experience:<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> One person recommended by the Speaker of the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> One person recommended by the minority leader of the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> One person recommended by the majority leader of the Senate.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/1/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> One person recommended by the minority leader of the Senate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Terms.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except as provided in subparagraph (B), members of the Advisory Committee shall be appointed for a term of 4 years.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Terms of initial appointees</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>As designated by the Secretary at the time of appointment, of the members first appointed—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> four of the members appointed under paragraph (1)(A) shall be appointed for a term of 4 years;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the four members appointed under paragraph (1)(B) shall be appointed for a term of 3 years; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id101c50e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> three of the members appointed under paragraph (1)(A) shall be appointed for a term of 2 years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Preservation of public advisory status</span>.—</span></p>No individual may be appointed to the Advisory Committee while serving as an officer or employee of the Federal Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Continuation of service</span>.—</span></p>Each appointed member may continue to serve for up to 6 months after the expiration of the term of office to which such member was appointed until a successor has been appointed.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Vacancy and removal.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Any vacancy on the Advisory Committee shall be filled in the manner in which the original appointment was made.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Removal</span>.—</span></p>Advisory Committee members shall serve at the discretion of the Secretary and may be removed at any time for good cause.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Chairperson</span>.—</span></p>The Chairperson of the Advisory Committee shall be appointed for a term of 1 year by the Secretary from among the members of the Advisory Committee.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Pay and expenses</span>.—</span></p>Members of the Advisory Committee shall serve without pay for such service but each member of the Advisory Committee shall be reimbursed from the United States Mint Public Enterprise Fund for travel, lodging, meals, and incidental expenses incurred in connection with attendance of such members at meetings of the Advisory Committee in the same amounts and under the same conditions as employees of the United States Mint who engage in official travel, as determined by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Meetings.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/8/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Advisory Committee shall meet at the call of the Secretary, the chairperson, or a majority of the members, but not less frequently than twice annually.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/8/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Open meetings</span>.—</span></p>Each meeting of the Advisory Committee shall be open to the public.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/8/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Prior notice of meetings</span>.—</span></p>Timely notice of each meeting of the Advisory Committee shall be published in the Federal Register, and timely notice of each meeting shall be made to trade publications and publications of general circulation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/b/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Quorum</span>.—</span></p>Seven members of the Advisory Committee shall constitute a quorum.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c50f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Duties of the Advisory Committee</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The duties of the Advisory Committee are as follows:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Advising the Secretary of the Treasury on any theme or design proposals relating to circulating coinage, bullion coinage, congressional gold medals and national and other medals produced by the Secretary of the Treasury in accordance with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5111"/>section 5111 of title 31, United States Code.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c50f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Advising the Secretary of the Treasury with regard to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the events, persons, or places that the Advisory Committee recommends be commemorated by the issuance of commemorative coins in each of the 5 calendar years succeeding the year in which a commemorative coin designation is made;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the mintage level for any commemorative coin recommended under subparagraph (A); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c50fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the proposed designs for commemorative coins.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c50fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Expenses</span>.—</span></p>The expenses of the Advisory Committee that the Secretary of the Treasury determines to be reasonable and appropriate shall be paid by the Secretary from the United States Mint Public Enterprise Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c50fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Administrative Support, Technical Services, and Advice</span>.—</span></p>Upon the request of the Advisory Committee, or as necessary for the Advisory Committee to carry out the responsibilities of the Advisory Committee under this section, the Director of the United States Mint shall provide to the Advisory Committee the administrative support, technical services, and advice that the Secretary of the Treasury determines to be reasonable and appropriate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c50fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consultation Authority</span>.—</span></p>In carrying out the duties of the Advisory Committee under this section, the Advisory Committee may consult with the Commission of Fine Arts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c50ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Annual Report.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5100-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Required</span>.—</span></p>Not later than September 30 of each year, the Advisory Committee shall submit a report to the Secretary, the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate. Should circumstances arise in which the Advisory Committee cannot meet the September 30 deadline in any year, the Secretary shall advise the Chairpersons of the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate of the reasons for such delay and the date on which the submission of the report is anticipated.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5101-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents</span>.—</span></p>The report required by paragraph (1) shall describe the activities of the Advisory Committee during the preceding year and the reports and recommendations made by the Advisory Committee to the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5102-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5135/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Federal Advisory Committee Act Does Not Apply</span>.—</span></p>Subject to the requirements of subsection (b)(8), the Federal Advisory Committee Act shall not apply with respect to the Committee.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/390/tII">Pub. L. 102–390, title II</span>, § 229(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-06">Oct. 6, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/1631">106 Stat. 1631</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tI">Pub. L. 104–208, div. A, title I</span>, § 101(f) [title V, § 529(d)], <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-314">110 Stat. 3009–314</span>, 3009–352; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/329/tIII">Pub. L. 104–329, title III</span>, § 303(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-20">Oct. 20, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/4014">110 Stat. 4014</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/15/tI">Pub. L. 108–15, title I</span>, § 103(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2003-04-23">Apr. 23, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/616">117 Stat. 616</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101c510a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5136"><span itemtype="num" value="5136">§ 5136.</span><span itemtype="heading"> United States Mint Public Enterprise Fund</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">There shall be established in the Treasury of the United States, a United States Mint Public Enterprise Fund (the “Fund”) for fiscal year 1996 and hereafter: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided, That all receipts from Mint operations and programs, including the production and sale of numismatic items, the production and sale of circulating coinage, the protection of Government assets, and gifts and bequests of property, real or personal shall be deposited into the Fund and shall be available without fiscal year limitations: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That all expenses incurred by the Secretary of the Treasury for operations and programs of the United States Mint that the Secretary of the Treasury determines, in the Secretary’s sole discretion, to be ordinary and reasonable incidents of Mint operations and programs, and any expense incurred pursuant to any obligation or other commitment of Mint operations and programs that was entered into before the establishment of the Fund, shall be paid out of the Fund: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That not to exceed 6.2415 percent of the nominal value of the coins minted, shall be paid out of the Fund for the circulating coin operations and programs in fiscal year 1996 for those operations and programs previously provided for by appropriation: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the Secretary of the Treasury may borrow such funds from the General Fund as may be necessary to meet existing liabilities and obligations incurred prior to the receipt of revenues into the Fund: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the General Fund shall be reimbursed for such funds by the Fund within one year of the date of the loan: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the Fund may retain receipts from the Federal Reserve System from the sale of circulating coins at face value for deposit into the Fund (retention of receipts is for the circulating operations and programs): <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the Secretary of the Treasury shall transfer to the Fund all assets and liabilities of the Mint operations and programs, including all Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund assets and liabilities, all receivables, unpaid obligations and unobligated balances from the Mint’s appropriation, the Coinage Profit Fund, and the Coinage Metal Fund, and the land and buildings of the Philadelphia Mint, Denver Mint, and the Fort Knox Bullion Depository: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund, the Coinage Profit Fund and the Coinage Metal Fund shall cease to exist as separate funds as their activites <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002075">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002075"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> and functions are subsumed under and subject to the Fund, and the requirements of 31 USC 5134(c)(4), (c)(5)(B), and (d) and (e) <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002076">2</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002076"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> of the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund shall apply to the Fund: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That at such times as the Secretary of the Treasury determines appropriate, but not less than annually, any amount in the Fund that is determined to be in excess of the amount required by the Fund shall be transferred to the Treasury for deposit as miscellaneous receipts: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the term “Mint operations and programs” means (1) the activities concerning, and assets utilized in, the production, administration, distribution, marketing, purchase, sale, and management of coinage, numismatic items, the protection and safeguarding of Mint assets and those non-Mint assets in the custody of the Mint, and the Fund; and (2) includes capital, personnel salaries and compensation, functions relating to operations, marketing, distribution, promotion, advertising, official reception and representation, the acquisition or replacement of equipment, the renovation or modernization of facilities, and the construction or acquisition of new buildings: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That the term “numismatic item” includes any medal, proof coin, uncirculated coin, bullion coin, numismatic collectible, other monetary issuances and products and accessories related to any such medal or coin: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided further, That provisions of law governing procurement or public contracts shall not be applicable to the procurement of goods or services necessary for carrying out Mint programs and operations.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/52/tV">Pub. L. 104–52, title V</span>, § 522, <span itemtype="date" date="1995-11-19">Nov. 19, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/494">109 Stat. 494</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id101c510f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch51/schIV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">SUBCHAPTER IV—</span><span itemtype="heading">BUREAU OF ENGRAVING AND PRINTING</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101c5110-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141"><span itemtype="num" value="5141">§ 5141.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Operation of the Bureau</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5111-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall prepare and submit to the President an annual business-type budget for the Bureau of Engraving and Printing.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5112-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5113-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary shall maintain in the Bureau an integrated accounting system with internal controls that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5114-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> ensures adequate control over assets and liabilities of the Bureau of Engraving and Printing Fund described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5142"/>section 5142 of this title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5115-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> develops accurate production costs to enable the Bureau to recover those costs on the basis of the work requisitioned;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5116-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> provides for replacement of capitalized equipment and other fixed assets by maintaining adequate depreciation reserves based on original cost or appraised values;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5117-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> discloses the financial condition and operations of the Fund on an accrual basis of accounting; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5118-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> provides information for the prior fiscal year on the annual budget of the Bureau.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5119-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The accounting system shall conform to principles and standards prescribed by the Comptroller General to carry out this subsection. The Comptroller General may review the system to ensure conformity to the principles and standards and its effectiveness of operation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c511a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5141/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> An officer or employee in the clerical-mech­anical service of the Bureau assigned to an established shift or tour of duty at least half of which occurs between 6 p.m. and 6 a.m. is entitled to pay for the regular 40-hour week (except when on leave) at a rate of pay 15 percent higher than the day rate for the same work.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/990">96 Stat. 990</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101c511f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142"><span itemtype="num" value="5142">§ 5142.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Bureau of Engraving and Printing Fund</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5120-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Department of the Treasury has a Bureau of Engraving and Printing Fund. Amounts—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5121-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> in the Fund are available to operate the Bureau of Engraving and Printing;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5122-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> in the Fund remain available until expended; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5123-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may be appropriated to the Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5124-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Fund consists of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5125-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> property and physical assets (except buildings and land) acquired by the Bureau;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5126-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> all amounts received by the Bureau; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5127-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> proceeds from the disposition of property and assets acquired by the Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c5128-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The capital of the Fund consists of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5129-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> amounts appropriated to the Fund;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c512a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> physical assets of the Bureau (except buildings and land) as of the close of business <p itemtype="date" date="1951-06-30"/>June 30, 1951; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c512b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> all payments made after <p itemtype="date" date="1974-06-30"/>June 30, 1974, under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5143"/>section 5143 of this title at prices adjusted to permit buying capital equipment and to provide future working capital.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c512c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary shall deposit each fiscal year, in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts, amounts accruing to the Fund in the prior fiscal year that the Secretary decides are in excess of the needs of the Fund. However, the Secretary may use the excess amounts to restore capital of the Fund reduced by the difference between the charges for services of the Bureau and the cost of providing those services.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101c512d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5142/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The Secretary shall maintain a special deposit account in the Treasury for the Fund. The Secretary shall credit the account with amounts appropriated to the Fund and receipts of the Bureau without depositing the receipts in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/990">96 Stat. 990</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101c5131-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5143"><span itemtype="num" value="5143">§ 5143.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment for services</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Secretary of the Treasury shall impose charges for Bureau of Engraving and Printing services the Secretary provides to an agency or to a foreign government under section 5114. The charges shall be in amounts the Secretary considers adequate to cover the costs of the services (including administrative and other costs related to providing the services). The agency shall pay promptly bills submitted by the Secretary, and the Secretary shall take such action, in coordination with the Secretary of State, as may be appropriate to ensure prompt payment by a foreign government of any invoice or statement of account submitted by the Secretary with respect to services rendered under section 5114.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub.
