L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/991">96 Stat. 991</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, § 6301(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3748">118 Stat. 3748</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101c5136-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144"><span itemtype="num" value="5144">§ 5144.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Providing impressions of portraits and vignettes</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Secretary of the Treasury may provide impressions from an engraved portrait or vignette in the possession of the Bureau of Engraving and Printing. An impression shall be provided—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c5137-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> at the request of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c5138-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a member of Congress;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c5139-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a head of an agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c513a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> an art association; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101c513b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a library; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101c513c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5144/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> for a charge and under conditions the Secretary decides are necessary to protect the public interest.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/991">96 Stat. 991</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id101ec240-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch51/schV"><span itemtype="num" value="V">SUBCHAPTER V—</span><span itemtype="heading">MISCELLANEOUS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec241-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151"><span itemtype="num" value="5151">§ 5151.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Conversion of currency of foreign countries</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec242-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec243-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “buying rate” means the buying rate in the market in New York, New York, for cable transfers payable in the currency of a foreign country to be converted.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec244-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when merchandise is exported on a day that banks are generally closed in New York, the buying rate at noon on the last prior business day is deemed to be the buying rate at noon on the day the merchandise is exported.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec245-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The value of coins of a foreign country expressed in United States money is the value of the pure metal of the standard coin of the foreign country. The Secretary of the Treasury shall estimate the values of standard coins of the country quarterly and publish the values on the first day of January, April, July, and October of each year.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec246-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Except as provided in this section, conversion of currency of a foreign country into United States currency for assessment and collection of duties on merchandise imported into the United States shall be made at values published by the Secretary under subsection (b) of this section for the quarter in which the merchandise is exported.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec247-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the Secretary has not published a value for the quarter in which the merchandise is exported, or if the value published by the Secretary varies by at least 5 percent from a value measured by the buying rate at noon on the day the merchandise is exported, the conversion of the currency of the foreign country shall be made at a value—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec248-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> equal to the buying rate at noon on the day the merchandise is exported; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec249-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> prescribed by regulation of the Secretary for the currency that is equal to the first buying rate certified for that currency by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York under subsection (e) of this section in the quarter in which the merchandise is exported, but only if the buying rate at noon on the day the merchandise is exported varies less than 5 percent from the buying rate first certified.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec24a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Federal Reserve Bank of New York shall decide the buying rate and certify the rate to the Secretary. The Secretary shall publish the rate at times and to the extent the Secretary considers necessary. In deciding the buying rate, the Bank may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec24b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> consider the last ascertainable transactions and quotations (direct or through exchange of other currencies); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec24c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> if there is no buying rate, calculate the rate from—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101ec24d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> actual transactions and quotations in demand or time bills of exchange; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id101ec24e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5151/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the last ascertainable transactions and quotations outside the United States in or for exchange payable in United States currency or foreign currency.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/991">96 Stat. 991</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec252-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5152"><span itemtype="num" value="5152">§ 5152.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Value of United States money holdings in international institutions</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Secretary of the Treasury shall maintain the value in terms of gold of the holdings of United States money of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the Inter-American Development Bank, the International Development Association, and the Asian Development Bank to the extent provided in the articles of agreement of those institutions. Amounts necessary to maintain the value may be appropriated. Amounts appropriated under this section remain available until expended.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/992">96 Stat. 992</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec256-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5153"><span itemtype="num" value="5153">§ 5153.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Counterfeit currency</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Disbursing officials of the United States Government and officers of national banks shall stamp or mark the word “counterfeit”, “altered”, or “worthless” on counterfeit notes intended to circulate as currency that are presented to them. An official or officer wrongfully stamping or marking an item of genuine United States currency (including a Federal reserve note or a circulating note of Federal reserve banks and national banks) shall redeem the currency at face value when presented.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/992">96 Stat. 992</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec25a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5154"><span itemtype="num" value="5154">§ 5154.</span><span itemtype="heading"> State taxation</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">A State or a territory or possession of the United States may tax United States coins and currency (including Federal reserve notes and circulating notes of Federal reserve banks and national banks) as money on hand or on deposit in the same way and at the same rate that the State, territory, or possession taxes other forms of money. This section does not affect a law taxing national banks.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/992">96 Stat. 992</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(22), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2477">96 Stat. 2477</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec261-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5155"><span itemtype="num" value="5155">§ 5155.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Providing engraved plates of portraits of deceased members of Congress</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">On conditions the Secretary of the Treasury decides, the Secretary may send an engraved plate of a portrait of a deceased Senator or Representative to an heir or legal representative of such a Senator or Representative.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/993">96 Stat. 993</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id101ec265-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53"><span itemtype="num" value="53">CHAPTER 53—</span><span itemtype="heading">MONETARY TRANSACTIONS</span></p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id101ec269-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53/schI"><span itemtype="num" value="I">SUBCHAPTER I—</span><span itemtype="heading">CREDIT AND MONETARY EXPANSION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec26a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301"><span itemtype="num" value="5301">§ 5301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Buying obligations of the United States Government</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec26b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The President may direct the Secretary of the Treasury to make an agreement with the Federal reserve banks and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System when the President decides that the foreign commerce of the United States is affected adversely because—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec26c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the value of coins and currency of a foreign country compared to the present standard value of gold is depreciating;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec26d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> action is necessary to regulate and maintain the parity of United States coins and currency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec26e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> an economic emergency requires an expansion of credit; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec26f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> an expansion of credit is necessary so that the United States Government and the governments of other countries can stabilize the value of coins and currencies of a country.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec270-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Under an agreement under subsection (a) of this section, the Board shall permit the banks (and the Board is authorized to permit the banks notwithstanding another law) to agree that the banks will—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec271-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> conduct through each entire specified period open market operations in obligations of the United States Government or corporations in which the Government is the majority stockholder; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id101ec272-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> buy directly and hold an additional $3,000,000,000 of obligations of the Government for each agreed period, unless the Secretary consents to the sale of the obligations before the end of the period.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec273-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5301/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> With the approval of the Secretary, the Board may require Federal reserve banks to take action the Secretary and Board consider necessary to prevent unreasonable credit expansion.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/993">96 Stat. 993</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id101ec27c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302"><span itemtype="num" value="5302">§ 5302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Stabilizing exchange rates and arrangements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec27d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec27e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Department of the Treasury has a stabilization fund. The fund is available to carry out this section, section 18 of the Bretton Woods Agreement Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t22/s286e–3"/>22 U.S.C. 286e–3), and section 3 of the Special Drawing Rights Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t22/s286"/>22 U.S.C. 286<p itemtype="i"/>o), and for investing in obligations of the United States Government those amounts in the fund the Secretary of the Treasury, with the approval of the President, decides are not required at the time to carry out this section. Proceeds of sales and investments, earnings, and interest shall be paid into the fund and are available to carry out this section. However, the fund is not available to pay administrative expenses.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec27f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Subject to approval by the President, the fund is under the exclusive control of the Secretary, and may not be used in a way that direct control and custody pass from the President and the Secretary. Decisions of the Secretary are final and may not be reviewed by another officer or employee of the Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec280-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Consistent with the obligations of the Government in the International Monetary Fund on orderly exchange arrangements and a stable system of exchange rates, the Secretary or an agency designated by the Secretary, with the approval of the President, may deal in gold, foreign exchange, and other instruments of credit and securities the Secretary considers necessary. However, a loan or credit to a foreign entity or government of a foreign country may be made for more than 6 months in any 12-month period only if the President gives Congress a written statement that unique or emergency circumstances require the loan or credit be for more than 6 months.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec281-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec282-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> By the 30th day after the end of each month, the Secretary shall give the Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate a detailed financial statement on the stabilization fund showing all agreements made or renewed, all transactions occurring during the month, and all projected liabilities.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec283-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary shall report each year to the President and Congress on the operation of the fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id101ec284-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5302/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> A repayment of any part of the first subscription payment of the Government to the International Monetary Fund, previously paid from the stabilization fund, shall be deposited in the Treasury as a miscellaneous receipt.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/994">96 Stat. 994</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10210b7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5303"><span itemtype="num" value="5303">§ 5303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reserved coins and currencies of foreign countries</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An agency may use coins and currencies of a foreign country the United States Government holds that are or may be reserved for a specific program or activity of an agency. The agency shall reimburse the Treasury from appropriations and shall replace the coins and currencies when they are needed for the program or activity for which they were reserved originally.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/994">96 Stat. 994</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10210b7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5304"><span itemtype="num" value="5304">§ 5304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Regulations</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>With the approval of the President, the Secretary of the Treasury may prescribe regulations—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10210b80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5304/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5301"/>section 5301 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10210b81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5304/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Secretary considers necessary to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5302"/>section 5302 of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/994">96 Stat. 994</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10210b85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53/schII"><span itemtype="num" value="II">SUBCHAPTER II—</span><span itemtype="heading">RECORDS AND REPORTS ON MONETARY INSTRUMENTS TRANSACTIONS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10210b86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5311"><span itemtype="num" value="5311">§ 5311.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Declaration of purpose</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">It is the purpose of this subchapter (except section 5315) to require certain reports or records where they have a high degree of usefulness in criminal, tax, or regulatory investigations or proceedings, or in the conduct of intelligence or counterintelligence activities, including analysis, to protect against international terrorism.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/995">96 Stat. 995</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 358(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/326">115 Stat. 326</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10237c9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312"><span itemtype="num" value="5312">§ 5312.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions and application</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237ca0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this subchapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237ca1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “financial agency” means a person acting for a person (except for a country, a monetary or financial authority acting as a monetary or financial authority, or an international financial institution of which the United States Government is a member) as a financial institution, bailee, depository trustee, or agent, or acting in a similar way related to money, credit, securities, gold, or a transaction in money, credit, securities, or gold.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237ca2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “financial institution” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an insured bank (as defined in section 3(h) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1813/h"/>12 U.S.C. 1813(h)));<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a commercial bank or trust company;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a private banker;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> an agency or branch of a foreign bank in the United States;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> any credit union;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> a thrift institution;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ca9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> a broker or dealer registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s78a"/>15 U.S.C. 78a et seq.);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237caa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> a broker or dealer in securities or commodities;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> an investment banker or investment company;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> a currency exchange;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/K"><span itemtype="num" value="K">(K)</span></p> an issuer, redeemer, or cashier of travelers’ checks, checks, money orders, or similar instruments;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/L"><span itemtype="num" value="L">(L)</span></p> an operator of a credit card system;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237caf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/M"><span itemtype="num" value="M">(M)</span></p> an insurance company;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/N"><span itemtype="num" value="N">(N)</span></p> a dealer in precious metals, stones, or jewels;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/O"><span itemtype="num" value="O">(O)</span></p> a pawnbroker;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/P"><span itemtype="num" value="P">(P)</span></p> a loan or finance company;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/Q"><span itemtype="num" value="Q">(Q)</span></p> a travel agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/R"><span itemtype="num" value="R">(R)</span></p> a licensed sender of money or any other person who engages as a business in the transmission of funds, including any person who engages as a business in an informal money transfer system or any network of people who engage as a business in facilitating the transfer of money domestically or internationally outside of the conventional financial institutions system;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/S"><span itemtype="num" value="S">(S)</span></p> a telegraph company;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/T"><span itemtype="num" value="T">(T)</span></p> a business engaged in vehicle sales, including automobile, airplane, and boat sales;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/U"><span itemtype="num" value="U">(U)</span></p> persons involved in real estate closings and settlements;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/V"><span itemtype="num" value="V">(V)</span></p> the United States Postal Service;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/W"><span itemtype="num" value="W">(W)</span></p> an agency of the United States Government or of a State or local government carrying out a duty or power of a business described in this paragraph;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/X"><span itemtype="num" value="X">(X)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a casino, gambling casino, or gaming establishment with an annual gaming revenue of more than $1,000,000 which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10237cbb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/X/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> is licensed as a casino, gambling casino, or gaming establishment under the laws of any State or any political subdivision of any State; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10237cbc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/X/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> is an Indian gaming operation conducted under or pursuant to the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act other than an operation which is limited to class I gaming (as defined in section 4(6) of such Act);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/Y"><span itemtype="num" value="Y">(Y)</span></p> any business or agency which engages in any activity which the Secretary of the Treasury determines, by regulation, to be an activity which is similar to, related to, or a substitute for any activity in which any business described in this paragraph is authorized to engage; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cbe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/2/Z"><span itemtype="num" value="Z">(Z)</span></p> any other business designated by the Secretary whose cash transactions have a high degree of usefulness in criminal, tax, or regulatory matters.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “monetary instruments” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> United States coins and currency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> as the Secretary may prescribe by regulation, coins and currency of a foreign country, travelers’ checks, bearer negotiable instruments, bearer investment securities, bearer securities, stock on which title is passed on delivery, and similar material; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> as the Secretary of the Treasury shall provide by regulation for purposes of sections 5316 and 5331, checks, drafts, notes, money orders, and other similar instruments which are drawn on or by a foreign financial institution and are not in bearer form.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Nonfinancial trade or business</span>.—</span></p>The term “nonfinancial trade or business” means any trade or business other than a financial institution that is subject to the reporting requirements of section 5313 and regulations prescribed under such section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “person”, in addition to its meaning under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t1/s1"/>section 1 of title 1, includes a trustee, a representative of an estate and, when the Secretary prescribes, a governmental entity.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> “United States” means the States of the United States, the District of Columbia, and, when the Secretary prescribes by regulation, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, American Samoa, the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands, a territory or possession of the United States, or a military or diplomatic establishment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this subchapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “domestic financial agency” and “domestic financial institution” apply to an action in the United States of a financial agency or institution.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “foreign financial agency” and “foreign financial institution” apply to an action outside the United States of a financial agency or institution.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Additional Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002077">1</span><span itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002077"><span itemtype="num">1</span> So in original. No par. (2) has been enacted.</span> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Certain institutions included in definition</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “financial institution” (as defined in subsection (a)) includes the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ccb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5312/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002078"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002078"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> Any futures commission merchant, commodity trading advisor, or commodity pool operator registered, or required to register, under the Commodity Exchange Act.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/995">96 Stat. 995</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/570/tI">Pub. L. 99–570, title I</span>, § 1362, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3207-33">100 Stat. 3207–33</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/690/tVI">Pub. L. 100–690, title VI</span>, § 6185(a), (g)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-11-18">Nov. 18, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/4354">102 Stat. 4354</span>, 4357; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIV">Pub. L. 103–325, title IV</span>, §§ 405, 409, <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2247">108 Stat. 2247</span>, 2252; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, §§ 321(a), (b), 359(a), 365(c)(1), (2)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/315">115 Stat. 315</span>, 328, 335; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, §§ 6202(g), 6203(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3746">118 Stat. 3746</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10237cd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313"><span itemtype="num" value="5313">§ 5313.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports on domestic coins and currency transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> When a domestic financial institution is involved in a transaction for the payment, receipt, or transfer of United States coins or currency (or other monetary instruments the Secretary of the Treasury prescribes), in an amount, denomination, or amount and denomination, or under circumstances the Secretary prescribes by regulation, the institution and any other participant in the transaction the Secretary may prescribe shall file a report on the transaction at the time and in the way the Secretary prescribes. A participant acting for another person shall make the report as the agent or bailee of the person and identify the person for whom the transaction is being made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary may designate a domestic financial institution as an agent of the United States Government to receive a report under this section. However, the Secretary may designate a domestic financial institution that is not insured, chartered, examined, or registered as a domestic financial institution only if the institution consents. The Secretary may suspend or revoke a designation for a violation of this subchapter or a regulation under this subchapter (except a violation of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5315"/>section 5315 of this title or a regulation prescribed under section 5315), section 411 <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002079"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002079"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the National Housing Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1730d"/>12 U.S.C. 1730d), or section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1829b"/>12 U.S.C. 1829b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A person (except a domestic financial institution designated under subsection (b) of this section) required to file a report under this section shall file the report—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> with the institution involved in the transaction if the institution was designated;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the way the Secretary prescribes when the institution was not designated; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> with the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cdb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary shall prescribe—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cdc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the filing procedure for a domestic financial institution designated under subsection (b) of this section; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cdd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the way the institution shall submit reports filed with it.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cde-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Mandatory Exemptions From Reporting Requirements.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cdf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary of the Treasury shall exempt, pursuant to section 5318(a)(6), a depository institution from the reporting requirements of subsection (a) with respect to transactions between the depository institution and the following categories of entities:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ce0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Another depository institution.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ce1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> A department or agency of the United States, any State, or any political subdivision of any State.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ce2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Any entity established under the laws of the United States, any State, or any political subdivision of any State, or under an interstate compact between 2 or more States, which exercises governmental authority on behalf of the United States or any such State or political subdivision.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ce3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> Any business or category of business the reports on which have little or no value for law enforcement purposes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237ce4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice of exemption</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury shall publish in the Federal Register at such times as the Secretary determines to be appropriate (but not less frequently than once each year) a list of all the entities whose transactions with a depository institution are exempt under this subsection from the reporting requirements of subsection (a).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237ce5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Discretionary Exemptions From Reporting Requirements.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237ce6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may exempt, pursuant to section 5318(a)(6), a depository institution from the reporting requirements of subsection (a) with respect to transactions between the depository institution and a qualified business customer of the institution on the basis of information submitted to the Secretary by the institution in accordance with procedures which the Secretary shall establish.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237ce7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Qualified business customer defined</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified business customer” means a business which—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ce8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> maintains a transaction account (as defined in section 19(b)(1)(C) of the Federal Reserve Act) at the depository institution;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ce9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> frequently engages in transactions with the depository institution which are subject to the reporting requirements of subsection (a); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> meets criteria which the Secretary determines are sufficient to ensure that the purposes of this subchapter are carried out without requiring a report with respect to such transactions.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237ceb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Criteria for exemption</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury shall establish, by regulation, the criteria for granting and maintaining an exemption under paragraph (1).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Guidelines.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237ced-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury shall establish guidelines for depository institutions to follow in selecting customers for an exemption under this subsection.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents</span>.—</span></p>The guidelines may include a description of the types of businesses or an itemization of specific businesses for which no exemption will be granted under this subsection to any depository institution.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Annual review</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe regulations requiring each depository institution to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cf0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> review, at least once each year, the qualified business customers of such institution with respect to whom an exemption has been granted under this subsection; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cf1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> upon the completion of such review, resubmit information about such customers, with such modifications as the institution determines to be appropriate, to the Secretary for the Secretary’s approval.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cf2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/e/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> 2-<span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">year phase-in provision</span>.—</span></p>During the 2-year period beginning on the date of enactment of the Money Laundering Suppression Act of 1994, this subsection shall be applied by the Secretary on the basis of such criteria as the Secretary determines to be appropriate to achieve an orderly implementation of the requirements of this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cf3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Provisions Applicable to Mandatory and Discretionary Exemptions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cf4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation on liability of depository institutions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>No depository institution shall be subject to any penalty which may be imposed under this subchapter for the failure of the institution to file a report with respect to a transaction with a customer for whom an exemption has been granted under subsection (d) or (e) unless the institution—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cf5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> knowingly files false or incomplete information to the Secretary with respect to the transaction or the customer engaging in the transaction; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cf6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> has reason to believe at the time the exemption is granted or the transaction is entered into that the customer or the transaction does not meet the criteria established for granting such exemption.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cf7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coordination with other provisions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Any exemption granted by the Secretary of the Treasury under section 5318(a) in accordance with this section, and any transaction which is subject to such exemption, shall be subject to any other provision of law applicable to such exemption, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cf8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the authority of the Secretary, under section 5318(a)(6), to revoke such exemption at any time; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cf9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any requirement to report, or any authority to require a report on, any possible violation of any law or regulation or any suspected criminal activity.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10237cfa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Depository Institution Defined</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section, the term “depository institution”—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cfb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> has the meaning given to such term in section 19(b)(1)(A) of the Federal Reserve Act; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10237cfc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> includes—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cfd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> any branch, agency, or commercial lending company (as such terms are defined in section 1(b) of the International Banking Act of 1978);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cfe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any corporation chartered under section 25A of the Federal Reserve Act; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10237cff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5313/g/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> any corporation having an agreement or undertaking with the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System under section 25 of the Federal Reserve Act.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/996">96 Stat. 996</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIV">Pub. L. 103–325, title IV</span>, § 402(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2243">108 Stat. 2243</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1025c6f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314"><span itemtype="num" value="5314">§ 5314.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Records and reports on foreign financial agency transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c6f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Considering the need to avoid impeding or controlling the export or import of monetary instruments and the need to avoid burdening unreasonably a person making a transaction with a foreign financial agency, the Secretary of the Treasury shall require a resident or citizen of the United States or a person in, and doing business in, the United States, to keep records, file reports, or keep records and file reports, when the resident, citizen, or person makes a transaction or maintains a relation for any person with a foreign financial agency. The records and reports shall contain the following information in the way and to the extent the Secretary prescribes:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c6f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the identity and address of participants in a transaction or relationship.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c6fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the legal capacity in which a participant is acting.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c6fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the identity of real parties in interest.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c6fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a description of the transaction.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c6fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may prescribe—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c6fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a reasonable classification of persons subject to or exempt from a requirement under this section or a regulation under this section;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c6ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a foreign country to which a requirement or a regulation under this section applies if the Secretary decides applying the requirement or regulation to all foreign countries is unnecessary or undesirable;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c700-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the magnitude of transactions subject to a requirement or a regulation under this section;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c701-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the kind of transaction subject to or exempt from a requirement or a regulation under this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c702-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> other matters the Secretary considers necessary to carry out this section or a regulation under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c703-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5314/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A person shall be required to disclose a record required to be kept under this section or under a regulation under this section only as required by law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/997">96 Stat. 997</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1025c708-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315"><span itemtype="num" value="5315">§ 5315.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports on foreign currency transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c709-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Congress finds that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c70a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> moving mobile capital can have a significant impact on the proper functioning of the international monetary system;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c70b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> it is important to have the most feasible current and complete information on the kind and source of capital flows, including transactions by large United States businesses and their foreign affiliates; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c70c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> additional authority should be provided to collect information on capital flows under section 5(b) of the Trading With the Enemy Act (50 App. U.S.C. 5(b)) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002080"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002080"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> and section 8 of the Bretton Woods Agreement Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t22/s286f"/>22 U.S.C. 286f).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c70d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> In this section, “United States person” and “foreign person controlled by a United States person” have the same meanings given those terms in section 7(f)(2)(A) and (C), respectively, of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s78g/f/2/A"/>15 U.S.C. 78g(f)(2)(A), (C)).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c70e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5315/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe regulations consistent with subsection (a) of this section requiring reports on foreign currency transactions conducted by a United States person or a foreign person controlled by a United States person. The regulations shall require that a report contain information and be submitted at the time and in the way, with reasonable exceptions and classifications, necessary to carry out this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/997">96 Stat. 997</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1025c713-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316"><span itemtype="num" value="5316">§ 5316.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports on exporting and importing monetary instruments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c714-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, a person or an agent or bailee of the person shall file a report under subsection (b) of this section when the person, agent, or bailee knowingly—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c715-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> transports, is about to transport, or has transported, monetary instruments of more than $10,000 at one time—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c716-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> from a place in the United States to or through a place outside the United States; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c717-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to a place in the United States from or through a place outside the United States; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c718-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> receives monetary instruments of more than $10,000 at one time transported into the United States from or through a place outside the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c719-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A report under this section shall be filed at the time and place the Secretary of the Treasury prescribes. The report shall contain the following information to the extent the Secretary prescribes:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c71a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the legal capacity in which the person filing the report is acting.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c71b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the origin, destination, and route of the monetary instruments.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c71c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> when the monetary instruments are not legally and beneficially owned by the person transporting the instruments, or if the person transporting the instruments personally is not going to use them, the identity of the person that gave the instruments to the person transporting them, the identity of the person who is to receive them, or both.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c71d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the amount and kind of monetary instruments transported.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c71e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> additional information.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c71f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> This section or a regulation under this section does not apply to a common carrier of passengers when a passenger possesses a monetary instrument, or to a common carrier of goods if the shipper does not declare the instrument.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c720-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5316/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Cumulation of Closely Related Events</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may prescribe regulations under this section defining the term “at one time” for purposes of subsection (a). Such regulations may permit the cumulation of closely related events in order that such events may collectively be considered to occur at one time for the purposes of subsection (a).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/998">96 Stat. 998</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/473/tII">Pub. L. 98–473, title II</span>, § 901(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-12">Oct. 12, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2135">98 Stat. 2135</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/570/tI">Pub. L. 99–570, title I</span>, § 1358, title III, § 3153, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3207-26">100 Stat. 3207–26</span>, 3207–94.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1025c726-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317"><span itemtype="num" value="5317">§ 5317.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Search and forfeiture of monetary instruments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c727-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for a search warrant when the Secretary reasonably believes a monetary instrument is being transported and a report on the instrument under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5316"/>section 5316 of this title has not been filed or contains a material omission or misstatement. The Secretary shall include a statement of information in support of the warrant. On a showing of probable cause, the court may issue a search warrant for a designated person or a designated or described place or physical object. This subsection does not affect the authority of the Secretary under another law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c728-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Searches at Border</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of ensuring compliance with the requirements of section 5316, a customs officer may stop and search, at the border and without a search warrant, any vehicle, vessel, aircraft, or other conveyance, any envelope or other container, and any person entering or departing from the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c729-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Forfeiture.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c72a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal forfeiture.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c72b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The court in imposing sentence for any violation of section 5313, 5316, or 5324 of this title, or any conspiracy to commit such violation, shall order the defendant to forfeit all property, real or personal, involved in the offense and any property traceable thereto.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c72c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Procedure</span>.—</span></p>Forfeitures under this paragraph shall be governed by the procedures established in section 413 of the Controlled Substances Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c72d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5317/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Civil forfeiture</span>.—</span></p>Any property involved in a violation of section 5313, 5316, or 5324 of this title, or any conspiracy to commit any such violation, and any property traceable to any such violation or conspiracy, may be seized and forfeited to the United States in accordance with the procedures governing civil forfeitures in money laundering cases pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s981/a/1/A"/>section 981(a)(1)(A) of title 18, United States Code.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/998">96 Stat. 998</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/473/tII">Pub. L. 98–473, title II</span>, § 901(d), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-12">Oct. 12, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2135">98 Stat. 2135</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/570/tI">Pub. L. 99–570, title I</span>, § 1355, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3207-22">100 Stat. 3207–22</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, § 1525(c)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4065">106 Stat. 4065</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, §§ 365(b)(2)(B), 372(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/335">115 Stat. 335</span>, 338.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1025c734-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318"><span itemtype="num" value="5318">§ 5318.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Compliance, exemptions, and summons authority</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1025c735-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General Powers of Secretary</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary of the Treasury may (except under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5315">section 5315 of this title</span> and regulations prescribed under section 5315)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c736-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> except as provided in subsection (b)(2), delegate duties and powers under this subchapter to an appropriate supervising agency and the United States Postal Service;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c737-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> require a class of domestic financial institutions or nonfinancial trades or businesses to maintain appropriate procedures to ensure compliance with this subchapter and regulations prescribed under this subchapter or to guard against money laundering;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c738-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> examine any books, papers, records, or other data of domestic financial institutions or nonfinancial trades or businesses relevant to the recordkeeping or reporting requirements of this subchapter;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c739-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> summon a financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business, an officer or employee of a financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business (including a former officer or employee), or any person having possession, custody, or care of the reports and records required under this subchapter, to appear before the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate at a time and place named in the summons and to produce such books, papers, records, or other data, and to give testimony, under oath, as may be relevant or material to an investigation described in subsection (b);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c73a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> exempt from the requirements of this subchapter any class of transactions within any State if the Secretary determines that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c73b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> under the laws of such State, that class of transactions is subject to requirements substantially similar to those imposed under this subchapter; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c73c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> there is adequate provision for the enforcement of such requirements;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1025c73d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> rely on examinations conducted by a State supervisory agency of a category of financial institution, if the Secretary determines that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1025c73e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/6/A"><span
