Money Laundering Concern.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102837f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>In making a finding that reasonable grounds exist for concluding that a jurisdiction outside of the United States, 1 or more financial institutions operating outside of the United States, 1 or more classes of transactions within, or involving, a jurisdiction outside of the United States, or 1 or more types of accounts is of primary money laundering concern so as to authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to take 1 or more of the special measures described in subsection (b), the Secretary shall consult with the Secretary of State and the Attorney General.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102837f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Additional considerations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In making a finding described in paragraph (1), the Secretary shall consider in addition such information as the Secretary determines to be relevant, including the following potentially relevant factors:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102837f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Jurisdictional factors</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In the case of a particular jurisdiction—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> evidence that organized criminal groups, international terrorists, or entities involved in the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction or missiles have transacted business in that jurisdiction;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the extent to which that jurisdiction or financial institutions operating in that jurisdiction offer bank secrecy or special regulatory advantages to nonresidents or nondomiciliaries of that jurisdiction;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the substance and quality of administration of the bank supervisory and counter-money laundering laws of that jurisdiction;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the relationship between the volume of financial transactions occurring in that jurisdiction and the size of the economy of the jurisdiction;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> the extent to which that jurisdiction is characterized as an offshore banking or secrecy haven by credible international organizations or multilateral expert groups;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> whether the United States has a mutual legal assistance treaty with that jurisdiction, and the experience of United States law enforcement officials and regulatory officials in obtaining information about transactions originating in or routed through or to such jurisdiction; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102837ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/A/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> the extent to which that jurisdiction is characterized by high levels of official or institutional corruption.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10283800-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Institutional factors</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In the case of a decision to apply 1 or more of the special measures described in subsection (b) only to a financial institution or institutions, or to a transaction or class of transactions, or to a type of account, or to all 3, within or involving a particular jurisdiction—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283801-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the extent to which such financial institutions, transactions, or types of accounts are used to facilitate or promote money laundering in or through the jurisdiction, including any money laundering activity by organized criminal groups, international terrorists, or entities involved in the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction or missiles;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283802-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the extent to which such institutions, transactions, or types of accounts are used for legitimate business purposes in the jurisdiction; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283803-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/c/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the extent to which such action is sufficient to ensure, with respect to transactions involving the jurisdiction and institutions operating in the jurisdiction, that the purposes of this subchapter continue to be fulfilled, and to guard against international money laundering and other financial crimes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283804-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notification of Special Measures Invoked by the Secretary</span>.—</span></p>Not later than 10 days after the date of any action taken by the Secretary of the Treasury under subsection (a)(1), the Secretary shall notify, in writing, the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate of any such action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283805-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding any other provision of this subchapter, for purposes of this section and subsections (i) and (j) of section 5318, the following definitions shall apply:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283806-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Bank definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The following definitions shall apply with respect to a bank:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10283807-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Account</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “account”—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283808-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> means a formal banking or business relationship established to provide regular services, dealings, and other financial transactions; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283809-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> includes a demand deposit, savings deposit, or other transaction or asset account and a credit account or other extension of credit.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1028380a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Correspondent account</span>.—</span></p>The term “correspondent account” means an account established to receive deposits from, make payments on behalf of a foreign financial institution, or handle other financial transactions related to such institution.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1028380b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Payable-through account</span>.—</span></p>The term “payable-through account” means an account, including a transaction account (as defined in section 19(b)(1)(C) of the Federal Reserve Act), opened at a depository institution by a foreign financial institution by means of which the foreign financial institution permits its customers to engage, either directly or through a subaccount, in banking activities usual in connection with the business of banking in the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1028380c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions applicable to institutions other than banks</span>.—</span></p>With respect to any financial institution other than a bank, the Secretary shall, after consultation with the appropriate Federal functional regulators (as defined in section 509 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act), define by regulation the term “account”, and shall include within the meaning of that term, to the extent, if any, that the Secretary deems appropriate, arrangements similar to payable-through and correspondent accounts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1028380d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Regulatory definition of beneficial ownership</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall promulgate regulations defining beneficial ownership of an account for purposes of this section and subsections (i) and (j) of section 5318. Such regulations shall address issues related to an individual’s authority to fund, direct, or manage the account (including, without limitation, the power to direct payments into or out of the account), and an individual’s material interest in the income or corpus of the account, and shall ensure that the identification of individuals under this section or subsection (i) or (j) of section 5318 does not extend to any individual whose beneficial interest in the income or corpus of the account is immaterial.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1028380e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Other terms</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may, by regulation, further define the terms in paragraphs (1), (2), and (3), and define other terms for the purposes of this section, as the Secretary deems appropriate.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1028380f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5318A/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Classified Information</span>.—</span></p>In any judicial review of a finding of the existence of a primary money laundering concern, or of the requirement for 1 or more special measures with respect to a primary money laundering concern, made under this section, if the designation or imposition, or both, were based on classified information (as defined in section 1(a) of the Classified Information Procedures Act (18 U.S.C. App.),<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002083"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002083"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> such information may be submitted by the Secretary to the reviewing court ex parte and in camera. This subsection does not confer or imply any right to judicial review of any finding made or any requirement imposed under this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 311(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/298">115 Stat. 298</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/177/tIII">Pub. L. 108–177, title III</span>, § 376, <span itemtype="date" date="2003-12-13">Dec. 13, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/2630">117 Stat. 2630</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, § 6203(e), (f), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3747">118 Stat. 3747</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/293/tV">Pub. L. 109–293, title V</span>, § 501, <span itemtype="date" date="2006-09-30">Sept. 30, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1350">120 Stat. 1350</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10283815-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5319"><span itemtype="num" value="5319">§ 5319.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of reports</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Secretary of the Treasury shall make information in a report filed under this subchapter available to an agency, including any State financial institutions supervisory agency, United States intelligence agency or self-regulatory organization registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission or the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, upon request of the head of the agency or organization. The report shall be available for a purpose that is consistent with this subchapter. The Secretary may only require reports on the use of such information by any State financial institutions supervisory agency for other than supervisory purposes or by United States intelligence agencies. However, a report and records of reports are exempt from disclosure under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552">section 552 of title 5</span>, and may not be disclosed under any State, local, tribal, or territorial “freedom of information”, “open government”, or similar law.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/999">96 Stat. 999</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, § 1506, <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4055">106 Stat. 4055</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 358(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/326">115 Stat. 326</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/74/dC/tI">Pub. L. 112–74, div. C, title I</span>, § 119, <span itemtype="date" date="2011-12-23">Dec. 23, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/125/891">125 Stat. 891</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1028381b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5320"><span itemtype="num" value="5320">§ 5320.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Injunctions</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">When the Secretary of the Treasury believes a person has violated, is violating, or will violate this subchapter or a regulation prescribed or order issued under this subchapter, the Secretary may bring a civil action in the appropriate district court of the United States or appropriate United States court of a territory or possession of the United States to enjoin the violation or to enforce compliance with the subchapter, regulation, or order. An injunction or temporary restraining order shall be issued without bond.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/999">96 Stat. 999</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1028381f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321"><span itemtype="num" value="5321">§ 5321.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil penalties</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283820-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283821-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A domestic financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business, and a partner, director, officer, or employee of a domestic financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business, willfully violating this subchapter or a regulation prescribed or order issued under this subchapter (except sections 5314 and 5315 of this title or a regulation prescribed under sections 5314 and 5315), or willfully violating a regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508/s123"/>section 123 of Public Law 91–508, is liable to the United States Government for a civil penalty of not more than the greater of the amount (not to exceed $100,000) involved in the transaction (if any) or $25,000. For a violation of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/2"/>section 5318(a)(2) of this title or a regulation prescribed under section 5318(a)(2), a separate violation occurs for each day the violation continues and at each office, branch, or place of business at which a violation occurs or continues.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283822-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury may impose an additional civil penalty on a person not filing a report, or filing a report containing a material omission or misstatement, under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5316"/>section 5316 of this title or a regulation prescribed under section 5316. A civil penalty under this paragraph may not be more than the amount of the monetary instrument for which the report was required. A civil penalty under this paragraph is reduced by an amount forfeited under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5317/b"/>section 5317(b) of this title.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283823-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A person not filing a report under a regulation prescribed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5315"/>section 5315 of this title or not complying with an injunction under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5320"/>section 5320 of this title enjoining a violation of, or enforcing compliance with, section 5315 or a regulation prescribed under section 5315, is liable to the Government for a civil penalty of not more than $10,000.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283824-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Structured Transaction Violation.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283825-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Penalty authorized</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may impose a civil money penalty on any person who violates any provision of section 5324.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283826-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maximum amount limitation</span>.—</span></p>The amount of any civil money penalty imposed under subparagraph (A) shall not exceed the amount of the coins and currency (or such other monetary instruments as the Secretary may prescribe) involved in the transaction with respect to which such penalty is imposed.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283827-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coordination with forfeiture provision</span>.—</span></p>The amount of any civil money penalty imposed by the Secretary under subparagraph (A) shall be reduced by the amount of any forfeiture to the United States in connection with the transaction with respect to which such penalty is imposed.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283828-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Foreign financial agency transaction violation.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283829-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Penalty authorized</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may impose a civil money penalty on any person who violates, or causes any violation of, any provision of section 5314.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1028382a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Amount of penalty.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1028382b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except as provided in subparagraph (C), the amount of any civil penalty imposed under subparagraph (A) shall not exceed $10,000.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1028382c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reasonable cause exception</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>No penalty shall be imposed under subparagraph (A) with respect to any violation if—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1028382d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/B/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> such violation was due to reasonable cause, and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1028382e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/B/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the amount of the transaction or the balance in the account at the time of the transaction was properly reported.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1028382f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Willful violations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In the case of any person willfully violating, or willfully causing any violation of, any provision of section 5314—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10283830-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the maximum penalty under subparagraph (B)(i) shall be increased to the greater of—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283831-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/C/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> $100,000, or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10283832-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/C/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> 50 percent of the amount determined under subparagraph (D), and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10283833-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> subparagraph (B)(ii) shall not apply.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283834-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Amount</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The amount determined under this subparagraph is—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10283835-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> in the case of a violation involving a transaction, the amount of the transaction, or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10283836-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/5/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> in the case of a violation involving a failure to report the existence of an account or any identifying information required to be provided with respect to an account, the balance in the account at the time of the violation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10283837-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Negligence.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283838-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may impose a civil money penalty of not more than $500 on any financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business which negligently violates any provision of this subchapter or any regulation prescribed under this subchapter.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10283839-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Pattern of negligent activity</span>.—</span></p>If any financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business engages in a pattern of negligent violations of any provision of this subchapter or any regulation prescribed under this subchapter, the Secretary of the Treasury may, in addition to any penalty imposed under subparagraph (A) with respect to any such violation, impose a civil money penalty of not more than $50,000 on the financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa93a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Penalties for international counter money laundering violations</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may impose a civil money penalty in an amount equal to not less than 2 times the amount of the transaction, but not more than $1,000,000, on any financial institution or agency that violates any provision of subsection (i) or (j) of section 5318 or any special measures imposed under section 5318A.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa93b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Time Limitations for Assessments and Commencement of Civil Actions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa93c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Assessments</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury may assess a civil penalty under subsection (a) at any time before the end of the 6-year period beginning on the date of the transaction with respect to which the penalty is assessed.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa93d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Civil actions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary may commence a civil action to recover a civil penalty assessed under subsection (a) at any time before the end of the 2-year period beginning on the later of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa93e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the date the penalty was assessed; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa93f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the date any judgment becomes final in any criminal action under section 5322 in connection with the same transaction with respect to which the penalty is assessed.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa940-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary may remit any part of a forfeiture under subsection (c) or (d) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002084"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002084"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5317"/>section 5317 of this title or civil penalty under subsection (a)(2) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa941-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Criminal Penalty Not Exclusive of Civil Penalty</span>.—</span></p>A civil money penalty may be imposed under subsection (a) with respect to any violation of this subchapter notwithstanding the fact that a criminal penalty is imposed with respect to the same violation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa942-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Delegation of Assessment Authority to Banking Agencies.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa943-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury shall delegate, in accordance with section 5318(a)(1) and subject to such terms and conditions as the Secretary may impose in accordance with paragraph (3), any authority of the Secretary to assess a civil money penalty under this section on depository institutions (as defined in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act) to the appropriate Federal banking agencies (as defined in such section 3).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa944-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority of agencies</span>.—</span></p>Subject to any term or condition imposed by the Secretary of the Treasury under paragraph (3), the provisions of this section shall apply to an appropriate Federal banking agency to which is delegated any authority of the Secretary under this section in the same manner such provisions apply to the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa945-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Terms and conditions.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa946-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/e/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe by regulation the terms and conditions which shall apply to any delegation under paragraph (1).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa947-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5321/e/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maximum dollar amount</span>.—</span></p>The terms and conditions authorized under subparagraph (A) may include, in the Secretary’s sole discretion, a limitation on the amount of any civil penalty which may be assessed by an appropriate Federal banking agency pursuant to a delegation under paragraph (1).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/999">96 Stat. 999</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/473/tII">Pub. L. 98–473, title II</span>, § 901(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-12">Oct. 12, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2135">98 Stat. 2135</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/570/tI">Pub. L. 99–570, title I</span>, §§ 1356(c)(1), 1357(a)–(f), (h), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3207-24">100 Stat. 3207–24</span>—3207–26; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/690/tVI">Pub. L. 100–690, title VI</span>, § 6185(g)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-11-18">Nov. 18, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/4357">102 Stat. 4357</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, §§ 1511(b), 1525(b), 1535(a)(2), 1561(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4057">106 Stat. 4057</span>, 4065, 4066, 4071; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tXXXIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title XXXIII</span>, § 330017(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2149">108 Stat. 2149</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIV">Pub. L. 103–325, title IV</span>, §§ 406, 411(b), 413(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2247">108 Stat. 2247</span>, 2253, 2254; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tII">Pub. L. 104–208, div. A, title II</span>, § 2223(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-415">110 Stat. 3009–415</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, §§ 353(a), 363(a), 365(c)(2)(B)(i), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/322">115 Stat. 322</span>, 332, 335; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/357/tVIII">Pub. L. 108–357, title VIII</span>, § 821(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-10-22">Oct. 22, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/1586">118 Stat. 1586</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa950-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5322"><span itemtype="num" value="5322">§ 5322.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal penalties</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa951-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5322/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> A person willfully violating this subchapter or a regulation prescribed or order issued under this subchapter (except section 5315 or 5324 of this title or a regulation prescribed under section 5315 or 5324), or willfully violating a regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508/s123"/>section 123 of Public Law 91–508, shall be fined not more than $250,000, or imprisoned for not more than five years, or both.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa952-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5322/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A person willfully violating this subchapter or a regulation prescribed or order issued under this subchapter (except section 5315 or 5324 of this title or a regulation prescribed under section 5315 or 5324), or willfully violating a regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508/s123"/>section 123 of Public Law 91–508, while violating another law of the United States or as part of a pattern of any illegal activity involving more than $100,000 in a 12-month period, shall be fined not more than $500,000, imprisoned for not more than 10 years, or both.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa953-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5322/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> For a violation of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5318/a/2"/>section 5318(a)(2) of this title or a regulation prescribed under section 5318(a)(2), a separate violation occurs for each day the violation continues and at each office, branch, or place of business at which a violation occurs or continues.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa954-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5322/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> A financial institution or agency that violates any provision of subsection (i) or (j) of section 5318, or any special measures imposed under section 5318A, or any regulation prescribed under subsection (i) or (j) of section 5318 or section 5318A, shall be fined in an amount equal to not less than 2 times the amount of the transaction, but not more than $1,000,000.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1000">96 Stat. 1000</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/473/tII">Pub. L. 98–473, title II</span>, § 901(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-12">Oct. 12, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2135">98 Stat. 2135</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/570/tI">Pub. L. 99–570, title I</span>, §§ 1356(c)(1), 1357(g), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3207-24">100 Stat. 3207–24</span>, 3207–26; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, § 1504(d)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4055">106 Stat. 4055</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIV">Pub. L. 103–325, title IV</span>, § 411(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2253">108 Stat. 2253</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, §§ 353(b), 363(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/323">115 Stat. 323</span>, 332.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa95b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5323"><span itemtype="num" value="5323">§ 5323.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Rewards for informants</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa95c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5323/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary may pay a reward to an individual who provides original information which leads to a recovery of a criminal fine, civil penalty, or forfeiture, which exceeds $50,000, for a violation of this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa95d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5323/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary shall determine the amount of a reward under this section. The Secretary may not award more than 25 per centum of the net amount of the fine, penalty, or forfeiture collected or $150,000, whichever is less.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa95e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5323/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> An officer or employee of the United States, a State, or a local government who provides information described in subsection (a) in the performance of official duties is not eligible for a reward under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa95f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5323/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/473/tII">Pub. L. 98–473, title II</span>, § 901(e), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-12">Oct. 12, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2135">98 Stat. 2135</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa961-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324"><span itemtype="num" value="5324">§ 5324.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Structuring transactions to evade reporting requirement prohibited</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa962-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Domestic Coin and Currency Transactions Involving Financial Institutions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>No person shall, for the purpose of evading the reporting requirements of section 5313(a) or 5325 or any regulation prescribed under any such section, the reporting or recordkeeping requirements imposed by any order issued under section 5326, or the recordkeeping requirements imposed by any regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508/s123">section 123 of Public Law 91–508</span>—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa963-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> cause or attempt to cause a domestic financial institution to fail to file a report required under section 5313(a) or 5325 or any regulation prescribed under any such section, to file a report or to maintain a record required by an order issued under section 5326, or to maintain a record required pursuant to any regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508/s123"/>section 123 of Public Law 91–508;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa964-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> cause or attempt to cause a domestic financial institution to file a report required under section 5313(a) or 5325 or any regulation prescribed under any such section, to file a report or to maintain a record required by any order issued under section 5326, or to maintain a record required pursuant to any regulation prescribed under section 5326, or to maintain a record required pursuant to any regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/91/508/s123"/>section 123 of Public Law 91–508, that contains a material omission or misstatement of fact; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa965-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> structure or assist in structuring, or attempt to structure or assist in structuring, any transaction with one or more domestic financial institutions.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa966-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Domestic Coin and Currency Transactions Involving Nonfinancial Trades or Businesses</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>No person shall, for the purpose of evading the report requirements of section 5331 or any regulation prescribed under such section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa967-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> cause or attempt to cause a nonfinancial trade or business to fail to file a report required under section 5331 or any regulation prescribed under such section;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa968-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> cause or attempt to cause a nonfinancial trade or business to file a report required under section 5331 or any regulation prescribed under such section that contains a material omission or misstatement of fact; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa969-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> structure or assist in structuring, or attempt to structure or assist in structuring, any transaction with 1 or more nonfinancial trades or businesses.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa96a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">International Monetary Instrument Transactions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>No person shall, for the purpose of evading the reporting requirements of section 5316—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa96b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> fail to file a report required by section 5316, or cause or attempt to cause a person to fail to file such a report;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa96c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> file or cause or attempt to cause a person to file a report required under section 5316 that contains a material omission or misstatement of fact; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa96d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> structure or assist in structuring, or attempt to structure or assist in structuring, any importation or exportation of monetary instruments.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa96e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal Penalty.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa96f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Whoever violates this section shall be fined in accordance with title 18, United States Code, imprisoned for not more than 5 years, or both.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa970-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5324/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Enhanced penalty for aggravated cases</span>.—</span></p>Whoever violates this section while violating another law of the United States or as part of a pattern of any illegal activity involving more than $100,000 in a 12-month period shall be fined twice the amount provided in subsection (b)(3) or (c)(3) (as the case may be) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s3571"/>section 3571 of title 18, United States Code, imprisoned for not more than 10 years, or both.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/570/tI">Pub. L. 99–570, title I</span>, § 1354(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3207-22">100 Stat. 3207–22</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, §§ 1517(a), 1525(a), 1535(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4059">106 Stat. 4059</span>, 4064, 4066; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tXXXIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title XXXIII</span>, § 330017(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2149">108 Stat. 2149</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIV">Pub. L. 103–325, title IV</span>, §§ 411(a), 413(a)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2253">108 Stat. 2253</span>, 2254; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, §§ 353(c), 365(b)(1), (2)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/323">115 Stat. 323</span>, 334, 335; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, § 6203(g), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3747">118 Stat. 3747</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa977-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325"><span itemtype="num" value="5325">§ 5325.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Identification required to purchase certain monetary instruments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa978-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>No financial institution may issue or sell a bank check, cashier’s check, traveler’s check, or money order to any individual in connection with a transaction or group of such contemporaneous transactions which involves United States coins or currency (or such other monetary instruments as the Secretary may prescribe) in amounts or denominations of $3,000 or more unless—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa979-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the individual has a transaction account with such financial institution and the financial institution—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa97a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> verifies that fact through a signature card or other information maintained by such institution in connection with the account of such individual; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa97b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> records the method of verification in accordance with regulations which the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa97c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the individual furnishes the financial institution with such forms of identification as the Secretary of the Treasury may require in regulations which the Secretary shall prescribe and the financial institution verifies and records such information in accordance with regulations which such Secretary shall prescribe.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa97d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Report to Secretary Upon Request</span>.—</span></p>Any information required to be recorded by any financial institution under paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (a) shall be reported by such institution to the Secretary of the Treasury at the request of such Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa97e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5325/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Transaction Account Defined</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this section, the term “transaction account” has the meaning given to such term in section 19(b)(1)(C) of the Federal Reserve Act.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/690/tVI">Pub. L. 100–690, title VI</span>, § 6185(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-11-18">Nov. 18, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/4355">102 Stat. 4355</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa982-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326"><span itemtype="num" value="5326">§ 5326.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Records of certain domestic coin and currency transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa983-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the Secretary of the Treasury finds, upon the Secretary’s own initiative or at the request of an appropriate Federal or State law enforcement official, that reasonable grounds exist for concluding that additional recordkeeping and reporting requirements are necessary to carry out the purposes of this subtitle and prevent evasions thereof, the Secretary may issue an order requiring any domestic financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business or group of domestic financial institutions or nonfinancial trades or businesses in a geographic area—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa984-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> to obtain such information as the Secretary may describe in such order concerning—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa985-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> any transaction in which such financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business is involved for the payment, receipt, or transfer of United States coins or currency (or such other monetary instruments as the Secretary may describe in such order) the total amounts or denominations of which are equal to or greater than an amount which the Secretary may prescribe; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa986-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> any other person participating in such transaction;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa987-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to maintain a record of such information for such period of time as the Secretary may require; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa988-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> to file a report with respect to any transaction described in paragraph (1)(A) in the manner and to the extent specified in the order.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa989-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority To Order Depository Institutions To Obtain Reports From Customers.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa98a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary of the Treasury may, by regulation or order, require any depository institution (as defined in section 3(c) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa98b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> to request any financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business (other than a depository institution) which engages in any reportable transaction with the depository institution to provide the depository institution with a copy of any report filed by the financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business under this subtitle with respect to any prior transaction (between such financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business and any other person) which involved any portion of the coins or currency (or monetary instruments) which are involved in the reportable transaction with the depository institution; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa98c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> if no copy of any report described in subparagraph (A) is received by the depository institution in connection with any reportable transaction to which such subparagraph applies, to submit (in addition to any report required under this subtitle with respect to the reportable transaction) a written notice to the Secretary that the financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business failed to provide any copy of such report.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa98d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reportable transaction defined</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this subsection, the term “reportable transaction” means any transaction involving coins or currency (or such other monetary instruments as the Secretary may describe in the regulation or order) the total amounts or denominations of which are equal to or greater than an amount which the Secretary may prescribe.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa98e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Nondisclosure of Orders</span>.—</span></p>No financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business or officer, director, employee or agent of a financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business subject to an order under this section may disclose the existence of, or terms of, the order to any person except as prescribed by the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa98f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5326/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maximum Effective Period for Order</span>.—</span></p>No order issued under subsection (a) shall be effective for more than 180 days unless renewed pursuant to the requirements of subsection (a).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/690/tVI">Pub. L. 100–690, title VI</span>, § 6185(c), <span itemtype="date" date="1988-11-18">Nov. 18, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/4355">102 Stat. 4355</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, §§ 1514, 1562, <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4058">106 Stat. 4058</span>, 4072; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, §§ 353(d), 365(c)(2)(B), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/323">115 Stat. 323</span>, 335.)</p><p itemtype="section" status="repealed" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa994-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5327"><span itemtype="num" value="5327">[§ 5327.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repealed. <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/208/dA/tII">Pub. L. 104–208, div. A, title II</span>, § 2223(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-09-30">Sept. 30, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3009-415">110 Stat. 3009–415</span>]</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa997-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328"><span itemtype="num" value="5328">§ 5328.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Whistleblower protections</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa998-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Prohibition Against Discrimination</span>.—</span></p>No financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business may discharge or otherwise discriminate against any employee with respect to compensation, terms, conditions, or privileges of employment because the employee (or any person acting pursuant to the request of the employee) provided information to the Secretary of the Treasury, the Attorney General, or any Federal supervisory agency regarding a possible violation of any provision of this subchapter or section 1956, 1957, or 1960 of title 18, or any regulation under any such provision, by the financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business or any director, officer, or employee of the financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa999-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Enforcement</span>.—</span></p>Any employee or former employee who believes that such employee has been discharged or discriminated against in violation of subsection (a) may file a civil action in the appropriate United States district court before the end of the 2-year period beginning on the date of such discharge or discrimination.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa99a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Remedies</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the district court determines that a violation has occurred, the court may order the financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business which committed the violation to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa99b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> reinstate the employee to the employee’s former position;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa99c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> pay compensatory damages; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa99d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> take other appropriate actions to remedy any past discrimination.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa99e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The protections of this section shall not apply to any employee who—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa99f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> deliberately causes or participates in the alleged violation of law or regulation; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> knowingly or recklessly provides substantially false information to the Secretary, the Attorney General, or any Federal supervisory agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5328/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coordination With Other Provisions of Law</span>.—</span></p>This section shall not apply with respect to any financial institution or nonfinancial trade or business which is subject to section 33 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act, section 213 of the Federal Credit Union Act, or section 21A(q) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002085"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002085"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Home Owners’ Loan Act (as added by section 251(c) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Improvement Act of 1991).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/550/tXV">Pub. L. 102–550, title XV</span>, § 1563(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-28">Oct. 28, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/4072">106 Stat. 4072</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 365(c)(2)(B)(i), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/335">115 Stat. 335</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa9a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5329"><span itemtype="num" value="5329">§ 5329.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Staff commentaries</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Secretary shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5329/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> publish all written rulings interpreting this subchapter; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5329/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> annually issue a staff commentary on the regulations issued under this subchapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIII">Pub. L. 103–325, title III</span>, § 311(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2221">108 Stat. 2221</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa9aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330"><span itemtype="num" value="5330">§ 5330.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Registration of money transmitting businesses</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Registration With Secretary of the Treasury Required.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Any person who owns or controls a money transmitting business shall register the business (whether or not the business is licensed as a money transmitting business in any State) with the Secretary of the Treasury not later than the end of the 180-day period beginning on the later of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the date of enactment of the Money Laundering Suppression Act of 1994; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the date on which the business is established.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Form and manner of registration</span>.—</span></p>Subject to the requirements of subsection (b), the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe, by regulation, the form and manner for registering a money transmitting business pursuant to paragraph (1).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Businesses remain subject to state law</span>.—</span></p>This section shall not be construed as superseding any requirement of State law relating to money transmitting businesses operating in such State.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">False and incomplete information</span>.—</span></p>The filing of false or materially incomplete information in connection with the registration of a money transmitting business shall be considered as a failure to comply with the requirements of this subchapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents of Registration</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The registration of a money transmitting business under subsection (a) shall include the following information:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The name and location of the business.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The name and address of each person who—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> owns or controls the business;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is a director or officer of the business; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> otherwise participates in the conduct of the affairs of the business.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The name and address of any depository institution at which the business maintains a transaction account (as defined in section 19(b)(1)(C) of the Federal Reserve Act).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> An estimate of the volume of business in the coming year (which shall be reported annually to the Secretary).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Such other information as the Secretary of the Treasury may require.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Agents of Money Transmitting Businesses.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maintenance of lists of agents of money transmitting businesses</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Pursuant to regulations which the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe, each money transmitting business shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> maintain a list containing the names and addresses of all persons authorized to act as an agent for such business in connection with activities described in subsection (d)(1)(A) and such other information about such agents as the Secretary may require; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> make the list and other information available on request to any appropriate law enforcement agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment of agent as money transmitting business</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe regulations establishing, on the basis of such criteria as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, a threshold point for treating an agent of a money transmitting business as a money transmitting business for purposes of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section, the following definitions shall apply:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Money transmitting business</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “money transmitting business” means any business other than the United States Postal Service which—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> provides check cashing, currency exchange, or money transmitting or remittance services, or issues or redeems money orders, travelers’ checks, and other similar instruments or any other person who engages as a business in the transmission of funds, including any person who engages as a business in an informal money transfer system or any network of people who engage as a business in facilitating the transfer of money domestically or internationally outside of the conventional financial institutions system;; <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002086"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002086"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is required to file reports under section 5313; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> is not a depository institution (as defined in section 5313(g)).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span
