itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Money transmitting service</span>.—</span></p>The term “money transmitting service” includes accepting currency or funds denominated in the currency of any country and transmitting the currency or funds, or the value of the currency or funds, by any means through a financial agency or institution, a Federal reserve bank or other facility of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, or an electronic funds transfer network.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil Penalty for Failure To Comply With Registration Requirements.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Any person who fails to comply with any requirement of this section or any regulation prescribed under this section shall be liable to the United States for a civil penalty of $5,000 for each such violation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Continuing violation</span>.—</span></p>Each day a violation described in paragraph (1) continues shall constitute a separate violation for purposes of such paragraph.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5330/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Assessments</span>.—</span></p>Any penalty imposed under this subsection shall be assessed and collected by the Secretary of the Treasury in the manner provided in section 5321 and any such assessment shall be subject to the provisions of such section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tIV">Pub. L. 103–325, title IV</span>, § 408(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-23">Sept. 23, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/2250">108 Stat. 2250</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 359(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/328">115 Stat. 328</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa9cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331"><span itemtype="num" value="5331">§ 5331.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports relating to coins and currency received in nonfinancial trade or business</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coin and Currency Receipts of More Than </span>$10,000.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Any person—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> who is engaged in a trade or business, and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> who, in the course of such trade or business, receives more than $10,000 in coins or currency in 1 transaction (or 2 or more related transactions), or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> who is required to file a report under section 6050I(g) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>shall file a report described in subsection (b) with respect to such transaction (or related transactions) with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network at such time and in such manner as the Secretary may, by regulation, prescribe.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Form and Manner of Reports</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A report is described in this subsection if such report—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> is in such form as the Secretary may prescribe;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> contains—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the name and address, and such other identification information as the Secretary may require, of the person from whom the coins or currency was received;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the amount of coins or currency received;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the date and nature of the transaction; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> such other information, including the identification of the person filing the report, as the Secretary may prescribe.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Exceptions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Amounts received by financial institutions</span>.—</span></p>Subsection (a) shall not apply to amounts received in a transaction reported under section 5313 and regulations prescribed under such section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Transactions occurring outside the united states</span>.—</span></p>Except to the extent provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, subsection (a) shall not apply to any transaction if the entire transaction occurs outside the United States.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Currency Includes Foreign Currency and Certain Monetary Instruments.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section, the term “currency” includes—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> foreign currency; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102aa9e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to the extent provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, any monetary instrument (whether or not in bearer form) with a face amount of not more than $10,000.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5331/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Scope of application</span>.—</span></p>Paragraph (1)(B) shall not apply to any check drawn on the account of the writer in a financial institution referred to in subparagraph (A), (B), (C), (D), (E), (F), (G), (J), (K), (R), or (S) of section 5312(a)(2).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 365(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/333">115 Stat. 333</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/74/dC/tI">Pub. L. 112–74, div. C, title I</span>, § 120, <span itemtype="date" date="2011-12-23">Dec. 23, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/125/891">125 Stat. 891</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102aa9e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332"><span itemtype="num" value="5332">§ 5332.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Bulk cash smuggling into or out of the United States</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal Offense.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Whoever, with the intent to evade a currency reporting requirement under section 5316, knowingly conceals more than $10,000 in currency or other monetary instruments on the person of such individual or in any conveyance, article of luggage, merchandise, or other container, and transports or transfers or attempts to transport or transfer such currency or monetary instruments from a place within the United States to a place outside of the United States, or from a place outside the United States to a place within the United States, shall be guilty of a currency smuggling offense and subject to punishment pursuant to subsection (b).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Concealment on person</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this section, the concealment of currency on the person of any individual includes concealment in any article of clothing worn by the individual or in any luggage, backpack, or other container worn or carried by such individual.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Penalty.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Term of imprisonment</span>.—</span></p>A person convicted of a currency smuggling offense under subsection (a), or a conspiracy to commit such offense, shall be imprisoned for not more than 5 years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Forfeiture</span>.—</span></p>In addition, the court, in imposing sentence under paragraph (1), shall order that the defendant forfeit to the United States, any property, real or personal, involved in the offense, and any property traceable to such property.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Procedure</span>.—</span></p>The seizure, restraint, and forfeiture of property under this section shall be governed by section 413 of the Controlled Substances Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Personal money judgment</span>.—</span></p>If the property subject to forfeiture under paragraph (2) is unavailable, and the defendant has insufficient substitute property that may be forfeited pursuant to section 413(p) of the Controlled Substances Act, the court shall enter a personal money judgment against the defendant for the amount that would be subject to forfeiture.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102aa9f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil Forfeiture.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Any property involved in a violation of subsection (a), or a conspiracy to commit such violation, and any property traceable to such violation or conspiracy, may be seized and forfeited to the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Procedure</span>.—</span></p>The seizure and forfeiture shall be governed by the procedures governing civil forfeitures in money laundering cases pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s981/a/1/A"/>section 981(a)(1)(A) of title 18, United States Code.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102aa9f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5332/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment of certain property as involved in the offense</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of this subsection and subsection (b), any currency or other monetary instrument that is concealed or intended to be concealed in violation of subsection (a) or a conspiracy to commit such violation, any article, container, or conveyance used, or intended to be used, to conceal or transport the currency or other monetary instrument, and any other property used, or intended to be used, to facilitate the offense, shall be considered property involved in the offense.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 371(c), <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/337">115 Stat. 337</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, § 6203(h), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3747">118 Stat. 3747</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id102cf2ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53/schIII"><span itemtype="num" value="III">SUBCHAPTER III—</span><span itemtype="heading">MONEY LAUNDERING AND RELATED FINANCIAL CRIMES</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf2ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340"><span itemtype="num" value="5340">§ 5340.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>For purposes of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Department of the treasury law enforcement organizations</span>.—</span></p>The term “Department of the Treasury law enforcement organizations” has the meaning given to such term in section 9705(<p itemtype="i"/>o).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Money laundering and related financial crime</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “money laundering and related financial crime”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf2f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> means the movement of illicit cash or cash equivalent proceeds into, out of, or through the United States, or into, out of, or through United States financial institutions, as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s5312"/>section 5312 of title 31, United States Code; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf2f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> has the meaning given that term (or the term used for an equivalent offense) under State and local criminal statutes pertaining to the movement of illicit cash or cash equivalent proceeds.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Secretary</span>.—</span></p>The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5340/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Attorney general</span>.—</span></p>The term “Attorney General” means the Attorney General of the United States.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2941">112 Stat. 2941</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/114/22/tI">Pub. L. 114–22, title I</span>, § 105(c)(2)(A)(ii)(II), <span itemtype="date" date="2015-05-29">May 29, 2015</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/129/237">129 Stat. 237</span>.)</p><p itemtype="part" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id102cf2f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53/schIII/pt1"><span itemtype="num" value="1"><span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Part</span> 1—</span><span itemtype="heading"><span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">National Money Laundering and Related Financial Crimes Strategy</span></span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf2f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341"><span itemtype="num" value="5341">§ 5341.</span><span itemtype="heading"> National money laundering and related financial crimes strategy</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf2fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Development and Transmittal to Congress.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Development</span>.—</span></p>The President, acting through the Secretary and in consultation with the Attorney General, shall develop a national strategy for combating money laundering and related financial crimes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Transmittal to congress</span>.—</span></p>By August 1 of 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2005, and 2007, the President shall submit a national strategy developed in accordance with paragraph (1) to the Congress.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Separate presentation of classified material</span>.—</span></p>Any part of the strategy that involves information which is properly classified under criteria established by Executive Order shall be submitted to the Congress separately in classified form.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf2fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Development of Strategy</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The national strategy for combating money laundering and related financial crimes shall address any area the President, acting through the Secretary and in consultation with the Attorney General, considers appropriate, including the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf2ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Goals, objectives, and priorities</span>.—</span></p>Comprehensive, research-based goals, objectives, and priorities for reducing money laundering and related financial crime in the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf300-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Prevention</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Coordination of regulatory and other efforts to prevent the exploitation of financial systems in the United States for money laundering and related financial crimes, including a requirement that the Secretary shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf301-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> regularly review enforcement efforts under this subchapter and other provisions of law and, when appropriate, modify existing regulations or prescribe new regulations for purposes of preventing such criminal activity; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf302-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> coordinate prevention efforts and other enforcement action with the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Federal Trade Commission, other Federal banking agencies, the National Credit Union Administration Board, and such other Federal agencies as the Secretary, in consultation with the Attorney General, determines to be appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf303-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Detection and prosecution initiatives</span>.—</span></p>A description of operational initiatives to improve detection and prosecution of money laundering and related financial crimes and the seizure and forfeiture of proceeds and instrumentalities derived from such crimes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf304-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Enhancement of the role of the private financial sector in prevention</span>.—</span></p>The enhancement of partnerships between the private financial sector and law enforcement agencies with regard to the prevention and detection of money laundering and related financial crimes, including providing incentives to strengthen internal controls and to adopt on an industrywide basis more effective policies.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf305-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Enhancement of intergovernmental cooperation</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The enhancement of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf306-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> cooperative efforts between the Federal Government and State and local officials, including State and local prosecutors and other law enforcement officials; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf307-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> cooperative efforts among the several States and between State and local officials, including State and local prosecutors and other law enforcement officials,<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>for financial crimes control which could be utilized or should be encouraged.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf308-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Project and budget priorities</span>.—</span></p>A 3-year projection for program and budget priorities and achievable projects for reductions in financial crimes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf309-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Assessment of funding</span>.—</span></p>A complete assessment of how the proposed budget is intended to implement the strategy and whether the funding levels contained in the proposed budget are sufficient to implement the strategy.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf30a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designated areas</span>.—</span></p>A description of geographical areas designated as “high-risk money laundering and related financial crime areas” in accordance with, but not limited to, section 5342.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf30b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Persons consulted</span>.—</span></p>Persons or officers consulted by the Secretary pursuant to subsection (d).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf30c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Data regarding trends in money laundering and related financial crimes</span>.—</span></p>The need for additional information necessary for the purpose of developing and analyzing data in order to ascertain financial crime trends.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf30d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Improved communications systems</span>.—</span></p>A plan for enhancing the compatibility of automated information and facilitating access of the Federal Government and State and local governments to timely, accurate, and complete information.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf30e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/b/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Data regarding funding of terrorism</span>.—</span></p>Data concerning money laundering efforts related to the funding of acts of international terrorism, and efforts directed at the prevention, detection, and prosecution of such funding.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf30f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Effectiveness Report</span>.—</span></p>At the time each national strategy for combating financial crimes is transmitted by the President to the Congress (other than the first transmission of any such strategy) pursuant to subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit a report containing an evaluation of the effectiveness of policies to combat money laundering and related financial crimes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf310-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Consultations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In addition to the consultations required under this section with the Attorney General, in developing the national strategy for combating money laundering and related financial crimes, the Secretary shall consult with—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf311-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and other Federal banking agencies and the National Credit Union Administration Board;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf312-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> State and local officials, including State and local prosecutors;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf313-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the Securities and Exchange Commission;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf314-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the Commodities and Futures Trading Commission;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf315-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> the Director of the Office of National Drug Control Policy, with respect to money laundering and related financial crimes involving the proceeds of drug trafficking;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf316-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> the Chief of the United States Postal Inspection Service;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf317-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> to the extent appropriate, State and local officials responsible for financial institution and financial market regulation;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf318-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> any other State or local government authority, to the extent appropriate;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf319-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> any other Federal Government authority or instrumentality, to the extent appropriate; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf31a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5341/d/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> representatives of the private financial services sector, to the extent appropriate.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2942">112 Stat. 2942</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/56/tIII">Pub. L. 107–56, title III</span>, § 354, <span itemtype="date" date="2001-10-26">Oct. 26, 2001</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/115/323">115 Stat. 323</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, § 6102(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3744">118 Stat. 3744</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf31e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342"><span itemtype="num" value="5342">§ 5342.</span><span itemtype="heading"> High-risk money laundering and related financial crime areas</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf31f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Findings and Purpose.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf320-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Findings</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Congress finds the following:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf321-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Money laundering and related financial crimes frequently appear to be concentrated in particular geographic areas, financial systems, industry sectors, or financial institutions.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf322-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> While the Secretary has the responsibility to act with regard to Federal offenses which are being committed in a particular locality or are directed at a single institution, because modern financial systems and institutions are interconnected to a degree which was not possible until recently, money laundering and other related financial crimes are likely to have local, State, national, and international effects wherever they are committed.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf323-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Purpose and objective</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>It is the purpose of this section to provide a mechanism for designating any area where money laundering or a related financial crime appears to be occurring at a higher than average rate such that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf324-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a comprehensive approach to the problem of such crime in such area can be developed, in cooperation with State and local law enforcement agencies, which utilizes the authority of the Secretary to prevent such activity; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf325-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> such area can be targeted for law enforcement action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf326-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Element of National Strategy</span>.—</span></p>The designation of certain areas as areas in which money laundering and related financial crimes are extensive or present a substantial risk shall be an element of the national strategy developed pursuant to section 5341(b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf327-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Designation of Areas.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf328-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designation by secretary</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary, after taking into consideration the factors specified in subsection (d), shall designate any geographical area, industry, sector, or institution in the United States in which money laundering and related financial crimes are extensive or present a substantial risk as a “high-risk money laundering and related financial crimes area”.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf329-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Case-by-case determination in consultation with the attorney general</span>.—</span></p>In addition to the factors specified in subsection (d), any designation of any area under paragraph (1) shall be made on the basis of a determination by the Secretary, in consultation with the Attorney General, that the particular area, industry, sector, or institution is being victimized by, or is particularly vulnerable to, money laundering and related financial crimes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf32a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Specific initiatives</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Any head of a department, bureau, or law enforcement agency, including any State or local prosecutor, involved in the detection, prevention, and suppression of money laundering and related financial crimes and any State or local official or prosecutor may submit—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf32b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a written request for the designation of any area as a high-risk money laundering and related financial crimes area; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf32c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a written request for funding under section 5351 for a specific prevention or enforcement initiative, or to determine the extent of financial criminal activity, in an area.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf32d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Factors</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In considering the designation of any area as a high-risk money laundering and related financial crimes area, the Secretary shall, to the extent appropriate and in consultation with the Attorney General, take into account the following factors:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf32e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The population of the area.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf32f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The number of bank and nonbank financial institution transactions which originate in such area or involve institutions located in such area.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf330-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The number of stock or commodities transactions which originate in such area or involve institutions located in such area.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf331-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Whether the area is a key transportation hub with any international ports or airports or an extensive highway system.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf332-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Whether the area is an international center for banking or commerce.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf333-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> The extent to which financial crimes and financial crime-related activities in such area are having a harmful impact in other areas of the country.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf334-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The number or nature of requests for information or analytical assistance which—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf335-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> are made to the analytical component of the Department of the Treasury; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf336-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> originate from law enforcement or regulatory authorities located in such area or involve institutions or businesses located in such area or residents of such area.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf337-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> The volume or nature of suspicious activity reports originating in the area.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf338-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> The volume or nature of currency transaction reports or reports of cross-border movements of currency or monetary instruments originating in, or transported through, the area.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf339-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> Whether, and how often, the area has been the subject of a geographical targeting order.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf33a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> Observed changes in trends and patterns of money laundering activity.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf33b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span></p> Unusual patterns, anomalies, growth, or other changes in the volume or nature of core economic statistics or indicators.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf33c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/13"><span itemtype="num" value="13">(13)</span></p> Statistics or indicators of unusual or unexplained volumes of cash transactions.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf33d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/14"><span itemtype="num" value="14">(14)</span></p> Unusual patterns, anomalies, or changes in the volume or nature of transactions conducted through financial institutions operating within or outside the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf33e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/15"><span itemtype="num" value="15">(15)</span></p> The extent to which State and local governments and State and local law enforcement agencies have committed resources to respond to the financial crime problem in the area and the degree to which the commitment of such resources reflects a determination by such government and agencies to address the problem aggressively.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf33f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5342/d/16"><span itemtype="num" value="16">(16)</span></p> The extent to which a significant increase in the allocation of Federal resources to combat financial crimes in such area is necessary to provide an adequate State and local response to financial crimes and financial crime-related activities in such area.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2944">112 Stat. 2944</span>.)</p><p itemtype="part" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id102cf343-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53/schIII/pt2"><span itemtype="num" value="2"><span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Part</span> 2—</span><span itemtype="heading"><span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Financial Crime-Free Communities Support Program</span></span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf344-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351"><span itemtype="num" value="5351">§ 5351.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Establishment of financial crime-free communities support program</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf345-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Establishment</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Attorney General, shall establish a program to support local law enforcement efforts in the development and implementation of a program for the detection, prevention, and suppression of money laundering and related financial crimes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf346-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Program</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In carrying out the program, the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Attorney General, shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf347-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> make and track grants to grant recipients;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf348-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> provide for technical assistance and training, data collection, and dissemination of information on state-of-the-art practices that the Secretary determines to be effective in detecting, preventing, and suppressing money laundering and related financial crimes; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf349-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> provide for the general administration of the program.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf34a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Administration</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall appoint an administrator to carry out the program.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf34b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5351/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contracting</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may employ any necessary staff and may enter into contracts or agreements with Federal and State law enforcement agencies to delegate authority for the execution of grants and for such other activities necessary to carry out this chapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2946">112 Stat. 2946</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf34d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352"><span itemtype="num" value="5352">§ 5352.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Program authorization</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf34e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Grant Eligibility</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>To be eligible to receive an initial grant or a renewal grant under this part, a State or local law enforcement agency or prosecutor shall meet each of the following criteria:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf34f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Application</span>.—</span></p>The State or local law enforcement agency or prosecutor shall submit an application to the Secretary in accordance with section 5353(a)(2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf350-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Accountability</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The State or local law enforcement agency or prosecutor shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf351-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> establish a system to measure and report outcomes—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf352-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> consistent with common indicators and evaluation protocols established by the Secretary, in consultation with the Attorney General; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf353-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> approved by the Secretary;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf354-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> conduct biennial surveys (or incorporate local surveys in existence at the time of the evaluation) to measure the progress and effectiveness of the coalition; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf355-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> provide assurances that the entity conducting an evaluation under this paragraph, or from which the applicant receives information, has experience in gathering data related to money laundering and related financial crimes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf356-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Grant Amounts.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf357-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Grants.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf358-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Subject to subparagraph (D), for a fiscal year, the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Attorney General, may grant to an eligible applicant under this section for that fiscal year, an amount determined by the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Attorney General, to be appropriate.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf359-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Suspension of grants</span>.—</span></p>If such grant recipient fails to continue to meet the criteria specified in subsection (a), the Secretary may suspend the grant, after providing written notice to the grant recipient and an opportunity to appeal.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf35a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Renewal grants</span>.—</span></p>Subject to subparagraph (D), the Secretary may award a renewal grant to a grant recipient under this subparagraph for each fiscal year following the fiscal year for which an initial grant is awarded.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf35b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation</span>.—</span></p>The amount of a grant award under this paragraph may not exceed $750,000 for a fiscal year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf35c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Grant awards.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf35d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the Secretary may, with respect to a community, make a grant to one eligible applicant that represents that community.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf35e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exception</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary may make a grant to more than one eligible applicant that represent <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002087">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002087"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> a community if—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf35f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the eligible coalitions demonstrate that the coalitions are collaborating with one another; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf360-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/b/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> each of the coalitions has independently met the requirements set forth in subsection (a).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf361-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Condition Relating to Proceeds of Asset Forfeitures.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf362-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>No grant may be made or renewed under this part to any State or local law enforcement agency or prosecutor unless the agency or prosecutor agrees to donate to the Secretary of the Treasury for the program established under this part any amount received by such agency or prosecutor (after the grant is made) pursuant to any criminal or civil forfeiture under chapter 46 of title 18, United States Code, or any similar provision of State law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf363-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Scope of application</span>.—</span></p>Paragraph (1) shall not apply to any amount received by a State or local law enforcement agency or prosecutor pursuant to any criminal or civil forfeiture referred to in such paragraph in excess of the aggregate amount of grants received by such agency or prosecutor under this part.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf364-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rolling Grant Application Periods</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In establishing the program under this part, the Secretary shall take such action as may be necessary to ensure, to the extent practicable, that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf365-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> applications for grants under this part may be filed at any time during a fiscal year; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf366-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5352/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> some portion of the funds appropriated under this part for any such fiscal year will remain available for grant applications filed later in the fiscal year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2946">112 Stat. 2946</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf368-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353"><span itemtype="num" value="5353">§ 5353.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Information collection and dissemination with respect to grant recipients</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf369-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Applicant and Grantee Information.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf36a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Application process</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall issue requests for proposal, as necessary, regarding, with respect to the grants awarded under section 5352, the application process, grant renewal, and suspension or withholding of renewal grants. Each application under this paragraph shall be in writing and shall be subject to review by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf36b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reporting</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable and in a manner consistent with applicable law, minimize reporting requirements by a grant recipient and expedite any application for a renewal grant made under this part.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf36c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Activities of Secretary</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf36d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> evaluate the utility of specific initiatives relating to the purposes of the program;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf36e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> conduct an evaluation of the program; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf36f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> disseminate information described in this subsection to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf370-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> eligible State local law enforcement agencies or prosecutors; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf371-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5353/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the general public.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2948">112 Stat. 2948</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf373-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5354"><span itemtype="num" value="5354">§ 5354.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Grants for fighting money laundering and related financial crimes</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf374-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5354/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p>After the end of the 1-year period beginning on the date the first national strategy for combating money laundering and related financial crimes is submitted to the Congress in accordance with section 5341, and subject to subsection (b), the Secretary may review, select, and award grants for State or local law enforcement agencies and prosecutors to provide funding necessary to investigate and prosecute money laundering and related financial crimes in high-risk money laundering and related financial crime areas.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf375-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5354/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Special Preference</span>.—</span></p>Special preference shall be given to applications submitted to the Secretary which demonstrate collaborative efforts of two or more State and local law enforcement agencies or prosecutors who have a history of Federal, State, and local cooperative law enforcement and prosecutorial efforts in responding to such criminal activity.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2948">112 Stat. 2948</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf377-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5355"><span itemtype="num" value="5355">§ 5355.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authorization of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">There are authorized to be appropriated the following amounts for the following fiscal years to carry out the purposes of this subchapter:<p itemtype="table" width="50%" style="border-collapse:collapse; border=0;  -uslm-lc: c2,L0,tp0,p7,7/8,s10,r10,tp0,p7,7/8,s10,r10; " id="id102cf378-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f"/>

<p itemtype="th" style="min-width: 72.0pt; text-align:center; vertical-align:middle;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left;"/><p itemtype="b"/>For fiscal year:<p itemtype="th" style="min-width: 133.0pt; text-align:center; vertical-align:middle;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left;"/><p itemtype="b"/>The amount authorized is:

<p itemtype="tbody" style="line-height:8pt; font-size:7pt;"/>
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>1999<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $5,000,000.
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>2000<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $7,500,000.
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>2001<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $10,000,000.
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>2002<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $12,500,000.
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>2003<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $15,000,000.
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>2004<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $15,000,000.
<p itemtype="tr" style="-uslm-lc:I02;"/><p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-right:2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:2em;" class="leaders"/><p itemtype="span"/>2005<p itemtype="td" style=" text-align:left; vertical-align:top; padding-left: 2pt;"/><p itemtype="p" style=" text-align:left; text-indent: -1em; padding-left:1em;"/> $15,000,000.


</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/310">Pub. L. 105–310</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-30">Oct. 30, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2948">112 Stat. 2948</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/458/tVI">Pub. L. 108–458, title VI</span>, § 6102(b), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-12-17">Dec. 17, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/3745">118 Stat. 3745</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subchapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id102cf37c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stIV/ch53/schIV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">SUBCHAPTER IV—</span><span itemtype="heading">PROHIBITION ON FUNDING OF UNLAWFUL INTERNET GAMBLING</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf37d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361"><span itemtype="num" value="5361">§ 5361.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Congressional findings and purpose</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf37e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Findings</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Congress finds the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf37f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Internet gambling is primarily funded through personal use of payment system instruments, credit cards, and wire transfers.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf380-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The National Gambling Impact Study Commission in 1999 recommended the passage of legislation to prohibit wire transfers to Internet gambling sites or the banks which represent such sites.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf381-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Internet gambling is a growing cause of debt collection problems for insured depository institutions and the consumer credit industry.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf382-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> New mechanisms for enforcing gambling laws on the Internet are necessary because traditional law enforcement mechanisms are often inadequate for enforcing gambling prohibitions or regulations on the Internet, especially where such gambling crosses State or national borders.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf383-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5361/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rule of Construction</span>.—</span></p>No provision of this subchapter shall be construed as altering, limiting, or extending any Federal or State law or Tribal-State compact prohibiting, permitting, or regulating gambling within the United States.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1952">120 Stat. 1952</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf387-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362"><span itemtype="num" value="5362">§ 5362.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this subchapter:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf388-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Bet or wager</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “bet or wager”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf389-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> means the staking or risking by any person of something of value upon the outcome of a contest of others, a sporting event, or a game subject to chance, upon an agreement or understanding that the person or another person will receive something of value in the event of a certain outcome;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf38a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> includes the purchase of a chance or opportunity to win a lottery or other prize (which opportunity to win is predominantly subject to chance);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf38b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> includes any scheme of a type described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s3702"/>section 3702 of title 28;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf38c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> includes any instructions or information pertaining to the establishment or movement of funds by the bettor or customer in, to, or from an account with the business of betting or wagering; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf38d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> does not include—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf38e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> any activity governed by the securities laws (as that term is defined in section 3(a)(47) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002088"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002088"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> for the purchase or sale of securities (as that term is defined in section 3(a)(10) of that Act);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf38f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any transaction conducted on or subject to the rules of a registered entity or exempt board of trade under the Commodity Exchange Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf390-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> any over-the-counter derivative instrument;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf391-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> any other transaction that—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf392-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/iv/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> is excluded or exempt from regulation under the Commodity Exchange Act; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf393-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/iv/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> is exempt from State gaming or bucket shop laws under section 12(e) of the Commodity Exchange Act or section 28(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf394-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> any contract of indemnity or guarantee;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf395-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> any contract for insurance;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf396-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> any deposit or other transaction with an insured depository institution;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf397-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/viii"><span itemtype="num"
