value="viii">(viii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> participation in any game or contest in which participants do not stake or risk anything of value other than—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf398-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/viii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> personal efforts of the participants in playing the game or contest or obtaining access to the Internet; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf399-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/viii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> points or credits that the sponsor of the game or contest provides to participants free of charge and that can be used or redeemed only for participation in games or contests offered by the sponsor; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf39a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ix"><span itemtype="num" value="ix">(ix)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> participation in any fantasy or simulation sports game or educational game or contest in which (if the game or contest involves a team or teams) no fantasy or simulation sports team is based on the current membership of an actual team that is a member of an amateur or professional sports organization (as those terms are defined in <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s3701">section 3701 of title 28</span>) and that meets the following conditions:<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf39b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ix/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> All prizes and awards offered to winning participants are established and made known to the participants in advance of the game or contest and their value is not determined by the number of participants or the amount of any fees paid by those participants.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf39c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ix/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> All winning outcomes reflect the relative knowledge and skill of the participants and are determined predominantly by accumulated statistical results of the performance of individuals (athletes in the case of sports events) in multiple real-world sporting or other events.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf39d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ix/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> No winning outcome is based—<p itemtype="item" style="-uslm-lc:I580434" class="indent5" id="id102cf39e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ix/III/aa"><span itemtype="num" value="aa">(aa)</span></p> on the score, point-spread, or any performance or performances of any single real-world team or any combination of such teams; or<p itemtype="item" style="-uslm-lc:I580434" class="indent5" id="id102cf39f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/1/E/ix/III/bb"><span itemtype="num" value="bb">(bb)</span></p> solely on any single performance of an individual athlete in any single real-world sporting or other event.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Business of betting or wagering</span>.—</span></p>The term “business of betting or wagering” does not include the activities of a financial transaction provider, or any interactive computer service or telecommunications service.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Designated payment system</span>.—</span></p>The term “designated payment system” means any system utilized by a financial transaction provider that the Secretary and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, in consultation with the Attorney General, jointly determine, by regulation or order, could be utilized in connection with, or to facilitate, any restricted transaction.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Financial transaction provider</span>.—</span></p>The term “financial transaction provider” means a creditor, credit card issuer, financial institution, operator of a terminal at which an electronic fund transfer may be initiated, money transmitting business, or international, national, regional, or local payment network utilized to effect a credit transaction, electronic fund transfer, stored value product transaction, or money transmitting service, or a participant in such network, or other participant in a designated payment system.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Internet</span>.—</span></p>The term “Internet” means the international computer network of interoperable packet switched data networks.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Interactive computer service</span>.—</span></p>The term “interactive computer service” has the meaning given the term in section 230(f) of the Communications Act of 1934 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t47/s230/f"/>47 U.S.C. 230(f)).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Restricted transaction</span>.—</span></p>The term “restricted transaction” means any transaction or transmittal involving any credit, funds, instrument, or proceeds described in any paragraph of section 5363 which the recipient is prohibited from accepting under section 5363.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Secretary</span>.—</span></p>The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">State</span>.—</span></p>The term “State” means any State of the United States, the District of Columbia, or any commonwealth, territory, or other possession of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Unlawful internet gambling.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The term “unlawful Internet gambling” means to place, receive, or otherwise knowingly transmit a bet or wager by any means which involves the use, at least in part, of the Internet where such bet or wager is unlawful under any applicable Federal or State law in the State or Tribal lands in which the bet or wager is initiated, received, or otherwise made.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Intrastate transactions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “unlawful Internet gambling” does not include placing, receiving, or otherwise transmitting a bet or wager where—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the bet or wager is initiated and received or otherwise made exclusively within a single State;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the bet or wager and the method by which the bet or wager is initiated and received or otherwise made is expressly authorized by and placed in accordance with the laws of such State, and the State law or regulations include—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> age and location verification requirements reasonably designed to block access to minors and persons located out of such State; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> appropriate data security standards to prevent unauthorized access by any person whose age and current location has not been verified in accordance with such State’s law or regulations; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the bet or wager does not violate any provision of—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/iii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Interstate Horseracing Act of 1978 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s3001"/>15 U.S.C. 3001 et seq.);<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/iii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> chapter 178 of title 28 (commonly known as the “Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act”);<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/iii/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> the Gambling Devices Transportation Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1171"/>15 U.S.C. 1171 et seq.); or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/B/iii/IV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">(IV)</span></p> the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t25/s2701"/>25 U.S.C. 2701 et seq.).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Intratribal transactions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “unlawful Internet gambling” does not include placing, receiving, or otherwise transmitting a bet or wager where—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the bet or wager is initiated and received or otherwise made exclusively—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> within the Indian lands of a single Indian tribe (as such terms are defined under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act); or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> between the Indian lands of 2 or more Indian tribes to the extent that intertribal gaming is authorized by the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the bet or wager and the method by which the bet or wager is initiated and received or otherwise made is expressly authorized by and complies with the requirements of—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the applicable tribal ordinance or resolution approved by the Chairman of the National Indian Gaming Commission; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> with respect to class III gaming, the applicable Tribal-State Compact;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the applicable tribal ordinance or resolution or Tribal-State Compact includes—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> age and location verification requirements reasonably designed to block access to minors and persons located out of the applicable Tribal lands; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> appropriate data security standards to prevent unauthorized access by any person whose age and current location has not been verified in accordance with the applicable tribal ordinance or resolution or Tribal-State Compact; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the bet or wager does not violate any provision of—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iv/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Interstate Horseracing Act of 1978 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s3001"/>15 U.S.C. 3001 et seq.);<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iv/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> chapter 178 of title 28 (commonly known as the “Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act”);<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iv/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> the Gambling Devices Transportation Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1171"/>15 U.S.C. 1171 et seq.); or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id102cf3c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/C/iv/IV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">(IV)</span></p> the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t25/s2701"/>25 U.S.C. 2701 et seq.).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Interstate horseracing.—</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The term “unlawful Internet gambling” shall not include any activity that is allowed under the Interstate Horseracing Act of 1978 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s3001"/>15 U.S.C. 3001 et seq.).<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rule of construction regarding preemption</span>.—</span></p>Nothing in this subchapter may be construed to preempt any State law prohibiting gambling.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/D/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Sense of congress</span>.—</span></p>It is the sense of Congress that this subchapter shall not change which activities related to horse racing may or may not be allowed under Federal law. This subparagraph is intended to address concerns that this subchapter could have the effect of changing the existing relationship between the Interstate Horseracing Act and other Federal statutes in effect on the date of the enactment of this subchapter. This subchapter is not intended to change that relationship. This subchapter is not intended to resolve any existing disagreements over how to interpret the relationship between the Interstate Horseracing Act and other Federal statutes.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/10/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Intermediate routing</span>.—</span></p>The intermediate routing of electronic data shall not determine the location or locations in which a bet or wager is initiated, received, or otherwise made.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Other terms.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Credit; creditor; credit card; and card issuer</span>.—</span></p>The terms “credit”, “creditor”, “credit card”, and “card issuer” have the meanings given the terms in section 103 of the Truth in Lending Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1602"/>15 U.S.C. 1602).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Electronic fund transfer</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “electronic fund transfer”—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> has the meaning given the term in section 903 of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s1693a"/>15 U.S.C. 1693a), except that the term includes transfers that would otherwise be excluded under section 903(6)(E) of that Act; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> includes any fund transfer covered by Article 4A of the Uniform Commercial Code, as in effect in any State.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Financial institution</span>.—</span></p>The term “financial institution” has the meaning given the term in section 903 of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act, except that such term does not include a casino, sports book, or other business at or through which bets or wagers may be placed or received.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Insured depository institution</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The term “insured depository institution”—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> has the meaning given the term in section 3(c) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s1813/c"/>12 U.S.C. 1813(c)); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102cf3d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> includes an insured credit union (as defined in section 101 of the Federal Credit Union Act).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5362/11/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Money transmitting business and money transmitting service</span>.—</span></p>The terms “money transmitting business” and “money transmitting service” have the meanings given the terms in section 5330(d) (determined without regard to any regulations prescribed by the Secretary thereunder).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1953">120 Stat. 1953</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf3d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5363"><span itemtype="num" value="5363">§ 5363.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prohibition on acceptance of any financial instrument for unlawful Internet gambling</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>No person engaged in the business of betting or wagering may knowingly accept, in connection with the participation of another person in unlawful Internet gambling—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5363/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> credit, or the proceeds of credit, extended to or on behalf of such other person (including credit extended through the use of a credit card);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5363/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> an electronic fund transfer, or funds transmitted by or through a money transmitting business, or the proceeds of an electronic fund transfer or money transmitting service, from or on behalf of such other person;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5363/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> any check, draft, or similar instrument which is drawn by or on behalf of such other person and is drawn on or payable at or through any financial institution; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5363/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the proceeds of any other form of financial transaction, as the Secretary and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System may jointly prescribe by regulation, which involves a financial institution as a payor or financial intermediary on behalf of or for the benefit of such other person.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1957">120 Stat. 1957</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102cf3db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364"><span itemtype="num" value="5364">§ 5364.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Policies and procedures to identify and prevent restricted transactions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf3dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Regulations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Before the end of the 270-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this subchapter, the Secretary and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, in consultation with the Attorney General, shall prescribe regulations (which the Secretary and the Board jointly determine to be appropriate) requiring each designated payment system, and all participants therein, to identify and block or otherwise prevent or prohibit restricted transactions through the establishment of policies and procedures reasonably designed to identify and block or otherwise prevent or prohibit the acceptance of restricted transactions in any of the following ways:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The establishment of policies and procedures that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> allow the payment system and any person involved in the payment system to identify restricted transactions by means of codes in authorization messages or by other means; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102cf3df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> block restricted transactions identified as a result of the policies and procedures developed pursuant to subparagraph (A).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The establishment of policies and procedures that prevent or prohibit the acceptance of the products or services of the payment system in connection with a restricted transaction.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf3e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Requirements for Policies and Procedures</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In prescribing regulations under subsection (a), the Secretary and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> identify types of policies and procedures, including nonexclusive examples, which would be deemed, as applicable, to be reasonably designed to identify and block or otherwise prevent or prohibit the acceptance of the products or services with respect to each type of restricted transaction;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to the extent practical, permit any participant in a payment system to choose among alternative means of identifying and blocking, or otherwise preventing or prohibiting the acceptance of the products or services of the payment system or participant in connection with, restricted transactions;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> exempt certain restricted transactions or designated payment systems from any requirement imposed under such regulations, if the Secretary and the Board jointly find that it is not reasonably practical to identify and block, or otherwise prevent or prohibit the acceptance of, such transactions; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102cf3e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> ensure that transactions in connection with any activity excluded from the definition of unlawful internet gambling in subparagraph (B), (C), or (D)(i) of section 5362(10) are not blocked or otherwise prevented or prohibited by the prescribed regulations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102cf3e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Compliance With Payment System Policies and Procedures</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A financial transaction provider shall be considered to be in compliance with the regulations prescribed under subsection (a) if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> such person relies on and complies with the policies and procedures of a designated payment system of which it is a member or participant to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> identify and block restricted transactions; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> otherwise prevent or prohibit the acceptance of the products or services of the payment system, member, or participant in connection with restricted transactions; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> such policies and procedures of the designated payment system comply with the requirements of regulations prescribed under subsection (a).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f63eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">No Liability for Blocking or Refusing To Honor Restricted Transactions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A person that identifies and blocks a transaction, prevents or prohibits the acceptance of its products or services in connection with a transaction, or otherwise refuses to honor a transaction—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> that is a restricted transaction;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> that such person reasonably believes to be a restricted transaction; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> as a designated payment system or a member of a designated payment system in reliance on the policies and procedures of the payment system, in an effort to comply with regulations prescribed under subsection (a),<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>shall not be liable to any party for such action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f63ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Regulatory Enforcement</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The requirements under this section shall be enforced exclusively by—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Federal functional regulators, with respect to the designated payment systems and financial transaction providers subject to the respective jurisdiction of such regulators under section 505(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act and section 5g of the Commodities Exchange Act; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5364/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Federal Trade Commission, with respect to designated payment systems and financial transaction providers not otherwise subject to the jurisdiction of any Federal functional regulators (including the Commission) as described in paragraph (1).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1958">120 Stat. 1958</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102f63f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365"><span itemtype="num" value="5365">§ 5365.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil remedies</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f63f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Jurisdiction</span>.—</span></p>In addition to any other remedy under current law, the district courts of the United States shall have original and exclusive jurisdiction to prevent and restrain restricted transactions by issuing appropriate orders in accordance with this section, regardless of whether a prosecution has been initiated under this subchapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f63f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Proceedings.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Institution by federal government.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The United States, acting through the Attorney General, may institute proceedings under this section to prevent or restrain a restricted transaction.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Relief</span>.—</span></p>Upon application of the United States under this paragraph, the district court may enter a temporary restraining order, a preliminary injunction, or an injunction against any person to prevent or restrain a restricted transaction, in accordance with rule 65 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Institution by state attorney general.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The attorney general (or other appropriate State official) of a State in which a restricted transaction allegedly has been or will be initiated, received, or otherwise made may institute proceedings under this section to prevent or restrain the violation or threatened violation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Relief</span>.—</span></p>Upon application of the attorney general (or other appropriate State official) of an affected State under this paragraph, the district court may enter a temporary restraining order, a preliminary injunction, or an injunction against any person to prevent or restrain a restricted transaction, in accordance with rule 65 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f63fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Indian lands.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f63ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) and (2), for a restricted transaction that allegedly has been or will be initiated, received, or otherwise made on Indian lands (as that term is defined in section 4 of the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act)—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6400-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the United States shall have the enforcement authority provided under paragraph (1); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6401-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the enforcement authorities specified in an applicable Tribal-State Compact negotiated under section 11 of the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t25/s2710"/>25 U.S.C. 2710) shall be carried out in accordance with that compact.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6402-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Rule of construction</span>.—</span></p>No provision of this section shall be construed as altering, superseding, or otherwise affecting the application of the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f6403-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitation Relating to Interactive Computer Services.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6404-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Relief granted under this section against an interactive computer service shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6405-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> be limited to the removal of, or disabling of access to, an online site violating section 5363, or a hypertext link to an online site violating such section, that resides on a computer server that such service controls or operates, except that the limitation in this subparagraph shall not apply if the service is subject to liability under this section under section 5367;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6406-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> be available only after notice to the interactive computer service and an opportunity for the service to appear are provided;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6407-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> not impose any obligation on an interactive computer service to monitor its service or to affirmatively seek facts indicating activity violating this subchapter;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6408-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> specify the interactive computer service to which it applies; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6409-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> specifically identify the location of the online site or hypertext link to be removed or access to which is to be disabled.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f640a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coordination with other law</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>An interactive computer service that does not violate this subchapter shall not be liable under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s1084/d">section 1084(d) of title 18</span>, except that the limitation in this paragraph shall not apply if an interactive computer service has actual knowledge and control of bets and wagers and—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f640b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> operates, manages, supervises, or directs an Internet website at which unlawful bets or wagers may be placed, received, or otherwise made or at which unlawful bets or wagers are offered to be placed, received, or otherwise made; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f640c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> owns or controls, or is owned or controlled by, any person who operates, manages, supervises, or directs an Internet website at which unlawful bets or wagers may be placed, received, or otherwise made, or at which unlawful bets or wagers are offered to be placed, received, or otherwise made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f640d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5365/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation on Injunctions Against Regulated Persons</span>.—</span></p>Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, and subject to section 5367, no provision of this subchapter shall be construed as authorizing the Attorney General of the United States, or the attorney general (or other appropriate State official) of any State to institute proceedings to prevent or restrain a restricted transaction against any financial transaction provider, to the extent that the person is acting as a financial transaction provider.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1959">120 Stat. 1959</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102f6411-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5366"><span itemtype="num" value="5366">§ 5366.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Criminal penalties</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f6412-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5366/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p>Any person who violates section 5363 shall be fined under title 18, imprisoned for not more than 5 years, or both.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id102f6413-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5366/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Permanent Injunction</span>.—</span></p>Upon conviction of a person under this section, the court may enter a permanent injunction enjoining such person from placing, receiving, or otherwise making bets or wagers or sending, receiving, or inviting information assisting in the placing of bets or wagers.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1961">120 Stat. 1961</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102f6415-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5367"><span itemtype="num" value="5367">§ 5367.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Circumventions prohibited</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Notwithstanding section 5362(2), a financial transaction provider, or any interactive computer service or telecommunications service, may be liable under this subchapter if such person has actual knowledge and control of bets and wagers, and—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6416-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5367/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> operates, manages, supervises, or directs an Internet website at which unlawful bets or wagers may be placed, received, or otherwise made, or at which unlawful bets or wagers are offered to be placed, received, or otherwise made; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6417-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s5367/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> owns or controls, or is owned or controlled by, any person who operates, manages, supervises, or directs an Internet website at which unlawful bets or wagers may be placed, received, or otherwise made, or at which unlawful bets or wagers are offered to be placed, received, or otherwise made.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/347/tVIII">Pub. L. 109–347, title VIII</span>, § 802(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/1961">120 Stat. 1961</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subtitle" style="-uslm-lc:I52" id="id102f6419-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV"><span itemtype="num" value="V">SUBTITLE V—</span><span itemtype="heading">GENERAL ASSISTANCE ADMINISTRATION</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id102f641d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch61"><span itemtype="num" value="61">CHAPTER 61—</span><span itemtype="heading">PROGRAM INFORMATION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id102f6421-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101"><span itemtype="num" value="6101">§ 6101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6422-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “administering office” means the lowest unit of an agency responsible for managing a domestic assistance program.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6423-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “agency” has the same meaning given that term in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s551/1"/>section 551(1) of title 5.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6424-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “assistance”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6425-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> means the transfer of anything of value for a public purpose of support or stimulation authorized by a law of the United States, including—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6426-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> financial assistance;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6427-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> United States Government facilities, services, and property; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6428-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/3/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> expert and technical information; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6429-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> does not include conventional public information services or procurement of property or services for the direct benefit or use of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f642a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “domestic assistance program”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f642b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> means assistance from an agency for—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f642c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> a State;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f642d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the District of Columbia;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f642e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> a territory or possession of the United States;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f642f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> a county;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6430-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> a city;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6431-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> a political subdivision or instrumentality of a governmental authority listed in subclauses (i)–(v) of this clause (A);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6432-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> a domestic corporation;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6433-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/viii"><span itemtype="num" value="viii">(viii)</span></p> a domestic institution; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id102f6434-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/A/ix"><span itemtype="num" value="ix">(ix)</span></p> an individual of the United States; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6435-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> does not include assistance from an agency for an agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6436-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “Director” means the Director of the Office of Management and Budget.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6437-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> “Administrator” means the Administrator of General Services.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id102f6438-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “formula” means any prescribed method employing objective data or statistical estimates for making individual determinations among recipients of Federal funds, either in terms of eligibility or actual funding allocations, that can be written in the form of either—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f6439-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a closed mathematical statement; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id102f643a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6101/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an iterative procedure or algorithm which can be written as a computer program;<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>and from which the results can be objectively replicated, within reasonable limits due to rounding error, through independent application of such statement, procedures, or algorithm, by different qualified individuals.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1000">96 Stat. 1000</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub. L. 98–169</span>, §§ 1(1), 3(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1113">97 Stat. 1113</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(b)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3060">100 Stat. 3060</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(S), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/287">Pub. L. 104–287</span>, § 6(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-11">Oct. 11, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3398">110 Stat. 3398</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ad3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102"><span itemtype="num" value="6102">§ 6102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Program information requirements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director shall collect and review information on domestic assistance programs and shall provide such information to the Administrator. The information on each domestic assistance program shall include the following:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> identification of the program by—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> title;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> authorizing law;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> administering office; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> an identifying number assigned by the Director.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad42-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a description of the—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad43-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> program;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad44-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> objectives of the program;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad45-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> types of activities financed under the program;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad46-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> eligibility requirements;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> types of assistance;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad48-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> uses, and restrictions on the use, of assistance; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad49-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> duties of recipients under the program.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a specification of each formula governing eligibility for assistance or the distribution of assistance under the program, which shall be described through the use of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the language used to specify each such formula in the law authorizing the program;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the language used to specify each such formula in any Federal rule promulgated pursuant to the law authorizing the program; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a mathematical statement which is derived from the language referred to in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of this paragraph;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a description of all data and statistical estimates used to carry out each formula specified pursuant to paragraph (3), and an identification of the sources of such data and estimates;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> financial information, including the—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> amounts appropriated for the current fiscal year or, if unavailable, the amounts requested by the President and the amounts obligated; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> average amounts of awards made in past years.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> identification of information contacts, including the administering office and regional and local offices with their addresses and telephone numbers.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a general description of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/7/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the application requirements and procedures; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ad55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a/7/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to the extent practical, an estimate of the time required to process the application.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> On request of the Director, an agency shall give to the Director current information on all domestic assistance programs administered by the agency. The Director shall be responsible for ensuring that the Administrator incorporates all relevant information received on a regular basis.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Administrator—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall ensure that information and catalogs under this chapter are made available to the public at reasonable prices;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may develop information services to assist State and local governments in identifying and obtaining sources of assistance;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> shall ensure that the information in the computerized system is made current on a regular basis and that the printed catalog and supplements thereto contain the most current data available at the time of printing; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> shall transmit annually the information compiled under paragraphs (3) and (4) of subsection (a) to the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1001">96 Stat. 1001</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub. L. 98–169</span>, §§ 1(2), 2, 3(b), (c), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1113">97 Stat. 1113</span>, 1114.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ad63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a"><span itemtype="num" value="6102a">§ 6102a.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Assistance awards information system</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> maintain the United States Government assistance awards information system established as a result of the study conducted under section 9 of the Federal Program Information Act; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> update the system on a quarterly basis.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To carry out subsection (a) of this section, the Director—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may delegate the responsibility for carrying out subsection (a) of this section to the head of another executive agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> shall review a report the head of an agency submits to the Director on the method of carrying out subsection (a) of this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may validate, by appropriate means, the method by which an agency prepares the report.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6102a/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Director shall transmit promptly after the end of each calendar quarter, free of charge, the data in the system required by subsection (a) to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and to the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(23)(A), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2477">96 Stat. 2477</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub. L. 98–169</span>, § 1(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1113">97 Stat. 1113</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3060">100 Stat. 3060</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/186/tII">Pub. L. 104–186, title II</span>, § 219(b)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-08-20">Aug. 20, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1748">110 Stat. 1748</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ad72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103"><span itemtype="num" value="6103">§ 6103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Access to computer information system</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Administrator shall maintain a computerized information system providing access to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the information described in paragraphs (1), (2), (5), (6), and (7) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a"/>section 6102(a) of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> such portions or summaries, as the Administrator considers appropriate, of the information described in paragraphs (3) and (4) of such section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> To the greatest extent practicable, the Administrator shall provide for the widespread availability of the information by available computer terminals.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When the Administrator decides the efficiency of the information system under subsection (a) of this section requires it, the Administrator may make contracts with private organizations to obtain computer time-sharing services, including—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> computer telecommunications networks;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> computer software; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6103/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> associated services.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1002">96 Stat. 1002</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub. L. 98–169</span>, §§ 1(2), 3(d), 4, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1113">97 Stat. 1113</span>, 1114.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ad7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104"><span itemtype="num" value="6104">§ 6104.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Catalog of Federal domestic assistance programs</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Administrator shall prepare and publish each year a catalog of domestic assistance programs.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In a form selected by the Administrator, the catalog shall contain—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> all substantive information on domestic assistance programs that, at the time the catalog is prepared, is in the system under paragraphs (1), (2), (5), (6), and (7) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a"/>section 6102(a) of this title; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad84-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> such portions or summaries, as the Administrator considers appropriate, of the information on domestic assistance programs that, at the time the catalog is prepared, is in the system under paragraphs (3) and (4) of <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6102/a"/>section 6102(a) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad85-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> information the Administrator decides may be helpful to a potential applicant for or beneficiary of assistance; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad86-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a detailed index.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad87-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When the Administrator decides it is necessary, the Administrator shall prepare and publish—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad88-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> supplements to the catalog; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> specialized compilations by function of information in the catalog.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ad8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Administrator may distribute a catalog without cost to each—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> member of Congress;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> department, agency, and instrumentality of the United States Government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> State;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> general purpose unit of a local government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Indian tribe recognized by the United States Government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> depository library of Government publications; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ad91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6104/d/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> depository designated by the Administrator.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1002">96 Stat. 1002</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub. L. 98–169</span>, § 1(2), 3(e), 4, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1113">97 Stat. 1113</span>, 1114.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ad96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6105"><span itemtype="num" value="6105">§ 6105.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Oversight responsibility of Director</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Director shall have oversight responsibility for the exercise of all authorities and responsibilities in this chapter not specifically assigned to the Director.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub.
