L. 98–169</span>, § 5, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1115">97 Stat. 1115</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ad9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6106"><span itemtype="num" value="6106">§ 6106.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authorization of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">After <span itemtype="date" date="1983-10-01">October 1, 1983</span>, there may be appropriated to the Administrator such sums as may be necessary to carry out the responsibilities of this chapter.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/169">Pub. L. 98–169</span>, § 5, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-11-29">Nov. 29, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/1115">97 Stat. 1115</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id1031ad9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch62"><span itemtype="num" value="62">CHAPTER 62—</span><span itemtype="heading">CONSOLIDATED FEDERAL FUNDS REPORT</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ada0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6201"><span itemtype="num" value="6201">§ 6201.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>As used in this chapter, the term—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ada1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6201/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “Director” means the Director of the Office of Management and Budget;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ada2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6201/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “State” means any State, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, Guam, American Samoa, the Virgin Islands, the Government of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ada3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6201/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “municipality” means any subcounty unit of general local government that received Federal assistance in the fiscal year that is the subject of the report.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3057">100 Stat. 3057</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031ada8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202"><span itemtype="num" value="6202">§ 6202.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Content, form, and data for report</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031ada9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> For fiscal years 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989, and 1990, not later than 180 days after the end of each fiscal year, the Director shall prepare a Consolidated Federal Funds Report presenting the total amount of Federal funds that were obligated for expenditure or expended in each State, county or parish, congressional district, and municipality of the United States in appropriate general categories of Federal funds during the preceding fiscal year. To the extent practicable, such categories shall be consistently constituted from year to year. The report shall be in the form described in subsection (b) and shall be based on the data referred to in subsection (c).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adaa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director shall include in each report required by subsection (a)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the total amount of Federal funds that were reported obligated for expenditure in each State, county or parish, congressional district, and municipality of the United States in appropriate general categories of Federal funds in the fiscal year preceding the fiscal year in which the report is made; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the total amount of Federal funds that were reported actually expended in each State, county or parish, congressional district, and municipality of the United States in appropriate categories in the fiscal year preceding the fiscal year in which the report is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The report required by subsection (a) shall be based on the data included in—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the Federal assistance awards data system established pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6102a"/>section 6102a of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adaf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the Federal procurement data system established pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t41/s1122/a/4"/>section 1122(a)(4) of title 41;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the appropriate data files of the Office of Personnel Management;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the payroll, pension, and grants files of the Office of the Secretary of Defense;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> the appropriate data files of the United States Postal Service and the Postal Regulatory Commission;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> the data system used by the Bureau of the Census to prepare the annual Federal aid to States report;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> the retirement and disability files of the United States Coast Guard, the Tennessee Valley Authority, the Commissioned Corps of the Public Health Service, the Commissioned Corps of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, and the Foreign Service;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> the insurance claims files of the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Department of Agriculture;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> the grants files of the Legal Services Corporation;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> the excess earned income tax credit file of the Internal Revenue Service;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> the appropriate data files of the National Railroad Passenger Corporation; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adb9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/c/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span></p> the payroll file of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6202/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> For the purposes of subsection (b), the general categories of Federal funds presented in each report required by subsection (a) shall include data with respect to grants, loans, purchases and contracts, cooperative agreements, direct Federal payments to individuals, pay of civilian employees of the Government, military pay, annuities, retirement pay, pensions, and disability compensation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3057">100 Stat. 3057</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(T), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/435/tVI">Pub. L. 109–435, title VI</span>, § 604(f), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-12-20">Dec. 20, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/3242">120 Stat. 3242</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/111/350">Pub. L. 111–350</span>, § 5(h)(9), <span itemtype="date" date="2011-01-04">Jan. 4, 2011</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/124/3849">124 Stat. 3849</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031adbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203"><span itemtype="num" value="6203">§ 6203.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Printing and distribution of reports and machine-readable records</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> prepare—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031adc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> printed copies of each of the reports required by this chapter; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031adc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> machine-readable records of such reports; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> make the printed copies of the reports and the machine-readable records available to the public for purchase at a price fixed under subsection (b).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director shall transmit free of charge one of each of the printed copies of the reports required by this chapter to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> each Federal regional depository library;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Committees on Government Operations, the Budget, and Appropriations of the House of Representatives; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the Committees on Governmental Affairs, the Budget, and Appropriations of the Senate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Director shall also transmit promptly after the end of each calendar year, free of charge, one machine-readable record of the report required by section 6202 to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and to the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adcb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Subject to subsection (b), the Director may, at his discretion, waive all or part of the fee required by subsection (a)(1)(B) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1031adcc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In carrying out subsection (a)(1)(B), the Director shall, based on the estimates made under paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection, fix the price of each printed copy and each machine-readable record of the report so that the aggregate revenues obtained in each fiscal year under subsection (a) will cover as much as is feasible of the incremental costs incurred in making these reports and machine-readable records available for purchase by the public. In computing these costs the Director shall not consider the costs of the activities set forth in sections 6102a and 6205 of this title but shall consider—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adcd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the cost of compiling the reports required by this chapter; preparing the printed copies and machine-readable records under subsection (a); and distributing the printed copies and the machine-readable records of the report for each fiscal year; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031adce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6203/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the number of printed copies and the number of machine-readable records of the report that will be purchased.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3058">100 Stat. 3058</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/186/tII">Pub. L. 104–186, title II</span>, § 219(b)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-08-20">Aug. 20, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1748">110 Stat. 1748</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031add3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6204"><span itemtype="num" value="6204">§ 6204.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Delegation</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">In order to carry out sections 6202 and 6203 of this chapter, the Director may delegate to any authority of the executive branch of the Federal Government the responsibility for carrying out such sections. The Director shall oversee the activities of any authority to which responsibilities are delegated under this section and shall monitor the compliance of each authority with respect to the requirements set forth in section 6205.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3059">100 Stat. 3059</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031add5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6205"><span itemtype="num" value="6205">§ 6205.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of information</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Each head of any authority of the Government having custody of the data files and systems referred to in section 6202(c)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031add6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6205/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall make available to the Director (or other authority to which the Director has delegated the responsibility to carry out such section) the information requested in the form designated; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031add7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6205/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> is authorized to make available to the Director (or such other authority) such administrative services, equipment, personnel, and facilities (and funds appropriated therefor) as the Director or such authority requires to carry out such section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3059">100 Stat. 3059</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031add9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6206"><span itemtype="num" value="6206">§ 6206.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Data consistency and uniformity of data elements</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The Director shall designate a single organizational unit to provide for data consistency and uniform reporting of data elements.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3059">100 Stat. 3059</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031addb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6207"><span itemtype="num" value="6207">§ 6207.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authorization of appropriations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this chapter such sums as may be necessary for each of the fiscal years 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989, and 1990.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/547">Pub. L. 99–547</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-27">Oct. 27, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3060">100 Stat. 3060</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id1031addd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch63"><span itemtype="num" value="63">CHAPTER 63—</span><span itemtype="heading">USING PROCUREMENT CONTRACTS AND GRANT AND COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031addf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301"><span itemtype="num" value="6301">§ 6301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Purposes</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The purposes of this chapter are to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ade0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> promote a better understanding of United States Government expenditures and help eliminate unnecessary administrative requirements on recipients of Government awards by characterizing the relationship between executive agencies and contractors, States, local governments, and other recipients in acquiring property and services and in providing United States Government assistance;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ade1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> prescribe criteria for executive agencies in selecting appropriate legal instruments to achieve—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ade2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> uniformity in their use by executive agencies;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ade3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a clear definition of the relationships they reflect; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1031ade4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a better understanding of the responsibilities of the parties to them; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1031ade5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6301/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> promote increased discipline in selecting and using procurement contracts, grant agreements, and cooperative agreements, maximize competition in making procurement contracts, and encourage competition in making grants and cooperative agreements.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1003">96 Stat. 1003</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1031adea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302"><span itemtype="num" value="6302">§ 6302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341eeb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “executive agency” does not include a mixed-ownership Government corporation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341eec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “grant agreement” and “cooperative agreement” do not include an agreement under which is provided only—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341eed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> direct United States Government cash assistance to an individual;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341eee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a subsidy;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341eef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a loan;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341ef0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a loan guarantee; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341ef1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> insurance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341ef2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “local government” means a unit of government in a State, a local public authority, a special district, an intrastate district, a council of governments, a sponsor group representative organization, an interstate entity, or another instrumentality of a local government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341ef3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> “other recipient” means a person or recipient (except a State or local government) authorized to receive United States Government assistance or procurement contracts and includes a charitable or educational institution.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341ef4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6302/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “State” means a State of the United States, the District of Columbia, a territory or possession of the United States, an agency or instrumentality of a State, and a multi-State, regional, or interstate entity having governmental duties and powers.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1003">96 Stat. 1003</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341ef8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6303"><span itemtype="num" value="6303">§ 6303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Using procurement contracts</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>An executive agency shall use a procurement contract as the legal instrument reflecting a relationship between the United States Government and a State, a local government, or other recipient when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341ef9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6303/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the principal purpose of the instrument is to acquire (by purchase, lease, or barter) property or services for the direct benefit or use of the United States Government; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341efa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6303/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the agency decides in a specific instance that the use of a procurement contract is appropriate.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1004">96 Stat. 1004</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341efe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6304"><span itemtype="num" value="6304">§ 6304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Using grant agreements</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>An executive agency shall use a grant agreement as the legal instrument reflecting a relationship between the United States Government and a State, a local government, or other recipient when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341eff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6304/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the principal purpose of the relationship is to transfer a thing of value to the State or local government or other recipient to carry out a public purpose of support or stimulation authorized by a law of the United States instead of acquiring (by purchase, lease, or barter) property or services for the direct benefit or use of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f00-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6304/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> substantial involvement is not expected between the executive agency and the State, local government, or other recipient when carrying out the activity contemplated in the agreement.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1004">96 Stat. 1004</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f04-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6305"><span itemtype="num" value="6305">§ 6305.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Using cooperative agreements</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>An executive agency shall use a cooperative agreement as the legal instrument reflecting a relationship between the United States Government and a State, a local government, or other recipient when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f05-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6305/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the principal purpose of the relationship is to transfer a thing of value to the State, local government, or other recipient to carry out a public purpose of support or stimulation authorized by a law of the United States instead of acquiring (by purchase, lease, or barter) property or services for the direct benefit or use of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6305/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> substantial involvement is expected between the executive agency and the State, local government, or other recipient when carrying out the activity contemplated in the agreement.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1004">96 Stat. 1004</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6306"><span itemtype="num" value="6306">§ 6306.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority to vest title in tangible personal property for research</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The head of an executive agency may vest title in tangible personal property in a nonprofit institution of higher education or in a nonprofit organization whose primary purpose is conducting scientific research—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f0e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6306/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> when the property is bought with amounts provided under a procurement contract, grant agreement, or cooperative agreement with the institution or organization to conduct basic or applied scientific research;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f0f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6306/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when the head of the agency decides the vesting furthers the objectives of the agency;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f10-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6306/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> without further obligation to the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f11-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6306/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> under conditions the head of the agency considers appropriate.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1004">96 Stat. 1004</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6307"><span itemtype="num" value="6307">§ 6307.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Interpretative guidelines and exemptions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Director of the Office of Management and Budget may—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6307/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> issue supplementary interpretative guidelines to promote consistent and efficient use of procurement contracts, grant agreements, and cooperative agreements; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f17-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6307/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> exempt a transaction or program of an executive agency from this chapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1005">96 Stat. 1005</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f1b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6308"><span itemtype="num" value="6308">§ 6308.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Use of multiple relationships for different parts of jointly financed projects</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">This chapter does not require an executive agency to establish only one relationship between the United States Government and a State, a local government, or other recipient on a jointly financed project involving amounts from more than one program or appropriation when different relationships would otherwise be appropriate for different parts of the project.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1005">96 Stat. 1005</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10341f1f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch65"><span itemtype="num" value="65">CHAPTER 65—</span><span itemtype="heading">INTERGOVERNMENTAL COOPERATION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f23-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501"><span itemtype="num" value="6501">§ 6501.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f24-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “assistance” means the transfer of anything of value for a public purpose of support or stimulation that is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> authorized by a law of the United States;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> provided by the United States Government through grant or contractual arrangements (including technical assistance programs providing assistance by loan, loan guarantee, or insurance); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> not an annual payment by the United States Government to the District of Columbia government under section 502 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/93/198"/>Public Law 93–198, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/87/813"/>87 Stat. 813, D.C. Code, § 47–3406).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “comprehensive planning” includes, to the extent directly related to area needs or needs of a unit of general local government—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> preparation, as a guide for governmental policies and action, of general plans on—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10341f2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the pattern and intensity of land use;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10341f2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> providing public facilities (including transportation facilities) and other governmental services; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10341f2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the effective development and use of human and natural resources;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f2d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> long-range physical and fiscal plans for an action referred to in subparagraph (A);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f2e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a program for capital improvements and other major expenditures based on their relative urgency, and definitive financing plans for the expenditures in the earlier years of the program;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f2f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> coordination of related plans and activities of States and local governments and agencies concerned; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f30-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> preparation of regulatory and administrative measures to support the items referred to in subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), and (D).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “executive agency” does not include a mixed-ownership Government corporation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “grant” (except as provided in subparagraph (C)) means money, or property provided instead of money, that is paid or provided by the United States Government under a fixed annual or total authorization, to a State, to a local government, or to a beneficiary under a plan or program administered by a State or a local government that is subject to approval by an executive agency, if the authorization—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> requires the State or local government to expend non-Government money as a condition of receiving money or property from the United States Government; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> specifies directly, or establishes by means of a formula, the amount that may be provided to the State or local government, or the amount to be allotted for use in each State by the State, local government, and beneficiaries.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> “grant” (except as provided in subparagraph (C)) also means money, or property provided instead of money, that is paid or provided by the United States Government to a private, nonprofit community organization eligible to receive amounts under the Community Services Block Grant Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s9901"/>42 U.S.C. 9901 et seq.).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “grant” does not include—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f38-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> shared revenue;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f39-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> payment of taxes;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f3a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> payment instead of taxes;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> a loan or repayable advance;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f3c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> surplus property or surplus agricultural commodities provided as surplus property;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f3d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> a payment under a research and development procurement contract or grant awarded directly and on similar terms to all qualifying organizations; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10341f3e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/4/C/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> a payment to a State or local government as complete reimbursement for costs incurred in paying benefits or providing services to persons entitled to them under a law of the United States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “head of a State agency” includes the designated delegate of the head of the agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> “local government” means a unit of general local government, a school district, or other special district established under State law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f42-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> “special-purpose unit of local government” means a special district, public-purpose local government of a State except a school district.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f43-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> “State” means a State of the United States, the District of Columbia, a territory or possession of the United States, and an agency, instrumentality, or fiscal agent of a State but does not mean a local government of a State.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f44-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6501/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> “unit of general local government” means a county, city, town, village, or other general purpose political subdivision of a State.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1005">96 Stat. 1005</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(24), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2478">96 Stat. 2478</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/453">Pub. L. 101–453</span>, §§ 3, 5(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-10-24">Oct. 24, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1058">104 Stat. 1058</span>, 1059; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/33/tXI">Pub. L. 105–33, title XI</span>, § 11717(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-08-05">Aug. 5, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/786">111 Stat. 786</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6502"><span itemtype="num" value="6502">§ 6502.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Information on grants received</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">On request of a chief executive officer of a State, a State legislature, or an official designated by either of them, an executive agency carrying out a grant program to States and local governments shall provide the requesting officer or legislature with written information on the purpose and amounts of grants provided to the State or local government.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1007">96 Stat. 1007</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f54-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503"><span itemtype="num" value="6503">§ 6503.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Intergovernmental financing</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f55-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Consistent with program purposes and with regulations of the Secretary, and in accordance with an agreement under subsection (b) entered into by the Secretary and a State—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f56-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the head of an executive agency (other than the Tennessee Valley Authority) carrying out a program shall schedule transfers of funds to the State under the program so as to minimize the time elapsing between transfer of funds from the United States Treasury and the issuance or redemption of checks, warrants, or payments by other means by a State; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f57-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the State shall minimize the time elapsing between transfer of funds from the United States Treasury and the issuance or redemption of checks, warrants, or payments by other means for program purposes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f58-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f59-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary shall enter into an agreement with each State to which transfers of funds are made, which establishes procedures and requirements for implementing this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f5a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An agreement under this subsection shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f5b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> specify procedures chosen by the State for carrying out transfers of funds under the agreement;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> describe the process by which the Federal Government shall review and approve the implementation of the procedures specified under subparagraph (A);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> establish the methods to be used for calculating and documenting payments of interest pursuant to this section; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> specify those types of costs directly incurred by the State for interest calculations required under this section, and require the Secretary to consider those costs in computing payments under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Secretary shall issue regulations establishing procedures and requirements for implementing this section with respect to a State with which no agreement is entered into by the Secretary under paragraph (1). Such regulations shall apply to a State until such time as the Secretary enters into an agreement with the State under paragraph (1).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary shall issue regulations that shall require a State, when not inconsistent with program purposes, to pay interest to the United States on funds from the time funds are deposited by the United States to the State’s account until the time that funds are paid out by the State in order to redeem checks or warrants or make payments by other means for program purposes. Except as provided under paragraph (3)(B) (relating to the Unemployment Trust Fund), the interest payable under this subsection shall be calculated at a rate equal to the average of the bond equivalent rates of 13-week Treasury bills auctioned during the period for which interest is calculated, as determined by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (3), amounts received by the United States as payment of interest under this subsection shall be deposited in the Treasury and credited as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f64-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Amounts paid by a State under paragraph (1) as interest on funds paid to a State from a trust fund for which the Secretary is the trustee shall be credited to such trust fund.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f65-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, amounts of interest paid by a State, on funds drawn from its account in the Unemployment Trust Fund, shall be deposited into that account and shall consist of actual interest earnings by the State, less related banking costs incurred by the State, for the period for which interest is calculated.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f66-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f67-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If a State disburses its own funds for program purposes in accordance with Federal law, Federal regulation, or Federal-State agreement, the State shall be entitled to interest from the time the State’s funds are paid out to redeem checks or warrants, or make payments by other means, until the Federal funds are deposited to the State’s bank account. The Secretary shall pay, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, such amounts as may be necessary for interest owed to a State under this subsection. Such interest shall be calculated, at a rate equal to the average of the bond equivalent rates of 13-week Treasury bills auctioned during the period for which interest is calculated, as determined by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f68-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> If interest is paid under this subsection as a result of a State disbursing its own funds before receiving payment from a trust fund for which the Secretary of the Treasury is the trustee, such interest shall be charged against such trust fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> The budget submitted by the President under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105"/>section 1105 of this title for a fiscal year shall include a statement specifying, for the most recently completed fiscal year, amounts of interest accrued to the Federal Government under subsection (c) and amounts of interest paid to States under subsection (d).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> If a State receives refunds of funds disbursed by the State under a Federal program, the State shall return those refunds to the Federal executive agency administering the program or apply those refunds to reduce the amount of funds owed by the Federal Government to the State under such program. Interest earned on such refunds shall be considered when setting overall interest obligations between the State and the Federal Government as required by this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> If the Federal Government makes a payment to a recipient under a Federal program, and a portion of the payment is an amount which the Federal Government is paying to such recipient on behalf of a State, such amount shall be considered to be a transfer of funds between the Federal Government and the State for purposes of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p> A State may not be required by a law or regulation of the United States to deposit funds received by it in a separate bank account. However, a State shall account for funds made available to the State as United States Government funds in the accounts of the State. The head of the State agency concerned shall make periodic authenticated reports to the head of the appropriate Federal executive agency on the status and the application of the funds, the liabilities and obligations on hand, and other information required by the head of the executive agency. Records related to the funds received by the State shall be made available to the head of the executive agency, the Inspector General of the executive agency, and the Comptroller General for necessary audits.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> The Secretary shall prescribe methods for the payment of interest under this section between the Federal Government and the States, including provisions for offsetting amounts owed by the respective parties. Such methods of payment shall require payment of interest on an annual basis and shall provide for comparable treatment in manner, technique, and timing for both the States and the Federal Government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6503/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> Consistent with Federal program purposes and regulations of the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, the head of a Federal executive agency carrying out a program shall execute grant awards to States on a timely basis to assure the availability of funds to accomplish transfers in compliance with subsection (a) of this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1007">96 Stat. 1007</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/453">Pub. L. 101–453</span>, § 5(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-10-24">Oct. 24, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/1059">104 Stat. 1059</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6504"><span itemtype="num" value="6504">§ 6504.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Use of existing State or multimember agency to administer grant programs</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Notwithstanding a law of the United States providing that one State agency or multimember agency must be established or designated to carry out or supervise the administration of a grant program, the head of the executive agency carrying out the program may, when requested by the executive or legislative authority of the State responsible for the organizational structure of a State government—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6504/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> waive the one State agency or multimember agency provision on an adequate showing that the provision prevents the establishment of the most effective and efficient organizational arrangement within the State government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6504/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> approve another State administrative structure or arrangement after deciding that the objectives of the law authorizing the grant program will not be endangered by using another State structure or arrangement.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1007">96 Stat. 1007</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505"><span itemtype="num" value="6505">§ 6505.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority to provide specialized or technical services</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The President may prescribe statistical and other studies and compilations, development projects, technical tests and evaluations, technical information, training activities, surveys, reports, documents, and other similar services that an executive agency is especially competent and authorized by law to provide. The services prescribed must be consistent with and further the policy of the United States Government of relying on the private enterprise system to provide services reasonably and quickly available through ordinary business channels.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an executive agency may provide services prescribed by the President under this section to a State or local government when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> written request is made by the State or local government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> payment of pay and all other identifiable costs of providing the services is made to the executive agency by the State or local government making the request.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f82-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Payment received by an executive agency for providing services under this section shall be deposited to the credit of the principal appropriation from which the cost of providing the services has been paid or will be charged.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f83-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6505/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The authority under this section is in addition to authority under another law in effect on <p itemtype="date" date="1968-10-16"/>October 16, 1968.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1007">96 Stat. 1007</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10341f89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506"><span itemtype="num" value="6506">§ 6506.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Development assistance</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The economic and social development of the United States and the achievement of satisfactory levels of living depend on the sound and orderly development of urban and rural areas. When urbanization proceeds rapidly, the sound and orderly development of urban communities depends to a large degree on the social and economic health and the sound development of smaller communities and rural areas.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The President shall prescribe regulations governing the formulation, evaluation, and review of United States Government programs and projects having a significant impact on area and community development (including programs and projects providing assistance to States and localities) to serve most effectively the basic objectives of subsection (a) of this section. The regulations shall provide for the consideration of concurrently achieving the following specific objectives and, to the extent authorized by law, reasoned choices shall be made between the objectives when they conflict:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> appropriate land uses for housing, commercial, industrial, governmental, institutional, and other purposes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> wise development and conservation of all natural resources.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> balanced transportation systems, including highway, air, water, pedestrian, mass transit, and other means to move people and goods.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> adequate outdoor recreation and open space.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> protection of areas of unique natural beauty and historic and scientific interest.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> properly planned community facilities (including utilities for supplying power, water, and communications) for safely disposing of wastes, and for other purposes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10341f92-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/b/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> concern for high standards of design.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f93-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> To the extent possible, all national, regional, State, and local viewpoints shall be considered in planning development programs and projects of the United States Government or assisted by the Government. State and local government objectives and the objectives of regional organizations shall be considered within a framework of national public objectives expressed in laws of the United States. Available projections of future conditions in the United States and needs of regions, States, and localities shall be considered in plan formulation, evaluation, and review.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f94-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> To the maximum extent possible and consistent with national objectives, assistance for development purposes shall be consistent with and further the objectives of State, regional, and local comprehensive planning. Consideration shall be given to all developmental aspects of our total national community, including housing, transportation, economic development, natural and human resources development, community facilities, and the general improvement of living environments.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> To the maximum extent practicable, each executive agency carrying out a development assistance program shall consult with and seek advice from all other significantly affected executive agencies in an effort to ensure completely coordinated programs. To the extent possible, systematic planning required by individual United States Government programs (such as highway construction, urban renewal, and open space) shall be coordinated with and, to the extent authorized by law, made part of comprehensive local and areawide development planning.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> When a law of the United States provides that both a special-purpose unit of local government and a unit of general local government are eligible to receive a loan or grant, the head of an executive agency shall make the loan or grant to the unit of general local government instead of the special-purpose unit of local government in the absence of substantial reasons to the contrary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10341f97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6506/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p> The President may designate an executive agency to prescribe regulations to carry out this section.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1008">96 Stat. 1008</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10368f9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507"><span itemtype="num" value="6507">§ 6507.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Congressional review of grant programs</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368f9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The committees of Congress having jurisdiction over a grant program authorized by a law of the United States without a specified expiration date for the program shall study the program. The committees may conduct studies separately or jointly and shall report the results of their findings to their respective Houses of Congress not later than the end of each period specified in subsection (b) of this section. The committees shall give special attention to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368f9e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the extent to which the purposes of the grants have been met;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368f9f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the extent to which the objective of the program can be carried on without further assistance;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fa0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> whether a change in the purpose, direction, or administration of the original program, or in procedures and requirements applicable to the program, should be made; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fa1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> the extent to which the program is adequate to meet the growing and changing needs that it was designed to support.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fa2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fa3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A study under subsection (a) of this section of a grant program authorized by a law of the United States enacted before <p itemtype="date" date="1968-10-16"/>October 16, 1968, shall be conducted before the end of each 4th calendar year after the year during which a study of the program was last conducted under this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fa4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6507/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A study under subsection (a) of this section of a grant program authorized by a law of the United States enacted after <p itemtype="date" date="1968-10-16"/>October 16, 1968, shall be conducted before the end of the 4th calendar year after the year of enactment of the law and before the end of each 4th calendar year thereafter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1009">96 Stat. 1009</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10368fa8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508"><span itemtype="num" value="6508">§ 6508.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Studies and reports</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fa9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368faa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When requested by a committee of Congress having jurisdiction over a grant program, the Comptroller General shall study the program. The study shall include a review of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the extent to which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the program conflicts with or duplicates other grant programs; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> more effective, efficient, economical, and uniform administration of the program may be achieved by changing the requirements and procedures applicable to it; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> budgetary, accounting, reporting, and administrative procedures of the program.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368faf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall submit to Congress a report on a study made under this subsection and any recommendations. To the extent practicable, a report on an expiring program shall be submitted in the year before the year in which a program ends.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fb0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fb1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When requested by a committee of Congress having jurisdiction over a grant program, the Advisory Commission on Intergovernmental Relations shall study the intergovernmental relations aspects of the program, including—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fb2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the impact of the program on the structural organization of States and local governments and on Federal-State-local fiscal relations; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fb3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the coordination of administration of the program by the United States Government and State and local governments.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fb4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6508/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Commission shall submit to the committee requesting the study and to Congress a report and any recommendations.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1010">96 Stat. 1010</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id10368fb8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch67"><span itemtype="num" value="67">CHAPTER 67—</span><span itemtype="heading">FEDERAL PAYMENTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10368fbc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701"><span itemtype="num" value="6701">§ 6701.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payments to local governments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fbd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payment and Use.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fbe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Payment</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall pay to each unit of general local government which qualifies for a payment under this chapter an amount equal to the sum of any amounts allocated to the government under this chapter for each payment period.
