The Secretary shall pay such amount out of the Local Government Fiscal Assistance Fund under section 6702.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fbf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Amounts paid to a unit of general local government under this section shall be used by that unit for carrying out one or more programs of the unit related to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fc0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> education to prevent crime;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fc1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> substance abuse treatment to prevent crime; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fc2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> job programs to prevent crime.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fc3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Coordination</span>.—</span></p>Programs funded under this title shall be coordinated with other existing Federal programs to meet the overall needs of communities that benefit from funds received under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fc4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Timing of Payments</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall pay each amount allocated under this chapter to a unit of general local government for a payment period by the later of 90 days after the date the amount is available or the first day of the payment period provided that the unit of general local government has provided the Secretary with the assurances required by section 6703(d).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fc5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Adjustments.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fc6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary shall adjust a payment under this chapter to a unit of general local government to the extent that a prior payment to the government was more or less than the amount required to be paid.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fc7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Considerations</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may increase or decrease under this subsection a payment to a unit of local government only if the Secretary determines the need for the increase or decrease, or the unit requests the increase or decrease, within one year after the end of the payment period for which the payment was made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fc8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reservation for Adjustments</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may reserve a percentage of not more than 2 percent of the amount under this section for a payment period for all units of general local government in a State if the Secretary considers the reserve is necessary to ensure the availability of sufficient amounts to pay adjustments after the final allocation of amounts among the units of general local government in the State.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fc9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Repayment of Unexpended Amounts.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Repayment required</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A unit of general local government shall repay to the Secretary, by not later than 15 months after receipt from the Secretary, any amount that is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fcb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> paid to the unit from amounts appropriated under the authority of this section; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fcc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> not expended by the unit within one year after receipt from the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fcd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Penalty for failure to repay</span>.—</span></p>If the amount required to be repaid is not repaid, the Secretary shall reduce payments in future payment periods accordingly.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Deposit of amounts repaid</span>.—</span></p>Amounts received by the Secretary as repayments under this subsection shall be deposited in the Local Government Fiscal Assistance Fund for future payments to units of general local government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fcf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Expenditure With Disadvantaged Business Enterprises.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fd0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General rule</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Of amounts paid to a unit of general local government under this chapter for a payment period, not less than 10 percent of the total combined amounts obligated by the unit for contracts and subcontracts shall be expended with—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fd1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> small business concerns controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals and women;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fd2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> historically Black colleges and universities and colleges and universities having a student body in which more than 20 percent of the students are Hispanic Americans or Native Americans; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fd3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> qualified HUBZone small business concerns.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fd4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exception</span>.—</span></p>Paragraph (1) shall not apply to amounts paid to a unit of general local government to the extent the unit determines that the paragraph does not apply through a process that provides for public participation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fd5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fd6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the term “small business concern” has the meaning such term has under section 3 of the Small Business Act;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fd7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the term “socially and economically disadvantaged individuals” has the meaning such term has under section 8(d) of the Small Business Act and relevant subcontracting regulations promulgated pursuant to that section; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10368fd8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/f/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the term “qualified HUBZone small business concern” has the meaning given that term in section 3(p) of the Small Business Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t15/s632"/>15 U.S.C. 632(<p itemtype="i"/>o) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002091"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002091"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p>).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fd9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Nonsupplanting Requirement.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fda-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>Funds made available under this chapter to units of local government shall not be used to supplant State or local funds, but will be used to increase the amount of funds that would, in the absence of funds under this chapter, be made available from State or local sources.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fdb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6701/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Base level amount</span>.—</span></p>The total level of funding available to a unit of local government for accounts serving eligible purposes under this chapter in the fiscal year immediately preceding receipt of a grant under this chapter shall be designated the “base level account” for the fiscal year in which a grant is received. Grants under this chapter in a given fiscal year shall be reduced on a dollar for dollar basis to the extent that a unit of local government reduces its base level account in that fiscal year.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1859">108 Stat. 1859</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/135/tVI">Pub. L. 105–135, title VI</span>, § 604(e)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-12-02">Dec. 2, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/2633">111 Stat. 2633</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10368fe3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702"><span itemtype="num" value="6702">§ 6702.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Local Government Fiscal Assistance Fund</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fe4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Administration of Fund</span>.—</span></p>The Department of the Treasury has a Local Government Fiscal Assistance Fund, which consists of amounts appropriated to the Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368fe5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authorization of Appropriations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Fund—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fe6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> $270,000,000 for fiscal year 1996;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fe7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> $283,500,000 for fiscal year 1997;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fe8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> $355,500,000 for fiscal year 1998;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fe9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> $355,500,000 for fiscal year 1999; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> $355,500,000 for fiscal year 2000.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>Such sums are to remain available until expended.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368feb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6702/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Administrative Costs</span>.—</span></p>Up to 2.5 percent of the amount authorized to be appropriated under subsection (b) is authorized to be appropriated for the period fiscal year 1995 through fiscal year 2000 to be available for administrative costs by the Secretary in furtherance of the purposes of the program. Such sums are to remain available until expended.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1861">108 Stat. 1861</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10368ff0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703"><span itemtype="num" value="6703">§ 6703.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Qualification for payment</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10368ff1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall issue regulations establishing procedures under which eligible units of general local government are required to provide notice to the Secretary of the units’ proposed use of assistance under this chapter. Subject to subsection (c), the assistance provided shall be used, in amounts determined by the unit, for activities under, or for activities that are substantially similar to an activity under, 1 or more of the following programs and the notice shall identify 1 or more of the following programs for each such use:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Drug Abuse Resistance Education Program under section 5122 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The National Youth Sports Program under section 682 of the Community Services Block Grant Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/35"/>Public Law 97–35) as amended by section 205, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/252"/>Public Law 103–252.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Gang Resistance Education and Training Program under the Act entitled “An Act making appropriations for the Treasury Department, the United States Postal Service, the Executive Office of the President, and certain Independent Agencies, for the fiscal year ending <p itemtype="date" date="1991-09-30"/>September 30, 1991, and for other purposes”, approved <p itemtype="date" date="1990-11-05"/>November 5, 1990 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/509"/>Public Law 101–509).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> Programs under title I of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Programs under subtitle C of title I of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s12571"/>42 U.S.C. 12571 et seq.), as amended.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> Programs under the School to Work Opportunities Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/239"/>Public Law 103–239).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> Substance Abuse Treatment and Prevention programs authorized under title V or XIX of the Public Health Services Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t43/s201"/>43 U.S.C. 201 et seq.).<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002092"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002092"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ff9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> Programs under the Head Start Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s9831"/>42 U.S.C. 9831 et seq.).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ffa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> Programs under part A or B of chapter 1 of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ffb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p> The TRIO programs under part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t20/s1070"/>20 U.S.C. 1070 et seq.).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ffc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> Programs under the National Literacy Act of 1991.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ffd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span></p> Programs under the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t20/s2301"/>20 U.S.C. 2301 et seq.).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368ffe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/13"><span itemtype="num" value="13">(13)</span></p> The demonstration partnership programs including the community initiative targeted to minority youth under section 203 <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of the Human Services Reauthorization Act of 1994 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/252"/>Public Law 103–252).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10368fff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/14"><span itemtype="num" value="14">(14)</span></p> The runaway and homeless youth program and the transitional living program for homeless youth under title III of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/586"/>Public Law 102–586).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369000-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/15"><span itemtype="num" value="15">(15)</span></p> After-school activities for school aged children under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t42/s9858"/>42 U.S.C. 9858 <p itemtype="sup"/>1 et seq.).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369001-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/16"><span itemtype="num" value="16">(16)</span></p> The community-based family resource programs under section 401 <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of the Human Services Reauthorization Act of 1994 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/252"/>Public Law 103–252).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369002-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/17"><span itemtype="num" value="17">(17)</span></p> The family violence programs under the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act Amendments of 1984.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369003-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/a/18"><span itemtype="num" value="18">(18)</span></p> Job training programs administered by the Department of Agriculture, the Department of Defense, or the Department of Housing and Urban Development.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369004-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice to Agency</span>.—</span></p>Upon receipt of notice under subsection (a) from an eligible unit of general local government, the Secretary shall notify the head of the appropriate Federal agency for each program listed in subsection (a) that is identified in the notice as a program under which an activity will be conducted with assistance under this chapter. The notification shall state that the unit has elected to use some or all of its assistance under this chapter for activities under that program. The head of a Federal agency that receives such a notification shall ensure that such use is in compliance with the laws and regulations applicable to that program, except that any requirement to provide matching funds shall not apply to that use.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369005-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Alternative Uses of Funds.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369006-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Alternative uses authorized</span>.—</span></p>In lieu of, or in addition to, use for an activity described in subsection (a) and notice for that use under subsection (a), an eligible unit of general local government may use assistance under this chapter, and shall provide notice of that use to the Secretary under subsection (a), for any other activity that is consistent with 1 or more of the purposes described in section 6701(a)(2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369007-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice deemed to describe consistent use</span>.—</span></p>Notice by a unit of general local government that it intends to use assistance under this chapter for an activity other than an activity described in subsection (a) is deemed to describe an activity that is consistent with 1 or more of the purposes described in section 6701(a)(2) unless the Secretary provides to the unit, within 30 days after receipt of that notice of intent from the unit, written notice (including an explanation) that the use is not consistent with those purposes.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369008-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General Requirements for Qualification</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A unit of general local government qualifies for a payment under this chapter for a payment period only after establishing to the satisfaction of the Secretary that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369009-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the government will establish a trust fund in which the government will deposit all payments received under this chapter;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036900a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the government will use amounts in the trust fund (including interest) during a reasonable period;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036900b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the government will expend the payments so received, in accordance with the laws and procedures that are applicable to the expenditure of revenues of the government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036900c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> if at least 25 percent of the pay of individuals employed by the government in a public employee occupation is paid out of the trust fund, individuals in the occupation any part of whose pay is paid out of the trust fund will receive pay at least equal to the prevailing rate of pay for individuals employed in similar public employee occupations by the government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036900d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> all laborers and mechanics employed by contractors or subcontractors in the performance of any contract and subcontract for the repair, renovation, alteration, or construction, including painting and decorating, of any building or work that is financed in whole or in part by a grant under this title, shall be paid wages not less than those determined by the Secretary of Labor in accordance with sections 3141–3144, 3146, and 3147 of title 40. The Secretary of Labor shall have the authority and functions set forth in Reorganization Plan No. 14 of 1950 (15 FR 3176; <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/64/1267"/>64 Stat. 1267) and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s3145"/>section 3145 of title 40;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036900e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> the government will use accounting, audit, and fiscal procedures that conform to guidelines which shall be prescribed by the Secretary. As applicable, amounts received under this chapter shall be audited in compliance with the Single Audit Act of 1984;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036900f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> after reasonable notice to the government, the government will make available to the Secretary and the Comptroller General of the United States, with the right to inspect, records the Secretary reasonably requires to review compliance with this chapter or the Comptroller General of the United States reasonably requires to review compliance and operations under section 6718(b);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369010-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p> the government will make reports the Secretary reasonably requires, in addition to the annual reports required under section 6719(b); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369011-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/d/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> the government will spend the funds only for the purposes set forth in section 6701(a)(2).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369012-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Review by Governors</span>.—</span></p>A unit of general local government shall give the chief executive officer of the State in which the government is located an opportunity for review and comment before establishing compliance with subsection (d).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369013-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Sanctions for Noncompliance.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369014-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the Secretary decides that a unit of general local government has not complied substantially with subsection (d) or regulations prescribed under subsection (d), the Secretary shall notify the government. The notice shall state that if the government does not take corrective action by the 60th day after the date the government receives the notice, the Secretary will withhold additional payments to the government for the current payment period and later payment periods until the Secretary is satisfied that the government—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369015-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> has taken the appropriate corrective action; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369016-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> will comply with subsection (d) and regulations prescribed under subsection (d).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369017-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice</span>.—</span></p>Before giving notice under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall give the chief executive officer of the unit of general local government reasonable notice and an opportunity for comment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369018-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Payment conditions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary may make a payment to a unit of general local government notified under paragraph (1) only if the Secretary is satisfied that the government—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369019-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> has taken the appropriate corrective action; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036901a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6703/f/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> will comply with subsection (d) and regulations prescribed under subsection (d).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1861">108 Stat. 1861</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(j), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3835">110 Stat. 3835</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/277/dA">Pub. L. 105–277, div. A</span>, § 101(f) [title VIII, § 405(c)(3), (d)(27), (f)(19)], <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-21">Oct. 21, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2681-337">112 Stat. 2681–337</span>, 2681–417, 2681–424, 2681–432; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(8), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1300">116 Stat. 1300</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/270">Pub. L. 109–270</span>, § 2(i), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-08-12">Aug. 12, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/748">120 Stat. 748</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/128/tV">Pub. L. 113–128, title V</span>, § 512(ff), <span itemtype="date" date="2014-07-22">July 22, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/1719">128 Stat. 1719</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10369022-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704"><span itemtype="num" value="6704">§ 6704.</span><span itemtype="heading"> State area allocations; allocations and payments to territorial governments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369023-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Formula Allocation by State</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For each payment period, the Secretary shall allocate to each State out of the amount appropriated for the period under the authority of section 6702(b) (minus the amounts allocated to territorial governments under subsection (e) for the payment period) an amount bearing the same ratio to the amount appropriated (minus such amounts allocated under subsection (e)) as the amount allocated to the State under this section bears to the total amount allocated to all States under this section. The Secretary shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369024-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> determine the amount allocated to the State under subsection (b) or (c) of this section and allocate the larger amount to the State; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369025-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> allocate the amount allocated to the State to units of general local government in the State under sections 6705 and 6706.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369026-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> General Formula.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369027-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For the payment period beginning <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01">October 1, 1994</span>, the amount allocated to a State under this subsection for a payment period is the amount bearing the same ratio to $5,300,000,000 as—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369028-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the population of the State, multiplied by the general tax effort factor of the State (determined under paragraph (2)), multiplied by the relative income factor of the State (determined under paragraph (3)), multiplied by the relative rate of the labor force unemployed in the State (determined under paragraph (4)); bears to<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369029-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the sum of the products determined under subparagraph (A) of this paragraph for all States.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036902a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General tax effort factor</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The general tax effort factor of a State for a payment period is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036902b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the net amount of State and local taxes of the State collected during the year 1991 as reported by the Bureau of the Census in the publication Government Finances 1990–1991; divided by<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036902c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the total income of individuals, as determined by the Secretary of Commerce for national accounts purposes for 1992 as reported in the publication Survey of Current Business (August 1993), attributed to the State for the same year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036902d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Relative income factor</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The relative income factor of a State is a fraction in which—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036902e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the numerator is the per capita income of the United States; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036902f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the denominator is the per capita income of the State.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369030-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Relative rate of labor force</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The relative rate of the labor force unemployed in a State is a fraction in which—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369031-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the numerator is the percentage of the labor force of the State that is unemployed in the calendar year preceding the payment period (as determined by the Secretary of Labor for general statistical purposes); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369032-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the denominator is the percentage of the labor force of the United States that is unemployed in the calendar year preceding the payment period (as determined by the Secretary of Labor for general statistical purposes).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369033-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Alternative Formula</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For the payment period beginning <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01">October 1, 1994</span>, the amount allocated to a State under this subsection for a payment period is the total amount the State would receive if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369034-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> $1,166,666,667 were allocated among the States on the basis of population by allocating to each State an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under this paragraph as the population of the State bears to the population of all States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369035-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> $1,166,666,667 were allocated among the States on the basis of population inversely weighted for per capita income, by allocating to each State an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under this paragraph as—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369036-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the population of the State, multiplied by a fraction in which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10369037-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the numerator is the per capita income of all States; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id10369038-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the denominator is the per capita income of the State; bears to<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369039-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the sum of the products determined under subparagraph (A) for all States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036903a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> $600,000,000 were allocated among the States on the basis of income tax collections by allocating to each State an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under this paragraph as the income tax amount of the State (determined under subsection (d)(1)) bears to the sum of the income tax amounts of all States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036903b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> $600,000,000 were allocated among the States on the basis of general tax effort by allocating to each State an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under this paragraph as the general tax effort amount of the State (determined under subsection (d)(2)) bears to the sum of the general tax effort amounts of all States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036903c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> $600,000,000 were allocated among the States on the basis of unemployment by allocating to each State an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under this paragraph as—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036903d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the labor force of the State, multiplied by a fraction in which—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1036903e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/5/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the numerator is the percentage of the labor force of the State that is unemployed in the calendar year preceding the payment period (as determined by the Secretary of Labor for general statistical purposes); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1036903f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/5/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the denominator is the percentage of the labor force of the United States that is unemployed in the calendar year preceding the payment period (as determined by the Secretary of Labor for general statistical purposes)<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I32" class="indent2 firstIndent0"/>bears to<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369040-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the sum of the products determined under subparagraph (A) for all States; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369041-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/c/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> $1,166,666,667 were allocated among the States on the basis of urbanized population by allocating to each State an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under this paragraph as the urbanized population of the State bears to the urbanized population of all States. In this paragraph, the term “urbanized population” means the population of an area consisting of a central city or cities of at least 50,000 inhabitants and the surrounding closely settled area for the city or cities considered as an urbanized area as published by the Bureau of the Census for 1990 in the publication General Population Characteristics for Urbanized Areas.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369042-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Income Tax Amount and Tax Effort Amount.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369043-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Income tax amount</span>.—</span></p>The income tax amount of a State for a payment period is 15 percent of the net amount collected during the calendar year ending before the beginning of the payment period from the tax imposed on the income of individuals by the State and described as a State income tax under section 164(a)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s164/a/3"/>26 U.S.C. 164(a)(3)). The income tax amount for a payment period shall be at least 1 percent but not more than 6 percent of the United States Government individual income tax liability attributed to the State for the taxable year ending during the last calendar year ending before the beginning of the payment period. The Secretary shall determine the Government income tax liability attributed to the State by using the data published by the Secretary for 1991 in the publication Statistics of Income Bulletin (Winter 1993–1994).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369044-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General tax effort amount</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The general tax effort amount of a State for a payment period is the amount determined by multiplying—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369045-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the net amount of State and local taxes of the State collected during the year 1991 as reported in the Bureau of <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002093"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002093"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> Census in the publication Government Finances 1990–1991; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10369046-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the general tax effort factor of the State determined under subsection (b)(2).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369047-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Allocation for Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, and the Virgin Islands.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369048-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10369049-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> For each payment period for which funds are available for allocation under this chapter, the Secretary shall allocate to each territorial government an amount equal to the product of 1 percent of the amount of funds available for allocation multiplied by the applicable territorial percentage.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036904a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> For the purposes of this paragraph, the applicable territorial percentage of a territory is equal to the quotient resulting from the division of the territorial population of such territory by the sum of the territorial population for all territories.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036904b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Payments to local governments</span>.—</span></p>The governments of the territories shall make payments to local governments within their jurisdiction from sums received under this subsection as they consider appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1036904c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this subsection—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036904d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the term “territorial government” means the government of a territory;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036904e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the term “territory” means Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, and the Virgin Islands; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1036904f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6704/e/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the term “territorial population” means the most recent population for each territory as determined by the Bureau of <p itemtype="sup"/>1 Census.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1864">108 Stat. 1864</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10369053-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705"><span itemtype="num" value="6705">§ 6705.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Local government allocations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10369054-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Indian Tribes and Alaskan Natives Villages</span>.—</span></p>If there is in a State an Indian tribe or Alaskan native <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002094"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002094"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> village having a recognized governing body carrying out substantial governmental duties and powers, the Secretary shall allocate to the tribe or village, out of the amount allocated to the State under section 6704, an amount bearing the same ratio to the amount allocated to the State as the population of the tribe or village bears to the population of the State. The Secretary shall allocate amounts under this subsection to Indian tribes and Alaskan native <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002094"/>1 villages in a State before allocating amounts to units of general local government in the State under subsection (c). For the payment period beginning <p itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01"/>October 1, 1994, the Secretary shall use as the population of each Indian tribe or Alaskan native <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002094"/>1 village the population for 1991 as reported by the Bureau of Indian Affairs in the publication Indian Service Population and Labor Force Estimates (January 1991). In addition to uses authorized under section 6701(a)(2), amounts allocated under this subsection and paid to an Indian tribe or Alaskan native <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002094"/>1 village under this chapter may be used for renovating or building prisons or other correctional facilities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d945-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Newly Incorporated Local Governments and Annexed Governments</span>.—</span></p>If there is in a State a unit of general local government that has been incorporated since the date of the collection of the data used by the Secretary in making allocations pursuant to sections 6704 through 6706 and 6708, the Secretary shall allocate to this newly incorporated local government, out of the amount allocated to the State under section 6704, an amount bearing the same ratio to the amount allocated to the State as the population of the newly incorporated local government bears to the population of the State. If there is in the State a unit of general local government that has been annexed since the date of the collection of the data used by the Secretary in making allocations pursuant to sections 6704 through 6706 and 6708, the Secretary shall pay the amount that would have been allocated to this local government to the unit of general local government that annexed it.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d946-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Other Local Government Allocations.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d947-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall allocate among the units of general local government in a State (other than units receiving allocations under subsection (a)) the amount allocated to the State under section 6704 (as that amount is reduced by allocations under subsection (a)). Of the amount to be allocated, the Secretary shall allocate a portion equal to ½ of such amount in accordance with section 6706(1), and shall allocate a portion equal to ½ of such amount in accordance with section 6706(2). A unit of general local government shall receive an amount equal to the sum of amounts allocated to the unit from each portion.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d948-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Ratio</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>From each portion to be allocated to units of local government in a State under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall allocate to a unit an amount bearing the same ratio to the funds to be allocated as—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d949-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the population of the unit, multiplied by the general tax effort factor of the unit (determined under paragraph (3)), multiplied by the income gap of the unit (determined under paragraph (4)), bears to<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d94a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the sum of the products determined under subparagraph (A) for all units in the State for which the income gap for that portion under paragraph (4) is greater than zero.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d94b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General tax effort factor</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d94c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subparagraph (C), the general tax effort factor of a unit of general local government for a payment period is—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d94d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the adjusted taxes of the unit; divided by<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d94e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the total income attributed to the unit.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d94f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> If the amount determined under subparagraphs (A)(i) and (ii) for a unit of general local government is less than zero, the general tax effort factor of the unit is deemed to be zero.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d950-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p><p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d951-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as otherwise provided in this subparagraph, for the payment period beginning <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01">October 1, 1994</span>, the adjusted taxes of a unit of general local government are the taxes imposed by the unit for public purposes (except employee and employer assessments and contributions to finance retirement and social insurance systems and other special assessments for capital outlay), as determined by the Bureau of the Census for the 1987 Census of Governments and adjusted as follows:<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d952-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> Adjusted taxes equals total taxes times a fraction in which the numerator is the sum of unrestricted revenues and revenues dedicated for spending on education minus total education spending and the denominator is total unrestricted revenues.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d953-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> Total taxes is the sum of property tax; general sales tax; alcoholic beverage tax; amusement tax; insurance premium tax; motor fuels tax; parimutuels tax; public utilities tax; tobacco tax; other selective sales tax; alcoholic beverage licenses, amusement licenses; corporation licenses, hunting and fishing licenses; motor vehicle licenses; motor vehicle operator licenses; public utility licenses; occupation and business licenses, not elsewhere classified; other licenses, individual income tax; corporation net income tax; death and gift tax; documentary and stock transfer tax; severance tax; and taxes not elsewhere classified.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d954-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> Unrestricted revenues is the sum of total taxes and intergovernmental revenue from Federal Government, general revenue sharing; intergovernmental revenue from Federal Government, other general support; intergovernmental revenue from Federal Government, other; intergovernmental revenue from State government, other general support; intergovernmental revenue from State government, other; intergovernmental revenue from local governments, other general support; intergovernmental revenue from local governments, other; miscellaneous general revenue, property sale-housing and community development; miscellaneous general revenue, property sale-other property; miscellaneous general revenue, interest earnings on investments; miscellaneous general revenue, fines and forfeits; miscellaneous general revenue, rents; miscellaneous general revenues, royalties; miscellaneous general revenue, donations from private sources; miscellaneous general revenue, net lottery revenue (after prizes and administrative expenses); miscellaneous general revenue, other miscellaneous general revenue; and all other general charges, not elsewhere classified.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d955-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/IV"><span itemtype="num" value="IV">(IV)</span></p> Revenues dedicated for spending on education is the sum of elementary and secondary education, school lunch; elementary and secondary education, tuition; elementary and secondary education, other; higher education, auxiliary enterprises; higher education, other; other education, not elsewhere classified; intergovernmental revenue from Federal Government, education; intergovernmental revenue from State government, education; intergovernmental revenue from local governments, interschool system revenue; intergovernmental revenue from local governments, education; interest earnings, higher education; interest earnings, elementary and secondary education; miscellaneous revenues, higher education; and miscellaneous revenues, elementary and secondary education.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d956-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/V"><span itemtype="num" value="V">(V)</span></p> Total education spending is the sum of elementary and secondary education, current operations; elementary and secondary education, construction; elementary and secondary education, other capital outlays; elementary and secondary education, to State governments; elementary and secondary education, to local governments, not elsewhere classified; elementary and secondary education, to counties; elementary and secondary education, to municipalities; elementary and secondary education, to townships; elementary and secondary education, to school districts; elementary and secondary education, to special districts; higher education-auxiliary enterprises, current operations; higher education-auxiliary enterprises, construction; higher education, auxiliary enterprises, other capital outlays; other higher education, current operations; other higher education, construction; other higher education, other capital outlays; other higher education, to State government; other higher education, to local governments, not elsewhere classified; other higher education, to counties; other higher education, to municipalities; other higher education, to townships; other higher education, to school districts; other higher education, to special districts; education assistance and subsidies; education, not elsewhere classified, current operations; education, not elsewhere classified, construction <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002095"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002095"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> education, not elsewhere classified, other capital outlays; education, not elsewhere classified, to State government; education, not elsewhere classified, to local governments, not elsewhere classified; education, not elsewhere classified, to counties; education, not elsewhere classified, to municipalities; education, not elsewhere classified, to townships; education, not elsewhere classified, to school districts; education, not elsewhere classified, to special districts; and education, not elsewhere classified, to Federal Government.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d957-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/VI"><span itemtype="num" value="VI">(VI)</span></p> If the amount of adjusted taxes is less than zero, the amount of adjusted tax shall be deemed to be zero.<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d958-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/i/VII"><span itemtype="num" value="VII">(VII)</span></p> If the amount of adjusted taxes exceeds the amount of total taxes, the amount of adjusted taxes is deemed to equal the amount of total taxes.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d959-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary shall, for purposes of clause (i), include that part of sales taxes transferred to a unit of general local government that are imposed by a county government in the geographic area of which is located the unit of general local government as taxes imposed by the unit for public purposes if—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d95a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/ii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the county government transfers any part of the revenue from the taxes to the unit of general local government without specifying the purpose for which the unit of general local government may expend the revenue; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d95b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/ii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the chief executive officer of the State notifies the Secretary that the taxes satisfy the requirements of this clause.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d95c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> The adjusted taxes of a unit of general local government shall not exceed the maximum allowable adjusted taxes for that unit.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d95d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> The maximum allowable adjusted taxes for a unit of general local government is the allowable adjusted taxes of the unit minus the excess adjusted taxes of the unit.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d95e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The allowable adjusted taxes of a unit of general government is the greater of—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d95f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/v/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the amount equal to 2.5, multiplied by the per capita adjusted taxes of all units of general local government of the same type in the State, multiplied by the population of the unit; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d960-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/v/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the amount equal to the population of the unit, multiplied by the sum of the adjusted taxes of all units of municipal local government in the State, divided by the sum of the populations of all the units of municipal local government in the State.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d961-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The excess adjusted taxes of a unit of general local government is the amount equal to—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d962-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/vi/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the adjusted taxes of the unit, minus<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d963-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/vi/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> 1.5 multiplied by the allowable adjusted taxes of the unit;<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I17" class="indent1 firstIndent0"/>except that if this amount is less than zero then the excess adjusted taxes of the unit is deemed to be zero.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d964-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this subparagraph—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d965-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/vii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the term “per capita adjusted taxes of all units of general local government of the same type” means the sum of the adjusted taxes of all units of general local government of the same type divided by the sum of the populations of all units of general local government of the same type; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d966-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/3/C/vii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the term “units of general local government of the same type” means all townships if the unit of general local government is a township, all municipalities if the unit of general local government is a municipality, all counties if the unit of general local government is a county, or all unified city/county governments if the unit of general local government is a unified city/county government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d967-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Income gap</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d968-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the income gap of a unit of general local government is—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d969-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/4/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the number which applies under section 6706, multiplied by the per capita income of the State in which the unit is located; minus<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d96a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/4/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the per capita income of the geographic area of the unit.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d96b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/c/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> If the amount determined under subparagraph (A) for a unit of general local government is less than zero, then the relative income factor of the unit is deemed to be zero.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d96c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6705/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Small Government Allocations</span>.—</span></p>If the Secretary decides that information available for a unit of general local government with a population below a number (of not more than 500) prescribed by the Secretary is inadequate, the Secretary may allocate to the unit, in lieu of any allocation under subsection (b) for a payment period, an amount bearing the same ratio to the total amount to be allocated under subsection (b) for the period for all units of general local government in the State as the population of the unit bears to the population of all units in the State.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1867">108 Stat. 1867</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d970-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6706"><span itemtype="num" value="6706">§ 6706.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Income gap multiplier</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>For purposes of determining the income gap of a unit of general local government under section 6705(b)(4)(A),<span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002096">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002096"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> the number which applies is—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d971-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6706/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> 1.6, with respect to ½ of any amount allocated under section 6704 to the State in which the unit is located; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d972-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6706/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> 1.2, with respect to the remainder of such amount.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 301001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1871">108 stat. 1871</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d976-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6707"><span itemtype="num" value="6707">§ 6707.</span><span itemtype="heading"> State variation of local government allocations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d977-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6707/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">State Formula</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A State government may provide by law for the allocation of amounts among units of general local government in the State on the basis of population multiplied by the general tax effort factors or income gaps of the units of general local government determined under sections 6705(a) and (b) <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002097">1</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002097"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> or a combination of those factors. A State government providing for a variation of an allocation formula provided under sections 6705(a) and (b) <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002097">1</span> shall notify the Secretary of the variation by the 30th day before the beginning of the first payment period in which the variation applies.
