A variation shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d978-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6707/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> provide for allocating the total amount allocated under sections 6705(a) and (b); <p itemtype="sup"/>1 and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d979-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6707/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> apply uniformly in the State.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d97a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6707/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Certification</span>.—</span></p>A variation by a State government under this section may apply only if the Secretary certifies that the variation complies with this section. The Secretary may certify a variation only if the Secretary is notified of the variation at least 30 days before the first payment period in which the variation applies.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1872">108 Stat. 1872</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d97e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708"><span itemtype="num" value="6708">§ 6708.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Adjustments of local government allocations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d97f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Maximum Amount</span>.—</span></p>The amount allocated to a unit of general local government for a payment period may not exceed the adjusted taxes imposed by the unit of general local government as determined under section 6705(b)(3).<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002098"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002098"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> Amounts in excess of adjusted taxes shall be paid to the Governor of the State in which the unit of local government is located.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d980-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">De Minimis Allocations to Units of General Local Government</span>.—</span></p>If the amount allocated to a unit of general local government (except an Indian tribe or an Alaskan native <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002099"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002099"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> village) for a payment period would be less than $5,000 but for this subsection or is waived by the governing authority of the unit of general local government, the Secretary shall pay the amount to the Governor of the State in which the unit is located.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d981-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of Payments to States</span>.—</span></p>The Governor of a State shall use all amounts paid to the Governor under subsections (a) and (b) for programs described in section 6701(a)(2) in areas of the State where are located the units of general local government with respect to which amounts are paid under subsection (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d982-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> De Minimis Allocations to Indian Tribes and Alaskan Native Villages.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d983-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Aggregation of de minimis allocations</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the amount allocated to an Indian tribe or an Alaskan native <p itemtype="sup"/>2 village for a payment period would be less than $5,000 but for this subsection or is waived by the chief elected official of the tribe or village, the amount—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d984-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> shall not be paid to the tribe or village (except under paragraph (2)); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d985-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> shall be aggregated with other such amounts and available for use by the Attorney General under paragraph (2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d986-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Use of aggregated amounts</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Amounts aggregated under paragraph (1) for a payment period shall be available for use by the Attorney General to make grants in the payment period on a competitive basis to Indian Tribes <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002100">3</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002100"><span itemtype="num">3</span></p> and Alaskan native <p itemtype="sup"/>2 village <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002101">4</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002101"><span itemtype="num">4</span></p> for—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d987-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> programs described in section 6701(a)(2); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d988-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6708/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> renovating or building prisons or other correctional facilities.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1872">108 Stat. 1872</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d98c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6709"><span itemtype="num" value="6709">§ 6709.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Information used in allocation formulas</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d98d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6709/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Population Data for Payment Period Beginning October</span> 1, 1994.—</span></p>For the payment period beginning <p itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01"/>October 1, 1994, the Secretary, in making allocations pursuant to sections 6704 through 6706 and 6708, shall use for the population of the States the population for 1992 as reported by the Bureau of the Census in the publication Current Population Reports, Series P–25, No. 1045 (July 1992) and for the population of units of general local government the Secretary shall use the population for 1990 as reported by the Bureau of the Census in the publication Summary Social, Economic, and Housing Characteristics.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d98e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6709/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Data for Payment Periods Beginning After September</span> 30, 1995.—</span></p>For any payment period beginning after <p itemtype="date" date="1995-09-30"/>September 30, 1995, the Secretary, in making allocations pursuant to sections 6704 through 6706 and 6708, shall use information more recent than the information used for the payment period beginning <p itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01"/>October 1, 1994, provided the Secretary notifies the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives at least 90 days prior to the beginning of the payment period that the Secretary has determined that the more recent information is more reliable than the information used for the payment period beginning <p itemtype="date" date="1994-10-01"/>October 1, 1994.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1873">108 Stat. 1873</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d993-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710"><span itemtype="num" value="6710">§ 6710.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Public participation</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d994-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Hearings.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d995-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p>A unit of general local government expending payments under this chapter shall hold at least one public hearing on the proposed use of the payment in relation to its entire budget. At the hearing, persons shall be given an opportunity to provide written and oral views to the governmental authority responsible for enacting the budget and to ask questions about the entire budget and the relation of the payment to the entire budget. The government shall hold the hearing at a time and a place that allows and encourages public attendance and participation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d996-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Senior citizens</span>.—</span></p>A unit of general local government holding a hearing required under this subsection or by the budget process of the government shall try to provide senior citizens and senior citizen organizations with an opportunity to present views at the hearing before the government makes a final decision on the use of the payment.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d997-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Disclosure of Information.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d998-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>By the 10th day before a hearing required under subsection (a)(1) is held, a unit of general local government shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d999-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> make available for inspection by the public at the principal office of the government a statement of the proposed use of the payment and a summary of the proposed budget of the government; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d99a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> publish in at least one newspaper of general circulation the proposed use of the payment with the summary of the proposed budget and a notice of the time and place of the hearing.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d99b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Availability</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>By the 30th day after adoption of the budget under State or local law, the government shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d99c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> make available for inspection by the public at the principal office of the government a summary of the adopted budget, including the proposed use of the payment; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d99d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> publish in at least one newspaper of general circulation a notice that the information referred to in subparagraph (A) is available for inspection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d99e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Waivers of Requirements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A requirement—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d99f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> under subsection (a)(1) may be waived if the budget process required under the applicable State or local law or charter provisions—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> ensures the opportunity for public attendance and participation contemplated by subsection (a); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> includes a hearing on the proposed use of a payment received under this chapter in relation to the entire budget of the government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> under subsection (b)(1)(B) and paragraph (2)(B) may be waived if the cost of publishing the information would be unreasonably burdensome in relation to the amount allocated to the government from amounts available for payment under this chapter, or if publication is otherwise impracticable.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6710/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Exception to</span> 10-<span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Day Limitation</span>.—</span></p>If the Secretary is satisfied that a unit of general local government will provide adequate notice of the proposed use of a payment received under this chapter, the 10-day period under subsection (b)(1) may be changed to the extent necessary to comply with applicable State or local law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1873">108 Stat. 1873</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711"><span itemtype="num" value="6711">§ 6711.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prohibited discrimination</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">General Prohibition</span>.—</span></p>No person in the United States shall be excluded from participating in, be denied the benefits of, or be subject to discrimination under, a program or activity of a unit of general local government because of race, color, national origin, or sex if the government receives a payment under this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Additional Prohibitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The following prohibitions and exemptions also apply to a program or activity of a unit of general local government if the government receives a payment under this chapter:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A prohibition against discrimination because of age under the Age Discrimination Act of 1975.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A prohibition against discrimination against an otherwise qualified handicapped individual under section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A prohibition against discrimination because of religion, or an exemption from that prohibition, under the Civil Rights Act of 1964 or title VIII of the Act of <p itemtype="date" date="1968-04-11"/>April 11, 1968 (popularly known as the Civil Rights Act of 1968).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitations on Applicability of Prohibitions</span>.—</span></p>Subsections (a) and (b) do not apply if the government shows, by clear and convincing evidence, that a payment received under this chapter is not used to pay for any part of the program or activity with respect to which the allegation of discrimination is made.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Investigation Agreements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall try to make agreements with heads of agencies of the United States Government and State agencies to investigate noncompliance with this section. An agreement shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> describe the cooperative efforts to be taken (including sharing civil rights enforcement personnel and resources) to obtain compliance with this section; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6711/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> provide for notifying immediately the Secretary of actions brought by the United States Government or State agencies against a unit of general local government alleging a violation of a civil rights law or a regulation prescribed under a civil rights law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1874">108 Stat. 1874</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712"><span itemtype="num" value="6712">§ 6712.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Discrimination proceedings</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Notice of Noncompliance</span>.—</span></p>By the 10th day after the Secretary makes a finding of discrimination or receives a holding of discrimination about a unit of general local government, the Secretary shall submit a notice of noncompliance to the government. The notice shall state the basis of the finding or holding.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Informal Presentation of Evidence</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A unit of general local government may present evidence informally to the Secretary within 30 days after the government receives a notice of noncompliance from the Secretary. Except as provided in subsection (e), the government may present evidence on whether—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a person in the United States has been excluded or denied benefits of, or discriminated against under, the program or activity of the government, in violation of section 6711(a);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the program or activity of the government violated a prohibition described in section 6711(b); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> any part of that program or activity has been paid for with a payment received under this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Temporary Suspension of Payments</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>By the end of the 30-day period under subsection (b), the Secretary shall decide whether the unit of general local government has not complied with section 6711(a) or (b), unless the government has entered into a compliance agreement under section 6714. If the Secretary decides that the government has not complied, the Secretary shall notify the government of the decision and shall suspend payments to the government under this chapter unless, within 10 days after the government receives notice of the decision, the government—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> enters into a compliance agreement under section 6714; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> requests a proceeding under subsection (d)(1).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Administrative Review of Suspensions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Proceeding</span>.—</span></p>A proceeding requested under subsection (c)(2) shall begin by the 30th day after the Secretary receives a request for the proceeding. The proceeding shall be before an administrative law judge appointed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3105"/>section 3105 of title 5, United States Code. By the 30th day after the beginning of the proceeding, the judge shall issue a preliminary decision based on the record at the time on whether the unit of general local government is likely to prevail in showing compliance with section 6711(a) or (b).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Decision</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>If the administrative law judge decides at the end of a proceeding under paragraph (1) that the unit of general local government has—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> not complied with section 6711(a) or (b), the judge may order payments to the government under this chapter terminated; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> complied with section 6711(a) or (b), a suspension under section 6713(a)(1)(A) shall be discontinued promptly.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Likelihood of prevailing</span>.—</span></p>An administrative law judge may not issue a preliminary decision that the government is not likely to prevail if the judge has issued a decision described in paragraph (2)(A).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6712/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Basis for Review</span>.—</span></p>In a proceeding under subsections (b) through (d) on a program or activity of a unit of general local government about which a holding of discrimination has been made, the Secretary or administrative law judge may consider only whether a payment under this chapter was used to pay for any part of the program or activity. The holding of discrimination is conclusive. If the holding is reversed by an appellate court, the Secretary or judge shall end the proceeding.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1875">108 Stat. 1875</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713"><span itemtype="num" value="6713">§ 6713.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Suspension and termination of payments in discrimination proceedings</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Imposition and Continuation of Suspensions.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall suspend payment under this chapter to a unit of general local government—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> if an administrative law judge appointed under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3105"/>section 3105 of title 5, United States Code, issues a preliminary decision in a proceeding under section 6712(d)(1) that the government is not likely to prevail in showing compliance with section 6711(a) and (b);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> if the administrative law judge decides at the end of the proceeding that the government has not complied with section 6711(a) or (b), unless the government makes a compliance agreement under section 6714 by the 30th day after the decision; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> if required under section 6712(c).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Effectiveness</span>.—</span></p>A suspension already ordered under paragraph (1)(A) continues in effect if the administrative law judge makes a decision under paragraph (1)(B).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Lifting of Suspensions and Terminations</span>.—</span></p>If a holding of discrimination is reversed by an appellate court, a suspension or termination of payments in a proceeding based on the holding shall be discontinued.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Resumption of Payments Upon Attaining Compliance</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary may resume payment to a unit of general local government of payments suspended by the Secretary only—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> as of the time of, and under the conditions stated in—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the approval by the Secretary of a compliance agreement under section 6714(a)(1); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a compliance agreement entered into by the Secretary under section 6714(a)(2);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> if the government complies completely with an order of a United States court, a State court, or administrative law judge that covers all matters raised in a notice of noncompliance submitted by the Secretary under section 6712(a);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> if a United States court, a State court, or an administrative law judge decides (including a judge in a proceeding under section 6712(d)(1)), that the government has complied with sections <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002102"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002102"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> 6711(a) and (b); or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> if a suspension is discontinued under subsection (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Payment of Damages as Compliance</span>.—</span></p>For purposes of subsection (c)(2), compliance by a government may consist of the payment of restitution to a person injured because the government did not comply with section 6711(a) or (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6713/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Resumption of Payments Upon Reversal by Court</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may resume payment to a unit of general local government of payments terminated under section 6712(d)(2)(A) only if the decision resulting in the termination is reversed by an appellate court.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1876">108 Stat. 1876</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714"><span itemtype="num" value="6714">§ 6714.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Compliance agreements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Types of Compliance Agreements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A compliance agreement is an agreement—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> approved by the Secretary, between the governmental authority responsible for prosecuting a claim or complaint that is the basis of a holding of discrimination and the chief executive officer of the unit of general local government that has not complied with section 6711(a) or (b); or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> between the Secretary and the chief executive officer.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Contents of Agreements</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A compliance agreement—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall state the conditions the unit of general local government has agreed to comply with that would satisfy the obligations of the government under sections <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002103"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002103"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> 6711(a) and (b);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> shall cover each matter that has been found not to comply, or would not comply, with section 6711(a) or (b); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may be a series of agreements that dispose of those matters.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6714/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Availability of Agreements to Parties</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall submit a copy of a compliance agreement to each person who filed a complaint referred to in section 6716(b), or, if an agreement under subsection (a)(1), each person who filed a complaint with a governmental authority, about a failure to comply with section 6711(a) or (b). The Secretary shall submit the copy by the 15th day after an agreement is made. However, if the Secretary approves an agreement under subsection (a)(1) after the agreement is made, the Secretary may submit the copy by the 15th day after approval of the agreement.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1877">108 Stat. 1877</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6715"><span itemtype="num" value="6715">§ 6715.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Enforcement by the Attorney General of prohibitions on discrimination</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The Attorney General may bring a civil action in an appropriate district court of the United States against a unit of general local government that the Attorney General has reason to believe has engaged or is engaging in a pattern or practice in violation of section 6711(a) or (b). The court may grant—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6715/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a temporary restraining order;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6715/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> an injunction; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6715/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> an appropriate order to ensure enjoyment of rights under section 6711(a) or (b), including an order suspending, terminating, or requiring repayment of, payments under this chapter or placing additional payments under this chapter in escrow pending the outcome of the action.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1877">108 Stat. 1877</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716"><span itemtype="num" value="6716">§ 6716.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil action by a person adversely affected</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority for Private Suits in Federal or State Court</span>.—</span></p>If a unit of general local government, or an officer or employee of a unit of general local government acting in an official capacity, engages in a practice prohibited by this chapter, a person adversely affected by the practice may bring a civil action in an appropriate district court of the United States or a State court of general jurisdiction. Before bringing an action under this section, the person must exhaust administrative remedies under subsection (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Administrative Remedies Required To Be Exhausted</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>A person adversely affected shall file an administrative complaint with the Secretary or the head of another agency of the United States Government or the State agency with which the Secretary has an agreement under section 6711(d). Administrative remedies are deemed to be exhausted by the person after the 90th day after the complaint was filed if the Secretary, the head of the Government agency, or the State agency—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> issues a decision that the government has not failed to comply with this chapter; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> does not issue a decision on the complaint.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority of Court</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In an action under this section, the court—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> may grant—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/c/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a temporary restraining order;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/c/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an injunction; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038d9f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/c/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> another order, including suspension, termination, or repayment of, payments under this chapter or placement of additional payments under this chapter in escrow pending the outcome of the action; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038d9f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> to enforce compliance with section 6711(a) or (b), may allow a prevailing party (except the United States Government) a reasonable attorney’s fee.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6716/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Intervention by Attorney General</span>.—</span></p>In an action under this section to enforce compliance with section 6711(a) or (b), the Attorney General may intervene in the action if the Attorney General certifies that the action is of general public importance. The United States Government is entitled to the same relief as if the Government had brought the action and is liable for the same fees and costs as a private person.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1878">108 Stat. 1878</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038d9fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6717"><span itemtype="num" value="6717">§ 6717.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Judicial review</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038d9ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6717/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Appeals in Federal Court of Appeals</span>.—</span></p>A unit of general local government which receives notice from the Secretary about withholding payments under section 6703(f), suspending payments under section 6713(a)(1)(B), or terminating payments under section 6712(d)(2)(A), may apply for review of the action of the Secretary by filing a petition for review with the court of appeals of the United States for the circuit in which the government is located. The petition shall be filed by the 60th day after the date the notice is received. The clerk of the court shall immediately send a copy of the petition to the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da00-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6717/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Filing of Record of Administrative Proceeding</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall file with the court a record of the proceeding on which the Secretary based the action. The court may consider only objections to the action of the Secretary that were presented before the Secretary.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da01-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6717/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Court Action</span>.—</span></p>The court may affirm, change, or set aside any part of the action of the Secretary. The findings of fact by the Secretary are conclusive if supported by substantial evidence in the record. If a finding is not supported by substantial evidence in the record, the court may remand the case to the Secretary to take additional evidence. Upon such a remand, the Secretary may make new or modified findings and shall certify additional proceedings to the court.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da02-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6717/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Review Only by Supreme Court</span>.—</span></p>A judgment of a court under this section may be reviewed only by the Supreme Court under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s1254"/>section 1254 of title 28, United States Code.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1878">108 Stat. 1878</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038da06-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718"><span itemtype="num" value="6718">§ 6718.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Investigations and reviews</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da07-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Investigations by Secretary.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da08-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall within a reasonable time limit—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da09-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> carry out an investigation and make a finding after receiving a complaint referred to in section 6716(b), a determination by a State or local administrative agency, or other information about a possible violation of this chapter;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da0a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> carry out audits and reviews (including investigations of allegations) about possible violations of this chapter; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da0b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> advise a complainant of the status of an audit, investigation, or review of an allegation by the complainant of a violation of section 6711(a) or (b) or other provision of this chapter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da0c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Time limit</span>.—</span></p>The maximum time limit under paragraph (1)(A) is 120 days.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da0d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6718/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reviews by Comptroller General</span>.—</span></p>The Comptroller General of the United States may carry out reviews of the activities of the Secretary, State governments, and units of general local government necessary for the Congress to evaluate compliance and operations under this chapter. These reviews may include a comparison of the waste and inefficiency of local governments using funds under this chapter compared to waste and inefficiency with other comparable Federal programs.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1879">108 Stat. 1879</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/316/tI">Pub. L. 104–316, title I</span>, § 115(k), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-19">Oct. 19, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3835">110 Stat. 3835</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038da12-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719"><span itemtype="num" value="6719">§ 6719.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da13-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reports by Secretary to Congress</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Before June 2 of each year prior to 2002, the Secretary personally shall report to the Congress on—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da14-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the status and operation of the Local Government Fiscal Assistance Fund during the prior fiscal year; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da15-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the administration of this chapter, including a complete and detailed analysis of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da16-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> actions taken to comply with sections 6711 through 6715, including a description of the kind and extent of noncompliance and the status of pending complaints;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da17-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the extent to which units of general local government receiving payments under this chapter have complied with the requirements of this chapter;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da18-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the way in which payments under this chapter have been distributed in the jurisdictions receiving payments; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da19-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> significant problems in carrying out this chapter and recommendations for legislation to remedy the problems.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da1a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports by Units of General Local Government to Secretary.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da1b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In general</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>At the end of each fiscal year, each unit of general local government which received a payment under this chapter for the fiscal year shall submit a report to the Secretary. The report shall be submitted in the form and at a time prescribed by the Secretary and shall be available to the public for inspection. The report shall state—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da1c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the amounts and purposes for which the payment has been appropriated, expended, or obligated in the fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da1d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the relationship of the payment to the relevant functional items in the budget of the government; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da1e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the differences between the actual and proposed use of the payment.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da1f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6719/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Availability of report</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary shall provide a copy of a report submitted under paragraph (1) by a unit of general local government to the chief executive officer of the State in which the government is located. The Secretary shall provide the report in the manner and form prescribed by the Secretary.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1879">108 Stat. 1879</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1038da23-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720"><span itemtype="num" value="6720">§ 6720.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions, application, and administration</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1038da24-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da25-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “unit of general local government” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da26-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a county, township, city, or political subdivision of a county, township, or city, that is a unit of general local government as determined by the Secretary of Commerce for general statistical purposes; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da27-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the District of Columbia and the recognized governing body of an Indian tribe or Alaskan Native village that carries out substantial governmental duties and powers;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da28-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “payment period” means each 1-year period beginning on October 1 of the years 1994 through 2000;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da29-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “State and local taxes” means taxes imposed by a State government or unit of general local government or other political subdivision of a State government for public purposes (except employee and employer assessments and contributions to finance retirement and social insurance systems and other special assessments for capital outlay) as determined by the Secretary of Commerce for general statistical purposes;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da2a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> “State” means any of the several States and the District of Columbia;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da2b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “income” means the total money income received from all sources as determined by the Secretary of Commerce for general statistical purposes, which for units of general local government is reported by the Bureau of the Census for 1990 in the publication Summary Social, Economic, and Housing Characteristics;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da2c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “per capita income” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da2d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/6/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> in the case of the United States, the income of the United States divided by the population of the United States;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da2e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/6/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> in the case of a State, the income of that State, divided by the population of that State; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1038da2f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/6/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> in the case of a unit of general local government, the income of that unit of general local government divided by the population of the unit of general local government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1038da30-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> “finding of discrimination” means a decision by the Secretary about a complaint described in section 6716(b), a decision by a State or local administrative agency, or other information (under regulations prescribed by the Secretary) that it is more likely than not that a unit of general local government has not complied with section 6711(a) or (b);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a31-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “holding of discrimination” means a holding by a United States court, a State court, or an administrative law judge appointed under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s3105">section 3105 of title 5</span>, United States Code, that a unit of general local government expending amounts received under this chapter has—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a32-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/8/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> excluded a person in the United States from participating in, denied the person the benefits of, or subjected the person to discrimination under, a program or activity because of race, color, national origin, or sex; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a33-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/8/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> violated a prohibition against discrimination described in section 6711(b); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a34-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> “Secretary” means the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a35-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Delegation of Administration</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may enter into agreements with other executive branch departments and agencies to delegate to that department or agency all or part of the Secretary’s responsibility for administering this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a36-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Treatment of Subsumed Areas</span>.—</span></p>If the entire geographic area of a unit of general local government is located in a larger entity, the unit of general local government is deemed to be located in the larger entity. If only part of the geographic area of a unit is located in a larger entity, each part is deemed to be located in the larger entity and to be a separate unit of general local government in determining allocations under this chapter. Except as provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, the Secretary shall make all data computations based on the ratio of the estimated population of the part to the population of the entire unit of general local government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a37-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6720/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Boundary and Other Changes</span>.—</span></p>If a boundary line change, a State statutory or constitutional change, annexation, a governmental reorganization, or other circumstance results in the application of sections 6704 through 6708 in a way that does not carry out the purposes of sections 6701 through 6708, the Secretary shall apply sections 6701 through 6708 under regulations of the Secretary in a way that is consistent with those purposes.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/322/tIII">Pub. L. 103–322, title III</span>, § 31001(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-09-13">Sept. 13, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1880">108 Stat. 1880</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id103b4a3b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch69"><span itemtype="num" value="69">CHAPTER 69—</span><span itemtype="heading">PAYMENT FOR ENTITLEMENT LAND</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4a3f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901"><span itemtype="num" value="6901">§ 6901.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a40-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “entitlement land” means land owned by the United States Government—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a41-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> that is in the National Park System or the National Forest System, including wilderness areas and lands described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1948-06-22/s2"/>section 2 of the Act of June 22, 1948 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s577d"/>16 U.S.C. 577d), and <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1956-06-22/s1"/>section 1 of the Act of June 22, 1956 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s577d–1"/>16 U.S.C. 577d–1);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a42-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Secretary of the Interior administers through the Bureau of Land Management;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a43-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> dedicated to the use of the Government for water resource development projects;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a44-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> on which are located semi-active or inactive installations (except industrial installations) that the Secretary of the Army keeps for mobilization and for reserve component training;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a45-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> that is a dredge disposal area under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Army;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a46-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> that is located in the vicinity of Purgatory River Canyon and Pinon Canyon, Colorado, and acquired after <p itemtype="date" date="1981-12-23"/>December 23, 1981, by the United States Government to expand the Fort Carson military installation;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a47-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> that is a reserve area (as defined in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1935-06-15/s401/g/3"/>section 401(g)(3) of the Act of June 15, 1935 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s715s/g/3"/>16 U.S.C. 715s(g)(3))); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a48-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/1/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> acquired by the Secretary of the Interior or the Secretary of Agriculture under section 5 of the Southern Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 that is not otherwise described in subparagraphs (A) through (G).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a49-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a4a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “unit of general local government” means—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a4b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a county (or parish), township, borough, or city (other than in Alaska) where the city is independent of any other unit of general local government, that—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id103b4a4c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> is within the class or classes of such political subdivision in a State that the Secretary of the Interior, in his discretion, determines to be the principal provider or providers of governmental services within the State; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id103b4a4d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> is a unit of general government, as determined by the Secretary of the Interior on the basis of the same principles as were used by the Secretary of Commerce on <p itemtype="date" date="1983-01-01"/>January 1, 1983, for general statistical purposes;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a4e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any area in Alaska that is within the boundaries of a census area used by the Secretary of Commerce in the decennial census, but that is not included within the boundary of a governmental entity described under clause (i);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a4f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the District of Columbia;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a50-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a51-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> Guam; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a52-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/A/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> the Virgin Islands.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a53-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6901/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the term “governmental services” includes, but is not limited to, those services that relate to public safety, the environment, housing, social services, transportation, and governmental administration.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1031">96 Stat. 1031</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/63/tI">Pub. L. 98–63, title I</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-07-30">July 30, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/323">97 Stat. 323</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/446/tI">Pub. L. 100–446, title I</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-09-27">Sept. 27, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1775">102 Stat. 1775</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1364">108 Stat. 1364</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/333/dI/tX">Pub. L. 104–333, div. I, title X</span>, § 1033(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-11-12">Nov. 12, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/4239">110 Stat. 4239</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/83/tIII">Pub. L. 105–83, title III</span>, § 350, <span itemtype="date" date="1997-11-14">Nov. 14, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/1607">111 Stat. 1607</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/263">Pub. L. 105–263</span>, § 5(d), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-10-19">Oct. 19, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/2348">112 Stat. 2348</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4a5c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902"><span itemtype="num" value="6902">§ 6902.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority and Eligibility <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002104">1</span><span itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002104"><span itemtype="num">1</span> So in original. Probably should not be capitalized.</span></span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a5d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a5e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Secretary of the Interior shall make a payment for each fiscal year to each unit of general local government in which entitlement land is located as set forth in this chapter. A unit of general local government may use the payment for any governmental purpose.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a5f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> For each unit of general local government described in section 6901(2)(A)(ii), the Secretary of the Interior shall make a payment for each fiscal year to the State of Alaska for entitlement land located within such unit as set forth in this chapter. The State of Alaska shall distribute such payment to home rule cities and general law cities (as such cities are defined by the State) located within the boundaries of the unit of general local government for which the payment was received. Such cities may use monies received under this paragraph for any governmental purpose.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a60-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A unit of general local government may not receive a payment for land for which payment under this Act <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002105">2</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002105"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> otherwise may be received if the land was owned or administered by a State or unit of general local government and was exempt from real estate taxes when the land was conveyed to the United States except that a unit of general local government may receive a payment for—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a61-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> land a State or unit of general local government acquires from a private party to donate to the United States within 8 years of acquisition;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a62-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> land acquired by a State through an exchange with the United States if such land was entitlement land as defined by this chapter; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a63-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6902/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> land in Utah acquired by the United States for Federal land, royalties, or other assets if, at the time of such acquisition, a unit of general local government was entitled under applicable State law to receive payments in lieu of taxes from the State of Utah for such land: <p itemtype="i"/>Provided, however, That no payment under this paragraph shall exceed the payment that would have been made under State law if such land had not been acquired.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1032">96 Stat. 1032</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/93">Pub. L. 103–93</span>, § 10(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-10-01">Oct. 1, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/999">107 Stat. 999</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/397">Pub. L. 103–397</span>, § 4, <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-22">Oct. 22, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/4157">108 Stat. 4157</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/333/dI/tX">Pub. L. 104–333, div. I, title X</span>, § 1033(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-11-12">Nov. 12, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/4240">110 Stat. 4240</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4a69-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903"><span itemtype="num" value="6903">§ 6903.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Payments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a6a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a6b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “payment law” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a6c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f"
