identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the Act of <p itemtype="date" date="1910-06-20"/>June 20, 1910 (ch. 310, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/36/557"/>36 Stat. 557);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a6d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> section 33 of the Bankhead-Jones Farm Tenant Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s1012"/>7 U.S.C. 1012);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a6e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the Act of <p itemtype="date" date="1908-05-23"/>May 23, 1908 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s500"/>16 U.S.C. 500) or the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a6f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1948-06-22/s5"/>section 5 of the Act of June 22, 1948 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s577g"/>16 U.S.C. 577g, 577g–1);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a70-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1935-06-15/s401/c/2"/>section 401(c)(2) of the Act of June 15, 1935 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s715s/c/2"/>16 U.S.C. 715s(c)(2));<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a71-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> section 17 of the Federal Power Act (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s810"/>16 U.S.C. 810);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a72-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1920-02-25/s35"/>section 35 of the Act of February 25, 1920 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t30/s191"/>30 U.S.C. 191);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a73-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> section 6 of the Mineral Leasing Act for Acquired Lands (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t30/s355"/>30 U.S.C. 355);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a74-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1947-07-31/s3"/>section 3 of the Act of July 31, 1947 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t30/s603"/>30 U.S.C. 603); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a75-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/1/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/act/1934-06-28/s10"/>section 10 of the Act of June 28, 1934 (known as the Taylor Grazing Act) (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t43/s315i"/>43 U.S.C. 315i).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a76-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> population shall be determined on the same basis that the Secretary of Commerce determines resident population for general statistical purposes.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a77-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a unit of general local government may not be credited with a population of more than 50,000.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a78-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a79-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A payment under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6902">section 6902 of this title</span> is equal to the greater of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a7a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> 93 cents during fiscal year 1995, $1.11 during fiscal year 1996, $1.29 during fiscal year 1997, $1.47 during fiscal year 1998, and $1.65 during fiscal year 1999 and thereafter, for each acre of entitlement land located within a unit of general local government (but not more than the limitation determined under subsection (c) of this section) reduced (but not below 0) by amounts the unit received in the prior fiscal year under a payment law; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a7b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> 12 cents during fiscal year 1995, 15 cents during fiscal year 1996, 17 cents during fiscal year 1997, 20 cents during fiscal year 1998, and 22 cents during fiscal year 1999 and thereafter, for each acre of entitlement land located in the unit (but not more than the limitation determined under subsection (c) of this section).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a7c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The chief executive officer of a State shall submit to the Secretary of the Interior a statement on the amounts of payments the State transfers to each unit of general local government in the State out of amounts received under a payment law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a7d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a7e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The limitation for a unit of general local government with a population of not more than 4,999 is the highest dollar amount specified in paragraph (2).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a7f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The limitation for a unit of general local government with a population of at least 5,000 is the following amount (rounding the population off to the nearest thousand):<p itemtype="table" width="50%" style="border-collapse:collapse; border=0;  -uslm-lc: c2,L0,tp0,p7,7/8,s11,15,tp0,p7,7/8,s11,15; " id="id103b4a80-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f"/>

<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a81-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6903/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> On October 1 of each year after the date of enactment of the Payment in Lieu of Taxes Act, the Secretary of the Interior shall adjust each dollar amount specified in subsections (b) and (c) to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor, for the 12 months ending the preceding June 30.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 98–63, title I</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-07-30">July 30, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/324">97 Stat. 324</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/397">Pub. L. 103–397</span>, §§ 2, 3, 5(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-10-22">Oct. 22, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/4156-4158">108 Stat. 4156–4158</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/393">Pub. L. 106–393</span>, § 4, <span itemtype="date" date="2000-10-30">Oct. 30, 2000</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/114/1610">114 Stat. 1610</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4a89-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904"><span itemtype="num" value="6904">§ 6904.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Additional payments</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a8a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In addition to payments the Secretary of the Interior makes under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6902">section 6902 of this title</span>, the Secretary shall make a payment for each fiscal year to a unit of general local government collecting and distributing real property taxes (including a unit in Alaska outside the boundaries of an organized borough) in which is located an interest in land that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a8b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the United States Government acquires for—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a8c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the National Park System; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4a8d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the National Forest Wilderness Areas; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a8e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> was subject to local real property taxes within the 5-year period before the interest is acquired.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a8f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary shall make payments only for the 5 fiscal years after the fiscal year in which the interest in land is acquired. Under guidelines the Secretary prescribes, the unit of general local government receiving the payment from the Secretary shall distribute payments proportionally to units and school districts that lost real property taxes because of the acquisition of the interest. A unit receiving a distribution may use a payment for any governmental purpose.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a90-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Each yearly payment by the Secretary under this section is equal to one percent of the fair market value of the interest in land on the date the Government acquires the interest. However, a payment may not be more than the amount of real property taxes levied on the property during the last fiscal year before the fiscal year in which the interest is acquired. A decision on fair market value under this section may not include an increase in the value of an interest because the land is rezoned when the rezoning causes the increase after the date of enactment of a law authorizing the acquisition of an interest under subsection (a) of this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a91-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6904/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary may prescribe regulations under which payments may be made to units of general local government when subsections (a) and (b) of this section will not carry out the purpose of subsections (a) and (b).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1033">96 Stat. 1033</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4a95-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905"><span itemtype="num" value="6905">§ 6905.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Redwood National Park and the Lake Tahoe Basin</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a96-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary of the Interior shall make a payment for each fiscal year to each unit of general local government in which an interest in land owned by the United States Government in the Redwood National Park is located. A unit may use the payment for any governmental purpose. The payment shall be made as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6903"/>section 6903 of this title and shall include an amount payable under section 6903.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a97-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a98-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In addition to payments the Secretary makes under subsection (a) of this section, the Secretary shall make a payment for each fiscal year to each unit of general local government in which is located an interest in land—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a99-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> owned by the Government in the Redwood National Park; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4a9a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> acquired in the Lake Tahoe Basin under the Act of <p itemtype="date" date="1980-12-23"/>December 23, 1980 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/96/586"/>Public Law 96–586, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/94/3383"/>94 Stat. 3383).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a9b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The payment shall be made as provided in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6904"/>section 6904 of this title and shall include an amount payable under section 6904. However, an amount computed but not paid because of the first sentence of subsection (b) and the 2d sentence of subsection (c) of section 6904 shall be carried forward and applied to future years in which the payment would not otherwise equal the amount of real property taxes assessed and levied on the land during the last fiscal year before the fiscal year in which the interest was acquired until the amount is applied completely.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a9c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The unit of general local government may use the payment for any governmental purpose.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4a9d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6905/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> The Redwoods Community College District is a school district under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s6904/b"/>section 6904(b) of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1034">96 Stat. 1034</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4aa2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6906"><span itemtype="num" value="6906">§ 6906.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Funding</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>For each of fiscal years 2008 through 2014—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4aa3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6906/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> each county or other eligible unit of local government shall be entitled to payment under this chapter; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4aa4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6906/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> sums shall be made available to the Secretary of the Interior for obligation or expenditure in accordance with this chapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1035">96 Stat. 1035</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/343/dC/tVI">Pub. L. 110–343, div. C, title VI</span>, § 601(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2008-10-03">Oct. 3, 2008</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/122/3911">122 Stat. 3911</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/112/141/dF/tI">Pub. L. 112–141, div. F, title I</span>, § 100111, <span itemtype="date" date="2012-07-06">July 6, 2012</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/126/906">126 Stat. 906</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/113/79/tXII">Pub. L. 113–79, title XII</span>, § 12312, <span itemtype="date" date="2014-02-07">Feb. 7, 2014</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/128/992">128 Stat. 992</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4aa9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6907"><span itemtype="num" value="6907">§ 6907.</span><span itemtype="heading"> State legislation requiring reallocation or redistribution of payments to smaller units of general purpose government</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4aaa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6907/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a State may enact legislation which requires that any payments which would be made to units of general local government pursuant to this chapter be reallocated and redistributed in whole or part to other smaller units of general purpose government which (1) are located within the boundaries of the larger unit of general local government, (2) provide general governmental services and (3) contain entitlement lands within their boundaries. Such reallocation or redistribution shall generally reflect the level of services provided by, and the number of entitlement acres within, the smaller unit of general local government.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4aab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6907/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Upon enactment of legislation by a State, described in subsection (a), the Secretary shall make one payment to such State equaling the aggregate amount of payments which he otherwise would have made to units of general local government within such State pursuant to this chapter. It shall be the responsibility of such State to make any further distribution of the payment pursuant to subsection (a). Such redistribution shall be made within 30 days after receipt of such payment. No payment, or portion thereof, made by the Secretary shall be used by any State for the administration of this subsection or subsection (a).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4aac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s6907/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Appropriations made for payments in lieu of taxes for a fiscal year may be used to correct underpayments in the previous fiscal year to achieve equity among all qualified recipients.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/63/tI">Pub. L. 98–63, title I</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1983-07-30">July 30, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/97/324">97 Stat. 324</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(U)(ii), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1362">108 Stat. 1362</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id103b4ab0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch71"><span itemtype="num" value="71">CHAPTER 71—</span><span itemtype="heading">JOINT FUNDING SIMPLIFICATION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4ab2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7101"><span itemtype="num" value="7101">§ 7101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Purposes</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>The purposes of this chapter are to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ab3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7101/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> enable States, local governments, and private nonprofit organizations to use assistance of the United States Government more effectively and efficiently;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ab4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7101/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> adapt the assistance more readily to particular needs through wider use of projects that are supported by more than one executive agency, assistance program, or appropriation of the United States Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ab5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7101/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> encourage Federal-State arrangements under which local governments and private nonprofit organizations may more effectively and efficiently combine Federal and State resources to support projects of common interest to those local governments and those organizations.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1035">96 Stat. 1035</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4ab9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102"><span itemtype="num" value="7102">§ 7102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4aba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “applicant” means a State, local government, or private nonprofit organization applying for assistance for one project.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4abb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “assistance program” means a program of the United States Government providing assistance through a grant or contract but does not include revenue sharing, a loan, a loan guarantee, or insurance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4abc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “local government” means a county, city, political subdivision of a county or city, or other general purpose political subdivision of a State, a school district, a council of governments, or other instrumentality of a local government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4abd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “project” means an undertaking that includes components that contribute materially to carrying out one purpose or closely related purposes and are proposed or approved for assistance under—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4abe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> more than one United States Government program; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4abf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> at least one Government program and at least one State program.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ac0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7102/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “State” means a State of the United States, the District of Columbia, a territory or possession of the United States, an agency or instrumentality of a State, and a tribe as defined in section 3(c) of the Indian Financing Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t25/s1452/c"/>25 U.S.C. 1452(c)).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1035">96 Stat. 1035</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(V), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1363">108 Stat. 1363</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103b4ac5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103"><span itemtype="num" value="7103">§ 7103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority of the President and heads of executive agencies</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4ac6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The President shall prescribe necessary regulations to carry out <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s7101">section 7101 of this title</span> and to ensure that this chapter is applied by all executive agencies consistently. The regulations may require executive agencies to adopt or prescribe procedures requiring applicants for assistance for a project to be jointly financed under this chapter to take steps to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ac7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> get the views and recommendations of States and local governments that may be significantly affected by the project; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ac8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> resolve questions of common interest to those States and local governments before making application.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4ac9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Subject to regulations prescribed under subsection (a) of this section and other law, the head of an executive agency may do the following by an order of the agency head or by agreement with another executive agency:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4aca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> identify related programs likely to be particularly suitable in providing joint financing for specific kinds of projects.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4acb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> to assist in planning and developing a project financed from different programs, develop and prescribe—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4acc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> guidelines;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4acd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> model or illustrative projects;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4ace-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> joint or common application forms; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4acf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> other materials or guidance.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ad0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> review administrative program requirements to identify requirements that may impede joint financing of a project and modify the requirements when appropriate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ad1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> establish common technical or administrative regulations for related programs to assist in providing joint financing to support a specific project or class of projects.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ad2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> establish joint or common application processing and project supervision procedures, including procedures for designating—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4ad3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/5/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a lead agency responsible for processing applications; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103b4ad4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/b/5/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a managing agency responsible for project supervision.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103b4ad5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of an executive agency shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ad6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> take maximum action to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s7101"/>section 7101 of this title in conducting an assistance program of the agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103b4ad7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7103/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> consult and cooperate with the heads of other executive agencies to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s7101"/>section 7101 of this title in conducting assistance programs of different executive agencies that may be used jointly to finance projects undertaken by States, local governments, or private nonprofit organizations.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1036">96 Stat. 1036</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d94cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7104"><span itemtype="num" value="7104">§ 7104.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Processing project requests to be financed by at least 2 assistance programs</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In processing an application or request for assistance for a project to be financed by at least 2 assistance programs, the head of an executive agency shall take action that will ensure that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7104/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> required reviews and approvals are handled expeditiously;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7104/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> complete account is taken of special considerations of timing that are made known by the applicant that would affect the feasibility of a jointly financed project;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7104/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> an applicant is required to deal with a minimum number of representatives of the United States Government;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7104/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> an applicant is promptly informed of a decision or special problem that could affect the feasibility of providing joint assistance under the application; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7104/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> an applicant is not required to get information or assurances from one executive agency for a requesting executive agency when the requesting agency may get the information or assurances directly.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1037">96 Stat. 1037</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d94d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105"><span itemtype="num" value="7105">§ 7105.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prescribing uniform technical and administrative provisions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> To make participation in a project easier than would be possible because of varying or conflicting technical or administrative regulations and procedures not required by law, the head of an executive agency may prescribe uniform provisions about inconsistent or conflicting requirements on—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> financial administration of the project (including accounting, reporting and auditing, and maintaining a separate bank account), to the extent consistent with <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s7108"/>section 7108 of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the timing of payments by the United States Government for the project when one schedule or a combined schedule is to be established for the project;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> providing assistance by grant rather than procurement contract or by procurement contract rather than by grant; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> accountability for, or the disposition of, records, property, or structures acquired or constructed with assistance from the Government when common regulations are established for the project.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> To make easier the processing of applications for assistance, the head of an executive agency may provide for review of proposals for a project by one panel, board, or committee where reviews by separate panels, boards, or committees are not specifically required by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Notwithstanding a requirement that one public agency or a specific public agency be established or designated to carry out or supervise that part of the assistance from the Government under an assistance program for a jointly financed project, the head of the executive agency carrying out the program may waive the requirement when—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> administration by another public agency is consistent with State or local law and the objectives of the assistance program; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the waiver is requested by the head of a unit of general government certifying jurisdiction over the public agencies concerned; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7105/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the State or local public agencies concerned agree to the waiver.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1037">96 Stat. 1037</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d94e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7106"><span itemtype="num" value="7106">§ 7106.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Delegation of supervision of assistance</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>With the approval of the President, the head of an executive agency may delegate or otherwise arrange to have another executive agency carry out or supervise a project or class of projects jointly financed under this chapter. A delegation—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7106/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall be made under conditions ensuring that duties and powers delegated are exercised consistent with law; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7106/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may not relieve the head of an executive agency of responsibility for the proper and efficient management of a project for which the agency provides assistance.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1038">96 Stat. 1038</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d94eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107"><span itemtype="num" value="7107">§ 7107.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Joint management funds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> In supporting a project, a joint management fund may be established to administer more effectively amounts received from more than one assistance program or appropriation. A proportional share of the amount required to pay a grantee shall be transferred periodically to the fund from each program or appropriation. When a project is completed, the grantee shall return to the fund an amount not expended.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An account in a joint management fund is subject to an agreement made by the heads of the executive agencies providing assistance for the project about the responsibilities of each agency. An agreement shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> ensure the availability of necessary information to the executive agencies and Congress;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> provide that the agency administering a fund is responsible and accountable by program and appropriation for the amounts provided for the purposes of each account in the fund; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> include procedures for returning, subject to fiscal year limitations, an excess amount to participating executive agencies under the applicable appropriation. An excess amount of an expired appropriation lapses from the fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For each project financed through an account in a joint management fund, a recipient of an amount from the fund shall keep records prescribed by the head of the executive agency responsible for administering the fund. The records shall include—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the amount and disposition by the recipient of assistance received under each program and appropriation;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the total cost of the project for which assistance was given or used;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> that part of the cost of the project provided from other sources; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> other records that will make it easier to carry out an audit.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94f6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Records of a recipient related to an amount received from a joint management fund shall be made available to the head of the executive agency responsible for administering the fund and the Comptroller General for inspection and audit.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d94f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For a project subject to a joint management fund, one non-Government share may be established conforming to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the proportional shares applicable to the assistance programs involved; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7107/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the proportional shares of an amount transferred to the project account from each of the programs.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1038">96 Stat. 1038</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d94fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7108"><span itemtype="num" value="7108">§ 7108.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitation on authority under sections 7105–7107</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Under regulations prescribed by the President, the head of an executive agency may act under sections 7105–7107 of this title for a project assisted under at least 2 assistance programs. The regulations shall ensure that the head of an executive agency acts under those sections only—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7108/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> when a problem cannot be adequately solved through other action under this chapter or other law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d94ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7108/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> when necessary to promote expeditious processing of applications or effective and efficient administration of the project; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9500-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7108/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> in a way consistent with protecting the interest of the United States Government and with the program purposes and requirements of law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1039">96 Stat. 1039</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9504-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7109"><span itemtype="num" value="7109">§ 7109.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Appropriations available for joint financing</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An appropriation available for technical assistance or personnel training under an assistance program is available for technical assistance and training for a project proposed or approved for joint financing involving the program and another assistance program.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1039">96 Stat. 1039</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9508-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7110"><span itemtype="num" value="7110">§ 7110.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Use of joint financing provisions for Federal-State assisted projects</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">Under regulations prescribed by the President, the head of an executive agency may make an agreement with a State to extend the benefits of this chapter to a project involving assistance from at least one executive agency and at least one State agency. The agreement may include arrangements to process requests or administer assistance on a joint basis.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1039">96 Stat. 1039</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d950c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7111"><span itemtype="num" value="7111">§ 7111.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Report to Congress</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">By <span itemtype="date" date="1984-02-03">February 3, 1984</span>, the President shall submit to Congress a report on actions taken under this chapter and make recommendations for its continuation, amendment, or termination. The report shall include a detailed evaluation of the operation of the chapter, including information on the benefits and costs of jointly financed projects that accrue to participating States, local governments, private nonprofit organizations, and the United States Government.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1039">96 Stat. 1039</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9510-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7112"><span itemtype="num" value="7112">§ 7112.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Expiration date</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">This chapter expires on <span itemtype="date" date="1985-02-03">February 3, 1985</span>.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1039">96 Stat. 1039</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id103d9514-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch73"><span itemtype="num" value="73">CHAPTER 73—</span><span itemtype="heading">ADMINISTERING BLOCK GRANTS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9516-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7301"><span itemtype="num" value="7301">§ 7301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Purpose</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>It is the purpose of this chapter to ensure that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9517-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7301/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> block grant amounts are allocated for programs of special importance to meet the needs of local governments, residents of local governments, and other eligible entities; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9518-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7301/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> all eligible local governments, residents of local governments, and other eligible entities are treated fairly in distributing block grant amounts.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1039">96 Stat. 1039</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d951c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7302"><span itemtype="num" value="7302">§ 7302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d951d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7302/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “block grant amounts” means amounts received for a program that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d951e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7302/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> directly allocates amounts to States only, except for amounts allocated for use by the agency administering the program; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d951f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7302/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> provides that the State may use any part of the amounts at its discretion to continue to support activities financed on <p itemtype="date" date="1981-08-12"/>August 12, 1981, under programs whose authorizations were discontinued by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/35"/>Public Law 97–35, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/95/357"/>95 Stat. 357) and that were financed on <p itemtype="date" date="1981-08-12"/>August 12, 1981, by allocations by the United States Government to local governments or other eligible entities, or both local governments and other eligible entities.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9520-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7302/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “State” includes the District of Columbia and territories and possessions of the United States.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1040">96 Stat. 1040</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9525-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303"><span itemtype="num" value="7303">§ 7303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports and public hearings on proposed uses of amounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9526-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9527-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The chief executive officer of each State shall prepare for each fiscal year a report on the proposed use during the fiscal year of block grant amounts received by the State. The report shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9528-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a statement of goals and objectives;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9529-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> information on the types of activities to be supported, geographic areas to be served, and categories or characteristics of individuals to be served; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d952a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the criteria for, and way of, distributing the amounts, including details on the way amounts will be distributed on the basis of need to carry out the purposes of the block grant amounts.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d952b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Beginning with the fiscal year ending <p itemtype="date" date="1983-09-30"/>September 30, 1983, each report shall describe how the State met the goals, objectives, and needs in using the amounts described in the report for the prior fiscal year.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d952c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A State may not receive block grant amounts for a fiscal year until the State conducts a public hearing, after adequate public notice, on the proposed use and distribution of the amounts set out in the report prepared under subsection (a) of this section for the fiscal year.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d952d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7303/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Each report prepared under subsection (a) of this section and changes to the report shall be made public in the State on a timely basis and in a way that encourages comments from interested local government and persons.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1040">96 Stat. 1040</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9531-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7304"><span itemtype="num" value="7304">§ 7304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Availability of records</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">To evaluate and review the use of block grant amounts, consolidated assistance, and other grant programs established or provided for in the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/35">Public Law 97–35</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/95/357">95 Stat. 357</span>), records related to the amounts, assistance, or programs that are in the possession, custody, or control of a State, a political subdivision of a State, or a grantee of a State or political subdivision of a State shall be made available to the Comptroller General.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1040">96 Stat. 1040</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9536-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7305"><span itemtype="num" value="7305">§ 7305.</span><span itemtype="heading"> State auditing requirements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9537-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7305/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The chief executive officer of each State shall conduct financial and compliance audits of block grant amounts received under the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/35"/>Public Law 97–35, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/95/357"/>95 Stat. 357) and amounts received under a consolidated assistance program established or provided for in the Act. An audit shall be conducted for the 2-year period beginning on <p itemtype="date" date="1981-10-01"/>October 1, 1981, and for each 2-year period thereafter. As far as practicable, the audit shall be conducted consistent with standards the Comptroller General prescribes for the audit of governmental entities, programs, activities, and functions.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9538-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7305/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> An audit under subsection (a) of this section is in place of other financial and compliance audits of those amounts that the chief executive officer of the State is required to conduct under another provision of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/35"/>Public Law 97–35, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/95/357"/>95 Stat. 357) unless the other provision, by explicit reference to this section, provides otherwise.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1041">96 Stat. 1041</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id103d953d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch75"><span itemtype="num" value="75">CHAPTER 75—</span><span itemtype="heading">REQUIREMENTS FOR SINGLE AUDITS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d9541-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501"><span itemtype="num" value="7501">§ 7501.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9542-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this chapter, the term—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9543-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “Comptroller General” means the Comptroller General of the United States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9544-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “Director” means the Director of the Office of Management and Budget;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9545-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “Federal agency” has the same meaning as the term “agency” in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s551/1"/>section 551(1) of title 5;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9546-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> “Federal awards” means Federal financial assistance and Federal cost-reimbursement contracts that non-Federal entities receive directly from Federal awarding agencies or indirectly from pass-through entities;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9547-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> “Federal financial assistance” means assistance that non-Federal entities receive or administer in the form of grants, loans, loan guarantees, property, cooperative agreements, interest subsidies, insurance, food commodities, direct appropriations, or other assistance, but does not include amounts received as reimbursement for services rendered to individuals in accordance with guidance issued by the Director;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9548-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/6"><span itemtype="num" value="6">(6)</span></p> “Federal program” means all Federal awards to a non-Federal entity assigned a single number in the Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance or encompassed in a group of numbers or other category as defined by the Director;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9549-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/7"><span itemtype="num" value="7">(7)</span></p> “generally accepted government auditing standards” means the government auditing standards issued by the Comptroller General;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d954a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/8"><span itemtype="num" value="8">(8)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “independent auditor” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d954b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/8/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> an external State or local government auditor who meets the independence standards included in generally accepted government auditing standards; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d954c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/8/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a public accountant who meets such independence standards;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d954d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/9"><span itemtype="num" value="9">(9)</span></p> “Indian tribe” means any Indian tribe, band, nation, or other organized group or community, including any Alaskan Native village or regional or village corporation (as defined in, or established under, the Alaskan Native Claims Settlement Act) that is recognized by the United States as eligible for the special programs and services provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d954e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/10"><span itemtype="num" value="10">(10)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “internal controls” means a process, effected by an entity’s management and other personnel, designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the achievement of objectives in the following categories:<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d954f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/10/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Effectiveness and efficiency of operations.<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002106"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002106"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9550-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/10/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Reliability of financial reporting.<p itemtype="sup"/>1<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9551-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/10/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Compliance with applicable laws and regulations;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9552-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/11"><span itemtype="num" value="11">(11)</span></p> “local government” means any unit of local government within a State, including a county, borough, municipality, city, town, township, parish, local public authority, special district, school district, intrastate district, council of governments, any other instrumentality of local government and, in accordance with guidelines issued by the Director, a group of local governments;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9553-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/12"><span itemtype="num" value="12">(12)</span></p> “major program” means a Federal program identified in accordance with risk-based criteria prescribed by the Director under this chapter, subject to the limitations described under subsection (b);<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9554-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/13"><span itemtype="num" value="13">(13)</span></p> “non-Federal entity” means a State, local government, or nonprofit organization;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9555-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/14"><span itemtype="num" value="14">(14)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “nonprofit organization” means any corporation, trust, association, cooperative, or other organization that—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9556-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/14/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is operated primarily for scientific, educational, service, charitable, or similar purposes in the public interest;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9557-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/14/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is not organized primarily for profit; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9558-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/14/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> uses net proceeds to maintain, improve, or expand the operations of the organization;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9559-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/15"><span itemtype="num" value="15">(15)</span></p> “pass-through entity” means a non-Federal entity that provides Federal awards to a subrecipient to carry out a Federal program;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d955a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/16"><span itemtype="num" value="16">(16)</span></p> “program-specific audit” means an audit of one Federal program;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d955b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/17"><span itemtype="num" value="17">(17)</span></p> “recipient” means a non-Federal entity that receives awards directly from a Federal agency to carry out a Federal program;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d955c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/18"><span itemtype="num" value="18">(18)</span></p> “single audit” means an audit, as described under section 7502(d), of a non-Federal entity that includes the entity’s financial statements and Federal awards;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d955d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/19"><span itemtype="num" value="19">(19)</span></p> “State” means any State of the United States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands, any instrumentality thereof, any multi-State, regional, or interstate entity which has governmental functions, and any Indian tribe; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d955e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/a/20"><span itemtype="num" value="20">(20)</span></p> “subrecipient” means a non-Federal entity that receives Federal awards through another non-Federal entity to carry out a Federal program, but does not include an individual who receives financial assistance through such awards.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d955f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In prescribing risk-based program selection criteria for major programs, the Director shall not require more programs to be identified as major for a particular non-Federal entity, except as prescribed under subsection (c) or as provided under subsection (d), than would be identified if the major programs were defined as any program for which total expenditures of Federal awards by the non-Federal entity during the applicable year exceed—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9560-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the larger of $30,000,000 or 0.15 percent of the non-Federal entity’s total Federal expenditures, in the case of a non-Federal entity for which such total expenditures for all programs exceed $10,000,000,000;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9561-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the larger of $3,000,000, or 0.30 percent of the non-Federal entity’s total Federal expenditures, in the case of a non-Federal entity for which such total expenditures for all programs exceed $100,000,000 but are less than or equal to $10,000,000,000; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9562-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the larger of $300,000, or 3 percent of such total Federal expenditures for all programs, in the case of a non-Federal entity for which such total expenditures for all programs equal or exceed $300,000 but are less than or equal to $100,000,000.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9563-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> When the total expenditures of a non-Federal entity’s major programs are less than 50 percent of the non-Federal entity’s total expenditures of all Federal awards (or such lower percentage as specified by the Director), the auditor shall select and test additional programs as major programs as necessary to achieve audit coverage of at least 50 percent of Federal expenditures by the non-Federal entity (or such lower percentage as specified by the Director), in accordance with guidance issued by the Director.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9564-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7501/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Loan or loan guarantee programs, as specified by the Director, shall not be subject to the application of subsection (b).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2327">98 Stat. 2327</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1396">110 Stat. 1396</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id103d956f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502"><span itemtype="num" value="7502">§ 7502.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audit requirements; exemptions</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9570-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9571-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9572-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Each non-Federal entity that expends a total amount of Federal awards equal to or in excess of $300,000 or such other amount specified by the Director under subsection (a)(3) in any fiscal year of such non-Federal entity shall have either a single audit or a program-specific audit made for such fiscal year in accordance with the requirements of this chapter.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9573-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Each such non-Federal entity that expends Federal awards under more than one Federal program shall undergo a single audit in accordance with the requirements of subsections (b) through (i) of this section and guidance issued by the Director under section 7505.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9574-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Each such non-Federal entity that expends awards under only one Federal program and is not subject to laws, regulations, or Federal award agreements that require a financial statement audit of the non-Federal entity, may elect to have a program-specific audit conducted in accordance with applicable provisions of this section and guidance issued by the Director under section 7505.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9575-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9576-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each non-Federal entity that expends a total amount of Federal awards of less than $300,000 or such other amount specified by the Director under subsection (a)(3) in any fiscal year of such entity, shall be exempt for such fiscal year from compliance with—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9577-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/2/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the audit requirements of this chapter; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9578-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/2/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any applicable requirements concerning financial audits contained in Federal statutes and regulations governing programs under which such Federal awards are provided to that non-Federal entity.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9579-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> The provisions of subparagraph (A)(ii) of this paragraph shall not exempt a non-Federal entity from compliance with any provision of a Federal statute or regulation that requires such non-Federal entity to maintain records concerning Federal awards provided to such non-Federal entity or that permits a Federal agency, pass-through entity, or the Comptroller General access to such records.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d957a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Every 2 years, the Director shall review the amount for requiring audits prescribed under paragraph (1)(A) and may adjust such dollar amount consistent with the purposes of this chapter, provided the Director does not make such adjustments below $300,000.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d957b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d957c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Except as provided in paragraphs (2) and (3), audits conducted pursuant to this chapter shall be conducted annually.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d957d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> A State or local government that is required by constitution or statute, in effect on <p itemtype="date" date="1987-01-01"/>January 1, 1987, to undergo its audits less frequently than annually, is permitted to undergo its audits pursuant to this chapter biennially.
