Audits conducted biennially under the provisions of this paragraph shall cover both years within the biennial period.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d957e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Any nonprofit organization that had biennial audits for all biennial periods ending between <p itemtype="date" date="1992-07-01"/>July 1, 1992, and <p itemtype="date" date="1995-01-01"/>January 1, 1995, is permitted to undergo its audits pursuant to this chapter biennially. Audits conducted biennially under the provisions of this paragraph shall cover both years within the biennial period.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d957f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Each audit conducted pursuant to subsection (a) shall be conducted by an independent auditor in accordance with generally accepted government auditing standards, except that, for the purposes of this chapter, performance audits shall not be required except as authorized by the Director.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9580-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each single audit conducted pursuant to subsection (a) for any fiscal year shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9581-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> cover the operations of the entire non-Federal entity; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9582-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> at the option of such non-Federal entity such audit shall include a series of audits that cover departments, agencies, and other organizational units which expended or otherwise administered Federal awards during such fiscal year provided that each such audit shall encompass the financial statements and schedule of expenditures of Federal awards for each such department, agency, and organizational unit, which shall be considered to be a non-Federal entity.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9583-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The auditor shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9584-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> determine whether the financial statements are presented fairly in all material respects in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9585-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> determine whether the schedule of expenditures of Federal awards is presented fairly in all material respects in relation to the financial statements taken as a whole;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9586-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> with respect to internal controls pertaining to the compliance requirements for each major program—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9587-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> obtain an understanding of such internal controls;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9588-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> assess control risk; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id103d9589-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> perform tests of controls unless the controls are deemed to be ineffective; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d958a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> determine whether the non-Federal entity has complied with the provisions of laws, regulations, and contracts or grants pertaining to Federal awards that have a direct and material effect on each major program.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d958b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d958c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each Federal agency which provides Federal awards to a recipient shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d958d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> provide such recipient the program names (and any identifying numbers) from which such awards are derived, and the Federal requirements which govern the use of such awards and the requirements of this chapter; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d958e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> review the audit of a recipient as necessary to determine whether prompt and appropriate corrective action has been taken with respect to audit findings, as defined by the Director, pertaining to Federal awards provided to the recipient by the Federal agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d958f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each pass-through entity shall—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9590-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> provide such subrecipient the program names (and any identifying numbers) from which such assistance is derived, and the Federal requirements which govern the use of such awards and the requirements of this chapter;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9591-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> monitor the subrecipient’s use of Federal awards through site visits, limited scope audits, or other means;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9592-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> review the audit of a subrecipient as necessary to determine whether prompt and appropriate corrective action has been taken with respect to audit findings, as defined by the Director, pertaining to Federal awards provided to the subrecipient by the pass-through entity; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9593-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/f/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> require each of its subrecipients of Federal awards to permit, as a condition of receiving Federal awards, the independent auditor of the pass-through entity to have such access to the subrecipient’s records and financial statements as may be necessary for the pass-through entity to comply with this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9594-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9595-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The auditor shall report on the results of any audit conducted pursuant to this section, in accordance with guidance issued by the Director.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9596-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> When reporting on any single audit, the auditor shall include a summary of the auditor’s results regarding the non-Federal entity’s financial statements, internal controls, and compliance with laws and regulations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d9597-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The non-Federal entity shall transmit the reporting package, which shall include the non-Federal entity’s financial statements, schedule of expenditures of Federal awards, corrective action plan defined under subsection (i), and auditor’s reports developed pursuant to this section, to a Federal clearinghouse designated by the Director, and make it available for public inspection within the earlier of—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9598-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> 30 days after receipt of the auditor’s report; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d9599-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d959a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> for a transition period of at least 2 years after the effective date of the Single Audit Act Amendments of 1996, as established by the Director, 13 months after the end of the period audited; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id103d959b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> for fiscal years beginning after the period specified in subparagraph (A), 9 months after the end of the period audited, or within a longer timeframe authorized by the Federal agency, determined under criteria issued under section 7504, when the 9-month timeframe would place an undue burden on the non-Federal entity.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d959c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> If an audit conducted pursuant to this section discloses any audit findings, as defined by the Director, including material noncompliance with individual compliance requirements for a major program by, or reportable conditions in the internal controls of, the non-Federal entity with respect to the matters described in subsection (e), the non-Federal entity shall submit to Federal officials designated by the Director, a plan for corrective action to eliminate such audit findings or reportable conditions or a statement describing the reasons that corrective action is not necessary. Such plan shall be consistent with the audit resolution standard promulgated by the Comptroller General (as part of the standards for internal controls in the Federal Government) pursuant to section 3512(c).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id103d959d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7502/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span></p> The Director may authorize pilot projects to test alternative methods of achieving the purposes of this chapter. Such pilot projects may begin only after consultation with the Chair and Ranking Minority Member of the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate and the Chair and Ranking Minority Member of the Committee on Government Reform and Oversight of the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2329">98 Stat. 2329</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(W), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1363">108 Stat. 1363</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1399">110 Stat. 1399</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503"><span itemtype="num" value="7503">§ 7503.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Relation to other audit requirements</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> An audit conducted in accordance with this chapter shall be in lieu of any financial audit of Federal awards which a non-Federal entity is required to undergo under any other Federal law or regulation. To the extent that such audit provides a Federal agency with the information it requires to carry out its responsibilities under Federal law or regulation, a Federal agency shall rely upon and use that information.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Notwithstanding subsection (a), a Federal agency may conduct or arrange for additional audits which are necessary to carry out its responsibilities under Federal law or regulation. The provisions of this chapter do not authorize any non-Federal entity (or subrecipient thereof) to constrain, in any manner, such agency from carrying out or arranging for such additional audits, except that the Federal agency shall plan such audits to not be duplicative of other audits of Federal awards.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The provisions of this chapter do not limit the authority of Federal agencies to conduct, or arrange for the conduct of, audits and evaluations of Federal awards, nor limit the authority of any Federal agency Inspector General or other Federal official.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Subsection (a) shall apply to a non-Federal entity which undergoes an audit in accordance with this chapter even though it is not required by section 7502(a) to have such an audit.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A Federal agency that provides Federal awards and conducts or arranges for audits of non-Federal entities receiving such awards that are in addition to the audits of non-Federal entities conducted pursuant to this chapter shall, consistent with other applicable law, arrange for funding the full cost of such additional audits. Any such additional audits shall be coordinated with the Federal agency determined under criteria issued under section 7504 to preclude duplication of the audits conducted pursuant to this chapter or other additional audits.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7503/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> Upon request by a Federal agency or the Comptroller General, any independent auditor conducting an audit pursuant to this chapter shall make the auditor’s working papers available to the Federal agency or the Comptroller General as part of a quality review, to resolve audit findings, or to carry out oversight responsibilities consistent with the purposes of this chapter. Such access to auditor’s working papers shall include the right to obtain copies.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2332">98 Stat. 2332</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(X), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1363">108 Stat. 1363</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1401">110 Stat. 1401</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504"><span itemtype="num" value="7504">§ 7504.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Federal agency responsibilities and relations with non-Federal entities</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Each Federal agency shall, in accordance with guidance issued by the Director under section 7505, with regard to Federal awards provided by the agency—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> monitor non-Federal entity use of Federal awards, and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> assess the quality of audits conducted under this chapter for audits of entities for which the agency is the single Federal agency determined under subsection (b).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Each non-Federal entity shall have a single Federal agency, determined in accordance with criteria established by the Director, to provide the non-Federal entity with technical assistance and assist with implementation of this chapter.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director shall designate a Federal clearinghouse to—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> receive copies of all reporting packages developed in accordance with this chapter;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> identify recipients that expend $300,000 or more in Federal awards or such other amount specified by the Director under section 7502(a)(3) during the recipient’s fiscal year but did not undergo an audit in accordance with this chapter; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7504/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> perform analyses to assist the Director in carrying out responsibilities under this chapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2333">98 Stat. 2333</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1402">110 Stat. 1402</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505"><span itemtype="num" value="7505">§ 7505.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Regulations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Director, after consultation with the Comptroller General, and appropriate officials from Federal, State, and local governments and nonprofit organizations shall prescribe guidance to implement this chapter. Each Federal agency shall promulgate such amendments to its regulations as may be necessary to conform such regulations to the requirements of this chapter and of such guidance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The guidance prescribed pursuant to subsection (a) shall include criteria for determining the appropriate charges to Federal awards for the cost of audits. Such criteria shall prohibit a non-Federal entity from charging to any Federal awards—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the cost of any audit which is—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> not conducted in accordance with this chapter; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> conducted in accordance with this chapter when expenditures of Federal awards are less than amounts cited in section 7502(a)(1)(A) or specified by the Director under section 7502(a)(3), except that the Director may allow the cost of limited scope audits to monitor subrecipients in accordance with section 7502(f)(2)(B); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> more than a reasonably proportionate share of the cost of any such audit that is conducted in accordance with this chapter.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The criteria prescribed pursuant to paragraph (1) shall not, in the absence of documentation demonstrating a higher actual cost, permit the percentage of the cost of audits performed pursuant to this chapter charged to Federal awards, to exceed the ratio of total Federal awards expended by such non-Federal entity during the applicable fiscal year or years, to such non-Federal entity’s total expenditures during such fiscal year or years.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7505/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Such guidance shall include such provisions as may be necessary to ensure that small business concerns, qualified HUBZone small business concerns, and business concerns owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals will have the opportunity to participate in the performance of contracts awarded to fulfill the audit requirements of this chapter.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2333">98 Stat. 2333</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1403">110 Stat. 1403</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/135/tVI">Pub. L. 105–135, title VI</span>, § 604(e)(3), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-12-02">Dec. 2, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/2634">111 Stat. 2634</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506"><span itemtype="num" value="7506">§ 7506.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Monitoring responsibilities of the Comptroller General</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Comptroller General shall review provisions requiring financial audits of non-Federal entities that receive Federal awards that are contained in bills and resolutions reported by the committees of the Senate and the House of Representatives.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If the Comptroller General determines that a bill or resolution contains provisions that are inconsistent with the requirements of this chapter, the Comptroller General shall, at the earliest practicable date, notify in writing—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the committee that reported such bill or resolution; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate (in the case of a bill or resolution reported by a committee of the Senate); or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7506/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Committee on Government Reform and Oversight of the House of Representatives (in the case of a bill or resolution reported by a committee of the House of Representatives).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2333">98 Stat. 2333</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1403">110 Stat. 1403</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7507"><span itemtype="num" value="7507">§ 7507.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Effective date</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">This chapter shall apply to any non-Federal entity with respect to any of its fiscal years which begin after <span itemtype="date" date="1996-06-30">June 30, 1996</span>.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/98/502">Pub. L. 98–502</span>, § 2(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1984-10-19">Oct. 19, 1984</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/98/2334">98 Stat. 2334</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/156">Pub. L. 104–156</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-07-05">July 5, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1404">110 Stat. 1404</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id104005d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stV/ch77"><span itemtype="num" value="77">CHAPTER 77—</span><span itemtype="heading">ACCESS TO INFORMATION FOR DEBT COLLECTION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701"><span itemtype="num" value="7701">§ 7701.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Taxpayer identifying number</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> In this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “included Federal loan program” has the same meaning given that term in section 6103(<p itemtype="i"/>l)(3)(C) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s6103"/>26 U.S.C. 6103(<p itemtype="i"/>l)(3)(C)).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “taxpayer identifying number” means the identifying number required under section 6109 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s6109"/>26 U.S.C. 6109).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The head of an agency administering an included Federal loan program shall require a person applying for a loan under the program to provide that person’s taxpayer identifying number.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The head of each Federal agency shall require each person doing business with that agency to furnish to that agency such person’s taxpayer identifying number.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> For purposes of this subsection, a person shall be considered to be doing business with a Federal agency if the person is—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a lender or servicer in a Federal guaranteed or insured loan program administered by the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> an applicant for, or recipient of, a Federal license, permit, right-of-way, grant, or benefit payment administered by the agency or insurance administered by the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a contractor of the agency;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> assessed a fine, fee, royalty or penalty by the agency; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> in a relationship with the agency that may give rise to a receivable due to that agency, such as a partner of a borrower in or a guarantor of a Federal direct or insured loan administered by the agency.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Each agency shall disclose to a person required to furnish a taxpayer identifying number under this subsection its intent to use such number for purposes of collecting and reporting on any delinquent amounts arising out of such person’s relationship with the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> For purposes of this subsection, a person shall not be treated as doing business with a Federal agency solely by reason of being a debtor under third party claims of the United States. The preceding sentence shall not apply to a debtor owing claims resulting from petroleum pricing violations or owing claims resulting from Federal loan or loan guarantee/insurance programs.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104005ea-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s7701/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Notwithstanding <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t5/s552a/b"/>section 552a(b) of title 5, United States Code, creditor agencies to which a delinquent claim is owed, and their agents, may match their debtor records with Department of Health and Human Services, and Department of Labor records to obtain names (including names of employees), name controls, names of employers, taxpayer identifying numbers, addresses (including addresses of employers), and dates of birth. The preceding sentence shall apply to the disclosure of taxpayer identifying numbers only if such disclosure is not otherwise prohibited by section 6103 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Department of Health and Human Services, and the Department of Labor shall release that information to creditor agencies and may charge reasonable fees sufficient to pay the costs associated with that release.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(Y)(i), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1363">108 Stat. 1363</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 31001(i)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-364">110 Stat. 1321–364</span>.)</p><p itemtype="subtitle" style="-uslm-lc:I52" id="id104005ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stVI"><span itemtype="num" value="VI">SUBTITLE VI—</span><span itemtype="heading">MISCELLANEOUS</span></p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id104005f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stVI/ch91"><span itemtype="num" value="91">CHAPTER 91—</span><span itemtype="heading">GOVERNMENT CORPORATIONS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104005f7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101"><span itemtype="num" value="9101">§ 9101.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005f8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “Government corporation” means a mixed-ownership Government corporation and a wholly owned Government corporation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104005f9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “mixed-ownership Government corporation” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the Central Bank for Cooperatives.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the Federal Home Loan Banks.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the Federal Intermediate Credit Banks.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the Federal Land Banks.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104005ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> the National Credit Union Administration Central Liquidity Facility.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400600-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> the Regional Banks for Cooperatives.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400601-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> the Rural Telephone Bank when the ownership, control, and operation of the Bank are converted under section 410(a) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s950/a"/>7 U.S.C. 950(a)).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400602-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the Financing Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400603-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p> the Resolution Trust Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400604-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/2/K"><span itemtype="num" value="K">(K)</span></p> the Resolution Funding Corporation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400605-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “wholly owned Government corporation” means—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400606-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the Commodity Credit Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400607-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400608-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the Export-Import Bank of the United States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400609-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1040060a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1040060c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> the Government National Mortgage Association.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1040060d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> the Overseas Private Investment Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1040060e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400610-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/K"><span itemtype="num" value="K">(K)</span></p> the Rural Telephone Bank until the ownership, control, and operation of the Bank are converted under section 410(a) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s950/a"/>7 U.S.C. 950(a)).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400611-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/L"><span itemtype="num" value="L">(L)</span></p> the Saint Lawrence Seaway Development Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400612-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/M"><span itemtype="num" value="M">(M)</span></p> the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development when carrying out duties and powers related to the Federal Housing Administration Fund.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400613-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/N"><span itemtype="num" value="N">(N)</span></p> the Tennessee Valley Authority.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" status="repealed" id="id10400614-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/O"><span itemtype="num" value="O">[(O)</span></p> Repealed. <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII"/>Pub. L. 104–134, title III, § 3117(a), <p itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26"/>Apr. 26, 1996, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-350"/>110 Stat. 1321–350.]<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400615-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/P"><span itemtype="num" value="P">(P)</span></p> the Panama Canal Commission.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400616-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/Q"><span itemtype="num" value="Q">(Q)</span></p> the Millennium Challenge Corporation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id10400617-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9101/3/R"><span itemtype="num" value="R">(R)</span></p> the International Clean Energy Foundation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, §§ 1, 2(<span itemtype="i">l</span>)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1041">96 Stat. 1041</span>, 1062; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(Z), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1363">108 Stat. 1363</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/325/tI">Pub. L. 104–106, div. C, title XXXV</span>, § 3530, <span itemtype="date" date="1996-02-10">Feb. 10, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/642">110 Stat. 642</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/127/tVII">Pub. L. 104–127, title VII</span>, § 722(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-04">Apr. 4, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1115">110 Stat. 1115</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/134/tIII">Pub. L. 104–134, title III</span>, § 3117(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-04-26">Apr. 26, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/1321-350">110 Stat. 1321–350</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/287">Pub. L. 104–287</span>, § 4(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1996-10-11">Oct. 11, 1996</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/110/3388">110 Stat. 3388</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/134/tIV">Pub. L. 105–134, title IV</span>, § 415(d)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1997-12-02">Dec. 2, 1997</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/111/2590">111 Stat. 2590</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/171/tVI">Pub. L. 107–171, title VI</span>, § 6201(d)(6), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-05-13">May 13, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/419">116 Stat. 419</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/199/dD/tVI">Pub. L. 108–199, div. D, title VI</span>, § 614(e)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2004-01-23">Jan. 23, 2004</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/118/223">118 Stat. 223</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/110/140/tIX">Pub. L. 110–140, title IX</span>, § 925(c)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2007-12-19">Dec. 19, 2007</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/121/1737">121 Stat. 1737</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10400626-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9102"><span itemtype="num" value="9102">§ 9102.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Establishing and acquiring corporations</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An agency may establish or acquire a corporation to act as an agency only by or under a law of the United States specifically authorizing the action.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1042">96 Stat. 1042</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1040062a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103"><span itemtype="num" value="9103">§ 9103.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Budgets of wholly owned Government corporations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1040062b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Each wholly owned Government corporation shall prepare and submit each year to the President a business-type budget in a way, and before a date, the President prescribes by regulation for the budget program.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1040062c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The budget program for each wholly owned Government corporation shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1040062d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> contain estimates of the financial condition and operations of the corporation for the current and following fiscal years and the condition and results of operations in the last fiscal year;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1040062e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> contain statements of financial condition, income and expense, and sources and use of money, an analysis of surplus or deficit, and additional statements and information to make known the financial condition and operations of the corporation, including estimates of operations by major activities, administrative expenses, borrowings, the amount of United States Government capital that will be returned to the Treasury during the fiscal year, and appropriations needed to restore capital impairments; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1040062f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> provide for emergencies and contingencies and otherwise be flexible so that the corporation may carry out its activities.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400630-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9103/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The President shall submit the budget programs submitted by wholly owned Government corporations (as changed by the President) as part of the budget submitted to Congress under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105"/>section 1105 of this title. The President thereafter may submit changes in a budget program of a corporation at any time.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1042">96 Stat. 1042</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10400634-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104"><span itemtype="num" value="9104">§ 9104.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Congressional action on budgets of wholly owned Government corporations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400635-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Congress shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400636-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> consider budget programs for wholly owned Government corporations the President submits;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400637-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> make necessary appropriations authorized by law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400638-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> make corporate financial resources available for operating and administrative expenses; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400639-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> provide for repaying capital and the payment of dividends.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1040063a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1040063b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> prevent a wholly owned Government corporation from carrying out or financing its activities as authorized under another law;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1040063c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> affect section 26 of the Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t16/s831y"/>16 U.S.C. 831y); or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1040063d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9104/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> affect the authority of a wholly owned Government corporation to make a commitment without fiscal year limitation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1043">96 Stat. 1043</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10400641-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105"><span itemtype="num" value="9105">§ 9105.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Audits</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400642-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400643-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The financial statements of Government corporations shall be audited by the Inspector General of the corporation appointed under the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.), or under other Federal law, or by an independent external auditor, as determined by the Inspector General or, if there is no Inspector General, by the head of the corporation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400644-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Audits under this section shall be conducted in accordance with applicable generally accepted government auditing standards.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400645-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Upon completion of the audit required by this subsection, the person who audits the statement shall submit a report on the audit to the head of the Government corporation, to the Chairman of the Committee on Government Operations of the House of Representatives, and to the Chairman of the Committee on Governmental Affairs of the Senate.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10400646-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Comptroller General of the United States—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400647-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> may review any audit of a financial statement conducted under this subsection by an Inspector General or an external auditor;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400648-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> shall report to the Congress, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the head of the Government corporation which prepared the statement, regarding the results of the review and make any recommendation the Comptroller General of the United States considers appropriate; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10400649-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> may audit a financial statement of a Government corporation at the discretion of the Comptroller General or at the request of a committee of the Congress.<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>An audit the Comptroller General performs under this paragraph shall be in lieu of the audit otherwise required by paragraph (1) of this subsection. Prior to performing such audit, the Comptroller General shall consult with the Inspector General of the agency which prepared the statement.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1040064a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/a/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> A Government corporation shall reimburse the Comptroller General of the United States for the full cost of any audit conducted by the Comptroller General under this subsection, as determined by the Comptroller General. All reimbursements received under this paragraph by the Comptroller General of the United States shall be deposited in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1040064b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Upon request of the Comptroller General of the United States, a Government corporation shall provide to the Comptroller General of the United States all books, accounts, financial records, reports, files, workpapers, and property belonging to or in use by the Government corporation and its auditor that the Comptroller General of the United States considers necessary to the performance of any audit or review under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1040064c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9105/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Activities of the Comptroller General of the United States under this section are in lieu of any audit of the financial transactions of a Government corporation that the Comptroller General is required to make under any other law.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1043">96 Stat. 1043</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/86/tIV">Pub. L. 100–86, title IV</span>, § 403, <span itemtype="date" date="1987-08-10">Aug. 10, 1987</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/609">101 Stat. 609</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/233/tVII">Pub. L. 100–233, title VII</span>, § 703, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-01-06">Jan. 6, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/101/1706">101 Stat. 1706</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/100/399/tVI">Pub. L. 100–399, title VI</span>, § 602, <span itemtype="date" date="1988-08-17">Aug. 17, 1988</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/102/1006">102 Stat. 1006</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/73/tV">Pub. L. 101–73, title V</span>, § 511(b)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1989-08-09">Aug. 9, 1989</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/103/406">103 Stat. 406</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tIII">Pub. L. 101–576, title III</span>, § 305, <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2853">104 Stat. 2853</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/82/tII">Pub. L. 103–82, title II</span>, § 202(e)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-09-21">Sept. 21, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/888">107 Stat. 888</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10427656-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106"><span itemtype="num" value="9106">§ 9106.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Management reports</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427657-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427658-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> A Government corporation shall submit an annual management report to the Congress not later than 180 days after the end of the Government corporation’s fiscal year.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427659-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A management report under this subsection shall include—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1042765a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a statement of financial position;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1042765b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a statement of operations;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1042765c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a statement of cash flows;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1042765d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> a reconciliation to the budget report of the Government corporation, if applicable;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1042765e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> a statement on internal accounting and administrative control systems by the head of the management of the corporation, consistent with the requirements for agency statements on internal accounting and administrative control systems under the amendments made by the Federal Managers’ Financial Integrity Act of 1982 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/255"/>Public Law 97–255);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1042765f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> the report resulting from an audit of the financial statements of the corporation conducted under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9105"/>section 9105 of this title; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427660-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/a/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> any other comments and information necessary to inform the Congress about the operations and financial condition of the corporation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427661-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9106/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A Government corporation shall provide the President, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the Comptroller General of the United States a copy of the management report when it is submitted to Congress.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1044">96 Stat. 1044</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576/tIII">Pub. L. 101–576, title III</span>, § 306(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1990-11-15">Nov. 15, 1990</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/104/2854">104 Stat. 2854</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10427667-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107"><span itemtype="num" value="9107">§ 9107.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Accounts</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427668-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> With the approval of the Comptroller General, a Government corporation may consolidate its cash into an account if the cash will be expended as provided by law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427669-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall keep the accounts of a Government corporation. If the Secretary approves, a Federal reserve bank or a bank designated as a depositary or fiscal agent of the United States Government may keep the accounts. The Secretary may waive the requirements of this subsection.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042766a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042766b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Subsection (b) of this section does not apply to maintaining a temporary account of not more than $50,000 in one bank.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042766c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Subsection (b) of this section does not apply to a mixed-ownership Government corporation when the corporation has no capital of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042766d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9107/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Subsection (b) of this section does not apply to the Federal Intermediate Credit Banks, the Central Bank for Cooperatives, the Regional Banks for Cooperatives, or the Federal Land Banks. However, the head of each of those banks shall report each year to the Secretary the names of depositaries where accounts are kept. If the Secretary considers it advisable when an annual report is received, the Secretary may make a written report to the corporation, the President, and Congress.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, §§ 1, 2(<span itemtype="i">l</span>)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1044">96 Stat. 1044</span>, 1062; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(27), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2478">96 Stat. 2478</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10427675-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108"><span itemtype="num" value="9108">§ 9108.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Obligations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427676-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before a Government corporation issues obligations and offers obligations to the public, the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427677-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the form, denomination, maturity, interest rate, and conditions to which the obligations will be subject;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427678-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the way and time the obligations are issued; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427679-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the price for which the obligations will be sold.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042767a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> A Government corporation may buy or sell a direct obligation of the United States Government, or an obligation on which the principal, interest, or both, is guaranteed, of more than $100,000 only when the Secretary approves the purchase or sale. The Secretary may waive the requirement of this subsection under conditions the Secretary may decide.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042767b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The Secretary may designate an officer or employee of an agency to carry out this section if the head of the agency agrees.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042767c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042767d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> This section does not apply to a mixed-ownership Government corporation when the corporation has no capital of the Government.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042767e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9108/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Subsections (a) and (b) of this section do not apply to the Rural Telephone Bank (when the ownership, control, and operation of the Bank are converted under section 410(a) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t7/s950/a"/>7 U.S.C. 950(a))), the Federal Intermediate Credit Banks, the Central Bank for Cooperatives, the Regional Banks for Cooperatives, and the Federal Land Banks. However, the head of each of those banks shall consult with the Secretary before taking action of the kind described in subsection (a) or (b). If agreement is not reached, the Secretary may make a written report to the corporation, the President, and Congress on the reasons for the Secretary’s disagreement.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, §§ 1, 2(<span itemtype="i">l</span>)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1045">96 Stat. 1045</span>, 1062; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/452">Pub. L. 97–452</span>, § 1(27), <span itemtype="date" date="1983-01-12">Jan. 12, 1983</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/2478">96 Stat. 2478</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10427686-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9109"><span itemtype="num" value="9109">§ 9109.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Exclusion of a wholly owned Government corporation from this chapter</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">When the President considers it practicable and in the public interest, the President shall include in the budget submitted to Congress under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s1105">section 1105 of this title</span> a recommendation that a wholly owned Government corporation be deemed to be an agency (except a corporation) under chapter 11 of this title and for fiscal matters. If Congress approves the recommendation, the corporation is deemed to be an agency (except a corporation) under chapter 11 and for fiscal matters for fiscal years beginning after the fiscal year of approval and is not subject to this chapter. The corporate entity is not affected by this section.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1045">96 Stat. 1045</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1042768a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110"><span itemtype="num" value="9110">§ 9110.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Standards for depository institutions holding securities of a Government-sponsored corporation for customers</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042768b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Secretary shall prescribe by regulation standards for the safeguarding and use of obligations that are government securities described in subparagraph (B) or (C) of section 3(a)(42) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Such regulations shall apply only to a depository institution that is not a government securities broker or a government securities dealer and that holds such obligations as fiduciary, custodian, or otherwise for the account of a customer and not for its own account. Such regulations shall provide for the adequate segregation of obligations so held, including obligations which are purchased or sold subject to resale or repurchase.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042768c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Violation of a regulation prescribed under subsection (a) shall constitute adequate basis for the issuance of an order under section 5239(a) or (b) of the Revised Statutes (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t12/s93/a"/>12 U.S.C. 93(a) or (b)), section 8(b) or 8(c) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act, section 5(d)(2) or 5(d)(3) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002107"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002107"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> of the Home Owners’ Loan Act of 1933, section 407(e) or 407(f) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002107"/>1 of the National Housing Act, or section 206(e) or 206(f) of the Federal Credit Union Act. Such an order may be issued with respect to a depository institution by its appropriate regulatory agency and with respect to a federally insured credit union by the National Credit Union Administration.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042768d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Nothing in this section shall be construed to affect in any way the powers of such agencies under any other provision of law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042768e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> The Secretary shall, prior to adopting regulations under this section, determine with respect to each appropriate regulatory agency and the National Credit Union Administration Board, whether its rules and standards adequately meet the purposes of regulations to be promulgated under this section, and if the Secretary so determines, shall exempt any depository institution subject to such rules or standards from the regulations promulgated under this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1042768f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> As used in this subsection—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427690-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “depository institution” has the meaning stated in clauses (i) through (vi) of section 19(b)(1)(A) of the Federal Reserve Act and also includes a foreign bank, an agency or branch of a foreign bank, and a commercial lending company owned or controlled by a foreign bank (as such terms are defined in the International Banking Act of 1978).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427691-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “government securities broker” has the meaning prescribed in section 3(a)(43) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427692-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> “government securities dealer” has the meaning prescribed in section 3(a)(44) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427693-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9110/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> “appropriate regulatory agency” has the meaning prescribed in section 3(a)(34)(G) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/571/tII">Pub. L. 99–571, title II</span>, § 201(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-28">Oct. 28, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/3223">100 Stat. 3223</span>; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/272">Pub. L. 103–272</span>, § 4(f)(1)(AA), <span itemtype="date" date="1994-07-05">July 5, 1994</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/108/1363">108 Stat. 1363</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id1042769a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stVI/ch93"><span itemtype="num" value="93">CHAPTER 93—</span><span itemtype="heading">SURETIES AND SURETY BONDS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1042769f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9301"><span itemtype="num" value="9301">§ 9301.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9301/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> “person” means an individual, a trust, an estate, a partnership, and a corporation.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9301/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “eligible obligation” means any security designated as acceptable in lieu of a surety bond by the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1046">96 Stat. 1046</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/351/tIX">Pub. L. 109–351, title IX</span>, § 901(a), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/2007">120 Stat. 2007</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104276a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9302"><span itemtype="num" value="9302">§ 9302.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Prohibition against surety bonds for United States Government personnel</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">An agency (except a mixed-ownership Government corporation) may not require or obtain a surety bond for a member of the uniformed services or an officer or employee of the United States Government in carrying out official duties. This section does not affect the personal financial liability of the member, officer, or employee.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub.
