L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1046">96 Stat. 1046</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104276aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303"><span itemtype="num" value="9303">§ 9303.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Use of eligible obligations instead of surety bonds</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> If a person is required under a law of the United States to give a surety bond, the person may give an eligible obligation as security instead of a surety bond. The obligation shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> be given to the official having authority to approve the surety bond;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> as determined by the Secretary of the Treasury, have a market value that is equal to or greater than the amount of the required surety bond; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> authorize the official receiving the obligation to collect or sell the obligation if the person defaults on a required condition.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> An official receiving an eligible obligation under subsection (a) of this section may deposit it with—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/b/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the Secretary of the Treasury;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/b/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a Federal reserve bank; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/b/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> a depositary designated by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary, bank, or depositary shall issue a receipt that describes the obligation deposited.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Using an eligible obligation instead of a surety bond for security is the same as using—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a personal or corporate surety bond;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a certified check;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> a bank draft;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/c/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> a post office money order; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/c/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> cash.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When security is no longer required, an eligible obligation given instead of a surety bond shall be returned to the person giving the obligation. If a person, supplying labor or material to a contractor defaulting under sections 3131 and 3133 of title 40, files with the United States Government the application and affidavit provided under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s3133/a">section 3133(a) of title 40</span>, the Government—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may return to the contractor the eligible obligation given as security (or proceeds of the eligible obligation given) under sections 3131 and 3133 of title 40 only after the 90-day period for bringing a civil action under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t40/s3133/b"/>section 3133(b) of title 40; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> if a civil action is brought in the 90-day period, shall hold the eligible obligation or the proceeds subject to the order of the court having jurisdiction of the action.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not affect the—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> priority of a claim of the Government against an eligible obligation given under this section;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> right or remedy of the Government for default on an obligation provided under—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> sections 3131 and 3133 of title 40; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> this section;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> authority of a court over an eligible obligation given as security in a civil action; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/e/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p> authority of an official of the Government authorized by another law to receive an eligible obligation as security.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9303/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> To avoid frequent substitution of eligible obligations, the Secretary may prescribe regulations limiting the effect of this section to an eligible obligation maturing more than one year after the date the obligation is given as security.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1046">96 Stat. 1046</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/107/217">Pub. L. 107–217</span>, § 3(h)(9), <span itemtype="date" date="2002-08-21">Aug. 21, 2002</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/116/1300">116 Stat. 1300</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/108/178">Pub. L. 108–178</span>, § 4(f)(2), <span itemtype="date" date="2003-12-15">Dec. 15, 2003</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/117/2641">117 Stat. 2641</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/109/351/tIX">Pub. L. 109–351, title IX</span>, § 901(b), (c), <span itemtype="date" date="2006-10-13">Oct. 13, 2006</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/120/2007">120 Stat. 2007</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104276cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304"><span itemtype="num" value="9304">§ 9304.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Surety corporations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> When a law of the United States Government requires or permits a person to give a surety bond through a surety, the person satisfies the law if the surety bond is provided for the person by a corporation—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> incorporated under the laws of—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the United States; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a State, the District of Columbia, or a territory or possession of the United States;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> that may under those laws guarantee—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the fidelity of persons holding positions of trust; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> bonds and undertakings in judicial proceedings; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> complying with sections 9305 and 9306 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9304/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Each surety bond shall be approved by the official of the Government required to approve or accept the bond. The official may not require that the surety bond be given through a guaranty corporation or through any particular guaranty corporation.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1047">96 Stat. 1047</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104276d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305"><span itemtype="num" value="9305">§ 9305.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Authority and revocation of authority of surety corporations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Before becoming a surety under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304">section 9304 of this title</span>, a surety corporation must file with the Secretary of the Treasury—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> a copy of the articles of incorporation of the corporation; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> a statement of the assets and liabilities of the corporation signed and sworn to by the president and secretary of the corporation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may authorize in writing a surety corporation to provide surety bonds under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304">section 9304 of this title</span> if the Secretary decides that—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the articles of incorporation of the corporation authorize the corporation to do business described in <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304/a/2"/>section 9304(a)(2) of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> the corporation has paid-up capital of at least $250,000 in cash or its equivalent; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> the corporation is able to carry out its contracts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> A surety corporation authorized under subsection (b) of this section to provide surety bonds shall file with the Secretary each January, April, July, and October a statement of the assets and liabilities of the corporation signed and sworn to by the president and secretary of the corporation.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall revoke the authority of a surety corporation to do new business if the Secretary decides the corporation is insolvent or is in violation of this section or section 9304 or 9306 of this title;<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may investigate the solvency of a surety corporation at any time; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/d/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> may require additional security from the person required to provide a surety bond if the Secretary decides that a surety corporation no longer is sufficient security.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A surety corporation providing a surety bond under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304">section 9304 of this title</span> may not provide any additional bond under that section if—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/e/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> the corporation does not pay a final judgment or order against it on the bond; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9305/e/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> no appeal or stay of the judgment or order is pending 30 days after the judgment or order is entered.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1047">96 Stat. 1047</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104276eb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306"><span itemtype="num" value="9306">§ 9306.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Surety corporations acting outside area of incorporation and place of principal office</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276ec-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A surety corporation may provide a surety bond under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304">section 9304 of this title</span> in a judicial district outside the State, the District of Columbia, or a territory or possession of the United States under whose laws it was incorporated and in which its principal office is located only if the corporation has a resident agent for service of process for that district. The resident agent—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276ed-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> may be an official of the State, the District of Columbia, the territory or possession in which the court sits who is authorized or appointed under the law of the State, District, territory or possession to receive service of process on the corporation; or<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276ee-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> may be an individual who resides in the jurisdiction of the district court for the district in which a surety bond is to be provided and who is appointed by the corporation as provided in subsection (b) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002109"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002109"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276ef-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> If the surety corporation meets the requirement of subsection (a) by appointing an individual under subsection (a)(2), the surety corporation shall file a certified copy of the power of attorney with the clerk of the district court for the district in which a surety bond is to be given at each place the court sits. A copy of the power of attorney may be used as evidence in a civil action under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9307"/>section 9307 of this title.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276f0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276f1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> If a resident agent is removed, resigns, dies, or becomes disabled, the surety corporation shall appoint another agent as described in this section.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276f2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Until an appointment is made under paragraph (1) of this subsection or during an absence of an agent from the district in which the surety bond is given, service of process may be made on the clerk of the court in which a civil action against the corporation is brought. The official serving process on the clerk of the court—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276f3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> immediately shall mail a copy of the process to the corporation; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id104276f4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> shall state in the official’s return that the official served the process on the clerk of the court.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276f5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9306/c/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> A judgment or order of a court entered or made after service of process under this section is as valid as if the corporation were served in the judicial district of the court.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1048">96 Stat. 1048</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/106/113/dB">Pub. L. 106–113, div. B</span>, § 1000(a)(9) [title V, § 5007], <span itemtype="date" date="1999-11-29">Nov. 29, 1999</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/113/1536">113 Stat. 1536</span>, 1501A–594.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id104276fa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307"><span itemtype="num" value="9307">§ 9307.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil actions and judgments against surety corporations</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276fb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276fc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> A surety corporation providing a surety bond under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304">section 9304 of this title</span> may be sued in a court of the United States having jurisdiction of civil actions on surety bonds in—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276fd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the judicial district in which the surety bond was provided; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104276fe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the district in which the principal office of the corporation is located.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id104276ff-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Under sections 9304–9308 of this title, a surety bond is deemed to be provided in the district—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427700-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> in which the principal office of the surety corporation is located;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427701-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> to which the surety bond is returnable;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427702-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> in which the surety bond is filed; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id10427703-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> in which the person required to provide a surety bond resided when the bond was provided.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id10427704-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9307/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> In a proceeding against a surety corporation providing a surety bond under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9304"/>section 9304 of this title, the corporation may not deny its power to provide a surety bond or to assume liability.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1049">96 Stat. 1049</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id10427708-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9308"><span itemtype="num" value="9308">§ 9308.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Civil penalty</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">A surety corporation is liable to the United States Government for a civil penalty of at least $500 but not more than $5,000 for violating section 9304, 9305, or 9306 of this title. A civil action under this section may be brought in a judicial district in which a civil action may be brought against the corporation under <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9307">section 9307 of this title</span>. A penalty imposed under this section does not affect the validity of a contract made by the surety corporation.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1049">96 Stat. 1049</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1042770c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9309"><span itemtype="num" value="9309">§ 9309.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Priority of sureties</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>When a person required to provide a surety bond given to the United States Government is insolvent or dies having assets insufficient to pay debts, the surety, or the executor, administrator, or assignee of the surety paying the Government the amount due under the bond—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044bffd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9309/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> has the same priority to amounts from the assets and estate of the person as are secured for the Government; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044bffe-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9309/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> personally may bring a civil action under the bond to recover amounts paid under the bond.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1049">96 Stat. 1049</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c002-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9310"><span itemtype="num" value="9310">§ 9310.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Individual sureties</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>If another applicable Federal law or regulation permits the acceptance of a bond from a surety that is not subject to sections 9305 and 9306 and is based on a pledge of assets by the surety, the assets pledged by such surety shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c003-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9310/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> consist of eligible obligations described under section 9303(a); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c004-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9310/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> be submitted to the official of the Government required to approve or accept the bond, who shall deposit the obligations as described under section 9303(b).<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/114/92/dA/tVIII">Pub. L. 114–92, div. A, title VIII</span>, § 874(a)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2015-11-25">Nov. 25, 2015</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/129/940">129 Stat. 940</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id1044c008-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stVI/ch95"><span itemtype="num" value="95">CHAPTER 95—</span><span itemtype="heading">GOVERNMENT PENSION PLAN PROTECTION</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c00a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9501"><span itemtype="num" value="9501">§ 9501.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Purpose</span></p>
<p itemtype="content" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0">The purpose of this chapter is to protect the interests of the United States and of the participants and their beneficiaries in Government pension plans by requiring complete disclosure of the financial condition of those plans.</p>
<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1050">96 Stat. 1050</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c00e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502"><span itemtype="num" value="9502">§ 9502.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Definitions</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>In this chapter—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c00f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> “Government pension plan”—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c010-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> means a pension, annuity, retirement, or similar plan (except a plan covered under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t29/s1001"/>29 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.) or a plan or program financed by contributions required under chapter 21 or 22 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t26/s3101"/>26 U.S.C. 3101 et seq., 3201 et seq.)) established or maintained by an agency, for any of its officers or employees, regardless of the number of participants covered by the plan; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c011-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> includes—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c012-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the Civil Service Retirement System.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c013-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the Coast Guard Retirement System.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c014-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> the Commissioned Corps of the Public Health Service Retirement System.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c015-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the Farm Credit District Retirement Plans.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c016-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> the Federal Home Loan Bank Board Retirement Systems.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c017-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/vi"><span itemtype="num" value="vi">(vi)</span></p> the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Plan.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c018-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/vii"><span itemtype="num" value="vii">(vii)</span></p> the Federal Reserve Employees Retirement Plans.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c019-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/viii"><span itemtype="num" value="viii">(viii)</span></p> the Foreign Service Retirement and Disability System.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c01a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/ix"><span itemtype="num" value="ix">(ix)</span></p> judicial plans.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c01b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/x"><span itemtype="num" value="x">(x)</span></p> the Military Retirement System.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c01c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/xi"><span itemtype="num" value="xi">(xi)</span></p> the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Retirement System.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c01d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/xii"><span itemtype="num" value="xii">(xii)</span></p> nonappropriated fund plans.<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c01e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/1/B/xiii"><span itemtype="num" value="xiii">(xiii)</span></p> the Tennessee Valley Authority Retirement System.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c01f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9502/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> “plan year” means the calendar, policy, or fiscal year chosen by the Government pension plan on which the records of the plan are kept.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1050">96 Stat. 1050</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/99/514">Pub. L. 99–514</span>, § 2, <span itemtype="date" date="1986-10-22">Oct. 22, 1986</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/100/2095">100 Stat. 2095</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c026-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9503"><span itemtype="num" value="9503">§ 9503.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Reports about Government pension plans</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" status="repealed" id="id1044c027-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9503/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">[(a)</span></p> Repealed. <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/362/tXV"/>Pub. L. 105–362, title XV, § 1501(a), <p itemtype="date" date="1998-11-10"/>Nov. 10, 1998, <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3294"/>112 Stat. 3294.]<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c028-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9503/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> This chapter does not prevent a Government pension plan from using the services of an enrolled actuary employed by an agency administering the plan.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c029-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9503/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> The requirements of this section are satisfied with respect to the Thrift Savings Plan described under subchapter III of chapter 84 of title 5, by preparation and transmission of the report described under section 8439(b) of such title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1050">96 Stat. 1050</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/104/66/tII">Pub. L. 104–66, title II</span>, § 2081, <span itemtype="date" date="1995-12-21">Dec. 21, 1995</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/109/729">109 Stat. 729</span>; <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/105/362/tXV">Pub. L. 105–362, title XV</span>, § 1501(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1998-11-10">Nov. 10, 1998</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/112/3294">112 Stat. 3294</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c02f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9504"><span itemtype="num" value="9504">§ 9504.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Review and recommendations</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>When necessary or when requested by either House of Congress or a committee of Congress, the Comptroller General shall—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c030-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9504/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> review financial and actuarial statements provided under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9503"/>section 9503 of this title to decide whether the reporting requirements of section 9503 are adequate to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9501"/>section 9501 of this title; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c031-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9504/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> submit to Congress recommendations for legislation necessary to carry out <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t31/s9501"/>section 9501 of this title.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1051">96 Stat. 1051</span>.)</p><p itemtype="chapter" style="-uslm-lc:I81" id="id1044c035-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/stVI/ch97"><span itemtype="num" value="97">CHAPTER 97—</span><span itemtype="heading">MISCELLANEOUS</span></p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c039-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701"><span itemtype="num" value="9701">§ 9701.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Fees and charges for Government services and things of value</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c03a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> It is the sense of Congress that each service or thing of value provided by an agency (except a mixed-ownership Government corporation) to a person (except a person on official business of the United States Government) is to be self-sustaining to the extent possible.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c03b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The head of each agency (except a mixed-ownership Government corporation) may prescribe regulations establishing the charge for a service or thing of value provided by the agency. Regulations prescribed by the heads of executive agencies are subject to policies prescribed by the President and shall be as uniform as practicable. Each charge shall be—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c03c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> fair; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c03d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> based on—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c03e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the costs to the Government;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c03f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the value of the service or thing to the recipient;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c040-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> public policy or interest served; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c041-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/b/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> other relevant facts.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c042-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> This section does not affect a law of the United States—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c043-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> prohibiting the determination and collection of charges and the disposition of those charges; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c044-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9701/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> prescribing bases for determining charges, but a charge may be redetermined under this section consistent with the prescribed bases.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1051">96 Stat. 1051</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c049-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9702"><span itemtype="num" value="9702">§ 9702.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Investment of trust funds</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0"/>Except as required by a treaty of the United States, amounts held in trust by the United States Government (including annual interest earned on the amounts)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c04a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9702/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> shall be invested in Government obligations; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c04b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9702/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> shall earn interest at an annual rate of at least 5 percent.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/97/258">Pub. L. 97–258</span>, <span itemtype="date" date="1982-09-13">Sept. 13, 1982</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/96/1052">96 Stat. 1052</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c04f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703"><span itemtype="num" value="9703">§ 9703.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Managerial accountability and flexibility</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c050-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> Beginning with fiscal year 1999, the performance plans required under section 1115 may include proposals to waive administrative procedural requirements and controls, including specification of personnel staffing levels, limitations on compensation or remuneration, and prohibitions or restrictions on funding transfers among budget object classification 20 and subclassifications 11, 12, 31, and 32 of each annual budget submitted under section 1105, in return for specific individual or organization accountability to achieve a performance goal. In preparing and submitting the performance plan under section 1105(a)(29),<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002110"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002110"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall review and may approve any proposed waivers. A waiver shall take effect at the beginning of the fiscal year for which the waiver is approved.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c051-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Any such proposal under subsection (a) shall describe the anticipated effects on performance resulting from greater managerial or organizational flexibility, discretion, and authority, and shall quantify the expected improvements in performance resulting from any waiver. The expected improvements shall be compared to current actual performance, and to the projected level of performance that would be achieved independent of any waiver.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c052-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p> Any proposal waiving limitations on compensation or remuneration shall precisely express the monetary change in compensation or remuneration amounts, such as bonuses or awards, that shall result from meeting, exceeding, or failing to meet performance goals.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c053-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> Any proposed waiver of procedural requirements or controls imposed by an agency (other than the proposing agency or the Office of Management and Budget) may not be included in a performance plan unless it is endorsed by the agency that established the requirement, and the endorsement included in the proposing agency’s performance plan.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c054-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span></p> A waiver shall be in effect for one or two years as specified by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget in approving the waiver. A waiver may be renewed for a subsequent year. After a waiver has been in effect for three consecutive years, the performance plan prepared under section 1115 may propose that a waiver, other than a waiver of limitations on compensation or remuneration, be made permanent.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c055-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9703/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span></p> For purposes of this section, the definitions under section 1115(f) <p itemtype="sup"/>1 shall apply.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/62">Pub. L. 103–62</span>, § 5(a), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-08-03">Aug. 3, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/289">107 Stat. 289</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c05b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704"><span itemtype="num" value="9704">§ 9704.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Pilot projects for managerial accountability and flexibility</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c05c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span></p> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall designate not less than five agencies as pilot projects in managerial accountability and flexibility for fiscal years 1995 and 1996. Such agencies shall be selected from those designated as pilot projects under section 1118 and shall reflect a representative range of Government functions and capabilities in measuring and reporting program performance.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c05d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span></p> Pilot projects in the designated agencies shall include proposed waivers in accordance with section 9703 for one or more of the major functions and operations of the agency.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c05e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall include in the report to the President and to the Congress required under section 1118(c)—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c05f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> an assessment of the benefits, costs, and usefulness of increasing managerial and organizational flexibility, discretion, and authority in exchange for improved performance through a waiver; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c060-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> an identification of any significant difficulties experienced by the pilot agencies in preparing proposed waivers.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c061-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9704/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span></p> For purposes of this section the definitions under section 1115(f) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002111"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002111"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p> shall apply.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/62">Pub. L. 103–62</span>, § 6(b), <span itemtype="date" date="1993-08-03">Aug. 3, 1993</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/107/290">107 Stat. 290</span>.)</p><p itemtype="section" style="-uslm-lc:I80" id="id1044c066-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705"><span itemtype="num" value="9705">§ 9705.</span><span itemtype="heading"> Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund</span></p><p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c067-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a"><span itemtype="num" value="a">(a)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">In General</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>There is established in the Treasury of the United States a fund to be known as the “Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund” (referred to in this section as the “Fund”). The Fund shall be available to the Secretary, without fiscal year limitation, with respect to seizures and forfeitures made pursuant to any law (other than section 7301 or 7302 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) enforced or administered by the Department of the Treasury or the United States Coast Guard for the following law enforcement purposes:<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c068-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c069-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Payment of all proper expenses of seizure (including investigative costs incurred by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization leading to seizure) or the proceedings of forfeiture and sale, including the expenses of detention, inventory, security, maintenance, advertisement, or disposal of the property, and if condemned by a court and a bond for such costs was not given, the costs as taxed by the court.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c06a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Payment for—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c06b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> contract services;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c06c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the employment of outside contractors to operate and manage properties or to provide other specialized services necessary to dispose of such properties in an effort to maximize the return from such properties; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c06d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> reimbursing any Federal, State, or local agency for any expenditures made to perform the functions described in this subparagraph.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c06e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Awards of compensation to informers under section 619 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1619"/>19 U.S.C. 1619).<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c06f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Satisfaction of—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c070-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/D/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> liens for freight, charges, and contributions in general average, notice of which has been filed with the appropriate Customs officer according to law; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c071-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/D/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> subject to the discretion of the Secretary, other valid liens and mortgages against property that has been forfeited pursuant to any law enforced or administered by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization. To determine the validity of any such lien or mortgage, the amount of payment to be made, and to carry out the functions described in this subparagraph, the Secretary may employ and compensate attorneys and other personnel skilled in State real estate law.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c072-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> Payment of amounts authorized by law with respect to remission and mitigation.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c073-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> Payment of claims of parties in interest to property disposed of under section 612(b) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1612/b"/>19 U.S.C. 1612(b)), in the amounts applicable to such claims at the time of seizure.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c074-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> Equitable sharing payments made to other Federal agencies, State and local law enforcement agencies, and foreign countries pursuant to section 616(c) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1616a/c"/>19 U.S.C. 1616a(c)), <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s981"/>section 981 of title 18, or subsection (h) of this section, and all costs related thereto.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c075-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> Payment for services of experts and consultants needed by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization to carry out the organization’s duties relating to seizure and forfeiture.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c076-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> Payment of overtime salaries, travel, fuel, training, equipment, and other similar costs of State or local law enforcement officers that are incurred in joint law enforcement operations with a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c077-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J"><span itemtype="num" value="J">(J)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Payment made pursuant to guidelines promulgated by the Secretary, if such payment is necessary and directly related to seizure and forfeiture program expenses for—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c078-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> the purchase or lease of automatic data processing systems (not less than a majority of which use will be related to such program);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c079-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> training;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c07a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p> printing; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c07b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> contracting for services directly related to—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c07c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/iv/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> the identification of forfeitable assets;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c07d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/iv/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> the processing of and accounting for forfeitures; and<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c07e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/1/J/iv/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> the storage, maintenance, protection, and destruction of controlled substances.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c07f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> At the discretion of the Secretary—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c080-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> payment of awards for information or assistance leading to a civil or criminal forfeiture involving any Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization participating in the Fund;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c081-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> purchases of evidence or information by—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c082-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization with respect to—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1044c083-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/i/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> a violation of section 1956 or 1957 of title 18 (relating to money laundering); or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1044c084-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/i/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> a law, the violation of which may subject property to forfeiture under section 981 or 982 of title 18;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c085-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> the United States Customs Service with respect to drug smuggling or a violation of section 542 or 545 of title 18 (relating to fraudulent customs invoices or smuggling);<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c086-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/iii"><span itemtype="num" value="iii">(iii)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the United States Secret Service with respect to a violation of—<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1044c087-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/iii/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p> section 1028, 1029, or 1030 of title 18;<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1044c088-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/iii/II"><span itemtype="num" value="II">(II)</span></p> any law of the United States relating to coins, obligations, or securities of the United States or of a foreign government; or<p itemtype="subclause" style="-uslm-lc:I16" class="indent4" id="id1044c089-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/iii/III"><span itemtype="num" value="III">(III)</span></p> any law of the United States which the United States Secret Service is authorized to enforce relating to fraud or other criminal or unlawful activity in or against any federally insured financial institution, the Resolution Trust Corporation, or the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation;<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c08a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/iv"><span itemtype="num" value="iv">(iv)</span></p> the United States Customs Service or the Internal Revenue Service with respect to a violation of chapter 53 of this title (relating to the Bank Secrecy Act); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c08b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/B/v"><span itemtype="num" value="v">(v)</span></p> United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement with respect to a violation of chapter 77 of title 18 (relating to human trafficking);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c08c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> payment of costs for publicizing awards available under section 619 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1619"/>19 U.S.C. 1619);<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c08d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> payment for equipment for any vessel, vehicle, or aircraft available for official use by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization to enable the vessel, vehicle, or aircraft to assist in law enforcement functions, and for other equipment directly related to seizure or forfeiture, including laboratory equipment, protective equipment, communications equipment, and the operation and maintenance costs of such equipment;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c08e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the payment of claims against employees of the Customs Service settled by the Secretary under section 630 of the Tariff Act of 1930;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c08f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> payment for equipment for any vessel, vehicle, or aircraft available for official use by a State or local law enforcement agency to enable the vessel, vehicle, or aircraft to assist in law enforcement functions if the vessel, vehicle, or aircraft will be used in joint law enforcement operations with a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c090-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> reimbursement of private persons for expenses incurred by such persons in cooperating with a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization in investigations and undercover law enforcement operations; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c091-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/a/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> payment for training foreign law enforcement personnel with respect to seizure or forfeiture activities of the Department of the Treasury.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c092-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b"><span itemtype="num" value="b">(b)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Limitations.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c093-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> Any payment made under subparagraph (D) or (E) of subsection (a)(1) with respect to a seizure or a forfeiture of property shall not exceed the value of the property at the time of the seizure.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c094-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> Any payment made under subsection (a)(1)(G) with respect to a seizure or forfeiture of property shall not exceed the value of the property at the time of disposition.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c095-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> The Secretary may exempt the procurement of contract services under the Fund from division C (except sections 3302, 3501(b), 3509, 3906, 4710, and 4711) of subtitle I of title 41, section 6101(b) to (d) of title 41, and other provisions of law as may be necessary to maintain the security and confidentiality of related criminal investigations.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c096-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary shall assure that any equitable sharing payment made to a State or local law enforcement agency pursuant to subsection (a)(1)(G) and any property transferred to a State or local law enforcement agency pursuant to subsection (h)—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c097-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> has a value that bears a reasonable relationship to the degree of participation of the State or local agency in the law enforcement effort resulting in the forfeiture, taking into account the total value of all property forfeited and the total law enforcement effort with respect to the violation of law on which the forfeiture is based; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c098-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> will serve to encourage further cooperation between the recipient State or local agency and Federal law enforcement agencies.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c099-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/b/5"><span itemtype="num" value="5">(5)</span></p> Amounts transferred by the Attorney General pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t28/s524/c/1"/>section 524(c)(1) of title 28, or by the Postmaster General pursuant to <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t39/s2003"/>section 2003 of title 39, and deposited into the Fund pursuant to subsection (d), shall be available for Federal law enforcement related purposes of the Department of the Treasury law enforcement organizations.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c09a-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c"><span itemtype="num" value="c">(c)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Funds Available to United States Coast Guard.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c09b-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary shall make available to the United States Coast Guard, from funds appropriated under subsection (g)(2) in excess of $10,000,000 for a fiscal year, an amount equal to the net proceeds in the Fund derived from seizures by the Coast Guard.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c09c-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> Funds made available under this subsection may be used to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c09d-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> pay for equipment for any vessel, vehicle, or aircraft available for official use by the United States Coast Guard to enable the vessel, vehicle, or aircraft to assist in law enforcement functions;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c09e-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> pay for equipment for any vessel, vehicle, equipment, or aircraft available for official use by a State or local law enforcement agency to enable the vessel, vehicle, or aircraft to assist in law enforcement functions if the vessel, vehicle, or aircraft will be used in joint law enforcement operations with the United States Coast Guard;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c09f-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> pay for overtime salaries, travel, fuel, training, equipment, and other similar costs of State and local law enforcement officers that are incurred in joint law enforcement operations with the United States Coast Guard;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/c/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> pay for expenses incurred in bringing vessels into compliance with applicable environmental laws prior to disposal by sinking.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0a1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d"><span itemtype="num" value="d">(d)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Deposits and Credits.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0a2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> With respect to fiscal year 1993, there shall be deposited into or credited to the Fund—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> all currency forfeited during fiscal year 1993, and all proceeds from forfeitures during fiscal year 1993, under any law enforced or administered by the United States Customs Service or the United States Coast Guard;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> all income from investments made under subsection (e); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/1/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> all amounts representing the equitable share of the United States Customs Service or the United States Coast Guard from the forfeiture of property under any Federal, State, local, or foreign law.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0a6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> With respect to fiscal years beginning after fiscal year 1993, there shall be deposited into or credited to the Fund—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> all currency forfeited after fiscal year 1993, and all proceeds from forfeitures after fiscal year 1993, under any law (other than sections 7301 and 7302 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) enforced or administered by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization or the United States Coast Guard;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> all income from investments made under subsection (e); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0a9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/d/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> all amounts representing the equitable share of a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization or the United States Coast Guard from the forfeiture of property under any Federal, State, local, or foreign law.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0aa-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/e"><span itemtype="num" value="e">(e)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Investments</span>.—</span></p>Amounts in the Fund, and in any holding accounts associated with the Fund, which are not currently needed for the purposes of this section may be kept on deposit or invested in obligations of, or guaranteed by, the United States and all earnings on such investments shall be deposited in the Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0ab-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f"><span itemtype="num" value="f">(f)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Reports to Congress</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>The Secretary shall transmit to the Congress, not later than February 1 of each year—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0ac-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a report on—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0ad-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> the estimated total value of property forfeited with respect to which funds were not deposited in the Fund during the preceding fiscal year—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c0ae-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/1/A/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> under any law enforced or administered by the United States Customs Service or the United States Coast Guard, in the case of fiscal year 1993; and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c0af-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/1/A/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> under any law enforced or administered by the Department of the Treasury law enforcement organizations or the United States Coast Guard, in the case of fiscal years beginning after 1993; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> the estimated total value of all such property transferred to any State or local law enforcement agency; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0b1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> a report on—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> the balance of the Fund at the beginning of the preceding fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> liens and mortgages paid and the amount of money shared with Federal, State, local, and foreign law enforcement agencies during the preceding fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> the net amount realized from the operations of the Fund during the preceding fiscal year, the amount of seized cash being held as evidence, and the amount of money that has been carried over into the current fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/D"><span itemtype="num" value="D">(D)</span></p> any defendant’s property, not forfeited at the end of the
