preceding fiscal year, if the equity in such property is valued at $1,000,000 or more;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/E"><span itemtype="num" value="E">(E)</span></p> the total dollar value of uncontested seizures of monetary instruments having a value of over $100,000 which, or the proceeds of which, have not been deposited into the Fund pursuant to subsection (d) within 120 days after seizure, as of the end of the preceding fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/F"><span itemtype="num" value="F">(F)</span></p> the balance of the Fund at the end of the preceding fiscal year;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/G"><span itemtype="num" value="G">(G)</span></p> the net amount, if any, of the excess unobligated amounts remaining in the Fund at the end of the preceding fiscal year and available to the Secretary for Federal law enforcement related purposes;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0b9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/H"><span itemtype="num" value="H">(H)</span></p> a complete set of audited financial statements (including a balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow analysis) prepared in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Chief Financial Officers Act of 1990 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576"/>Public Law 101–576); and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0ba-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/I"><span itemtype="num" value="I">(I)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> an analysis of income and expenses showing the revenue received or lost—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c0bb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/I/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> by property category (such as general property, vehicles, vessels, aircraft, cash, and real property); and<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c0bc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/f/2/I/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> by type of disposition (such as sale, remission, cancellation, placement into official use, sharing with State and local agencies, and destruction).<p itemtype="continuation" style="-uslm-lc:I10" class="indent0 firstIndent0"/>The Fund shall be subject to annual financial audits as authorized in the Chief Financial Officers Act of 1990 (<span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/101/576">Public Law 101–576</span>).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0bd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g"><span itemtype="num" value="g">(g)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Appropriations.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0be-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> There are hereby appropriated from the Fund such sums as may be necessary to carry out the purposes described in subsection (a)(1).<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0bf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> There are authorized to be appropriated from the Fund to carry out the purposes set forth in subsections (a)(2) and (c) not to exceed—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0c0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> $25,000,000 for fiscal year 1993; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0c1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> $50,000,000 for each fiscal year after fiscal year 1993.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/3/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> Subject to subparagraphs (B) and (C), at the end of each of fiscal years 1994, 1995, 1996, and 1997, the Secretary shall transfer from the Fund not more than $100,000,000 to the Special Forfeiture Fund established by section 6073 of the Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1988.<p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002112"/>1<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002112"><span itemtype="num">1</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/3/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> Transfers pursuant to subparagraph (A) shall be made only from excess unobligated amounts and only to the extent that, as determined by the Secretary, such transfers will not impair the future availability of amounts for the purposes described in subsection (a). Further, transfers under subparagraph (A) may not exceed one-half of the excess unobligated balance for a year. In addition, transfers under subparagraph (A) may be made only to the extent that the sum of the transfers in a fiscal year and one-half of the unobligated balance at the beginning of that fiscal year for the Special Forfeiture Fund does not exceed $100,000,000.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/3/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> The Secretary of the Treasury shall reserve an amount not to exceed $30,000,000 from the unobligated balances remaining in the Customs Forfeiture Fund on <p itemtype="date" date="1992-09-30"/>September 30, 1992, and such amount shall be transferred to the Fund on <p itemtype="date" date="1992-10-01"/>October 1, 1992, or, if later, the date that is 15 days after the date of the enactment of this section. Such amount shall be available for any expenses or activities authorized under this section. At the end of fiscal year <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002113"/>2<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002113"><span itemtype="num">2</span></p> 1993, 1994, 1995, and 1996, the Secretary shall reserve in the Fund an amount not to exceed $50,000,000 of the unobligated balances in the Fund, or, if the Secretary determines that a greater amount is necessary for asset specific expenses, an amount equal to not more than 10 percent of the total obligations from the Fund in the preceding fiscal year. At the end of fiscal year 1997, and at the end of each fiscal year thereafter, the Secretary shall reserve any amounts that are required to be retained in the Fund to ensure the availability of amounts in the subsequent fiscal year for purposes authorized under subsection (a). Unobligated balances remaining pursuant to section 4(B) of 9703(g) <p itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002114"/>3<p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002114"><span itemtype="num">3</span></p> shall also be carried forward.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/4"><span itemtype="num" value="4">(4)</span></p><p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/4/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> After reserving any amount authorized by paragraph (3)(C), any unobligated balances remaining in the Fund on <p itemtype="date" date="1993-09-30"/>September 30, 1993, shall be deposited into the general fund of the Treasury of the United States.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/4/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> After reserving any amount authorized by paragraph (3)(C) and after transferring any amount authorized by paragraph (3)(A), any unobligated balances remaining in the Fund on <p itemtype="date" date="1994-09-30"/>September 30, 1994, and on September 30 of each fiscal year thereafter, shall be available to the Secretary, without fiscal year limitation, for transfers pursuant to subparagraph (A)(ii) <p itemtype="sup"/>1 and for obligation or expenditure in connection with the law enforcement activities of any Federal agency or of a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization.<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0c9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/g/4/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> Any obligation or expenditure in excess of $500,000 with respect to an unobligated balance described in subparagraph (B) may not be made by the Secretary unless the Appropriations Committees of both Houses of Congress are notified at least 15 days in advance of such obligation or expenditure.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0ca-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h"><span itemtype="num" value="h">(h)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Retention or Transfer of Property.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0cb-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may, with respect to any property forfeited under any law (other than section 7301 or 7302 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) enforced or administered by the Department of the Treasury—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0cc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> retain any of the property for official use; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0cd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> transfer any of the property to—<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c0ce-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/1/B/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span></p> any other Federal agency; or<p itemtype="clause" style="-uslm-lc:I14" class="indent3" id="id1044c0cf-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/1/B/ii"><span itemtype="num" value="ii">(ii)</span></p> any State or local law enforcement agency that participated directly or indirectly in the seizure or forfeiture of the property.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0d0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> The Secretary may transfer any forfeited personal property or the proceeds of the sale of any forfeited personal or real property to any foreign country which participated directly or indirectly in the seizure of <span itemtype="ref" class="footnoteRef" idref="fn002115">4</span><p itemtype="note" type="footnote" id="fn002115"><span itemtype="num">4</span></p> forfeiture of the property, if such a transfer—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0d1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> is one with which the Secretary of State has agreed;<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0d2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> is authorized in an international agreement between the United States and the foreign country; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0d3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/2/C"><span itemtype="num" value="C">(C)</span></p> is made to a country which, if applicable, has been certified under section 481(h) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t22/s2291/h"/>22 U.S.C. 2291(h)).<p itemtype="sup"/>1<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0d4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/h/3"><span itemtype="num" value="3">(3)</span></p> Nothing in this section shall affect the authority of the Secretary under <p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t18/s981"/>section 981 of title 18 or section 616 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1616a"/>19 U.S.C. 1616a).<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0d5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/i"><span itemtype="num" value="i">(i)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Regulations</span>.—</span></p>The Secretary may prescribe such rules and regulations as may be necessary to carry out this section.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0d6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/j"><span itemtype="num" value="j">(j)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Customs Forfeiture Fund</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>Notwithstanding any other provision of law—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0d7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/j/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> during any period when forfeited currency and proceeds from forfeitures under any law (other than section 7301 or 7302 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) enforced or administered by the Department of the Treasury or the United States Coast Guard, are required to be deposited in the Fund pursuant to this section—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0d8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/j/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> all moneys required to be deposited in the Customs Forfeiture Fund pursuant to section 613A of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1613b"/>19 U.S.C. 1613b) shall instead be deposited in the Fund; and<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0d9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/j/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> no deposits or withdrawals may be made to or from the Customs Forfeiture Fund pursuant to section 613A of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1613b"/>19 U.S.C. 1613b); and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0da-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/j/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> any funds in the Customs Forfeiture Fund and any obligations of the Customs Forfeiture Fund on the effective date of the Treasury Forfeiture Act of 1992, shall be transferred to the Fund and all administrative costs of such transfer shall be paid for out of the Fund.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0db-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/k"><span itemtype="num" value="k">(k)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Limitation of Liability</span>.—</span></p>The United States shall not be liable in any action relating to property transferred under this section or under section 616 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<p itemtype="ref" href="/us/usc/t19/s1616a"/>19 U.S.C. 1616a) if such action is based on an act or omission occurring after the transfer.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0dc-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/l"><span itemtype="num" value="l">(l)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Authority To Warrant Title</span>.—</span></p>Following the completion of procedures for the forfeiture of property pursuant to any law enforced or administered by the Department of the Treasury, the Secretary is authorized, at the Secretary’s discretion, to warrant clear title to any subsequent purchaser or transferee of such forfeited property.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0dd-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m"><span itemtype="num" value="m">(m)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Forfeited Property</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section and notwithstanding section 524(c)(11) <p itemtype="sup"/>1 of title 28 or any other law—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0de-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> during fiscal year 1993, property and currency shall be deemed to be forfeited pursuant to a law enforced or administered by the United States Customs Service if it is forfeited pursuant to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0df-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m/1/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a judicial forfeiture proceeding when the underlying seizure was made by an officer of the United States Customs Service or the property was maintained by the United States Customs Service; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0e0-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m/1/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a civil administrative forfeiture proceeding conducted by the United States Customs Service; and<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0e1-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/> after fiscal year 1993, property and currency shall be deemed to be forfeited pursuant to a law enforced or administered by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization if it is forfeited pursuant to—<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0e2-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m/2/A"><span itemtype="num" value="A">(A)</span></p> a judicial forfeiture proceeding when the underlying seizure was made by an officer of a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization or the property was maintained by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization; or<p itemtype="subparagraph" style="-uslm-lc:I13" class="indent2" id="id1044c0e3-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/m/2/B"><span itemtype="num" value="B">(B)</span></p> a civil administrative forfeiture proceeding conducted by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0e4-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/n"><span itemtype="num" value="n">(n)</span><span itemtype="heading"> Transfers to Attorney General and Postmaster General.—</span></p><p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0e5-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/n/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span></p> The Secretary shall transfer from the Fund to the Attorney General for deposit in the Department of Justice Assets Forfeiture Fund amounts appropriate to reflect the degree of participation of participating Federal agencies in the law enforcement effort resulting in the forfeiture pursuant to laws enforced or administered by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization. For purposes of the preceding sentence, a “participating Federal agency” is an agency that participates in the Department of Justice Assets Forfeiture Fund.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0e6-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/n/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span></p> The Secretary shall transfer from the Fund to the Postmaster General for deposit in the Postal Service Fund amounts appropriate to reflect the degree of participation of the United States Postal Service in the law enforcement effort resulting in the forfeiture pursuant to laws enforced or administered by a Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization.<p itemtype="subsection" style="-uslm-lc:I11" class="indent0" id="id1044c0e7-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/o"><span itemtype="num" value="o">(o)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Definitions</span>.—</span></p><p itemtype="chapeau"/>For purposes of this section—<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id1044c0e8-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/o/1"><span itemtype="num" value="1">(1)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Department of the treasury law enforcement organization</span>.—</span></p>The term “Department of the Treasury law enforcement organization” means the United States Customs Service, the United States Secret Service, the Tax and Trade Bureau, the Internal Revenue Service, the Federal Law Enforcement Training Center, the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network, and any other law enforcement component of the Department of the Treasury so designated by the Secretary.<p itemtype="paragraph" style="-uslm-lc:I12" class="indent1" id="id104731e9-4db1-11e6-8af2-b19ed7ef7a5f" identifier="/us/usc/t31/s9705/o/2"><span itemtype="num" value="2">(2)</span><span itemtype="heading"> <span itemtype="inline" class="small-caps">Secretary</span>.—</span></p>The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Treasury.<p itemtype="sourceCredit">(Added <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/102/393/tVI">Pub. L. 102–393, title VI</span>, § 638(b)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="1992-10-06">Oct. 6, 1992</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/106/1779">106 Stat. 1779</span>, § 9703; amended <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/pl/103/182/tVI">Pub. L. 114–22, title I</span>, § 105(c)(1), <span itemtype="date" date="2015-05-29">May 29, 2015</span>, <span itemtype="ref" href="/us/stat/129/237">129 Stat. 237</span>.)</p>
